summary_comment: Professor Dain is highly regarded for his clarity and accessibility, making lectures easy to follow and engaging. Students appreciate his kindness and availability outside of class, and many find his teaching style fun and straightforward. While some note that midterms can be challenging, overall, Professor Dain is seen as an excellent instructor who helps students succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dain is highly regarded for his clarity and accessibility, making his lectures easy to follow and engaging. Students appreciate his kindness and availability outside of class, and many would take his courses again.

Ratings.comment: Professor Dain is extremely easy to follow in lectures, he is very kind and easy to reach outside of class. I wish he could be my math professor for all levels.

Mr. Dain knows the material he teaches well. He does a good job at keeping people as engaged as possible. I'm a student who has returned to college after many years. Math was the class I was most concerned about, as I did not get good grades when I took the same class at another college before. The professor matters and he's a good one.

He was a great lecturer and very accessible. Midterms/exams were a little tricky but as long as you study and pay attention, you will do well. Homework was never too excessive and he made the lectures fun and simple.
great professor would take again

This class was super easy even though he teaches fairly quickly. He's a great professor and makes sense just make sure to keep up with notes. Everything is straightforward and easygoing but there are a lot of tests so make sure you study. The midterms are simple as long as you know the material.

Dain was an amazing professor for 1050. There was a lot of homework from the book, but he gave you the due dates at the very beginning and you knew when they were due, along with exams. Homework was completion based and no accuracy based, but he would leave feedback. Very open for questions and office hours and helps students as much as he can!

He's super nice! I'm just not a math person so it was kind of difficult for me to understand just generally, but he delivered the material in the most fun and clear way I think anyone could've done. I'd take him for 1148 if I could !

Pretty easy class. I stopped going to lectures and recitations and watched the videos on ALEKS instead and still got an A. When I did go to lectures, Dain made them interesting and fun. Midterms are a bit tricky but multiple choice and a few short answer and weekly recitation quizzes are only 2 questions.

Homework is graded for accuracy, but you're able to correct the ones you missed (as long as it's submitted before the due date!). Textbook is provided online. Lectures were clear and easy to follow, and he posts his completed notes to canvas after every lecture.

I love his class. He was able to explain little details in an essay way. He will have time for extra classes to help you if needed. Besides we have recorded all the classes! That was the best and his jokes :)

Dain was super kind and a great professor. I struggle with math a lot, so I didn't do too great in his class. His lectures were often very boring and dry, but he's a really good educator. If you struggle with math, your TA and/or office hours will be your best friend.

He is one of the nicest professors I've ever had. Genuinely such a sweet man who cares for all of his students. He really wants everyone to succeed. I'm not good at math but this class was relatively not too bad for me! Take him if you can he is so nice 10/10

Literally, the nicest man I've ever met, and also one of the BEST math teachers I've ever had. I'm not even exaggerating. He's a very sweet guy, who takes his time in lectures to explain things. Very understanding, and explains concepts thoroughly. His tests aren't hard, he genuinely wants you to succeed. 10/10

Professor Dain was awesome, he is very sweet and understanding. He was prepared each lecture with notes that were understandable. Also very forgiving, he allowed me to make up assignments and take an exam late since I was unable to at the scheduled time. Final exam was kind of hard for me which knocked me down to a B+. Great professor!
This course is super easy, but he is a great lecturer and explains math so well. He makes jokes here and there which lightens the mood. A very good professor!
Great

This class was fast paced, but he would slow down and go back if u asked. He would actually answer questions we had and would really go through them step by step. Math is usually torture for me, but he kind of made it enjoyable as he cracked jokes in class to lighten the mood. Wouldnt take again because it was a bit too fast, but i do recommend.
I really enjoy the way he goes over the material during class. he leaves homework twice a week and one quiz per week about the things we have learned.
Professor Dain is so caring and nice. His lectures are pretty interesting and he loves talking to his students. He also does a superb job on teaching.
I love Professor Dain! He is literally so sweet and funny. He truly cares about his students and tries to make math fun. I highly recommend taking any of his classes. It is an easy class as well.
Best math teacher Ive ever had. I would take every single math class he teaches. Very funny and will take time to answer any questions.
Super nice, very helpful. If you can take him for any math class, do it!

summary_comment: Professor Estill is generally regarded as a nice and helpful individual who is passionate about his subject matter and encourages student engagement through office hours. However, his teaching style can be challenging, with lectures described as dry and hard to follow. Grading is slow, which can impact students' ability to address areas of weakness in a timely manner. Despite these challenges, some find his approach effective, especially when combined with regular attendance at office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Estill is generally considered a nice and helpful person who is passionate about his subject matter and encourages student engagement through office hours. However, his teaching method is criticized for being dry and difficult to follow, and his grading process is often slow, which can impact students' understanding and final grades.

Ratings.comment: Weekly homework yet I never got anything graded until November. By that time it was almost too late to save my grade, but lowest 2 homework grades were dropped. Midterms were alright, there was somewhat of a curve. Just confusing lectures but office hours are helpful. However, Foundations sequence is inherently difficult.

Professor Estill said he would curve midterm 2 or add an end of the year curve due to poor results, and he just never ended up doing it. Sent multiple emails throughout the semester regarding grading and never responded to a single one. Does not care about his students and their grades whatsoever. Nice guy, but one of the worst professors ever.

He cares for students and has a good sense of humor. However, his lectures are really dry and hard to understand. He also grades homeworks and tests really slow. He is a very nice grader but that is because almost everybody in the class does not understand what is going on.

Super easy grader, unfortunately Estill is also an incredibly slow grader, midterms were graded over a month after just before the next test. Other than that Estill is a great guy who genuinely likes what he does. He is super helpful although lectures be a little hard to follow, the homework definitely helps to solidify things.
Awesome dude and tests are directly from homework. Just make sure you go to office hours for homework's because graders can be harsh. Really nice guy just go to him and he will help you.

He's a very nice man but not a reliable professor. As others said, very slow grader. Classes were canceled or moved to zoom VERY often, and it was hard to learn online. midterm 2 was graded oddly harshly (no partial credit given at all?). I do appreciate his consideration for international students and he is very helpful in office hours.
Not sure why there's so many negative reviews. He's a solid and nice guy who is passionate about the subject. His lectures are helpful in my opinion. He is also very open to questions.
Super Chill Guy. Very helpful in Office hours. Just study his slides and you should be good to go.

If you haven't taken math in a while, it might be a little of an adjustment. But he is an easy grader and gives easy exams (much easier than HW). Not a good set up for Foundations 2, but super accessible for office hours and questions. Doesn't provide lecture slides until after.

Estill is truly a nice guy, but imo cannot lecture to save his life. The final was also oddly difficult compared to the midterms. Not hard to get an A in this class, but I do not feel like I learned much. Office hours are v helpful, which makes up for the mid lectures.

NEVER answer emails. Not a single thing graded until two days before the second midterm, so we didn't have any feedback to know what we were doing wrong. His lectures were way too focused on proofs, even though engineers don't care about proofs. He taught like a math class when it literally is not a math class. His lecture slides are walls of text.

My major concern is that I didn't know what my grade in the course was until after the final exam was taken because he takes forever to grade assignments. Lectures can be a little difficult to follow, but they do directly coincide with exam material which is helpful. He is a fun person, however I do feel that his lectures could be made more clear

This is the WORST professor I've ever had. He can't teach to save his life and is always off topic. I would go to his office hours consistently and leave feeling even more confused. I ended up bombing all of my tests and considered switching majors, but after retaking the class with someone else and getting an A- I realized he was just horrible.

Did not show up for our final exam and did not grade assignments for the entire semester until eventually grading them for completion nearing finals week. He is a nice guy, but I am pretty nervous for foundations II as I am unprepared and will likely have to self-teach and play catch up

Look, if you take his Foundations I class it's an easy A. But you won't learn a thing and won't be prepared for foundations II. His lectures are abysmal and people perform so poorly on certain exam questions that he doesn't grade them at all. Also, for one of his sections he just didn't show up for the final. He's a nice guy, but is unfit to teach.
Good class overall. Lectures are a little hard to follow and confusing but prepares for exams very well, and is very accesible at office hours.

Estill's lectures were pretty subpar. I felt they were unorganized and I didn't think he did a great job of actually teaching us the content that would show up on homework and tests. But I'll admit that his office hours were SUPER HELPFUL, so if you're ever stuck on homework problems definitely attend office hours and he'll help you out.

Not the best lecture format as he would go through presentations of like 70-80 slides and it wasn't always clear what you should take notes on, but he grades leniently and his office hours were always a huge help

Dr. Estill is overall a nice guy, but a terrible teacher. His lectures consisted of him reading over 70+ slide long presentations and were boring and difficult to follow. Seems to have short term memory loss, often forgetting what he's talking about mid-sentence. One week left in the course and 80% of assignments weren't graded yet. Exams were easy

Dr. Estill goes through lecture material very fast, which can be confusing. The organization of the material got messy in the middle of the course, but got cleaner towards the end of the semester. Dr. Estill is extremely helpful during review sessions and office hours though. You can tell he really cares about his students.
His lectures were not the best, but his office hours are very helpful and overall he cares for the students.

Dr. Estill deserves more credit than he's given in his ratings here. He genuinely cares so much about students and while his lectures were more math-oriented than CSE-oriented which could be confusing, he put in so much extra time and effort to anyone who needed it to make sure people understood the content, and his grading was extremely generous.

I enjoyed his mathematical take in this class. The class can be a bit boring at times and the homework hard, but his office hours are super helpful for understanding the material. Exams and hw are fair, and final is not cumulative except for 1 or 2 subjects. I enjoyed learning from Dr. Estill!

You will be completely lost in his lectures and the first half of the class you might wonder how you're gonna make it through, but his homeworks and exams are pretty fair and you'll be fine as long as you take the time to teach yourself the material. His lectures tend to have a lot of random tangents and thoughts to himself

I loved Charles. He was quirky and seemed to really care. Personally I thought lectures were very clear, but if you find that's not the case for you, go to office hours! He will spend a long time going over things with people until they get it.

Professor Estill is not the best but he isn't the worse. His tests are easier than other professors but his lectures are def 100% confusing. I would watch his lectures after I had examples in front of me and would go to office hours regularly. You could perfectly go to office hours and just listen to other's questions and skip lectures.
WORST PROFESSOR EVER! DOESN'T REPLY TO EMAILS AND IS SO HARD TO GET AHOLD OF! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

I took him for CS2321. Very nice guy but not the best, he spends a long time on examples but it's not always clear what he is trying to teach with them. I found it useful to skip the lectures and watch a week's worth on Monday when the homework was due. Did not try to trick you, and most everything on quizes/hw was taught explicitly in class.

Charles is by far the worst professor I have ever had the displeasure of taking. He is impossible to get ahold of outside of class, and straight-up ignores emails. Beyond that, he doesn't communicate the material at a level beyond "here is how you do this specific problem" - lecture is essentially watching him solve a math problem with no insight.

Dr Estill is easily the worst college professor I have ever had. He failed to communicate the material in an understandable manor, would cancel classes with less than an hour notice, and had powerpoint's with a multitude of mistakes. Pro tip: he barely changes the exam questions from semester to semester. He should not be teaching CSE.

His lectures weren't horrible for me, as others have said, but my advice is to make use of his office hours. His office hours were definitely more helpful to me than lecture, and he was always eager to help. His class is a nice balance between not too hard and not too easy.

He is very lecture heavy, but if you at least show up and kind of listen and pit the effort in to learn the material you don't understand, you'll do fine. The only problem I had was he didn't have the grade weights in till the day of the final.

Charles is a nice guy and tries his best but is a horrible lecturer. The exams arent too bad though (the final was very easy) and the homeworks are graded loosely. I felt like I had no idea what was going on for much of the semester and got an A. Just go to class and learn the material the best you can and youll be fine.

Terrible foundations teacher. When asked for any review problems for an exam he said "no". Complete disconnect in teaching the subject compared to other professors of 2321. Absolutely worst professor I've had. Exams are easy though

Avoid at all costs. Foundations I isn't meant to be hard, Estill makes it hard. The only things to study from are your own notes and hw, so if you skip class you're extremely behind. The grader is also slow, the last two homeworks were only put in after the final. He also never responds to emails, and cancels office hours often.

Don't take Foundations 1 with Estill. There isn't much to study off of for exams except for your notes and previous hw (which the solutions are riddled with mistakes). He's not a bad lecturer but his exams and hw make you wish you didn't even bother taking this class.

There are better professors out there. Estill isn't the end of the world, but his homeworks are sloppy with mistakes he didn't catch and tests can be confusing. He is extremely late in putting in grades and doesn't provide many example problems, as his lectures come out of the textbook verbatim. Try to avoid him..

I personally like the way he teaches the content. The problem I have is the way the class is organized. He's scattered, our grader was constantly late with HWs (and he didn't push him as to why), and it's halfway through winter break and our finals haven't been put in yet...

This is the worst class I've taken at OSU. I'm not sure why they decided to let a math teacher instruct a CSE course, but he's absolutely TERRIBLE. Doesn't post the material on Carmen, and his notes are a hot mess to follow and hardly make sense most of the time. I really do not think he should be teaching CSE courses - he should stick to math.

DO NOT TAKE THIS !! I respect that he is a math professor but I don't think he is qualified to teach this CSE class. This class is designed to help CS major student to understand programming algorithm and logic based on math. But he make this class SO complicated and even out of topic. You want self learn?NO WAY because there is not enough material

Dr. Estill seems to be teaching higher level math (arguably calc II and III aren't even higher level math) yet he seems to struggle with algebra and will make many basic mistakes per lecture to the point it doesn't make sense to take notes till he finishes his writing. He is a nice guy who knew the calculus but seemed lacking in other math skills.
10/10 would recommend for Calc 2 recitation. Perhaps eccentric, but eccentricity is far better than monotony. Excellent at explaining theory, which is good when you have no true lecturer (as I did).

Easy and interesting math class. Watch lecture videos online, show up to online recitation and work in a group to do the problems, do the homework within a week of recitation. As long as you get your work done and can remember to watch the online lecture videos, you'll be fine. Almost no real math, all basic theories.

Math 1151 can be tough. Dr. Estill has frequent office hours, and he is very good at explaining the material. Even if you do all of the homework and study consistently, the exams can still be very tricky. Taking advantage of office hours really helped me succeed in the course. With his help, there was nothing that I did not understand.

Definitely recommend him. he's a little eccentric, but really cool. Definitely recommend attending class, but he confuses himself a little bit sometimes. Very understanding guy, though, and he teaches in a way that makes calculus very very easy to understand. OSU calc department sucks though, still ended with a B (not charles' fault!)

I would recommend him.  He always teaches straight from the book, which can be a little confusing when he uses the definitions, but overall I found lectures to be useful.  He is extremely helpful during office hours, which he has plenty of, and very caring about his students.  Definitely take advantage of his office hours.

Charles is pretty bad at lecturing.  He makes a lot of mistakes that we have to catch for him, and he takes a lot of lecture to write down theorems and proofs from the book.  I did really well on the first exam, and not too good on the second.  But the final exam had stuff that I don't think he ever taught us.  All the quizes were fair though.

Decent Professor, He occasionally confuses himself and often asks unnecessarily about spelling. Most of class is writing down formulas and doing practice problems. Class isn't mandatory. As long as you go to recitation and to most lectures you should be able to get a B.
He isn't capable of reaching a class because he gets lost so easily. I've gotten worse at calc in this class. We had a sub a couple days ago and it was incredibly easier to follow.

His lectures are unbearable for me, he constantly corrects his grammar and asks the class if he spelled something right. As long as you read the book, do practice problems and attend recitation, you'll be fine.

Very nice guy, but not the best teacher. Feel like he couldn't teach the class if he didn't read straight out of the book. Often messes up notes. Gives tough tests with twists you've never seen before that he probably couldn't even do.

I thought that Dr. Estill was a great professor.  He had a very interesting personality that was hilarious, and I never felt overly confused in his class.  You definitely have to work hard for it though.

Estill is a bit eccentric. He constantly corrects his own grammar when it isn't necessary. He confuses himself and doesn't seem to know what is going to be on the exams because he "isn't the one who makes them." If you need to have email correspondence with him, don't bother. He won't reply. Otherwise, if you go to his office hours, he will help.

Charles is a really great professor who really cares about what he is teaching. He is available and willing to help you in office hours if you need it. This class nevertheless is very challenging and you will definitely have to work for the grade you want but Charles does a excellent job at helping you do that. Attend lecture because he moves quick
Honestly, the online lectures found at the course website are just as helpful, if not more, as attending the lecture.
He clearly explained the material ad is rather hot

He listed "lecture note problems" in the syllabus that were basically the tests and quizzes. He doesn't curve, but he builds in extra credit (which is why I got over 100%). He made it super easy, but still taught you everything you needed to know.

My success in the class was mostly due to my Godlike TA, Daniel Glasscock. But Dr. Estill is good too. He lectures straight out of the textbook, so if I missed a lecture, I could just teach myself. He's very helpful during office hours. The practice problems my TA assigned were ridiculously helpful for studying. Pretty easy class if you keep up.
He is a great teacher, and enjoyable to listen to! Math 1172 is very difficult, but he is one to make the class as headache-free as he can.

Charles is wonderful! He wears all black, but is really nice. Go to his office hours, he really likes meeting his students! Exams aren't that bad, just study hard for the quizzes. No homework and not mandatory attendance. Overall, great guy.

Probably the best professor I have this semester. Extremely nice person and very willing to help with anything. He may wear all black and seem intimidating, but he is funny and a nerd in the best kind of way. Extremely passionate about math, but more importantly, passionate about his students as well.

Charles is by far the best math professor I've had at Ohio State. He explains the material decently, he is easy to understand (not foreign), and incredibly nice. As some others have said, don't be put off by the fact that he dresses in all black-- he might just be the nicest professor at OSU. I highly recommend Charles.
I would not recommend him to anyone, but he is bearable.
Easy class but charles in no help at all. Students correct him on the regular, doesnt even know his own material.

Over all a good teacher, and is very nice and helpful. He will go out of his way to help you understand the material, is very generous in grading; will give you some points for at least trying to answer the homework and test questions. Sometimes his lectures can be a bit confusing, as he tends to go through the material a little fast, however; if y

He was the best recitation teacher that I've had. He explains things really well and goes over the homework before it's due sometimes. Don't get put off by him dressing in all black; he's a great guy.
Charles is the cooooooolest guy ever. Who else would sport the full black apparel other than charles? Anyways... he's a good TA will explain whatever you need help with.

confuses himself then confuses students, figures it out eventually but by the time he does everyone's so confused they agree with him just to make him stop talking.  nice guy, bit of a pushover, more times than none will change a quiz or homework grade if you talk to him about it after class.  class was a bit blah, didn't get much out of it.
An interesting guy that you have to meet to understand.  He does sometimes get confused by his own explainations.
He tried, but he could not explain anything very well. He always messed up on the problems and was very unclear and just a bad teacher. He is a nice person though.
Charles is a nice guy.  He'll do whatever he can to help you out.  He can be a little unclear at times but he usually sorts it out by the end.

Really good TA!  I had him for two of the Calculus sequences, and he is not only very good at getting the material across, but is also good at showing little tricks that make the material easier to do.  Great mustache, too!
Charles was awesome, a really fun guy who is willing to spend as much time as you need for you to understand. He does wear black but its at odds with his extremely nice personality. A+ rating!
nice guy, would help you if needed but seemed a little strange, he would come to class dressed in all black and a leather jacket like a hardass but didn't seem that was at all, nice guy though

summary_comment: Professor Vutha is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by clear explanations, a supportive and inclusive classroom environment, and a strong commitment to student success. Students appreciate his availability during office hours and his responsiveness to emails, as well as the numerous resources and opportunities he provides to enhance learning beyond the standard curriculum.
summary_comment_short: Professor Vutha is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for his kindness, willingness to help, and clear explanations. Students appreciate his supportive approach, manageable workload, and dedication to creating a welcoming learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Amit is the kindest, most caring professor at OSU. He is always willing to help at office hours and since this class was online, he was very quick to respond to any questions using Microsoft teams. Nothing but great things to say about Amit.

Super good class! This professor keeps the workload manageable and understands that students have other things to do. But also makes so many resources and opportunities available if you want to learn the material well and not just focus on the grade. Really passionate about the subject and it comes through in his lectures.

I was lucky to have Amit for multivariable calc in Summer ‘24. He works very hard into making the class run smoothly, mixing ideas, theory, and real-life examples in his awesome lectures. Super chill and humble! He created a real community where everyone felt welcome and actually learned a lot.

Amit Vutha is one of the best math professors I have ever had. He truly cared for his students and wanted to see them succeed. He held numerous office hours and held online exam review sessions. He was very responsive to his emails and extremely understanding if you needed to reschedule an exam.
nice professor

A combination of best professor, best TA, and best design of course! Helpful lectures, good grading criteria that reduces stress, always patient, explains things clearly, respond quickly. Prof and TAs are really working hard helping you to get a good grade! Feel so lucky to be in this course for my first semester of college.

Prof. Vutha is truly one of the best math teachers around. He explains concepts clearly and genuinely cares about his students' success. Definitely take advantage of his office hours - they're super helpful. For study prep, I found unstuckstudy and the free textbook really useful.
He's awesome. Just take the class, I sucked at pre-calc, and he made me change my approach completely to math. Probably the best professor I'll ever have.

If you are paying attention, it will become clear that Dr. Vutha is a true blessing. He's a wonderful teacher who is extremely humble and selfless of his time.  I was a non traditional veteran student and was stressed about returning to college math. His positive energy and support made me feel seen in a five hundred person class and stick it out.

Super amazing teacher who actually cares about his students and wants to help! Willing to put in extra time and work around your schedule if additional help is needed. No textbook, everything can be learned from the organized notes he posts, and there were no surprises on the midterms. Go to office hours and monopolize on the extra credit offered!
My favorite professor!! Nice hand-writing, clear lecture slides and practice midterms.

Beyond being a gifted teacher, this guy's got a soul that's pure gold. 

He may have hundreds of student each semester, and yet he's got this knack of seeing the best in you and pulling you up, every single day, even if you can't see it yourself.

Whatever they're tossing his way in pay, it's a drop in the ocean for what he's truly worth.
Great guy, great sense of humor, and very reasonable. Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had. He's always looking to help, and cares more about you than the university and his job.

Amit is by far the best professor I have ever had. He is very kind and genuinely cares for all of his students and wants to see them succeed. Going to his office hours is very beneficial, especially for the written homework. He is very lenient with turning in late work and is very understanding.

Amit is the best teacher I have ever had. He is extremely understanding, down to earth, and kind. I actually learned everything I was being taught and understood it at a deeper level. I am so grateful to have had such an awesome experience being his student this year. He truly showed that he cared about each and every student.

Amit is the best math professor I have had. He provided us with clear notes and was thorough when explaining topics in lecture. He had numerous office hours throughout the week but was willing to help you anytime during the week regardless of his posted office hours. Amit wanted to see you succeed and cared for you much more than just a student.
Not many complaints. Amit did a good job being down to earth and making student feel like they are real people. Taught relatively well, but there is a lot of content to remember for the final.

Amit is one of the best professors I've had and really cares about his students. He's very understanding and has a good sense of humor. Weekly quizzes don't impact your grade too much. HW is due every week but overall a great prof and I would 100% take again.

Amit was the best math teacher I have had. He is very organized and uses a consistent format for lectures. He hosted zooms every Monday to prepare students for the weekly quizzes, held in-person exam review sessions, and was always helpful during office hours. Truly wants to see his students do well. Take Amit if possible.

Dr. Vutha is probably the best math professor I will ever have, which is sad for me, but great for you if you're planning to take any of his classes! He explains things thoroughly but in simple ways, and is always willing to help. His office hours are great to go to! He truly cares for you as a person and as a student :)
He was very funny and entertaining during class, he talked really fast though so you had to take notes fast.

Absolutely awesome guy. Incredibly caring and willing to meet with students outside of class, regardless of his office hours. Lectures are fast paced, but that is not his fault. He makes jokes during class and tries to make the content seem less boring. I highly recommend taking his class if you need the math credit!

Prof Vutha was an amazing professor and a great start to my freshman year. His lectures were detailed and helpful. He also hosted zoom reviews for every midterm and for the final which I found extremely helpful. Overall, his lectures made it easy to pass the class despite the material perhaps being difficult for some. I highly recommend him.
best ta ever hes awesome awesome !!!!!
best TA i have ever had in my life amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!
BEST TA EVER!!!!! Amazing guy very helpful!!!

BEST TA EVER!!!!!!!!!! Amit met up with me before the final exam to help me out because I was struggling and he is the most helpful TA I have ever had! He is very good at explaining things, and genuinely cares about his students. If you have him you will never struggle in math and you will have an easy, fun, and exciting semester!!! Hes a great TA!

I had Amit as a TA and he was incredible. I didn't have the best professor for calc 3, so having Amit during recitation was a life saver. He was funny, interesting, and cares about his students doing their best. He is great at explaining difficult subjects to understand and never makes you feel stupid for being wrong or asking questions.

The way Professor Vutha taught the course made it very easy to understand and internalize the material. He was always ready to help outside of the classroom and took the time to make sure his students felt prepared to take the quizzes and exams.
Does a good job treating you like a person and adult rather than a robot or just some kid. Funny too.
he will take care of you
Caring teacher, easy class.
He was great, and funny.

Nicest and most genuine guy I've ever met. Class was somewhat difficult, but Amit made himself so accessible online and outside of class because he genuinely cared about seeing us succeed. I wish I would've had him as my lecturer instead. He's very laidback and his review sessions were very helpful.

The actual class itself is not bad at all if you go to the lectures and keep up with the homework. There are 10 quizzes, 3 exams, weekly online homework assignments, and 1 final. Amit is such a great professor! He is very kind, caring, and funny. Highly reccomend!
Didn't go to as many lectures as I should have, but he's a good teacher. Always makes himself available and posts good notes. Very funny too.

Always held quiz review sessions and midterm prep sessions outside of class time, during his evenings which was very caring. He uses great symbolism during lectures to help us grasp concepts and always kept me engaged. Was very accessible outside of class. Great professor!

This has to be the best math teacher I've ever had. He's very honest about the material and does a fantastic job explaining it. He responds to emails within the hour, and even quicker the night before quizzes and exams. I would retake his class again if I had to because he made math easy for me when it's always been my least favorite subject!

Best professor ever. He formats his lecture notes very clearly - for each topic you can easily follow his examples and teaching. I definitely recommend him as a professor! If I could take his math class again, I would.
Great professor I missed 3 quizzes from my recitation and he let me take it with him during his own time.

Amazing professor. He clearly explains math. He is funny and is super caring. He will hold zoom calls for exam and quiz review. He spends a lot of his outside time for the greater good for his students. Exams are hard.
Amazing experience with him. He is hilarious and makes content engaging. Always available to answer questions too, he does reviews constantly and will do individual help for anyone who asks.
good prof for 1131

Fantastic professor in general. If your struggling in the class just ask him for help and he will literally just set up meets with you to help you catch up. Has review sessions for midterms and 2 practice midterms for each one. Grades well. Put in the effort and you will be fine. Also has extra credit opportunities and curves.

Amit Vutha is genuinely a great professor and cares a lot about his students. He hosts exam review sessions that are very helpful, responds quickly to emails, and is easily accessible outside of class. The content of the class is challenging by nature, but he tries his best to help students.

Easily one of the best professor's at OSU. Genuinely cares for his students and cares about his job. The class material may not be the easiest thing in the world but Amit makes sure to help you the best he can. Would definitely recommend taking him. Without a doubt cares more about his students than anything else. Amazing person.
nice!!!
The most awesome professor I ever met!
Dr. Vutha is probably the best math teacher I've had, he actually cares that you do well, and his exam review sessions are super helpful. If you get a chance to take a class with him, do it.
Really great and always willing to help!

Professor Vutha is one of the most kind, compassionate, & caring professors at OSU. I HATE math. I've always struggled with it, and after taking a W in Math 1130 the semester before (with a different professor), he made the class so easy to understand. He remembers students and wants them to succeed. Amazing man with a huge heart!
I had him as a TA and he was really great at giving us extra resources and creating extra study sessions before the final. You can tell he really cares about his students and their sucess.

I wish I could give him a 6/5. He does such a good job of connecting with his students and explaining the concepts well. He is also super understanding and will put the student over absolutely everything except his own son. I would take him for every math class if I could
Amazing professor that integrates conciseness, analogies, and passion into his well-prepared lectures. Accessible outside of class and is understanding of his students.
I loved having him as a professor. Hes very fair and really cares about his students. I didnt do well in math until his class and I learned a lot from him.

Amit Vutha is a great professor. He really cares about his students success and is willing to work with you outside of class. He grades very well and takes into account all work. In math 2174 he did not assign homework, but gives worksheets with good practice problems that prepare you for exams. However, the quizzes and exams were weighted heavily.
he always explains materials clearly, and submits specific notes

Vutha is an amazing professor. He makes his lectures interesting and is extremely accessible outside of class. he made me actually LIKE math which is insane because I've never had a teacher who made a math class interesting. i love his class and hope to get more teachers like him. DEFINITELY choose his class if you can

This professor was the most organized, proficient, and aesthetically pleasing lecturer ever. His lectures are clear, concise, and coherent. I would highly advise this professor for this course. He gives many extra exercises to help prepare for the exams. The course overall is a bit of a tough one, but he makes it so much easier.

Dr. Vutha is the best! He goes above and beyond what exceptional professors would do by offering ample review sessions before exams, times outside of class to discuss material, and more helpful resources which is a game changer for a class like Business Calc. If you get to take Amit, count your blessings because he is a very big one!

Dr. Vutha is one of the best professors I have had here at OSU. He really cares about his students' success, and goes out of his way to help. He held many (optional) review sessions for quizzes and exams, and gave many opportunities for extra credit. This guy is a gem.

Dr. Vutha is incredible. He truly cares for his students and is very encouraging. His lectures are entertaining and he is always open to students. He was many opportunities for office hours and review sessions and is easily accessible. He is one of the best professors I have had by far.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Vutha! He is humorous, always willing to meet with students, has great & incredibly helpful lectures, and allows for a tough subject like Calc to be easily understood. He is the best prof I have ever had at OSU, and if you get him- count your blessings!

Best professor at Ohio State. If you ever need extra help, Amit is always willing to help. The course material is difficult, but he always does his best to help. He gives an ample amount of practice problems and review sessions. Follow his practice problems and the tests will be manageable, but calculus, regardless, is hard.

Professor Vutha makes math quite easy. His lectures keep you engaged and he devotes extra time on the weekends for review sessions where you can ask him to cover the more difficult concepts. By far the best math professor I've ever had. The math department needs to promote him.

Registered for calc expecting to end up with a B. The exceptional Dr. Vutha is the reason I have an A, a newfound interest in math, and much-developed skills. He breaks down the most complicated concepts, keeps you engaged, & gives you countless opportunities to improve. Abundant review sessions. Will tailor his help to your needs if you reach out.

Dr. Vutha is an amazing professor. He is very accessible outside lectures and genuinely cares about your success. Do the homework, utilize office hours to ask questions, and the class will go well, thanks to Dr. Vutha.

Amit has got to be my favorite professor thus far. He is incredibly caring and takes time to help each of his students. He goes above and beyond by offering extra homework or problems and even holding multiple review sessions. He truly cares that his students succeed. Explains difficult concepts very easily too.
GOAT

The best professor I will probably ever have. I personally had to change to P/NP, but if you do your work on and over time, you shouldn't have to. The class is hard, but Vutha makes it really easy to understand and he's very open and easy to access. He has reviews before every quiz and exam and is always willing to answer every question. Test heavy
Great lecturer and easy to follow notes. Simplifies complex material to make it easier to understand.

He was a very nice professor always ready to help his students. He genuinely cared about the well being of the students during this hard time and he always tried his best to simplify things down for students. Office hours are very helpful attend them.

Dr. Vutha has been one of the best professors I have ever had. The class is tough but Dr. Vutha does everything in his power to help you through it. He is very funny and personable. He holds review sessions before every quiz and exam and he is willing to meet with you anytime about any questions you have and explain them to you. Awesome dude!

Dr. Vutha is a professor that genuinely cares about each and every one of his students, and wants everyone to succeed. His lectures are very easy to understand, and he is a very clever and witty person. I would absolutely recommend him for this class.

Dr. Vutha is not only able to make a very difficult subject like calculus digestible, he will take his time to make sure every student understands what he is demonstrating. I took this course during COVID and every week, multiple times a week, Dr. Vutha would run a study session for any student to attend. He is very king and genuine.

This was my first semester at OSU, and I'm extremely confident that this will be the best professor I will ever have. He is very caring and wants his students to succeed. He has weekend review sessions before midterms, and review sessions before quizzes. You won't be left hanging if you put in effort. He's a GREAT professor and an amazing person!

Dr. Vutha is one of the best professors at OSU. He holds many review sessions outside of class and makes sure you are ready for every single weekly quiz and exam (every 3 weeks). Class is weighted 70% on the exams so be sure to do well. Final exam was tough but all other exams were quite easy.
Amit is an amazing professor and you can tell he wants his students to be successful. He knows what he's talking about and his lectures are very helpful so I recommend attending as many as you can.

Dr. Vutha is by far my favorite professor ever. He honestly cares about each and every student and wants them to succeed. The class is difficult due to the math department. A weekly quiz, homework, and five exams made up the course. Dr. Vutha does everything he can to prepare you for exams. We need more teachers like him. Take this course with him.

Absolutely amazing professor. You can tell he genuinely cares a lot about the success of his students; he holds many review sessions and is always open to help even in the middle of a lecture. His lectures are very easy to understand and actually quite interesting. He is an amazing person and teacher... 10/10 would recommend taking his class!

Because classes moved online the math dep. was very strict about time limits for quizzes and tests which heavily affected my grade. That being said, Dr. Vutha was amazing and did everything he could to make this semester easier. The notes he makes for his lectures are absolutely incredible and he is very funny. He replies fast and willingto help.

Very funny professor. He is very knowledgable and the notes he makes are very aesthetic. The notes themselves make you want to be good at calculus. The extra revision sessions are a great asset. Never leaves you hanging. Answers all questions in lectures even if youre interrupting the flow

Amit was a great guy. His lectures were extremely well done with plenty of example problems. He held a few (optional) review lectures outside of class time. More over for Calc 1156 using the online/MyLab resources really helped. Overall really nice guy who makes sure you understand the material one way or another :) 10/10 would take again!!

Professor Vutha is the best math teacher I've ever had in my life. He legitimitaly cares about students understanding the material and he holds review sessions where you can ask about anything and he explains it in full detail until you understand. I struggled with calculus in high school but now calc is one of my favorite subjects!

Dr. Vutha is a fantastic professor and he really helps you learn the material. In lecture he keeps the content interesting with some random facts/interesting one liners, and you can tell he genuinely cares about his students. Amit is a sweetheart as a person, and the course is the same content/less rigorous than the MATH 1151 course I've been told.

Dr. Vutha is, by far, the best math professor I have EVER had. He explains things very well and thoroughly, he is easily available outside of class to answer any questions, and he's funny, so it makes learning calculus bearable. Also, dare I say, kinda fun? If you are taking calc for the first time ever, DEFINITELY take it with Dr. Vutha!

So glad I had Vutha after I failed this course the previous semester. He explains the material very well, was easily accessible outside of lectures, and he truly cares about his students. Homeworks do include some harder questions that you won't be tested on.

It's really nice for me to have Professor Vutha for Calc 3. You all know that this course won't be easy. However, Dr. Vutha makes it relatively easier. Great lecturer with plenty of patience in explaining everything you wondered. I took the online version of this course. He's course definitely stands out among all the other online courses.
Great professor for calculus.

This was the first calculus class that I had ever taken so I was worried. However, Dr. Vutha made the work as easy as possible. He cares about his students and really wants everyone to succeed. He keeps lectures interesting with some light humor, he has his funny moments. I would recommend Dr. Vutha to anybody, he is a great professor.

Amit is so sweet and inspirational. He believes greatly in his students and wants them to do well; he is always readily available to help. Clearly very knowledgeable about the course material. 10/10 recommend.
He is a great person. One of my favorite teachers ever.

I have never really used office hours, but between my second and third midterm I did not go to a single lecture, so right before the third midterm, I attended office hours. Vutha went above and beyond to make sure I understood the material and does this for all his students. The content is very easy, and the tests are even easier.

Vutha is such an amazing professor and got me through so much my first semester at OSU. He will spend a lot of time working with you outside of the classroom and will bend over backwards to make sure that you really understand the material. His class is pretty straight forward. Do the homework and show up to lecture! 12/10 would recommend this man!
Dr. Vutha was hands down the best math professor I've ever had. He is always willing to provide extra help on his own time. He truly wants the best for his students.

It's college calc, so it won't be easy, but Amit is willing to move deadlines and is always available for office hours or at the very least an e-mail. He was funny and understanding and did a good job of explaining everything. Only reason I struggled was a poor TA. Plus he fought for us to have calculators on the exams, so.

For MATH1148, he is a great and organized professor. Guided notes are provided and he clearly moves through at a good pace. Don't miss lecture, quizzes are given every week, homework is due every week, and final exam is cumulative. He's a great professor and wants to help his students outside of class-time. Also he has the best dry humor ever.

I had him for recitation, and I could see how he would definitely be a better lecture prof. He seems pretty cool and has a dry sense of humor that makes him relatable, but can come across as pretty rude and condescending when you ask a question during class. I would leave recitation more confused than when i came bc his teaching can be confusing.
No complaints here. Great professor and extremely nice guy who conveys information clearly to students.
He is a Very helpful teacher. If you ask, he is aways willing to help you even on a Sunday afternoon. Gives clear , coherent and logic lectures.

Super great class. Professor Vutha lays it all out and makes its super easy to follow with tons of examples and a step by step procedure. He really cuts the fat out of teaching and gets to the point. He's not a very personable person, but he doesn't really need to be for this class. Tough because I don't like math, but a very good class to take

Prof Vutha is the reason I did well in this class. He was always available to meet if you sent him an e-mail, even outside of his regular office hours. His exam reviews were thorough and clear, and he was genuinely interested in helping us understand the material. I remember before the final he held an open study session that went until 2am.

Homework due online and a quiz every week. He has an accent but its not that bad to understand. The material is easy but sometimes he can make it confusing. He is very nice and helpful if you go to him one on one though. Tests are tough, make sure you do the practice midterms. I skipped lecture a lot but I took the class in high school so...
Personally went out of his way to offer me an extra study session when he saw my second midterm grade take a dip.

This guy is absolutely amazing. I wasn't even in his class, but Vutha subbed in once and I loved him so I attended his office hours. He treated me like a son. He spent hours upon hours tutoring me before every exam. One night, he opened up the math building and sat with us from 9PM-5AM to study for an exam.  Quality human being.

Great professor, he is always willing to meet with you and help. Also if you go to him with your midterms he'll walk you through them and might even give you points back! Make sure you get to know him, he is an amazing guy as well

Amit is one of the best math professors I have ever had, always willing to help and arrange office hours to help you, it was 1172 so it is NOT an easy class by any means but his teaching is wonderful and he is a great guy.

He is probably the most dedicated math prof at OSU. He is very easy to approach and made a hard class like Math 1172 doable. He is very knowledgeable and interested in what he does. Honestly he helped me change the way I look at math.

Very clear and organized lecturer. Nice and helpful. Midterms & finals are taken with other 1131 sessions. The lectures are pretty easy but the midterms can be challenging because they're only 50 min. You'll be fine if you go to Amit's lectures and attend recitations.
Its a calculus class, it's supposed to be tough. Three exams, one final and weekly homeworks and quizzes. Very smart guy and accommodating of any issues you have in class.
Very tough class, but the professor is good

summary_comment: Professor Liu is considered a decent individual, but his teaching methods are criticized for focusing heavily on memorization rather than deep understanding, particularly through the use of slides for mathematics instruction. Additionally, his midterms are predominantly multiple choice and true/false, leading to poor performance and requiring grading curves, which deviates from standard assessment practices for the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Liu's teaching style is criticized for focusing heavily on slides, which leads to rote memorization rather than deep understanding. The midterms are predominantly multiple choice and true/false, with low passing scores, requiring grade curving, and not aligned with the course homework.

Ratings.comment: The professor is a good person, but his teaching style is not good. He uses slides to teach mathematics, which feels like memorising rather than understanding. His midterms contain concept questions only; no mathematical questions at all. Everyone in the class did horrendously, and he had to do a curve, which is not a rule for this course.

He's not a bad person and his lectures aren't that bad, but his midterms (worth 20% of our grade each) are completely multiple choice and true/false. The high on our midterm was a B and the median was an F because of trick questions. If you need a high GPA for a scholarship, switch profs ASAP because the HW does not prep you for the exam.

summary_comment: Professor Krishnan is known for fostering an intellectually stimulating environment and encouraging deep understanding over rote memorization, which some students find challenging initially. Despite being described as generous with grades and having a positive personality, his lectures are sometimes disorganized and difficult to follow, leading to confusion among students. Students appreciate his deep knowledge of the subject matter and the fairness of his exams, though many recommend supplementing his teaching with additional resources.
summary_comment_short: Professor Krishnan is known for fostering an intellectually stimulating environment and encouraging deep understanding over rote memorization, which some students find challenging initially. Despite occasional disorganization and difficulty in following lectures, students appreciate his generosity in grading and his willingness to help, finding the class both rewarding and demanding.

Ratings.comment:
I think it is important to consider the role of the professor and the student- Dr. Krishnan is enthusiastic but discourages memorization/ straightforward procedures. 

Student wants straightforward work.

Students around me seem understandably confused.

Overall he is a generous grader, great personality, and fosters an intellectual environment.
Easy, but disorganized class. Extremely lenient grading but expect to work to understand the material. Also, if you are reading this, nerf miner.

He provides no materials, recordings, notes, or slides—just writing on anblackboard and a book focused on applying linear algebra in MATLAB. I struggled since I couldn't take notes, and the book was awful. His tests were mathematically easy but conceptually brutal. I don't know how strict he is on grading yet.
Makes algebraic mistakes on problems that a 5th grader could do. Lectures are pointless and expects you to learn the entire course by yourself.

Dr. Krishnan is a bit unorganized and his lectures can be hard to follow at times. The homework can be very challenging without guidance. However, his exams are fair and he grades very leniently. It is obvious he has a deep understanding of the course content, and the class is very interesting. One of the best math classes available.

Lectures were extremely hard to follow. I found it easier to understand concepts by just looking at online videos. 90% of all lectures are about concepts with very few examples of how to apply them to problems. Be ready to spend time outside of class learning. Exams were straightforward and similar to homework. Overall, the class felt disorganized.

I liked Professor Krishnan. He was kind and wanted to help. The homework was harder than the tests, but that was a good thing. He would work in broad terms and was difficult to understand in lecture, so it took a lot of outside studying to understand the content. Tests were generally fair and easier than homework.
He is a wonderful teacher, but a lot of homework Exam is not so hard

Pros: Tests are pretty simple (Same difficulty as easiest HW problems), Goes through many problems in class, Not much HW, Gives plenty of time to do HW, Very energetic Cons: Often made simple algebra mistakes during lectures which made following his lectures difficult sometimes Overall he was great. Study 3-4 hours a week and you should be good.
Clearly explains course material and tests reflected homework exactly. Had some interesting tangents to keep students engaged.

He wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Sometimes hard to contact. I felt that the course material was somewhat difficult but all the tests were extremely fair and to the point, no curveballs were thrown like many past math classes at OSU. Wasn't an excellent lecturer but was well prepared for class everyday. Attendance not mandatory, but helpful.
He is a nice guy and well-prepared.

Prof Krishnan's class was incredible (averages of 80% on midterms), until we got to second order differentials. He had to do some lectures twice because he got so many questions, and no one i talked to got it. Unfortunately, I have to actually apply ODE's in my major, so thats a big problem for me. Final was brutal, I went from a solid A to a B-.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Partial Differential Equations for Science and Engineering

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra for Engineering Graduate Students

summary_comment: Professor Aboughazi is challenging to understand due to her accent and messy notes, leading many students to rely on recorded lectures and self-study. While some found the content manageable and the exams relatively straightforward, others struggled with the format and difficulty of the exams, which heavily weighted tests and quizzes. Overall, the class structure allows for flexibility in attending lectures, with a focus on independent study and office hours as key resources.
summary_comment_short: Professor Aboughazi is known for her challenging exams, which are heavily weighted and often differ significantly from practice problems. Students find her lectures difficult to follow due to her accent and messy handwriting, though many appreciate the recorded lectures and extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: This class has 3 exams, but the final is not cumulative over the whole year just the newest stuff and then like the first 6 lessons. The lecturer is hard to understand but she records all the lectures so you don't have to go to class. There are 3 quizzes in recitation, and lowest one gets dropped. Felt the content was duable and easy to get help.

Her teaching style was very confusing and I really struggled to understand the material in lectures. Exams are nothing like the practice problems she recommends. Not sure why I can do the homework without struggle but manage to do poorly on the exams. You don't know what's on the exams and they're 70% of your grade. Good luck.

She is hard to understand because of her accents. Lectures are her just talking about her pre-written notes. I never went to the lectures and did the notes myself and got an A. The class isn't horrible as long as you study well for the tests and quizzes. Not that many assignments.

Can't understand her, recitation teacher was also awful, her notes are messy and unhelpful. If you want to pass this class ypu have to read the text book on your own. I did tutoring and still failed. Also homework is the hardest part of the class.

A lot of people complain about her accent, but it honestly isn't that heavy. Her office hours are a great resource, and while it's pretty test heavy it's not the end of the world if you do bad on one exam. Uploads online lectures so that you can choose to go or not go to class, and attendance isn't mandatory for recitation or lecture.

She is very nice, but not a good professor. She has a very strong accent and it his hard to understand, also her notes are the messiest notes I have ever seen and it is hard to follow along. Eventually I just stopped going to lectures because it did not help me at all. I would teach myself through the textbook.

I really like the layout of this course. I highly recommend doing the pre-lecture extra credit quizzes immediately after class, because they really help and take 5 minutes to do. The exams were super easy, mostly multiple choice, and the difficulty of the exam questions matched the difficulty of the questions we did in class.

Her lectures weren't helpful to me at all as her handwritten notes were difficult to read and understand. Pretty much stopped going to lectures and taught myself using the textbook. She's a nice person but just not a very good teacher. She does cancel class a lot and there are extra credit opportunities.

I have personal beef with Rachida. She told us we had to memorize 22 formulas for an exam, not wanting to fail I did, and forgot to mention she decided to provide them. Her homework includes a lot of information that we never go over bc she doesn't make them. She he cancels class but fails to let us know, and talks to us like children.

The lectures can be hit or miss, but using resources like Unstuck study AI alongside the textbook makes it doable. Grading is mostly based on quizzes and exams, so staying on top of the material is key. Overall, an average class.

She was a really average professor, to be honest. She definitely wasn't a bad professor, but she wasn't great either, she's just middle of the road. Lectures can be boring and also hard to understand because of her accent, although you do get used to it.

I took Calc 3 2153 and learned nothing from going to her lectures, her accent made it so hard to understand. Her PDF of notes was the only thing I learned from. Exams were kind of out of pocket/not what I expected. When you got 2-3 of the MC questions wrong brought the exam grade down a letter grade. She was friendly though and wanted us to learn.

Dr.Aboughazi is a wonderful person, but her class is difficult. It was 80% exams/quizzes and 20% homework. There was no curve, but 1 quiz and 2 HW's were dropped and there was no cumulative final. Lectures could be very scattered/confusing, but the homework examples on the online platform help a lot. General physics knowledge may help as well.
I thought she was fairly good at explaining concepts and included helpful examples as well as provided multiple practice problems for each exam. The weekly quizzes were kind of annoying but doable.

Lectures can be boring, but there are shortened video forms of the lecture material posted for the entire semester. Doesn't move on until someone provides an answer to her question, she does not answer her own questions typically. Pretty easy to follow notes.
Professor Aboughazi is so sweet and gives plenty of examples during lecture
Lectures are too hard to read and she doesn;t explain topics literally just solves the problems and expects you to put two and two together. She is a very nice person but a very bad teacher!!

She grades literally nothing, the TA's grade every assignment. One time she put in an online Carmen quiz answer wrong and said it was only one point and she won't fix it as it doesn't matter because it was too much work to fix everyone's grade. She doesn't really care. If you're decent at math going into the class you're fine. Ask your TA for help.

She knows what she's doing, however, lectures tend to get boring. Wants students to succeed so if you do your work, you will get an A. There are quizzes every week, 3 exams (including the final), and 1 homework a week.

Lectures were 90% practice problems, so you definitely have to read the textbook and teach the chapters to yourself to actually learn the material. Lecture notes not organized super well and could be difficult to understand. Grades mostly based on recitation quizzes and online exams.
She loves to say the number trillion and she makes no sense whatsoever. She is so confusing. Good luck.
Nah
Hard to understand and goes off on random tangents.

I was super scared going into this semester just because Ive heard diff eq is a nightmare universally; I never would have thought that I could end the class with an A-! Lecs both online and in-person, homework isnt awful (it is group hw though), and exams/quizzes are fair. Plus, if you do well on the last three quizzes, you wont have a final ;)

Rachida is a very sweet and kind individual, who is eager to help her students when they don't understand material. I recommend taking a blended course with half days with a TA, since her class is very fast-paced and it helps to have someone in between to slow things down.

not a good lecturer. all she does is draw arrows and circle prewritten notes. you do not need to show up to class, but I recommend going to recitation. don't get me wrong, she is very sweet, but personally not my favorite professor/way of learning. 3 exams (1 is a final) that are multiple-choice, and some homework assignments in connect math.

She was nice, but not a good lecturer at all. her lectures were all online and were very boring. She doesn't speak very good English which made it hard to follow. By the end of the semester I was not attending lecture and teaching myself out of the homework and textbooks which you are required to purchase.
This class sucked. The lectures would not work half the time and she would not check the chat that is telling her that it isn't working.
Rough class and she was no help. Her notes don't make sense and she doesn't explain anything well. Do NOT take her class unless you already know trig or if it's absolutely necessary.
Terrible. Just terrible. Only thing saving you is online quizzes & exams. Because she cannot lecture.

She's horrible, has a heavy accent. Could not understand her at all. DO NOT TAKE HER AT ALL COSTS. Exams were online, and quizzes were in recitations. Exams and quizzes were very difficult. Her notes were very sloppy. I did not learn anything from her. You have to teach yourself everything. There is no extra credit. Homework was also online & hard

Her lectures were frustrating because her notes were messy, she talks very scatterbrained and her accent makes her harder to understand at times. She struggles with technology and spent a lot of class time figuring out technical problems over zoom. Top it off with her singing at 9AM and I stopped attending the lectures.

Not the worst professor, not the best. The course content was well outlined and explained. All her notes are in her handwriting and can be very confusing. The way she explains things can be difficult to understand. I probably did so well because of how well my high school math teachers prepped me.

Goes through material rather slowly but is thorough, and lectures are recorded so you can go through them later at your own pace. References the book minimally but is is easily accessible online. Professor always tries to interact with students

Notes were extremely helpful for me, lectures not so much. I would often work on my own problems and have the lecture on in the background. However she is great at being upbeat and answering questions, genuinely wants you to succeed.

She's a pretty decent instructor. Sometimes the lectures were hard to follow, but every time I asked her a question, she would answer it well. It is boring to watch the lectures, but they are somewhat important to pass the class. This class was lectures 3 days a week, recitation 2 days a week, and you have normally one homework and one quiz per wk.

She post lecture videos and notes from each lecture on carmen. The notes were a little lacking but overall good prof. Weekly homework assignments and quizzes that aren't that hard (sometimes they did take more time than necessary). If you review the material from the homework and ask your TA what would be on the quiz you will do well.

She isn't the greatest, but she isn't the worst either. I took this class online, and her lectures were very boring and disengaging, not sure how she translate to in person lectures. Every lecture was recorded so you don't have to attend. If you pay attention and do the homework, you'll pass easily, but that can be difficult to do at times.

By far one of the most disorganized math teachers I have ever encountered. She jumps from topic to topic with little explanation and her notes look like a 10 year old wrote them (literal chicken scratch). While her class is by no means hard, if you actually want to learn pre-calc material TAKE ANOTHER PROFESSORS course.

Aboughazi's lectures were often hard to understand and to complete my own notes I often had to reference the textbook to make sense of what she was saying. I relied more on my TA toward the end of the semester to learn the material.

Rachida is a nice person, but she doesn't speak English or teach very well. Also her lectures were very hard to follow. I had her for PE calc and the class was easy and I really didn't even attend the lectures at all.

She is a terrible professor, very accent heavy and does not explain things clearly at all. She moves through topics incredibly fast in her lectures and does not answer questions but instead tells students she has no idea what they are talking about. Only way to learn anything is a TA and mine was terrible as well.

She is very hard to follow and does not teach Trig in the most easy way to understand. I have no Pre-Calc background and my saving grace was my TA: Eric Fawcett. I learned more from him than from the professor. Not a bad professor just needs to improve on communication.
The class was unorganized, and the professor was very confusing. She didn't even post office hours. Recitation TA's are the only way to learn anything. Would never and will never have her again.
Class was disorganized and to have someone sing to you about trig at 8 am and then not answer questions was interesting. Did not have office hours, would not reccomend this teacher

dont be fooled by her high rating, she is a terrible math teacher. notes are extremely unprofessional and looks like doodle bob wrote them instead. accent heavy so you cant understand her. people slander sherry but you will be begging for sherry after this class. besides eric the TA's are pretty bad and not eduan level overall a downgrade from 1148

If she was teaching calc or higher this would be a nightmare. Only 12 people show up to lectures and the first one had 170ish. Her notes are unreadable and you cant understand her. Trig is easy but I would avoid if you struggle with the content because she cant teach.

Very poor lectures that don't help at all I have self taught my way through this entire class. Can't believe she is a professor it seems like she has no background in teaching at all. Homework is not bad and is often helpful because you work with a partner. The exams are terrible many questions are things that are not even reviewed.

Lectures are a joke no one shows up because she is so bad at teaching online. The exams on connect math are made up of questions she's not even aware of when you ask she won't know how many questions are on it. If you miss a single question on the connect math exam's your grade drops by a letter each question. Do not recommend this professor.
She is actually caring, and an easy class. If you watch her lectures and do online homework then it's an easy A.

She genuinely cares about her students, and I am sure that the majority of the assignments and amount of exams were determined by the math dept- not her. Here notes could be confusing and I found her lectures to not be super engaging, but if you attend, participate, and really try on your homework (which should be an easy A), you will be fine!

Had her for my precalc class last semester, I haven't taken a math class in over a year but it was fine. Really tho, it was my TA that saved me learning wise. Her lectures are a little all over the place but she is super nice. Grades are worth 60% of your grade so as long as you do the review you should be good.

I am taking this class during the COVID pandemic so everything is online. I fell behind in all my classes for various personal life reasons. She is the only professor that did not allow me to catch up on my work despite me describing my situation to her. She has absolutely no sympathy for her students and I recommend no one takes her classes ever.

I didnt mind the lecturer herself, it was just the fact that class was online. Exams were on a program called Connect Math, and you typed your final answer with no way to show your work. This made exams challenging because you couldnt get partial credit for your work. If it was in person, Id recommend this professor.
Shes okay. But make sure to do a lot of practice on your own.
This was the second class I took with her and would take another any day! Shes a fair grader and youre more heavily weighted by homeworks than exams and quizzes. The criteria for an A is 90.

Always flies through the lectures expecting everyone to understanding everything ahead of time. Does not respect students questions and concerns and gives no insight as to what is to be expected on the test. Disgraceful.

The professor was not bad, but it was not a great learning environment. The ideas were scattered and out of order making class hard to understand and easy to zone out. Overall not a bad professor and cares about what she is teaching. I would recommend going to office hours and asking questions there.

Sweetest woman in the world! Her lectures were okay, attendance is not mandatory but it helps to listen. Recitation definitely taught more than lecture. She puts up plenty resources to do well on tests, the exams have the exact types of problems in the practice exams and quizzes. If you still feel shaky, do the homework.

Super nice, but quickly blows through lectures, and posts the notes online after class. After the first 4 weeks, I stopped showing up every single day because I actually learned more from my TA during recitation than I did in lecture.

As far as math goes, this prof is actually pretty great. I have trouble paying attention in math and enjoying professors, but she does a really good job teaching what she does, despite the dry subject matter.
What a woman. She is hilarious and a great lecturer. I'm not the best at math and she made 1150 a lot easier for me

I had to drop this class initially and she was WAY better than my previous guy. She organizes her notes in a way that clearly outlines different examples and she knows what she's doing. Really listen to her tips and tricks!!! This is a difficult class so make sure you are doing the PRACTICE WORKSHEETS and PRACTICE EXAMS!!!

Great lecture style- gave info in easy-to-understand pieces and did example problems solved during lecture. Receptive to questions during lecture. Class is hard (taylor series) but she/math dept. made sure to give us a list of things to know for test. Prof. also gave a self-made guide before exams in addition to study guide given by the department.

Nice lady, but blows through lecture material like you already know it, and then immediately posts the notes online. Total waste of time going to lecture when Khan Academy videos teach the material, and you have a recitation.

Didn't go to lecture--she just posted all the lecture notes on Carmen and I wrote them down and studied them from there. Nice lady, did not find lecture very useful. Found that many people had the same experience, but I still recommend going the first few weeks to see for yourself.

Dr. Aboughazi was very prepared and on schedule. She cared about her students and always finished material on time. If you do all of the practice problems and practice midterms you will do okay on exams. The first exam is hard, second easy, third medium and the final is hard.

Dr. Aboughazi is a charming woman who lectures well. She is good at breaking things down and always put the abstract concepts in understandable context. She is fairly easy-going, and likes to joke around a bit. She also has an accent but it never once got in the way of my understanding. I like math, so I may be biased, but her course was enjoyable.

Dr. Aboughazi clearly cares about math and does her best to explain things well, but lectures became pointless. Her notes are posted online and she just explains them in her lectures. If you have questions, feel free to go to the lectures, but recitation is more beneficial.

She seemed nice enough but I found her lectures unclear and unorganized. The book problems helped me prep for the tests but the quizzes were killer because the questions always seemed to be way out of left field. Maybe it's because I had a bad TA, but with this class I had to do a lot on my own.
She is a great prof. She's very accommodating and her teaching style is organized.

I can't understand what is she talking about during classes. I attended most classes before midterm 2, but I gave up because of her. She doesn't write anything during class but uses her previous lecture notes. Although she uploaded her notes on Carmen, it still be difficult to get an A.
It is very hard to understand what she is saying.  Even so, she seems to typically find the most complicated way to solve an equation. Recitation is important and where you'll learn the most.
Unorganized, hard to follow and understand. Did not prepare students well for quizzes.

Sometimes has no idea what she is even talking about, gets sidetracked very easily and although her accent is not hard to understand it caused some confusion when she is explaining things. However the way the class is set up you have some help with the grades, but the tests are heavily weighted and very hard.

Dr. Aboughazi was a wonderful and quirky Math 1150 professor. She does have an accent but it's really easy to understand.
