Even if you are very smart and are going to get an A, you should still switch out of this class. Sutherland has 0 flexibility and never gives second chances- suppose you forgot to submit or do something on time even when it was completely out of your control. No clue with he is still hired, especially since he's only a tenured Professor.
Very very poorly made class, even an IMO medalist would struggle in this. 100% do not recommend! DROP OUT IF YOU HAVE HIM.

Extremely difficult class, especially for one that shouldn't even be that difficult. I took Calc BC in high school and got a 4 on the AP test, but the Professor never actually taught any of the concepts. I would not have got an A- if I did not take Calc BC. The final had problems that we never even did anything remotely similar to during lectures.

He does not care about your time. He literally wants students to do tons of useless problems, that have nothing to do with the exam, instead of actually helping students to be succesful in this class. Honestly cannot think about anything positive to say. Frequently messes up his answers in lecture problems, and the problems he does are pointless.

Got a 5 on the Calc AB test before starting this class. The only reason I even managed to get a B was because of everything I learned from Calc AB. I don't even think Sutherland taught a single useful thing in any of his lectures, to prepare us for the actual exams. Tried asking him a question one time, he completely shut me off.
PLEASE TAKE THIS CLASS WITH LITERALLY ANYBODY ELSE!!

Do not be fooled by these reviews! Sutherland isn't actually as bad as the reviews make him out to be. In fact, he's EVEN WORSE. No matter how good you are at calculus, I am begging you to please take this class with literally anybody else.

Currently in this guy's class, nothing he says makes sense. He just blabbers over random problems that he pulled out of his ass. We took our first midterm thsi week, nothing he did in class helped for the midterm. I'm considering skipping all his lectures from now and just self-studying instead to save my time. Do not be in this dude's class.

Only got an A because I self-studied for all the exams (while skipping half his lectures) and asked bunch of questions to Math 1152 TAs. Sutherland is quite literally the most useless Professor in all of OSU. He probably is smart and really good at math, but my god, he is the worst Professor of all time and has absolutely 0 compassion for humans.

If you believe anything on this website about an OSU professor, believe this man's page entirely. Take 1151 with literally anyone else. I can't believe he has a job. Not only a bad lecturer but a very rude and unpleasant person.

Honestly this is a hard course and idk how much control he has over it but theres too much homework and too test heavy and not very understanding and minor things get lots of points off, horrible lecture, over complicates and bad at explaining, doesn't properly awnser your questions, only got an A from self studying

Every negative quality that you thought a Professor could have, and I mean EVERY, this guy has. Not even just an absolutely horrendous Professor, but also a terrible human being with zero ethics or care in the world for any of his students. I cannot fathom how someone spent that much time and money on getting a phD, just fo ruin lives of students.

THIS IS THE WORST PROFESSOR AT OSU. PLEASE SWITCH INTO LITERALLY ANYONE ELSE"S CLASS, OR ELSE YOU WILL PROBABLY REGRET IT. HE WOULD NOT GIVE ME AN EXTENSION ON THE FIRST WRITTEN HOMEWORK ASSIGNMENT, WORTH 7% OF THE TOTAL GRADE, EVEN AFTER I TOLD HIM I WAS EXTREMELY SICK (I COULD NOT LEAVE MY BED) AND NEEDED MORE TIME TO PROPERLY DO THE ASSIGNMENT.
DO NOT BE IN THIS PROFESSOR'S CLASS, TRY YOUR HARDEST TO SWITCH INTO LITERALLY ANYONE ELSE"S CLASS.

Extremely difficult class that grades like math is your single life long dedication. It's super easy to lose too many points to math grammar and other formalities. Professor is also not accommodating in any way and does the minimum. And do not take Flipped and Flexible either!

Lets say on a test you decide not to, or forget to write the lim as k -> infinity for every single line of your work. You write it at the beginning, and in the final answer, but not in your work. This can and will literally result in a zero on that problem, even if the answer is correct. Alex Sutherland is hell. Stay away be any means possible.
DO YOUR WRITTEN HOMEWORK WELL.

This class requires EFFORT. None of the handholding that takes place in high school flies by in this class. This class is for hardworking ADULTS, and that HARDWORK is rewarded here. This man is genuinely a great professor, but he faces the misfortune of having to deal with all of these immature business majors who expect homework to be coloring.

I had to go through absolute hell and tons and tons of hours of studying to get an A. I completely studied everything online independently, since this Professor's lectures were completely useless. Nobody likes him as a Professor or person as he is unwilling to do more than the bare minimum for his students. If OSU doesn't fire him, we should riot.

I may have gotten an A- in this class but the only person that I can blame for that is myself. I clawed my way towards this grade, and I learned everything on my own. He uses such big, random, and ambiguous words, when he does not have to, like we already know that he is smart. Most of the grade is based off the written homeworks and midterms.

Very bad at explaining topics. He spent the majority of time in lecture doing practice problems rather than explaining the topic at hand, where he would make lots of errors which lead to even more confusion. He also doesn't post notes, and the only way I was able to understand the topics were from YouTube videos and guides from other professors.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I don't even know where to begin on how bad he is. He doesn't know how to teach and can't answer questions. He also wastes time by staring at students demanding for participation when he doesn't explain the material enough to understand. I passed AP Calc BC with a 5 and struggled. Trying to learn from this guy is a nightmare.
Pretty much everything everyone is saying is true. Overall just a horrible professor.
NEVER TAKE THIS PROFESSOR

I took his class as a high school CCP student and it was absolutely horrible. The class was so homework heavy that I would be spending 3-5 hours every night working on it and still not complete it. That took my focus away from my other high school classes and I almost started failing those too. He has no sympathy and is not helpful to his students.

I'm genuinely curious as to why OSU hasn't done anything to remove this professor from the school? No offense, but how did he earn his PhD? I have only heard negative things about him from everyone, and not a singel slightly positive thing. When everyone complains, it seems like the issue is definetely this Professor himself.

I have been to every single lecture thus far this semester, and this Professor repeats the same things each lecture. He will ask the entire lecture what the answer to a question or step is, and he won't say anything until someone speaks, wasting time. He also constantly stares at people and heavily breathes, which makes me a little uncomfortable.

Professor Sutherland is by far, with all due respect, the worst Professor I have ever had. Not only is he a bad professor, but he is also a bad person. He doesn't care about any valid excuses or tough times that his students have. He won't help students at all with things that he isn't required to, via school policies, while other professors would.

Horrible professor, uses extremely difficult examples when introducing a new topic. I have never seen him actually answer a question from a student before, he will just say "we'll come back to that later". I genuinely don't understand why OSU would hire him and keep him hired when he is down right the worst professor I have ever had.

Even though I took AP Calc in HS, his class was overly difficult. His lectures don't prepare you for midterms or finals. When students would ask questions he wouldn't understand their question and answer very vaguely. The MSLC is the only thing that helped. If you have a choice do not take calc with him.

Alex Sutherland is hands down the worst Professor I have ever had in my life. I had him last year for Math 1152, and he (without exaggeration) ruined my life. I wasn't able to submit a homework assignment on time because of personal events (out of my control), and he didn't want to help me in the slightest and gave me a full zero, ruining my GPA.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! This professor does not effectively communicate the material, he will not answer questions clearly, and does not have any flexibility at all. The tests are brutal, and the amount of assignments can be overwhelming. Ideally, take Calculus 1 with any other professor at this institution.

This was by the worst class I have taken at OSU.The professor is terrible, he does not know how to teach at all and/or doesn't care. I actually learned nothing from him the whole semester and taught this class to myself because the lectures consist of him giving the students material that has really no applicability to the workload of the class

DO NOT TAKE CALC 1 WITH HIM. He is the worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are just him talking about theorems and proofs but never actually effectively explaining anything. I stopped going to lectures and did way better by just self-studying. He is also quite frankly rude. If I could give negative stars I would.

This class was way more difficult than it needed to be. There were 5 midterms, as well as an insane amount of assignments and written homework. His lectures were incredibly unhelpful, and whenever someone would ask a question he would just repeat exactly what he had just said. 0/10 would not recommend.

He would never post any notes after the lecture was finished, so lecture was just me trying to write everything down without really learning it - not that he was explaining it well anyways. He got upset at us many times for not asking questions, but whenever we WOULD ask, he would straight up give us the wrong answer or essentially call us dumb.
He does not really teach the material but just provides examples that he expects you to solve without actually teaching first.

Please switch out of this professor. His lectures are useless, and the material is not even on the 5 exams. Syllabus is strict and I am failing this class because of a zero late work policy. Complete 0/60 for a written homework. When you ask a question you will NEVER get an answer. Switch out now or your 5-credit hour class gets tanked like mine.

I can not stress enough do not take the course.  He is completely unhelpful and sometimes fairly rude. He spent most of the time staring at students and wasted an hour long lecture by demanding participation. If his questions are not answered he resorts to standing directly behind students in an effort to make people uncomfortable.

Best professor ever if you love being stared at for 50 mins. Barely teaches and spends a concerning amount of the lecture sitting on his phone behind his desk while we work out problems that he doesn't explain or provide answers to. Overall 0/10 class, I'm only 2 months in and I might legitimately fail my first class ever (I have a 4.0 right now).

Calculus is of course a very high effort class being 5 credit hours but this lecturer makes it much harder than it needs to be. He will ask a question with an answer that has not been taught yet and waste 5 minutes standing there waiting for someone to answer. You can tell he knows his stuff but my god he needs to go into a different line of work.

He is a nice guy, but it is impossible to do well in the class when you are teaching yourself all of the material. Lectures are just theorems, which don't help on the test. Tests are on material that isn't covered anywhere
Wastes time waiting on people to answer questions he should be answering. Horrible question taker, if you do not spend all of your time on this class you will fail.
Does not do a good job of explaining the material, had I not taken calculus previously I would have most definitely failed

His lectures are basically useless, he doesn't post notes after class which by the way other professors do. Side note: he won't curve your tests even if the whole lecture fails. Don't take the class unless you can learn by yourself.

I would not recommend taking his class if math is not your best subject. He does not lecture very well and when people ask questions he never gives a clear answer. He will also waste critical lecture/review time by waiting for someone to answer his question. Like others have said you are very much on your own if you take his class.
Lectures are extremely hard to follow, lots of homework and basically a midterm every other week. Even after putting in a lot of time outside of class to study, tests were still difficult.

He's super nice, but the class is impossible. The homework load is unbearable and the tests are 100% harder than the practice ones we're given. Lecture is somewhat helpful when he doesn't make mistakes that makes it more confusing. I'm only doing decently because of the amount of work outside of class I'm putting in.
Did not answer lecture questions clearly, office hours were during popular class times, did not stick around to answer questions.
Class is very hypnotic

A very "you're on your own" class, DO NOT TAKE IF CALCULUS DOES NOT COME EASY TO YOU.
Will easily stand there for 5 min waiting for class to answer something instead of teaching.
Goes over the reading expecting us to fully understand it.
Exams are difficult, usually containing stuff we did not go over in class.

Makes Calc 1 absolutely unbearable. His lectures are so monotonous and he mainly teaches from the online lessons so there is no sense in going anyway, because he never explains things more clearly. Also, his class is very homework and exam-heavy, and a majority of the questions contain content that was barely covered in class if it ever was.
Calc 2 was a nightmare. His lectures were not helpful whatsoever and nobody had any idea what was going on.

Dr. Sutherland was my TA for Math 1152, which I took online with in person recitations. He was a wonderful TA and had very helpful office hours. He was always willing to help and very on top of his work and grading. I would recommend him to anyone taking a math course for a little extra help.

summary_comment: Professor Sanford is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and supportive approach. Students appreciate his clear lectures and the similarity between practice and actual midterms, which aids in preparation. His passion for helping students understand mathematical concepts deeply is evident, though some find his teaching style challenging for those without a strong foundational knowledge. Overall, his commitment to student learning is commendable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sanford is highly regarded for his clear lecturing style and supportive approach, often praised for making exams similar to practice tests and offering helpful office hours. However, some students find his teaching style challenging for those without a strong mathematical background and note that his lectures can be confusing at times.

Ratings.comment: Sean Sanford is a great lecturer and also a great guy. He is very understandable, and his midterms are very similar to his practice midterms. Very helpful if you ask questions as well.

Sean is a great math lecturer and keeps his exams relatively easy. The homework is can be annoying as it sometimes asks questions beyond the difficulty of what's discussed in class on the exam, but this is still mildly helpful. It's still pretty light as a whole. Go to lecture, do the homework.

Dr. Sanford is one of my favorite professors I ever had. He is very supportive and is willing to make sure that students are understanding the concepts in a challenging course like calculus 3 or any math course. Extremely helpful during office hours whether it is feedback on an exam or a tough homework problem.

I thought that Dr. Sanford was a really nice person, however, his style of teaching only really catered towards someone with a "mathematical" mind. So, sometimes this caused his lectures to be confusing sometimes. Office hours are great and definitely helped me before the exams. Homework is very tough and can take hours.

Prof. Sanford is a very passionate professor who cares about the development of his students' understanding of the concepts rather than just showing them how to plug in and get solutions. While he does show shortcuts, he shows the more complex derivations of those shortcuts as well. This class takes effort but Sean does care about his students.
Some of the concepts covered are difficult, however the class itself is not very hard. If you come prepared to the quizzes and exams, you will succeed.

This was the worst math class I've ever taken. Though he's  smart, this professor cannot teach. He assumes that his students already know a lot of things and skips over them while providing unnecessarily complex explanations during his lectures. If you don't understand his 1st lecture never go again. Watch youtube tutorials, you'll learn more.

He is passionate about helping his students understand math instead of just being able to plug numbers into a formula. I learned a lot and felt that the exams and quizzes were always reasonable, even if hard. But, he is always willing to help and his office hours are useful.

I really enjoyed his lectures, and I believe there is a lot to gain from them. his quizzes and exams are very reasonable and not overly difficult. However, its still a tough subject and class; if youve always struggled with math, like me, be prepared to put the work in. i wish i could have him again

Calc 3 is hard but the class is not. I started not going to lec since the second month and just used yt and hw to learn and review, still got A. Sean actually knows math as every time student asked a question he could answer it quickly and well. A lot of hw to do, 2 of 6 lowest quiz grades will be dropped, midterm&final are relatively easy.

The guy is passionate about teaching and will go out of his way to make sure you understand, however the content, especially unit 17 are very hard to understand conceptually, and skipping 1 lecture is enough to get lost. Don't worry about the quizzes. Make sure you maximize midterm 1 to have wiggle room for the other 2 exams.

Sean is a intelligent individual, and unique in the way that he both has a fundamental understanding for why the math works, and how to explain it to a student. You walk away with both a understanding of the equation and why it works which I appreciate.

Exams are simple, only gripe is that there is a lot of HW some weeks. 

FYI: textbook not used.

Don't bother going to lecture, the textbook videos are 100x better than his were. Extremely homework heavy with an unreasonable amount due each week. Passable class, but only if you decide to put in the work yourself.

Sean is smart, and many people like his lectures, but he speaks with terms that students don't understand, making it hard to grasp the content. He gets sidetracked and talks about why we use certain equations rather than showing us how to use the equations. 2/6 quiz grades get dropped. Midterms are fair, you will do good if you prepare.
Good professor. His lectures are very amazing. The quizzes and midterms are very simple, but the homework and final are a little difficult but still acceptable.
I learned a lot from his course. His exams are with appropriate difficulty.

I highly recommend Mr. Sanford! His teaching is very striking. The lectures deserve to be attended, though they are not mandatory, because you could really learn Calculus 3 knowledge in his lecture. Quizzes and midterms are accessible, but weekly assignments and the final exam are challenging but not unsolvable.

Mr. Sanford is an amazing professor. His lectures are very valuable, so even the attendance is not mandatory, the lectures are deserved to attend. Three quizzes and three midterms are very easy, and the lowest score of quizzes would be dropped. The homework and final exam are challenging, but not inextricable.

A very good professor! Lectures don't count for attendance but are well worth listening to. His quizzes and midterms are easy. The lowest quiz score will be dropped. Homework and the final exam are difficult, but the homework will certainly make you improve as long as you work hard, and the final exam score is with a certain extent of curve.

Very solid professor! His lectures were not compulsory, but they were very clear. His homework was a bit difficult, but you could try it many times until you got it all right, and his midterms and quizzes were very easy, only 40% as difficult as the homework! Moreover, he would drop the lowest quiz score! However, the final is a little challenging.

If I could give him a zero I would he openly lie about what's on exams and would never give you any practice material until Sunday night when your exam was on the Wednesday. I can't talk enough about how awful he is as a teacher he did not even show up to 3 out of our 4 exams. He is going to make me have to take the class again.

Prof. Sanford is friendly and organized. He projects his iPad to the screen and writes the class lecture on a notetaking app and posts all the class notes to the class Carmen, which is very helpful. His grading is fair and the first midterm had an average of 90. I have no complaints about this class and I recommend taking it with Prof. Sanford.
Sean was awesome. He really enjoys teaching and wants you to succeed. The lectures are very informative.

summary_comment: Professor Ohl is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and approachability. Students consistently praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly and his willingness to provide additional support through office hours. While some find his lectures somewhat repetitive, most agree that his teaching methods make the class accessible and straightforward, leading to good performance on exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ohl is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and ability to explain complex concepts clearly, making the class very accessible. Students find his office hours and willingness to help extremely beneficial, though some note that his teaching style can sometimes make simple topics overly complicated.

Ratings.comment: Best math professor I've had. Had him for algebra for business and he is always willing to help his students understand. His office hours are really helpful. Great guy!
Trent is a kind professor and is actually pretty funny. He does a good job of explaining course material and keeps the reviews very similar to the actual exams. Definitely would recommend.
Review exams are just like the actual exam. Easy hw due once a week. Attendance is not graded. Ended with a 98 in the class.

Overall, he was a great professor. He provided a thorough explanation of the topic with examples. However, sometimes, he made an easy concept seem way harder than it needed to be. Tests are not hard as long as you study using the study guide he provides.

you'll have a quiz every week and the final is cumulative but the class isn't that bad and I didn't go to half the lectures, everything was retaught in recs, but the rec and the lecture didn't always line up or they taught things different ways so it made it more confusing

Overall Dr. Ohl is a great guy but just an okay professor. He easily loses students after 10 minutes into lecture. Simply reads off slides and can't go into detail on why or how things are. Office hours is somewhat helpful. Your grade is mostly based on weekly quizzes (very loosely based on homework), your exams, and weekly homework (completion).

Prof Ohl is amazing. He explains everything super slow so that even a baby could understand, but not too slow its annoying. nothing has mandatory attendance. Very easy to access outside of class and seems really happy to help you understand. Makes a decently easy class VERY easy. 100% would recommend.
Amazing lecturer, super nice guy and unbelievably overqualified to teach this class. 100% take

Dr. Ohl is probably one of my favorite professors I've had! He explains concepts extremely well. He is very accessible outside of class; he always took the time during office hours to make sure I understood something when I wasn't sure. He cares about his students, and his exams are exactly like the homework (very reasonable for a 2 credit class).

Trent Ohl is easily the best professor I have had from the math department. He explains the material well and the homework is straightforward. He is very helpful in his office hours. If you can take MATH 4578 with him, do it.

Always Wrote and explained every step he took while doing a problem. He does multiple examples for each topic which is awesome. Get partial credit for showing work so it hedges points if you get the wrong answer on exams.
Great professor! Excellent lecture. 80% of lecture have slides. Not very much homework and have unlimited attempts.
Dr. Ohl overall was a amazing professor, went through each units thoroughly and explained the concepts clearly, plus he responds to emails pretty quick.

He's a great lecturer and a lot of challenging math concepts seemed easy after going to class and listening to his lectures! He explains things very well and is such a sweet guy and seems like he genuinely cares about his students!
Actually the sweetest cutest guy ever. Class is hard but it is math so it like should be. Would not want to take it with anyone else!

He cares about you and is passionate about what he is teaching. Class is hard and harder homework questions every week, along with quizzes every week. But he sometimes pushes back homework dates an extra day if he knows he is behind. Tough material.
Great Class, amazing teacher, just listen in lecture and you will succeed.

I have nothing bad to say about Professor Ohl. He has an amazing layout for the class, and everything on the exams is material he gives you in lecture and the study guides. He genuinely is a great person and makes for an awesome teacher.

He has clear expectations and his homework comes directly from examples in his lectures. His exams are take home  with problems similar to those of the homework. He records all his lectures, so it is not a big deal if you miss them. He is also flexible and always willing to help.

Hands down the best math professor I've ever had. Trent does a great job explaining content clearly during lectures and ensuring students understand it. If you ever have questions on homework he is more than willing to help guide you on how to set up problems and work through to the solution. He also had lots of fun with our class during lab!
Great guy! very clear on homework and exams. lots of fun in the lab where we play contexto!

Trent has been undeniably my favorite professor that I have taken math with at all of Ohio State. He cares about your success, and he helps you to succeed by making the class enjoyable. I don't think there is a better professor at all of Ohio State. He is very open to extensions on homeworks. I recommend everyone take him.

Ohl is a great lecturer and explains concepts well. That being said, the homework assignments are usually quite time consuming and difficult, as well as the quizzes he makes. However, the math department makes the midterms, and the midterms are typically much easier than his homework, quizzes, and review guides. He's very nice and accommodating.

- nice person
- love math and sometime he getting really into it and confuse me
- kinda confusing something
- wished he used guide notes 
3/5
Professor Ohl is a great professor. He is clear in his lectures and explains material very well. He is kind and helps all the students he can. I highly recommend taking a class with him.

I wish he had taught me calc 2. Foundations of Higher Mathematics is what I took with Dr. Trent and his Ph.D. was in it so he taught it incredibly as you imagined. He's a fair teacher who's easy to reach outside class with lots of feedback on every homework.

Mr. Ohl is a great professor, as long as you go to lecture and try on homework you will do great in this class. Homeworks can be lengthy at time (20 questions on average) but are not very difficult. Would highly recommend Mr. Ohl though.
The class was taught pretty well, isn't difficult to pass as long as you pay attention
The content isn't great, but he was always very prepared and collected when he was explaining the concepts. The final exam was cumulative though, but pretty fair overall.
this class was hard but he didnt make it any more difficult or any easier

In my opinion, professor Ohl did a good job thoroughly explaining the material during lectures, and even records all of them in case you aren't able to attend. There's a good amount of quizzes and homework throughout the semester, as well as 5 total exams. Bottom line - it's calculus, so don't expect anything easy.

Lecture and recitation are not mandatory, but you should definitely at least watch the lectures back. You will have to watch the lectures in order to pass the class. Dr. Ohl makes everything very clear, but the class is still decently difficult.
Terrible class

I have already taken calculus before, so this class shouldve been easy. Instead, the final exam will now determine whether or not I have to take the class again. I went to recitation and lecture basically everyday, yet I will probably have to retake the class because the test and exam questions are too difficult. My effort isnt the issue, he is.

An issue with this class is the number of tests! Test every single Monday, and each one has a huge impact on your grade, which is based almost solely on tests. There is no partial credit given on written exams but you must show all work. All exams have a very constraining time limit, which is short and unfair.

Prof. Ohl is a great lecturer, especially if you're easily confused with math. His class is super organized and structured and there are lots of assignments other than exams to buff your grade. Super fair, smart, and approachable. He made a harder math class very manageable but you have to actually go to class and do the homework.

He made concepts very easy to understand and throughly covered topics so that you were prepared for exams. Exam reviews were very similar to the exams. Very good at answering questions and clearing confusion

Prof Ohls class and lectures are very organized. If you watch the lectures and do the homework its pretty easy. The lectures and quizzes sometimes have questions that I never remember learning, and since each question is worth a lot of points one missed question lowers your grade a lot. But I would still recommend taking the class.

Dr. Ohl has been one of my favorite professors! GO to his office hours! He is willing to help, and I would strongly recommend it. Math is NOT my strong subject, and while I did struggle at times in this class, Dr. Ohl was very kind in answering questions and meeting with me. Top class professor.

By far the most organized professor I've had here. He is a great teacher, and explains concepts in lecture very well. However, he speeds through the material so prepare to be learning a lot throughout the weeks. He covers many examples during lecture, and make sure you GO TO RECITATION!

I dropped his class after the second week, hes disorganized and goes way too fast on his online lectures. His quizzes are timed to the point that youre struggling to make sure you answer all the questions. I couldnt do it, Ill take this class another semester with a different professor

Professor Ohl had very clear and easy to read slides that he would go over in lecture. I feel like he explained things well, and was great about answering questions. The only downside is that he would announce if there was a hw the week of, and didn't release exam dates or times until only a few weeks beforehand, so it was hard to plan ahead.

He has been my favorite professor that I've had so far. He was an amazing lecturer and I never got bored during his classes. He was very thorough and explained the material very well. I totally recommend him as a professor.

I LOVED Professor Ohl. He's so sweet and actually cares about you passing. If you want to pass this class with an A, do ALL the homework practice problems and GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS! I have NEVER passed a math class higher than C and this is the first math class I've EVER passed with an A! Attend lectures & write good detailed notes & pass. Easy.

Trent was incredible. Before this class, I cannot remember the last time I got an A on a math test. I aced two of the midterms, and ended up with a B+ for the course, which is amazing for me. Trent's lectures are crystal clear, and the material he covered seemed extraordinarily easy to me thanks to him. Big props to Trent. Highly recommend.

Genuinely enjoyed going to lecture. He is SO cute and cares so much. He goes everything so thoroughly I barley had to study for midterms and finished with an easy A. Lectures dont take attendance so a lot of people didnt go, and they struggled a lot. Just make sure you go to lecture and do the homework problems and youll be good.

I have him for business calculus and I feel like I do not learn a thing from his lectures. I hate to say it but going to lectures is a waste of a time a lot of days... luckily, I took calc senior year of hs and was good at it so I have a good baseline but people who struggle in math definitely have a challenge ahead.

He's great, his lectures on the blackboard are absolutely amazing. I went from hating maths in High School and performing poorly to excelling thanks to Trent. The class is graded very well and reflects your understanding of the concepts. He goes above and beyond when teaching you the principles of Calculus.

He was the most genuine of my professors and definitely acknowledged the fast pace which accompanied 1161.02 and made the lecture similar to the midterms. However, the final was a shock for most people I talked to. But he is overall a great guy and he takes time in class to answer questions while moving as efficiently as possible. HE ROUNDS UP.
Was very approachable and gives good help in office hours. Explained topics well and work was easy to understand. 1172 is a tough class that he made easier to understand.

Trent's class will be difficult, but not impossible. You really have to work at it if you want a good grade. A lot of times he over explains the theory behind concepts and not how to apply them. Do all of your homework problems and make sure you understand them, and you'll be fine.

Big T is a real G. He explains everything really well and has super helpful office hours. He's a really nice guy and rounded up my borderline grade without me even asking him!!! Also, he gave candy to the people who showed up for Friday lectures

Had Trent for the Calc 1/Intro to calc 2 class for Honors Engineers. Really nice guy, total Dad in every way. Class wasnt too hard, homework helped reinforce subject matter a lot and wasn't crazy hard. Helped with any questions I had, easy midterms and final with medians >80% every time. I recommend!

Dr. Ohl is a fine professor. He does excellent jobs of representing visually and conceptually what is happening in terms of topic material, his office hours are also helpful. The only qualm i had with him was that his lectures were very dry and it was extremely easy to lose focus, however this is just a slight mark from an otherwise good prof.

I had Trent Ohl for Math 1172. Great Lecturer, gives good examples and explained concepts clearly. I felt prepared going into exams based on his lectures. I wasn't a huge fan of how the course was organized (organized by Department, not lecturer), but he was definitely a positive aspect of the course.

This was a 2 credit hour discrete math class that moved faster/was more work than the discrete class for my math major friends. Lectures were just reading off the textbook (slides were literally screenshots of the book). Homework assignments were 11-14 pages each with only a few days to complete. Grades sometimes took over a month to come back.

I really want to like Professor Ohl because he just seems like a nice guy who likes math. However, the lectures are very dry and don't stick with me (especially because we can't have the slides and the book takes forever to describe the simplist thing) and it's a 2-credit course that feels like a 5-credit course

Quite possibly the driest lectures I've ever been to. Homeworks are ridiculously long, does not do a good job of preparing you for exams. If you really want a good grade in this class, be prepared to treat it as a 5 credit hour course. Awful.

Be prepared to self learn a lot of material. Homework was almost nothing like the problems in the book. A large portion of homework solutions were uploaded Sunday when the exam was the VERY NEXT day, so you better hope you have a good understanding of the material beforehand. Its a 2 credit hour class that I spent 20+ hours a week on.
His lectures were terrible. Very dry and boring. Examples given in class were nothing like homework or exams. Homeworks were unnecessarily long and he would change the due date every week.
A great teacher.
Good class.

He made many simple things more complicated than they had to be. Be prepared to figure things out on your own because he's not much help.  I have had some very good & very bad math professors & he is leans close to the bad. He is a friendly guy but I wouldn't take him if you can help it .

i really like Ohl's class. I took his Summer section of Calc 3, so it was probably a bit more fast paced than during the regular school year due to time constraints. His quizzes and exams were very reasonable, and you should be able to do well on them if you do practice problems from the book and work to understand the material.

Ohl understands math, but he does not understand how to teach math. He spends most of lecture time writing down long sentences, instead of going through examples. He will not tell you what section the quizzes are over, and will find minuscule problems hidden in the side margins in the book, and call it "fair material" for quizzes. Depend on your TA

The syllabus, exams, quizzes, and homework are administered by the math department and can be hectic to follow... just to clarify. Trent is a much better instructor than Sherry. This class is for people who need a slower and a much more specific approach at math. I love his teaching style. My TA is the best. If you can, choose Dylan Wood.

The lectures are super dry and unclear. He just writes on the chalk board and talks at the same time. If you don't keep up or miss something you are completely lost. He makes no attempt to actually clarify anything.

Often complicates the material and speeds through lectures because he often runs out of time. He offers no extra study material such as  (specific)practice problems or review handouts for quizzes and exams which others lecturers did do. Nice guy but doesn't go the extra mile for students.

Ohl is a nice nice guy, but his lectures are often confusing and he makes the material more complicated than it actually is. Recitation made the lessons much more understandable. Do the homework and study for exams.

If you took Precalc in high school you should be okay, it's mostly review.. The class wasn't terrible but professor Ohl made the content much harder than it really was. Thankfully I had notes from high school and a good TA. Overall, don't cram for the midterms and you will be fine. They also curve the whole class at the end of the semester

He goes through the material incredibly quickly. If you didn't take precalc in high school, then it may be a little hard to keep up. I relied heavily on my amazing TA to clarify the material in recitation. Also, he ALWAYS goes over time in his lecture.

I am not a fan of math, but college algebra with Trent was clear and, almost, interesting. Do the homework (and definitely visit the Math help lab) and you will be golden. He is also quite flexible on grading (just go to his office hours if you have any grading questions).

summary_comment: Professor Lin is known for being a challenging instructor with a focus on rigorous testing, where exams are significantly more difficult than homework. Students find his lectures inadequate and unhelpful, often requiring extensive self-study to succeed. Many recommend avoiding him due to his poor teaching methods and lack of support, noting issues with grading policies and the difficulty of the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lin is known for his challenging exams and extensive homework, with some students finding his lectures inadequate and unhelpful for exam preparation. Overall, he is described as a difficult professor who does not provide sufficient support or curve exam grades, leading many to advise students to seek out a different instructor.

Ratings.comment: Homework is hard, but the exams are harder. He thought a 79 average was way too high for an exam.

Plz avoid, if take this class be prepared for lot of outside studying. Vry poor lectures, often unable to answer questions if asked. Good guy, but horrid prof. Vry test heavy, but luckily test is 80% same as prctic exam. Final is hvy, can succeed in class, but need to do lot of self study. Exmples r helpful but not many done in class. Gl w Chao!

Take another professor. He doesn't curve exams no matter if the averages are low, and doesn't even grade all your homework problems, making your time spent on a problem basically useless. He'll assign 10, but will only grade 3 and won't tell you which ones he's grading or not. just be prepared to learn everything on your own.
Dr. Lin was a chiller but the class itself is difficult to teach. The class tries to fit 5 credit hours of content into a 3 credit hour class.

This is by far the worst professor I have ever taken a course from. He often made mistakes when teaching, but never corrected them making the class confused. Purposefully assigned the hardest homework and exam questions. Nobody was able to finish exams on time. Often made comments about hating his job and even was racist at times. PLEASE AVOID HIM!
No curve even though averages were low 70s or 60s.

Lin was a horrible professor. He was nice, but he couldn't teach if his life depended on it. He wasted so much time explaining his prewritten PowerPoint notes that we barely got to the examples. No curves, no extra credit. Midterms 1 and 2 were 50% and the final was worth 35%. Told us to drop the class after the dropping deadline. Avoid!

Get a different professor if you can. His lectures are very difficult to understand and do not prepare you for how difficult the exams are. This is the first time I struggled in a math class. I went to his office hours for help and was told "you just need to understand the math". I'm retaking the class right now with Sharma and have an A no problem

The worst professor I ever has, shows no remorse and told students who are not doing good in the class to just drop it near the end of the semester because it will be "Good for him and us". He doesn't know how to explain things and constantly messes up. Exams are worth 85% of the grade and he will double dock for algebraic mistake.

Not finished with Business Calc yet. This is my first calculus class, so the material is relatively difficult, but Professor Lin does everything he can for his students to succeed. I wish I could give him a 10; he's a super down-to-Earth dude. The class is very doable if you put the time in and attend lectures and some office hours.

This class was absurdly ridiciulous. There were times in class when this professor did the problem wrong and taught extremely important material (almost 1/4 of the exam) three days before. Exams are 85% of your grade and if you do bad on one exam it is difficult to bounce back. If you have him, I recommend taking online through different university
Super friendly and explains topics well. Would definitely recommend

summary_comment: Professor Yao is knowledgeable in linear algebra but struggles significantly with communication, often delivering lectures that are unclear and abstract, leading many students to rely on self-study rather than attending lectures. Despite his genuine passion for the subject and efforts to provide additional resources, his teaching style makes the class challenging and potentially overwhelming for many students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yao is knowledgeable but struggles significantly with communication, making his lectures difficult to follow and largely ineffective for learning. Despite his expertise and willingness to provide additional resources, students find the course challenging and often rely on supplementary materials to succeed.

Ratings.comment: I recommend taking the course of Dr. Yao.

Really a bad lecturer, extremely unclear. You can tell he knows what he's doing but is so so bad at explaining things. I got through it by skipping lectures. Just read the textbook, watch some videos online and study hard for the exams which are the vast majority of the grade. Grading is lenient and his review guides basically mirror the exams.

Makes this class way harder than it has to be. He teaches like a graduate class, exams are a race against the clock, no point in showing up to lecture (about 1/3 of my class does, I am one of them), no curve, 45% final exam 30% midterm 25% tedious weekly homework. His lectures don't correlate to anything, homework won't prep for exam. Don't take it

Really cares about linear algebra and a super nice guy but not the best at communicating it. Lectures are kind of useless because he just does proofs and abstract concepts and he barely gives any examples. not much homework but very loosly align with his lectures. Tests are hard but his sample exams are almost identical to the actuals exams.

Honestly if he didn't give us so much homework then I wouldn't be rating this class so low. The textbook is pretty ok at explaining stuff, proofs do get somewhat confusing though. I also wish the homework had less proofs.

He takes no care in explaining concepts, with abstract examples/definitions with no simplifications to help. He talks too fast for information to digest as well. HW does not line up with his lectures, sometimes touching on topics he discusses the next week over. He genuinely loves linear algebra but cannot communicate that love to others.

Yao's vast knowledge extends beyond textbooks. He introduces improved proofs and offers extra help outside class. His review sessions and study guides aid exams, making challenging material manageable. Can talk fast in lectures, would recommend following his logic rather than taking notes, as he posts all his lecture notes after lectures.

Solid professor for analysis, explains the theory well and was able to answer questions satisfactorily. Homework's not too hard but does require you to think hard and/or go to office hours, for the most part definitely harder than proofs done in class.  Spent a lot of time on exam reviews, do think could've done it more rigorously/learn more stuff.

To put it bluntly, Yao was the worst math professor I have had. He spoke way too quickly and incomprehensibly during lecture and his hand writing was extremely difficult to read. His examples were very unhelpful and had a very difficult time answering students' questions clearly. You would be better off learning through the textbook on your own.

Nice and smart guy, but not a good lecturer. Sped through lectures with lots of complex, unhelpful examples and concepts Also was not very well organized, gave us the wrong (more difficult) midterm 1 and an excessively difficult final (both were then curved, but not enough IMO). I learned 99% of material from the textbook and practice exams.

I really wish I could give Yao a better rating, because he is a nice, caring, and smart person. Unfortunately his way of teaching is very confusing, and I found myself lost more often than not, having to rely on the textbook and YouTube videos to learn. I think with experience, he will become a better professor, but for now, I wouldn't recommend.

BFR don't take Linear Algebra with Liding, he will only lessen your understanding of the content with a combination of bad handwriting, poor word choice, useless abstract examples, inconclusive answers to student questions, and the inability to explain basic concepts.

A nice guy, but introduces concepts in a very poor manner. Introduces variables, and words that nobody in the class is familiar with and fails to elaborate on them. You're basically lost in the class until the practice exam comes out (which is very similar to the actual exam). No curve either. I don't know how anyone got an A.

Prof Yao is incredibly smart and caring, but he cannot teach. His lectures are disorganized and incomprehensible, and the examples are complex not relevant. His practice exams are EXACTLY like the actual exam, which is the only thing that will get you through this course, but other than that the students do not know what is going on in the class.

Legitimately probably one of the worst teachers I've ever had. I've never seen a teacher so woefully unprepared to teach a course. For the first Midterm, he gave us the WRONG exam and his lecture notes were nearly unreadable. This may explain why his lectures are disorganized and only consist of abstract examples and theories.

This may be the first semester that Liding Yao has taught Linear Algebra, but this class has been nearly impossible without reading the textbook. Yao's lectures are mid at best, and his notes are nearly unreadable. He is an unconfident lecturer and should take some time to learn how to teach better before he has any more sections of Linear Algebra.

summary_comment: Professor Golubeva is known for her challenging teaching style, with extremely difficult homework and exams; the median exam score was 51, and many students struggled without additional tutoring. Despite her patience and willingness to explain concepts thoroughly, the course is often described as the most demanding for engineering majors, with a steep learning curve and a lack of clear preparation for exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Golubeva is known for her challenging teaching style, making the course extremely difficult, with harsh grading standards reflected in the low median exam score of 51. While some students appreciate her patience and detailed explanations during office hours, the class is generally regarded as one of the most challenging in the engineering curriculum, and many advise against taking it unless absolutely necessary.

Ratings.comment: Not a bad teacher, but the hw and exams are VERY difficult. The median was a 51.
This is undeniably the hardest math class you will take as an engineering major.

Class is taught in a way that makes it more difficult than it has to be. Homeworks were returned with only vague suggestions on what was incorrect and took forever as there was a gap of knowledge that she assumes that we know between her teaching and the textbook (which is incomplete and basically worthless questions. I only passed due to a tutor.
Very Great professor. I learned a lot from her throughout this course. She's super patient and elaborate to answer any questions I have.

By far the hardest professor that teaches this course. Run if you have her. She is very sweet and clearly cares but shes goes WAY too fast in class to where its impossible to follow along, and gives no absolutely no examples of the types of questions that will appear on exams so there is no set way to study. Drop the class if you can
GET OUT OF HER CLASS WHILE YOU CAN!!

Natalia's class is very difficult, made more so by the awful textbook she teaches with. All homework relied on question sets from the textbook, some of which were worded very poorly. However, if you have a strong background in functions, how to transform them, as well as Calculus and Algebra, you will do fine. Office hours are definitely a must.

She is an awesome teacher but the textbook SUCKS. The course is VERY hard and so are the homework. Go to her office hours and you are saved. She is caring and will break down math concepts so you understand and help you learn. But the class is very hard so be warned if you do not have time for office hours. Exams are curved, which is a plus.
Evil professor, do not choose her!

The class is exceptionally challenging yet doable. Prof Natalia is very intelligent and very accessible through multiple approaches to support students. To well handle this course, ensure you don't miss any exams that are 80% of the total grade. There was a slight grading curve that led me to an 'A'  as the final grade.
Really thorough professor, you will learn a lot. Keep in mind the work is very intense, plan on 3-7 hour homework on any given homework.
My life was better before it.

80% of your grade id determined by exams, which have ~4 questions on them. From my experience, the questions on the first exam were much harder than anything she ever covered in class. I ended up withdrawing after the first exam because I did not see myself being able to pass the class.

RUN!!

- Lecture notes are very scattered so it is hard to understand the development of the concepts. 
-  Doesn't take or explain all questions seriously because she understands the material and assumes it is easy for students.
- Office hours is where she actually teaches
- homework is long and your grade depends on 1 question.

This class was very poorly organized and I would recommend that you drop the class if you see her name. She held alot of office hours but the homework was impossible if you didn't go. She was a fair grader for the exams however the average was often around 60-65%. The book was near impossible to understand and all the lectures relied off the book.

The class is almost all graded on tests (about 80%), but they are fair, and reflective of lecture material. The textbook is horrible, and the HW legit takes like 8-12 hrs a week, and is impossible without going to office hours. She has a lot of office hours, and is very willing to help though. The work for this feels more like a 4-5 credit class.

Prof. Golubeva truly cares for helping students succeed and is accessible outside of class (go to office hours), but the course is poorly structured. The Baker textbook tries to teach differential equations from an engineering perspective but is not very good at it. Homeworks are long, graded by a single question for accuracy, and graded harshly.

Dr. Golubeva is nothing but helpful and passionate about this topic and helping students get through it. However, the textbook is bad. The lectures are based off of the textbook as well, and there seems to be a lack of direction in the material for the first few weeks. I would take any other class she teaches, but not one with the Baker book.

Definitely the hardest course I've ever taken. Baker book is atrocious. Teaches using many engineering-related examples and then core concepts, which I'm not sure I enjoy. There was a 9%-11% curve for my section (both MT grades averaged ~65% and final averaged ~70%). Good professor? Sure. Content/roadmap/book? Horribly structured.

Her section for Math 2415 is one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. The homework is long, and you only get graded for pre-lectures, homework, two exams, and the final. However, Golubeva is incredibly caring and very willing to help with any questions you have. Office hours are essential. Her class is tough, but stick it out.

She's knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject, but it's extremely hard to get everything. The lectures are sometimes helpful, but the textbook used in this class is unintelligible, only one homework problem is graded out of the many assigned each time (and no feedback is given, just the grade), and no exam prep material is provided at all.

Good gosh don't take her class. She's smart and knows her stuff, sure. I'm writing this review as I slave over 8+ hrs of homework that is only going to be graded by 1 out of 6 problems. If you don't understand one concept out of the many covered by the homework, you're screwed. Homework feedback/learning from mistakes is basically non-existent too.

yes this class is naturally difficult, but dr golubeva is incredible. she's more than accessible outside of class, and her office hours are truly a lifesaver. her tests are fair but challenging, so if you do the homework and go to class you should be fine for the exams. however, the exams make up 80% of your grade in the class so beware

Very good professor. Her lectures are kind of boring but very understandable. I had a conflict during her office hours, but whenever I emailed her with a question I got a helpful response pretty quickly. The homeworks she assigns are very hard and take lots of time to solve, but if you work hard on them you will be well prepared for the exams.

Professor Golubeva makes differential equations at Ohio State as bearable as possible. That said, this is not an easy class. There is a large amount of difficult homework for this class, and the textbook that it comes from is one of the worst I've ever seen. However, Natalia is amazing in office hours to ensure you can complete the homework.

The homework was insanely hard so office hour attendance is mandatory. She is overall a caring professor and you will succeed as long as you put the work in. The lectures were pretty easy to fall asleep or space out in but it is math so. Exams can be tough but she is good with partial credit. Overall a great experience for a tough class.

She is a good professor who gives out TONS of homework. My advice is to find someone in the class who you can do the hw with (this is allowed) because it will be easier. She has a ton of office hours and will help you out in those office hours, please go to them if you are confused.

Avoid her like the plague.The Textbook is unreadable. Her lectures are unintelligible(like the book). She'll say 1 sentence and proceed to copy her notes in silence w/o explaining herself at all.If you show up to office hours half of the lecture hall is there too so she is unable to give you any helpful amount of 1-1 attention to answer questions.

This class is a stupid amount of work but you learn a lot and if you put in the work you will do alright. The homework takes a lot of time each week, but she will ALWAYS help, I've never had a professor who cares more about their students success. The exam questions are much easier than homework and if you understand the homework you will do fine.

Natalia is extremely smart, and is great in her lectures. This class is basically just weekly homework, two midterms, and a final. The midterms and final make up a majority of your grade, but if you do the homework you'll be prepared for the exams. The homework is hard, but she tells you how to solve the problems if you go to her office hours.

Her homework is hard to do by yourself so go to her office hours. She goes fast during lecture and can be a little overwhelming. However, in office hours she is super willing to help. The homework has 1 random problem graded for accuracy and 1 for completion. Tests are very similar to the homework and with 2 midterms and a final are weighted 80%.

Pretty intimidating to me, but actually very willing to help especially during office hours. I never could finish homework by myself but able to figure it out as long as I attended ALL the office hours. Lots of HW, weighted 2 midterms and final heavy, but exams aren't nearly as bad as homework. Very generous grader overall, small curve.

Great professor, but don't even bother doing the homework outside of office hours, you'll waste your life away in misery. It's based off one of the worst textbooks in history that makes Ximera look like candy.

If you do the homework and understand how to do each problem, you will do well on the exams. If you don't understand a problem, you have to talk to her to understand it. At first, the class will be confusing, but at one point she will bring it all together and it will make sense. You will learn a lot from the class and can do well if you try.

Natalia is one of the best instructors I've ever had. Math tends to come a bit easy to me, so combined with her teaching, I didn't find the material hard. However, for those who do, her office hours are extremely helpful and she's super willing to help anyone who asks. Great lecturer.

The homework can be rather long and tedious. However, if you go to her office hours she walks you through the problem to make it easy to understand. Her lectures follow the textbook, so if you miss one class you can read the textbook and figure it out. Her texts are extremely fair, and pretty simple if you understand the material and study.

Homework is ridiculously hard and tedious, so dont wait til the last minute like I did. If you can logic your way through homework problems, exams will be a breeze. If you can visualize what the question is asking graphically, solving the problems will be a breeze

Natalia is a solid choice for Math 2415. Go to class and take notes; she gives you all the tools you need to be successful in the course. I would only recommend the textbook as supplementary material. Homework is a long drag, but go to her office hours and she will help you with any problems. Not an easy A (its diff equations!) but fair exams.
Natalia is a great professor, and she explains problems very clearly in lectures. The exams are easy. Easy A !!!

Terrific Lecturer! The best thing is she is always accessible outside of class through email and separate appointments. The homework(s) are too long and annoying but the midterms are easy. Just make sure to attend class, take notes, go to her office hours with problems, and this class should be a breeze.

She was an average instructor. She was really slow at explaining things and had to rush the harder topics at the end. She is more about the trivial operations than the big picture. Pretty boring repetitive lectures. You can skip a class once in a while and not notice anything different the next class. Also 4 midterms, seriously?

One of the best Math teachers at OSU. If you are planning to take math 2415, I would definitely recommend her. If you show to the class, pay a lot of attention, and do all the home works  this class is an easy A.

Really nice teacher. Seems like one of the better choices for 2415. Even though the class is uniform across all sections, she does a good job teaching diff eq and does helpful example problems. Her accent wasn't an issue for me.
Super nice. I was in a night class, so she taught both lecture and recitation. Explain theories or principles clearly, very patient. Interact a lot with students. Very generous on scores.

I found Natalia to be kind and helpful, and wish she taught ALL my math classes. She always made sure we understood everything, and she explained the material quite well. I had no trouble with her accent. I would recommend her!

Over all she is a nice teacher but I found it very hard to understand her and understand her teaching methods. If you try to ask her a question that may seem that she is wrong she gets very frustrated. Over all I would not recommend her as a teacher. Switch classes.
She gives very clear, concise lectures and good review problems.  I had no trouble understanding her accent.  One of the best profs teaching the 151-153 series.
easy to understand
Lectures are kinda boring, but if you stay awake you'll get the material, but the tests were tough.
Hated this professor. She was broad did not speak very clear English at all. Avoid at all costs.

OSU math sucks, so this class naturally sucked.  She has been my best lecturer thus far, but my first two were pretty bad.  On the upside, she's very helpful if you go to her during office hours.  She kinda hard to understand, but not too bad compared to most.

She was a very good teacher.  One of the best you can get when it comes to math classes at OSU.  Very helpful and very clear.  Her notes were very organized and she was very friendly and sympathetic towards the students.  Her midterms and final were also quite fair.  I would recommend her.

I did not like this class at all. She goes way too fast in lecture and doesn't give you time to think. I went to MSLC 3 times a week just to understand her lectures. I do not wish her upon anyone. If you don't have to take this class, DON'T. If you have to take this class, avoid her like the plague!
lectures move extremely fast, and follow straight from the book... shes friendly and will do her best to answer your questions.. compared to other professors.. i wouldnt complain if i got her again

She is the worst teacher at OSU. Her lectures are extremelly quick and unclear. She always makes mistakes on the board. Her exam reviews are nothing like her exams. Her homework assignments are nothing like her exams. She focuses on theory way too much. She's confusing. Class average 54% on exams.

Dr. Golubeva is very good at explaining both practical problem solving techniques and the concepts behind them, and gives fair exams.  I never had a problem understanding her accent; it's actually rather pleasant.
She was friendly but out of class but hard to follow in class. She had a Russian accent which was a little hard to follow at times.
No Comments
I agree, tests are fairly easy but lecture is confusing. Especially when "pi" is pronounced "pee." :)
i liked her, tests are fair, and she bellydances

Apparently, going to school in the U.S.A. doesn't always warrant having a teacher capaple of speaking English.  The only point to going to lecture would maybe be to catch up on some sleep.  She tries hard but its difficult to understand

I didn't put much effort into the class so can't speak for her helpfulness but the test were alright i thought (though our first exam average was a 38...i got a 69), she also was russian or something so was somewhat hard to understand
easy tests... teaches well...

summary_comment: Professor Gu's teaching quality is highly variable according to student feedback. Some students find his thorough notes and practice exams helpful, while others criticize his incoherent lectures and extremely difficult grading standards. Overall, many students advise against taking his class due to its challenging nature and perceived lack of effective teaching.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gu's teaching quality is widely regarded as poor, with many students citing incoherent lectures and difficult exams as significant issues. Students consistently warn against taking his classes, noting low average scores on midterms and harsh grading standards.

Ratings.comment: sucked. please dont take this your gpa will drop TT
DO NOT TAKE THIS PLEASSEE UGH
Avoid this guy. Average on the midterm was a 40% and highest was 80. Doesn't care about teaching and his lectures are incoherent.

Homeworks are graded a little harsh but aside from that he seems reasonable. Usually replies fast to emails and tests aren't too difficult if you understand the material. At times difficult to understand. The recent midterm wasn't difficult to finish in the time given, and most questions were extremely similar to those posted on the practice exam.

Honestly don't understand the hate for this guy. He comes in every day with a smile on his face and laughs when no one will laugh at his jokes. He teaches all the content thoroughly and posts multiple practice midterms along with pages and pages of notes. The practice exams were very similar to the midterm too, and there's usually a curve.

Zeshen 's exams are a LITERAL NIGHTMARE. No joke, his teaching is exactly like Jackie Chu from SuperMarioLogan. His exams are way way too long for the time you have. Please drop, I have no idea why he is still employed at OSU.
He is the toughest grader I ever met, linear algebra is supposed to be trivial, but he decided to make it my hardest class. If you have him, prepare for a very, very tough semester ahead.

Right before a midterm worth 30% of our grade, he said that he doesn't expect people to be able to finish in time and he will be happy if the average is above 65%. He doesn't care about teaching. His lectures consist of him reading out his sloppy pre written notes and going through examples incoherently.
drop the class

Zeshen Gu is worst lecturer I have ever had in my entire life. HIS TESTS ARE MUCH MUCH HARDER THAN HIS CLASS MATERIAL. Do not be fooled by the practice exams, switch sections or drop this class immediately.
Impossible to reach, impossible midterms. HE WILL FAIL YOU.
Professor is a really smart person. I love his lectures.

Extremely difficult midterms and little feedback. Tests were based more on fast computations than on understanding the material. If you can integrate by parts fast, you will succeed. If not, good luck. Tests were based on homework, just way too long to finish. I feel my grade didn't match my understanding. Avoid.

AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS. DROP OUT IF YOU HAVE HIM, EVEN IF IT TAKES AN EXTRA SEMESTER TO GRADUATE (just do the EM exam instead if no section works). Taking Gu is signing up for the worst semester of your life.

He is pretty funny in class as he randomly laughs out of nowhere, however, he is not so good at teaching though he is a teacher. He has more room for improvement than the cardinality of the real number set. Linear algebra is supposed to be an easy class, but not!!! No such thing as bad student, only a bad teacher.
WORST TEACHING, IMPOSSIBLE EXAMS, DO NOT TANK, YOU CAN QUALIFY FOR AIME/USAMO AND STILL FAIL THIS CLASS. FIND SOMEONE ELSE ASAP!

genuinely the most awful professor i have ever had the displeasure of having in my entire college career. handwriting = horrible. lecture notes arent even his. give up and throw in the towel with this prof, get out while you still can. bro comes to lecture in the same green shirt every day for weeks and the same sandals. he isnt professional.
make sense to all?

For your own mental health, drop this class. For the brave souls: don't bother attending lectures other than for the exams. Grind study the material on the practice exams and you'll get by.

The GTA, Natalia, is the only reason this class is survivable. She is an easy grader, so just put down ANY work for problems and you'll get pity points.

Not one to bash profs but my goodness. Lectures are awful. Bad notes and his handwriting is chicken scratch. First exam was near impossible to complete in time. To be fair, exams got slightly easier after the first but avgs. were still in the 60s. Just made the class harder than necessary. Textbook has lecture videos that were solid, use those!!

Drop this class if you have Zeshen Gu. Awful lecturer, moves too fast and expects you to know everything. His handwriting is illegible and he makes mistakes on half his problems. Tests are hard. Midterms were just 55 minutes and had about 5 long questions--averages were around 60%. Do the homework well, you'll need any grade help you can get

Dr. Zeshen Gu is an intelligent person but not very good at teaching. His lectures are very hard to follow and I learned little to nothing from them. However the homework is good and teaches the material effectively. The midterms and finals are fair and there is plenty of review material for the exams.

Horrible lecturer and even worse hand writing and explanations. Went through everything too quick. YouTube explained everything better once I stopped going to lectures. I'd drop the class and take it at cscc if you can. Grades are mostly determined by exams.
Worst lecturer at OSU, notorious for ruining students' perfect 4.0 status. If you get this professor, change IMMEDIATELY before it's too late.

Dr. Gu was clearly very smart and very passionate. He knew math very well, but just did not teach it very effectively. His lectures were always quite fast-paced, which made content quite difficult to understand. I don't think he really knew how to best communicate with students, which caused a lot of confusion on my end.

Do not take his class! He is a terrible professor and doesn't teach anything. He makes mistakes all the time and his writing is very messy. He is also very hard to understand. He will ruin your grade!!!

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. His handwriting is illegible, he is unable to concisely and effectively communicate answers. This professor wrote our final, took it himself, scored below an 80% on it, and took 50 minutes to complete the test (students get an hour). Completely unrealistic expectations for all of his students. Do not take Dr. Gu!!!

His lectures have no structure. Zeshen only reads off of slides (which aren't even his own). On the 1st day, I witnessed 20 people leave within the first 10 minutes. My favorite announcement from Zeshen was when he pushed back an assignment bc "he felt lazy" and didn't want to grade it "that weekend" (this was less than two days before it was due).

Going to this professor's lectures is like having to watch a toddler waddle around and spew incoherent garbage for 55 minutes. On top of that, the exams and quizzes were many times harder than was necessary, and the professor posts no notes on the Carmen webpage. If at all possible, either change lecturers or drop this class. You will hate it here.

Dr Gu  was clearly very smart, but this was the issue. He didn't explain things as if he was teaching them to students he explained them as if we were all on his level. He also spent a very long time on each topic but didnt really go over them in a way we could learn them. Grades took forever to come out. Midterm averages were slightly above 50.

While he is obviously very smart, he lectures incredibly fast and he is extremely difficult to follow, and he struggles to answer many students' questions in a clear or concise matter. You look away for 2 seconds and you have missed 10 pages of his lecture.
Cannot teach to save his life. Midterms are easy, final was impossible.

Incomprehensible voice and incoherent lecturing back when I took the class. The real issue is, his tests were EXTREMELY EXTREMELY HARD. People got D's on quizzes simple units such as cross products and vectors, and the final had an average grade being an F. Do yourself a favor and AVOID THIS GUY!!! Take literally anyone else and it will be better.

I had him in AU23 and he was a pretty terrible lecturer. He moved so fast through lectures and was hard to understand, so I always had to go back and rewrite notes later. He lectured us like we all had mathmetician brains that worked like his. Tests are VERY hard, so take as many practice tests/questions beforehand as possible. Test heavy course!

Miserable class. This quiz was simply atrocious and no one knew or could learn what they had to know (I know people in his section). I'm so glad I switched sections (more about that in a previous review). Avoid this guy at all costs.

Zeshen Gu is a nice guy, but not a great professor. Let's just say after the first lecture of my section of the semester, 43 people dropped out of the class. He doesn't teach well and goes too fast. He also doesn't tell you what content is being asked before a quiz/test. I wouldn't recommend him at all.
Bro doesn't want to teach, find another section asap

By far the hardest class you will ever take at OSU. Worst teaching and infamous for ruining people's straight A status. You will not get an A in this class. Be fortunate if you pass; the average student failed the final.
EXTREMELY HARD. Like running before you know how to walk. Avoid at all costs!
Very difficult tests, the students are very uncomfortable to take his course.

He is the hardest math grader and the worst math teacher. Im pretty sure the average grade for his final was a fail. He is the worst professor at ohio state and everyone knows not to take him, so avoid zeshen and you will be fine
the GOD AFWUL WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY ENTIRE LIFE DONT DO IT

He is the worst professor I have ever had in my life the average grade on his final was an F. He made the material significantly harder than it needed to be for literally no reason. He enjoyed showing off his understanding of math to students but at the expense of their learning and grades
He was very funny, the tests were easy, and you didn't even have to go to class to get an A. 5/5 recommend again. Dr. Gu is one of the the most intelligent teachers I have ever had.

His teaching style isn't for everyone, but personally I enjoyed it. He goes through lectures very quickly, but if you can keep up, and are thoughtful of which parts of the lecture to pay more attention to, they can be very informative. The only truly awful thing is that you won't know your grade until after the final exam due to the large curve.

It was his first semester teaching afaik, but I thought he was decent. Often got confused when students asked him questions, but overall taught the material that was required and posted notes online for easy review. Homework is easy to get 100% on, and I thought the exams were fair, but maybe a bit too long for the time we had to do them.

Zeshen Gu was very distant and did not seem to care much about the preformance of his students. He was obviously very interested in math and the challenges that came with it and would try to flaunt his understanding and intelligence over the students rather than actually teaching.
I hated this class so much, I dont want to do math ever again

Zeshen Gu is the worst math professor in the entire department. If you have him, you will have a very very tough semester ahead of you. He does not teach well at all, and he grades very very tough. The average for his final was an F. He is by far the worst combination in a teacher, bad at teaching, tough on grading.

While professor Gu did they indeed have a sense of humor from my experience, that is the one of the only two positive things from this class. The other being that homework assignments were relatively simple. However, the tests were very difficult, and he lectured at a lightning quick pace. Most people had earned a failing grade on the final exam.

The standard of teaching at Zeshen Gu is deficient, and students are not recommended to enroll in Zeshen Gu classes. I took Gu's section, and then a week later, I switched to Sean Sanford's Math 2153 and got an A- in Sean's Section. Be sure to give Sean Sanford a 5-point rate while giving Zeshen Gu a 1-point rate!
I would literally pay double tuition to be guaranteed to never have Zeshen as a professor again.

easily the worst professor I have ever had. In the end, he refused to give students their grades back because final exam grades were so low, the average student failed, so he simply didnt even give the exams back
having zeshen as a professor is like signing up to have the worst semester of your life
DO NOT TAKE HE IS THE WORST PROFESSOR AT OHIO STATE DONT DO IT
the average student failed his final exam. thats all you neef to know
did not teach at all, was very hard to reach and his tests were so hard, the class average for the final was a fail
HiS CLASS IS HELL STAY AWAY
