wost professor I have ever had in my entire life
wosrt professor ever DO NOT TAKE

least genuine guy I've ever met. Class was very very difficult, and zeshen never made himself accessible online and outside of class because he never cared about seeing us succeed. I wish I would've had Amit (the TA) as my lecturer instead. Amit is very laidback and his review sessions were very helpful.
moved at a lightning fast pace, tests were extremely hard, he will fail you
put no effort into teaching, tests were SUPER HARD
boring teacher, hard class
he will make sure you fail
treates you like a robot or just some kid. Boring too.

The way Professor Gu taught the course made it very hard to understand and internalize the material. He was never ready to help outside of the classroom and never took the time to make sure his students felt prepared to take the quizzes and exams.
horrible experience, stressful semester, he cannot teach for his life

Gu was very poor at teaching, and did not seem to take any interest in helping students, rather used his authority to make his tests harder and make the semester unpleasant for his students. I heard rumors about him but I didnt listen, HIS. CLASS. IS. HELL.
If you take Gu, your semester will be very stressful. If you take liling Ko, your semester will be a breeze
I think I have had such a stressful semester because of this professor, even though calc 3 is supposed to be really easy, he decided to make it my most difficult class
Hardest tests of any professor that teaches calc 3. Very very hard tests, would not recommend unless you want to have an extremely stressful semester
Zeshen Gu is a LITERAL NIGHTMARE. He rigged his tests by making them much much harder than the material he covered. The average grade for his final was an F
Very poor teching skills, would not recommend
DO NOT TAKE DO NOT TAKE
The wosrt professor I have ever had in my entiee life, his exams are VERY difficult, do yourself a favor, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. Take liling Ko
the average student in his class failed his final exam. thats all i have to say on the topic. im glad im done with the HELL that was his class
Worst professor I have ever had, AVOID AT ALL COSTS
The only good part of zeshen gu was that his TA Amit, was amazing. He is the worst professor I have ever had in my entier life, his tests were HARD, he couldnt lecture, do not take

Professor Gu is th worst professor I have ever had in my entier life. HIS TESTS ARE MUCH MUCH HARDER THAN HIS CLASS MATERIAL. The only good part of his class was that his TA, Amit, was the best TA ever

Professor Gu, while put in effort, was simply unable to adequately teach the content properly. He would often breeze through topics, and given that the notes he taught off of were Liling Ko's, its clear he did not know how to teach the material well. Just take Liling Ko instead, Zeshen just teaches off of her materials any way, his tests just SUCK!
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH ZESHEN. He is extremely difficult, and the wordt professor I have EVER had in my entire life! Take this class with liling Ko
Worst professor ever. Do not take under ANY CIRCUMSTANCE
The most unhelpful, strict professor I have ever had. If you take this class with Liling Ko, you will have a MUCH easier time and this class will be a breeze. Math with Zeshen is a literal NIGHTMARE

It is clear that zeshen gu takes more pleasure from giving students bad grades than actually teaching material for his class. He will tae any and every opportunity to take points off, and will not provide a clear explanation as to why. He is also a horrible lecturer, and is hard to understand due to his thick accent. Do yourself a favor, avoid him
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR DO NOT TAKE
Very difficult professor, exams were near impossible to do well on, average student failed final exam

Zeshen Gu is without a doubt the most difficult professor in the entire math department. His exams were extremely difficult, and he did not do a very good job teaching. His examples in lecture were very vague, and he would not elaborate on them if asked to. He'd give material in exams that was not even mentioned during his class. It was a nightmare

Professor Gu had extremely hard exams. I remember the other teacher (Liling Ko) (who you should probably take instead if u r readin this) I heard had easier tests, his has mostly curveballs, and the main issue I have against this was that the material he taught didnt nearly match the difficulty of his tests! The average student failed his final!

I dont know why Zeshen Gu made his tests so difficult but they are the most difficukt tests I have ever took. He was extremely bad at teaching, and I only walked away more confused. He made his tests so difficult that the average grade for his final was F. He is horrible, I wish I never had him. He is really harsh and bad at teaching and rude

Zeshen Gu is genuinely the worst professor I have ever had. His average final exam grade was an F. It was so bad he refused to give students their scores and was forced to curve the final class grade by two letter points. He makes his tests so so much harder than any practice material for anything he gives. I HIGHLY recommend avoiding him

It was very clear that Zeshen is new to lecturing. He used notes and materials from a different professor but created his own exams, which were often way too long and difficult for the time given. I did well in this class and learned the material by the end, but definitely had troubles understanding him during lectures.

Professor Gu's overall teaching ability is very subpar. He was often vary unclear when explaining difficult topics. He would often breeze over important topics and spend a lot of the lecture back tracking and going on tangents. Additionally, his exams are very challenging and I would consider them to be unfair with the material covered in lecture.

Zeshen Gu was not a great lecturer. He often backtracked when explaining difficult material during lectures, and would have to send Canvas notifications later correcting the work he did in class. It was especially difficult when the material would start to increase in difficulty. However, he was very kind and was always happy to answer questions.

summary_comment: Professor Everson is highly regarded for her caring and supportive approach, especially in online settings, where she maintains frequent communication and offers extensive help. Her lectures are praised for their clarity and use of numerous examples, making the material accessible and engaging. Students find her classes easy and recommend them enthusiastically, noting her dedication to student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Everson is highly regarded for her caring and supportive approach, particularly in online settings, where she maintains regular communication and offers extensive help. Her lectures are praised for their clarity and numerous examples, making the material accessible and engaging despite some students finding them initially dry.

Ratings.comment: michelle seems like a nice person, but personally i didn't love her lectures. they were all very boring and she would often breeze through examples but spend lots of time talking about the random studies she was using in class. not too bad though, just pretty boring and uninteresting.

Dr. Everson was the sweetest and most caring professor I have ever had! Especially for an online class, she was SO communicative and checked in weekly to let us know she was there to help. Her lectures were great to watch and she illustrated every concept in a great way with a lot of examples to go through. I would 1000% recommend taking her class!
Very easy class and team of lecturers are very good.

I really enjoyed Professor Everson's class. I liked the way that the class was set up and how she graded things. Her lectures were great to watch and she gave plenty of examples in case a concept is unclear. She emails about once a week to ask how everyone is doing and is overall so sweet! 100% would recommend her.
Weekly in-person recitation to work on a lab assignment. Weekly asynchronous work includes some reading, normally 2 lessons, and an online homework. Open-note, noncumulative midterm and final.

I took it from Ms. Wenxin Du (lecture) and Mr. Jake Roberts (recitation). The class is super easy and the teachers are pretty nice. You only need to attend the recitation and there are only two assignments every week (both pretty easy only take like 20 minutes). You can miss 3 recitation, one lowest-grade lab&quiz will be dropped. TAKE THIS CLASS

Dr. Everson truly cares about her students and wants to see them succeed. I was dreading taking a math course, but Dr. Everson made it very easy and offered so much help and resources outside of class. It actually ended up being my favorite class of the semester! Definitely take this class with her if you can!!

The class was asynchronous, but Dr. Everson tried to get to know people and was always available if need be. She sent very kind emails and carmen messages. The material is fairly straightforward and the exams were not difficult.

I loved taking stats with Dr. Everson. She is so caring and willing to help. She made stats not as scary as I imagined since I am someone who is not good at math. The homework was not hard and is very manageable. I liked the way this class was structured and the lectures were engaging and she made sure to tell us why the info is important.
If you're taking STATS1350, then you 100% should take it with Dr. Everson. She is an amazing lecturer and always makes it very clear that you can reach out to her for whatever.

Lectures can be long, but the textbook should work fine on its own. Very nice and cares about you understanding the material, and frequently checks in to make sure everything is explained clearly. Feedback is thorough so you know where to improve. Exams are not too different from regular assignments. I suck at math but this class was great!

Professor Everson is one of the best professors I have ever had. She is so kind and understanding and responds to help on emails quickly. Her lectures were very clear and engaging and her practice study exams helped a lot. She has a passion for her students and I would highly recommend her.

I absolutely fell in love with this professor. Her lectures are not just to talk about random things, but actually goes according to the homework and exams. The midterm practice exam was very similar to the actual midterm exam, same with the final. She is great at teaching. One of the best I have had since attending OSU!

Professor Everson was an amazing professor! She is such a caring person, she emails students each week to make sure that everything is going good. Her lectures are very easy to understand and she explains the material well. If you review the lectures and the example problems in the lecture notes, you will go just fine on exams and homework.

Prof Everson's course was extremely well organized and easy to navigate. She made Stats interesting, accessible, and applicable to the real world. I truly loved learning from her and was so touched she took the time to send personalized messages to every single one of her students. Her lectures were relaxing (she has an extremely soothing voice!).

She was such a great professor. Honestly she was the only professor who truly took the time to reach out to me and check on the class throughout the whole semester. She was super understanding. The class was an Easy A. Labs and Homework are due every week, but they were super easy if you watched lecture. Exams were very easy too.

Professor Everson is an actual angel. She emails students weekly to remind them of assignments, and checks in on us to see how we are, which is especially important in a pandemic. Her exams are open note, and when Carmen went down unexpectedly she worked to help fix the problem and gave us all extra credit due to the stress. 100/10 do recommend!

Prof. Everson is seriously so nice and caring. I took the class online bc of covid and she took time weekly to check in on her students personally. I never expected that. The class can be difficult if you aren't the best at math (me) but she has plenty of office hours that are very helpful. The TA's were helpful as well.

I am taking Stats 1350 with prof. Everson this semester, and she has just been so wonderful. Despite my course being completely online and asynchronous, Prof. Everson makes the course personal and values her students. She offers lots of Zooms throughout the week with herself and TA's to get extra help. I wish I had more classes to take with her..

summary_comment: Professor Lafont has received mixed reviews, with some students finding his lectures straightforward and thorough, praising his preparation and detailed examples, while others describe his classes as unorganized and difficult to follow. Many recommend getting a good teaching assistant or dropping the course if possible, due to challenging exams and inconsistent attendance. Overall, his teaching style and effectiveness vary significantly among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lafont has received mixed reviews, with some students finding his lectures straightforward and thorough, praising his preparation and detailed examples, while others describe his classes as unorganized, difficult to follow, and overly focused on proofs, leading to a poor understanding of the material and challenging exams. Overall, his teaching style and effectiveness vary significantly according to student perception.

Ratings.comment: It seems like he's turned a new leaf in comparison to his old ratings. The class is straight forward. He only lectures on a chalk board so while attendance is not mandatory, you should go. He still arrives just on time still, but he is prepared when teaching. Each lecture he covers the concept and goes over good examples from the book. I liked him.

Prof. Lafont is not a someone that you want to have as a professor. He is a tough grader and his lectures are very hard to follow. It seemed like he was only there because the university was making him. It was pretty clear that he would much rather be doing research than teaching.

Prof LaFont made an effort to teach but he should really stick with his research... lecture was pointless and extremely unorganized! Pray for a good TA! Also, be prepared to get difficult exams that do not resemble any problems from class... that is if the prof decides to show up. Have fun learning the class from your TA and the textbook!

Does lots of in-depth examples, but as a result doesn't cover all the material he should. What you do learn, you know well, but overall had a bad experience. Shows up late and lectures until whenever he feels like (no bells in our building). First couple quizzes were really tough. The exams will cover things you've never discussed in class.

If you get this professor, drop the course or get a section change. I repeat, drop the course or get a section change. Tends to lecture into the board and prove every single formula given. If you have a good TA, you can survive the course, but if not, DROP!!!
TERRIBLE!!!  Never gave out practice exams and his lectures are worthless.

Horrible.  Has a huge fetish with proving everything.  We didn't cover the entire last chapter.  Useless lectures, useless recitations that everyone skips, tests that don't correlate with stuff covered in class.  Avoid.  Our final had one problem worth over 25% of the final - we spent one-two days on it in class.  Godawful teacher.
Very smart proffesor, really knows his stuff. The class is supposed to be challenging but his explanations of things are very thorough so it makes it somewhat less challenging.

I had him for both of my calculus classes, and he is utterly useless. Expect to spend endless hours at the MSLC to fully understand the material with him. No accent, although by the name you might expect it, but a horrible teacher. Does not get anything across clearly and only proves everything.
Definitely not a good Lecture Teacher, unless u like writing a book of notes every class that doesnt help to learn the topic!

Writes literally everything he says on the board. He has a million "remarks" and proofs. Not very clear in his explanations. Going to class doesn't help at all. Odd man- smokes his cigarettes holding his pack of chalk.

Ok so he has a few words that he just loves to use (i.e. remark, note, this gadget etc.)... but I still learned a lot from his class.  If you don't like reading the text, go to class and he basically reads it to you which isn't always a bad thing.  Be optimistic!
I could have skipped class, only read the book, and gotten the same grade.  He doesn't actually do anything I would call "teaching."

He wrote down everything he says, which was quite annoying, but at least he covered everything. Most people never came to class, and the ones that were there usually fell asleep. Nice curve on the course though... I managed to get an A in the course with an 85%.
If i hear the work Remark one more time, i might scream. He just rewords everything out of the book, including proofs. If you have him, at least try to get a good T.A.
No Comments

Let's just say that if I wanted to write every word that came out of his mouth, I would.  He doesn't need to do that for us.  He could probably be a good teacher, except for the fact that he just restates things.

This professor explains things as if one is reading out of the text book.  He fails to serve as a bridge between the advanced reader and the layman.  Furthermore, the use of powerpoint with an overhead projector is extremely useful, but for some reason he does not use this.

summary_comment: Professor Anderson is highly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about his subject, making him an effective lecturer. However, his classes are challenging, particularly due to midterm-heavy grading and the necessity of regular attendance to keep up with the content. While some students find his lectures dense and confusing, others appreciate his depth of knowledge and the thoroughness of his exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Anderson is highly knowledgeable and an engaging lecturer who clearly enjoys teaching, making complex subjects accessible through detailed explanations. However, his classes are challenging, with tough grading and midterms carrying significant weight, and missing even a few classes can make it difficult to keep up.

Ratings.comment: Very knowledgable and a good prof all around. He was funny and you could tell he enjoyed teaching. The grading is very midterm heavy and attendance is necessary. Content builds so if you miss a class or two it is hard to catch up

DA is a fantastic lecturer, the best I've ever had. His intensive knowledge of the subject means he can explain everything very well. That being said, his tests were HARD, and he was a very tough grader. If you want to learn the subject matter, take the class with DA, but if you want to get an easy A take the other teacher.

Hes a chill prof. Lectures are a lot though, so be ready to write. Someone said, which I agree with, hes too knowledgeable sometimes so the content ends up going over our heads; but sometimes, usually after us asking questions, he simplifies things down. Thankfully, exam content matches what he teaches in lectures/practice exams. Hes alright.

Professor Anderson is very knowledgeable in Mathematics. Perhaps too knowledgeable. I find that he doesnt realize that what he is saying is very confusing to students. His lectures are a bit messy. I would definitely recommend reading the textbook to help understand his lectures.

summary_comment: Professor McDougal is widely regarded as biased, with some students alleging that he grades favoritistically. Others describe his lectures as unengaging and his knowledge questionable. Despite this, a few students find him helpful and fair on quizzes.
summary_comment_short: Professor McDougal is highly regarded by some students for being insightful and challenging, though his teaching style and grading system are often criticized as confusing and unfair. Other students, however, find him biased and lacking in knowledge, with one even questioning his credentials.

Ratings.comment: Ah, Robert—truly a master of his craft… if his craft is making students question their life choices. His lectures are the perfect cure for insomnia, and his grading system? A mix of dart throws and horoscope readings. Truly, Robert redefines education… by making sure you learn nothing from him. Bravo, Robert, bravo!
Biased lecturer, gives his favorite students higher grades. No idea how he ended up at yale
Very bad professor, not knowledgeable at all
No Comments
Awesome, extremely helpful, quizzes fair.

summary_comment: Professor Margolis is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, making linear algebra accessible and straightforward. His clear lectures and helpful notes contribute to an easy learning experience, with both homework and tests being relatively uncomplicated. Attendance is recommended to fully grasp the material, though he provides lecture notes afterward for those who miss class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Margolis is known for his effective teaching methods, making linear algebra accessible and straightforward. His clear lectures and easily manageable homework and test requirements contribute to a focused learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Margolis was a good professor would made linear algebra very straightforward and easy to learn. The tests were all very easy, and there was not too much homework either. The class is very focused on the content covered in the lectures so I would make sure not to skip class, but he does upload the notes after each lecture.
A great professor who made the class seem easy. Lectures were clear and the notes he writes are helpful for homeworks. Homeworks and tests were easy.

summary_comment: Professor Kunz is highly regarded for his care and approachability, though his handwriting and notation can be challenging. Despite this, his practice exams closely mirror actual tests, and attending lectures and recitations regularly is key to achieving a strong grade. His commitment to student success and clear intentions to improve his lectures are evident, though some students find his start times slightly inconvenient and his Greek letter notation difficult to decipher.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kunz is highly regarded for his care and approachability, though his handwriting and notation can be challenging. Despite this, students find his practice exams to be very useful, and many believe consistent attendance leads to strong performance.

Ratings.comment: He is an amazing professor and is also very kind and chill. His handwriting and notation is confusing at times but it didn't harm my learning. His practice exams were pretty much the same as the real exams and I think if you attend every lecture and recitation it would be hard to not get close to an A.

Prof Kunz has been one of my favorite lecturers. His handwriting and notation is confusing at times. There were plenty of classes I left feeling like nothing made sense but the following class, recitations, and the online textbook were very helpful. Exams are straightforward and the class is an easy B if you study and attend lecture/recitation.

Was an okay professor, he has a very thick accent and his handwriting is super hard to read. Exams were exactly like the practice, and he posted all of his notes online. We had a few homework assignments, but were super helpful and an easy way to boost your grade. There is a slight curve at the end of the class.

Great professor, definitely cared about your success in the class and how he was able to make his lectures better. The quizzes in recitation were fairly easy and so were the exams. Only complaint is that he usually starts a few min early for lectures and some of the way he writes greek letters are a bit difficult to read.

summary_comment: Professor Fateheddin is widely regarded as having poor teaching quality, with students finding her lectures boring and difficult to follow due to her rapid and unclear speech. The class atmosphere is negatively impacted by her unhelpful interactions with students, including public scolding and attempts to discourage them from seeking further clarification.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fateheddin's teaching is generally considered poor, characterized by rapid, unclear speech and a focus on solving math problems without engaging students effectively. Students also report issues with her demeanor, noting her rudeness and tendency to publicly shame students, which has led many to drop the class.

Ratings.comment: awful TA, wearing a microphone that has no effect

I ended up dropping the class but for the classes I went to, it sucked. Classes were so boring and she speaks very fast and not clear; very hard to follow along with. She also seems unsure of herself for anything she talks about for the most part, otherwise she seemed sweet. Wouldn't recommend though.

Her "teaching" is just standing at the front of the room, mumbling as she works her way through math problems. She's also incredibly rude. She publicly scolds and shames students when they're wrong. She once incorrectly docked points from my assignment, and tried to bully me out of emailing the professor to fix it. So many more examples, DONT TAKE!

summary_comment: Professor Basa is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, which significantly enhance the learning experience in recitations. Despite being described as nerdy and a bit awkward, he successfully injects a sense of humor into the classroom, making the sessions engaging and memorable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Basa is an excellent instructor known for his effective teaching methods and helpful recitations. Despite being described as nerdy and a bit awkward, he manages to infuse the class with a unique sense of humor.

Ratings.comment: He was my recitation instructor. He is amazing! His recitations were actually very helpful and he is good at teaching. He is definitely nerdy and a little awkward, but he made the class kind of silly

summary_comment: Professor Bersudsky is known for being challenging, with a significant portion of students requiring retakes. Lectures are often disorganized, and he frequently struggles to complete examples or explain concepts clearly, leading many to rely on additional resources. Despite his genuine care for students, his imperfect English can hinder effective communication, and his teaching methods are generally less effective than supplementary resources like recitations and external tutoring.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bersudsky is known for being challenging, with a significant portion of students requiring retakes due to the difficulty of the material. His lectures are often criticized for being disorganized and lacking in depth, with many students relying on additional resources to understand the course content.

Ratings.comment: so hard, a half class cannot pass. most of student will retake.

Very poor at teaching the material. A lot of times it seemed like he didnt even know the material. Often he would start a practice problem, then not know how to solve it and say he would send out the answer later that day.

I had a hard time learning from his lectures and it felt like a lot of the time he was not prepared and struggled to even finish one example problem in his notes. His lectures were unorganized and I had to heavily rely on the recitations and math tutoring services to get me through this course.

I feel bad rating him a 3 because I think he genuinely tries and cares about his students, but his English is not perfect, and he struggles to relay the message sometimes. In addition to recitation, there are thousands of outside resources to help you succeed in the class, though. The exams are standardized and fair. No excuse to not do well.

summary_comment: Professor Poudel is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which significantly enhances student engagement. He is known for his detailed and interesting lectures, and his willingness to assist students with extenuating circumstances. Students consistently praise his thoroughness, clear explanations, and availability during office hours, though some note occasional delays in posting lecture slides. Overall, he is highly recommended for his dedication to student learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Poudel is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style, detailed lectures, and willingness to assist students with extenuating circumstances. His ability to make complex material accessible through real-life examples and office hours support contributes significantly to his effectiveness as a professor.

Ratings.comment: He is constantly cracking jokes in class which did a lot to keep me engaged and entertained. He is willing to work with students with extenuating circumstances as long as he is informed well enough in advance. His lectures are very detailed and interesting and he always posted the lecture notes. He is am excellent professor I would recommend.
The class is hard if you never learn Cal befor, but the professors is great, he will help you with everything, if you have anything you don't know ask him after class or go to his office hour.

Clear and worthwhile lectures. He posts slides online and says that it's so you don't need to take careful notes, but he sometimes forgets to post them in a timely manner so take good notes anyway. Responds to regrade requests for tests and is a fair grader. Helpful in office hours. Great person who cares about students learning.
Made the lectures interesting. Broke down information in an easily absorbable manner. Very willing to help students outside of class.
The class is very hard, but professor Anup was awesome, go to office hours.

Makes lecture interesting, relates the material to different real life examples, office hours are great. Calc will always be difficult especially at OSU, but he made the class bearable. If you have to take calc to understand another class like physics, I recommend him because he gives very detailed and understandable explanations. Cool dude.

Calculus is hard course regardless, but Anup is a great professor!  He makes calculus content understandable and comprehendible. He has great notes, examples and directions, keeps lecture interesting and is overall a great guy and professor. I recommend taking 1151 with him.
I love Anup

There weren't fill in the blank slides given you had to write what he wrote down. Most of the time you couldn't even see what he was writing cuz his hand writing was impossible to read. Half way through the semester went to a different professor's lecture. AVOID HIS CLASS IF YOU CAN'T DECODE BAD HAND WRITING.

Anup is actually an amazing professor, guy is super knowledgeable and makes jokes during class that keep lecture entertaining. It's easy to pay attention and he makes lots of connections to previous material so you always understand the WHY as well as the HOW. If you pay attention, you will learn a lot.

Really great at reading the room and asking students their opinions on the material being covered in lecture. Very available for questions outside of class during office hours. Makes great analogies and jokes during lecture that help students think about math in a different way.

good sense of humor, but man, calculus is not easy. 

confusing at times, but i could have utilized office hours and i chose not to :p

He kept class interesting by joking around and connecting back to old lessons. Lectures always seems to build on each other as the semester progressed. The material was hard to understand at times, but studying outside of class, practice problems/exams, and attending lecture were super helpful and important.
Good lectures that don't go crazy fast and are good about tying back previous concepts. Likes to interact with the class and make jokes to keep the lecture interesting.

Overall great person and professor. Cons are he has in cases a thick accent that makes hard to understand him, and he moves at a very fast pace expecting that all students know the material. But other than that he has a good sense of humor and trys to keep students involved.
Goes through material fast which keeps you engaged if you keep up with it. Very chill, runs good office hours, would take again.

summary_comment: Professor DeVilbiss is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and willingness to help students. Despite the challenging coursework, his availability during office hours and responsiveness via email make learning more manageable. Students find his lectures engaging and his grading fair, with a focus on ensuring everyone understands the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor DeVilbiss is highly regarded for his thorough knowledge and engaging teaching style, though his classes and assignments are challenging. He is extremely supportive, offering extensive office hours and extra help, and is known for being a fair grader who provides generous partial credit.

Ratings.comment: Amazing professor!! This class is pretty difficult and the homeworks/take home exams can take hours on hours, so be prepared to put in work. However, he is super super helpful in office hours or over email and will really sit to help you understand a problem. Would say he is a pretty fair grader also! Would definitely take him again

It's a little bit late to evaluate but awesome professor! Extra office hours make your life easier. 
The material is hard to understand, but he is always ready to answer your questions. 
You really learn stuff.

Very nice professor, and very knowledgable of the subjects. He was very helpful in office hours and tries his best to make sure everyone did well. His tests were fair and he was generous with the partial credit. His lectures are interesting, but he had a tendency to write every single word and it made his proofs take longer than needed sometimes.

Such an awesome professor! I actually enjoyed taking MATH 3345 with him. Knowledgeable about math but not condescending. Engaging lectures and very understanding and down to earth with students. He's aware that the class is hard but tries to make success achievable. Exams were fair and I felt he gave us the material to be prepared for them.

summary_comment: Professor Ramsey is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, including supportive class discussions, detailed lecture materials, and frequent practice exams. He is known for his dedication to helping students succeed and his responsiveness to emails. However, some students have noted issues with his grading consistency and occasional arrogance, particularly regarding communication and TA support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ramsey is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, including supportive class discussions, clear expectations for grades, and comprehensive resources such as lecture recordings and practice exams. Students appreciate his dedication to helping them succeed and his prompt responses to emails, though some note that his teaching style can be challenging and requires active engagement from students.

Ratings.comment: Professor Booby is a really good teacher who supported students to ask more questions during the class. I'll recommend the TA Mejia Cordero Julian, his office hour always help me to figure out issues.

Dr. Ramsey truly cares about teaching and making his students learn. His standards-based class does seem difficult at times, but it does set help set a clear path of what exactly you should do to get the grade you want. His office hours are greatly helpful. Lectures are unconventional and involve very important group activities and discussions.

Dr. Ramsey has been the best professor I've had as a freshmen at OSU because he's genuinely willing to help you succeed in the class. Also, he has helped me a lot throughout the semester class and he responds to your emails in less than 2-3 hours which is awesome when you're solving problems and have questions. Overall, I'll suggest him for Calc 1.

Professor Ramsey is an excellent lecturer, along with my TA Juan Pablo De Resis. Both are extremely friendly to student and responds to emails very quickly. Professor Ramsey always posts recordings of lectures, complete notes, and many many practice exams to help with the review process. Best Calc 1 teacher here at OSU in my opinion.

The class is organized, and he teaches very well. However, he is arrogant and does not reply to emails at all, so do not bother to email him for problems you have. He does not accept any kind of responsibility for his TA(graders) and It has a tough grading role,

I took MAth 1140 to get a deeper understanding of calculus as an engineer. While he gives okay lectures and multiple homework quizzes per week, he wasn't a very hard teacher. He and the TA are very different graders and your grades on exams and written homework will reflect that. Also, he continues to post practice assignments without answers.
Amazing!!!!!

Very thoughtful professor but tends to go through lecture material extremely quickly. If you get stuck on a concept make sure that you learn it before the next class or you will go down an endless rabbit hole of having to learn the entire sections before the exams. Lots of midterms but not worth that much of your grade.

Great instructor. Spells everything out for you and will help you learn. Homework is easy and tests can be difficult. The hard part isn't the math but you must explain everything and show ALL work, you can't skip steps or use alternate methodology, you MUST use what was discussed in lecture.

Bobby makes sure to teach you everything fully and does a well job doing so. However, you will almost undoubtedly lose points for not wording things the exact way he wants you to and take away points for reasons outside of math.
I am not good at math actually, but prof Ramey makes it easy to understand. If you need to take 1151 in OSU, I strongly recommend you to take his class.
Great Calc I professor. It's 1151 so expect the class to be hard and a lot of work. Overall, Ramsey made the content easy to understand.
Pretty good class, tough but doable, the professor makes it easier to understand but it was a struggle for sure. Tests aren't anything like the in class work or homework though.

Clear lectures, straightforward exams. As a person, Bobby is definitely rude and thinks hes better than his students. But at the end of the day, that doesnt really matter for a college course, so Id recommend. Just dont ever ask for help or clarification, go to the TA (much nicer!!).

I took his flipped-and-flexible version of Calculus 1 and enjoyed it. It is extremely nice for people who can't attend a 1 hour lecture multiple times a week and need to work on their work throughout the day.

He's straight to the point and clear in every lecture. I recommend you take Math 1140/1141 because you learn at a much more reasonable pace when compared to Math 1151 (you learn the same content over 2 semesters instead of one).

Prof Ramsey said on the first day that this was the first and last time we would ever see him. Assigned flipped & flexible modules for our lectures so basically had to teach ourselves everything. 12 assignments due every tues/thurs and exams/worksheets due Mondays. Recitation is pointless but attendance is graded (only reason people show).

There’s a LOT of homework and typically the homework is nothing like the exams. Prof Ramsey is a good lecturer and he explains things well however don’t ask questions because he’s very condescending when answering. The exams have sample midterms that are usually very similar so I would practice those.

We have not seen this guy once this entire semester, the only teacher we see is the TA. The course is terribly organized and heavy on pointless online homework instead of more class time. It is very hard to learn anything in this calculus course and the grading is terrible on the written homework and the frequent midterms.
Bobby is super condescending when you ask questions. The lectures are very simple and straightforward, but the midterms dont really relate sometimes. He is definitely rude though.

Awful teacher if you can avoid having him do it. His lectures are so boring and do not keep you engaged at all. His grading is awful and he is not forgiving at all and not willing to understand mistakes and give points back.
Super hard class but Bobby made it bearable. This was my 2nd go around and he truly was better than my last professor. Try to get him if you can!!
calc department is notoriously bad at osu, but ramsey has very weel set up lectures that are easy to follow. as long as you do the homework and take decent notes during lecture it's easy to do well

This man is a complete jerk. He is rude and does not take inconsideration of how students feel with the pace. I probably will not pass this class but fingers crossed. Be aware what happens in lecture is barely on the exams. He called my class stupid....

This class was definitely challenging, but Professor Ramsey was very accommodating. Lecture videos were helpful, but most face time was over zoom with my TA. Still, when I came to Prof Ramsey with issues I was having in class, he was extremely flexible and understanding. There are a LOT of homework assignments and the class is pretty time consuming
Bobby is the absolute greatest!!!!

I never enjoyed math before, and while that didn't change too much with this class, Professor Ramsey at least made some calculus concepts very interesting. Despite the pandemic, he was really understanding of the fact some people may need a little refresher on certain topics and never hesitated to answer even the seemingly "dumb" questions.
Great Professor, but just a lot of homework and studying for his class. He teaches calc well, but quizzes are very challenging.

First off-avoid taking calc at OSU altogether. Ive never experienced something so difficult for no reason in my life. I received an A in the class and that was because of Bobby. If you have to take calc at osu TAKE BOBBY! Id taken calc in high school for 2 years, but he definitely has the best approach. Countless people fail calc at osu.

Let me tell you, I was not happy to see Bobby by the second week of his lectures. I once showed up to a midterm 3 minutes before it was going to begin, and he made me move to the front and started the exam before I could sit down. I'm a good student, and did well in his course, but he was always very rude to me anyway, and I did not appreciate it.

This class was very challenging. Would not recommend if you have no previous calc knowledge. However, Bobby isn't a bad professor. Lectures are too easy compared to the exams, but that is because the math department sets you up to do poorly. Overall I think Bobby is a good option for this class if you have to take it.

Ramsey made a really difficult subject seem really simple the way he broke concepts down during lectures. He's fun and energetic and makes math not boring. If you have to take this class, I highly recommend him!

I failed Calc before and had to re-take. Calc department at OSU is HORRIBLE. They expect way too much. Grade is 90% exam-based. Don't take unless you absolutely have to. But if you do TAKE BOBBY. He teaches in a way that's easy to understand, teaches multiple approaches, and gets ALL of the subject matter in. Awesome prof. Doesn't get any better.
Talk to him after midterms about things you missed. If there was a mistake hell give points back AND YOULL NEED THOSE POINTS

Professor Ramsey is a great professor and he did a good job for the lecture. His lecture is easy to follow and not tougha at all. The only reason that I got an B+ is because of the exam. The exam is all about the lecture materials but not easy to get full marks.
Very boring class. Throws a lot of tricks at you on the test. Very nice guy, not my favorite class. Not an easy class

Bobby was a great lecturer and really cared about students understanding the material. He often uses Top Hat and walks around the class to answer questions. The Top Hat questions are not for points. If someone asks a question he will thoroughly explain it in a way you can understand. DON'T BE LATE to class if you choose to go, it irritates him.

Professor Ramsey is a fantastic teacher. His lectures are great. He keeps your attention the whole class and gives great explanations and examples. He speaks very clearly and posts most of his notes and lectures online. He really cares about how his students do in his class and is easily available for questions.
Ramsey was a great lecturer and I'm glad to have gotten to take him. He puts effort into what he does and truly wants to see all of his students succeed.

Taught the material well during the lectures. It did get boring sometimes but that is the nature of the class. Got an A- in Calc 1 in his class without really any studying. If I had tried, or attended the recitations, I would have gotten an A probably.

He is really a responsible professor. You can always ask questions during the class or office time. He always presents the content clearly, and leads us step by step. Just do practice before quizzes and exams.
Great teacher, hard class.
I wouldn't say that any calculus is an EASY A, closer to "Lets just pass" but bobby was for sure very helpful. If you reach out to him and go to office hours he will try his best to help you.

Hes a really good lecturer but he talks fast and all of the information is extremely important, even to the last second of class. New topics are regularly introduced in the last 5-10 minutes of class. Hes very receptive to questions at appropriate times during the lecture
Easy A if you study.
Pretty good lecturer, explains things very well, always answers questions

Bobby really cares about his students. If you go talk to him one on one about a bad test grade, he will do what he can do help you. He would always answer every question in lecture with care, even if it was a "dumb" question. Overall, he was a good professor that made things clear and made my first math course at OSU not bad at all.
He made the content understandable, was available to answer questions after class, and worked with me when I had a scheduling conflict for one of the exams.
Really enthusiastic lecturer. He certainly livens up the lecture room for those who may find the material dry.
Bobby Ramsey was an excellent Calc 1 prof. He delivered excellent lectures and I greatly appreciated them. However, I took Calc in high school, so I earned an A without much difficulty.

Bobby's lectures were so clear. It really helped when it came for studying for the final when I forgot a few things and could re-watch the lecture. I definitely would recommend going to the actually lectures. Math 1151 wasn't that bad with Bobby. The only thing that people complain about is the test, which he DOESN'T create. Bobby made me like math

Bobby Ramsey is the sole reason I passed Calc 1. After never taking Calc in high school, I was in for a surprise in this class. However, Bobby teaches the material so clearly and efficiently that if you pay attention, you can get a good grade in this class. He goes above and beyond in teaching harder questions that those on the midterms
The clearest math teacher I have ever  met! Awesome!

No matter what professor you take for Calculus at Ohio State, the class is going to be ridiculously difficult. However, Ramsey is at least a very clear lecturer who explains things well and in detail. He posted video links to all of his lectures online which was super helpful if you miss class or just need to go over a concept again. Recommend.

Math 1151 is definitely a weed-out class, but Bobby gives you the best chance at passing. His lectures are available online and are extremely useful to use as I can't take good notes with how quickly he teaches (this isn't his fault; the curriculum is intense for this course). He's accessible outside of class and cares about his students. A++ prof.
An inspirational math teacher. He is very logical while taking lecture and answering questions.

Math 1151 is a hard class but I believe Ramsey is a good lecturer. The math department makes the final, midterms, quizzes, etc. There is really only so much Bobby can teach about the test material. The best way to get a good grade is to do book problems even though the textbook isn't required. The final class grade was curved approx. 3 percent.

1151 is a difficult class but that is the department's fault. Bobby is an oddball, but he makes calc lectures fun. Lectures are posted online so you can miss them and not fall behind. You don't need the textbook, but you do need a MML access code (can be purchased separately).

He is a great professor. Energetic and loves math. He might rub some people the wrong way, but he really does care about students. The Math Department sucks as a whole, and the exams have been difficult relative to previous years, but  Ramsey prepares you well. Make sure to use the tutor rooms! They're free and open most of the day.

A really good professor. He taught Calculus I in a very understandable fashion. I understood everything he explained in lecture, and much of what he explained appeared on the homework and midterms/exams.

Very good teacher. I never went to him outside of class for help, but his lectures were very easy to follow and explained the content very well. All of his lectures are online which was very helpful. The problem with the class lies more with the Math Department than Ramesy himself, he is exactly what you want in a lecturer for math.

I'm not sure why the other recent reviews are so bad, but Bobby is the best math professor you can probably get from the Math Department. He wants students to pass, and lectures are extremely engaging. He allows you to ask questions during and after lecture if you need help. He doesn't make OR grade the exams, but I think he prepares you well.

Bobby is an outstanding professor, one of the best instructors I have ever had.  Although the Ohio State Math Department is quite difficult, Bobby always does his best to prepare his students for the challenging exams.

He's a decent lecturer but really not a decent person. very unapproachable. He posts all lectures online which is really helpful cuz you really don't even need to go to lecture. The one time I tried to ask him a question after class he wouldn't stop interrupting and condescending me. Don't go to him for outside help. Calc department sucks overall

Dr. Ramsey is extremely well prepared and is very clear in his lectures. He answers questions well and goes through countless examples in class. In addition, if you miss class, he posts all of his lectures on Carmen online that are available to watch at any time. This professor really understands how to convey material to students!
Best lecturer I've ever had. Interesting man. Never had a professor so prepared for each lesson.

Super amazing math professor, always ready for lecture, he is super smart and super clear. sometimes can be too robotic when teaching but that is because he follows prepared material. explains math very well, probably the best calac 1 teacher, he is so smart!

Really great lecturer - keeps you interested in the material, and his lectures seem to go by fast just because he's really good at explaining things. He doesn't make/grade the tests/quizzes nor does he assign the HW -- it's all assigned by the OSU math department. HW for math 1151 at OSU is a lot!

There's no way around the fact that the math dept at OSU is very tough. Not a big fan of Bobby's lecture style, I didn't get a lot out of it. Exams are very difficult, and generally the practice exams are much easier than the real exam will be, so be prepared for that. If you have to take 1151, he's not a bad choice, but good luck with the dept.
I really like this professor. He's kind of an a'hole sometimes, but generally he is brilliant. Definitely recommended

Dr. Ramsey's lectures were very professional, he was always well prepared for class. However, the way he explained things was very confusing for me. I was able to use the free tutoring services and had to work really really hard and got a good grade. He's also really intimidating and I avoided talking to him at all costs.

Bobby was probably the best professor I have had yet. His lectures were very interesting and clear. He made sure you were prepared for the tests even though they are tough. It is still a lot of work and the tests are made by the math department and very tricky. If you have the option, take his class!!

Great Lecturer! He knows exactly what to tell you to do well on the tests. If you go to lecture everyday and take notes on the problems he gives you will do well in the class. I highly recommend taking his class if you have to take 1151.
i stopped going to lecture after the first couple weeks. he records letters though so if you have time, watch them. he's alright though. the math department is just difficult on its own
He posts lectures and notes to Carmen which is wonderful. Was very helpful during office hours.

Ramsey has the most refined, interactive, and fun lecture style I have ever seen. He has the the ability to connect mathematics to such common experiences that recitation become unnecessary. I would take again.

Clear to the point, and gives lots of examples. Usually posts electronic lectures online too so you can miss a day or two and still be on track. Or you can use it to review for exams. Failed my first Calc class and had to drop. This guy taught me calc and got me an A.
Good guy. Explains material very well. Could be a bit more approachable, but he does a good job once you become friendly. Would take again.
Class is pretty straightforward. He never had time to help during office hours though
You can't go up to him and ask him a question. He's too condescending and unaware that students are here to learn. Do not recommend.

Ramsey is one of the few calculus professors who actually understand the material and teach it well. His midterms are hard just because the material is difficult and fast-paced. Doing the practice problems and midterms along with precalculus knowledge, you'll do well. He's a fair grader but he gives points if you deserve them.  Lec vids are online!

Awesome guy and teacher. He is very to-the-point and moves kind of quickly, but he will give you help if you ask for it. He records his lectures, which is great because you can get away with missing class.
Doesn't curve class after a midterm average of 66. Don't trust him he is a misleading grader

Ramsey is one of the best professors, or even teachers, I have ever had. He understands the material and knows how to explain it so that his students can also understand. He doesn't talk down to any students despite their questions and seems to enjoy what he does. If I could have him again, I would.

Very clear and super nice. He is much better than many other math professors. He explains things well and is good at example problems. Can sometimes be a little condescending in his lectures, but not in a rude way, he just explains things in such a way that someone with little background in math can easily understand. All lectures posted on carmen.

He was extremely clear in his lectures and made class thoroughly enjoyable. Very good at giving example problems that are relevant to the midterms and from speaking with other students, he is the best Calculus professor. I definitely recommend!

Great Professor, throughly enjoy this class. He does a great job explaining concepts in lecture and it makes it very easy to understand what you are doing. I haven't missed lecture once even though he posts them on carmen. Very humorous guy and I am very glad I have him, the best choice.

He's definitely the best math professor I've had here. Everything he speaks just makes sense. And he's super into it, gets out of breath sometimes explaining infinite series..... He barely puts a curve on the class though, just a precaution.

Bobby is an amazing prof! Even tho he hasnâ??t taught 153 that many times in the past, he was REALLY clear & helpful. Kinda goes fast in lectures so u have to keep up. Posts past tests on Carmen with answer keys, assigns only 3 hw probs out of the book each week. If u spend enough time doing assigned probs and go to lectures, u should be fine!

He was probably the best math professor the school has. He's such a good lecturer and his exams aren't easy, but they're definitely fair. Overall he made the class a lot easier than other professors did. If you do the work and all of the suggested homework you're fine. Only complaint is that the class has no curve regardless of low averages.

summary_comment: Professor Falkner is known for his heavy emphasis on theoretical content and extensive homework assignments, often requiring students to memorize proofs and tackle complex problems. While his lectures can be challenging and focused on proofs, he is described as a kind and helpful professor who provides extensions and extra credit opportunities. Students note that while his tests are generally fair, the class demands significant effort and prior calculus experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Falkner is known for his heavy focus on theoretical concepts and extensive homework assignments, though his tests are generally straightforward and often include questions directly from the homework. Students appreciate his willingness to help if asked the right questions and note that while his lectures can be challenging, they are overall effective in conveying the material.

Ratings.comment: Lots of theory, LOTS of homework. Tests are fairly easy, usually pulled directly from hw, but you will need to memorize 2-3 proofs for each and be skilled at homework examples. His lectures are okay but he is super helpful if you ask the right question. Overall, I love Dr. Falkner and hope to take another class with him in the future.

He's a nice guy but his teaching sucks. He spends almost the entire lecture writing out proofs, and rarely gets around to teaching us how to actually solve the problems he assigned for homework, and even when he does his explanations are lacking in vital information. If you didn't take AP Calc BC, you will struggle. The textbook is as bad as he is.

Falkner is a very kind and passionate professor, but PLEASE don't take this class unless you have calc 2 experience and want a challenge. The new material was taught poorly (focused on proofs) and HW was overly complex and took hours to complete each night. The textbook doesn't help. You won't know your grade until after the semester ends.

Professor Falkner requires us to memorize some analysis content, but memory does not require understanding. This is very unfriendly. Overall, this professor's lecture was good and I learned a lot. A little reminder, for any freshmen who want to learn real math, just take 4181H and don't waste your time on calculus.

He is a nice professor! Generous on giving extensions even if the reason is today is my birthday lol. But he is a tough grader, caring details and wording a lot. However, the curve is also big, so overall your grade won't be bad. He also gives bonus questions as extra credit. Recommend him!
g

All the homework is in the textbooks, but finding its solution online is hard, so you have better solve it as early as possible. However, his test is not quite tricky since there is always a makeup quiz for each midterm exam for everyone, and he will give positive feedback for each question you ask. A strict, humourous, and kind professor.
He's good at what he does, but it's a difficult class.

If you want your semester to be easy to get an A, don't choose Neil Falkner. but he is a very serious and demanding teacher to his students. I did all his bonus problems and reviewed them carefully, but I still lost a lot of points because of mistakes in details. But I think Neil Falkner is generally a serious and responsible teacher.

Average/Median for both midterms was in the 50%range. Having nearly finished my degree he is the toughest grader I have come across. You need to attend class because he does not post his material online or record lectures. You need to enter the exams knowing exactly how to do the proofs on there,he will give you a zero on questions for very little.

Did not do anything to improve the class average of 50% for both exams and said "we weren't doing enough" or "pulling our weight". Was passive-aggressive when students asked questions at times. Takes almost all points off for grammatical or spelling errors. Would stand in front of the board so it was hard to see what he was writing

Class averages for midterms were 50% and instead of helping he told students that they needed to "pull their weight". If you make a typo or forget a small logic statement he will not hesitate to give a zero for a midterm question. Not very helpful to students and overall has the opinion of you either pass or fail.

Professor Falkners probability class was the most unpleasant math course I took at OSU, and this includes a class taken by a different professor who would insult students to their face. 80% of the grade is exams, and he grades super hard. An 80% is an A in the class , to be fair, but I spent hours studying for exams and got screwed by minor typos.

Dr. Falkner was a pretty good professor. I didnt take BC Calc, so I struggled for being so far behind my classmates. Dr. Falkner didnt usually teach the material, often opting to take deep dives into theory. He expected that we knew the material, and I did not, which made the class hard. The textbook was also very confusing sometimes.

I love Neil Falkner! While I found that a lot of times his lectures were not super helpful for me when doing actual homework, if you're stuck he's always available during office hours to help you out and explains everything really well. He grades exams really harshly, but there's a really nice curve at the end of the course!

A legend, honestly. For lack of a better phrase, this class slaps. His lectures are easy to follow and hes available at his office long past his official office hours. Tests are hard, but thats to be expected. Theres no Carmen course for you to check your grades on, but its easy to calculate with a spreadsheet.
Great class and professor; would recommend. That being said, somewhat harsh grading, and as others have mentioned you have to either see him in office hours for your grade or calculate it yourself.

He was very irresponsible in teaching Honors Complex Analysis. He got caught up in technical points for summing series and neglected to teach us much actual, you know, complex analysis. I don't think his class was adequate for a strong undergrad program. When I looked at Berkeley's prelims, I could do all everything but the complex.

He's one fun, entertaining guy. When he gets really excited, he takes out a prop mallet and hits himself over the head like a living cartoon character. That, alone, is worth the price of admission. A real character!

Doesnt use a carmen page so youll have to manually calculate your own grades. Has office ours everyday and it always accesible by email. Very kind and understanding of when you forget your homework or have any questions. Doesnt tell you but he curves your overall grade. Overall a very kind man.

He's a pretty good teacher but the textbook he wrote for Math3345 is the worst math textbook I've ever had in my life. Problems correlating with examples are similar but contain major differences from the examples that make the problem different & there is no reference material in the book to show you how to handle the differences in the problem

Professor Falkner is very good at explaining the subject matter. He allows you to go back and correct mistakes on assignments until you completely comprehend the information and also gives extra credit.
Neil Falkner is the best thing to come out of Canada since Shania Twain. What a man. A legend in the department.

Very smart guy. Picky with words. Boring class. I never really listened to his lecturing since my priority was to copy all the notes down. (Even though it's straight from the text he wrote himself!) Be prepared to write 1 or even 2 pages of homework everyday and that's mostly in words. The material itself is easy since it's primarily memorization.

He clearly understands math very well, but is a horrible teacher. He focused way too much on wording proofs "his way" rather than just understanding them. His attitude was very rude, and when I went to office hours I felt like he was just counting down the time until I left. Maybe his social skills just need some improvement!
best math teacher i've ever had!
He can be very boring in lecture but overall he is a great lecturer and explains this very well. Tests are not extremely hard.
Good professor. Explains things pretty well but can be confusing at times. Nice guy and he's pretty laid back.
harsh

Falkner wrote the text for 345, which is excellent in of itself.  He teaches directly from this text, working out examples methodically, slowly and clearly.  This is the best taught math class I have attended thus far.
Genius... He should be at Harvard...

Falkner is a genius. He is a shining beacon of light in an otherwise cold and dark world. Simply stated,the man is math. He presents the material in a very rigorous, precise and methodical manner. His class is rather difficult, but it forces you to learn the material. I certainly recommend him to those who are serious about learning math. Hail Falk
Falkner is the man! I love his lectures. He is very clear and concise, his style is elegant and efficient, and he makes math a great deal of fun.

Will become annoyed if you ask the same question to many times. Points on exams are not distributed equally to all questions, so if you miss one you could lose 20 points dropping you a letter grade. They are also hard to study for because he does not give practice midterms. He says look at the homework, but that wont save you. Good lecturer though.
The class was ok . It was boring and I fear I might lose interest in math if I attend his lectures.
Very nice guy!
I hated this guy. He acted like he invented math.
This guy is a dinosaur. Mr. Rogers has come back to teach measure theory at OSU. Class comes complete with free ballroom dancing demo. I'd rather die, than experience this again.
No Comments
Clear speaker who really helps you understand Math.
No Comments
Clear explainations in ENGLISH!!

summary_comment: Professor Lam is widely regarded as a poor instructor, known for his self-centered demeanor and ineffective teaching methods. Students consistently report that his lectures move too quickly without adequate explanation, leading to confusion and poor performance on heavily weighted exams. Many advise avoiding his class entirely and seeking alternative resources or substitutes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lam is widely regarded as ineffective in his teaching, with students citing issues such as poor lecture delivery, excessive and confusing homework, and extremely difficult exams. Many students advise avoiding his class entirely, suggesting that it is one of the worst academic experiences available.

Ratings.comment: This guy is self obsessed and thinks he's better than you. Most professors I give bad reviews to are just bad at teaching, he is a bad person

Loads of homework assignments every week! Lecture-wise, he's not good. He moves very fast, and he doesn't explain well either. Any substitute lecturer I had in his class was always better than him. Test heavy! I've taken 5 midterms and then the final at the end of the semester. Please avoid this guy if you can, if not, go to tutoring.
run!

AVOID!!! His explanations made no sense and then he gets mad at people for asking questions during lecture. Lectures, recitation, and the textbook were all useless when preparing for midterms because he never taught the content well (if at all) in the first place.

The class was difficult, but I found the lectures very helpful (exams are modified HW problems and he says exactly what to know in class reviews.) Just read the book, go to class, and try the HW problems once before googling answers. I'm an Econ major who hadn't taken Calc in 3 years, so you'll be fine with some honest effort. Curved a good bit.

It's unnecessary how hard he makes the exams. The averages for both midterms were a 56% and 64%. Very conceptual question based professor, especially on the exams. Gives little partial credit and class is very heavy on the exams (for instance the final is 40% of the grade).

lecture, HW, textbook, himself, none of them would be helpful to your exam, and he even won't give you any sample exam b/c he thinks' you guys need to learn and understand and all the practice problems are not helpful at all, so if you want some fresh experience about how bad a class can be, choose him, he won't let you down

Lectures are horrible and unhelpful, especially when trying to do the homework. I had to learn the material online (the book wasn't great either), and I still didn't understand the lectures. Do not take this class if you have any other options!

summary_comment: Professor Casian is an energetic instructor with detailed lecture notes who covers exam problems thoroughly, making him suitable for students with strong calculus foundations. However, his lectures can be fast-paced and difficult to follow, requiring significant additional study. His teaching style, while passionate and detailed, occasionally leads to confusion and stress due to his tendency to go off-topic and his sometimes poor handling of student questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Casian is a passionate lecturer with detailed notes who covers exam problems thoroughly, making him valuable for exam preparation. However, his lectures can be fast-paced and difficult to follow, requiring significant additional study, and he struggles to help students who lack strong calculus foundations.

Ratings.comment: Ok lectures, but struggled to answer questions from "lost" students. Do not take if you do not have *strong* calc foundations. He also assigned interesting but difficult add'l problems that weren't from the book. Not tech savvy and didn't predictably update lecture notes. Hw was sometimes assigned late eg 2 days before exam. Disagree w/ "5" ratings
really good professor have many extra contents you can enjoy math

Dr Casian was a bit fast-paced but his lectures and lecture notes were excellent in quality. He also covered exam problems and explained them very well, which was very helpful for preparing for exams. Him missing minus signs and mis-writing stuff also brought some levity to the lectures.

He is very passionate about teaching us as much math as possible, and his lecture notes are very detailed and helpful. He does go off on tangents frequently, often ending up teaching us analysis proofs even though they are not part of the curriculum. His classes are fun to attend and the homework and exams are only moderately challenging.

Calc 1 honors is very theoretical/analysis heavy. Dr. Casian is nice, responsive, and an ok lecturer but there is no opportunity to work on problems in class. You just watch him scribble on the chalkboard for an hour at lightning speed and leave the class confused. There is no recitation, just lecture 5 days a week. Take 1152 if you can.

Don't skip lectures. Most of the material will be learned through lectures and he doesn't do that good a job of posting his notes online. His lectures are okay but hard to follow sometimes and it doesn't help the class is quite difficult.

His lectures are informative, but usually hard to follow, so extra studying is required. His tests and homework are relatively easy, but also very easy to make punishing mistakes on. He often will ask for questions, then not look for raised hands, and answer questions badly. These factors make the class uninteresting, stressful, and not enjoyable.

Very fast lectures and a bad grading system. Most of the grade was based on multiple choice questions that are very easy to mess up from tiny mistakes and they can ruin your grade. Prof Casian provided very detailed lecture notes of everything he covered in order which was very helpful. He was always willing to stay late or meet for office hours.

Signed up for 2568, he taught the much harder 4568 in its place, got credit for 2568. The material taught in lectures is missing parts that help you with the exams and mini homework. Idk how I got a b.

He is a nice enough guy, but cannot lecture at all. By the end of the year no one would go because lecture was so useless. Also, it is practically impossible to get a good grade in his class. Exams are way harder than they need to be, and missing one question on an exam drops you a letter grade becasue of how it is set up. Homeworks way too long.

Nothing against the guy, but I was no fan of his teaching style. It feels like he just brushed over really important, foundational concepts, and then dived into some of the more technical/theoretical aspects of linear algebra. His lectures often jumped from on subject to another. Also, the homework do not prepare you well for quizzes/exams.

Dr. Casian, does not really care about the students at all. I went to his office hours to ask him questions about the homework, which had nothing to do with the Lectures he gave, and he denied help when there wasn't a single student in the zoom call. His lectures are terrible. The only helpful thing is the email he sends the night before the exam.
Hes actually bad at teaching. If you bother him enough you can bend the course to be more practical. Drop the class and take it with someone else.

He isn't the worst at teaching material but he makes his tests absurdly hard to the point where you're just guessing on 50% of questions. He gives a lot of extra credit so you will think you'll be fine but the extra credit doesn't matter because they're impossible. He adds on so much extra content compared to other professors. Do not take from him.
Avoid this man at all costs. He does not let you see your old quizzes, or exams. He holds office hours on Fridays after both of the weekly quizzes and homework are due. Not helpful at all.

The class covered fairly difficult material, but Dr. Casian did a generally very good job of teaching things and incorporating both good intuitive reasoning and insights into some higher-level math. Grading was also very lenient overall, and the online transition was handled in a very generous way with regards to exams. Would recommend.

Taking this class (linear algebra) was legitimately one of the worst experiences Ive had in college. His lectures were very confusing and only seemed vaguely connected so they were largely not helpful. The textbook was free and somewhat helpful but also failed to explain many very important concepts. He seems like a decent guy but not a good prof

Avoid, I'd say. The book (Golubitsky) is quite terrible, most commands don't work & it doesn't go into enough detail to teach yourself reliably. He uploads lectures that are vaguely related to each other & don't follow the book at all, but the HW is from the book He'll do reviews before exams but they don't help. He's seems like an OK guy generally

Prof. Casian would be great for someone serious about going in-depth into math. He often gives questions not standard in textbooks or proves things that other instructors would just give as formulas, which makes his class interesting but also very difficult/time-consuming. Fast lecturer, brilliant guy but not 100% at replying to emails

This could be because it was online lectures, but worst math lectures I've had. There are no online notes to download before lecture and this guy plows through all the material with little explanation. The lectures are pre-recorded and he gives almost no time to write what he has written before scrolling past it. 55 min lectures take me 3 hours.

Good mathematics professor, excellent for those with an interest in math. Sometimes quick to speak and has an accent, but very clear in lectures. I do not, however, recommend Honors 190 with him for those who do not want to be math majors. It is an involved class with a good deal of work and it didn't much help me in the end as a Chem major.

Pretty awful teacher. Refused help many times, and was compeltely unclear in his explanations. I am a math major with a 3.8 in-major GPA, and his class was so poorly taught, I got a C. Continued the series with a different prof and it was MUCH MUCH better. 2nd worst teacher of my life.
Very good.
He is so smart...sigh. i think i'm kinda attracted to him too,  *blush*
Ok, as others said, he flies.  But he's willing to help if you ask, and his grading is easy.  And dangit i know Kevin wrote that about the fly and shotgun; i thought he said that in h520 though.
He is the best thing that happened to math. He is an awesome teacher and very sexy too. All ladies should have the honor of having him as a teacher.  He is badass man!!!
he talks fast with this european/mexian accent but clear and straightfoward with the grading easy grade

Grades based on curve because he basically makes up his own material. If you feel comfortable with the h.w. you still could not do good on test because it is not like the tests and the quizzes. He should just write his own math book.

The class was always graded on a curve with quizes and test, but be careful because the extra credit assigned is hard and sometimes you can put in alot of work on it and get 0 points. Test three was hard and final is hard as well, most folks got a c or d.

He is the fastest thing with big hair and a piece of chalk. His board writing is something from the matrix, so come equipped with a video camera. His speed defies his huge hair. Oh yeah, killing fly with shotgun?
good prof.

Overall a good professor! Lectures can be confusing, especially when he's going really fast over new material. Good thing is quizzes and tests are fairly easy, straight from the homework. Uses a lot of weird analogies in lecture: balloon, lions, fireflies

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Honors Linear Algebra and Differential Equations

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Honors Linear Algebra and Differential Equations

summary_comment: Professor Cassady is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, giving the impression that his goal is to fail or cause trouble for students. Students found his lectures to be unhelpful, often consisting of posted videos from others, and he was extremely strict about the syllabus, deducting points for technical errors. In contrast, some students who had him as a recitation TA noted that he was helpful and understanding, though the overall class was still perceived as difficult.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cassady is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, giving the impression that his goal is to fail students and create difficulties. Alternatively, some students found his Calculus 1 class exceptionally easy due to his effective teaching methods and minimal homework load, though his recitations were less helpful for many.
