Ratings.comment: Perhaps no professor is worse than him, he gives the impression that it is his task to fail or bring troubles to the students, if there is another professor, do not choose him.

Didn't teach himself, posted videos of other people explaining the topics. Extremely strict with the syllabus, didn't give me some points even though it was a technological error instead of a human error.

I had Connor for recitation as part of a flipped and flexible section of MATH1151, and he was great. His recitations were helpful in recapping and practicing some material in the lectures. You can tell he has a very good understanding of the subject and is genuinely wanting to be helpful. He is also understanding that the class is difficult.

Dr. Cassady made Calculus 1 feel like elementary Algebra. Truely one of the easiest math classes i've ever taken. And it's not because of the content, but rather how Dr.Cassady presented and taught the material.
Took the class in person and had him as lecturer and TA. Not much HW if you space it out correctly. He responds to emails fast!

Took Math 1151 hybrid, so lectures online and he was my recitation TA. When I visited office hours he was pretty informative. He didn't make the curriculum but the class itself is set up to be extremely difficult and his recitations didn't help nearly as much as my own studying. Really depends on how comfortable you are with calculus.

summary_comment: Professor Abdalkhani has mixed reviews overall. Some students found him approachable, caring, and effective in explaining concepts, noting his willingness to stay after class to help and occasionally cracking jokes to lighten the mood. However, others struggled with his lectures, citing issues with clarity and direction, and found the class structure, particularly the heavy reliance on midterms and finals, challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Abdalkhani appears to have mixed reviews; while some students found him approachable, funny, and clear in his lectures, others struggled to follow his teaching style, found the class structure difficult, and performed better in recitations. Overall, his effectiveness as a lecturer varies significantly among students.

Ratings.comment: Pretty decent guy, all things considered. Seemed like he cared about teaching and his students. Gave lectures at a pace that I could follow and would stay after class to answer questions (even ~20 min after lecture ended), although obviously this may have been unique to our Math 1148 class specifically. Cracked a funny joke every now and then, too!

I hated this class. I gave up on the lectures as it was so hard to follow him. I really do not recommend this course. The class is midterm and final heavy and It makes it hard to learn with how the teaching is set up. It was hard to see anything or hear him in the lectures and he believes you need to teach yourself math and that he can't do it.

I gave up on attending this lecture. He seems like a nice guy, but I could not follow anything he taught. I did better just attending recitations and learning through the homework. If you can not learn things without a teacher- choose another professor. Attendance is not mandatory. There is a quiz every single week. Exams are weighted heavily.

He has no sense of direciton in his lectures.He writes random things on the chalk baord with no lesson plans. I tried my very best to pay attention but genuiley couldn't follow along. After the first midterm,I started going to another lectuere,Tony Nance. I wouldnt have passed without him. If you get this lectuer  switch out or just go to another.
The instructor was very challenging and lazy don't take his class !!!

Overall very mid teacher. Not bad not great. Found myself getting lost in lectures because of lack of direction, but still did alright. Seemed to genuinely care about his students and made a few jokes that made lectures better.
I think he is really good at lectures and gives information clearly and explains things well. Grades very fairly and is very understanding. Really funny guy! Overall, a great teacher.

You think this would be an easy class because it's college algebra, but not with this professor. He bases most of your grade off exams. If you even get an 100 percent on hw, quizzes and attendance, it will do nothing. He is a horrible lecturer and only went through like one problem in class. Exams are nothing like the recitations. Don't recommend.

Lectures were on the chalkboard (no PowerPoint presentation, which is a plus) and easy to understand as long as you attend all lectures. Professor is hilarious and respected by his students. He will always help students or lecture extra topics after class. You are also given PowerPoints of each lecture and recordings of each recitation on Canvas.

His teaching style is difficult to adjust to since he uses primarily powerpoints but they are given to students outside of class and he was flexible in adjusting his teaching style when students asked to have him write on the board instead. he cares about his students and is very funny - class not mandatory but i dont recommend skipping often.

Very nice, but a horrible lecture professor. He just talks numbers at you on a slideshow/powerpoint instead of using the board and actually doing the problems so we can see where he got the answers. Very frustrating especially when students have given suggestions like using the board more, he just ignores us.

Okay so math is a subject that you need to write out on the board. Not literally talk numbers at us. He is a nice man but he does'nt write on the board. HE JUST TALKS WITH POWERPOINT SLIDES!!!! That is not how math works. SO I do not think he is fit if you're a visual learner. Good Luck!
The nicest professor I have ever had. He likes to joke and he told my lecture about how he was proud of us all which was honestly just so wholesome.

summary_comment: Professor Ferdinand is generally considered approachable and caring, but his lectures can be difficult to follow due to the rapid pace and complexity of the material covered in a short timeframe. Students find his explanations sometimes lacking, making it necessary to supplement learning with additional resources like textbooks and TAs. While some appreciate his intentions, many recommend seeking extra help and utilizing supplementary materials to succeed in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ferdinand is generally considered a nice person with good intentions, but his lectures can be confusing due to frequent mistakes and a focus on repetitive examples rather than comprehensive coverage of material. Students find his courses challenging without strong supplementary resources or a good teaching assistant.

Ratings.comment: Steer clear of courses taught by Victor if you can. I found him cryptic when asking questions, as he sometimes would just tell you to figure it out yourself when you asked him anything at all. Incredibly frustrating course, and a frustrating experience with him at the helm.

Taught things in a very random order, I never felt like I understood how the previous material connected and because of that I struggled. Random group projects at the end of the class that took so much time, but counted for very little of your grade. Took this class in AU2023 and I needed it to get into my major, but I wouldn't take again.

I feel as though I was teaching myself. The lectures were pointless, and I would not have attended if participation were not a part of the final grade. Save yourself the tears and take math 1126 at a community college.

He is caring and has good intentions, but I would get confused from his lectures because he messes up often and so having a good TA was helpful. I mostly taught myself the material. Tests were not bad, the review guides were super helpful. Overall he is fine but get help if needed and do the homework/reviews!

Vic was incredibly kind and caring when I had a personal emergency that caused me to miss over a week of class (the most accommodating instructor I had for sure), but his lectures are often long, over time, boring, and hard to follow. Homework/quizzes are graded harshly- it has to be worded exactly right or you lose points. Hope for a good TA.

I think that Vic is a nice guy & means well, but he often spends the entire lecture going over one basic problem over & over again. Weekly quizzes should be based on the homework from that week, but they almost never cover the same material & the homework isn't even graded before the quiz so we aren't sure if we did the problem right anyways.

Overall not a good prof. Vic seems nice, but he would rather tell bad jokes than actually teach you the material. If you don't have a good TA, the weekly quizzes will be hard. The exams will kill your grade if you have no background in calc. There's not even a point in going to lecture because he messes up the problems more than he gets them right.

Ferdinand is a nice guy who means well, but he's not that great at explaining the material. This could potentially be because this course covers a lot of material in one semester, so it's hard to thoroughly cover it all. I'm not a math brain, but I had a good TA and the textbook was very helpful. Do the recommended practice problems from the book!
Run away screaming.
He's literally terrible. He shows up late for class and doesn't even teach. He spent one class just talking about kool-aid. There's one homework assignment and one quiz once a week.

Math 1150/Precalc - skip lecture, go to recitation, do your homework and practice problems. I was blessed with an amazing TA (Greg LeVay) and he taught us the class basically. Vic is not a good lecturer, so skip lectures and just work on practice problems or homework.

Ferdinand doesn't really teach students the material. Even if you go to class, you don't really learn anything. This class takes things you know and makes you feel like you don't know them. In addition, if you have a bad TA it's a mess.

Vic is pretty nice but nice does not mean that he is a good professor He mostly relies on online videos that are posted by the math department which you can watch at home and teach yourself He also makes you do all the recitation worksheets by yourself and tries to glaze over the answers Do not recommend if you have not taken calc before
He often made mistakes in lecture, and a lot of students didn't attend the lectures because of that

Ferdinand is kind of bumbling and disorganized, gets on tangets and goes off topic. Makes a lot of dad jokes, literally always goes over class time. Says "here" and "there" a lot. Definitely see your TA!

Knows his stuff, but doesn't really know how to articulate it to students. Made easy simple problems super complex. After a while I stopped showing up to lectures because they were useless. Textbook, TAs and math learning center was much more helpful. Funny, quirky, nice guy though.

Seems like a nice enough guy, but made my pre-calculus experience harder than in needed to be. Often made mistakes in lecture. Knew what he was talking about, didn't know how to explain it to his students in a concise manner. Would not recommend.

Absolutely horrible. Makes terrible jokes, lectures never ends on time, and makes things a million time more confusing than they need to be. Took him 5 steps to show how to convert radians to degrees. Something simple, which he makes so difficult.
The course is hard.
He made mistakes in his lectures.
He often taught the questions wrongly in the lectures. I suppose the recitations by the TA are even more important and useful than the lectures.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Math for Middle School Teachers I

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Math for Middle School Teachers I

summary_comment: Professor Zhang appears to have low engagement in his classes, with students reporting that few pay attention and many fall asleep. Despite being in his second year at OSU, he seems to lack experience in classroom management and focuses heavily on RStudio, which is unnecessary for the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhang's teaching style appears to focus heavily on lecturing without much interaction, which may contribute to low student engagement. Students find his lectures monotonous and believe he may lack experience, as evidenced by frequent signs of disinterest such as students falling asleep during classes.

Ratings.comment: No one pays attention in the class, it seems like it's his second year teaching at OSU, maybe he is unexperienced. He just talks and points. I've taken SRM before (and failed) but I know for sure you don't need to know Rstudio, but he focuses on that. Litteraly saw a guy falling asleep like in a movie almost every class. He was the only available.

summary_comment: Professor Li is highly regarded for her extensive knowledge and patience, effectively explaining complex material and ensuring students understand the concepts. She maintains an organized and structured approach to teaching, providing thorough review sessions and clear lectures. Her commitment to student success is evident through her availability, quick responses to emails, and lenient grading policies.
summary_comment_short: Professor Li is highly knowledgeable and patient, ensuring thorough understanding through clear explanations and generous office hours. She maintains an organized and structured approach, providing ample practice and support, which contributes to students' success in the course.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Li is incredibly knowledgeable and patient with students. The grade is based on weekly homework, 3 midterm exams, and a final exam, and she always reviews before exams. She explains the material well and genuinely cares about students' understanding. She also answers emails quickly and extends office hours. Amazing professor for Diff Eq!

Very kind professor, extremely organized. Everything was thoroughly planned and lectures always made sense and were very clear. Numerous midterms and weekly graded homework gave a nice cushion. Good review guides provided. Really good for OSU math.

Very compassionate professor and a good lecturer. She remembers names, has prizes for participation, always stays after class to answer questions, and answers emails quickly. Only 1 homework assignment a week and the 3 lowest scores are dropped. Very lenient grader. I would recommend anyone who is interested in taking MATH 2415 to take her class.
Very nice teacher, patiently answer all the questions after class.

summary_comment: Professor Rudman is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and expertise in mathematics. Students consistently praise her ability to make complex concepts accessible and engaging, her responsiveness to emails, and her memorable personal touch, such as learning students' names in large lecture halls. Her teaching methods, including the use of an inverted classroom approach, are credited with enhancing student understanding and enjoyment of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rudman is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and deep expertise in mathematics. Students consistently praise her for her caring nature, ability to explain complex concepts clearly, and commitment to helping students succeed, often noting her prompt responses to emails and her memorable personal touch, such as learning students' names in large lecture halls.

Ratings.comment: I learned so much from this processor and I would 100% take another math course with her. She is an expert in her field as well as a gifted teacher.
she was amazing!!! i actually took math 1116, but she was so helpful and kind and funny. i would take any of her classes; she's just so good!!!!!

She was by far the best professor i've had at Ohio State, she was very caring about all of her students and would always respond to her emails within an hour or two. What really stood out to me was that she knew every persons name in my lecture hall which was very unique of any lecture i've had. I would recommend going to office hours often.

Never have I ever in any school had such a good professor that cared so much about her students. She is funny and responds to emails immediately, weekdays or weekends. She has no problem spending extra time of her own to meet up with students to help or go over things. She honestly carried the difficult class and made it enjoyable.

She is honestly one of the best professors here. She understands these are hard concepts, and not everyone understands them right away. What impressed me is that she remembers her students' names. Her lectures really help and she's fun! Don't be afraid to ask her questions, even by email, she will help you to make sure you understand.

Marvelous! The BEST math instructor I've ever had. The inverted classroom approach enables you to go at your own pace and ask questions during class with crystal-clear explanations from Dr. Rudman! She will respond to e-mails at pretty much any time seemingly, even late at night. Incredible.
She is an absolute gem! makes sure everyone truly understands the concepts and memorizes everyone's name, even in a 200 person lecture hall.

Amazing professor! You can tell she really cares about her students. She made Calc 3 feel easy because of how well she taught it. She is always willing to talk and help if you need it. 10/10 best professor I have ever had.
Fantastic professor. I would absolutely recommend taking her class.

okay so this was for trig math 1149 but it didnt give me that option to select. but she was amazing!!!! she really takes her time and cares for students. Her exams are exactly what she says they are going to be. No sneaky tricks and she helps outside of class. She has a great caring side about her. just 10/10

Best professor I've had at OSU, I cannot recommend her enough! Great person, funny, and care so much for her students. Lectures were well organized, easy to understand, and had lots of good examples. Weekly homework was sometimes tedious, but prepares you extremely well for midterms and the final (which were always straightforward).

Professor Rudman is literally the best professor I've ever had (and probably ever will have). Calc III is certainly not an easy class, but she explains the material extremely well. She cares so much about teaching and makes sure every single person understands the content. I really hope OSU hires her after her Ross contract ends in a few years.

I wish I could have her for every math class! she makes sure she is teaching everything the best way she can/genuinely wants us to understand everything. The homework wasn't the easiest but over-prepared us for the tests. If you go to the lectures you don't really have to do much outside studying because they're similar to the in-class examples.

The best math instructor I've had. Always willing to help outside of class, phenomenal lectures with great explanations. Homework was fair (if not time consuming), and exams were straight forward and fair. No tricks in this class - you come to class, you do the homework, and you ask questions when you don't understand, you get an A. Take her class!
One of the best professors I've had at OSU and definitely the best I've had in the math department!

Dr. Rudman is an amazing professor and a really nice lady. She really cares about her students. Attendance is not mandatory, but her lectures make subjects easy to understand and are worth it. She interacts with her class and is always available for extra help. There is one homework each week that is pretty long, but the tests are much easier.
One of the best professors in the math department at OSU. Homework is hard but you are allowed wolfram. Exams are straightforward. honestly learned a lot from her and her teaching style.

Could not imagine a better math professor. Interesting lectures, goes out of her way to answer questions thoroughly, and makes sure you never feel stupid for asking a question. Always taught in a way that just clicked. Exams never had unexpected questions or tried to trick you. Cannot recommend enough.
She's one of the best, if not the best professors in the Math department. She's the angel of Math

Legit the best math prof at OSU. AMAZING lectures, makes the content easy to understand and enjoyable. Tests were very straightforward, not trying to trick you or anything. A lot of homework but you get unlimited attempts so its not too bad. Highly recommend her for calc 3!

summary_comment: Professor Cueto is known for her rigorous and challenging teaching style, which some students find rewarding in terms of learning depth but others find overwhelming due to her strict grading and lack of additional support materials. While she is generally considered approachable outside of class, her teaching methods and exams are often described as demanding, with a focus on theoretical understanding rather than practical application. Students recommend putting in significant effort, especially through self-study and thorough textbook review, to succeed in her courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cueto is known for her rigorous teaching style and high expectations, which challenge students to excel but can also be daunting. While some students appreciate her dedication and the depth of knowledge she imparts, others find her exams and grading to be harsh, and she often receives criticism for her limited accessibility outside of class and office hours.

Ratings.comment: Not accessible outside of class and office hours AT ALL. Her exams are harshly graded, homeworks are fine but long and tedious. She's very old fashioned and doesn't provide practice exams or study guides or allow cheat sheets. She's a bit intimidating but is nice if you try and ask questions. She could have done more for her students though

Although this was one of the most difficult courses I have taken, I feel like I learned a lot about both Algebra as well as being a better mathematician. Dr. Cueto is a fantastic professor and cares about how her students perform. It is because of this the course was challenging, however if you put in the effort you will do well in the course.

this is your sign if you are reading this to not take this professor. I have gotten an A in every single math class I have taken until I took 3345 with her and failed. She is the most harsh grader I have ever seen and is rude. If you show up to office hours/ask questions she acts mad. She will give you a 0 on an exam question if you miss 1 part.

This course was challenging, but the tests were not too hard. The lectures focus on the theory instead of practice questions. something I dont like: 50% of the final is series (23AU), but the series was only 2/13 of everything we learned. (2) We do not have enough time to review for tests; the Instructor didn't pay much attention on review sections

Avoid at all costs. I already took the equivilant of 1181H and she still manages to make the easiest concepts incredibly difficult to understand. If you take her class get ready for math with no numbers and only letters. Tells us tests will be easier than practice tests but they're actually way harder. Very inaccessible outside class.

Tough but doable. First suggestion- READ THE BOOK. Her lectures are extremely hard to follow at times (not always), but the book covers everything you need to know. If you study the book very thoroughly, you'll be good.  3 exams, 4 quizzes, weekly homework. She gives optional homework questions too- do those when you have the time, or to review.

I absolutely loved having Professor Cueto this semester. Her class was tough -- probably the toughest I have ever taken. However, if you put in the work, you get so much out of it. She really inspires the whole class to love calculus and understand the underlying concepts. Exams were hard and make up most of your grade, though. Would recommend.

Cueto Is a nice person out of class. Her teaching style though seems to lack when it comes to an introductory class. Sometimes lectures are helpful sometimes not. The textbook is a brick wall and the proof she does is not related to the homework/test itself, except for specific types of problems. Self-study and try to work more efficiently in math.

Prof. Cueto was unapproachable. She was clearly annoyed when you asked questions in class. Her exams are unnecessarily difficult. If she is teaching this class, just pass out of it with the qualifying test instead because you will have a terrible time in her class.

Professor Cueto is a really nice professor. Her lectures were decent and the midterms weren't hard at all but for the final it felt like she shot a death cannon at everyone. Averages were an 85% and then the final average was like a 60. Read the textbook along with her lectures and the class is not bad

I found her to be intimidating and difficult to approach. I was afraid to ask questions because I felt that she was being judgmental. If I take another class I'll tale my chances with a different prof

Prof Cueto is very willing to meet with you. She is very understanding about extensions and stuff like that, just make sure to show her that you are putting effort in. Her lectures are very close to the book, but she does a good job illustrating theorems. There's a reasonable amount of homework due about once a week. Overall, great prof!

Overall she was a very forgiving grader on both the homework and the exams. She wanted the whole class to succeed and do well. The first exam was a lil rough, but all the ones after were not hard. She adapted to the classes abilities and the class as a whole was successful.

She is very lecture heavy and I do not find her lectures to be very helpful.  The homework is optional, but to do well you really have to do it.  She provides very few examples (and even the examples seemed pretty abstract to me).  She says the tests are easy, but I did not think so.

Cueto is willing to meet outside of class to answer questions. Teaching is heavily based in theory with few examples (in recitation challenging examples). I had to read and re-read the text to understand. TONS Of HW and tests are challenging and too long.  Noticed several errors in her online keys. I'd avoid.  My class ended up with a big curve.
You have to be the next einstein to get an A in her class

Prof Cueto is one of the most confusing professors I've had to date. She only teaches conceptual ideas and never does numerical problems. If you ask a question in class she talks down to you and never fully explains the topic. Her exams are very difficult and she assigns very long homework assignments. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS.

Wow this class was awful. she's so robotic when teaching, you can tell she's taking phrases right from the book and she never does examples so you learn nothing in lecture. She also talks to students like they are dumb when they ask questions. Try and avoid having her as your teacher.

Try your best to avoid this professor you will not learn majority of the material because you will be overwhelmed with the way she tries to explain the materials and the amount of homework she assigns

If you have to take this class, i would recommend taking it with another professor. Her lectures are very long and confusing and she doesn't give a lot of examples. I didn't really understand the topics until i did the homework. The homework is also pretty long , and took (at least for me) a long time to complete.
Makes the class way harder than it needs to be. Do yourself a favor and take any other section of calculus 3.
she use course percentage to determine your final grade.. tough grader
She has long pointless lectures and shows mostly proofs which dont really help me. said the tests weren't hard but she was clearly lying cause I failed the first exam...

summary_comment: Professor Castillo is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and kindness. Students consistently praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly, making him an invaluable resource, especially for those struggling with the subject. He goes above and beyond to support his students, offering additional office hours and ensuring their success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Castillo is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and kindness, with students consistently praising his ability to make complex concepts accessible. He goes above and beyond to support his students, offering additional office hours and ensuring their success.

Ratings.comment: This man is a gem of a human being. Only class where I've never missed a lecture.

I've always struggled with math but he was very good at getting the point across and helping me understand. Attending class isn't really mandatory, but you should definitely go if you struggle with math. Don't buy the textbook if you don't plan on doing the problems for extra practice, it's a waste of money. If you have the chance, 100% get Andrew
Super kind and helpful makes sure you succeed
Fantastic TA, is always willing to help. He was always willing to help during office hours, even made more office hours for us. Really Cares about his students.
Andrew is a very helpful professor, fair grader, and always is looking out for his students.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Math for Middle School Teachers II

summary_comment: Professor Young is highly regarded for his dedication to student success and clear communication, though his teaching style can vary. Some students find him engaging and supportive, while others describe him as sarcastic and challenging. Overall, Professor Young is seen as a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who provides ample resources and opportunities for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Young is highly regarded for his dedication and effectiveness as a teacher, with many students praising his care for student success and his willingness to help. However, some find his teaching style challenging, noting that while he is knowledgeable and clear in his lectures, the material can be tough, especially without prior preparation.

Ratings.comment: Professor Young was an amazing professor. He is such a great teacher. He really cares about students and he wants everyone to succeed. I recommend everyone take this course! Great guy!!

He was very sarcastic and kinda cold. Seemed not to really care, very much a smart-ass. I already knew most of the material from high school as this class was precalculus so I had an A the entire time up until the final which was ridiculous! He gave quizzes every Friday that were open note and the exams he allowed a cheat sheet on. he was ok
Easy A. Show up, take a short quiz at the end of class over what you learned that day, get out early.

Easy professor. There are 3 tests and a final. He gives you practice exams before every test that are VERY similar to the actual test. He is boring, but he wants everyone to succeed. He is very helpful. Do the practice problems from the textbook over and over and you will be fine.
Great professor, the class is just tough. Knows what he's talking about and is willing to explain in depth. There are good math teachers and bad ones. He's a good one.
Quirky and funny, and a clear, concise lecturer. Good instructor.

Communicates very clearly in lectures. However he's a southpaw that uses an overhead projector, and often smears his handwriting. Note taking can be difficult, but he recognizes his problem and post all his notes online. He's also very good about responding to emails and the 5% curve he gives at the end of the quarter provides a nice boost.

He likes to go into the theory behind the math towards the end but tries to fit examples into his lectures.  He's a very nice and patient guy who you can approach with questions. He grades reasonably and fairly and he does have a sense of humor. Nicest prof teaching the 254 course.
Very good professor, just the right balance between depth and clarity.
Awesome teacher, very helpful. If you have any questions GO TO OFFICE HOURS!! def recommend!

Prof Young is quite a great teacher. He is very personable and will help with homework before lecturing in front of the entire class. He often makes jokes which makes class tolerable especially through winter quarter. I enjoyed having him as a teacher.
Great professor! Very easy to understand. If you have the opportunity take his class. You won't regret it.
Great teacher. Worked many example problems to go along with his notes - following the notes made tests and homework easy. Easy for even those that dont like math.
A nice, middle aged guy who cracks jokes and generally enjoys teaching. Notes were just copies of text book definitions which made it difficult to grasp what was going on.
Extremely helpful and an excellent math teacher. Perfect for someone who hates math or struggles with it.

summary_comment: Professor Gogolyev is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at Ohio State, known for his clarity and precision in explaining complex material, particularly in linear algebra and ODEs. His lectures are well-articulated, supported by helpful diagrams and meaningful examples, and he offers substantial extra credit opportunities through challenging homework assignments. Students find his exams and homework fair and appreciate his approachability, though some note he may become slightly annoyed with tardiness or phone use in class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gogolyev is highly regarded as one of the best professors at Ohio State, known for his clear explanations, helpful diagrams, and meaningful examples. Students appreciate his fairness in exams and homework, though some note he may become slightly annoyed with tardiness or phone usage in class.

Ratings.comment: Definitely the best professor I've ever had in my life!

This class was really hard online, but there was so much extra credit. Every homework assignment had extra credit questions, which eventually got extremely difficult, but definitely made you learn a lot. Dr. Gogolyev gives really great lectures. We spend most of our time on linear algebra, and finished with ODEs. Tests and quizzes are fair.

He is the best I've had at Ohio State. He articulates material clearly, his diagrams are always helpful, his examples are always meaningful. Exams and homework are fair. I would take him again given the chance. He will get a little annoyed if you're a few minutes late or you use your phone in class. But if that doesn't bother you then he's amazing.
He is very good. Makes everything clear and easy.
Prof Gogolyev is the best professor I've had at OSU and I would love to take another class of his in the future. Very clear and precise despite the content of the course being very difficult.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Honors Linear Algebra and Differential Equations

summary_comment: Professor Guan is known for delivering challenging content, though his lectures are often criticized for being unclear and unhelpful. Students find his tests difficult and feel they do not always reflect the material covered in homework. While some appreciate his patience during office hours, many advise against choosing him due to his poor teaching methods and lack of effective feedback.
summary_comment_short: Professor Guan is known for his challenging course content and unhelpful teaching methods, often criticized for unclear lectures and lack of feedback. Students generally find his exams difficult and not reflective of the homework, leading many to advise self-study over attending his classes.

Ratings.comment: It cannot be denied that the content of this course is extremely difficult for me. However, he is very patient and kind to students, and it is helpful to attend his office hour.

Extremely difficult test and little feedback. Graded 1-2 homework problems per set. Tests were based more on fast computations than on understanding the material. If you can integrate by parts fast, you will succeed. If not, good luck. Tests were based on homework, just too much material to finish. I feel my grade didnt match understanding. Avoid.
The worst professor I had met in my 4 years of university life. If you want to get a high GPA, DO NOT CHOOSE THIS PROFESSOR! NEVER!

His lectures were worthless, we never got feedback on any tests or quizzes, and the class was horribly disorganized. There was a huge lack of leadership in the classroom and his grading is obscure. Assuredly the worst professor that I have ever had. Just get ready to teach yourself through reading, youtube, and the book. Doesn't respond to emails!

The material in this class is hard but the professor makes it much harder than it needs to be. He gets frustrated when you ask questions and doesn't give practice exams for review. He doesn't give any homework solutions or feedback so it's hard to check your work. My advice is to get ready to spend hours teaching yourself

He does a good job explaining things on average. Sometimes he'll write something wrong like a 0 instead of a 1 or miss a negative sign but if you say something he'll change it. The exams are on par with the homeworks so if you do the homeworks and understand them you'll be good.

The worst professor I have ever had. After the first lectures I stopped going and just read from the book. His lectures are horrible so I suggest skipping them. His midterms were easy, but the final was very difficult and did not reflect the midterms at all. Avoid this professor at all costs, probably the worst math professor at Ohio State.

Professor Guan reads right off of his very confusing slides. He's obviously smart but can not teach for his life. You will have to teach yourself everything from the book and online. I would avoid his class if possible. The quizzes/tests are harder than the homework and you are rushed to finish in time for basically every single one.

Avoid like the plague. Incoherent lectures reading off confusing slides that are hard to follow. Midterms were reasonable (if you're able to teach yourself the content), final was not. Linear algebra, Vector fields, and ODE chapters are easy to learn yourself, MV Calc chapter is challenging but manageable, good luck with the final PDE chapter.

Run for your life unless you're fully prepared to entirely teach yourself and hope you have a good TA. Useless professor. No feedback on anything. Extremely poor English, coming from someone who has extensive experience with non-native speakers. His lectures are incomprehensible with many errors on slides along w/ nodrop quizzes only in his section
Goooooood teacher

Can't stress enough: AVOID. Doesn't grade exams for 6+ weeks, doesn't explain material well and exams are not fair (gives a 3-4 hr exam in 2 hr). Was weeks ahead of the syllabus. Reach a point where the whole class is lost. Have 5% or less of the class at his lecture. Sporadically changes lecture times too. Homeworks can take a very long time too.

Very nice and wants to help, but lectures almost impossible to learn from. Only 10-15% of class still goes to them. Very theorem based, feels like I'm reading textbook. Doesn't follow syllabus (week ahead rn). I've taken material before but he's leaving me more confused than I was coming in. I'm usually an A student. Might be my first dropped class

Can't speak English to save his life. Lectures are disjointed and confusing. He'll often briefly touch on a topic, write a couple lines of notes on it, and then forget it and move to the next thing. Midterms are easy and do not at all represent the very difficult final exam. Did not curve at all, even with an appalling grade distribution. Avoid.

Dr guan was the worst teacher Ive ever had. He over explained the most elementary of concepts and it seemed like he didnt know what he was going half the time. Luckily his tests were easy enough where failing wasnt an issue. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

You pretty much just listen to somebody attempt to speak english during lectures. Totally incomprehensible. He didn't even provide a syllabus until the second week of class. Only two exams, so if you do poorly on one you dont have much of a chance to fix your grade. Skip class and go to MSLC+TA office hours and you should be okay.

Bo Guan seemed to be an intelligent person, but was definitely not a good professor. He had difficulty explaining even the most basic of concepts clearly. I made it through the entire class with only a very superficial understanding of the material at best.
awful. I got A because I never listen the lectures and study on my own

Prof. Guan was horrendous: -Incapable of explaining even the most basic concepts to the class -Genuinely 0 point in attending lecture I wish I had just used the hour I wasted during lecture to study the material on my own. Avoid this professor at all costs. I pretty easily received an A in 1151 and 1172. He made an easier class nigh on impossible.

Bo Guan crushed any passion for mathematics that was left in me. His explanation of even simple topics is confusing, and I usually left class understanding less than I had before. I stopped going halfway through the semester and was much better off. Thank god I had a good TA or I would have had to teach myself the entire course. Avoid at all costs.
Lectures are pointless, dude makes no sense and is unable to communicate any of the material.

Prof tried to help us. However, he was really unable to communicate any of the concepts in a way that I understood. 2162 is a hard class already because there is so much to cover. Prof is not helpful in class or office hours. I went to a different prof lecture. TA was awesome. I went to his office hours multiple times a week and it saved my grade.

Prof. Guan is probably the best Diff Eq teacher at Ohio State. His accent is not bad at all, and is not that hard to understand. His lectures are basically useless though, as he teaches by just doing examples on the board, but fails to actually teach you how to do them. Tests arent bad though, so take his class for the better grade.

Dr. Guan is clearly intelligent but his lectures are simply awful. He wastes a LOT of time on proofs that don't help you understand the material whatsoever. You will learn more by yourself from the book than you will in lecture. I  finished Accelerated calc 2&3 for honors engineers with him and just found I have him for ODE and PDE next semester.

One of the most confusing and incomprehensible teacher I've ever had. Along with his horrible accent, he's like teaching to himself rather than teaching to the students. Homeworks are really challenging. Attendance is mandatory even though you would not understand even half of what he talks about. Would not recommend.

Dr. Guan is knowledgable but he doesn't know how to make you understand. Many of my classmates had totally no idea how to solve homework after attending class. If you choose him, I would encourage you to study by yourself for this course.
Horrible accent, can't transfer knowledge from himself to you. Really smart man though.

Extremely smart man, however it is difficult for him to transfer the knowledge from his head to his students.  His accent is kind of hard to understand, homework is long and difficult, and you have to study and review a lot to understand what's going on. But his tests were fairly easy and he curved grades a lot in the end.

He was all right. Homework problems sometimes a bit crazy, but his midterms were always easier. Go through the problems quick on tests because he gives a great deal of partial credit. Spent a little too much time deriving some theorems in class, but the book assigned for the class (Asmar) is a very good supplement. Fair class, fair teacher.

Probably the worst professor I've ever had.  Can't keep notes straight, hard to understand, assigns ridiculous homework problems.  I dread every single morning I have this class, and it's sad because I actually wanted to learn this material.
not bad
nice guy, easy exams.

talks crazy during lecture, good luck keeping up with him...TA's are where you learn the formula's and tricks to do well in this class...best thing you can do is make sure you understand the homework b/c the tests are very similar...if you can get ahold of a past exam u'll be set for this class
His test are easy, if you fail this class you should commit suicide
If you are very good at teaching yourself material, the tests are exactly like the homework. If you understand what is going on you will be fine, if not... good luck.
No Comments
This dude is terrible at transfering knowledge from his head to yours. Very smart man, but not a good teacher in my opinion.

summary_comment: Professor Martinez-Soto is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts easy to understand and fostering a positive learning environment. Students consistently praise his passion, patience, and willingness to go above and beyond to help them succeed. His promotion was well-deserved, and many express sadness at his departure while eagerly wishing him well in his new role.
summary_comment_short: Professor Martinez-Soto is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts easy to understand and fostering a positive learning environment that students look forward to. His passion, dedication, and willingness to help students succeed have earned him consistent praise and high recommendations from his students.

Ratings.comment: I had him for recitation in MATH 1148 and WOW! Everything was explained to a point that was extremely easy to understand and every lecture I actually looked forward to going to because I knew I'd be learning so much. I was very sad that he had to leave due to a promotion, but excited for him! I HIGHLY recommend him and if you can take him DO IT!
He was smart, but kinda passive aggressive.

Eduan is a very passionate and caring TA. Had him for math 1148 last semester (before leaving) and was fortunate to learn so much regarding algebra and the math solving process. He makes math 1148 very easy to understand and works consistently to help his students succeed.

The best teacher Ive ever had. I was very upset when he had to leave, due to his promotion but it was most definitely deserved. He was understanding, compassionate and made 8am Calc somehow enjoyable. I looked forward to attending his recitations and hope he does well with his new job.

Best math instructor and mentor I've ever had. Eduan made calculus easy to understand. He just got promoted in the university, so he is done with teaching after this semester. I cannot thank Eduan enough. You have made a huge difference in our lives and how we think about mathematics.

Math isn't my thing. If I manage to pass it's because Eduan is the best TA of all time. Follow along on the OneDrive folder and go to office hours. He is very personable and willing to go above and beyond for his students.

Professor Martinez-Soto is very friendly, polite, and will go out of his way to help students succeed in math. Although this was an online summer course, I loved coming to class and interacting with Eduan. I will recommend him to every student that needs to complete this course or another math course for graduation.
Amazing Prof! 11/10 would recommend.

I had Eduan for recitation in spring 2021 and he helped a lot. Definitely going to his office hours will also help when you need that extra help or when you have questions that you dont want to ask infront of people or about about grades/assignments. He wanted to help to make sure that you understand the material!

THE BEST MATH TEACHER EVER! I am taking his class over the summer. Eduan is a great teacher and explains everything well. This class is so much easier than the teacher I had before! 1075 can be difficult if you don't pay attention, but if you go to class, pay attention, and do your HW you will easily get an A!

Professor Martinez-Soto is the best math instructor I have ever had! Eduan keeps his virtual sessions interesting and shows the application of mathematics in everyday life. I wasn't even assigned to his section but I attend every one.
He is nice, funny, talks a lot and makes it as easy for us to understand as possible! Really cares and wants us to succeed. Offers very open office hours and help before exams.

I love Eduan! He cares about his students and he is an excellent professor. It is truly refreshing to see somebody so excited about math (especially at 8:00AM) and that excitement spread onto me and my group members. I would definitely want him again as my professor for the future.

Professor Martinez-Soto is by far the best teacher I have ever learned math from; he offers multiple points of view for students to discover which methods are best for them for learning math. He is kind and understanding and is really interested in making sure his students succeed.
Eduan is the best math professor at tOSU. Period. He makes math so easy to understand.
Eduan is the best math Professor for any math course. He really loves teaching and explains everything as clear as possible. Legend.
Dope

I don't think I have met a professor who was as excited about teaching his students or caring about how well they performed as Eduan. His materials were always so organized and he also offered many resources outside of class to those students who needed it. Could not recommend a better professor for Math 1148! Top notch.

Eduan is really passionate about what he does. He creates a welcoming environment. His teaching is clear and in depth and he really takes the time to explain the whys behind the concepts. I wish that every professor was like him. He is truly a blessing, and this class has made me realize that I actually like doing math!!

Professor Martinez-Soto cares a lot, especially the students mental and physical health during this pandemic. He is a truly caring, well prepared, and effective instructor. When lectures were still in person he was an excellent instructor, and after all classes went online, that fact remained the same and he made the transition very smooth.

He's one of the best professors I've ever had! You can tell through his teaching and just getting to know him a little that he really cares about his students. He's super helpful in office hours and has even helped me later on when I wasn't even his class anymore (not to mention he remembered me from a 100+ person lecture from a whole year ago)

I cannot thank Eduan enough. He is not my professor, but I attend to his lectures and I understand better with him than my actual lecturer. He embodies everything a teacher should be (caring, patient, humble and wants you to succeed). He makes math so accessible and easy for the students. I love this man with all my heart.

He is absolutely the best. You can tell he loves what he does, and he knows that math is not for everyone. Very patient. He also teaches each topic as if you never heard of it. It helps you to have a better understanding of each topic.

E-D-U-A-N! Had him for MATH 1075. Had him for MATH 1148. I'm having him for MATH 1149 this semester. I refuse to take a math class he's not a lecturer or TA for. If you don't take him you're torturing yourself.
10/10 would recommend
Eduan is amazing with relating to his students, and identifying the proper ways to help his students understand math concepts. If there was a Hall of Fame wall for teachers please induct him.
Eduan is a 10/10 professor, knows what he is talking about and cares for his students!

I really enjoyed having Eduan as a professor. He was motivational and really cared for his students. Don't hesitate to reach out and go to his office hours. Go to the MSLC, you might see him there. He wants his students to succeed in his classes. I have taken a math class with him before and will take another again if he teaches math 1149.

I don't think any other instructor out there will be able to top him. His colored chalk and analogies are a big deal. Eduan always makes sure everyone in the classroom is on the same page. I was always excited to come to class because of how relaxed and fun the environment was. He is my all time favorite math teacher, and teacher overall.
I failed my first math course in freshman year and Eduan has helped bring back my interest in math. It truly was an honor having him as my instructor. Instructors need to take tips from him!

Eduan is AMAZING. I have never met a more passionate, devoted, and kind professor like him. He believes in you and he let you know. His lectures are very clear and effective. Straight to the point and his notes are organized (very). He does NOT want YOU to fail. He gets mad if you do not contact him for help.
I love Eduan. Had him for 1075 and now for 1148. He really makes me appreciate math in a way I've never have before. He is a role model for any student and instructor at OSU.
The Best College Math professor I have ever had.
Eduan is a legend. I greatly appreciated his class and his effort over the summer. Thank you for actually caring if your students understand the material or not and working as hard as you do!
EDUAN! Man that guy is something else! I wouldn't want to have anyone else to teach me math! Really knows how to teach and make sense of difficult material. Very humble and positive!

Love Eduan!! He is really inspiring and encouraging, which helps a lot when I don't have the motivation to continue working hard after breaks. In addition, he also encourages students to come to his office hours and ask him questions, which makes it less intimidating when asking him questions. See you in MATH 1148!!

Eduan is great at making math less painful and he encourages you to not give up no matter what you get in one test. This type of encouragement is truly a blessing to get because in college we think one bad grade is the end of the world, but he reminds me why I came to college in the first place. Wish you could be my math teacher next semester!
Eduan is the best math professor Ive ever had. Period. He is kind and always encourages us to share our ideas. So inspiring! Thank you for this great semester. See you in Math 1148! :)

I liked this course. It requires a lot of critical thinking and having Eduan as your instructor is a big plus. Eduan is genuinely one of the most compassionate, caring, patient, entertaining and helpful instructors I have ever had. He makes doing math at 8am not so bad. Attendance is required as part of your final grade.

Eduan is the best professor that I have ever had. He is so inspiring and I am motivated by his passion for math and for helping students not be afraid of math. He is completely dedicated to his students. The best ever!

Eduan is always there to help the students whenever they need him. I was always able to reach out to him whenever I needed help with math. I dont know if I will ever get a math professor as good as him. Coming as a freshman its really difficult to transition, however he made the learning environment comfortable and easier. Excellent math prof!
Legend.

Eduan makes every class feel comfortable and it feels like a great learning environment to be in. The feeling of disinterest and uncomfortable is never there. I would like to see him again as an instructor (but this is my last math course). Attendance is mandatory & asignments could be tedious (painful) but the expectations were clear since day #1.
Great teacher with excellent people & communication skills. Very down to Earth and will go out of his way to help you if need be.

One of the best math professors I've had. From his lectures, you can tell he is really passionate about helping students learn. Completely open to any questions you might have, and ensures you understand the material. I strongly recommend him!

Eduan is a professor that puts all of his time and effort into helping students understand that subject matter. I was irritated that I was required to take a math course, but he completely surprised me with his excitement to teach students. He is always excited to see us, definitely a one of a kind professor that the university is lucky to have.

The best! Eduan can tell when you are clearly confused and asks what is confusing you instead of just moving on and hoping you understand later. His class worksheets are very simplified but give good examples so you have amazing references to study about. Overall I think Eduan should be guidelines for any lecturer or recitation leader!!!

Eduan is possibly THE best Instructor Ohio State has to offer. He has an amazing personality and his lectures are upbeat and entertaining. I went to his office hours and he was so helpful. He genuinely cares about every student he has. I was lucky to have him as one of my first instructors and Im sad that no one can compare.

Eduan is easily the best math instructor I've had in either high school or college. He cares about his students on a personal level. I felt as though our recitation group became a small family. He begins teaching the content thoroughly as soon as class begins but also makes time for laughter. His story is inspirational and he is a great person.

Eduan is one of the most caring and passionate professors I have ever had. In the subject of math I usually have nothing but negatives things to say but Eduan truly has changed the way I looked at math over the course of the semester. One of my favorite professors of all time. Thank you for being such an inspirational and caring professor!

Eduan is the first teacher to ever effectively engage me in a math class. He kept an otherwise boring class interesting and allowed me to ask many questions. Despite this course doesnt have any extra credit assignment :@ Eduan motivates everyone to do well and to never give up. Super kind, patient and understanding person.

Eduan is an amazing lecturer. His colored markers are super helpful when understanding the processes. He always make sure to explain every step so each student understands. Youre very lucky if you have him!

Literally I learned more from him than from all my teachers in the past (all combined). Eduan has a busy schedule but he tries to make extra time for his students at office hours (and review sessions). LOVED HIS COLORED CHALK! He knows how to motivate his students. More teachers should be like him.

Eduan is a FANTASTIC professor and is always energetic and passionate about what he is teaching. He was the first math teacher Ive had that really made me understand things. He was meant to be a teacher. I wish I can have him for another course.
The best instructor Ive had throughout my time as a student. He makes lectures fun and entertaining. Eduan is always happy and excited to teach.
Eduan is and will be my favorite teacher at OSU. He makes math the simplest subject ever. I can't wait to have him as my teacher for Math 1131 next semester! :P

Professor Martinez-Soto is very funny and makes lecture relevant. I really enjoy his teaching style as he breaks down each problem and explains why something is the way it is. If you have the chance to take a class with him, do it! He is well organized and always encourages his students to learn and think.
Eduan is the real MVP for math 1130.

Eduan is a great professor. He talks really quickly, but his accent is easy to understand and his teaching is very clear. Honestly, I think I learned more from recitation just because it's a smaller environment, but Eduan's lectures were definitely useful as well. Despite teaching hundreds of students, I thought he was great!
I am not great at math, but I was able to get high grades in the class with Eduan's help. He explains the material so well plus he is patient and thorough. I am grateful I had him.

EDUAN IS THE BEST!!!! He is engaging and always has high energy. Eduan really is always willing to help and makes sure you know the material. And GO to his office hours!!!! I hope to GOD I get him in 1149. Such an amazing professor thank you for everything if I do not have you this semester!!!!

Eduan is my favorite TA ever...... like seriously... Wish I could have him as a lecturer for calc.. He is patient and very passionate about his job and helping students succeed. Super approachable and articulate with his teaching, never needed the textbook. Loved recitation honestly. Also, did I say he is great????

Eduan is a gifted instructor. He is engaging and always has high energy. Extremely patient and would go the extra mile to make people understand things. We need more professors like him. Thank you for everything!!

Eduan is and was by far the best TA I've ever had. Truly cares whether you're learning or not and sets you up for success. Very accessible outside of class. Make sure you attend all of the classes, or else he'll stop sending you his notes from the day. He scans his notes and emails them to you which is so helpful when it comes to studying.
Eduan is one of my favorite teachers at OSU. He truly cares about his students and is so passionate. Inspired me to work hard! Please continue using all the colored chalk and markers!!

Eduan is a great math teacher. He really cares about his students and does his best to keep everyone positive and motivated, as well as make lectures interesting. He's easily accessible outside of class and is always willing to help. I can't stress enough how great of an instructor he is. If you have the chance to take a class with him do it!

Eduan is the best math teacher I have ever had in my entire life. He definitely cares about his students success and is extremely interesting. I love his motivational speeches! Really grateful to have had the honor of meeting him and having him as my instructor. No one like him (OSU needs to clone Eduan)!

Eduan saved my Calculus grade! I had him as a recitation TA for Calc and he is very supportive, easy to contact, and always fields students' questions. He really cares for each student, and encourages each student to try their best and succeed! Attendance is mandatory or else he will not share his class notes, but attending is very beneficial!

Professor Martinez-Soto is very enthusiastic about the course and teaching itself. He is very personable and makes learning boring subjects fun. I feel like I actually learned a lot and feel prepared for math 1149 and math 1151. Very engaging instructor plus gives good life lessons!

Eduan was an amazing professor. He has very organized and understandable notes. He is great at explaining even some of the hardest calculus concepts. I really believe that he is the main reason I was able to survive calculus and receive a good grade in the course! I would highly recommend him if you have the chance!

Eduan is a really good professor. He is well organized in his notes and truly wants his students to succeed. The only thing I would say is DO NOT get the textbook. Just don't do it, you will literally never use it. Also, do the practice exams, they really help. Overall, I recommend him especially for Math 1148.

Eduan is the best. He has been covering my lecturer for the past 8 weeks and helped me understand math MUCH BETTER in a week than my actual lecturer has done all semester. He uses lots of colors when he writes on the projector which makes it easy to learn. My official lecturer is back and Eduan is no longer teaching our class. PLEASE COME BACK!!

Eduan is a wonderful Professor. He is deeply passionate about math, and it shows as he teaches. His teaching style is clear, consistent, and organized. He always tries to tie in real life with the mathematics he teaches because he stresses the importance of math. Eduan is the best math teacher I've ever had, and I can't recommend him anymore!

Amazing instructor! If not for him I believe many students would not have done nearly as well as they did. He's very kind and humorous. I love going to his class because he creates such a positive atmosphere. Eduan deserves all the praise for his students' success!

Eduan is incredible. His lectures are so organized and clear-cut that he's pretty much impossible not to like. He gives you exactly the info you need, and is accessible if you ever need help. I have always hated math but he is legitimately the best math teacher I've ever had.

Eduan made this class incredibly easy to understand. He makes calculus much simpler to learn. I switched to his class because I heard good things about his teaching style and personality. He has exceeded my expectations in a 100%. One of the best instructors I ever had!
Great!

Anyone that was lucky to have Eduan as an instructor would agree that he genuinely cares about the students. He creates a positive learning environment. Ive had to take over Math 1050 once and Math 1075 twice. I am passing this class, Math 1148, and I am learning a lot, because of his good teaching! Best instructor I have had in math at OSU!

summary_comment: Professor Terman is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students citing her difficult-to-understand lectures, unclear explanations, and inability to effectively address student questions. Her teaching methods have been described as confusing and ineffective, leading many to advise avoiding her classes altogether. Students also report issues with technical difficulties and a generally negative classroom environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Terman is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students citing her difficult-to-understand lectures, ineffective explanations, and technical issues. Many students also report feeling confused and unprepared for exams, with some noting that she is rude and dismissive when questions are asked in class.

Ratings.comment: Run away if she is your TA. I had her and Sherry for 1148 and it was a chaotic horror show. She is a nice lady, but very hard to understand and not good at explaining anything.

IF YOU HAVE EFFAT SWITCH TAS NOWWW!!!! Sherry, the lecturer would rely on her TAs and Effat never even learned how to share her screen so we would sit and watch her not understand technology for an hour twice a week. (today was the last day of class and she still hasnt learned). If you get stuck with her you can switch. If you dont switch goodluck.

Effat Terman was my TA. She is hard to understand and makes the content even more confusing than it already was. The recitations aren't mandatory, just the discussion board posts. Skip the recitations and use the example problems in the homework instead, they're actually helpful.

She literally does math incorrectly and needs to be corrected. I attend class and get more confused than if I just try to learn myself. If it wasnt for my TA I would not know a single thing. She does not put anything online. If you try to ask questions in class shes rude and talks down on you. Would not recommend taking her class.
Hard to understand. Refused to grant accommodations.

Lectures are terrible, speeds through material and doesn't always know how to answer questions. She randomly takes attendance in lecture for a grade and makes the material much harder than it needs to be. She doesn't lecture for success on the exams. A lot of times she would start class before it was actually time too. AVOID IF AT ALL POSSIBLE

Worst professor ive had at osu so far. Strong accent makes lectures impossible to understand on top of bad teaching makes the class way harder than it needs to be. Doesnt answer questions clearly. Do not recommend taking any of her classes.

She is a really bad professor all around. Would not recommend taking her class, she is always putting down the wrong answer or debating with students about what is correct vs what is not. She does not follow her own notes, and she consistently has technological problems. Seriously, 0/10

She was difficult to understand in lecture and would mistaken one concept for another so following her examples was tricky. However, she does a good job staying true to the textbook and having review sessions before exams that ask similar questions and concepts that you will need to know. She also wants to help students, so go to office hours!

She's a nice gal, but she is very difficult to understand to the point where lectures were useless for me. Ended up not going to lecture after the 2nd or 3rd week, thankfully the midterms and finals aren't difficult so you can learn from the book/recitation. Not the end of the world if you she's teaching your course, but don't bother with lecture.

I could barely understand her most days and it made it very difficult to understand what was happening. I had to take advantage of the tutors because I was not able to learn from her because her lectures were't very helpful.

I had trouble learning with this instructor. Had her for both MATH 1148 and 1149. For 1149 I just started skipping classes and self teaching from YouTube and the book. Stay away if possible. She is a nice lady, just not the best math instructor. I have always enjoyed math and been good at it.

YOU CANNOT UNDERSTAND THIS WOMAN. She is a nice person but you will not understand what is going on in class. Her notes make no sense and how she solves problems is more difficult than it has to be. STAY AWAY.

Absolutely useless and terrible. She is friendly but completely and utterly useless. Have I mentioned she's useless? She is so hard to understand and does problems in ways that are so uncommon. Makes everything harder than it needs to be. TRANSFER out while you still can!!!!

The worst teacher I think I have ever had. Luckily the class is pretty easy, but she has a terrible accent and does not know how to use the equipment for the projector. My TA was decent so he was able to help me get my A in the class, but I would still AVOID her at all costs.

Effat seems to be a very nice lady, but is an awful teacher. She has a thick accent and is very hard to understand. She also skips crucial steps in problems and does not have neat handwriting. She makes a lot of mistakes and gets offended when people correct her. She is by far the worst lecturer I have ever had, and I highly recommend changing.

Effat is very hard to understand and is a poor grader. 1149 however, is not a very hard class and the tests are partially multiple choice. She only knows her way and will not understand if you try any other way. Lecture is optional, but can be helpful at times. Overall, shes mediocre at best.
can't understand her, she laughs when we failed, no curve, almost the whole class has dropped, she skips steps and is really hard to follow. TAs for this class aren't to great either.

She moves too fast, skips over steps because she thinks we should all be math whizes, and when people try to ask questions she makes fun of them or gets frustrated and can't answer because she doesn't understand the question. She mumbles and has a thick accent.

I got an A in the class - but I give all the credit to my TA, who was really on top of things. Prof. Terman was very difficult to follow, she made a lot of mistakes and could not understand the overhead projector - we had 3 classes of just sitting there while she called people to fix her projector for her.

We began the class with a full birth of students. I stayed in the class for 2 weeks and never understood a single word from this professor... Tried sitting at front and went to every recitation.  NEVER register for a class with her again!

Everyone puts Prof Terman down, but I thought she was okay. Very nice & light hearted, really interested in teaching. She is somewhat difficult to understand, but if you at least sit in the front 5 or so rows & pay attention, you'll understand her just fine. Also a good recitation TA is helpful. Just go to class, pay attention, do homework, easy A.

She has a very thick accent, and she speaks quietly, so it's very difficult to hear and understand her.  She also uses an overhead projector..Her handwriting is sometimes hard to read, and she sometimes doesn't write down the important steps for a problem.  If you have Effat for lecture, you better hope to have a good ta for recitation.
Fairly intelligent, but extremely hard to understand. She has a very thick accent and speaks with somewhat broken english.

Effat should just...not teach Math 150.  She has an accent that makes it very hard to understand what she says.  Shes a nice lady and all, just a horrible teacher.  She confuses herself on the problems she puts on the overhead (in red marker) and often dosnt finish.  Basically, teach yourself out of the book, or go to your TA... Effats pretty bad.
She's a nice woman and knows her material but can be extremely difficult to understand. Her accent is heavy but you get used to it, her explanations of problems can get confusing though.

She is the sweetest lady, but is very hard to understand. Often rambles on about easy problems, but skips over hard ones b/c she confuses herself while trying to explain them & leaves it with the wrong answer. If someone asks her a question she gets irritated and feels everyone is attacking her or saying shes wrong. She's an awesome person though!
Very nice and sweet person. Professional. There are better lecturers for this class though, some of her explations can be confusing.

SHE IS THE WORST LECTURER I HAVE EVER HAD! He voice makes me want to punch puppies!! (and I want to be a veteranarian). She screws up problems in class ALL THE TIME! She still uses overhead projectors, and writes in red pen!!! By the middle of the quarter I stopped going to her lectures, they were worthless and so is she. (This is not too mean)

She is a very kind and nice women, as a person I loved her. EXCEPT that she is my professor, and I find it VERY difficult to understand her. Not to mention she always messes up problems in lecture and won't finish problems/skips critical parts of problems. I had a death in my family a day prior to my midterm and she wouldn't let me reschedule/retak

i loveddddd effat!!! she is such a good reacher!!! this was the easiest class i have ever taken. effat really really wants you to do well. she often gives you test questions. lets you retake quizzes if you get a bad grade and lets you ask questions during exams!!! CHOOSE HER NIGHT CLASS!!
Terrible Teacher. Extremely difficult to understand. Nice lady, however, doesn't help you understand her more. Recitation teacher saved me!

She is har to understand. Often made mistakes during lecture. She has different ways of explaining something in English... She is use to saying "2+2 comes by 4" When she means "2+2 equals 4". Gets confusing. She does ramble sometimes and will skip over some critical points in a problem and then you get lost. Pick a different lecturer.

Has an accent, but still understandable. Very friendly. I went to her office hours almost weekly, and she's very helpful. The textbook is horrible, but the lectures made it understandable. I didn't read the textbook at all, except for homework problems. Gave a very nice curve at the end. I got an A for the course.

I really liked Effat. She was always enthusiastic and even though it was hard to understand her she taught the material well. She gave a lot of good examples that were on quizzes and exams, so make sure you at least got to review lectures.
Not a good teacher. Doesn't not speak clear English and doesn't help at all. the recitation teacher will help you alot more
You will learn more from your book and in recitation than in her lecture.
I'm not generally good at math but this class wasn't hard at all. I do recommend going to lecture even though the prof is very hard to understand because of her accent.

I absolutely loved her!  Yes her accent is strong, but that's what makes her great.  She's been in the U.S. for over 30 years and that is just a part of her.  Math at OSU is generally challenging to begin with.  I took her last year and she was very helpful in office hours and lecture, and yes she makes jokes, but you have to love her personality!
I thought she was very fun, but never took attendance. I always thought it was really warm in her room. The midterms were not awful either!
her accent gets in the way of her teaching a lot, and she rambles off into jokes that you can't understand while teaching a lesson. I was lucky enough to get a really good TA. "Chris your my boy!!!
she is very hard to understand and gets easily confused. the tests are very fair but they take off points for EVERY mistake you make. TA's are nice and more helpful than the lecuturer
She's....hm    haha...i don't know, shes fine i guess.
she is a very good math prof and you can tell she loves teaching it....she does a really good job making it easy to understand.
cant understand her accent.  she confuses the class when she lectures for too long.  easy class if you just read the book and go to recitation.
She speaks brokem english

Her accent is hard to understand at times and sometimes I wonder if she knows what she's talking about.  She went through a whole lecture saying that the square root of -1 is 1 then had to go back through all the problems to correct them.

summary_comment: Professor Rao is widely regarded as having poor teaching clarity and effectiveness, making it difficult for students to follow his lectures and learn the material. Students find his explanations confusing and often feel compelled to teach themselves the subject matter. Due to his high expectations and lack of supportive teaching methods, many advise against taking his class unless one is already proficient in mathematics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rao's teaching method is often criticized for its lack of clarity and effectiveness, with students finding his lectures difficult to follow and unhelpful for learning calculus. Many students recommend avoiding his class unless they are already proficient in mathematics, as he does not provide sufficient guidance or explanation for problem-solving.

Ratings.comment: I had to teach myself calculus. Mr. Rao doesn't provide information in a clear or thought-out way. The lectures he gives hardly make sense and the information is not properly explained. This class is a waste of money because you will have to teach yourself. Don't take this class with him, there are much better professors on this campus.
Really hard to understand (not his fault) but gets frustrated easily when asked questions. Assumes we all know calculus like him even though most people had never taken it before.

Do not take this class if you are not already good at math or have not taken previous calculus classes. I struggle with math and Prof. Rao was the worst professor I have ever had. He doesn't teach you how to do the problems, he just does the problems on the board for you to watch and expects you to understand. I am a good student and I got a D.

summary_comment: Professor Mishra is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics easy to understand through simple explanations. Despite being new to teaching, he has proven to be highly effective, helping students grasp difficult concepts in Calculus with clarity and enthusiasm. His interactive approach ensures that students not only learn but also enjoy the process.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mishra excels in creating an engaging and supportive classroom environment, making complex topics accessible through humor and clear explanations. Despite being new to teaching, he has proven highly effective, enabling students to grasp difficult concepts with ease.

Ratings.comment: Mishra is that one college professor that is a close friend to you, makes you laugh in the class and makes sure that your doubts are cleared. He is hilarious and makes class very interactive and easy to understand. Explains everything in simple words and if you point out his mistake he will give a reaction that will surprise you.
