Even though the class was a total goof, he still really wanted to help us learn and understand the material.

Instructor Mishra is new to teaching. I learned more from him than the actual professor. If you need to take Calculus he is the one. The class is tough, but he breaks it down in a way that one will understand.

summary_comment: Professor Wagh is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching methods, making complex subjects accessible and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his passion, care, and willingness to help, often noting his availability for one-on-one assistance and his creative approach to teaching. His structured class format and engaging teaching style have earned him a reputation as one of the best instructors, with many students expressing enthusiasm about his future potential as a professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wagh is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching methods, making complex topics accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise his care, creativity, and willingness to help, often noting his positive impact on their understanding and enjoyment of mathematics.

Ratings.comment: Not sure if he works at UNF now but I took his STA2014 and I've done better than I have in past math classes (I'm bad at math). Posts video lectures and uses MyMathLab for HW and a test every couple weeks, that's all. Very caring and helpful and responds back to emails within a day or 2. Great professor I love the way his class is structured.

Teaches calculus like he's teaching the alphabet. By that I mean he makes the subject SO understandable. He's so excited to teach and is incredibly creative. Excellent instructor, by far the best teacher I have had at Ohio State or any school for that matter. Oh and he has a pretty amazing smile and cute laugh too. You will be lucky to have him.

Niraj is not only the BEST teacher I've ever had, but he is the MOST CARING and MAGNETIC person I've known.He is a scholar,utilizing different approaches for those who didn't 'get it'.His ability to teach far surpassed the ability of my lecturer,textbook,and youtube searches. He wants everyone to do well,and is the NICEST person you will EVER meet.

THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD. Seriously. I will talk this guy up to anyone I meet. I had him for both Math 1150 and math 1131. I heard he was a TA for 1131 and I switched my class schedule just to have him again. My friends loved him as well. He is going to make the best professor someday.

He made math fun and enjoyable. The only TA that made me want to go to recitation. He gives handouts and explains problems step by step. He sometimes gives treats and tells fun stories; he even dresses up! He is passionate when he teaches and is great with one-on-one help. I am so glad to have met him. BEST TA WITHOUT A  DOUBT!

Niraj is the best math TA I have ever had. He's the best TA I have ever had. He was MUCH better of a teacher than my actual math professor. I have never met a person more willing to help students. He makes himself available to students whenever they need help. He teaches so clearly and you can tell he really wants his students to get the concepts

summary_comment: Professor Ban is known for his clear lectures and detailed explanations of complex concepts, though some find his focus on certain topics can be excessive. He is highly regarded for his willingness to assist students both in and out of class and for his passion for the subject matter. However, his teaching style and pace may not suit all students, as some have struggled to keep up or find the material challenging without consistent attendance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ban is known for his clear lectures and willingness to help students, though some find his explanations can sometimes be overly detailed. He is highly regarded for preparing students effectively for actuarial exams and for his passion and dedication to teaching, though the class can be challenging and requires consistent attendance.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Ban is a good lecturer. He makes sure to enunciate clearly and spend a lot of time on difficult concepts. Sometimes its too long on a topic, but I didnt mind. He is always willing to work with students and help us out. Online exams were tricky due to multiple choice questions, but he gives partial credit if we sent him our work.

not too much homework & all the answers can be found online which is nice, he uses content from past actuarial exams so he is probably the best teacher in terms of getting you prepared for the exams, but if you are someone who asks a lot of questions I don't suggest him never understood my questions and was so frustrating that i dropped mid semest
Yeah, no, I hated this class so much. I couldn't understand him and did not do well on the exams even after hours of doing the practice exams/studying.
amazing teacher. curves a lot. he gives a lot examples on class and make it easier to understand and remember. exams are not that hard.
(Predictive Modeling) Class is unorganized but he's more concerned with you learning some concepts rather than tests.

GO TO CLASS. Nice guy. You will not pass this class if you skip. Class is "hard", but honestly there is no reason to not do well in the class if you try. Got a 63, 100, & 88 on the 3 exams, and ended with an A -, so there is a 5-6 pt curve. Majority of HW answers are online. If you want to do well on the tests, do the HW probs and Practice Test.

Dr. Ban was clearly very passionate about this material, and he would get so excited while teaching us. He is willing to help his students outside of class and really cares about his students doing well. Would definitely take his class again!

I loved having professor Ban! He was always really good at explaining the concepts & always takes the time to draw out a problem on the board and go through it slowly. He was also really good at answering my questions too. Whether in class or over email. And although he has an accent, I was always able to understand him very well. Highly recommend!

Dr. Ban is a really nice professor. He gets extremely excited when he is teaching and he is always smiling wide. He explains things in a manner that is really easy to understand. If you follow his lectures, its a sure A!

He kept explaining all the equations during classes. The exam was all right. 10-11 multiple choices. Not very hard but time consuming. No cheat-sheet, no bonus point. He is a good professor but didn't deliver a very good class.

This is a tough class, but he does a good job preparing you for the exams (midterms and FM). You have to take the time to do the homework and do more practice problems out of the book. If you take the time, you'll be able to pass FM easy. I passed on the first try during finals week in the same quarter that I took this class.

Don't spend much time worrying about this class. Its a great class to hear from actuaries in the field and get to do some "real" actuarial work, but the workload itself is minimal. Pretty much if you participate in your group and go to every class, you'll get an A. Make sure to do your part in the groupwork, because your group members grade you!

This class was hard. He didn't give us any practice problems for tests. Instead, he told us to go over all the problems in the book. His office hours weren't helpful at all. His homeworks and tests are from Exam FM solution manuals, so my advice would be to study as much of those as you can and just go over some concepts in the book.

I don't know why, but Dr. Ban just makes me laugh when he talks.  I think it's because of his accent.  The most annoying thing was when he wrote something on the board, then erased it and rewrote it differently.  I've never used my eraser more times in my life when taking notes.  The final was brutal but hey, all the actuarial exams are brutal.

Such a nice guy, but he's entirely useless during class. He spends forever on the easy stuff, often reiterating himself over and over, and then goes over hard concepts very quickly. Tests were difficult - multiple choice with no partial credit. Not impossible to get an A, but you definitely have to invest a lot of time. Plus, he's SO BORING!

He's a really nice guy and will do whatever he can to help you. But he teaches the easy stuff too slow and the hard stuff too quickly. He's really boring so it's either do your best to pay attention or read the book on your own.

class is very boring. homework is fairly easy, but the some test problems is hard. if you do a lot of FM manual problems，you should be fine with the test. the test setup is ridiculous, only have 8-10 multiple choice problems, no partial credits, all came from FM manual.want to get a A? no need to go to his class but study the FM manual well
Not so nice teacher but really a nice man. Is willing to help you and whole of the class with the grade. Tries to make sure that the class average is really high. (Don't sit on the front seat!)
He is great. really help-ful
good math teacher--granted math 130 is the easiest math course at OSU but he made sure there was no way anyone could be confused before he moved on.  weird accent though.
dont understand his accent

Dr. Ban is an exellent math teacher...he definately made math 152 a lot more easy.  go to lecture, you will definately learn and wont have to read your book at all.  and he gets really excited sometimes, so thats fun to watch.

Chengshung makes sure to explain everything to his students.  The exams for this class were taken from problems out of the book, and even if you didn't do the homework, the quizzes and midterms were not too hard.  He wants his students to actually learn the material, not just memorize things.

Dr. Ban makes integration alot easier than it could be. He really prepares you for the tests and is actually very interested in explaining things and making sure that you can follow every step. He's very into letting students ask questions and always willing to help. He's adorable too!

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Practicum in Actuarial and Quantitative Risk Management

summary_comment: Professor McNeal is highly regarded for his clear and accessible teaching style, making complex topics in complex analysis understandable through interactive discussions rather than traditional lectures. Students appreciate his willingness to elaborate and provide thorough explanations, though some find his classes demanding and require significant effort. Overall, he is seen as an excellent and dedicated instructor who focuses on student understanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor McNeal is highly regarded for his clear explanations and willingness to elaborate, making complex topics accessible. His teaching approach emphasizes deep understanding over rote memorization, and he is praised for his fairness and commitment to helping students succeed.

Ratings.comment: Instead of lectures, he had optional recitations where we'd come in with questions and discuss them in a seminar format. His explanations were clear and he was very willing to elaborate when we were confused. Despite the class being called "complex analysis", it was very easy to follow and understand. By far the best math professor I've had at OSU!

Jeff McNeal was the best professor I had during my undergraduate career at Ohio State.  On the first day of class, he summarized calculus in a way that made a year's worth of classes suddenly make sense.  And it just got better from there.

This class was actually pretty interesting. Dr. McNeal is obviously a genius, and obviously knows exactly what he's talking about, but nevertheless, it's a class that requires hard work. If you go to him for help, you'll get it. Study regardless of how confident you are in you're own ability for the class and you should do fine.

Very difficult class, but fair. I liked this professor plenty, but TOO MUCH material for one semester! Still, the stacking books example and french take on functions vs. graphs made this a mind-expanding (though GPA deflating) experience.
Cares about what you learn, not the math in front of it. Read the book before going to class. Quite difficult class.

He is more concerned that you understand what is actually being calculated than doing the actual calculations themselves.While he was clear and helpful while lecturing, he had alot of trouble understanding questions and would often spend 5 minutes explaining something completely unrelated to what was being asked. Quite inaccessible outside of class

Dr. McNeal's class is challenging and his tests are very fair. He helps to teach problem solving. The course if loosely centered around the book but his lectures are much more succinct and useful than the book. You can expect your success in the class to be proportional to your level of understanding.

I took his Multivariable Calculus class at Princeton University in 1992 and was profoundly dissatisfied.  I found him to be self-absorbed and unhelpful--he could barely find time to meet, and he never learned our names.  It sounds like he may have changed his stripes, and if he has developed a commitment to his students, I'm glad to hear it.

Quite classy guy, he looks like George Clooney. His lectures are clear, organized and insightful; a rarity for the math department. He is very helpful and goes into great length answering your questions. The homeworks are brutal and time consuming, but if you manage not to die doing them, you'll learn a lot. Exams were also hard and had surprises.

I agree with review below. This guy made the math in course come alive! I have never learned so much in 1 course .... but I never suffered so much either. The exams are hard. And the lectures demand that you read alot before class. Still, highly, highly recommend this professor.

Wow, this guy is off-the-charts good! Funny thing is, I didn't think so at first, cause he didn't make things smooth as some profs in lecture. But what he did do was show how to _be_ a mathematician, how to think like one. Everyday. The lectures were not really polished, but raw, somehow ....in a way that changed my thinking about math. I
he is nice guy and definitely knows what he did in class
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Waller is highly regarded for his approachability and willingness to assist students, making his classes accessible and supportive. His lectures are clear and effective, and he goes above and beyond to ensure students understand the material, often through detailed notes and a student-centered approach. While some find the homework and quizzes demanding, many appreciate his fairness and commitment to helping students succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Waller is highly regarded for his approachability and willingness to assist students, making his classes manageable and fair, despite some challenging homework and exams. Students consistently praise his ability to explain concepts clearly and his dedication to helping them succeed.

Ratings.comment: Very nice guy, gives fair work for the most part. Solid as a lecturer and most importantly willing to help and understand when it comes to unusual or difficult situations.

Prof Waller is a great resource for those in the Act. Sci. Program. He also did a great job teaching this class. I appreciated him writing out notes rather than reading slides. I did think exams could be tougher than maybe they shouldve, but I did alright. I will say dont take the quizzes lightly. They are more like tests in length and weight.

He's a very approachable professor that obviously cares about his students. If you bring up an issue, he will look into it right away and get you a quick response. He also helps students with issues related to the actuarial science major and helps connects students with the guest speakers from class. Definitely one of the best professors I have had

GREAT TEACHER. Just took his class and he definitely made a challenging class doable by being so approachable for help. Couldn't have passed without him, really grateful that he was such a great guy favorite teacher I have had at Ohio State.

A lot of the material is online but pop quizzes means you have to go to class. The homeworks are really tough. The midterm and final are open note. I don't feel like I learned much in this class. I was looking forward to this class because I really enjoyed Brad's other class 5632 but this one was structured differently and I did not like it.
Brad is a fantastic instructor. He is really good at explaining concepts and genuinely wants to help you understand. The exams/quizzes are very fair, as long as you understand how to do the hw.

Professor Waller is one of the best professors I have ever met in Math Department. This course is not hard if you attend class and write your notes. We have 8 homework but there are unlimited attempts to make sure you could get full credits. I got 98% of this course at the end. Even if it's 5---math course, Professor Waller makes it easy and fun.

A lot of his homework and test problems are very similar to the problems done in class, so even though he doesn't take attendance I would advise going. That being said, if you do go, the class isn't too hard to do well in. He is quite possibly the best instructor I have had at Ohio State- helpful, cares about your grades, and just a great guy

Dr. Waller is probably the best professor I've had at OSU.  His homeworks, quizzes, and exams are tough but if you go to class and complete the homework you will be fine.  He is very helpful when you go to office hours and will sit and go through an entire homework problem with you if you are confused.  Highly recommend.

Professor Waller did really well on teaching. He will give you a bunch of examples to explain the theory and that works well. He is not a hard grader at all. The only reason I do not suggest him is that the tests were confusing. Exams were not hard but just confusing. The other professor who teach 3618 is more easy for student to get a A.

Brad Is a great professor and always willing to teach things in different ways so that students will understand. Go to every class because he moves quickly through the material. Tests are pretty much your entire grade. It is a difficult class, but he does a great job of making it easier through office hours and talking you through problems.

He doesn't take attendance and I still didn't miss a single class-  first class I have ever taken and actually wanted to go. He's hilarious and a great instructor. All you have to do is practice the material and you're good to go.

3 Exams (69%) and 4 quizzes (16%) are not hard. However, that not means it's easy A because if you get about 85 every exam and full in quiz and homework. You can only get B+ for this class! I know most of students are retook this class so the avg grade is high. Exams have weighted a lot. Suggest student choose another instructor.

A great instructor. He knows the material well and knows how to explain it in basic terms. There is barely any homework, but he does provide ample extra problems to look over if you need help in any particular section. Exams are pretty straight forward. Should be an easy A if you follow his lectures.

summary_comment: Professor Skipper is known for her clear explanations of material, making the class accessible. However, students found her lectures sometimes confusing and too fast-paced, leading to significant reliance on TAs for understanding. While some appreciated her straightforward grading and the opportunity to ask questions during office hours, others criticized her for inconsistent testing and a lack of preparedness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Skipper is known for explaining material clearly, though some students found her lectures too fast and confusing. Overall, her classes are not considered difficult but can be challenging, especially without additional support, and her grading is seen as inconsistent with less leniency given.

Ratings.comment: She is great and explains the material very well and clearly

1161 was not a difficult class, but it was definitely made more difficult than it needed to be. Your entire grade is basically based on how well you do on the midterms. I respect Rachel and would take a class from her again, but she was not particularly supportive, caring, or funny. Sometimes just confused the class more with her explanations.

Dr. Skipper was one of the worst professors Ive ever had. In lecture, she would go through notes way too fast without properly explaining important concepts. So most of my learning was self taught. Her tests were inconsistent with some questions being super easy and some being unnecessarily hard. Also dont expect leniency with grades or curves.

I learned everything in this class from my TA. I felt like this professor did not know what she was doing half the time and sometimes her work was wrong. Her lectures made no sense and she just seemed not prepared most of the time.

She teaches the material as if you should know it before entering the class. When showing examples she will often choose problems that are too challenging and it will only confuse us, even though its not what she asks on the exam. The questions in lecture are not an accurate representation of what she wants done on the exams.

Rachel is a pretty good professor. Grades were only composed of midterms and quizzes. Quizzes were super easy, but exams were challenging. I recommend going to hers and your TA's office hours for every question you have, anything is fair game in her class. She is nice, but has no mercy when it comes to grades. I'd take her again though.

summary_comment: Professor Tussing is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and dedication to his students' success. Students consistently praise his willingness to go above and beyond, offering extensive tutoring, additional study materials, and numerous office hours. While some note occasional tangents in lectures, his passion for the subject and commitment to helping students understand the material are widely appreciated.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tussing is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students, often staying late and providing extensive resources and support outside of class. His passion for teaching is evident, though some find his lectures can veer off-topic, and he occasionally gets overwhelmed, yet his commitment to helping students succeed is unparalleled.

Ratings.comment: Tim is a great teacher and mentor in and out. He really works hard for these students and deserves the recognition! He truly cares about his students and wants the best for everyone!

He is truly a life saver and super caring and wants you to pass and understand the work. I took 2 yrs off from college, so in total it has been 4 yrs since I have taken a math course and the confidence he gave me to pass the class is A plus quality. He is really great and amazing. if you struggle in math please see him! He also TUTORS!!!!!!

Tim was my favorite professor at Ohio State so far. He is so caring and will go above and beyond for his students. He always finds different ways to help you learn the material. I learned so much in his class and always enjoyed going to class (even with an 8am lecture). I would definitely recommend taking Tim's class!

He worked so hard to help you pass & put hours outside of his class to help students making packets of everything we needed to know with examples & he had long office hours and super long review sessions so then no matter what your schedule you could still attend. if you are confused he will take the time out of his day to answer your questions.

Tim is one of the most compassionate professors you'll ever have, and he really cares about his students doing well. He has lots of office hours and always has reviews before exams. He does get a bit off-topic in lectures occasionally, but he clearly cares about the material and will always answer questions before, during, and after class.

Tim was a great professor. He started off confusing in lecture but learned quickly the best way to teach. He posts to carmen the information he does in class so going to lecture isn't mandatory. He also advocates for you if you think your midterm or quiz was graded unfairly. There are 10 quizzes and the lowest two are dropped. Online hw is the same
Tim is kind of a mess but is really passionate about the material. Going to the lectures is really important because he elaborates on what you need to know much more than the textbook.

Tim would go out of his way to make sure you had all of the tools necessary to pass. He would hold several review sessions before exams that were always very helpful. He was occasionally hard to follow because he would get off topic but overall he was an excellent lecturer/TA.

Nice guy, very evident that he wants his students to pass. He is generous with giving points back on exams, & general consensus was that he was not out to get his students, which is not always true for intro STEM classes. A little nutty and got distracted easily, but doesn't take attendance and is really accessible outside of class.

Tim is great when you attend office hours. When he is in front of over 100 students, he is all over the place and hard to follow. He over-complicates problems and his lecture is just boring. He always talks about things that are unrelated to the course content. He also holds his class over the class time and is visibly annoyed when people leave.

His lectures are extremely boring and he often is rambling on about something irrelevant or the same minor topic for majority of the lecture. He over complicated the material. I had taken this class in high school and he made me confused. In almost every recitation my TA had to reteach the content so we could actually understand it.

Tim is very unprofessional in his teaching. He often came to class late and barely made it to exams. In class, he would spend the first 5-10 minutes off topic and usually talking to one student. When teaching, he would focus on material that wasn't very important and dismiss questions about anything else. Tried to switch TAs but was too late.

Tim is a great guy. He puts so much time and energy into helping you pass. My 1149 lecturer was completely impossible to work with, and Tim carried the class with his recitations. He know's the material and more importantly, he knows how to teach it in a way students will understand it. 10/10. Go to every recitation.

When I took 1149 my lecturer was incompetent, Tims recitations were the only reason I passed. He always made sure we understood the material, and even spent time writing long cheat-sheets to explain hard concepts. Overall he cares a lot about his students, and genuinely loves teaching. He can be awkward and get off topic, but overall he is great

Tim was great when I had him. No complaints. Best trait as a professor was translating the confusing points of lecture into language that you can easily grasp. Very good for visual learners/people that like to see how the math works. In my opinion, He made a somewhat difficult class fairly easy.

Tim doesn't know how to talk to people at all. He talks to you as if you're stupid, especially if you ask questions right before a quiz. He is accessible outside of class but only on the days he comes to campus. He rambles on constantly during recitation which is very annoying and the way he explains things aren't very clear. I don't recommend him.

Tim is generally not good in front of a group of students as he gets flustered, making errors in his work, and goes off on tangents. However, in office hours, he makes himself incredibly available (especially before exams) and he is very good one on one. He saved my grade in 1149 as my lecturer was horrible

summary_comment: Professor Pengitore is generally perceived as ineffective in his teaching, with students citing issues such as poor preparation, unclear explanations, and difficulty following his fast-paced lectures. Many found his lectures confusing and unhelpful, often relying on TAs, recordings from another instructor, or their own notes to grasp the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pengitore is widely perceived as ineffective in his teaching, with many students finding his lectures confusing and poorly delivered. Students frequently mention issues with his handwriting, lack of preparation, and inability to clearly explain concepts, leading to a generally negative assessment of his teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: I survived this class due to my TA and a couple of smart friends to do team tests with. He is... not the best prof to say the least.

I stopped going to lecture after it became clear that he was not prepared to teach live at all. Jim Talamo's recorded lectures were a life saver - they literally taught me all of the material in this class. Mark was unhelpful and ill-equipped to teach this class.

Honestly one of the worst professors that I have ever had. He stopped in the middle of class one time and said he was doing the whole thing wrong and told us to go home. Stinks because he actually seems like a humble, nice guy, just not a great professor.

Moves at the speed of light and treats you like you are dumb if you ask a question. Most calculus professors are like this, so I dont have much advice. Ohio state needs to reevaluate who they force to teach.

He writes on the chalkboard and can barely read his handwriting. Try to ask a question and he gives very vague answers. Messes up the problems at times even though he is reading the solution off a piece of paper.

Prof. Pengitore was a great Calc 1 lecturer. He wasnt in control of any of the assignments and tests the math department created, but he was very willing to help us prepare for them. The course is very fast-passed, so as long as you take good notes and ask questions when needed, you will pass.

Dr pengitore never explains any of the material clearly. He would always sit on his phone for about 5 minutes after class was supposed to start and he consistently screwed up simple derivatives and students always corrected him. My best advice... get out while you still can
His lectures are way too fast paced and he skips so many steps without even mentioning it, so your notes are pretty much impossible to follow after class.

Pengitore has good intentions but is better suited for a desk job. He doesn't teach very clearly and assumes that all of his students have innate knowledge of math before they come into the class. Calc 1 is already really hard at OSU and is made harder by his complex and way-too-fast-paced lectures. Be ready to work incredibly hard.
Be ready to learn on your own.

To be honest, the way Professor Pengitore gives lectures dont suits me well. He write everything on the blackboards. Its hard to see what he wrote and to hear what he said. Ive already changed to another session of Math 1151. And I feel like I made the right choice.

Dr. Pengitore made this class far more confusing than it had to be. At one point he said, Raise your hand if you actually understand what a probability density means. Two people raised their hands. The homework was impossible and the book didnt help at all. If you go to office hours, he shows how to do the homework without explaining any steps.

summary_comment: Professor Best's teaching quality varies widely according to student feedback. Some students find her lectures difficult to follow and her grading and communication practices frustrating, while others praise her dedication, willingness to help, and ability to make complex topics accessible. Overall, her effectiveness as a teacher is highly dependent on individual student engagement and seeking additional support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Best's teaching quality is inconsistent; some students find her lectures difficult to follow and her grading slow and unresponsive, while others praise her for her dedication, willingness to help, and ability to make complex topics accessible. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some students finding her a top-tier instructor despite initial challenges.

Ratings.comment: Avoid this professor if you can. Takes a month and a half to grade tests and homework and has poor lectures. Had to basically teach myself the entire course. She waited until the very last day to upload final grades so that when you ask for your grade to be rounded, she ignores your emails. If you enjoy incompetence this lecturer is for you

Loved Professor Best. She makes differential equations much easier for everyone to understand. Her grade breakdown is very generous of her as well and emphasizes a participating class. Definitely raise your hand and talk because that is how you will do well. Her exams are hard but doable. Would take her twice over for how awesome she was.

I love Dr. Best! She loves differential equations and it shows through her teaching. The only con I have to say was that her notes were sometimes overkill and hard to pick out info. Otherwise she grades very easy, makes exams and quizzes easier than homework, and was extremely generous in the grade breakdown. Take her if you have the chance.

Dr. Best did a decent job. She is not great at explaining the concepts but she does go through example problems which can be helpful but is sometimes hard to follow. Try reading the book even though it can sometimes be confusing. Right before the class ends there are really tricky concepts so look out for that. Otherwise, the topics are not bad.
She is nice teacher. But as she was teaching the course for the first time(being offered first time) she was not that organized. But she did good job. Really helpful.
She was great and really wanted her students to do well! She is always willing to help and put in extra time with her students!

She is a bit hard to understand in lecture, but if you go to office hours, she works through every problem wonderfully. She is able to explain math concepts in many different ways until one makes sense for a particular student. If you actually do the homework and approach her with your questions, she is always very excited to help out or clarify.

Prof Best seems a bit out there at times in lecture, but she is one of the best (no pun intended) Math teachers I have ever had.  She will help you out as much as possible with hwk, quiz prep, etc.  I would recommend her. Go to office hours! Also her T.A., Dan Grollmus, is awesome!

This class really made me think that girls and math can't go together, even though i am a girl. The class was terrible, she didnt make a lot of sense at all. Very hard to understand her. Everyone who got As in 151 ended up in the B range, some ppl even got Cs. She was just a terrible lecturer, n u need 2 c good examples in math.

She's completely insane, but she's a good teacher nonetheless.  She is a little disorganized at first, but once you get going, the class is extremely straightforward.  The quizzes and tests were never tricky, and she was extremely eager to help just in case you did have a problem.  She seemed genuinely interested in helping.  Visit her office hours

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

summary_comment: Professor Le is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts accessible and ensuring students are well-prepared for exams. He creates a supportive learning environment that helps students excel, as evidenced by positive outcomes such as improved grades and a better understanding of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Le is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts accessible and ensuring students are well-prepared for exams. His classes create a supportive learning environment that helps students achieve strong grades.

Ratings.comment: Amazing professor!! Was really nervous for linear algebra coming in because of what I've heard. Although math is a strength, I wouldn't have expected an A out of this course, and I 100% know I couldn't have gotten that grade without him. If you have an opportunity to take his class, DO IT!!

Absolute king. Created a wonderful atmosphere in his classroom and made linear algebra easy to learn and digest. Second midterm was challenging compared to the first, but he gave us exactly what we needed to prepare and didn't test on material we didn't learn. His section is a bit slower than others, but it's exactly what I needed this semester.

summary_comment: Professor Fiedorowicz's teaching quality is mixed, with some students finding his lectures confusing and difficult to follow, while others appreciate the structured approach and ample extra credit opportunities. His lectures are described as boring and rushed, with unclear explanations and frequent mistakes in notes. Despite these challenges, many students found the course manageable due to the generous grading scale and availability of office hours, though some noted that the class is significantly harder than previous versions and that his teaching style is not effective for everyone.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fiedorowicz's teaching quality is generally perceived as poor, with students finding his lectures boring, confusing, and difficult to follow. Despite offering review materials and ample extra credit opportunities, his fast-paced delivery and unclear explanations make it challenging for students to grasp the material, leading to high stress levels and significant difficulties in keeping up with the coursework.

Ratings.comment: The lecture is very boring. Only half people attend his course. Before each exam, this teacher will provide a review file. Try to be able to dictate the answer to each question in this file. That's all you need to do before each exam.

I felt that he was very fair in the way that he structured points and exams in the course. He always gives review problems before exams, and he has a lot of office hours throughout each week to answer questions. He also has multiple huge extra credit opportunities throughout the semester that can boost your grade multiple letters if you do them.

He was very fair in terms of grading and the class was set up in a way that was very easy to end with a good grade (lots of extra credit, generous grading scale). However, he is so rude! He has one of those brains that understands everything the first time and doesnt understand how someone could be confused. He was very rude during office hours.

4182H is much harder than 4181H and so you're even more dependent on his teaching rather than your prior knowledge and his teaching is awful - constant notes with unclear explanations. Homeworks will easily take a whole day minimum. There's a little EC on exams. This is the first time I've ever gotten below an A- in any course, so this is no joke.

Zig's lectures are boring and confusing, and the tests are more difficult than the homework problems. He will not meet with you outside of office hours. He makes many mistakes and typos in the notes, so things get confusing. The only saving grace is the curve. Math was always easy for me, but this class sucked the life out of me.
Sooo confusing. Never understood a thing from lectures
So confusing. Concepts go unexplained. He writes so fast but talks so slow, you can only just copy what he writes without understanding a thing.

He just goes from topic to topic so fast. There's never a break. Notes everyday really gets to you. He doesn't explain things too well either. He sometimes goes too fast and you're more focused on just copying the notes rather than trying to understand them. There's so much content, it's hard to comprehend everything. Long, hard homeworks also.

Zig gives out extra credit stuff like extra problems or attending math competitions. He doesn't answer questions all that well during lectures, but he's very willing to do homework questions. The homework is very long and sometimes tedious (a lot of calculations instead of proofs) so it's good to start on those early.
Excellent.

Zbigniew's lectures are difficult to understand and they are usually not related to exams. He is not accessible outside class, never responded my email or text. Plus, not friendly and too much homework.

I'm a freshman and Zbigniew Fiedorowicz is my favorite professor so far. If you are willing to put in some work, you would receive a good grade. The exams and quizes are usually easier that the stuff he talks about during class. You should hand in homeworks in time but he is pretty flexible with them.

In this term, Zig gave a lot of extra credits which certainly made him more respected among his students. There is a Chinese proverb which goes like "if you ever want to learn Analysis, then you should learn it from Zig": His handouts are amazing (although some times full of typos! ): very helpful to do well in his tests or to learn some new math!

Zig is a really solid instructor for 4181H (Analysis I). I learned so much from him about single variable calculus! However, a tragedy is that his 4182H (Analysis II) lectures which are not as enjoyable as those for Analysis I, which perhaps is due to the level of students in the 4182H session - (confusingly) much lower than that of 4181H session!

Zig is a great professor. He really cares about his craft and his students. The class is lecture heavy and be ready to do a LOT of homework. That being said, the problems are helpful and the exams are fair. ZIg does a great job at putting some panache in the otherwise dry subject.

Zig is a solid professor for 4181H but you will need to put in the work to get results. You will get lots of long homeworks but he is flexible about the due dates if you ask him to push it back in class. Sometimes his handwriting is a little hard to read but his lectures are very useful and his curves are extremely generous
Great professor, very eager to help if you need it

Took both 4181H and 4182H with Zig. Fair grader, given the proof-based nature of the classes, but make sure you justify your work. Homework sets are very long, so expect to put in some effort. He often diverges from the text. Take-home exams save exam grades. Very helpful if you go to office hours.
His class is difficult, but fair.
Did not enjoy the class.
Oh yeah.

I really enjoyed having Zig as a professor.  This was the most challenging courses I have ever take.  Be ready to give up your life.  However, if you put in the required amount of work then you will get a lot out of it.
He's cool.
The class is very tough, but "Zig" really cares about his students' success. If you come to office hours, he will always give you as much help as you need.
He's a great guy who's there to help you whenever you may need it.

He is extremely knowledgable, but sometimes is hard to understand in class. Go to office hours, there are usually not many people there, and he explains things so well. He also does problems similar to the quizzes and tests. He offers extra credit and his practice midterms help tremendously for the actual ones. Plus, he's so adorable.

Z-Bigs is probably the only teacher that can make honors calculus a class worth taking. The cutest old man ever, he is extremely knowledgable but class can seem intimidating. He offers a ton of extra credit and out of class office hours. Take home quizzes and problem sets help pad the grade. His best quality is his dress game: straight grandpa

Fiedorowicz is a genius. He gives fair quizzes and midterms, and offers a good buffer of extra credit. His accent and choice of sweaters can be hilarious. Take advantage of the extra credit, and go to class for questions similar to the exam problems.

I took 1181H. I was in a higher class and dropped down into this one after a couple of weeks. He was very helpful. He has extra office hours before midterms and the midterms are the same format as the review. He adds in a couple take home quizzes and easy homeworks to boost grades after midterms. Great professor overall- really knows the material!

Much better than my 151 teacher. His notes are organized and easy to understand. Averages on the midterms are 62, 68, and 75ish. Study for each and you'll do fine. The final is nearly impossible, but you'll get a decent curve. He is one of the better math teachers at OSU.

Class was boring but the good thing is you can score in midterms by just doing past years' questions. Also, to understand the materials, you need to do the exercise given like everyday because i bet you won't be able to understand what he teach in class.
Exams are just like the practice exams. He is very hard to understand with the thick polish accent, so read before you go to lectures.

Very well prepared. A master of the material. Great board work. Very clear and understandable. I wish he would have spent more time giving the motivations, and intuitions for definitions and theorems, even though after some serious thinking a student will usually figure it out alone.

This man will put you to sleep. He uses an overhead. He turns on a mic, but doesnt use it, so you can't hear him and then you listen to static all class. Teach yourself or pick a different teacher, he is good for a couple laughs, but otherwise is useless.
Extremely smart, but almost too smart. Likes to explain the math behind the math (proofs) which are confusing and unnecessary. decent lecturer but you need to good TA to succeed in this class
pretty boring

He is a very nice teacher. The material is very hard, but he helps a lot. You can always argue for points back on your midterm if you feel you've been cheated. He's also very fun to listen to. I recommend this class.

I beg you to avoid this class at  all costs. The man canNOT teach!!!! I actually like math and am a math major and this class completely stumped me!!! he teaches in the most confusing manner known to man!!! Do NOT take his class...if you want to save your gpa.

Tends to lead confusing lectures and doesn't explain much. His notes consist of slides he wrote years ago and he just presents them to the class. My suggestion is don't go to lecture because he posts his notes online and they are essentially worthless and pray you have a good TA.
Hard to understand, but is really laid back.  It is not hard to ace the class  without attending the lecture (that is if you are good at math).  He goes over many webwork problems in class

Talk about a hard class!!! this man was not a good teacher and didnt prepare us for the exam!!!! AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS!!!! if ur stuck with him, be prepared to teach the entire course to yourself....and get hellp no matter what!!! funny guy sometimes but horrible teacher!!

His class is not easy, so many homeworks, quizes and midterms. The lecture is really boring and not useful, you have to learn by yourself if you want to get a better grade. But the good thing is there's no attendence policy and his notes are all on the website.

A bit hard to understand, but he really stands out in his passion, which is topped only by how much he cares about his students. Dr. Fiedorowicz will never give up in helping an individual student, and as long as you continue working/trying he will make sure you succeed. Exams are very hard, but if you attend lectures and meet with him over any con

Not a great teacher.  Class is pretty bad just reads off of his notes.  His tests are pretty tough even if you study.  He was a nice guy but didnt care about the students that much - id suggest another prof

I loved him!!! there were only a couple lectures that were boring but the other lectures were lovely.  he made strange comments reflecting how much he truly loves to teach math.  definitely go to office hours during the week and before exams...he'll go step by step through difficult problems.  if you want an A, take him, plus he's just a fun guy:)

He's a nice guy when you get to know him.Tests are hard but he's the best 152 teacher.The grade averages are higher in his class than the others.Also,GO to his office hours,especially before midterms,ask him for previous exams.They HELP. Trust me,I got an A ;) Warning:He does have an accent,and some of the TA's aren't that great. Big curve on final

The class was pretty much a review of my AP calculus class in high school.  The material was pretty easy.  Don't be scared by what you have heard.  Do the extra credit, the webwork, and study before the quizes and exams and you'll be fine.
Not the best teacher - find someone better if you can or get a good TA!

avoid him if you can  it's not about his accent, but about his style of teaching it doesn't matter how well he understands math.. he is not a good teacher but still attend lectures so you can get the answers to webwork

Not horrible.  Go to office hours and review sessions he holds for tests.  Do the extra credit.  Don't bother with webwork unless your quiz grades suck.  Notes didn't give very good examples.  Not much of a curve in the class either. He gets an A for effort, but about a B- for quality.

I understood Calculus prior to this class. He explained things in a complicated round-a-bout way, half the time never actually answering the question. I found my grade skyrocketed when I stopped going to lecture and only attended recitation where my TA could explain things in more simple terms. HINT: Do the extra credit at all costs!

"Ok, so umm..." Worst math experience of my life. Never answered people's questions. Read directly off of the overheads. Midterms and final were impossible. Tried to be funny-- not even close. Refused to increase the size of the notes so people could actually see (didn't really matter whether you could see or not). Do the extra credit.

I had breezed through AP Calculus in high school with an A, however I had to do hours of studying daily to maintain that grade in this class. The test questions are more difficult than the homework, but if you study the webwork problems and webwork review you should be okay. Also, the extra credit projects are worth your time.

I had breezed through AP Calculus in high school with an A, however I had to do hours of studying daily to maintain that grade in this class. The test questions are more difficult than the homework, but if you study the webwork problems and webwork review you should be okay. Also, the extra credit projects are worth your time.

Heavy Transylvanianesque accent. I failed the class (for the 2nd time, different prof)  by 3 points. So I sent multiple e-mails and office calls to see if I could get the grade changed, never even got a response. My TA, Xun Yu, if you ask him to do a hw prob, he would do it. We weren't sure if he was that nice, or just didn't know. OSU MATH SUCKS!!

I stopped attending lectures after the third day.  On this particular day the professor was asked to make the overhead larger or perhaps focus it.  He responded with "the notes are online."  You are better off learning the material yourself, he will not help.  It is impossible to follow his lectures regardless of the overhead size.

I thought Fiedorowicz seemed very nice and maybe not too approachable, but also not very intimidating.  If you have questions, ask! It will score you points with any teacher and show them that you care about learning the material. If you feel lost the MSLC workshops are extremely helpful.
Reads directly from overheads.  Questions on tests are always harder than the examples done in class. Webwork reviews for exams are helpful
Reads straight from overheads.
This is most notably the worst math experience of my life. It is impossible to understand him and he moves impressively slow in lecture so that the more difficult topics are never covered.

Horrible lecturer.  Talks above most peoples understanding and doesn't explain things well. He has a slight accent and constantly trails off, making it really hard to hear what he's saying.  One on one he's very impersonal and not very nice.  Avoid him if you can, if not just go to another lecture.  My TA was the only reason I survived. Thanks Nick

definitley one of the better math professors at osu. The exams are fair and their are not too many suprises. he is very willing to help and you can tell he really likes what he does. for the exams i would advise to study the webwork...if you can do those problems you can probally handle the exam.

Fiedorowicz is the lead Math 152 professor.  The exams were graded more then fairly, I thought I did worse on each of them then what I ended with.  If the professors pick their own TA's, he picks good TA's.  Some of the other math teachers have a better note setup where you print off fill in the blans off their website.  It's just like any math.
Had to work VERY hard to get a decent grade. Tests were just complicated and hard. Just hope you get a good TA to help you get by.
Poor explanations so I just stopped going by the end. Look at the reviews on the website calendar. MSLC reviews are pretty worthless. Get Guo Luo as a TA.

Over explains really easy stuff and flys through difficult stuff.  Midterms are ridiculous and his reviews don't even come close to covering the material tested.  MSLC reviews are worthless too.  My advice- discover the tutor room in Cockins and PRAY for a good TA!
he is so confusing that i just stopped going to class.

Nice guy and a decent course even if you haven't taken math for a few years. Only problem is that he sometimes over explains stuff and doesn't get to the point at all. Get a good TA to translate his ramblings and you'll be alright. Midterms are like his reviews

Gave clear examples and did most of the problems on the midterms in lecture. Plus he offered 40 points in extra credit which if you go to the help sessions, should be done easily. His midterms were exactly like the practice ones on the website. This was my first and last college math class...easy A.
He doesn't really teach and doesn't give good examples. He knows what he's talking about but has trouble conveying it.

Fiedo was one fo my favorite teachers freshman year, he kept things interesting and made me laugh daily. My friends and I could mess around the whole class and take notes when he went over midterm info and do well everytime. As long as you get his notes down (sometimes can be too long) it's not bad.
No Comments

he's a **** and should go back to wherever he came from, aweful teacher overall, it sucks when you go from an A in math 151 to a D+ b/c your professor and your TA don't speak english practically & don't know how to teach
Sometimes he's hard to understand since he's from some other country.  Actually, I think he's a vampire.  But not a horrible professor.
Goes at a nice pace, gives old midterms & final online, pushes back deadlines, very good professor!!!
he sucks
Great teaching style. I enjoyed his unique personality.

Great teacher - really wanted to teach and make sure you got the information.  Notes clear and at a nice pace for people to follow.  Go to all of the classes and do the webwork and a good grade is guaranteed.  Very helpul professor.

Tests were not very difficult... especially if you do the homework. Quizzes are not hard at all... especially if you go recitation. Basically, if you go to most classes and recitation and do most of the homework, an A is not hard to get at all. He also does a good job explaining the material.
Everything is available online and easy to follow. Also provides extensions when needed for extra credit and webwork!

He was a little hard to understand, but his notes were very clear!  Tests weren't easy, but the exam was very fair!  Go to all the classes, do the webwork, and see him if you still have some questions!  You'll get a decent grade if you just do the work!
No Comments
Horrible.
All he covers in lectures is Math theory.  Makes no sense and you are left in the dark come test time!
not the best in lecture... and tests are hard but gives plenty of extra credit and makes the class very fair. It all evens out in the end.

Makes countless mistakes in which the students point out so basically we are teaching the class ourselves. Posts lecture notes online which help in webwork so you can skip if you want and recitation goes over webwork. REVIEW WEBWORK FOR EXAMS. seriously. And the suggested probs couldn't hurt as well

He talks at a decent rate. Don't count on the webwork reviews to help a whole lot on midterms or final. Office hours are never busy. Overall, class is extremely difficult if you don't do suggested homeworks. The 40 points extra credit saved me. He's better than a lot of math professors I've had.

I beg to differ. Exams do refect midterms but not directly. Do all webwork problems to get 100 recitation points + 40 extra credit points and you should be fine. Also, an 85% is an A-... including curve
extra credit and good curves in the class... but the exams never closely reflect the material on the reviews... just hope you get a good t.a., this class is difficult.
No Comments
hard to understand.  doesn't explain things really well but lots of extra credit in the class.
Cool guy ever and entertaining. exams and quizzes are easy and sure an A if u did all home works and webwork. He awesome as a person...but as a teacher he was horrible.
The class was a breeze.  Tons of extra-credit is offered and tests were only 5-6 questions that were exactly like the Webwork(Homework).  If you do the work, you can easily get an A.

He was an OK teacher, but great with students. He gave tons of extra-credit and the quizes didnt even count if you did the webwork good. He even changes homework due dates because people have other exams in other classes.
Handwriting is messy, but he puts the notes online and is always willing to help
Great professor overall. Always willing to help. If you're taking 152, try to get him.
His accent was a little difficult to understand, but he was there if you needed help.  He was also as entertaining as you can get with math

His method of teaching is very difficult.  He writes on one overhead and you CANNOT see what he writes because he is in the way!  Then he switches it to another overhead while he continues.  If you ask a question chances are high he won't understand them.
all i can think about is how he pronounced "the fundamental theorem of calculus" and the sweaters....
All I can say is DEAR GOD.... and glad I am done
His quizzes make me want to gouge my eyes out. He wears the same orange sweater every day.

Was a tough class, but not because of Professor Fiedorowicz.  He was pretty generous on letting you know what he expected you to know for the midterms.  He gives excellent notes! Got an A in the class.

I absolutely loved how he taught!!!  He gave tricky examples and "nonexamples."  I was a big fan of his sweater choices too.  He is an incredible teacher, and makes math seem soo much more simple than it is!

i was worried by these other comments, but the prof. was easy to understand and helpful when i visited during office hours or asked a question after.  **take advantage of the extra credit, it's very generous!!!**
This class was way too hard for the level.  I had to get help from math tutors and they frequently struggled.  The passing rate of this class is way too low.  Drop it now
I think Prof. Fiederowitz is very helpful
Horrible.  I ended up going to a different lecturer teaching the same course after it was too late for me to drop.
Couldn't understand him through his thick accent

Fair, difficult teacher.  Sometimes acts goofy and is occasionally tough to understand, but explains material well and grades more than fairly.  I bombed a midterm and still was able to pull an A.  Has extra credit that helps a bunch
try to avoid him at all costs!! change immediately if found in any of his classes
After breezing through Math 151, thought I would rock 152 as well.  Probably would've I could understand this professor.  Avoid at all costs is so true!
Very good teacher, explains problems bery well.  Offers extra credit assignments.
Midterms are AWFUL! Got a B in 151, worrying about passing 152...
No Comments
No Comments
Horrible...avoid at all costs
No Comments
No Comments
Lectures/Exams/Quizes/Homework all co-relate very well.  Offers extra credit!!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Mukherjee is highly regarded for his accessibility and willingness to help students, often staying late to clarify concepts and provide additional support. While his lectures can move quickly, students find his clear presentation and organized slides beneficial. Despite the challenging nature of the course, many appreciate his responsiveness to emails and his commitment to student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mukherjee is a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who responds quickly to emails and offers additional help after lectures. Despite the course being challenging, he provides clear and structured lectures and is generally supportive of students' learning needs.

Ratings.comment:
NOTE: this is for MATH 1152, not 1151

Very nice and smart guy, goes a little fast in lectures so I strongly advise reading/working thru the Ximera textbook section for each topic the day before the lecture. I never tried going to his office hours but I heard they were helpful, and he always responds to emails very quickly.

While I did not love Calculus 1151, it was because they use a lot of Chimera. He posts a ton of these. He is very accessible outside of class (even at late hours), and he'll also go back and explain topics during lecture if you don't get it. I did poorly on all of the exams but I believe I was an outlier, and he was willing to round my final grade.

While this class is tough, I found Sujoy to be a great Calc 1 teacher. I thought he was very nice and he always made sure to check if students had any questions during lectures. Beware of this class' midterms and final though; they will make or break your grade.
Very nice and friendly guy. Not at great teacher but willing to try to help. Lectures are confusing.

Math 1151 is a bad class, but Sujoy makes it bearable. He is incredibly helpful in office hours and will respond to emails in 10 minutes around the clock. He really cares about your success. His lectures are somewhat difficult to understand (fast talker + accent), but he will stop and answer questions and has GREAT slides. Take Sujoy!!!

Sujoy was a great professor! I think people who rank him poorly can't differentiate between the teaching and the difficulty of the class. I recommend spaced repetition (see all content multiple times) and lots of practice problems before exams. Read the textbook and look over lecture slides before the actual lecture and you're set!

Fast at responding to emails. Aways stays 30 minutes after the Zoom meetings to explain the concepts to students and possible test prep. Organized and the lectures are well-structured. Generally would recommend.

As other reviews mentioned, yes he had his moments... but overall a better experience than other professors Ive had teach 1151. Hell answer your questions instead of staring at you until you figure it out(yes some of them do that), and he presents lecture content in a clear and understandable manner, rather than performing math at you like others

He laughs at students and belittles them in front of others in his lectures. He's terrible at explaining any concepts. He says things like "Maybe I should explain this slowly for you" or "You all are fools" and the GroupMe has quoted him and called him out on these things several times. Do not recommend, wish I could give a 0/5

I was enrolled to take Borland the previous semester and dropped him, and this semester I took Sujoy. His lectures are way better than any other professors that I've seen, and I've had problems with the work, emailed him at midnight, and got a response in ten minutes. I'm so impressed with Sujoy as a professor, he is brilliant and a great choice.

He teaches at a relatively fast pace but still double checks if anyone has questions or if there has been a misunderstanding. During office hours he typically stays a lot longer than the allotted time and makes sure he gives sufficient explanations.
He laughed when someone asked him to explain a problem further and he said " maybe I should explain this slower for you guys especially."

summary_comment: Professor Magsino is known for his thorough explanations and clarity, making complex topics more accessible. However, some students find his lectures focused primarily on reviewing homework material, which can be challenging to follow without prior knowledge. Despite this, he is highly regarded for his friendliness and willingness to help outside of class, and he provides valuable resources like practice midterms to aid student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Magsino spends most of his lectures reviewing homework material, which some find makes his lectures less engaging. Despite being clear and thorough in his explanations and genuinely caring about student success, his lectures can be challenging to follow, especially without prior preparation or additional resources.

Ratings.comment: He is an okay professor but all of the time in lecture is spent reviewing the homework material.
Mark really cares about students but his lectures can be hard to understand. This can be easily countered by choosing to go to Jim Talamo's lectures instead. Mark is easy to access outside class.

Dr Magsino's lecture is pretty unclear. It is hard to understand what he is talking about in the lecture, so I can understand the content of lecture by reading the course notes. He gives not enough examples in the lecture so it is difficult to learn multivariable calculus. The homework and exam is easy, and the grading is friendly for students.

Mark is the best. He explains things so clear in a proof based math class like this. He is super friendly in and outside of class. Always super helpful during office hours. Over all a great math professor I would definitely take his class again.

Mark is an excellent professor. No accent. He is very clear and gives you an idea of the questions you will encounter for the material he is teaching. This class might kill you, however. There are practice midterms available on carmen. TAKE EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM. Unless you are both brilliant and unbelievably daring.
Not great. I ended up going to a different lecturer's lectures. Taught a few things incorrectly and was not a fan of his chalkboard use. It was a little all over the place and difficult to follow.

His lectures were organized and with plenty of examples, and he did his best to make the content understandable for students. There is a lot of homework and it is easy to cheat on, but if you dont do the homework (unless you are very gifted) you wont do well. He genuinely cared about student success on exams and in the class as a whole.
He explained things thoroughly and in a way that made math easier for me to understand. He didn't skip steps when solving problems, making it easier to follow.

He did not explain those useful tips for exams just pure proving formula during lecture. No lecture notes posted as he only uses the chalkboard. When comes to explaining concepts, he literally asked to imagine yourself without giving a actual animation that would help students a lot.

summary_comment: Professor Schuda Stout is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to make complex math concepts accessible, earning her a strong reputation among students. However, some criticize the heavy workload and lack of clarity in grading expectations, noting that the class requires significant self-guidance and outside work. Overall, her engaging and supportive approach is widely praised, though the demanding nature of the course is a notable point of contention.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schuda Stout is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and ability to make complex concepts accessible, earning her a strong reputation among students. However, her class requires significant self-guided writing and homework, often leaving students with a heavy workload and slower grading turnaround times.

Ratings.comment: This was not as much a math class as a self-guided writing class. It hardly mattered if your actual math was correct, if you did not write to her exact expectations (which she does not spell out) then you got points off. There was far too much homework for the amount of credit hours. Grading turn around time was very slow. Would not recommend.

She's one of the best math teachers I've ever had, and math has always been my worst subject. She explains really well and is understanding if you need to go over a topic more than once. A lot of work outside of class though, and most of class time is spent doing group work

The class was very simple and easy to follow and understand. She does a wonderful job of explaining things and always is on the lookout for questions. Additionally shes very kind and has a good light hearted sense of humor!

Debi is the best. I took a class called "excursions in math" and she made it fun and wasn't condescending at all which I really appreciated. She is super funny and personable as well as excellent at teaching and explaining math concepts. Assignments could be tedious, but the expectations were clear.

Debi is a great instructor. I am AWFUL at math and found her very easy to follow in lecture. Shes very nice and will answer any questions you have. She posts exam study guides and works out the problems in the key.
Debi is so great! She makes a great effort to keep students interested and focused on math. Started every class with a pun. Definitely recommend taking her classes

Debi is by far the best math teach I have ever had. I always struggled in math and her lectures make every concept easily understandable. She has so many office hours and is willing to make extra appointments if you cant make them or need more help. She is also super approachable, nice, and patient when you need help in office hours.

By far the best math teacher I have ever had. She is warm, engaging, concise and unbelievably eager to help out students. Seriously, go to her lectures - they turn an otherwise difficult subject into something easily approachable.
Stout is really good! She provides very clear examples in class and will help you a lot outside of  class as well!

She is by far the best math lecturer that I have ever had. She is very clear and easy going. If you miss lecture, you will fall behind in this class. Doing extra homework helps you to do better on the quizzes and tests, but the extra work is not mandatory. There is a weekly homework with 10 questions, 3 midterms, 11 quizzes, and a final .

Best lecturer I've ever had for a Math course. Very clear, friendly, willing to answer questions. Go to lecture, I was personally very uninterested in the subject, but she'd keep my focus and taught me a lot.

Love her! She really simplifies concepts that helps everybody understand. She can also be really funny at times and she's very relatable. She helps out with questions after class ALL the time. Awesome. Would definitely take her again.

Debi is great!!! she gives great examples in class and is very clear! the quizzes and homework is automatically full credit if you average 80%.. Very easy! The midterms are exactly like the practice exam so be sure to take the practice and ask about what you dont get. It is the same exact questions just different numbers.
Math 1131 is not exactly easy, but her willingness to help you during office hours is great! She also is engaging and provides excellent notes.
Debbi is not a bad professor, but she goes WAY to fast in lecture. Without recitation, I would not have passed this class.

SP15: Deb is very easy to understand and knows her stuff. She writes too much down though and always makes you stay till the end of class. It's not mandatory to show up, I probably skip once a week. Midterms are not that bad if you do the practice midterm and practice problems. Online HW and a quiz due every week in Rec. I would take again...
Pretty good lecturer. First midterm was impossible with a class average of 67 but second and third midterms were much easier. Go to class and take notes and you'll do well

She always made lecture seem shorter than it was and she was very easy to follow. She is very approachable and definitely wants her students to pass. She adds extra office hours approaching a test incase you need additional help.

The ONLY reason I passed 1148.  She was a great TA and always willing to help you.  I'm terrible at math and was so confused at lecture, but she made everything so clear and I passed the class with an A.  Would definitely recommend her!
Debi was a great math professor. She clearly explains the concepts and was very helpful in office hours if lectures didn't quite make sense. Would definitely recommend her to anyone.

summary_comment: Professor Lou is highly regarded for his clear teaching style and ability to explain complex concepts effectively. Students appreciate his fairness, thoroughness, and commitment to helping them succeed, though some note that the class can be challenging due to its pace and workload. His enthusiasm for mathematics is evident, and he provides ample support through office hours and clear expectations for exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lou is highly regarded for his clear teaching style and ability to explain complex concepts effectively. Students appreciate his fairness, thoroughness, and willingness to provide additional support through office hours.

Ratings.comment: Professor Lou clearly cares for the students and listens to feedback. Unfortunately, I had to take this class online but Lou was able to keep a positive attitude and help make up for it. Clear what is on tests and how to get an A. I recommend checking out the book because it does a good job explaining anything that was unclear in lecture.

Dr. Lou is a solid professor. He gives thorough lectures and explains things well, and was very fair with exams  would tell you what to expect and did reviews. The class is tough  a large variety of material at a fast pace w/plenty of work to do each week, but if you stick with it (and read the book!) you wont fail.

Professor Lou is very good at explaining each point clearly, and all the examples which he gave us were pretty useful. If you show up in each lecture and do all the homework by yourself, you will get A in final. I highly recommend you to take Professor Lou's 2177 class.

Professor Lou is the best math professor Ive had at OSU. The examples he does are clear and straightforward. There werent any surprises on exams. He assigns a reasonable amount of work and is clear about what to know for exams. He has many office hours throughout the week to help with homework. Highly recommend him if you take this course.

Professor Lou is very clear on what he taught. He may seem to be strict at first, but later you will realize he is actually a nice and kind person. Exams are fair, and similiar to the homework. Go to class and finish the homework, you will get an A.

His accent wasn't an issue over the whole class. He made tests really easy, and the final wasn't cumulative. He had high averages so he probably will make the tests harder in the future. Regardless, he was a good professor and I would recommend taking 2177 with him.

He's super enthusiastic about math and teaching, which is nice. His lectures are good overall, but his examples in class are extremely basic and much easier than homework problems. His exams were really easy, but that was only because this was his first year teaching 2177.

He did a good job his first semester teaching 2177. He was a little disorganized at first and spent disproportionate amounts of time on different topics, but it got better as the semester went on. His tests also got a little harder, but nothing was unreasonable. He never surprised you on the exams: they were at least as easy as the homework.
Just overall an "eh" prof. Nothing great or horrible. His lectures are kinda dry, but he is a good guy. He tries pretty hard and is easy to understand. Just makes a lot of mistakes.

He is a really, really good teacher who seems to truly care about his students. He is passionate about math, which make it easy to pay attention in class. He does have an accent, but it is usually not difficult to understand. Tests are fair.

He is so awesome! Literally the best math teacher that I've had yet. He makes sure you understand everything before he moves on and is always willing to answer any questions. He has a Chinese accent but he really funny. He just an adorable little Chinese dude. I would definitely recommend taking his class if you can.

Once you get used to his accent (which takes a couple days), you realize he is a really good teacher. He's so nice and makes sure he does everything he can to make sure you understand. Very good professor
Cares about Math.  He only has two sweaters that he wears every other day. Sometimes, students can understand him.

Would only suggest lou for people who have taken calc in high school!  He is nearly incomprehensible, but for someone who already knew what he was talking about, class was basically usless anyway.  He was a very sweet guy though, and seemed very willing to help.  I know a lot of people though who really struggled with him though.  Hard final.

I absolutely loved Professor Lou! After he explained a concept he always took time to make sure everyone understood what he was saying. He was probably the sweetest teacher I've ever had. He loves math and it really shows. His exams weren't bad and he gave really helpful exam reviews that were very similar to the test. I really miss him!

Professor Lou is very helpful and is sincerely interested in helping the class. His office hours are very helpful for homework problems and his reviews are almost the test exactly. He may be a bit hard to understand at first but a few days after you get going you'll be fine!
He knows what he's talking about and really tries to help the class in understanding the material. He's very helpful during office hours too! His kids are adorable!
Really quite sweet. It was a hard class, but he made you want to go. Willing to help you out, and he'll crack jokes that aren't really funny... but make you laugh anyway.
Dr. Lou is a good teacher. He is quite amusing really. He is really helpful too.

summary_comment: Professor Chung is highly regarded for his exceptional ability to simplify complex material, making it accessible and deeply understandable for students. His lectures are praised for their clarity and the use of effective examples, though his exams are known for being challenging and strict. Students appreciate his care and accommodation, especially during difficult times such as illness or remote learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chung is highly regarded for his exceptional ability to simplify complex material, making it easier for students to achieve deep understanding. His lectures are praised for their clarity and the use of effective examples and visuals.

Ratings.comment: Dr Chung is by far one of the best professors I've had. He is really good and simplifying the material to a level in which you can achieve a deep understanding of the topics. The exams were graded pretty strictly, but for me they were take home, so maybe that's why. Also, the pictures drawn are top tier. If you get an opportunity to get him, do it!

Sjuvon Chung is by far the best lecturer I have had so far. He is very very good at making things easy to understand and easy to conceptualize.
