He also knows how to pick very good examples to show during lectures that build a deep understanding of the material. I would definitely try to get him as a lecturer again if it's ever an option.

Really really great math professor. Lectures are really simple and easy to understand. Also, in September of this semester I fell very ill and missed multiple weeks of classes. Sjuvon was very accommodating and really helped me be ready for the midterm. Midterms are very difficult, however. They're never unfair but you have to be careful.
He is a very nice person. He can offer me a lot of inspiration.
Took this online during COVID. He is a very tough grader and will take off lots of points for little things. He is very good at explaining concepts however and keeps lectures interesting.

For a hard class like calc II, Sjuvon is a GREAT professor to have. The exams are especially difficult because they're often not just a computation, but also require a paragraph explaining something as well. He is good with technology, records all of his lectures, and just really cares for his students. 4 midterms, 4 quizzes, lots of hw on Ximera.

He is by far the worst math teacher I have ever had. If you can switch professors do it. He is the toughest grader, removing a ton of points for minor errors in math. Run as far away as you can from him. I don't understand why people claim he is likable and nice. He is rude, not understanding of mental health issues, and all around a mean man. 0/5

I took this class online because of the COVID, but he explained things so well and clear even thought its not face to face. He provides two lectures in one day which mean he really want student to have live classes and ask questions. He cares and understands students and he gave the whole class a fall break since we dont get one this year.
He's so good! Great lectures, really funny, really wants to help you understand the material. Made Calc 2 so easy. Super accessible outside of class. Absolutely recommend!

He is super chill and he just has a really likable personality. I didnt know him super well bc I took this class online, but over zoom and stuff he seemed super cool. This class is A LOT of work and it can get very confusing and hes also a pretty tough grader but overall a pretty decent professor.

super tough grader! if you usually don't get perfect score on math because of some tiny tiny mistakes, plz plz don't take this class never see anyone is so tough on grading, his math test is not math, is pretty much asking you explain every single thing, feel like I have to explain why 1+12. if you can switch a prof, please do so. RUN! RUN!
Great dude and great teacher. Super fun and hilarious and really helpful with understanding the material. Always a huge help at office hours and always made class fun :)

This is a pass/fail class, so as long as you show up and do the work, youll pass. There is no homework, so thats cool. Very cool dude. Very cool concepts covered in lectures. He takes some of the more interesting parts of math and teaches that to you. No exams or quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor Salako is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, with many students praising his availability during office hours and his thorough lecture notes. While some students noted his sometimes snide remarks and inconsistent attendance, others commended his clear teaching methods and genuine care for their learning outcomes. Overall, he is seen as a knowledgeable and supportive professor who pushes students to excel.
summary_comment_short: Professor Salako is known for his thorough teaching methods and genuine care for student success, despite some students noting his occasional snide remarks and inconsistent attendance during office hours. His lecture notes are highly praised, and many students appreciate his availability and dedication to helping them understand the material.

Ratings.comment: He always made snide remarks when people showed up to the Zoom instead of showing up in person, even though he himself said the IRL recitation was optional (COVID and all). On several occasions he didn't show up to his own office hours. He purposefully "didn't teach x thing on the first exam so you learn how to study better", and that's a quote.

I enjoyed having Professor Salako as a lecturer. He is always open to questions and always does his best to answer them, which shows that he obviously cares about the success of the students. Keep an eye on the textbook though, but that can apply to most math courses.

The lectures and recitations were very helpful. Just stay on top of homework, attend class, and study for midterms and youll do fine. There are a lot of resources provided to help study for midterms, and the whole department wants everyone to succeed! Definitely a class where the professors and TAs want students to learn and do well.

I have professor Salako this semester (AU20), and I can say without a doubt he is one of a kind. For my class section, we rely on online discussions through our LMS, and he goes out of his way to give you direct feedback on every one of your points.
Dr. Salako is the only reason why I survived Calc II. He is so helpful in office hours and his lecture notes are clear. Though a lot of homework, but there are plenty resources to help you succeed.

Rachidi is a great professor. It is really hard to teach this class because of the reputation it has, but Rachidi makes sure he moves fast enough so we get through all of the material but slow enough for everyone to understand it. His notes are extremely thorough and well written. He has lots of office hours after class and extends them often.

Salako was a great lecturer and is an amazing person. He genuinely cares about each student. He not only knows the material but he knows how to teach it. He is probably my favorite professor I have had at this University.

Professor Salako is one of the most caring and intelligent professors I have had at Ohio State. The class is not easy and there is lots of online homework, but he is available at office hours, and in class, he does a great job teaching the content. He truly wants to see you succeed.

summary_comment: Professor Keyfitz is a respected but challenging instructor, known for preparing students well for tests and having detailed, lecture-based classes that require thorough textbook reading. Students find her grading strict and often struggle without extensive preparation, though some appreciate her efforts to make difficult topics manageable. Overall, her teaching style and difficulty level are polarizing, with many advising caution and thorough preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Keyfitz is a respected but challenging instructor, known for her thorough preparation and clear organization of class material, yet her teaching style requires significant self-study from students who must read the textbook extensively to keep up with her lectures. Many students find her tough on grading and unyielding in her methods, leading to mixed reviews and high dropout rates in her classes.

Ratings.comment: For diff eq, Dr. Keyfitz was awesome. But you can't only rely on lectures to learn the material -- you NEED to read the textbook before class; otherwise, lecture is hard to follow because she mainly scrolls through pre-written notes. As long as you read and understand the textbook, homeworks and exams were EASY.

Like the following comments, she didn't teach well in this course. Prepare to read the whole book to understand the concept. She definitely is a tough grader which makes the course much harder. Respected teacher but please avoid her unless you are extremely smart. P

I would avoid her at all costs. She's bad at explaining anything, lectures come straight out of the book, and doesn't understand finance (in a financial mathematics class). She barely gives partial credit if you don't follow her "perfect" method. Just really cold too and doesn't seem to care about her students. Had to have had 15+ people drop

Very nice lady. Some people struggled with her during office hours, but showing up prepared and throwing in a bit of effort was very helpful for me. Tests are based mostly on in-class material and she prepares the class very well for each one.  Her humor goes over most people's heads, but she tries...

She is the worst teacher i have ever encountered. No explainations for grading, no partial credit for anything, no information on if or how she does grade curving for exams. She basically expects her students to memorize long formulas they will never have to use in real life and has zero practical applications for her teachings.
Very nice lady.  Test were pretty easy, study hard because she doesn't give much partial credit if you don't follow her ways.  Makes a tough class very passable- some people should not have...

summary_comment: Professor Cogdell is highly regarded for his clear and thorough teaching style, making complex concepts accessible and ensuring students understand key material. He is known for his accessibility and willingness to provide detailed feedback, particularly on homework assignments and papers. While some students note his unique mannerisms, they consistently praise his dedication to student learning and his ability to make mathematics engaging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cogdell is highly regarded for his clear and thorough teaching style, with lectures that are well-organized and accessible. Students appreciate his patience in answering questions and his willingness to explain concepts in different ways, though some note his unique mannerisms.

Ratings.comment: This was an online class. Not required to attend live lecture and everything was recorded, which was very helpful. Lecture were always very clear and he would always mention when a concept was going to be especially important or when we should review old material that was relevant again. I did not use office hours a lot but he was always accessible

The class was mostly homework assignments and a final paper. Felt like I was actually learning the material instead of just cramming for exams. I appreciated the thorough feedback that was given on the problem sets. I had not previously written a term paper for a math class and found it to be helpful in organizing my thoughts and revisiting topics

The absolute best professor ever.  Highly accessible and concerned with students' progress.  Exceptional ability to explain difficult concepts. Well organized and always prepared for class.  Tests are difficult, but provides liberal partial credit.

A little strange and takes some adjusting to get used to some habits of his (whistling, pinches fingers to count).  Helpful in class and office hours.  He really likes it when a class is responsive and gives feedback.  If you dont get something, say so.  He'll try to explain it differently and it usually clarifies the issue.  Good Prof overall. :)
Dr. Cogdell is a great teacher. His lectures and board-work are very clear and understandable and he always takes time to patiently answer questions.  Highly recommended.

Really helpful in office hours, tests are similar to homework and he let's you know what to expect.  Nice, but a few odd mannerisms.  I hope I have him for another class, he really got me interested in set theory.
tests are just like the homework. he's really nice and explains everything
Made me almost not hate math. Great teacher, always there to help. Just do homework and go to class. Study vocab more than technique. Kinda reminds me of Bob Saget and Ross from Friends.

I really enjoyed this guy - actually made math somewhat entertaining. Wasn't real worried about being technical, so as long as you know how to do everything you'll be fine. Tests weren't hard as long as you do a good job on your homework and go to class on a regular basis.

summary_comment: Professor Wheeler is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and clear explanations, making complex topics easy to understand. Students praise her responsiveness and availability during office hours, and many recommend seeking her help for additional support. Her structured approach, including regular homework and quizzes, ensures students stay on track and perform well.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wheeler is highly regarded for her effective and clear lectures, which are designed to facilitate understanding and prepare students for quizzes and exams. Students consistently praise her responsiveness, availability during office hours, and overall supportive approach to teaching.

Ratings.comment: I took this AU20 and couldn't attend the synchronous lectures, but I still did fine. Anything 90 or above is considered an A, which was great. When I needed clarification, I went to Prof. Wheeler's office hours and she was really helpful. Just DO NOT fall behind.

Professor Wheeler gave extremely insightful lectures that made the information we were learning easy to understand. She was very responsive to emails over the course of the semester and was great about answering questions in lecture as well.

Her lectures are really helpful, and my TA was great at clearing up my questions. Shes pretty serious in lectures and the worst part about class was that she always gave exams or quizzes on Fridays at 6.

For sure in my top favorite math teachers of all time. Pro tip: If you need extra help in math, are uncomfortable with any of the content, or just wanna review a few problems, I highly recommend office hours. Jessica explains things super well, and is always welcoming to help you out. Glad I had her last semester, she is for sure a good one.

Weekly homework assignment due day before the weekly quiz, everything on the homework prepares you for the quiz. Very easy to talk to, very nice, and uses her time wisely. Lectures are very clear and thorough and constantly asks if anyone has questions to make sure everyone is understanding. Class is easy as long as you do the notes, hw, and study.
Very easy to communicate with.
really good lecturer. her lectures we easy to follow and she was very clear about what she was explaining. Would take her again in a heartbeat

I honestly loved Jessica. She was literally so sweet and lectures were usually super helpful. The class really isnt hard at all if you have any kind of higher level math background. Exams werent very hard as far as the math, they just cover a lot of material so youll have to review thoroughly!

Although she does well in her lectures her class is weighted; the exams are 88% of your grade so take diligent notes and be prepared to ensure you do well on them. She also holds class until the very end and will be upset if people try to leave early. Overall, she is definitely not a professor I would go out of my way to take another class with.

Jessica(a TA) is like a big sister. She likes to joke around and wants to help her students be successful, but she also knows what the lecturer wants and how to help us get there. Never be afraid to ask your questions to her. She is a tough grader for the homework, but that helps you out when it comes to the exam. She is my favorite instructor.

Technically she is a TA, but she is more useful than the professor for this class. I've only been attending recitation for a month now and my grades have greatly improved. She makes sure you understand the material and is always willing to help without looking down on you (even when people ask stupid questions)

summary_comment: Professor Hafuta is highly regarded for his caring and understanding approach, offering extra help and ensuring his exams are fair and predictable. Students appreciate his patience, clear explanations, and review sessions that closely mirror exam content, contributing to better performance. However, some find his lectures challenging due to his accent and the frequent focus on recent material, necessitating additional effort to keep up.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hafuta is highly regarded for his caring and understanding approach, offering additional support through extended office hours, Zoom sessions, and patient explanations. His exams are known to be fair and predictable, with review sessions closely mirroring the exam content.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hafuta was very caring and understanding. He always stayed behind if needed, set up zooms if he couldn't stay, and answered my emails even when it was close to the deadline. He explained things readily without being condescending and was very patient. His exams were very reasonable and had no surprises.

Took 3345 with him SP2022 and he was great. Good lectures, funny guy, and would hold reviews before the exams that were similar to the actual exams. 3345 is a notoriously hard class, but with him it was not bad at all. Highly recommend

The class itself is pretty challenging but if you do the homeworks and watch the lectures, you will be just fine. The lectures before the exams he does a review session that more or less tells you exactly what will be on the exam which REALLY helps your grades. He is lenient on grading too.
I absolutely loved this class. Attending lectures really helped me get through this course.

I absolutely can not understand anything he says. If it weren't for the internet, I would have to put the recorded lectures on slow-motion and attempt to decipher the transcript. Has a heavy accent. Quizzes also seem to be on material from the last lecture or two instead of the lectures from a week ago, so prepare to bomb every quiz, every week.

Professor Hafuta was an amazing professor. You could approach him after class if something in lecture didn't make sense. YOU MUST GO TO THE LECTURE BEFORE THE EXAM. He will go over basically what every question on the exam will be but with different numbers. I was able to finish with over a 100 in the class because of this.

summary_comment: Professor Penneys excels in clarity, providing students with a detailed understanding of expectations and exam content, and allowing the use of cheat sheets during exams. However, his lectures are fast-paced, leaving little time for breaks. While his homework load is significant, he offers practice midterms that closely mirror the actual exams. His teaching style, though, can be challenging due to his rapid writing and occasional difficulty in clarifying complex topics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Penneys is highly effective in clarity, clearly outlining expectations and exam formats, and allowing the use of cheat sheets during exams. However, his lectures are fast-paced, leaving little time for breaks. His teaching style is less engaging, as he writes quickly and sometimes struggles to clarify complex concepts.

Ratings.comment: This is the prof you want for 2568. He's VERY clear about what he expects (as far as what you need to know, both for the subject matter and for the exams). He lets you use a cheat sheet on exams too, which is really nice. Only thing I'd prefer was different is that lectures are very fast paced. Expect to be writing constantly with few breaks.

Homework was due every class period, so there was a lot. Midterms weren't too bad if you understand the material and also the fact he gives practice midterms that are just like the actual midterms. The thing is his teaching isn't the best. He rights super fast and isn't the best at clarifying or explaining anything.

summary_comment: Professor Lam is an adequate lecturer who possesses a strong grasp of the subject matter and effectively prepares students for exams. While his lectures can be somewhat dull, he consistently delivers valuable content. The homework is manageable but time-consuming, and the course includes a significant number of midterms (five in total).
summary_comment_short: Professor Lam is an adequate lecturer who possesses a strong grasp of the subject matter and effectively prepares students for exams. However, his lectures tend to be somewhat dull, and the course is marked by a high volume of midterms, making it less than enjoyable for students.

Ratings.comment: "I weep for you" - Adrian

Professor Lam was a good lecturer but nothing super special. He knew his stuff and got us prepared for the exam. Lectures were a little bit boring but overall a good professor. The homework wasn't all that difficult they just took a while sometimes. There was a ton of midterms though 5 in total which was not very fun.

summary_comment: Professor Holmes is an effective lecturer who clearly explains complex concepts, making calculus accessible to students. He is highly engaged and passionate about teaching, which enhances the learning experience. While some students find the material challenging, they appreciate his availability and commitment to helping them understand the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Holmes is an effective lecturer who clearly explains complex concepts, preparing students well for exams and ensuring they understand the material. His passion for mathematics is evident, making him a highly recommended and engaging professor.

Ratings.comment: He's a good lecturer. He understand the departments goals, so he teaches in a way that prepares you for the way questions will be given. Overall he cares for the student, will try to engage the students in the lecturer so that students may receive immediate feed back

Very mixed feelings. Sometimes I think he cares a lot for students but other times found it difficult to approach him and he doesn't seem to be very understanding sometimes. By no means a bad professor but when one test determines your grade for the course (final) I think more preparation could be done on his part and show up to the review day

Hands down the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He takes some of the harder concepts, and really breaks them down and explains them in a way everyone understands. Calculus by nature is a very difficult class and he does an amazing job of making the class reasonable.

Prof. Holmes is a top-shelf dude. He explains well most of the time, and only occasionally gets ahead of himself. He's super available outside of lecture, even if you can't make it to office hours. He's really in to math and teaching, and it shows in a good way! Definitely recommend this guy.

Professor Holmes is amazing. He's like a dog but instead of getting excited about tennis balls and treats he gets excited about math. He's just so passionate and wholesome. All around a great and caring professor.

Really good professor. I suck at Calc and I wanted to cry everyday but he makes you want to cry less. I took AP clac in high school and this doesnt help. Probably would have failed if I had any other professor. Highly recommend.

Super nice and chill dude. He was always excited to teach, so it made it enjoyable. He used many examples, which is helpful. The class overall was somewhat difficult. The tests and quizzes took the examples we used to a higher, unseen level. Even though I took AP Calc in high school, I barely got a B.

He's a really clear lecturer, makes things very simple and easy to understand. Granted I took AP calc AB in high school, but I didn't pass the test. If you struggle with math, I highly recommend him. Also, he teaches with a lot of application type examples, things like you will see on the exams.

A bit hard to grade since I took Calc AB in high school, but he seemed to cover everything accurately, though the long definitions didn't help. I went to class, but it was mostly stuff I knew already. Class didn't feel like a chore though because he was genuinely interesting even on something like Calc 1. Tests are fair if you pay attention.

Dr. Holmes ran a very good lecture for MATH 1151. The class is tough, but the department makes the exams, not him. He explained concepts very well, and he would often start off with easy examples and then progress to exam-level difficulty examples later in lecture. He would usually walk around and talk to students before class started as well.
My favorite professor in OSU!!So amazing!!! I love him very much!!! He can make Math easier than you think it was. Easy A due to his teaching!!! I want to meet him again!!
Very good lecturer! He taught us in an extraordinary clear and detailed way.

He's one of the best Math teachers in OSU. Although the class itself is tough, John is good lecturer and he's trying his best to make what he taught understandable. He cares about students and wants to help. He curves by situation so that your grade will not be terrible. Take his class.

This course is really toughbut professor Holmes is a funny guy and always trys to explain those abstract theroies clearly. He is not a tough grader and gives  as many as partial credits as he can in exams.

John Holmes is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. Really cares a lot about teaching, goes out of his way to explain things in an easy to understand manner. Textbook was not required, he made his own homework assignments and explained things slightly different than the book. Very helpful outside of class.

summary_comment: Professor Miller is known for his rigorous teaching approach and high standards, particularly in Math 3345. Students find his exams challenging and his grading strict, often citing issues with formatting and word choice. While some appreciate his thoroughness and preparation for future studies, others describe him as difficult, arbitrary, and potentially demotivating due to his harsh grading and perceived arrogance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller is known for his rigorous teaching methods and high standards, often described as challenging and demanding, particularly in Math 3345. Students note his meticulous attention to detail, including proper formatting and precise wording, which can lead to significant deductions if not followed correctly, though many also appreciate his thoroughness and preparation of students for exams.

Ratings.comment: If you take Professor Miller for Math 3345, be prepared to study. He gives practice exams that are very helpful and the homework is not challenging. However, the examinations are very challenging and will test your knowledge of the definitions in the textbook. He will grade your handwriting and will give you a zero if you do not follow the format.

Don't take his classes. Heed the warnings. Grading is arbitrary and unnecessarily harsh. He's too full of himself to give meaningful feedback, excoriates you if you ask questions, and talks down about everything (students, school bureaucracy, other professors, the book, high school education) except for himself and how smart he is.

By far the worst professor I've ever had. He expects nothing short of perfection. He'll take points off your exam just cause he doesn't like your wording. Going into the final, the average from the midterms/quizzes is a 50% and he refuses to curve the class. Probably going to be retaking the class, but definitely not with him.

I onetime got a 16/20 on a midterm question simply because he thought the way I wrote pi wasn't good enough.  He is the hardest professor I have ever had, he is the most stubborn professor I have ever had, and he is ridiculous. Nevertheless, if you are studying Mathematics, he is the only 3345 professor that will truly prepare you

Chris Miller is a extremley strict teacher. That being said everything he does will push you to be better if you take his teaching methods the right way. It is very easy to get frustrated when you get a zero on an assignment for having wrong margins. But if you show up, and listen carefully, you can come out of this class a better math student.
Worst teacher ever. He always made mistakes and he could not make himself clearly.

He makes a 300-level math course more difficult than needed. He prides himself as being the most difficult of the sections. Although he is very picky and quite difficult, he is a good guy and a great teacher overall. Hint: follow his homework guidelines! (Else, be prepared to receive a 0 for going beyond the margins.)

I enjoyed taking Math 345 with Dr. Miller last fall. He does a good job presenting the material and is very thorough in his expectations. He requires a lot of work, but what did you expect if you're taking math classes? He's pretty funny if you go to office hours. He can be pretty arrogant, but once you get over that you'll be fine. I got a B+

Probably the hardest math professor at OSU, but certainly the best. Hard as nails on homework, but by the end of it you'll feel like you can write a paper. Great in class, but reading and homework are a must! He's also a great guy, funny and opinionated: he made sure we knew how much he hated our book, or how the 190 series is set up, or...
The hardest professor at OSU, probably. Honestly expects at least 25 hours of work a week. Very hard tests, no curve. Very clear, intelligent lecturer. Funny. Interesting. But SOOOOOO much work.

Excellent, prepare to be frustrated, all for the greater good. I worked my butt off for a B-, but I think I learned more with him than people learned with other professors.  He has done this for awhile.

Miller is a hard professor.  He expects students to understand basic proof and logic structure prior to class (which he feels is just simple English).  However, he taught me an unbelievable amount of mathematics and definitely prepared me for higher level classes.  The class was extraordinarily worthwhile!

I learned so much from professor Miller.  The class was very difficult, but I think that I had a much better experience than I would have had if one of the easier teachers taught the class.  This class certainly prepares you for later honors math classes.
No Comments
He is the worst math teacher I have ever had.

He did a reasonable job with a very difficult course.  He assigned homework systematically and made his expectations very clear.  He is very demanding in ways you wouldn't expect (you may lose points for bad grammar or overly small margins, for example).
This guys is Satan himself.  Avoid at all costs.
This guy is insane. He could intimidate prison inmates. However, he is an excellent instructor. Unbelievably clear and helpful.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Mathematical Logic IV: Computability Theory

summary_comment: Professor Altomare is highly regarded by some students for his engaging and thorough lectures, sense of humor, and willingness to help, though he is noted for lengthy lectures and potentially harsh grading standards. Other students, however, find him unprofessional, disorganized, and difficult to follow, citing issues with clarity, preparation, and grading practices. Overall, opinions are divided, with significant differences in student satisfaction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Altomare is widely regarded as engaging and thorough, with students appreciating his clear explanations and willingness to help. However, opinions vary significantly, with some finding his lectures lengthy and his grading strict, while others warn to avoid him due to perceived unprofessionalism and confusion in his teaching.

Ratings.comment: I had him for Physics 111 and I absolutely loved him. He was funny and thorough in his lectures. Lectures could be a little long but he covered what was on the exam exactly. He told us exactly what we needed to know and did as many examples as we needed. Easy going grader, lots of partial credit. Always ready to help with anything he can

I loved his class!  The reviews online had me scared, but Chris was one of my favorite teachers.  He is funny and engaging, and if you talk to him he is willing to help.  You will definitely need to study and work hard, but it is worth it.

Worst professor I've ever had. Extremely unprofessional and disorganized. Only 8 homework grades and midterms only had 5 questions with barely any partial credit given. He is unclear and tends to make many confusing mistakes during the few examples he gives. STAY FAR AWAY!

I absolutely loved him as a teacher most people complain about his grades how hard he is but if you look at the classes most classes he teaches are the ones that transition to harder ones so if you don't understand you pass the class you will  do worse next year
Worst professor ever. Cannot give a proper lecture without making mistakes and preparing you for his exams.
Absolute joke of a professor. Awful at his job do not take a class with him.

Arrogant, and just mean in general. Tries to be funny by making sexist comments or whatever and can't stay on topic to save his life. Literally will go through a whole lecture and at the end mention that you don't need to actually know that. DO NOT TAKE

This is for MATH 1118.  He stopped using book half was through to try experiment. Doesn't dress professionally( Pjs). Makes sexist jokes on class and doesn't care. Believes that giving us sample questions for the exam or even telling us what to study degrades or degree.

Showed how to do example problems, but didn't explain the theory very well, which was problematic when the final was (unexpectedly) mostly multiple choice theory questions. Willing to help and answer questions when asked, but it is still often unclear. Study as much as possible, and have drinks ready after each exam.

This course is extremely difficult. You have to want an A in order to get it. If you are not use to the whole "studying thing" get use to it. Without more studying, other than homework and for quizzes, you won't pass. Study more than just the night before. Also he is really funny, but very difficult to follow and understand, goes really fast.

Everyone here is complaining about him, but honestly it's just the class itself that's really tough.  I felt as if he did a good job explaining every required concept for the midterms and final, plus he was funny.  The material itself was very difficult but it was no fault of his, friends w other lecturers struggled as much if not more than I did.

Altomare is indeed a smart individual; he knows what he talks about but he is NOT a good example of what a lecturer should be. In general he stresses about theory over physical applications which in an engineering-based calculus course is not what one should be doing. If you have him, don't drop him unless you NEED a competent lecturer to learn.

Altomare is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. If you end up with him in your schedule, switch ASAP. He is more interested in theories and real life application than actually teaching and preparing you for exams. 1172 is hard enough, don't let this guy make it harder. Hes also a stand up comedian. Lectures are about as bad as his jokes
Probably the worst professor Ive ever had. Makes zero sense. Learn from the book and dont go to lecture.

Switch out!!! Worst prof, especially night classes. Before each quiz he would tell us, "If you look up, I will kill you." Very rude, poor lecture ability, and make concepts more confusing. No help at office hours! Teach yourself from the book to pass the tests. He even emailed my class telling everyone they are going to fail out of college. So BAD.

He is not fantastic by any means. Exams were really easy though. I slept almost every day and still got an A. If you take him for who he is he is pretty ridiculous and funny to listen to. I recommend asking random non-math questions; he will have fantastic answers.
Decided he wasn't going to curve the class to FEH standards...so very few people got A's.

Horrible professor. Ask a question and he wont answer it because he "wants us to develop math sense on our own". Switch out and if you cant rely heavily on your TA. Possibly go to another lecture it helps. Exams are extremely easy though, got a 100 on 2 midterms and final
Not much to like about this guy other than his tests are easy.  Material is confusing at times, and he claims the tests are hard but they're not bad

Had him for linear algebra...he didn't even know the material very well and made mistakes frequently while teaching. Thankfully his exams were super reasonable because attending lecture was basically worthless. I taught myself linear algebra.

His Linear algebra examsinvolved a lot of little details which amounted to a lot of points. Many times on exams a problem that took 30 min was worth the same as a problem that took 2 min. His way of solving problems is much easier but different from the book. However he dosen't teach you the little tricks. You have to ask question then it is ez A.
This man is about as useful as his left arm! At least I think it was his left. It's been a while since I took the class.

Arrogant and unhelpful.  I was optimistic after the first class but it goes downhill really fast. He was never prepared for lecture, had horrible lecture notes, and insults anyone who asks questions.  I recommend attending Ms. Miller's lectures.

Pretty much everything everyone says about this guy is true. You can tell he is extremely intelligent, but he should not be teaching. He often shows up late to his own lectures. He's arrogant, unhelpful and he made an easy class much harder than it should have been. I highly recommend that you avoid him, or hope that you have a great TA.
Just horrible all around. I only went to a couple lectures before I started going to a different lecturer with someone else in my class.

His entire teaching consists of him saying how much better he is than you and rambling about random things. Going to his lectures are useless. Spend the time reading your book instead, and just go to all the recitations.

This guy is absolutely horrible. Switched out of his class promptly after he spent three lectures literally teaching nothing. He ran an extra credit help session in which he didn't help at all, but merely stated that he didn't know how to use excel or complete the assignment. I honestly don't understand why OSU employs this guy.
wow. worst prof ever. stopped attending class within two weeks and improved drastically.

Everything you've heard is true. He starts the first lecturer of the quarter saying everyone tell your best injury story. You think he's funny but he doesn't teach anything. Rambles on and on about other stuff but I'd advise you to switch teachers.

Altomare tries to really hard to teach but i don't think he is just meant to. The guy is should just another occupation in math cuz he is really smart but he just doesn't know how to teach the content. Only went to lecturers when it was exam time. If it weren't for my T.A. i would not have stayed in the course. Hope this helps
ok, in all honesty I though altomare was a god awful lecturer. It was pretty common for his examples in class to be not even close to midterm/final caliber. Also, he is rarely on time for anything.
Worst professor I have ever had, should not teach at all. Switch classes if he's your professor, or go to the lectures of another professor.

if you see this man is teaching your class, run. You will learn absolutely nothing. the first day of class will have 250 plus students. next week maybe 40 if your lucky. you're also lucky if he shows up on time. If he even shows up..
Very hard to understand. Try another professor, unless you have an awesome T.A., you will be out of luck.
Shows up late to class. Lots of rambling
Horrible... he sucks to the extreme...he stay wearing them short shorts....learn to teach

bad really really bad. not helpful at all. always tells us to drill and that we should practice the stuff we are learning, but never actually teaches it to us. he starts out the course all cutsie trying to get your approval but then just confuses you with random crap that he later says is useless. he made me hate math

Horrible lecturer. I was fortunate enough to have an amazing TA and also a tutor, or this class would have ended badly. I only went to lecture about once a week, and always regretted it. I left lecture feeling more confused than when I went in. He rambles on and on about nonsense stuff and is terrible at explaining even the simplest concepts.

Absolutely useless as a professor; if I hadn't covered the most of the material in high school/had a good TA this class would've been very difficult. He is very unprofessional, and spends lectures going on about the importance of math while not teaching the subject. It's not impossible to do well in this class, you just have to do it on your own.
horrible teacher, i stopped going to his lecture after the first week and went to my friends teacher instead. does not explain anything in class. i HIGHLY recommend switching teachers

He knows calculus but cannot teach it. At all. The book is quite useless in examples. I would not have passed on his instruction and the book alone. If you have this professor, the MSLC will be your best friend.
Just absolutely awful.  Did nothing for attending Lectures, rambled on about nothing.  I advise to sign up for another professor.

He is terrible at explaining anything. He spent 20 minutes one day saying infinity = BIG. He either over simplifies things to the point where the concept is lost or tells you that you'll never use something and give a terrible explanation of it. He attempts to be humorous and sometimes is but more often then not it makes him look like a ****.
avoid him at all costs!!!!!

Because of this guy, i have not gone to a math lecture in over a month and my grades have improved in doing so. i highly reccomend skipping the lecture and just spend the time reading the book and attending your ta's office hours

At first I thought I was really going to enjoy Chris.  However, as the quarter comes to a close, I realize I did not enjoy my time spent in lecture and I hardly learned anything.  I learned so much more from my TA.  Chris made many mistakes while teaching and my TA made very few.  I highly recommend finding a different lecturer.

Chris's lectures are impossible to follow, he constantly makes mistakes while doing problems and doesn't realize it until he gets to the end and the answer is wrong, then everybody gets confused as to what is going on. He has made understanding math more difficult for me. I suggest looking through the book and not going to lecture to do well

He rarely introduces general methods for solving a problem. He does an example REALLY fast and then asks "Do you get it now?" Then, when the inevitable "NO!" comes back from the class, he just moves on to a more complicated problem and tells us we need to understand it for the midterm. Going to lecture is almost useless.

Lecturer now, not TA. Currently looking to attend different lecture.  Often reacts with annoyance to any questions.  Makes frequent mistakes in his examples.  Teaches solely through doing problems, but usually doesn't finish them or adequately explain them. Exams very hard  thus far, and he offers no practice tests (other profs do, find them) Avoid

Mr. Altomare is a very bad lecturer. At first he appears to be a fun, interesting teacher, but you soon learn that he is fairly arrogant and terrible at teaching his students. He frequently screws up when teaching math problems, and fails to explain how to do such problems. You are better off teaching the material to yourself.

Let me say, I got an A+, with no help from Chris. I stopped going to his lectures and learned it on my own. He came to class never prepared. On his birthday, he BEGGED us to sing him happy birthday, and was gonna cry if we didnt. Also, if he had a substitute, he would almost cry if we thought they were better, which they were. SWITCH NOW!

He ruined my GPA because he's a miserable man. Even if you have every necessary person on your side he still will not help you. He doesn't care about disability or close deaths. You cannot miss any midterm or final for your best friends funeral. He also does not answer or return calls or answer emails in timely matter.

Chris is the worst teacher you could ever have. He never came to class prepaired.  Always confused on what he was teaching and then would blame the students when he didn't know what to teach because knowone knew what questions to ask.  He may seem funny but for paying big $$$ you learn nothing from him.  Rely on the tutor rooms or your TA

He's a funny guy, but a terrible teacher. He doesn't explain things well at all and a lot of the time he screws up problems. He's likable as a person, but as a teacher he's arrogant and rather unhelpful - I recommend finding someone else.

Smart guy, horrible teacher. He is super-intelligent, and he knows it. He seemed to make up the lecture as he went along. He wore pajamas to class and encouraged students to do it. You're better off learning math from Gabba Gabba.

WASTE OF TIME!! Has to be the worst math prof at OSU. He is never prepared for lecture and all he does is make mistakes. If there is another lecturer available SWITCH NOW! If I didnt take calc in High school I would have failed out of this class. Very cocky and not funny at all. Also never posted office hours the whole quarter
Math lectures are pretty terrible no matter who your professor is. At least he has a decent sense of humor.

Arrogant is an understatement. Does not have time for students, continuously freaked out when ppl whispered. Always threatened to kill the person that was whispering, but usually just kicked them out of the classroom. He thought he was SOOOO funny, but ended up wasting a lot of my time. I self-taught myself the material since the TA was worthless.

Worst TA I have ever had hands down. He is so arrogant and cocky and never helps students. Every class he would go through problems half way and not finish because he thinks that we can do  the problems on our own. Also he will ramble on about how he runs marathons and swims, which have nothing to do with math. He will never get laid.

Being Math 153, course material is hard, but he makes it as easy and simple as possible. Explains everything great, and is HILARIOUS. I've never laughed so hard in a Math class. Best TA I've had by far. Really interested in helping students. Great TA and highly reccomended.

He's pretty cocky, and will make a decent amount of mistakes.  Also, he's kind of a ****.  I'd suggest a different TA, he's just not very willing to help you out, ever.  Also, the environment of his classroom is similar to that of the BMV.  You'll survive through the class, but if you can take someone else, go for it.

I had Chris as a lecturer.  I attended every class but ended up relying on my textbook to teach myself.  He was a little arrogant which made me feel uncomfortable in approaching him with questions.  I would recommend another teacher if possible.

He wasn't that bad of a TA. He did go through things very quickly, and often made mistakes. He had test every week, which were pretty simple. He always would answer questions if you had any, and was very helpful. Overall, his class was easy.
Great as a TA.  Very clear, and very good at clarifying.  Always an entertaining class period, and always a helpful one.

Possibly the worst TA.  He goes through everything really fast and explain things in ways that are hard to understand.  Often he will start a problem and be unable to finish it because he can't figure out where he messed up.  Students have to point out his mistakes frequently.  Recitation offers no help and the only reason I go is to turn in homewo

I had him as a lecturer, and I have to say that he wasn't that helpful. He went quickly through problems without slowing down to ask for questions. He was very unclear and didn't seem interested in his students. He was a little arrogant,and by the end of the quarter barely anyone was going to lecture. Not the worst, but pretty bad.

I went into this class after taking high school AP calculus.  I ended up having to teach the class myself normally because Chris couldn't explain many of the concepts clearly.  Take another TA if you can.
Chris was last to class everyday and was never prepared to teach. He did NOT prepare us for exams and was very unhelpful in explaining new material. DO NOT TAKE THIS TA.

Chris is an AWESOME teacher.  these "midterms every week were 4 question 30 min quizzes that were easy.   He made math fun, and his class was easy.  You really learn a lot without actually doing a lot of work. He is very lenient on grading.

Arrogant and thought he was the best teacher in OSU math since Brutus Buckeye, but in reality, wasn't all that good.  Had a midterm every week causing me a lot of stress.  At least he spoke English unlike some of the others...

summary_comment: Professor Gautam is highly regarded for his clear and thorough teaching methods, with well-prepared material and legible handwriting. He goes above and beyond to ensure students are well-prepared for exams through detailed reviews and accessible lecture notes. His passion for mathematics and dedication to student understanding make complex concepts more approachable, and he is known for his willingness to provide additional support during office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gautam is highly regarded for his clear explanations and well-prepared lectures, with straightforward material that effectively prepares students for exams. His passion for mathematics and dedication to student understanding are evident, making complex concepts accessible and ensuring students are well-prepared.

Ratings.comment: Very nice professor, with well-prepared material, good handwriting, and clear explanations.

Material presented in lecture was really straightforward. Before each exam, we would do a review which was great preparation. Lecture notes were posted online in you missed class but I would recommend going because what we went over in class was what showed up on the exams.

Professor Gautam was truly amazing to have as a professor. He has a noticeable accent, but that is about par for math professors. It is very clear that he cares about each one of his students and is willing to explain anything you need help with. The content is by default difficult but he tries his best to ensure you are well prepared for it.
He is really nice and responsible! And he makes complex concepts much easier to understand.

Really sweet guy. Has a bit of an accent, which I'm usually terrible with, but could understand him just fine. Really passionate about math and spends a lot of time giving background to what your learning that I always found interesting. Teaches theory well and is really helpful at office hours if you need extra help.
Good instructors! Clear with lecture notes. Homework easy and quiz easy. Highly recommend.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Applied Complex Variables and Asymptotics I

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Applied Complex Variables and Asymptotics II

summary_comment: Professor Golubitsky is highly regarded for his deep knowledge but is often criticized for his teaching style, which is heavily theoretical and proof-based, lacking in practical examples. Students find his lectures challenging to follow and frequently require additional self-study, particularly with his textbook. Despite the difficulty, his exams are generally easier than the material covered in class, and many students appreciate his expertise and approachability.
summary_comment_short: Professor Golubitsky is highly regarded for his deep knowledge and intelligence but is often criticized for his teaching style, which is heavily focused on theory and proofs. Students find his lectures challenging due to a lack of examples and clear explanations, necessitating significant self-study.

Ratings.comment: I found this class very frustrating. He rarely does any examples in class ever. He'll just introduce a topic and spend the hour on a proof. As a result, I never knew how to do any of the homework problems at all without spending a ridiculous amount of time on them. I would have given him a 1 if he didn't curve the class a ton at the end.

This course really required me to self-study a LOT, because the lectures are generally hard to follow. However, professor Golubitsky allowed us to use his online textbook for free, which was very helpful for me to understand the concepts. There were weekly homeworks, which can be challenging. The exams were not very hard, to be honest.

I cannot put into words how truly terrible this mans class is. His handwriting is chicken scratch (at best) and if you want to learn from the textbook because you hate his teaching style, GOOD LUCK because he wrote it. To give you perspective, I have never received anything lower than a B at OSU.

He's one of the smartest people I've ever met. Lectures usually didn't make sense & were very confusing because he had a hard time breaking it down to us, but after finishing up a chapter he usually did a good job summing it all up into useable information. His exams are surprisingly easy and as long as you know what you're doing it's a good choice

Professor Golubitsky looks like an extremely knowledgeable person, but his lecture is very theoretical. He hardly ever give examples or do problems like other math teachers does, which I personally find really annoying. He is also not very good at clarifying concepts clearly. So I need to self-study the text book for the most part of the semester.

Am fortunated to have prof Marty, and even be able to work with him. He is a wise and welcomed person. However, this course requires us to work more outside classroom. Proofs in hw sometimes get very challenging. Be sure to ask him questions. Go to office hour, and so on. The exam are purely knowledge base, Merely testing us understanding of Theore

Marty is a nice man but is maybe too smart for his own good. His lectures are EXTREMELY theoretical and proof based. He hardly ever gives examples of how to apply theorems; be sure to stop & ask him to show the class what he means. Weekly hw can get exhausting. Despite the lectures being very difficult and dense, his exams are surprisingly easy.

summary_comment: Professor Gutman is highly regarded for his deep understanding of the material and ability to make lectures engaging and clear. Students appreciate his fairness in grading, no surprises on exams, and willingness to accommodate late work and personal makeup times. While some note that his lectures can be lengthy and may require attentive focus, overall, he is praised for his effective teaching methods and supportive approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gutman is highly regarded for his deep understanding of the material and ability to make lectures engaging and clear, though some find them lengthy. Students appreciate his fairness, clear expectations, and willingness to help, though his classes can be challenging without attendance.

Ratings.comment: Gutman is a great professor. He clearly understands the material thoroughly, and is capable of making all of his lectures interesting, and clear. That being said you can pass the class simply by following his notes and not attending lecture. Just don't ask dumb questions and you'll pass. He makes it hard to fail, for sure.

Gary Gutman is the best math professor I have ever taken.  Even though he teaches math, he makes it as painless as possible. He is a good grader and he won't screw you over if you make minor mistakes as long as you understand the material. Definitely take him if you have the chance.

Gutman, he is a very inspirational man. I also took him at CState and I could honestly say that he is the best math teacher I've had so far. He is very helpful and wants everyone to pass. His lectures are long and he does stick to one topic for like two hours, which get overwhelming. To anyone though, take him! You will pass and you will get it!!!

I took him at CSTATE, in his 1151 CALC class. He is eccentric, although very very smart. He made all of his own quizes tests and homework which was great not to have to deal with the online HW junk. I highly suggest him to people who have never been very good at math, as he will help you very much.

This is the most fun I've ever had in a college math class. Gary is very laid back and funny. He's also so smart that he comes up with tricks to help you actually learn math instead of memorizing formulas like other math teachers do. He doesn't try to trick you on quizzes or exams.  He's just plain great.  I would take every class he teaches.

Gary UNDERSTANDS his students. He's a fair grader and won't take off point for silly mistakes as long as u know the concept. He creates his own homework assignments and quizzes and THERE ARE NO SURPRISES ON THE EXAMS. You will know what you will be tested on. He accept late works and gives personal make up times

If you just show up and try the class requires little studying. The tests are exactly like the homework. Save your money and don't buy the textbook. Sometimes he is too smart for his own good but he is an awesome guy and teacher. Really recommend this class!

WOW! Completely awesome prof.  The only math teacher I have felt actually cared about the students.  I went to his lecture even though I was not scheduled for his class. Awesome guy, funny and laid back.

He is the best professor I had for my math class ever... I never seen anybody like him. he is so laid back and he is so easy to work..HE IS JUST AWSOME and he is not very technical and organized person..  but he try to work around it. he could not turn his cell phone off.. and it goes off in class many time.. and that class was just fun..

summary_comment: Professor Manin is an effective but demanding instructor who sets high expectations for his students. His lectures are clear and thorough, though his blackboard writing and accent can be challenging for some. Students must work diligently, as quizzes and tests account for a significant portion of the grade, and homework is notably difficult. Overall, while the course is rigorous, it provides a strong foundation in the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Manin is an effective instructor with high expectations for his students, who must work diligently to succeed given that quizzes and tests account for a significant portion of the grade. His lectures are clear, though his blackboard writing and accent can be challenging, and the homework is notably difficult.

Ratings.comment: Nice person, average lecturer. You do need to work hard since quizzes and tests count for about 80% of the total grade. Some of the problems can be hard, but there are extra credits to make up for it if you screw up a little, and two lowest quizzes will be dropped.
The professor's blackboard writing and accent made me crash! Homework is also relatively difficult. To be honest, this is the most difficult course for me this semester.

Fedya is overall a good professor. He expects quite a lot out of students but has clear expectations and does a good job explaining material in lecture. The hw's that he gives are pretty challenging and lengthy and somewhat help you learn the material but, I feel the OSU textbook is not a very good and the lectures and hw's are all out of the book

summary_comment: Professor McNeal has received predominantly negative reviews, with many students describing her as verbally abusive and grading harshly, leading to changes in course requirements. Students also report feeling condescending and unprepared during lectures, with some suggesting that her classes are better taken elsewhere.
summary_comment_short: Professor McNeal is widely regarded as one of the worst math professors at Ohio State, with students reporting severe issues including verbal abuse, harsh grading, and a chaotic classroom environment that hinders learning. Despite a few positive comments highlighting her kindness and willingness to help, the overall consensus is that her teaching methods are ineffective and detrimental to student success.

Ratings.comment: Would not recommend taking Math 1125 or 1126 at Ohio State especially with McNeal. Not only has she verbally abused her students but graded so harshly. For the education program, we originally had to have at least a B- in this course but almost if not all weren't able to achieve at least a B- so they had to change the requirement.

One of the worst math professors here at OSU. I have been verbally abused by Betsy and her co-teacher, Jenny. The new 2021 MATH1126 is based off of outcomes, you will not get credit for the outcome if you do not get a 100% on your explanation. They do not use rubrics for your explanations. get the text book or go to a community college to take 1126

By far one of the worst math professors at OSU. You're better off just taking math courses elsewhere like C state. She continuously graded me so harshly. I tried talking with her about my progress and ended up getting verbally attacked. Her classes are basically just learning from our peers in our breakout rooms and hoping for the best.

I have never had a more condescending professor than her. I always felt like I was stupid whenever she would talk to us. She also didn't know what was going on half of the time and as a result the class was absolutely chaos and I really didn't learn anything; especially because she never finished what we were talking about if we ran out of time.

Betsy has been one of the best professor I have had so far. She is so kind and funny. Math 1126 is not easy but she breaks things down for students and does whatever she can to make it easier for them. There are weekly homework assignments but she gives good feedback on what you need to fix. She makes a horrible class, definitely more enjoyable!

I had Dr. McNeal for Math 1125 and she has been one of the best professors I have had so far. The course is in no way easy, but she will do anything to help her student do well. If you have to take this class, definitely take it with Dr. McNeal.
Such a nice kind professor. You can tell she actually cares about her students.

Not only is Betsy an amazing teacher but she genuinely cares about her students. In all my years of schooling I have never had a teacher care about me so much. She will make accommodations for you if you need them and make sure you understand the material given to you.

Betsy is my favorite professor I have had at Ohio State. She absolutely cares about her students and wants everyone to succeed. If you ever need anything, definitely contact her and she is very quick to respond. I am so thankful for Betsy!!

Betsy is so passionate about her students. This class is challenging, but if you go to office hours /tutor room, it will help so much. There is a lot of homework and make sure you go to class. Betsy really wants her students to succeed, so if you have questions or concerns, just talk to her. The class seems scary at first, but it gets better.

i had Betsy for 1125 and 1126. She really got to know me and was always super understanding and caring! The class is a lot of writing and explaining math and the homeworks have to be pretty detailed. Betsy gives good feedback and if you go to lecture, you can definitely get an A or a B! Betsy is awesome! I'd take it again!!

This professor is so passionate about what she does and  truly wants everyone to succeed in the class and become great teachers. There is weekly homework and it is not easy, but you can always go to office hours and the tutor room. She is always willing to help and will take note of who works hard and participates in class, so don't be shy.

Tough course,  get ready to put some time into it. Weekly homework (approx. five pages front&back if you want a good grade) and quizzes. Betsy's the best professor ever though, she's funny and really cares about the class and students. She's also very good at clearly conveying the material!

Betsy really cares and wants to get to know her students. However, you want to be on her good side. Recitation is just another lecture- learning new materials, so ask questions. Homework assignment due and quiz every week. If you go to the tutor room enough she may round up your exam grades. Get the loose leaf version of the textbook if you can.
Betsy is a tough professor that really cares about sending great teachers out into the world. If you care she will be your greatest resource, if you don't she will be your worst enemy

This class is extremely hard. I struggled to get a B, which is required to get accepted into the Early Childhood major. There is a homework assignment and quiz every week. The homework is as much as the midterms and final, so make sure that grade is a B or above. This class took a lot of time and work, but it is required. Go to office hours.

Betsy was a really great teacher. Her class was difficult but if you put in the work, show up to class, and come ready to learn you will be just fine. I barely studied for the exams and got a B- on all of them. As long as you do all the homework and pay attention in class you'll pass easily. I highly recommend Betsy as a professor rather than Vic.

Betsy is truly by far one of the most amazing and supportive teachers and people I've ever met. If you put effort into her class, she'll put the effort right back. This class didn't always come all that easily to me and I couldn't have succeeded without her. Love her passion and drive for education and teaching!
Literally the hardest professor I've ever had. I got a D on the first midterm so I went to her office hours to talk to her and she basically said I was screwed. No help whatsoever.

This class was awful. The homework takes hours to complete. The review sheets for the midterms and final had 50 sample problems on them with only the midterms and final with 4 problems. Worst class I have ever taken. Betsy was no help.
Tough x 20000

She is also there to you help you out. Very fair but also very understanding. Lectures were enjoyable and I never going to class. She will always answer questions and make sure you understand before moving on. Give candy and stickers sometimes!
Betsy is great. She will go out of her way to help you and make sure you understand the material. Attendance was a grade. She definitely believes in practice hard test easy, love  her!

Learned a lot about teaching in this class. Betsey knows a lot about the subject and will offer help if you seek it! However be prepared for she grades homework and exams very aggressively!!! And beware of a very difficult final exam!
Betsy was awesome! I learned so much in this class!

Prof. McNeal is one of the nicest ladies I've ever met. Explains things thoroughly but sometimes tends to be a bit confusing, because she can explain any concept in a variety of ways. Class material is somewhat difficult but overall not that bad. Also, go to the tutor room for help with homework and studying for exams. It's really helpful.

I would advise taking Betsy if you like teachers that are extremely descriptive. Betsy can explain nearly any concept in a plethora of ways. She is very helpful, and it is obvious that she wants the best for her students. My only  criticism of Betsy is that she sometimes expects too much explanation on homework problems. Overall though, great prof.

She's a great teacher! She really is good at getting the class involved, and does a great job preparing your for teaching. Also, she really makes a huge effort to not only make you able to teach ideas, but to completely understand why it works.

Had betsey for 105-107 and she's the best teAcher at Ohio state. Go to class and definitely go to office hours and the tutor room at least once a week. She always willing to help you out and is so nice! Will prob write you a great grad school recommendation If you go to the board enough!

Betsy is a great professor. You can tell she has a lot of experience teaching, and is very interested in what she is teaching. She really challenges you to do the best you can in the class. Get ready for lots of writing.

Betsy is AMAZING!!!! Take her if you can for MATH 105, 106, 107!  I always look forward to attending her lecture. It is a great class because she doesn't lecture at you, she helps you to understand why math happens.  You need to understand so that you can teach it to your own students.  Intense midterm, but easy.  BETSY ALL THE WAY!
Betsy is an amazing Professor.  She clearly cares about students learning and will push them to learn and make connections.  She is very supportive too.

There is a reason this professor is teaching future teachers on how to be good instructor. Exams are difficult, but she is very responsive and sensitive to the needs of her class and is willing to help them in any way she can. Just an excellent teacher.
She is a wonderful teacher.

shes an amazing teacher!  Shes really personable to the students and its not her priority to just get THROUGH the content, but she wants you to UNDERSTAND it-so she'll slow it down if the class doesnt get it and explain stuff in more than one way--our discussions were actually kindof interesting!  I was worried about the class but she was wonderful
i really think she is fantastic. very articulate and consistent. she is more than happy to talk about troubling ideas or explanations. this is a really challenging class, but i loved it.

Worst class I've ever had to take at OSU, but she is a good teacher.  She wants to see her students do well but she will push you to think.  It seems like it should be the easiest class but the quizzes and exams were hard because you never know if you explained them enough

She is a good teacher but one of the hardest graders I have ever had in college. Everything needs to be written out perfectly for her. You dont really have much choice in taking her since she is one of the only ones teaching Math 105-107.
The class was challenging, but Betsy is awesome.  She is willing to help you, but makes you think for yourself!  I recommend her!
A caring and wonderful teacher. Always willing to help. Knows each of her students as individuals. Very Smart and Encouraging.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: History of Mathematics for Middle School Teachers

summary_comment: Professor Hansen is known for his high-quality teaching, evident in his clear passion for the subject matter and his genuine desire to ensure students understand the material. While his classes require significant effort, an 85% or higher typically earns an A. The potential downside is that his online lectures can move quickly, and he frequently includes detailed proofs, which might challenge some students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hansen is an effective teacher who challenges students to excel, with clear enthusiasm for his subject matter. While his lectures can move quickly and focus heavily on proofs, this approach ensures a deep understanding of the material.

Ratings.comment: I liked Dr. Hansen. I wasn't sure what to put for difficulty, as he definitely makes you work for your grade, but also an 85+% is an A. It's obvious that he loves what he's teaching and genuinely wants you to understand the material. Potential cons would be that (online at least) he can go a bit fast, and he likes showing proofs for most things.

summary_comment: Professor Sun is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, clarity, and fairness. Students consistently praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly, provide thorough lectures, and ensure that exams align closely with the material covered. His responsiveness to emails and prompt grading with helpful feedback further enhance his teaching experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sun is widely regarded as one of the best math professors at Ohio State, known for his clear and thorough lectures, fair grading, and responsiveness to student inquiries. Students consistently praise his ability to make complex concepts accessible and understandable, with many noting his fairness in assessments and his dedication to helping students truly grasp the material.

Ratings.comment: Extremely nice guy, helpful and smart. Tests are (like most cases in OSU math) different from homework but a good grasp of homework concepts will mean decent performance on tests. Very responsive to emails and a fair grader. The best math professor I've had at OSU.

Professor Sun is 100% the best math teacher I've ever had. The lectures were very clear, explains the concept/theory and then shows great examples. The homework is difficult but very fair, same for exams. Everything you need is in the lectures, just take good notes. He helps you really understand the ideas, not just formulas. Also a super nice guy!

Truly outstanding professor. I just created a rate my professor account today so that I could write this review. His lectures were clear and thorough, and his exams were fair. Any time I had an issue, he was always quick to respond to my emails. Additionally, he graded assignments ridiculously fast and gave helpful feedback on them.

Without a doubt the best math teacher I have ever learned under. He makes the material very easy to understand and his homework and exams apply his lecture material directly. No tricks, no huge time commitment, fair grading, and excellent use of class time. You'll learn a lot under professor Sun, and he is very receptive to students that need help.

Sun is truly one of the best math teachers I have had at Ohio State. He tries his hardest to give students ways to visualize very abstract ideas. Linear algebra can easily mislead you, but he is always open for questions outside of class.
Amazing professor, literal mathematical genius

summary_comment: Professor Baker is an effective and caring instructor who deeply engages students with detailed explanations and a commitment to their understanding. While his lectures can be disorganized and his handwriting difficult to read, he is highly respected for his thorough knowledge of the subject matter and his willingness to help students outside of class. His grading is rigorous but consistent with departmental standards, and he is widely regarded as a great and supportive TA.
summary_comment_short: Professor Baker is an effective teacher who deeply engages students with detailed explanations and a genuine concern for their understanding and well-being. While some students note that he could improve in terms of organization and clarity during lectures, they consistently praise his dedication and willingness to help outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Baker is a decent professor overall. He could definitely work on a few things like trying to be more organized while lecturing, writing neater, and explaining a bit more. He is a really nice person though and will help you out a lot if you go to his office hours.

1172 is very tough, and Mr. Baker goes above and beyond to try and make it easier. He explains the concepts very in depth, and really tries to deepen your understanding of the topics. It's obvious he cares about the wellbeing of his students. He grades tough, but he makes it clear that he grades according to the department standards. Great TA.
Really goes the way to teach his students. Knows what he's talking about for sure!
Like how he laughs in class
He's really great afterall
Great Guy!

Despite acting nervous in class, there's really nothing bad to say about him. The class itself is hard, and he's trying to make it easier. People blame him on his grading, but he makes it clear that he consults his superiors for how they should be graded. He goes out of his way to teach students, and that's really respectable. Would recommend.
Nothing bad about him, he explains things very slow and clear. One of the best TAs i have had.
total boss. absolute genius. will suggest more powerful re-indexing if needed

Once you get past his quirks, he is a pretty great teacher. He knows pretty much everything there is to know about math, always asks for student input, and explains everything in great detail. He goes out of his way to help you, but you have to ask him for it. He is a pretty tough grader, but its more to help students on exams when it matters.
He was a very helpful TA and went out of his way to do well. He seemed extremely nervous, but I felt like he taught the material clearly.

Don't take him. He's very good at his work but cannot teach or explain well. He's difficult to comprehend and confusing. I only passed (barely passed, at that) the class because I took Calculus in high school and worked from what I could remember. Also grades rather harsh and takes off high points for small mistakes.

Just trust me, DO NOT take him! Too difficult and very fast at times. His quizzes are set to where if you miss a part of the problem, then you are set to fail that entire quiz. Tests are not made by him, but his grading scale is pretty rough. I recommend taking a different teacher!!

summary_comment: Professor Kodama is known for his challenging and dense lecture notes-based teaching style, with a focus on exams rather than homework. Students find his lectures difficult to follow without additional resources, and many require significant self-study and office hours support. While he offers ample extra credit opportunities, his teaching can be hard to grasp, particularly in the later sections of the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kodama is known for his challenging and dense lecture notes, with a focus on exams rather than homework. His teaching style can be difficult to follow, and some students found it necessary to rely heavily on teaching assistants and office hours to understand the material.

Ratings.comment: When I took this prof he taught the class online, no lectures just very dense lecture notes. No homeworks, only graded on exams. Class average for exams were around 30-50% including bonus points. Showed up late to his own office hours online.

Difficult to understand. Can't teach yourself because he doesn't follow textbook. Asked for another textbook to teach myself and he refuse to recommend me one. Dropped after learning there was no reference material
Be prepared to study yourself. He's good at doing Math but definitely not teaching it. A lot of the things he said in class only make sense to himself

He is very difficult to understand and his teaching of the material did not make sense. Everything I learned this semester was from my TA and I spent about 3 hours a week in office hours. The practice exams he gives are almost identical to the exams and he offers extra credit on some quizzes, but there's no homework grades and he grades hard.

Yuji is the kindest and smatest man in the world and if you have any respect for math, fashion, or the human spirit, you will love this class. also theres a TON of extra credit. Doesn't make you take the final if your grade is real high.
The course isn't hard, listen to the course, then easy A.

At times he was hard to understand especially during the last section. He gave a lot of opportunities for extra credit on the quizzes. He actually cared about how the students were doing on the weekly quizzes. There was no assigned homework but he always gave suggested problems for each section.

Yuji Kodama is a wonderful teacher and gives ample opprutunity for extra credit throughout the semester on the quizzes to make up for lost points on the tough midterms If I had to knock prof Kodama for anything, it would be his teaching of partial diff. Up until this last quarter of the material he was fantastic but this last section was sporadic

Very poor at explaining. He will give you a theorem and show the proof, but not show how to actually use the theorem. He also does not give explanations on how to do the homework problems. When tests come it is almost impossible to know how to do the problems because you have not been taught how to use the theorems.
