Kodama is truly one of the worst professors I have ever seen in my entire life. It is an insult that I paid money to take his class. He sped through the material, he is very difficult to understand, and when students ask questions, he is amazed that we do not understand what he means. He also refuses to grade or post solutions to homework problems

Dr. Kodama is extremely fair. His quizzes are over the basic concepts and principles, and his exams are extremely fair. Guaranteed to pass if you do the homework, especially since HW problems usually show up on the quizzes/exams.
So tough. The exams are much harder than anything we practiced on. Hard to understand. We had a midterm on the day before the final. Avoid if possible.

He is one of the worst teachers I've ever had and should be avoided at all costs. I used to be a math major but he changed that and now I'm glad it is my last math class, even though I have to retake it. Can't understand him. Doesn't teach in accordance to book. Exams don't relate to class. Many many curveballs. Avoid. Avoid. Don't sign up. At all.

No calculator on exams/quizzes. TA grades harshly on assignments/exams. Exams very difficult/unfair at times. Class is barely curved, if at all. Hard to understand; flies through material too and doesn't leave time for questions. Avoid/switch sections if possible.

This class was very difficult. Not clear on anything that he taught. He usually would just write down stuff on the board without really explaining what it meant. He assumed  we knew things that there was no way for us to know. When someone would ask a question, he never would truly answer it or didn't understand. The tests were incredibly difficult

Learned a lot from the class but it was extremely hard.  Assigned 10 HW problems from every section. 3 sections a week, 10 problems graded each week.  Paired with an awful TA and will be surprised if anyone passes. Can never use a calculator.  All of his examples come from the book. Tries to help though. 1st midterm scratched, 35% avg. Impossible.
Tests are completely unfair.  Very difficult to understand
Be prepared to spend hours doing impossible hw, and to do poorly on exams.  Material is presented confusingly.
I would rate him average.  I learned a lot in class but also a lot from the book.  His final was ridiculously hard
Seemed fair to me; gave practice problems very similar to exam questions, and the curve was good. Helpful, works lots of examples, but might go too quickly when introducing new material.
Very difficult to understand. I even went to office hours. I had to ask the grader for help. I learned more from the grader in 4 hours then from Kodama in the whole 10 weeks.
His class is very hard. The homeworks weren't so bad but the quizes and tests were horrible. Don't take Vector with him, grades agianst the students and those that do poorly

Not that great at explaining new concepts, but is one of the most helpful professors I've ever had in office hours.  Very patient, just make him let you do the problem instead of him racing off and doing it and you'll learn a ton.
Tests are significantly unfair. Questionable grading policy.

summary_comment: Professor Wendlandt is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being well-prepared, articulate, and detail-oriented. His lectures are challenging yet meaningful, and he provides ample support through office hours and accessible communication, ensuring students succeed. Students consistently praise his clarity in presenting difficult material and his commitment to their understanding and success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wendlandt is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching, known for being well-prepared, articulate, and detail-oriented, which makes his lectures both challenging and meaningful. Students consistently praise his accessibility, the quality of his explanations, and his commitment to helping them succeed, often recommending him to others.

Ratings.comment: I had Curtis for Group Theory at the U of S and upon finishing it, I think he was one of the best math profs that I had. He is extremely well prepared, articulate, and detail-oriented. His lectures were heavy, but meaningful and I would recommend Curtis to anybody. The assignments were difficult, but there was always purpose behind them.

Linear algebra for me was difficult because it's more abstract, but he made my experience so much better. He goes through content at a reasonable pace and really wants you to succeed. There's a lot of homework, but GO TO OFFICE HOURS. It is so helpful and he often walks you through the problems so that you understand them. He's one of the best.

Prof. Wendlandt is a great professor! While lectures are required and are amazing, there a lot of office hour opportunities to ask questions. Material is presented in a easy to understand manner, but the homeworks and exams will test students for sure. Homeworks were challenging, but doable. Exams were a bit tricky, but mostly fair aside from time.

Curtis is an amazingly nice and funny person. He did an excellent job teaching the linear algebra material and gave really helpful feedback and answers to questions. He posts all his class notes and recordings of office hours. Would definitely take a course with him again!

Linear algebra is inherently a difficult, heavily conceptual course. However, there is probably no better professor than Curtis to have for this class. He proceeds at a reasonable pace, takes time to answer questions, is easily accessible and very helpful through emails and office hours, and is overall a great, funny, and cool guy.
Fantastic professor and cares a lot about his students.

Prof Wendlandt is an incredible professor! Although the content in this class can be tough, he explains it in a clean and thorough way. Homeworks can be challenging, but his office hours are really helpful, and the hws prepare you for exams really well. He's really nice and wants his students to succeed, definitely recommend!

Prof. Wendlandt is amazing! The course material is difficiult in of itself, but he presents it in a really clear way, using both theory and examples to teach in lecture. Also - go to his office hours! Those are extremely helpful and you will get a clearer idea of what to expect on exams.

Prof. Wendlandt is clear, knowledgeable, enthusiastic about his subject, understanding and accessible. His class in great - it's a little bit higher level math (more proofs and more conceptual understanding) but he delivers the material well and is easy to understand and follow. His expectations are very clear and his exams and grading fair!

Rarely does examples in class and often just seems to read definitions. He expects you to "learn from the ground up" and has said that doing more examples would defeat the purpose of a math class. His teaching style makes the class exponentially more difficult and the homework takes hours. Do not recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Terman is widely regarded as an effective instructor, particularly praised for his clear preparation for quizzes and exams, easy-going nature, and accessibility. However, his teaching style can be inconsistent, with some students finding his lectures monotonous or difficult to follow, while others appreciate his straightforward approach and helpfulness. Overall, his exams tend to be straightforward if students pay attention in class, but the final exam can be unexpectedly challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Terman is widely regarded as an effective instructor, particularly for mathematics courses, with many students praising his preparation of students for exams and his approachability. However, opinions vary significantly, with some students finding his lectures monotonous and unhelpful for exam preparation, while others appreciate his straightforward exams and accessible teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely love Dr. Terman. He is an amazing professor. Grades in class are based only on quizzes and exams. However, he does a great job preparing you for the quizzes and exams. Also he's really accommodation with final grades in this class.

BEST MATH professor in OSU!
Very nice person with very easy exams! Easy A!

Good class, boring/droning lectures and examples were pretty long and involved, but homework was pretty easy if you took solid notes. HOWEVER, the final consisted of borderline-graduate level work. First and second exams I got an 85 and a 96, got a 45 on the final. I'd recommend his class, but that final was a gut-punch.

TRY YOUR BEST TO AVOID! He never comes prepared, basically reiterating the textbook. Ended up teaching myself more than half of the materials. Very monotone and lectures are all over the place. Often makes mistakes in lectures, confuses himself and the class, then says "anyway" and moves on without explaining. Won't recommend him at all!

He gave one homework assignment per week and it usually took about 5 to 10 minutes because he goes through most of the problems during lecture. His exams are extremely simple as long as you've been paying attention to lecture. He is easily approachable and wants to help everybody.

Great teacher! You have to remember guys, anyone who teaches Calculus 1 a lot is going to have a mediocre rating at best because its the first semi-challenging math course students take, so being the narcissists that most freshmen are they pass all the blame on to their teacher. So his rating here is terribly misleading. He's a really good teacher.

A good math teacher teaching diffential equations. Several class to get used to his voice volume. Listen carefully during class. Take notes. Homework are all from book so not really hard. Two exams are not really hard if you take notes from regular class.
Did not like his class at all. Did not clearly explain things. Lectures were not geared towards helping to do well on midterms and finals. Very disappointed.
He's very into what he's doing which is a very nice thing to see in a professor. He's honest with you about your midterms and tests. He does whatever you need help with and knows his math very well.
Really a fan of this guy. Not the most energetic, but he has a dry sense of humor that really keeps you interested. He explains concepts really well and makes is fairly easy to understand.
Boring and can't hear him past the 3rd row
Average math teacher - not amazing but not terrible either.
Great teacher. Contrary to the other comments, he actually does well at explaining concepts. Go to class with your brain active and a desire to learn and you'll do good.
Nice guy, but doesn't seem to care much about teaching. He walks in every day and just starts with a random math problem and usually doesn't finish anything. His logic doesn't make much sense either.
likely incompetent or just not that interested in teaching.

He doesn't seem to want to teach the class, arriving late every day. He never has anything planned, he just walks in and asks if anyone has any questions. I understand he's a great researcher, and probably a nice guy, but if he doesn't want to teach, he shouldn't. He seems more suited to being a TA than a teacher. If you have him, switch ASAP.
A great teacher, if you know what you're doing prior to the class.  He is very interesting and always is good for a laugh.

How can I describe Terman?  The man isn't clear on anything, his examples never work out the way he plans them, and cannot reason to save his life.  He seems very overwhelmed.  The TA was very helpful though.

I really didn't like his teaching style. He doesn't give clear examples, nor does he finish the ones he gives. He doesn't cover all of the material, and he is in general not clear when explaining a concept. He is a very nice, laid back guy though.

Very laid-back friendly teacher, made class fairly easy. Would skip sections he didn't like, and would let us leave class early on Fridays sometimes because he probably figured we didn't really want to be there anyway.
Great teacher.  Friendly, funny, and extremely interesting.  One of the best math professors I've had at this university.
good sense of humor

summary_comment: Professor Dawes is known for her challenging yet doable approach to teaching linear algebra, with some students praising her understanding and willingness to accommodate students' needs, such as allowing a late exam section. However, many students find her lectures less effective and the material difficult to grasp without additional resources or external tutoring, citing harsh test grading, poor communication, and a lack of supportive study materials. Overall, her teaching style and course difficulty vary widely among students, with some finding it nearly impossible to succeed without significant
summary_comment_short: Professor Dawes is known for being a dedicated and understanding lecturer who helps students, as evidenced by allowing a student to take the final exam during a later section. However, her teaching method is largely lecture-based, and students find her explanations and communication style challenging, leading to difficulty in grasping concepts and performing well on exams.

Ratings.comment: This course is not easy, but it is doable if you show up to lectures and study well for exams. Dawes is a great lecturer and very understanding; she let me take the final with a later section when I slept in past my section's exam- literally saved me from failing. Averages on exams were low 80s, so not terrible

Linear Algebra is a difficult subject so be prepared to study, a lot.  Dr. Dawes however is a fantastic person who is willing to work with her students.  Her office hours are great experiences and she is a great communicator in general.

Worst professor ever. Every time a student would ask a question, she would respond with another question. The tests were so confusing, and there were questions on there that we never went over in class. There is no curve/extra credit. Does not provide a lot of study resources. The book is useless. The only reason I passed was because of my tutor.

Professor Dawes lectures are essentially useless. She teaches straight from the book, and most of your learning will be done through recitation. Although she is a very nice person, she is not a good professor. Most of your grade will be from tests, which are graded harshly. Save your GPA and take Calc with another professor.

She is very smart, but she does not communicate the ideas well. We were also very underprepared for exams. Also the exams were HARD. She doesnt curve any individual assessments, just a final curve on the class, so you wont have an idea of your final grade until near the end the of class. I took Calc my senior year and got an A, got a C in hers :(

Biology majors  save yourself and just take calc 1151. It is fairer in terms of grading. I have always been good at math and took calc my senior year of high school. I passed with an A. Prof Dawes is clearly an intelligent person, but so bad at explaining anything. She overcomplicates everything in a way where you feel like u are actually stupid.
So bad does not explain

I understand calculus. I have taken a college calculus class before and received an A. I thought Id be fine in this class, but that was simply not the case. I have never had a worse math professor. Do not be like me, you will not be fine, take another class!!! I do not know anyone with a grade higher than a C, and there is NO CURVE.

I have never had a professor or teacher that I didn't like. That is, until I took her class. I'm a math person and still had extreme difficulty. She makes the content way harder than it should be. The first two midterms had an average grade of below 55%. and she DOES NOT curve. Had to drop this class and I am retaking it with someone new.

This class was the worst way possible to start college as a first year. DO NOT TAKE IT!!! save yourself by taking 1151 instead. Professor Dawes, while smart, overcomplicates simple calculus topics and makes midterms unimaginably difficult. the only thing that is saving my grade is my TA. Seriously, save your gpa and your pride and don't enroll!!!
a piece of me dies every time I attend one of her lectures. She over complicates and rushes through every topic. Lectures aren't even worth attending because she will just confuse you.

VERY few example problems done in lecture combined with a far-too technical textbook used for homework problems leads to students hitting a brick wall each week on how to do homework problems and therefore the midterms. Homework averages consistently in the 70% range. The lecturer knows a lot about the subject but this course is NOT organized.

I would not recommend taking her class to anyone. Yes she offers up office hours, but she does not offer much insight when you go. Midterms are very difficult and the only way to do reasonably well in the class is to get lucky enough to have a fantastic TA. Smart woman, not great at communicating the information to students. Take 1151!!!

Dr. Dawes is clearly very intelligent about mathematics. However, she does not do a good job communicating and sharing her knowledge with the students. Going to lectures is not even worth it. She will confuse you, and the practice problems done in lecture are far easier than any you will ever see on an exam. Recitation saved my grade.

She is a terrible professor to take as a Freshman. There should be a wider range of math 1156 professors so that most could avoid taking her. She doesn't give many outside resources, and those that she does give are from 2013. Take 1151, you will have more resources available to you. The third midterm was extremely difficult and there was no curve.

Dr. Dawes is very nice, and it is easy to tell that she knows a lot about Calculus. However, she is not always the best at explaining calculus concepts. She uses very complicated examples in class that don't always relate well to homework or exam questions. I had a good TA, and he is the only reason I've been able to get a good grade in this class.

Dr. Dawes is a very nice and intelligent lady, but lacks the ability to teach the calculus material well. Problems are overly complicated and they do not help to prepare students for exams. On one occasion, she created a test knowing that the class average would be an F; she admitted this to us in lecture. Take 1151 and save yourself the stress.

Way over complicates everything. Lecture is practically useless. Recitation is your only savior. (Just know that her tests will ask questions MUCH more difficult than was on the homework or in practice problems). Also when the entire class failed a midterm, like badly, she told us she expected the grades we got for that midterm??

Dr. Dawes was a poor professor. She over complicated the simplest concepts. She will turn you away if you ask for help on the homework and is quite bad with communication. Only reason I survived is because of my TA. The book is terrible with explanations too, so I suggest tutoring and Khan Academy. Do the suggested book problems & GO to recitation!

I found professor dawes to be pretty straightforward.  She covers the material well, sometimes not as clear as you might want, but she will answer questions at length and provides office hours that for me turned out to be very helpful.

She just wrote definitions and didn't really teach anything. I've taken AP Calc before and she made it way more complicated in the way she explained things. She was extremely unhelpful. I learned nothing from lecture. I learned everything during recitation. I wish I would have taken 1151

Her examples and ways of explaining the material were very confusing compared to the ones in the book or done by the TAs. You can't use graphing calculators like the other calculus classes and there's no curve.

Nice lady but not very helpful in class. her examples and assigned homework were way harder than they needed to be. She would ask for questions then if someone asked something she would say good question but I don't have time for that and come to office hours. I did well in precal but struggled with her.
Honestly one of the worst teachers I have ever had. She's a smart lady, but a terrible teacher. Your only chance is if you get a good TA

It was very clear from day one that she has a very strong grasp of her subject but absolutely no clue how to convey that information to her students. Do not take this class. You will have much more success in 1151.

She seems like a nice person, but she teaches straight from the book with examples that are next to impossible to understand. When asked questions, all she answers with is "it's something you learn with experience" or "because that comes out with the best result", which doesn't teach us anything. At all.

summary_comment: Professor Neofytidis is highly regarded by many students as one of the best math instructors in the department, known for his engaging lectures, clear explanations, and availability for extra credit opportunities. However, his teaching style can be challenging, particularly for those who do not attend class regularly, as attendance significantly impacts performance. Some students find his lectures confusing and his methods of providing extra credit unfair, while others describe him as condescending and unhelpful during office hours. Overall, his effectiveness as a teacher
summary_comment_short: Professor Neofytidis is widely regarded as an excellent lecturer, known for his passion and involvement in the classroom, and the availability of significant extra credit opportunities. However, his teaching style can be challenging, particularly for those who miss classes, as attendance is crucial for understanding the material, and some find his lectures and tests demanding.

Ratings.comment: Even though I utterly failed his class, I can't hate him. A great lecturer, passionate about his work and tries to get the audience involved.  Test are difficult, but reasonable with study.  In this class attendance is not mandatory, but you will not succeed if you skip class. I regularly skipped class and paid the price.
man he was just too good!

Honestly, he is one of the best math professors in the department. He teaches the curriculum clearly, gives loads of extra credit, and is extremely reasonable (he let me off with a late homework). If you are taking Lin Alg, do it with him. You will not regret it.
If you actually show up to lecture your grade will improve by a lot. Lots of extra credit available. Pretty helpful in office hours.
Worst instructor ever.

This has to be the worst math professor I have taken at OSU. The class itself is not hard but his lectures are very confusing, and the method of extra credit is very unfair with the ability for one student to receive all the points and leave the other students struggling. Do not take this class under this professor, not worth it.

He is very condescending and rude. Is not helpful during office hours and seems to not want you there. He has only 3 tests in his class each point on the test is a percent of your grade. The homework is hard and his lectures are fast and confusing. Study the textbook and do your work to pass. You "can" get extra credit on assignments but you won't.

The class is test heavy, but there is a lot of extra credit. Each homework assignment has the potential for extra credit. All exams were curved by 10 percent. You have to go to class to know what proofs you need to memorize, but his lectures are very good. He is reasonable with the amount of homework he gives too. Best OSU Math Professor.

summary_comment: Professor Malen is highly regarded for his engaging and interesting lectures, which reflect his genuine passion for the subject matter. However, some students find his approach to be confrontational and uninterested, especially when asked questions. Recipients of his assistance, particularly as a Teaching Assistant, praise his clarity in explaining complex concepts and his willingness to help students outside of regular hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Malen is highly regarded for his engaging and enjoyable lectures, where he clearly demonstrates his passion for the subject matter. However, some students find his approach to be somewhat rigid and unapproachable, particularly when it comes to handling questions or providing support.

Ratings.comment: Fantastic professor, truly one of the best professors that I have had so far as an undergraduate. Lectures are always engaging and interesting. You can tell that he truly enjoys the material and offers questions for students to think about in their free time if interested. The class itself was somewhat difficult, but that's due to the material.

Malen is my least favorite professor! If you ask him somewhat of a dumb question, he will definitely be irritated and show signs of anger. He doesn't actually care about his students. Lecture literally seems to be just his "job" that he has to fulfill.

Saved my semester in MATH2162. My lecturer never really did any application problems, but that is all we focused on in recitation. Greg is a great guy and really cares about his students. He makes confusing concepts very clear and easy to understand.
Very Good TA, basically what got me through the course since the lecturer wasn't all that great. More than happy to go out of his way to help. Highly recommend him.

Solid TA- one of the first I've had in the Math Dept. that speaks and understands English. He made a couple of mistakes working problems, but he always caught them and apologized. Good-natured, friendly, helpful.

summary_comment: Professor Hermiller is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging personality. Students appreciate his clear explanations and commitment to ensuring understanding over rote memorization, making even challenging topics like calculus accessible. His accessibility, use of technology like Remind, and supportive approach contribute to a positive learning environment, helping students succeed and even enjoy the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hermiller is highly regarded for his engaging and effective teaching methods, making complex mathematical concepts accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate his clear explanations, accessibility, and genuine desire to help them succeed, often citing his humorous approach and comprehensive support outside of class.

Ratings.comment: The secret to finally understanding calculus is having a professor who also happens to be a stand-up comedian at heart. Hermiller will also answer any math-y questions you may have as he clearly wants to see his students understand the underlying concepts without just memorizing a pattern or formula.

I had this professor in Highschool and man was it great to see him again in College, he is easy to follow for a tough class.  His class is very fast pace, and although he give out a lot of hw, they are more so for extra credit.  He is very accessible outside of class, and uses remind to make sure your following along the hw and quizzes and test.

I hate math and I thought I would hate a 2 hour lecture even more but Mr. Hermiller made it enjoyable. This guy moves quick but always makes sure that you're following. His note taking process is amazing and he really does want to see you do well. If you have the chance take 1148 with him. He will teach you better than any professor.
1148 is a tough class, but he is very helpful. He wants yo to succeed. Class pace is fast, but his notes are great.
Amazing teacher.
Great class! I was terrible at math in high school and really nervous to take this class. Mr. Hermiller was very helpful and truly was there for the students.
BEST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD AT OHIO STATE. He literally sets his students up for success. He is a funny guy, yet at the same time you get a lot done. I enjoyed his class throughly.
Hermiller is a great teacher. He's simple, straightforward and takes his time to make sure everyone knows what they are doing.

Mr. Hermiller was an excellent teacher. He also teaches high school during the day and does night classes at OSU. I knew mostly everything he was teaching but he helped me develop other ways of doing the math. He adds humor to the class and his teaching is very thorough

Mr. Hermiller is an exceptional teacher.  I had not taken math in over 25 years and I was very nervous. Mr. Hermiller teaches in a simple manner without making you feel 'dumb.'  It is also obvious that he really wants the students to learn.  I wish he could teach all my classes.  Great teacher!
Absolutely the best math professor that I have ever had.  Very helpful, very knowledgable, and a cool guy overall.  Made math class fun! One of my favorites of all time.

I had not taken a math class in ten years and was not looking forward to this class. Mr. Hermiller was excellent. He tried to get to class early and always answered questions clearly and concisely. I wish I could take all of my math classes with him!
GREAT teacher. I wish he could have taught all of my math classes. Very helpful in and outside of class and made math, dare I say.. fun =P

I honestly HATE math but Mr.Hermiller was an excellent teacher. He was always willing to help in anyway at anytime. He gave sample quizes before every quiz and also provided sample exams. If I had a chance I would absolutely take a class with him again!
I actually had him for 104 first but liked his teaching style so much that I enrolled specifically in his class for 148. Funny (in a dorky kind of way;), energetic, and a great teacher.
Really cool teach.  Learn some stuff, got an A. What more can I ask for?

Professor explained everything very well.  Recomend this instructor for anyone that has a fear of taking math courses at the college level. does a great job breaking everything down.  does most of his lecture with the use of pretty good powerpoint presentation.  Does not take attendance.
great teacher take his class

summary_comment: Professor Xing is an effective lecturer who explains material clearly and provides numerous examples, enhancing understanding. He begins each class with a review of previous content, aiding retention. While his classes require significant time commitment, particularly for weekly homework, students find him kind, patient, and approachable, recommending him highly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Xing is an effective lecturer who explains material clearly and provides numerous examples, enhancing understanding. He is also known for his kindness, patience, and approachability outside of class, making him highly recommended by students.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Xing was a good professor. He explained the material well in lecture, and did lots of examples. He usually spends the first 10-15 minutes of class reviewing the material covered in previous lectures, which was very helpful. The weekly homework is time consuming, so don't wait until Thursday night to start it, or you won't get much sleep.
Very kind and patient. Approachable outside class. Super helpful. Definitely take him.
Very quiet speak sit near the front of the class.

summary_comment: Professor Garrett's Teaching Quality: Based on student feedback, Professor Garrett is highly regarded for his exceptional TA, Reeve, who is described as extremely knowledgeable, responsive, and passionate about the subject. Reeve's recitation handouts and quick grading are particularly praised, making him one of the best TAs at Ohio State, with many students giving him top ratings.
summary_comment_short: Professor Garrett is highly regarded for having exceptional TAs, particularly Reeve, who are known for their thorough knowledge, responsiveness, and ability to fill gaps in the professor's lectures. These TAs provide invaluable resources and support, making complex topics more accessible and ensuring students are well-prepared for exams.

Ratings.comment: Reeve is the best TA I've had so far, he is extremely responsive via emails, makes up for the contents where the Prof doesn't do a good job teaching. His note sheets are very useful especially when it comes to the content after midterm 3 (heat &wave eqns). Very knowledgeable, easy to approach, does an excellent job explaining concepts, awesome guy!

Best TA I've had at OSU! You can tell that he is very passionate about the subject and makes sure his students are too! His recitation handouts were extremely helpful and he did everything he could to help us out. He graded our quizzes and tests very quickly which was much appreciated! Would 100% recommend him.

Reeve has been by far the best TA I have had at Ohio State. He is quirky, caring and overall passionate about his profession, math, which is seen in his teaching. Where the prof lacked, Reeve picked up. Lectures were not even necessary with Reeve as TA. Also grading was done so fast! 10/10
Great TA, his weekly handouts are 90% of the reason I passed this class. Quizzes could be a bit rough sometimes, but ultimately they were good practice for the exams.

Easily the best TA I've had at Ohio State. Goes through the problems somewhat fast during recitation, but always ready to answer questions. Not too difficult of a grader, but he does sometimes ask for definitions to prove your answers in the take-home quizzes. His section guides are KILLER too (I think he wants to be a textbook writer). 10/10

Reeve is  by far the best TA I've had at OSU thus far. I had him for MATH 1172 and MATH 2177, and I firmly believe I wouldn't have passed either of those courses without him as a TA. Lectures were horrible (very scatter-brained professors who were hard to understand) but I was able to learn the material quite well in recitation.

If you have the option to have Reeve as your recitation TA, he's the man. Even if you come to class confused, he'll teach the problems better than the lecture content, which for this class was often overly conceptual. He goes through concrete examples very clearly. 10/10. Best TA in my college career thus far.

Nice guy, though a little awkward and doesn't always take the easiest approach. Still, he fills the cracks that are left from lecture and makes sure any questions you have are answered. He really cares, and he really wants to help you. Super fast grader too - expect exam scores to be posted the morning after you take your exams!

summary_comment: Professor Lewis is known for his relaxed teaching style and thorough coverage of material, making it nearly impossible to fail if one completes the minimal homework and attends class. He responds promptly to emails and returns assignments and grades quickly, and his practice exams effectively prepare students for assessments. However, some students have found him unhelpful and strict about grading, particularly if alternative methods are used or work is not presented in a specific way.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lewis is known for his lenient grading policy, making it difficult to fail if one completes the minimal homework and quizzes. He is described as thorough, patient, and helpful, often covering material in detail and providing clear guidance for exams.

Ratings.comment: It is literally impossible to fail i his class. If you do the homework you will understand the work. The material he teaches is stuff I learned in High School. The homework is only worth 2 points and the quizzes are worth 5 points. Attendance is worth extra credit but is worth it in the end. Nice guy when you get to know him.

Answers all questions and tells you if methods other than the ones he teaches work to find the answers to math problems. Responds to emails quickly and returns assignments and tests grades in an fast manner

Lewis is a great example of one who can teach. Relaxed class atmosphere. Covers material thoroughly. Answers more questions than any Math teacher I've ever had. Patient. Go to class, do homework ask questions in class. His practice exams tell you exactly how to prepare for the midterms and exam. Everyone can get an A or B in this  class!!!

I did not find him to be helpful or understanding at all. He does not care if students understand the material or not. . If the answer is wrong you get 0 credit no matter how much work is shown. Even if you get the answer right, if he does not like the way you did your work you will get a 0.
Very good and helpful instructor. Do the homework and study guides and you will be fine.
Do the homework and do the practice midterm and you will do GREAT

summary_comment: Professor Bomba is highly regarded for his caring approach and thorough explanations, though his lectures can be dry and notes require active participation. Students appreciate his availability during office hours and quick responses to emails, and many recommend attending his lectures and supplementing with additional resources like online podcasts. His tests are described as fair and easy, provided students complete the weekly homework on time.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bomba is highly regarded for his dedication and clarity in teaching, making complex concepts accessible to students. While his lectures are thorough and his explanations clear, they can be dry and require active participation, as notes are often not posted online and must be taken during class.

Ratings.comment: Professor Bomba is very caring and tries his best to make sure his students can understand the lecture and gives adequate prep before exams.
Hes Awesome! My favorite professor! Never met anyone better!
Mr. Bomba is the littest math teacher this school has seen. He's funny and energetic and has a good attitude.

Dr. Bomba explained concepts throughly and was always willing to answer questions. However, his lectures were very dry and the notes are not particularly well organized. You have to fill in the notes at lecture because they're not posted online. You can print or type the notes-I would recommend printing because the notations were difficult to type.

The lectures are powerpoint slides that are fill in the blank so you have to show up to get the notes, but he does a good job of explaining everything and gives good examples so if you show up and pay attention, you should not struggle at all

Professor Bomba is a great teacher. He is very straightforward, and his tests are fair. The online homework is difficult but does not count toward that much of your overall grade. You get graded assignments every week in recitation, so you have to go. Going to class is not mandatory, but if you don't have the notes from class, you won't pass.

Bomba is great in office hours and responds to emails quickly. I recommend going to his lectures AND listening to Debra Rumsey's online podcasts as they include different things when explaining the same slides which really helps you put it all together. Online homework due every week is tough but everyone has the same questions.

Pro. Bomba is a really amazing teacher. He always clarify the concept very clearly. The test is very easy. If you do the homework by yourselves, you can get a really good grades at end. But for this class not allowed for late homework. Overall I will recommend this class to everyone.

Professor Bomba is fantastic. The class is difficult at times but Bomba is always welling to stop and go over whatever you need to make the material easier. In this larger class, Bomba does a great job at making it feel small. The tests are tough but fair, he is very clear about the material you are expected to know. Overall a great professor.
Chris Bomba is a great professor but the class is tough. He is super nice and is willing to help during office hours. If you do the homework and review often, you will be just fine in the class.

One of the best Calculus instructors I have had. Friendly and helpful. High workload with assignments and quizzes, but if you do the assigned work, you will definitely get a good grade. Two thumbs up!
He is very helpful
Very helpful teacher. Creates a good learning environment. Gave me information on Actuarial Science which was great because he himself is an actuary.
He is awesome.
Very good teacher

I thought Chris was very helpful. As he teaches he goes through every step making sure no one is lost, and is very helpful in office hours as well. I was definetly prepared for the material on the midterm.

Chris is a great teacher that truly takes an interest in the subject and his students' comprehension of it.  He grades the homework on complete perfection but his quizzes and tests are completely fair.  DO THE SUGGESTED EXERCISES!

I took night math because I was told it was easier but our class was the hardest math 152 class. He didn't allow us to use calculators but we took the same tests as the other 152 classes that could use calculators and were graded on the same curve.  I think he truly tried helping, but 15 hours of homework and webwork a week was too stressful!
Nice guy, and very helpful. Tests are fair but the homeworks are very lengthy and graded on pefection.

Nice guy and a very good TA. he explains material very clearly and he exactly knows what is expected of him. His quizzes are not bad but if u dont study, it could get little hard. He actually grades the home work for perfection. Overall Great TA u can get.
Shy guy who tries to keep the environment lite. Sometimes covers useless steps. If you study hard and do the work, you will do fine.

summary_comment: Professor Koutsogiannis is known for his challenging classes, with exams that closely follow the textbook content. While some students appreciate his care and willingness to help outside of class, many find his teaching style difficult to follow due to a strong accent and a focus on textual explanations over visual aids. Students generally advise against taking his class unless absolutely necessary, citing the lack of practice exams, homework solutions, and comprehensive feedback as significant drawbacks.
summary_comment_short: Professor Koutsogiannis is known for his challenging exams and clear explanations of concepts, though his lack of practice exams and detailed homework feedback can make studying difficult. Students generally find his class demanding but appreciate his care for their learning, with some recommending attending office hours for additional support.

Ratings.comment: He doesn't give practice exams or any homework solutions. Homework is the only assignment you can study for the exam besides your notes. The grader will not mark everything you did wrong so if the grader didn't mark it you will probably study the wrong solution for the whole time. The average for our first midterm was about 67. Avoid if possible!

This class is difficult but Andreas explains the concepts well and gives fair homeworks and exams. Reading through parts of the textbook definitely helped because his test questions are directly from the textbook. Homeworks are short, but the best way to do well in his class is to read the textbook and practice the extra HW questions he gives.

He and his grader will never tell you if there is anything wrong in your optional exercises. However, exams are almost all from these optional exercises. His midterms and finals are heavy and you can barely finish them given a limited time frame. All my friends around me told me they hated him. Just drop it, if you are accidentally enrolled in!!!!!

I don't know why you guys give him such high ratings. His lectures were heavy and his homeworks were much more different than any other professor's. He will assign several exercises from the textbook to be homework. Some of them are required and the rest of them are for supplement. However, you will have to do all of them if you want a good grade.

He really cares about helping his students. This class is just hard in general. He has sort of a strong accent so it is a bit difficult to understand at times. Weekly homeworks and 2 midterms and a final. Not a super visual professor, he likes to use words and write out how to do things and not really show you. This class is just a lot of hard.
Solid professor for 3345. Has a slight curve at the end.
Andreas is a good professor. He cares about students and would love help outside class.
Very nice professor and cracks nice jokes sometimes. I would strongly recommend you to go to his office hours. Helps a lot with coursework.

Andreas puts a ton of emphasis on class participation. He sometimes got upset when no one would answer in class questions. On the flipside of this though, if you tend to answer questions in class, he'll love you. Material isn't too bad (a bit dry) until the last few weeks, at which point it gets so abstract it's hard to follow. Solid prof for 3345
Andreas just wants you to be successful. I felt like I got the grade I deserved. Tests were from homeworks. He gave us a small curve at the end

He seems tough at first, but every once in awhile he will say something so far out of the blue that you aren't sure it was really him who said that. Andreas truly cares about his students (which was shown when he seemed devastated after seeing the grades on our first test). He wants them to learn and understand. Just practice and you'll do fine.
Andreas has very hard tests but wants you to succeed. He had a hard test but cared about his students
Andreas excels in office hours and is very approachable. This class is extremely difficult, but he will help you. Material was crammed into the lectures, but that is the nature of the class

Math isn't my forte and this class was the bane of my existence. I spent over 20 hours a week doing problems and reading the book and honestly I'll be lucky to get a C. He said he doesn't like curving but the averages on all of the midterms have been in the low 60% range. Unless you love math- don't do it.
Absolutely fantastic office hours, but somewhat difficult tests, but not as bad when compared to the other sections.

If you're in his class, be prepared to write VERY QUICKLY because he talks at the speed of light. Add in his accent, and sometimes its hard to follow his explanations. Thankfully, I had a good TA, which helped a lot. The examples he does are nice, and he bases his test questions off of them, so they weren't TOO bad.

Andreas was a pretty good lecturer; did examples and made lectures available online. Was always willing to help if you went to office hours. Both tests and quizzes were really tough, so having a good TA would really help

summary_comment: Professor Franze is generally praised for his engaging and humorous teaching style, though some students find his lectures less effective due to his reliance on pre-written notes and tardiness. Despite these issues, many students appreciate his willingness to help and his ability to make difficult material more accessible. Overall, his classes are considered manageable, with homework and exams being key components for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Franze is generally praised for his engaging lectures and ability to make complex material accessible, though some students find his teaching methods less effective due to his reliance on pre-written notes and occasional tardiness. Despite these issues, many students appreciate his humor and willingness to help, and several recommend attending his lectures and recitations for a better understanding of the material.

Ratings.comment: Rlly easy class, but not a great teacher. Was consistently 5-20 minutes late to lecture, and would only talk over pre-written notes. Wish he had worksheets to follow along with his lectures. You could look at his notes at home & get the same out of it. Sad bc he's a rlly kind, funny & willing guy who just doesn't teach efficiently :(

He's okay when it comes to explaining math but his attitude towards us was just lazy and disrespectful. 10 to 15 minutes late every single time to a class that costs my family 1000s of dollars. Never replies to emails. Just talks over prewritten notes instead of working out problems in class. The OSU math dept. should pay students back their money.
If you do the homework in this class you will get an A. It is optional, but to study for exams I did the homework and my lowest exam grade was a 95 of all 4 exams. Super easy class, great professor!

I love this guy. When learning any math, you need a good teacher and this is your guy. I would retake calc anytime, anywhere if I always had him. He's really funny and cracks jokes. Exams are HUGE for your grade so study before them or you'll probs fail. Hw is super easy and recitation is easier. If you're nervous abt calc, take this guy.

Craig Franze is an amazing teacher. He is by far the best professor I have had thus far, as he was tasked with making the dry calculus material interesting. He was engaging in all his lectures, and always did everything in his power to make sure everyone was prepared for exams. Nothing but high praise for Professor Franze.

I genuinely think this is one of the best math professors I will ever have at OSU, this professor knows how to lecture and is always willing to explain further if you need it, just ask. My TA was great too, and I definitely recommend going to lectures and recitations. The only bad thing about him is that he takes a long time to respond to emails.

I found the lectures to be easy to follow and pretty helpful. The class is only composed of homework, quizzes, and exams, so there's not a lot of room for error. I think my TA really helped with my understanding of the material, but the homeworks weren't hard and neither were the quizzes. The exams were moderate but I never got below a B.

Good professor overall as long as you actually show up to class and recitation with your TA. Lecture time doesn't have mandatory attendance, however highly recommend being there as much as possible. He is very relaxed and appreciates those who participate. Also, be sure to go to math tutoring or your TAs office hours if you need help!

Great professor who really enjoys teaching and explaining things thoroughly. Also a really funny guy. Exams are worth 85% so it is very test heavy but he does his best to prepare you for each exam with practice tests that are helpful.

Could tell that he was new to lecturing this year. But, got more comfortable as the year went on. Tries his best in the big lecture hall to help everyone and answer questions. He is hilarious and makes jokes during class. I've had experience with Calculus in high school, but the way he teaches it clarified a whole bunch of questions. Great person!

I didn't get to pick this professor and was just assigned to the class. He sucks. Exams were worth 85% of final grade and were ridiculously hard. Gives practice exams completely different from actual test. Also writes with white chalk in small print on the chalk board in the 300 seated lecture hall. Could barely see in the front/middle section.

Took two weeks to respond to my email and only after I had to reach out to someone else. Does not truly explain himself when going through problems on the board so make sure you go to recitation

I did most of my learning through youtube videos and recitation

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Calculus and its History for Teachers

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Algebra and Coordinate Geometry for Teachers

summary_comment: Professor Morton has mixed reviews, with some students finding him helpful and engaging, while others struggle with his teaching style. Many complain that his lectures assume prior knowledge, homework and exams are poorly aligned, and the material is challenging without clear correlation to class content. Overall, his effectiveness as a professor is widely questioned, though some appreciate his availability and the potential for an easy grade with effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Morton's teaching quality is inconsistent; while some students find his classes engaging and helpful, others struggle with his approach, which often assumes prior knowledge and does not adequately prepare students for exams. Overall, his grading can be harsh, particularly for those without a strong background in the subject.

Ratings.comment: Nice enough guy, but he is not a good professor. He goes through material as if it's review and you already understand it, the hw is much harder and dosent correlate with what we do in class, same with even the exam reviews. He's a nice guy but the way his class is is not at all a breeding ground for success.
Really great at getting into contact with his students. Always there to help.
Although the textbook was helpful it was not required. Lectures were good and if you have any questions he answers them efficiently.
Worst teacher ever. Worst professor, tough to understand, forced to show an unnecessary amount of work.
this is the hardest professor, tough to understand, very insecure...i wouldn't take his class again

Dr. Morton is the best math teacher ever.  The class is fun just take notes and pay attention!!  attend every class.  Tests and quizzes are directly from the class teaching.  He is helpful and willing to answer questions.  Go to his office hours and meet with his, ask questions.  The tutoring center is very helpful.  I would highly recommend him.
Easy grade if you do all the homework and go to all lectures

Do not take this professor unless you already have calculus experience. One of the worst professors I have had. The exams are extremely hard, but the quizzes aren't so bad. He is very uncaring. He wouldn't even give me a half of a percent to bump my grade up to a c-. So now I have to re-take the course.

Prior to go to his class I hated math with a passion. /But some how through his odd way of teaching I'm actually learning how to do different kinds of math. I think he is better than my high school math teacher but sometimes he doesn't make any sense at all....

Hate to be rude, but he was the worst math instructor I've ever had. He was sarcastic to students with questions and he never explained anything. He lacked interest and he made quite a lot of students' grades suffer, mine included.
BOOOO!!!!!!! He sucks! That simple!

This class was a review for me, but you haven't take any of the material before, then I'd suggest finding another TA. The few questions I asked, weren't answered clearly and he could be confusing. To his credit, he graded quizzes fairly. Overall, thumbs down.
Terrible TA. Does not know how to answer questions or explain. It is useless to go to class if you get him. The only reason I went was for attendance. He is very insecure and it shows!
Horrible! and very very unhelpful

summary_comment: Professor Seress has a structured teaching style that can be challenging, but many students find her approach effective when supplemented with recitation sessions and additional study tools. While some students appreciate her efforts to connect material to real-world applications and provide detailed lecture notes, others describe her as unapproachable and condescending, particularly those who struggle with math. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some finding her teaching valuable and others strongly advising against her classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Seress has a structured teaching style that can be challenging, but many students find value in attending recitations and utilizing additional study resources. Opinions vary widely, with some praising her for making complex concepts accessible and providing detailed notes, while others describe her as unhelpful and condescending, particularly those who struggle with math.

Ratings.comment: Sherry has a structured teaching style, but can be a challenging professor. Recitation with the TA is key to learning the concepts. Utilize Unstuck study AI and other study tools to supplement the course materials.
In hindsight I'm glad Sherry was the first college professor I took because it opened my eyes to how bad professors can make a class way harder than it actually is.

Sherry was alright, she liked talking to students, answering questions and connecting material to the real world. She made print out copies of the lecture to fill in which helped me a lot. She did try to insert her opinions a lot, she related a math concept to how a boy can have multiple girls but a girl can't have multiple guys. She was weird.

At first I thought sherry was terrible. Then I took another math class here and missed her class. She prints out notes and actually does a range of problems during lectures. Even though there is a lot of material in a short amount of time, she makes it easy to learn.Homework (2 a week) and a quiz every week but she makes it east to understand!
The worst teacher I ever had.

Sherry was professional and accommodating when I had a few issues come up. She has a lot of material to get through in the short amount of time during the lectures. She does a good job of showing the steps if you follow along. Use recitation as a time to really cement these concepts and that will help you to go far in this class.

She was alright. I thought she taught the material well. I wouldn't search for her to take her class again but I wouldn't mind if I had to. I had a couple one-on-one interactions with her and she was slightly cold. If you don't attend her lecture you won't know what's going on because her posted notes are very messy.

please, Please do not take this professor's course. she IS NOT understanding, helpful or flexible even if you have disability accommodations.She is very condescending, my way or the highway and if you are like me and have sucked at math your entire life DON'T ask her any questions because she will humiliate you and make you feel stupid
She's not only rude and boring but just bad at teaching math. She teaches simple math in the most complicated way possible, leaving everyone in the room confused. Avoid her if you can.

Honestly, she wasn't that bad of an instructor. The lectures consisted of a small packet of notes that she did with the class. You need to buy ConnectMath to be able to do the homework. The homework ranges from 10-30 problems, depending on the section, and was pretty simple. She wasn't that energetic, but it still seemed like she cared.

I am not exaggerating when I say that this is EASILY the worst professer I've ever had.

I stopped attending lectures after the first week and *only* learned the material from Recitation (Caleb Dilsavor is an amazing TA!) and YouTube. She's an incredibly difficult professor to learn material from, don't bother going to lecture.

Sherry was a very difficult and stubborn professor to work with-- she is not very flexible or understanding. Her lectures are so hard to go through, she talks really fast and does not really explain things very well. Her handwriting is also very hard to read. I was able to pass the class because I had a good TA. Would not retake her class again.

Weekly quizzes that are one question and graded out of 10 points. Exams being 8 or less questions. Lecture was optional but hated when people missed - recitation is mandatory. She is not a good professor - barely gives explanations and when students have questions she tells them to ask during rec periods. Get ready to teach yourself the content.

It's true that Sherry is rude and acts like she's uninterested in teaching, but it's not bad if you have a good TA. There are two homework assignments per week, 1 weekly quiz, 3 midterms, and a final. Make sure to take advantage of your recitations because that's really where you learn the content since Sherry is not a great lecturer.

I was hesitant to even take this course after reading the reviews over the summer. While I don't think she is AS bad as the reviews stay, she is a difficult and stubborn professor. It's her way or the high way and she often goes on rants that are irrelevant to the material learned in class. She gave me a hard time wit accommodations and flexibility

she is incredibly rude and abrasive and often went on rants that had nothing to do with math. it honestly made more sense to not attend lecture and just go to recitation if you had a good TA. there is not many grades in this class so doing average on the midterms and final still gets you a poor grade. would not recommend.

Honestly, before the semester started I was a bit scared by other reviews, but the class and the teaching were NOT awful.  I recommend never skipping lectures because that's where you learn most of the information.  Plus the information found in these classes is not overly complicated or complex along with exams and especially the quizzes.
Her lectures are useless and teaches us how to do things the hardest way possible for no reason. Honestly has no clue what she is doing and a terrible teacher overall.

Genuinely one of the least helpful professors I've ever had. Unpleasant and will make you feel bad about having questions or not understanding something. Skipped the lectures most of the time because she is so unorganized and unclear. Class isn't too hard, but do not rely on her for anything.

Aggressive learner. Do not take this class if you're not fast-paced. She runs through the lecture quickly so be the person to ask questions if you don't understand. She runs through problems quickly and doesn't give you time to understand what she taught you before moving on to the next question. Expects you to know everything from start to end.

She is just awful. Passive aggressive, difficult to understand, very fast paced, horrible communication with students, and downright not friendly. She made what should have been a simple, straight forward class extremely difficult. Gives a ton of homework. Exams are easy on ConnectMath, but the quizzes are very exceptionally difficult.

As simple as college algebra should have been, Sherry made it nearly impossible to connect to the subject due to her terrible teaching tactics. She is a "my way or the highway" professor. She refuses to adapt to the simple technological advancements although they were literally needed to accommodate sick or disabled students (covid era). Avoid her!

Terrible terrible professor. Rude. I literally had to go back home to take care of my father who had been in a terrible car accident and so i missed a few assignments. I emailed her to ask if I could still complete them for some sort of credit and she fought me about! The old girl needs to retired. I do not think she cares about the students.

Quizzes are much harder than the practice problems we have for homework. You cannot makeup for any lecture participation points either, even if you are sick and provide a dr note. However, the teaching assistants were very helpful.

I had COVID and she made it impossible to get notes. She flies through the notes and just wants you to be able to regurgitate info. Quizzes are only 30 mins and very hard not anything like what is shown. The tests are online and open note so they are easier. Ignores when people have questions but gets mad when no one answers her questions.

Seemed annoyed when students had questions or wanted her to slow down in the lecture. Notes were often hard to read when she showed work in class and only sporadically accessible later on to review. Was not at all accommodating to COVID concerns and quarantines, and usually did not answer any emails sent to her about these things either.

Very passive aggressive lecturer. I did not like the environment created. Quizzes were hard, we only had 30 minutes, so review! However, mid-terms and finals are online through connect math so those were pretty easy.
Do not recommend going to lectures, they harm more than help.

Sherry is not the most amazing lecturer. She often goes quite quickly, and if you ask her to slow down, she can be pretty mean about it. She does often post the notes as long as people attend the lectures. But it can be super confusing to follow, and you end up having to do a lot of studying on your own.

This course is a nightmare. Recitation is mandatory and it is a waste of time. Midterms/Final are extremely easy, but quizzes are exceptionally difficult. You basically fend for yourself. Grade is curved but still not an easy course at all. Lecturer is not approachable and environment is uncomfortable. Things are explained horribly. Good luck.

She gives tons of homework and it seems to be way easier than the lecture worksheets so you never know what to expect on the quizzes or exams. Everything is very confusing and it’s nearly impossible to learn from this class.

I am very disappointed with this Professor.  I’ve never felt so under prepared going into an exam during  my time so far in university. Every exam so far there are problems you haven’t seen before or discussed in class. She skips steps often while working out problems which makes it difficult to follow.

Though the recitation is mandatory this isn't the problem with the class. The lectures aren't worth showing up either because the information that she does explain doesn't make sense for the majority of the class or due to the constant technical problems. Midterms were a breeze, but the quizzes are very difficult. Good luck

Recitation attendance is only mandatory, however, if you miss any lectures and email her for any recorded lectures, she will not email you back, ever. She is terrible at explaining any material and cannot use technology to save her life.
She doesnt explain how she solves the questions and gets straight to the point which confuses everyone in class
awful just straight up awful.

Her lectures were boring and confused me more than helped me. I started skipping the lectures halfway through the semester and just went to recitation. I think I learned more from recitation than the lectures.

extremely unhelpful. during my third lecture with sherri she told the class ill explain the things that are easy, but not the things that are hard. shes also very passive aggressive with her teaching and with people who ask her questions or send her emails. she also chooses to fill out the notes with a black sharpie on paper. no one can see.

It shouldnt matter how you get a math answer as long as the answers correct but she cares you have to do it her way. She said Ill explain it to you when its easy but not whens its hard overall not very good professor would not recommend her to anyone.

Professor never responded to my emails. Went in to go over my exams with her and she made me feel very uneducated. I would rely on my TA a lot to teach the materials because Seress does NOT explain anything.

I strongly recommend attending recitations and taking some time to study before tests. The lecturer tends to make simple topics sound hard and complex. Recitation helped simplify a lot of the content. Very easy to get a good grade as long as you do the online homework (usually very easy) and take time to review the material.

Professor Seress tries her best to answer any questions you might have, but she's always hard-pressed for time, so I always go to my TA. Her lectures are fast-paced as she assumes you already know previous topics, which can trip some people up. Other than that, she does a solid job making sure you know the material and it's up to you to practice.

Professor Seress was okay. Although the online lectures were not mandatory, if you miss just 1 lecture you will immediately be behind and confused. She never answered any of my emails and also her in person quizzes were so so difficult. Overall, okay professor. Got a 95 on my midterm and a 100 on final. Easy class you just have to put work into it.

Go to recitation they count attendance. Quizzes are pretty easy because its highschool review. Midterms are open note and online so pretty easy. Study for the quizzes and midterms though because they make up most of your grade. She records lectures which is nice to go back if you don't understand because sometimes she goes really fast.

I hated Sherry's teaching methods and learned more from my TA in recitation. I went to probably 3 of her online lectures and didn't retain anything so I turned to my TA and friends to learn from. She's not very accomodating.

The lectures were incredibly dense. The professor also went pretty fast in lectures and didn't have a lot of time to answer questions. The exams were very easy to miss points on since we couldn't show work or receive partial credit on any of the questions. I found the recitations to be helpful though.

Professor Seress is incredibly passive aggressive in lecture, through emails, saying things to students like, "I have no idea what you could even be asking that about", etc. Or when students must take a makeup quiz she referred to helping the students as something she unfortunately has to deal with tomorrow.

not the hardest but you definitely need to put in the work. there is a ton of homework and the quizzes are difficult to complete in time. would recommend going to the tutors, they are free and they saved my grade. also she is weirdly passive-aggressive during lectures?

Math 1148 was not the best, and a lot of it has to do with Lecturer Seress. Quizzes are fairly easy if you understand the material, but Sherry was not the most warm person and lectures were extremely boring and I had to teach myself the material myself. Honestly, not a great experience.

Sherry was an average professor. She didnt like students asking questions though, and would single you out for the entire lecture if you ended up asking one. Lectures were pretty boring and I learned more from recitation and connectmath. Attend recitation! Your TA will help it connect.

This class is a mix of material you definitely learned in high school and material that feels irrelevant and is oddly specific. Midterms and final are online, so its easy to miss points, and theyre also weighted quite a bit. TAs are good, homework easy and flexible.
Shes very uhhhpassive aggressive. Doesnt respond to emails half the time. Quizzes are barely reflective of the homework.

Definitely not a class that you can not pay attention in, but if you do you will get by. There is a lot of opportunity for homework to boost your grade and the midterms are rather easy compared to the quizzes which was the hardest part for me.

It seemed like everything in this class was explained in the most complicated way possible. The recitation quizzes are graded very tough and almost impossible to complete in time. So much material was crammed into a single lecture and I wouldnt have understood anything if my recitation TA wasnt good. The only good thing is the exams are online.
She wasn't horrible, but she goes WAY too fast in lectures. My recitation was the only reason I passed.

Honestly, the class itself is easy but Sherry is just so hard to respect which makes it hard to want to do the classwork. I recommend watching the lectures after she posts them to Carmen so you can skip through them since she doesn't explain things but rather just shows them. Just try to keep up and do good on quizzes bc thats the bulk of the grade

Horrible, horrible teacher. I learned all of this stuff in highschool and passed fine, but she's made it 10000x more confusing and is nitpicky about the exact method you use to get your answers on quizzes. Additionally, she has a horrible attitude and will berate students both on the zoom calls and during office hours. Do not recommend at all

This class just sucks, there's not other way of putting it. Sherry is fine. She's not amazing, but not awful. The quizzes in recitation are super hard and nothing at all like the notes or homework we do. The exams are pretty easy. I haven't gone on the zoom for a Sherry lecture since August and I'm doing just fine, the class just sucks.
Professor Seress prepares pre-lecture notes for students to use before each lecture. This is very useful for taking notes on exactly what we need to know. The class was by no means difficult.

The main reason I rated Sherry with a 3/5 is because if you have any extenuating circumstances, she is willing to work with you and help you get back on track. While her lectures weren't the best, if you go to her office hours you'll be fine. Just be prepared to take matters into your own hands in this class.
Pretty easy to pass if you have previous algebra experience. If you do the review PDFs that she gives then the tests are very easy to pass.

Math isn't my thing, but her lectures are too fast to learn anything, and she still doesn't have time to go over everything in the section. This happens daily. She doesn't seem personable at all. I don't feel like she cares about her students and teaches too many students for you to feel important to her.

Rarely ever answers her email or questions in class, moves through notes too quickly during lecture and calls out people rudely and by their name. Quizzes, midterms, and exams are the bulk of your grade, which means there is barely any wiggle room to fail. Despite assigning a lot of homework, its only worth 5% of your grade. The TA is great.
Terrible professor that does not care about you at all, literally listened to her call a student embarrasing

Not a good Professor. Math is usually hard for a lot of individuals and to ignore people's questions or not wanting to answer because " we should already know" isn't a professor that you should go for. If you struggle with math this is not a professor you should choose.

Sherry is quite possibly the worst professor I have experienced in all four years of my undergrad. She acts like she is put out by students asking questions and doesn't make any adaptations when students express they aren't understanding a concept. Her response is simply "I have to get through x amount of material in a day, sorry about your luck".

She teaches like someone who hates being stuck at a lower level. Math 1148 covers content that was taught in high school, but she makes it so much harder than it needs to be. Lectures are an hour long but you could get the same info in 5 minutes on khan academy. Im more confused about most of the math procedures now than before I took this class.

worst professor ever. She doesn't care about her students even though we were in the middle of a pandemic. Would usually cut people off when they asked questions. Quizzes and Test were too detailed . Also was very strict on turning in test on time, if you were having a wifi- issue she wouldn't care 10% off the test right automatically.

She grades so harshly and her quizzes are in person for me (during recitation). You have to show all work and there is too much nitpicking in how you show your work. Her lecturing is a bore and she will turn down your questions in the chat very frequently. I cant say she really cares about how you do in her class.

Professor Seress provides PDF files of the lecture notes before every class. She is the best math teacher I have ever had and truly cares about the quality of her teaching. She would reach out to the students not doing too hot and expect them to come to her office hours so she could better teach. Well-rounded awesome professor.

Pretty good professor for level of math taught. Goes painfully slow for the material you learned in 8th/9th grade. Somehow got an A- because the final was cumulative and i didnt really study. Very easy teacher and easy A, if you have to take than I recommend her. Write down due dates.

Sherry was a terrible teacher in my opinion, she was bad at communicating and did not want her students to succeed. She made all the exams way harder then they needed to be and didnt teach most of what was on them. She has given no extra credit or curves when they are clearly needed.
probably the worst, most confusing professor I've ever had

Sherry's lecturing left a lot to be desired. I heavily relied on tutoring to get me through this class. Anything that came out of Sherry's mouth felt incomprehensible. She wasn't very lax on disability accommodations, either. Prepare to do a bunch of assignments and feel confused the entire time.

Wish I could give a 0. She has a horrible attitude& is honestly just bad @ teaching. She doesn't take the time to answer student's questions & expects us to know everything. Goes through problems like she is doing it herself & barely teaches. Tests were brutal and stuff we never learned was on it. Would rather drop out then take this class again

She honestly made this class 1000% more difficult than it needed to me. On top of that, she lacked empathy and was not very understanding. We are in a pandemic and she did not care one bit. Puts you on the spot if you ask a question and goes way too fast. Hard to keep up with and speeds through without giving time to ask questions. Horrible.

She is a nice person, but as a professor- no good. Starts before class even started and finish way after it was supposed to end. Sometimes when u ask questions (when she got to them) she almost scolds u and puts u on the spot. She also teaches VERY fast. Hard to keep up. Tough grader& takes points off for every little thing. if you get her, switch.

She teaches quite fast, so she is hard to keep up with sometimes. As long as you show up the lectures and ask questions for recitations you should pass the class easily. Show up and take notes, ask questions, and you'll pass.

Sherry wasnt very understanding considering we are all in a pandemic. Also, her lectures are very heavy and full of content. She also leaves a lot of work on her TAs which arent very great either. She doesnt always get through stuff in class and added some stuff that she never touched base on in the exams.

Sherry isnt really a great teacher but you understand everything if you follow along with the examples. Shes quick sometimes in lecture. Go to recitation! And do all of your homework and LP/RPs its easy. Do practice exams and youll pass. Its not bad at all. I maybe put in 2-3 hours outside of class time at Most

This professors taught at fast speeds and expected us to know certain things without going into details. Her lectures were content heavy and if we didn't have enough time she said to do it on your own. like that's not what i am paying you for. She also had 4 exams and a final which was brutal on us. The exams were timed and the problems were hard.
Awful professor, not accommodating.
She is the least useful part of Math 1148, she's less of a teacher than google images explaining equations in my opinion.

She would not answer student's questions. She would go over material extremely fast, and ignore an in-class questions. Would not recommend her or take this class again. If I could give her a zero I would.

Professor Sherry was great! I took her class AU20 and it was very well organized and very straight forward. I dont know why so many people complain about her, but if you put assignments and exam dates into your calendar from the syllabus you should be just fine.
She was open to always helping anyone

A lot of people complained about her during the semester but honestly if you actually read the syllabus and go to lecture and recitation and actually practice the homework they give you like you're supposed to you'll do fine.

Absolutely awful. She has an attitude and gives simple problems during lectures but difficult and advanced ones in the homework. Teaches very fast and doesn't accommodate well with technology issues on both ends. I'm sure if the lectures were in person she'd be a lot better professor. Learned more from recitation than the actual lectures.

Sherry really tries to help her students. Sometimes her lectures can be kind of boring. I preferred this course online instead of in-person as you can fast-forward and pause lectures. Online homework was very annoying and time-consuming.
