She is not nearly as bad as people say. She is very willing to help during her office hours and gives out helpful practice problems for the tests.

Sherry gets a bad rep for some reason. The class is easy, she explains the concepts in a dumbed down way, and you know what you have to do to pass. She holds a lot of office hours and is always willing to talk about your grades and other things. Shes sassy but in all honesty it is quite funny.

The class was pretty easy, but Sherry was an okay prof. She gets really sassy and rude sometimes and she doesn't explain things well sometimes, but recitation clears up info so its pretty easy. I got As on all exams and did not really pay attention. The only thing I hated was the amount of homework. It was a lot sometimes. overall she's fine.

Sherry is awesome! Her lectures are very clear and she records them and posts them on Carmen so you can go back to them if you dont understand something. Test questions are just like questions on the notes. just be sure to show all your work on exams and midterms cuz if you skip one small step in showing your work she will mark the whole problem.

I hate math, but algebra is easy for me. I never attended lectures or recitations. ConnectMath was my teacher and I did well on the exams. She makes you do stupid pointless discussion posts where you ask a question about the lecture to get credit. It was hard to come up with questions sometimes and they were easy to accidentally forget about...

Very fair teacher, a little heavy on the connectmath homework but other than that she goes over the material very well. She records her (online) lectures but if I didn't go to the live one I wouldn't end up watching it. But she also doesn't give us our class grades which drives me insane. She wants us to calculate it ourselves with the syllabus.

Lemme put it out here first that I absolutely suck at math and was actually placed in the math class below this but got bumped up by my advisor. Im really confused as to why she has such a low rating shes an excellent teacher and the class was so easy. The work load is bigger but not really that bad. Dont do Sherry like that yall.
bad

Sherry Seress is an okay teacher, she does a decent job explaining the concepts and I usually caught on pretty well. The homework is usually tedious The real problem was with her being online- she is completely inept. Disconnections, lag, saying she's "being hacked", not knowing how to do stuff, etc. Would probably be fine in-person, avoid online.
gives cookie cutter problems in the lecture that a brain damaged toddler could solve but on the homework its ten times more advanced and half the stuff we didn't go over
Was very rude, notes were illegible
basically doesn't teaches, uses connect math and it will grade you wrong if you breath in the wrong direction, concepts are easy but if you a sped in math, good luck lmao.

Genuinely the worst class that I have ever taken. Somehow makes simple algebraic concepts seem as hard as calculus. EXTREMELY condescending and never elaborates on challenging topics that need further detail. Basically inaccessible outside of class and she'll respond to your email (if you're lucky to even get a response) within 2 weeks.
Its a pretty easy class if youve taken algebra before. However all she does is do a problem and doesnt take any questions. She can also be condescending and her voice gives me a headache.

She speeds through an hour of lecture covering 5 different topics giving all the answers without taking questions and at the very end be like "so you guys understand that, right?" 2 seconds later - "Okay, great well I'll end the recording here and see you guys next time." Every. Single. Lecture. It's just awful. Make your TA your best friend.

If you struggle with math, I would recommend avoiding this professor. Her "lectures" are just her doing the problems for you and she expects you to memorize the steps ("I'm doing for this for your sake, not mine"). She's virtually inaccessible outside of the lectures. If you send her an email, you'll never get a response.

The "teacher" who I refuse to call a professor is so "matter of fact" in her lectures that anything other than her word is wrong. If I could put the "DOES THE PROBLEM FOR YOU" tag I would. There is no learning here other than what you can memorize on your own. Avoid if you really struggle at math.
Hello homework every week! Some of the stuff in the homework we didnt learn until the next week so I had to Photomath hella of the problems and the theres quizzes every Wednesday.

So I am not good at math, at all. It is difficult to have a professor that does the problem for you and expects you to follow those steps. That is not teaching. If you are slow with math as I am, be careful with the professors you choose. Always have one that's more supportive and understands your learning ability. Not everyone is the same.

Horrible Horrible Horrible. I dont know whats wrong with her. Avoid her at all costs, shes just another type of human being. Shes rude, cant teach and probably doesnt know what shes talking about. Honestly if you get stuck with her, I would advise you to work on connect and talk with your TAs. Shes honestly the worst.

Her lectures aren't anything bad or special, I don't understand the bad reviews. She does guided notes which are super helpful and outlines all the info you need to know. Make sure you go to class for the midterm reviews, she throws in random never before covered questions that will be on the test.

This class is not as hard as people are making it out to be. If you are decent or good at math, don't worry because you will do well even if you don't like the professor. Just make sure to go over her notes before exams and quizzes because if you can do them without looking at the answers, the exams should be easy. TAs can be a helpful source too.

She's not as bad as others may think, but she definitely can be snippy at times in lecture. The first couple exams were easy but the third exam and final were not the easiest. Definitely a do able class if you attend lecture and recitation!

If you can avoid this professor, do so. She is very vague and extremely lecture heavy. She basically does the problems for you and then you have to go from there. There are not very many outside resources to help with exam prep (study guides, practices problems, etc.). Overall, the class was poorly organized and hard to follow.

I have never been great at math however in all my years at OSU Ive never just flunked out of a math course until I had Sherry as a teacher. She is AWFUL the best advice I can give you is to really use your resources. Go to the math center and try not to skip recitation because that is the only reason Im getting through it this time. Good luck.

Her lectures were not helpful as she did a poor job of explaining things and constantly made mistakes that students had to catch. She's the type of person that doesn't answer the question you emailed her. Constantly had to remind her to upload notes (for those who take electronic notes). You're better off skipping lectures and going to recitation.

Horrible instructor DO NOT TAKE HER!! Does NOT explain any of the material well. Talks down to students as if we are children. Focuses more on basic concepts than difficult to understand ones. Is not helpful AT ALL when preparing for exams.

Lectures are optional, recitation saves me. Her notes are easy to follow but she sometimes goes too fast during more difficult material. She is fine besides being snippy sometimes which I personally find hilarious. Online homework every week and quiz every week. Grade mostly dependent on midterm and final.
Rude, Unclear, Confusing. Made me struggle in a class I breezed through in high school. Would recommend otherwise.

Very condescending when it comes to questions in lecture, doesn't let TAs give you examples of what you will be tested & quizzed on (you must provide examples on your own, stupid), & seems to not care about your grade. I used to love math & I was in advanced math all through high school & she confused me about things I already knew. dont take her.
Super confusing, test content wasnt clear

Condescending, explains concepts in the most difficult ways. I came in being pretty good at math and already having taken pre-calc before but the way that she explains concepts makes it incredibly difficult to understand even if you've come across it before. Go to the math help center every day if you can, they are far better teachers .

Sherry is by far the worst lecturer in the math department, and every other instructor knows it. The terrible thing about OSU, is that you cannot chosen tour Math instructor. If you end up with her, Im sorry. Sherry is rude, mean-spirited, and honestly doesnt explain anything well. Overall, she doesnt care about us, just her paycheck.
Worst math professor ever. Not clear on what's going to be on the exam. PLEASE DO NOT TAKE HER IF YOU CARE ABOUT YOUR GRADE!
Sherry is literally the worst. Thats all you need to know.

So so so so so bad. Horrible hand writing but more importantly she explains simple things in the hardest most complex way possible which confused the whole class and made us all feel defeated. She lies about what to expect on tests- especially the final... Get OUT if you have her as your math professor.

The sloppiest hand writing i have ever seen - you fill in the lectures notes so you actually need to see what she's writing, but you can't make it out. Goes so quickly through the content and hands down one of the worst prof ive ever had. do not recommend
You are better off transferring than taking a course with her

Sherry gets a really bad reputation but she is very clear on what you need to do in order to succeed. This is probably the most Ive ever worked in a math class to get an A but it is doable if you follow her advice which is foremost to review her lecture notes. If you can re-fill out her notes without help before each exam, you WILL get an A.

I was often so frustrated with this prof. bc I would be completely confused when she was teaching only to figure out, wait I already KNOW this, and I know how to do this in a simpler way. lectures are boring but the only reason to go is for the word problems, I really tried to like this prof. just too fast during lecture and too confusing.

She gives out good notes but will teach you like you've never learned how to add 2 + 2 before. She also tends to be really fast during lecture. Her one motto is to "always look at my paper notes, not the online homework" even though much of the exam questions come from homework. The tests are also designed to trick you and mess you up.

Good luck keeping up-quizzes are every week and Youll have about two or three days to learn whats covered in the lectures. The book you have to buy because its for the online HW but it doesnt corispond with what you work on in lecture. You we have to hope On getting a good TA but with the lack of communication Sherry levees them in the dark also

Sherry really knew how to make herself come off as snarky and pompous. Listening to her speak, one would think she was Einstein in a room full of Patrick Stars, however Einstein had to constantly prove his superior intelligence. The word condescending does not do it justice.

Sherry's style helped me understand concepts pretty well. You must pay attention the entire lecture and skipping her lectures will almost certainly lead to exam failures. She is good at leading students through problems and the guided notes are almost exam "cheat sheets", which is nice. She organized content well and gave solid explanations.
Success in this class came from my TA and the free tutor room. Use outside resources because the material isn't hard to understand, it just needs to be taught. Study and practice the homework.

Sherry is a very condescending person and if you ask her any questions she will look at you like you don't have brain. If you get a good TA this class isnt that bad but Sherry rushes through topics that are more difficult and takes the whole lecture on simple topics.

The lectures are fast paced; she does provide guided notes which is helpful. Online homework and weekly quizzes are essential for a good grade. She is a bit of a tough cookie, prepare to work hard. You need the textbook for the online homework code and not much else.

Easily one of the worst teachers I have ever had. Very condescending and explains easy concepts in confusing ways. The only reason I did well in this class was because I learned a lot of the material in high school

Ive never been that bad at math and I went into the class feeling pretty prepared because I thought I knew the content. Well she makes math so complicated, honestly half of the time I had no idea what she was talking about. Also the homework and midterms are hard because she doesnt prepare you for them. Take it with another professor if you can.

Sherry makes the easiest tasks hard. She expects you to know as much about math as she does and treats the class as such. Topics are simple topics however sherry has an incredible knack for making things more difficult than need be. Unless you are a math person DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH SHERRY. She has a condescending attitude and is not a good prof

If you are like me and math is your worst subject then DO NOT take a class with sherry. Her lectures feel very fast paced and she is incredibly hard to keep up with. When someone asks her to slow down she very condescendingly states that we should be able to keep up and is overall not a good professor. Your better off watching videos on YouTube.

Makes easy concepts hard, speeds through concepts. Has a slight attitude when you ask questions in class and when you rephrase it, still doesn't answer it. I have previously taken Calculus and the way she explains material is confusing for College Algebra.

I came from college calculus to college algebra because of placement. I literally went to 2 lectures at the beginning and never showed up again other than quizzes once a week. The night before exams I would review homework and do the online practice questions and I got an A on everything. Tip: YouTube is 100% better than going to the lectures.

Doesn't explain concepts very well. In lecture, she provides packets that you follow along/ fill out but she writes fast. My TA wasn't the best so I went to the tutoring center to meet with a different TA (s/o to Aidan) in order to pass. E-textbook comes with access code for weekly online hw but I never used it. Online hw can be like 50 problems/wk
Pretty easy honestly, she will cut you slack if you need it with homework. I never did it and also didn't study enough for tests, they're not hard but I didn't really know anything.

We had a midterm where the average was 52, and she said she wouldn't curve it unless we all failed all the other exams, not cool. Her lectures are very boring, half the people fall asleep. She doesn't explain things in detail, so if you struggle with math like me, I would advise against taking her.

The course can be challenging and it is very fasted paced. I personally struggled with the course especially towards the end. Just remember to utilize all the resources. Go to the math center and your TA office hours as much as possible.(Serious) Also don't be afraid to ask questions if you don't understand the material, trust me it will help!

She gets a lot of bad grades on here talking about exam averages and what not. It's like any math course, where the lecturer only has 55 minutes to cover an entire section or chapter. Really, your TA that teaches the Recitation is more important as far as learning goes, so if you're nervous you won't learn from that TA, find another.

I went into the course confident bc I took calc in high school, did well on the first midterm, then stopped going to class. Big mistake. The midterms are pretty challenging if you don't go to class, so make sure to study and do the homework. Sherry isn't the best, but not the worst. Don't feel discouraged if you get her for math. Ask q's during rec

fast-paced professor, but that wasn't really a problem because the material was basic algebra that most people took in HS. Don't get too cocky & think that bc you learned it before that you don't have to show up bc a lot of what you thought you know you've probably forgotten since hs algebra. one flaw is that she made made many mistakes in her work

If you read & take notes from your textbook before lecture then Sherry's lecture will basically serve as a cognitive reinforcer instead of being a hour of confusion & frustration. Sherry is a great lecturer just come prepared.

I agree with everyone else. Sherry takes concepts you learned in high school and makes them a million times more confusing. If you have a great TA for recitation like I did, you'll be fine. If not, get ready to learn a lot of the material on your own.

Pointless lectures. Pace is too fast for math and acts like you should already know everything. Things I learned years ago, she taught in an entirely different manner, making concepts very confusing. I decided to drop out after a few weeks. I felt like I spent hours on homework only to receive very little points. Most points come from exams.

Everything that she covered in the lectures just made concepts I had already learned in previous classes much more difficult to understand. The only reason this class was manageable was because of the recitation .

I'm with everyone else on sherry. She makes everything so so so confusing. Worst math teacher ever. You basically have to teach yourself everything after class unless your a math major. She also refuses to slow down when the whole class tells her she's going too fast. She told us we need to learn faster.

Sherry moves with the rapid pace of a NASCAR race. By the time you have copied everything down from the board, she is on to the next problem, which leaves you with little-to-no time to understand what was just taught. I never thought that such a basic level algebra class could be so difficult, but she ensures that you leave each lecture confused.
PSA: AVOID HER AT ALL cost. Professor Seress could make the problem 2 + 2 seem like a NASA engineering problem. Horrible teacher and acts like every student should know as much as her.

During the lectures she when way to fast for me, i understand we only have 55 mins but she could slow down some. I also didn't like the way she explained things. I felt like i learn more from the TA than i did from here. Also the class is worth the most points in the class, so i you  get an E or D you drop a few letter grades. DON'T TAKE  WITH HER.
Very nice and willing to help. STUDY HER LECTURE NOTES they are basically the exam questions.

Definitely cares about your grade in the class. She's very clear about her availability and wants to make sure you get the help you need to succeed. Lectures are pretty clear and she goes over material on review days that will be on midterms.

Sherry is not a bad professor whatsoever, she just is not personable in any way, shape, or form. I tried to approach her and she immediately became defensive even when I was being completely respectful. If you don't care to interact with a professor, she's a good teacher just not my favorite person.
She teaches the stuff ok, but I stopped going to lectures. Unless you struggle in math, recitation will cover everything you need.

I learned all of the content in high school but Sherry made it impossible to understand. She is awful at explaining things in simple terms. Attendance isn't taken, so honestly if you have her I would just find someone to get the notes from and just go to recitation.

If you are not a math person, do not take Sherry's class. She thinks you know just as much as her but were not all math majors, Sherry! Probably going yo have to retake this class and you better believe I won't be taking it with her.

The material in this class shouldn't be hard but Sherry makes sure that it is. She goes way too fast in lecture so you barely have time to write everything down let alone actually comprehend it. Find someone who doesn't mind sending you the notes and just go to recitation.

This professor sends out notes with gaps in them that you print off and just fill in the gaps as she fills out her paper on the projector. If you struggle with math Sherry explains it in a very clear way. She specifically tells you how problems are expected to be completed. Attendance isnt mandatory but doing so probably would have gotten me that A

worst professor ever. I learned this stuff in High school and the content is pretty easy but the way she teachers you it is absolutely horrendous!! She makes it so much more difficult that it needs to be. Get another professor if you have her. Worst choice I ever made taking her. She does not help you prepare for the exams. absolute waste!

This class was review for me and I still struggled in it. She talks super fast and assumes everyone already knows the content. I was confused by almost everything she said. You could probably pass the class by just going to recitation..

This class was an interesting one. You really need to keep up with Sherry and pay attention or else you will fall behind. All homework is online. There are multiplier 10-point questions, but they're easy. There are a few midterms and one final. Just study and ask questions if needed, and you'll do well in the class.

Probably one of the worst professors Ive ever had. Was not helpful at all during office hours and was very snippy with you. she didn't seem like she was there to help students just wanted to get the class over with. Horrible professor.

Worst professor ever. I am a very strong math student and I struggled to understand her lectures. Honestly never went to class and just came to recitation.  Had I not already learned the material in high school I probably would have struggled a lot. Terrible lectures, but at least had printable notes she followed with structured problems. DONT TAKE

She's absolutely terrible. I am an excellent math student and ever since i've been in her class, I have not done well. She over complicates things, and barely writes anything done, but expects you to for the exams. I have emailed her asking for help, and she also doesn't respond.

Great professor who prints out notes for you to go along with during the lecture. Midterms are challenging, but not a problem if you understand the material and how it works, not necessarily just having memorized the steps. She's always willing to help and provide comical relief when necessary.

Sherry is a wonderful person, but I stopped going to lectures second week into school. I teach myself the material now and go to recitations only.  Sure it's an easy class if you study and AVOID lectures. She makes easy things soooooo complicated and confusing. She has a great Great personality though !
I have no idea what this woman is even saying ... I know algebra . and day one she made the easiest stuff seem so much harder than it had to be I dont know how she did it.

The class was very easy. If you are good at math at all, then you will get an A no problem. However, Sherry is very scatter brained. She did not explain the material in a very effective way. The quizzes in recitation are easy and usually two questions.

I thought this class was super easy, as I'd learned everything previously. I felt Sherry was very direct with her examples and told us exactly what to expect on exams. I did very well in this class and liked her a lot, but I'm not sure if that's just because I understood the subject matter from earlier years. Over all, easy class, liked her a lot!
She is an awesome teacher and awesome person.  She really cares about every student and she is fun!

She's nice, but unfortunately not that helpful. I have no idea how a 55-minute lecture can seem longer than all my 80-minute ones.  I will miss her pink sweatsuits when the class ends and how she likened math to playing bridge.  (I still don't understand the analogy.) Exams are honestly easier if you just go to recitation.

The material is really not challenging at all. I found her lectures to be extremely extensive and boring. I went to lecture twice the entire semester and only went to recitation on the days we had quizzes. Don't sweat over the online homework, I did about 14 of the assignments and it did not affect my grade at all.

she goes on long tangents all the time, hard to focus in her class, goes super fast doesn't really explain things because she is so used to the material, says to come in for help but doesnt email you back, homework, lecture and recitation notes are easy, quizzes as well but the midterms and final exams are impossible

The material is really easy and the class isn't hard, but she's confusing at times. She goes on long tangents and gets off topic a lot which is annoying. She talks really quietly, too, so its hard to listen. I rarely go to recitation. Go to the review class the day before exams.

Sherry has been at OSU for over thirty years; her experience and diligence makes lectures and office hours rewarding as a student. She is very thorough when it comes to explaining concepts and test expectations, encouraging learning as it is truly meant to be, an experience, not a chore. As a historyenglish nerd, Sherry made me want to learn math!
She is so confusing.  I skipped every lecture and just went to recitation.  Easy A after that decision.
pretty easy

Class will be very intimidating and hard at first. She sometimes gets scattered with her thoughts, but if you pay attention and go to lecture, you're good. GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS. This is the reason I got an A in this class. She is so much more helpful in person! Ended up liking math more after taking this class!

While she was scattered sometimes, she was always making sure everyone in the lecture was learning and understood the material (not an easy task in a 300 person lecture). She was super nice and always made time during office hours, which made a big difference. Unfortunately I did not have a good TA,but her lectures were enough to the info need B+
I'm not sure why she has such bad reviews. At first I struggled but kept going to her office hours and she was a huge help. The class can be intimidating  but stick with it.

Sherry is SO disorganized and unclear when teaching. The only reason I did alright in the class was because of my TA. I would definitely suggest trying to get a different professor if you end up with her. Lecture is useless.

Sherry was terrible. She did not explain information well at all. The only reason i learned anything from this class was because of my TA. Sherry made things more difficult than they needed to be. Our TA didn't even understand half the things she did. If you are able to, do not have her as your professor. Other then her, the class is easy.

I went to lecture the first half of the semester and did not learn a single thing from her. She's extremely scatterbrained and often did not know what she was doing, how to explain it, nor helped me learn it whatsoever. I learned everything I know from my TA and through doing the homework. If you have a sufficient math background class is a breeze

She is one of the best math teachers I've had. She gives you print out notes each week, which end up being SO helpful. They're always neat, concise, and make it 10 times easier to study from. She's super sweet and always willing to help you! I'd highly recommend her.

Overall a very nice lady. If you ask questions after lecture she will help you all she can. If you go to lecture prepared to learn then you can learn a lot. She wants you to do well. Go To Lecture, because she uses examples that will be on tests. Also, do all the online homework, because it is very helpful if you miss something during lecture.

Didn't explain what she was doing very well, just breezed through examples. Skipped steps. Expected us to know things we didn't. Not usually available for help, and makes mistakes often. Nice woman, bad teacher. (Re-posted due to site randomly logging me out.)

Didn't explain what she was doing very well, just breezed through examples. Skipped steps. Expected us to know things we didn't. Not usually available for help, and makes mistakes often. Nice woman, bad teacher.

Sherry makes the material more difficult than it needs to be, and never stops in the middle of an example to explain the steps, even if you raise your hand to ask. Do the homework, attend recitation, go to your TA's office hours, and go to the tutor room, you'll do fine, don't bother going to lecture unless you want to leave with a headache.

*Facepalm. Learned more from my TA (Rachel Arps, who would certainly get all 5s) and my book than I ever learned from Prof. Seress. Unclear, unsure, and unhelpfull. That 48 minutes every lecture would be much better spent reading the book and trying practice problems. Not an enjoyable experience.

I thought her lectures were almost useless and learned more from my textbook and my TA.  If you study the practice tests online and supplement with the homework problems you'll do fine because they are just like the actual exams.

She is a genuinely nice lady who wants her students to do well. She has great reviews before tests. Definitely go to OFFICE HOURS-she has everyone work problems out on the board and its great practice for you. She's a bit quirky but what math prof isn't?
The woman did not make one bit of sense, nor had any idea what was going on. Once compared math as walking in a winter forest.

she's kindof weird, but definitely nice. she really wants her students to do well. i went to all the lectures and she gives a lot of practice problems that are found on the exam (just slightly different numbers). i hate math, did horribly on the final. but with a little curve, got a B.

Tries to teach and wants her students to do well, even goes out of her way to try and find out why her students don't understand the material, but shes just a bad teacher, she breaks down the material so much that she makes something simple seem difficult

I feel sorry for math that it has to have this woman teaching it. Math 148 is an easy class and she makes very basic math hard, furthermore she does not know what she's doing and is constantly making stupid mistakes and confusing herself as well as her students. DO NOT BY ANY MEANS TAKE HER CLAS!!

FAIL. She made the simplest things very difficult.  She couldn't explain anything well.  She was more interested in covering as much material as possible than making sure all of her students understood the material.  My TA was 234092348 times better than the lecturer herself. If you haven't had this material before, avoid this lecturer.

She seems nice enough but as a teacher she is just godawful. Theres no other word for it. I started going to another lecture 2 weeks into the quarter and never looked back. I feel bad for all those who stayed...
She is pretty out there. She says very weird things and never makes any sense. If you can, avoid sherry at all costs.
i thought lectures were hard to follow and pay attention to.
The Peach Cobbler was delightful...
sucked.

TERRIBLE!!!!!! NEVVEERRR TAKE HER!!!! she is so ridicuously scatterbrained that it makes your head spin. she is a terrible teacher and makes you just want to die. she cant explain anythinggg!! oh my god i cant stress it enough. she is the worst thing that has ever happened to math

I knew more going into the class than when I came out. She was constantly making mistakes and we always had to erase half the notes because she messed up on something stupid The class isn't hard, she makes it that way.

she goes quickly through the lectures so it is hard to keep up. i learned maybe 1 or 2 things she taught the whole quarter. she is  a very nice lady and genuinely interested in helping you understand the materials, but you have to see her out of class if you want her help. i would recommend going to the math lab or seeing your TA for help

She was just a really annoying teacher. Like some have said before, she made really simple things seem hard. My TA was awesome though! Also, she messes up problems a lot, and the class always had to correct her.
No Comments
Material is presented very quickly, and usually very unclear.  This prof is one of the worst I've had while at OSU.
No Comments
wow, i dont know if this class was about learning math, or learning her family history.  her son was mentioned every class.
Prof was kind of out there, seems like she didnt really know what she was talking about and made things seem hard.
i swear she taught the same lesson two classes in a row, she does not know how to teach
In a sentence, she is a moron
Made even the most simple concepts confusing and impossible to learn, thank god for good TA's
VERY UNCLEAR THE WORST MATH PROF IVE HAD!!!

summary_comment: Professor Murphy is an effective and engaging recitation instructor known for his thorough example-led sessions and willingness to help students, though his teaching style can be challenging for some due to his sometimes abrupt demeanor and grading errors. Despite these drawbacks, many appreciate his efforts to connect with students and create an energetic classroom atmosphere, particularly valuing his friendly service dog.
summary_comment_short: Professor Murphy is an effective recitation instructor known for his thorough example-led sessions and willingness to help students, though he can come across as gruff and may make grading errors. His energy and service dog add a unique dynamic to the classroom, but his teaching style requires getting used to due to occasional rudeness and impatience with questions.

Ratings.comment: Overall good professor, but might be too much for some (you just gotta get used to his personality)

Mr. Murphy stops to ask if anyone has questions, he keeps the recitation short, and is helpful when approaching him one-on-one. However, there are times when he can be unnecessarily short with students who ask questions and he often makes errors in grading & lectures. He has a friendly service dog in class and I like the energy it brings to class.

i appreciated michael for making lectures easier to digest, but his demeanour is definitely one to get used to. he comes off as rude or arrogant which throws students off when trying to ask a question but you j have to learn that its not personal and thats j how he is. he does try to talk abt things like movies, legos, and his dog tho.

He was a good TA and could help if you did not understand the lecture. However he was a bit rude at times and was definitely snappy with the class if he was not satisfied with participation, or even if someone asked a question that he did not like.

Good guy just kind of snippy.  I felt like he did try to connect with students and his recitations did help somewhat but he went about it in not the best way.  Honestly a toss up for me.  He did bring his dog to class once and that was my favorite class.

Rather than going to lectures and learning a topic in a complicated manner, just attend Murphy's recitations. He did his best to connect with his students even in an 8 am class. However, while the quizzes were easy the tests the professor made were extremely different, I hope he changes his quiz questions to fit the tests better.

Mr. Murphy is one of the best recitation professors I have had at OSU. He leads recitations for Calc 1131 and goes through helpful examples during each class. He grades some quizzes, homework, and helps on exams, states he could grade easier if he could and if any of us were struggling he does his best to explain all his examples thoroughly.

He's a great teacher. In this Calc for Business class, he was in charge of grading quizzes and homework. Him & other TA's split grading exams. He would definitely grade easier if he could. Tries to give you points when he can. **Loves when class is energetic and talks to him before class, especially later in the day. Cannot stress this enough.**

Mr. Murphy is the best teacher I had this semester. I'm not very strong in math and was super nervous for this class but Murphy's recitations helped me so much. He actually cares if you understand the material and wants you to succeed in the class. Great guy and super nice as long as you show up to class.

He is a TA, and you will learn a lot from him, but he is a horrible person. At the end of the semester I didnt know one person who wasnt completely fed up with how rude and disrespectful he is. He gets mad at you for asking questions and if you dont understand something he is saying... good luck!
Murphy made the lectures so much easier to understand and if you do the practice problems, doing well in this class is very doable.
He is a TA, but honestly I learned more from him than the lecturer. Really enjoyed being in his recitation.

One of the best math teachers/professors I have ever had and he is only a TA. He explains the material in a very straight forward and simple way thus making the course simpler than it otherwise would be.

He frequently works ahead of the lecturer and makes class very confusing. He is very close-minded and opinionated and makes it hard to focus on the math when he is busy talking about his wife or baseball. Although he is clearly enthusiastic about math and being a scholar, his attitude and mode of teaching is highly undesirable. Teach yourself here
Good Professors, very snappy at times. If you can avoid him, if not it's manageable just study hard.

summary_comment: Professor Mills is known for his clarity and thorough explanations, making complex material accessible through step-by-step breakdowns and visual aids. While some find his lectures straightforward and potentially dull, many students appreciate his detailed approach and the importance he places on understanding the material, leading to success on exams. Students generally recommend attending class regularly and doing plenty of practice to excel in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mills is known for his clarity and ability to break down complex material into manageable steps, often using visual aids like color coding and humorous references to engage students. While some find his lectures straightforward and even boring, many appreciate his thorough explanations and dedication to ensuring understanding, though regular attendance is crucial for success.

Ratings.comment: Jeff made sure everyone understands the material and breaks it down into steps. He would also color code things and make comical references to help us understand the material.

You won't be graded on attendance, but it is important you go if you are unfamiliar with the coursework. He's specific about the work he wants to see on homework and especially on exams, and the only way you'll know is if you go to class and take notes.

This professor's lectures are pretty boring and tough to stay focused. The material is not anything super difficult and covers general pre-calc concepts. His lectures are basically right out the textbook. His notes are helpful, however you learn more in recitation. In order to do well on tests, do several book problems and practice!

Awful professor. I got an A and did not attend more than 5 lectures the whole semester. If you happen to know the material so exceptionally well that you want to attend a lecture that will certainly confuse anyone who is not a math major, by all means go.

Had him for lecture and he was very clear straight to the point and was great at answering questions.  Basically took the class in high school so was already easy, but he just added to that.  Overall great guy
I don't think I've met a better man, but beware!!!! You'll have trouble paying attention in class

Jeff is the best math teacher I've ever had. I've never gotten an A in math until this past semester. I'm highly impressed with how well he knows the material and how he somehow made the math I never understood so easy. I highly suggest taking Math 1050 from Jeff. Do expect quite a bit of homework, but the homework definitely helps.

Jeff is by far the best math teacher I have ever had. He explains things multiple times in various ways to make sure everyone understands. Being in class everyday is very important as new sections are taught almost every day. I wish he taught higher up math classes because I would most definitely have him as a teacher again!

Jeffery mills is by far the worst instructor (if I may be so bold as to use this term to describe the sub par instruction I received) that I have had at OSU in any department. He has a serious superiority complex in regard to his students. He fosters a hostile classroom environment and I feel its outlandish that he remains employed.
Jeff Mills is by far one of the worst teachers I have ever had in my life. He thinks we are all stupid and refuses to help us with anything. Avoid this teacher if you can!
Worst teacher I've EVER had. Not only was he awful at teaching, but he was extremely not understanding when I became sick and couldn't make it to class and missed a quiz.

The only professor I've ever had that does not review before a test. Gives quizzes the last 15 min. of class leaving nothing but anxiety for the student. Jeff Mills is very snarky with a attitude of superiority towards students with questions about his methods. He is knowledgable about mathematics, but just not much of a people person.

He may be the best math teacher I've ever had. I am not good in math at all, nor do I have any interest in it at all. I always struggled, but I actually felt accomplished in his class. He's very nice, helpful, clear, and fair. If you have trouble in math, he'll be especially great for you.

Jeff was very helpful and really did describe a lot of the material in a way that everyone could understand. He also gave some background information before just explaining things that everybody may not have learned from other classes prior to this one. I do not like math at all but I actually did well in this class.
Great teacher. I had always struggled with math, but Jeff makes it clear and really cares about helping you learn. I highly suggest him if you can get him.

He taught this past summer at Columbus State Community College (part-time).  He was a wonderful teacher and I would highly recommend him.  He is by far the best math teacher I have had at CSCCC.  He tries to help you in how every way he can.  He even gives you review sheets before taking the tests, which were very helpful.

Great teacher if you are not very confident with math. He goes out of his way to answer any questions you may have and has many different ways of attacking a math problems. This is good because you can use the technique that best fits you. If I need to take another math class I would go out of my way to ensure Jeff is my teacher.

Jeff is very dry, and kind of a jerk. He is very VERY picky about how you write your answers, which is annoying. The class itself was very easy, I didn't study and I got an easy A. I didn't attend lecture for the last half of the quarter because he was soooo boring. But he answers any questions that you may have, I just didn't have any.
Jeff is the most dry and boring teacher there is at ohio state. I hate math.. and he just added himself to one of the reasons why. He is way, way WAY too picky.

Im actually very limited when it comes to math, but I aced this class. His strategies for P.R.T.I problems and Mixture problems were pretty fantastic. Definitely gave me the skills for future math classes and helped me break down the barriers that prevented me from putting any effort. It's a lot of work, but it's for the best if you want to succeed

The biggest problem I had was the lack of difficulty in the problems he covered!!  Generally the biggest problem with the course's quiz's and the homework would have been remedied if he would have covered more complex problems in class instead of the examples ALREADY provided in the textbook.

He's nice and can be funny. I found it easier to not attend lecture, and just study from the book before quizzes and exams. Be prepared to take the exams kind of quickly. It seemed like a lot of problems and not a lot of time, if you have trouble solving them fast.

Nice guy, a little strange but overall he's a good teacher. he's a stickler about showing ur work but in the long run thats good because he wants to make sure u dont skip a step on the exam and make a mistake and get points taken away. overall very thorough and is a good teacher.  I'd take another class from him.
This instructors was very helpful. however he does like things done a certain way. I did learn a few new strategies from this class, that make things easier. I recommend Jeff without reservation.

Jeff's a great teacher. He's really helpful and will take his time explaining things to you. I really liked his system of teaching even though I already knew the material. The homework was fair and the quizes were exactly over what you study, so no surprizes.
Jeff was a really nice and funny guy but he graded pretty tough.  This class is frustrating in general, but Jeff does a good job teaching it.
Nice guy, helpful. I failed but passed with a different prof w/ a different approach the next quarter.

Jeff Mills is a very helpful professor. If you ever have a question about something during class, he will answer it for you until you understand what he is talking about. Although there are a lot of homework problems that he assigns to his students, it is very helpful in the end when you need a good review for the Midterms and even the Final Exam.
He was my TA for this course... he was helpful if you needed it, but didn't constantly yell at you if you werent doing your work. Overall a good teacher, much better than Ferdinand.
No Comments

It was my second time taking this awful course so I kind of new the gyst of it, so maybe thats why i felt like he over-explained the simplest steps. Still a nice guy, tried to be interested in the students' well being. I hate math so i cant say i enjoyed the course, but besides the elementary-school like approach to some math concepts he was cool.
This guys is ok as far as TA skills goes. He is good at explaining stuff, but could care less if you missed an assignement or quiz. He is an **** for all intensive purposes.

summary_comment: Professor Carnovale is widely regarded as having a poor teaching style, characterized by rapid pacing and disorganization, which complicates even basic concepts. Students find his lectures difficult to follow and often struggle to grasp the material without significant additional support from TAs. While some appreciate occasional extensions on assignments and the option for virtual lectures, the overall consensus is that his teaching methods are ineffective for learning the course content independently.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carnovale is widely regarded as having a poor teaching style, characterized by rapid pacing and disorganized lectures that complicate rather than clarify concepts. Students found his approach challenging and often struggled to understand the material without additional support from TAs.

Ratings.comment: Marc was one of the worst teachers I have ever had. He was very unorganized and overcomplicated everything even the easy topics. I really recommend not taking any math courses with him.
Teaching style in lecture is very bad. Moves so fast and work is very unorganized.

although i have taken similar math courses, he was really difficult to understand, like he overcomplicated concepts that i have learned before but the way that he teaches made me struggle with these things. but he did give a couple extensions on a few assignments which was nice. also i could attend lecture virtually which was great

He's passionate but his teaching style isn't helpful. It's not the end of the world if you get stuck with him bc the key to passing this class is going over hw and skimming through the textbook. About 90% of the exam/finals material is from the hw and textbooks just a harder version of it so make sure you do a lot of practice problems.
I had absolutely no idea what was happening all year. Exams were difficult and notes were confusing. I only passed because of my TA. Way more difficult than it should have been.
Absolutely couldn't follow anything he taught. Passed thanks to my recitation TA.

summary_comment: Professor Li's teaching quality is generally low, marked by her lack of fluency in English and reluctance to engage in lectures, making them less valuable. She frequently uploads slides just before class, hinders review, and fails to adequately explain projects or address student questions. Her teaching methods often focus on complex approaches without proper clarification, and she is frequently late and slow in entering grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Li's teaching is marked by significant challenges due to her limited fluency in English, making lectures difficult to follow. The class structure relies heavily on textbooks and slides provided just before lectures, offering little value beyond self-study and leading many students to find the class unsatisfactory and avoidable.

Ratings.comment: Not very fluent in English. Also very quiet. Had to follow along in the textbook during lecture (which means lecture is not very valuable in the first place). Overall, class was not too difficult but I definitely would not take a class with her again.

-always uploaded the slides for the day exactly right before she started the lecture which make students cant review before class
- not fluent in english AT ALL (VERY hard to understand)
- lots of project which she never describe the schemes and never care if anyone doesnt have partner for the group
- she wrote wrong answer in board and unexplained

Rarely explained things in class. Would continuously get lost while teaching from the book. Always seemed to only explain the difficult way to do things. Continuously late to class by 5-10 minutes. Grades took weeks to get entered. Never had an answer to a student's question during lecture.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

summary_comment: Professor Talamo is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and commitment to student learning. Students praise his clear explanations, availability of lecture materials online, and his focus on ensuring students truly understand the material through test corrections and extra credit opportunities. While the class is challenging and time-consuming, many find his approach rewarding and effective for achieving good grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Talamo is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and commitment to student learning. Students consistently praise his clear explanations, availability of lecture materials online, and his focus on ensuring students truly understand the material through various support mechanisms like test corrections, extra credit, and comprehensive cheat sheets.

Ratings.comment: Jim was the best professor I have had at OSU. He was an exceptional lecturer, and his TAs for recitation were extremely helpful in explaining content. He is generous with points back with test corrections as his main focus is making sure students truly learn the material. If you put the work in, he gives you every opportunity to earn a good grade.

One of the greatest professors ever. He is very good at teaching the concepts he talks about and is always willing to help students. There is also a lot of extra credit for students and you get a full sheet of paper as a cheat sheet so it is relatively difficult to fail the class.

Dr. Talamo is AMAZING. I struggled BADLY in 1151 and was buckling up for another hard semester. He does an amazing job of teaching the material in a practical way. His #1 priority is getting everyone to have a solid understanding of the material and it shows. Normally I'd rate this class a 5 for difficulty but his teaching is so good it gets a 4.
Talamo is a great prof. You can pretty much fully take the class from home on your own time if you want. Every midterm there are corrections, as well as extra credit opportunities.
Great teacher, makes all lecture material available online. No curve hurts, but the group portion of the class makes it up.

Great professor, actually cares about his students learning the material instead of them getting a grade. Allows cheat sheets and revision for tests, letting you get a good grade and an opportunity to review the material. Put the effort expected for a 5 credit hour course into it and study for finals and you'll get an A.

Jim is a very good professor. He explains concepts very clearly and the class is extremely organized which is very nice. However, this class is definitely challenging and time consuming. There is a lot of work, but it prepares you well for the exams.

Best Math Professor ever. If James teach any other math courses, I will choose him without a second thought. All the hard parts are clearly explained by Jim‘s intuitive lecture notes, which made my study go smoothly throughout this course.

1000/10 

One of the best math teachers I've had in a long time. Makes Calc 2 super easy if you pay attention to the lectures and do all your work on time. Gives good feedback and clarification on concepts when needed and gives priority to actually understanding the topic rather than worrying about your grade for the class.

Extremely understanding and nice professor. Content is hard and notorious weed out but in reality the practice exams are so similar to test and you are given so much review material, If you put in the work you will excel. Midterms and exams might be out of 120 and put in outta 100, boosting grade. Also allows revisions to learn and get upto 20 back

Provides plenty of material including lecture videos and practice problems. You need a good group for team exams and homeworks because they are hell. Exams are very similar to practice exams and revisions allow you to get a lot of points back. Says there isn't a curve but all exam grades are out of 100 instead of the actual amount of points listed.
Great lecturer, teaches hard subject well

Great lecturer that makes difficult content pretty digestible; revisions and extra credit will buffer your grade a ton. Lots of homework that's really easy to cheat on, but not doing it makes the class very hard, so try to do as much of it as possible.

Dr. Talamo gives very little partial credit on exams and his rubrics are extremely difficult. You can get 20 points back but not on the final (worth 25% of your grade). His teaching was terrible. He doesn't teach. He expects you to watch lectures outside of class, adding an entire other course load worth of time onto what he already requires.

Professor Talamo made this class significantly easier than the content actually is. There are online lectures, so you don't need to go to lecture or recitation, but my recitation instructor was very helpful. The instructional team for this class is the best I've seen at the university. Talamo genuinely cares about the success of his students.
actually one of the best professors I've ever had for math
He might be the best professor I've ever had. Absolutely amazing at what he does, and watching his online lectures made me feel actually enlightened.
Professor Talamo is a fantastic teacher - his lectures are engaging and he provides tons of support. Use unstuckstudy alongside the textbook and study sessions for an easy A.
There's a reason he has so many great reviews he's awesome

was very fair and had all his lectures zoomed as well so you didnt have to go in class which was very helpful. Calc 2 as a subject can be hard but he is VERY fair and gives corrections and extra credit on midterms and even the final. Just the take home midterms are very difficult so make sure you give your team a lot of time to complete those.

This class is a lot of learning and cramming lol but he did an amazing job teaching the content. I am very happy to have had him as my professor. Make sure to watch the prerecorded lectures to get a better understanding of the lecture and make sure to do test corrections, they help a lot with your grade. You got this!!
We love Jim! We love Jim! Study, do your revisions, and don't pick bricks for teammates on the group parts of exams, and you will do fine. Also... do the homework... for real. I see you.
The greatest to ever do it.

I can honestly say professor Talamo loves math and loves teaching it and cares deeply about his students success. You are given any resource you would possibly need on carmen, and as long as you want to pass his class, you will.
Quite simple: The Goat

I've gotten an A in every class in my 3 semesters except Math1151 and Phys1250. After 1151, I was scared I would struggle a lot with this class, but Talamo provided every single resource and opportunity necessary to succeed. I did every team-midterm on my own and only really bothered watching the lectures for studying, and I did great.

There are tons of opportunities to raise your grade with test revisions and extra credit. His tests are very similar to the samples he gives out. The group midterms can be challenging so start them before the day they're due.

Currently in this course, one of my all time favorite professors. He posts so much content for you to use depending on your learning style (lecture vids, online interactive free textbook, guided notes, practice questions & exams) and is a fantastic lecturer. Lectures are optional, but go. Cheat sheets on exams & midterm test corrections is a plus.
Talamo just grabs your attention the moment he begins and it just helps me pay more attention to his lectures and understand what is going on throughout the semester. Best calc teacher I have had.
the goat

Can be extremely biased and has favorites despite what all the other ratings say. Helpful to some but unhelpful to those who he doesn't look highly upon based on his own opinion. Exams are difficult and are usually harder than any practice exam. We had no test corrections but I heard the students now do so i'm not totally sure what that is like.

1172 is definitely a difficult class because of how much stuff there is to do throughout, but the grading scheme is extremely fair and provides a million chances to get back up if grades slip. Just please don't COAM. Jim is a great guy. Sometimes his lectures get a bit slow, so just watch on a higher speed. First class where I actually enjoyed math

Hands down the best professor I'll ever encounter at this University. Lectures are awesome; they're in-person, online, and prerecorded. Exams are online and you get to complete a portion of it with a team of 4. You can also revise your exam. This guy takes teaching to a whole new level!
What a great Pro. He really knows what he's doing and has a fantastic way of teaching and conveying the new concepts.
great, just make sure to stay up to date and not to fall behind. Lot's of opportunity for success.

Great at teaching content. Also, I liked that he made online lecture videos and the class was more of a review and ask questions about the videos. It really helped me learn the content well. Overall, Talamo is a great professor.

Hated how the class is set up-flipped classroom-had to everything on your own. Lecture videos are long and boring. The team exams were very annoying and took an excessive amount of time. The actual exams were hard but you can use notes, which would help a bit. You can revise for up to 50% back on exams (but usually you don't get the full 50% back).

BEST MATH PROFESSOR! Definitely try to take his course because he is one of the best professors out there. The next semester, I had a question about the math class I was taking then and my professor was unavailable, and he still helped. 
Incredible professor who is insanely smart, and his exam problems are funny.
Highly highly recommend.

Absolutely amazing. Along with Dr. Rudman, they deliver the BEST math class I've taken. The flipped classroom model is PERFECT for math and makes learning YOUR responsibility. Class time is about asking questions on homework and time for homework is lecture time. Midterms are straightforward and group midterms are a nice challenge.
He is an excellent professor. His lecture videos are very thorough and he ensures the content is clearly explained.

He's a good professor and has a great personality. 

The course is a classic Engineering weed-out course that is designed to break you. yeah, they may teach a+b=c but they'll be very creative in turning it into an impossible question, especially in the take-home midterms. Just keep at it and don't give up. He's always available to help.

Talamo gives you everything you need to succeed (practice exams) and has great lectures. He has a great personality.The class grade is the 4 midterms and final. Ximera homeworks are too long and due every other day. I didn't do well on the midterms (~60%) and final but had a good team on the team midterms and because of corrections, got a B+.
Organized and what is covered in class is what you are tested on

This instructor is great as same as the rate! I took his 1172 last semester. His grader always give clear and detail comments about why the points losing in the midterm, and you got chance to make revision to get up to 50% lost points back.
So many resources available to succeed. Talamo does a great job at explaining topics and offering different ways for students to learn.

He does "Reverse Classroom Style" which did not work for me. You can easily get 100% on homework. But the tests are really hard. This semester had 4 midterms, which felt like a lot. There is a timed part (which I could never finish) and home (which can get insanely hard). He lets you do revisions on the test after. He is a great guy- wholesome.

Professor gives students option to learn according to their learning style. Each topic is discussed in person, via videos, through an online text book, and reviewed through homework. Exams have individual timed portion which can be revised for half credit back, and a group portion which the group has a few days to complete.

Jim is one of the best math professors I've had. He truly has a passion for what he teaches and he explains the concept really well and he always answered my questions. There are 4 midterms  and each one is split into a timed and take home part all of which are virtual. The take home exam can take 4-5 hours long but you take it with a group.
Professor Talamo is very good at what he teaches

Jim does pretty well with the lectures and helps his students understand the material. All of the lectures can be attended over zoom if desired and all of the recordings are posted. The tests are challenging and they are split into a timed and take-home portion (which can sometimes take 4+ hours) It is a lot of work, but otherwise he is great

Jim is an AMAZING professor. He was always providing as many resources as possible to help on exams and quizzes. He was very understanding and accommodating to students. He is one of the few bright spots in the Math department.

Tough class! Had him before COVID and then he was extremely arrogant when I had him and didn't like me asking him questions! Tests were hard and you gotta make sure you study hard since there weren't "corrections"   you could do

Talamo was a good professor. He makes it really difficult to not succeed in his 1172 course. There are plenty of EC opportunities and you can correct your tests for 1/2 credit back. Best prof I've had for math thus far at osu.

Jim Talamo was a really great math teacher. His lectures explain the material very well and make it understandable. The tests are hard, but he allows test corrections so you can learn from your mistakes and improve your grade. Half of the tests are with a group but are long.

Dr. Talamo is the best professor I have had. He made difficult conceptual concepts easy to grasp. He abswers questions very well and is super accessible outside of class. There are 1 to 2 pre-lecture videos to watch which normally are around an hour, and then he asks that you attempt the ximera homework prior to class to ask informed questions.

Talamo is a great teacher. His pre-recorded lectures are super informative and he let's you take group tests which helps to boost the grade. However, the class is quite difficult so be prepared to put some work in.
Professor Talamo is great. He explains concepts in an easy to understand manner. Tests are long but reasonable and you can make revisions for half credit back.
The professor is very helpful and the course is set up very reasonably. As long as you do your work, this professor makes it so you can succeed.
This class completely sucks and Jim is extremely arrogant with a superior attitude. He also didn't teach much when I had him! Exams are difficult and TAs blatantly make mistakes while grading!

Great professor, tough class.

Be prepared for low initial exam grades, you are able to correct exams for half credit back which improves course grades. There is no curve, but he offers 2% extra credit.
One of the best math professors I've ever had. You have to go to class and put effort in, the material isn't easy, but as long as you try and ask questions when you need it you'll do well.

The content itself was not bad, especially if you have already taken AP in high school. I often relied more on the recitations than watching the lectures themselves--sometimes they were very long and not useful to me. The take home exams took hours (4+), so make sure to get a good group and set aside time to complete them. Overall, not bad.

God awful online class. Your entire grade is based on 5 separate 5+ hour long written exams that are graded by TAs who could care less. Also, they made consistent and blatant errors in their grading throughout the entire semester. If that sounds like a good class to you then go ahead.

Dr. Talamo does a good job teaching this course. Lectures are specific and convey the content well to prepare you for exams. Exams are hard but the availability of corrections provide a good opportunity to increase your test grades. He is always willing to assist you when he can and is clearly passionate about teaching this course.
Great guy, his class was great even though 1172 itself is hard. His TAs on the other hand, they really sucked overall

Talamo was simply amazing, always responded to your emails and was always understanding of what situations you had going on. Never wen't to a live lecture or recitation and still managed an A in this class. Just choose whatever works the best for you, for me it was pre-recorded lectures and studying the practice problems:)
Math 1172 is one of the hardest math classes ever. Talamo tries his best to make it fun and easy to understand. Cares a lot about his students.

Talamo is probably the best math teacher I've ever had. You can tell he's passionate about teaching and his lectures make difficult material easy to understand. Tests are challenging but fair, and you're guaranteed to have seen similar problems in class. Even if you do bad, group exams are averaged with individual exams and will boost your grade.

Jim is always available for his students and cares about student understanding. He goes above and beyond in order to make sure students are understanding his lecture content. He is definitely a fair teacher and offers tons of opportunities to improve within his class. The contents is extremely hard but he makes the class worth it.

James Talamo is the best math professor you could have. I took 1172 instead of 1152, an objectively easier class, so I would have him. I came in with AP credit and didn't know if I should retake Calc 1 or take 1172. He sent me a practice midterm so I could see the difficulty. Extra credit given, fair exams, great in office hours. Take this class!
Hard class, but GREAT PROFESSOR
Professor Talamo is the goat

Just the best math professor I could've asked for here at Ohio State. He cares about every student and always makes himself available to help. He always posts his notes on time and even before class so you can ask questions on what you don't understand. Exams are hard so study hard for them. Quizzes and homeworks offer some buffer.

Jim is one of the best teachers I've had at OSU and I wish I could have taken his class in person this past fall semester. The class is difficult and there are a lot of tests (midterm every 2-3 weeks), but he was extremely fair and let us do them with groups. Definitely cares about his students and wants you to learn.

This class is definitely the most difficult class that I've taken but Jim is just the coolest guy and always posts his notes on time for everyone to follow. Explains very well in lecture. I would say there were times that I didn't understand the material in lecture and the exams were tough but that wasn't even his fault its the department.

This class is very difficult and is considered a "weed out" but he literally did his absolute best the make the experience as smooth and easy as possible. Explains lectures in detail and is always available through office hours or email.

His lectures and guided notes are very easy to understand and learn from. Although the class itself is very difficult, he makes it easy. I liked how his lectures were structured and how the reading was optional. My only gripe with the class is that although you get 5 credit hours, you put in a lot more time. Though, that' not Talamo's fault.

Really cares about your learning, and is always willing to answer questions. The tests are very hard, but generally reflected what you learn in lecture pretty well. Make sure to good on quizzes and homework cause that'll save your grade from the midterms and final.

Jim is a great guy, and his lectures are amazing. This class is difficult, but Jim is definitely the professor you want to have. I took this class online, and I only attend asynchronous lectures. I do not even need to attend live lectures because he explains the concepts so well in the pre-recorded classes! He is always there for his students!
THE GREATEST PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME. He forces us to think logically and really helps us understand math rather than just memorize things.
Great professor
Easy to follow lectures and notes, posted all on time

He's the best math professor I've ever had. He was able to design the midterms and final so that you could work with a group and use the internet and take the test over a 24 hour period, but created each question so that you couldn't cheat, since all of the questions were so unique. This process really fostered collaboration.

Jim is an amazing professor. He understands both that math is almost never a scenario where you cant collaborate with other and use the internet, as well as virtual learning is not the best way to learn. By allowing us to work in groups for the entire course, he turned it from one of the most dreaded courses into one of the best.

Talamo is easily one of the best professors / teachers I have ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable and intelligent, and actually cares about your understanding of the subject. Even with a class of almost a 1000 students (there was like 900 something in Fall 2020)! Definitely the best calc professor at OSU.

Jim's the best math professor I've ever had. The course content itself is pretty difficult but the way Jim structured the class made an A definitely achievable. His lectures are clear a relevant to exam questions. He also writes all graded material himself which is definitely a positive, however, TAs did exam grades and sometimes graded harshly
He is a great guy who cares about his students.
Greatest teacher I've had. Very good lectures and explanations of a hard topic.
Best prof I have ever met in OSU so far!
Great with explaining Calc and teaches it very well. Highly recommend this professor to any one who needs to take Calc 2.

He's the best professor for 1172 which really isn't saying much. The class is ridiculously hard and he does the best with what he has. The math department is really at fault for having such an awfully structured class to try to weed freshmen out. Use all the recitation worksheets they give you and watch youtube videos if you want to pass.
Very very very good math professor. Definitely go to office hours if you have questions.
He is the only good professor for 1172. Take him if you can. He is accessible outside of class, and is generous in giving back exam points.

Jim is a fantastic professor! He genuinely cares how everyone in the class is doing. Notability lecture notes are are available at the end of class on Carmen. I frequented Jim's office hours, and he was great help. There was also at least a 4.5% curve.

James is a great math professor. His lectures were extremely organized and straightforward. The practice exams were close to the actual exam and great study material. The most important thing about this class is actually going to lecture. I think it would be very hard to do well in class if you skipped lecture often and didn't actively take notes.

Don't let my grade fool you, it's just that the class itself is hard. I had a different professor in the beginning of the semester, but I switched to James mid semester and he helped boost my grade. All he wants is to help you out and make sure you understand everything, but overall, he was really helpful to me and making sure I didn't fail

He is an amazing professor. He always uses the easiest way to explain those difficult concepts. He is extremely patient. Definitely should go to his office hours or set up an appointment with him if you need any help.

He's a pretty good lecturer. He's been teaching 1172 for so long that he has a very good insight on what can and will be on the exams. His lecture notes are actually useful for solving the homework problems, which the exams are heavily based on. 1172 is a hard class but he will give you all his tips on how to succeed.
Very clear notes. Respected. He is one of the best maths instructors. You just need to listen to his lecture then you understand everything.

Jim is honestly such a gem. Calc 2 (especially at OSU) will be very hard--the exams are made by the department and all classes/sections are standardized, but Jim does a good job preparing you for them. I had friends in other sections that came to his lectures because they were so good. You need to do more than just the assigned work to do well tho.

Talamo is definitely a great professor, and does a terrific job making the content of 1172, which can be dry and difficult at times, very easy to understand. Without a doubt the best math professor I've had. The class is mostly easy if you took Calc BC, if not it'll be more difficult, but there was a 4% curve when I took it, and was fine.
He's a fantastic professor in a very hard class. He gets straight to what you'll need to know, but he makes even the hardest of material understandable.
Has great lectures, great worksheets, and a great sense of humor. Also, he is one of the few professors that actually cares about his students.

Jim is by far the best teacher I've ever had at OSU, and potentially one of the best teachers in my entire education. He is very patient, very approachable and very responsive to questions. He makes himself available outside of class, clearly presents what's expected of the students for exams, and just in general makes taking his class be a joy.

Jim is the absolute best lecturer you can have for 1172, I went to his lectures even though he wasn't my prof (Had Diego Penta, he was alright but taught in a quite conceptual way that could be confusing at times), I emailed him and got his lecture times and building. He gave awesome notes and remarks regarding upcoming exams/quizzes, he's the best

I was terrified to take this class at OSU (not to mention I did not take CalcBC in high school). I cried over this class multiple times and it was a ton of work, but I got an A and that's all thanks to Jim. He has GREAT lectures, he's funny, and he is always happy to meet outside of class. If you take this course, you NEED Jim.

Never realized how much Jimbo was a gem until having 2 terrible Math professors directly after. Very easy to understand, goes at a great pace and is extremely organized in his lectures. 1172 is a beast regardless but he'll make it much easier to handle. Also very easy on the eyes.

I took 1172 as a first-semester freshman after coming in from AP Calc AB. That wasn't the best choice I've ever made. The class is rigorous at best and tear-inducing at worst. The tests and quizzes are made by the department, not Jim, but Jim is easily the only reason I did as well as I did. He breaks things down and explains things well. Premium.
He is a good teacher but the tests are extremely tough.

Jim is by far the best teacher I've ever had at OSU. Math 1172 is a notorious weed-out course, but his teaching method is really great. The final exam was VERY difficult with a class average of 59%. Overall grade curved about +5%. ANYONE TAKING 1172 NEEDS JIM AS THEIR LECTURER. OSU math department, please give him a raise. Or clone him. Or both.

Jim is a fantastic Calc II professor. He's great at explaining concepts and breaking them down in a way that's easy to understand, and he is also good at teaching the mechanical side of solving problems too. He's so good, in fact, that I didn't find the content any more difficult when we started learning content that I didn't learn in AP Calc BC.

Thank goodness he posts his lecture notes online because this allows me to skip almost every lecture. When I do go, he's very clear about the content and he actually teaches you how to do the problems. This is mainly a review of AP Calc BC.

Hands down the most friendly and understandable lecturer in the Department of Mathematics. His notes are the best quality I've ever seen and truly helps you succeed and understand math if you go to his Office Hours.
He's just awesome!

Talamo makes math interesting and fun. He's very quirky and intelligent and I really enjoyed his lectures. I was told Calc 2 was the hardest math class at OSU. Talamo made it more than bearable and would suggest that anyone who has the opportunity to have him, DO IT.

Jim by far made taking Calc two more bearable than I've heard. I took the summer course so it was a little faster than the regular semester, but doable. I would highly suggest paying attention to series and what he wants for series. I would also recommend using the worksheets. Overall, the course isn't that bad.

Talamo is a great lecturer but the bottom line is that math 1172 is just a hard class. You have to keep up with the worksheets and prepare for every exam  heavily by doing the practice exams until you clearly understand everything. In his lecturers he points out a lot of past exam questions to note and common mistakes made on exams, which was huge

Most people advised me not to take calc 2 at OSU. I'm glad I stuck with my gut and had Talamo as a teacher. He was phenomenal. He made learning so easy. Of course you have to put in time after class to learn. His math shirts were hilarious. The curve in the class was huge. Also he was quite charming ;). What more could you ask from a professor!

I have hated math since high school, and calculus was no exception last semester. This semester however, I learned to enjoy  calculus 2 thanks to Talamo.
