Most people say that Calc 2 at OSU is one of the hardest math courses available, but he made it bearable and, dare I say it, understandable. Great examples and well thought out explanations.
He really cares about the material he is teaching. Really encourages me to learn

Jim is hands down the best math professor I've had in Ohio's State's notoriously difficult math department. His lectures are amazing and he explains everything very clearly. He wants you to do well and will take feedback and go over things again. The class is gonna be hard no matter what, but he makes it bearable.
Great Lecturer!

Jim was a fantastic lecturer. He explained concepts clearly and gave proof for all major ideas. On the days leading up to exams, he would hold review sessions during his free time after class. 1172 is as a difficult course, and not having Calc BC in highschool (like me) makes it even harder, but Jim made the material easy to understand.

Calc II was honestly one of the hardest classes I've ever taken. The workload is not easy. I spent a lot of time going to office hours or asking questions after class. He was very helpful and really seemed to care about me and my understanding of the subject material. Could not have asked for a better professor.

Calc II is not an easy class, but you wont have a better prof. than Talamo. He is immensely smart, and explains complex topics extremely well. Due to the nature of the class lectures will fly, but absolutely talk to him if you need some extra help. Hard but absolutely doable.

Best math department teacher at OSU. Seriously... students in other classes or even other courses would come to his lectures or review sessions. 1172 was an insanely hard class to stay afloat in. Beware: I didnt read the method of grading online homework closely enough and barely prepped for the final bc of Ochem. Dropped from solid C to C-

James Talamo is THE MAN. Best math teacher I have ever had. Class is definitely not easy, but he makes it better by always explaining things thoroughly and being there for students. He also wears super funny math shirts. For a tough subject you really cannot get a better professor than him. Class wise: 1 final, 3 exams, 10 quizzes, and hw each week

Jim is the BEST. He really loves math and is amazing at explaining it. He is very willing to work with you if you aren't understanding. By far the best math professor I have had and quite possibly the best professor I have had. Really great person. The class is difficult but he makes it very manageable.
HE DEVOTES ON MATH VERY MUCH,so many times after the class I go to ask him questions and he will continue explaining to me along the walking path for a mile!Feel go on to take an extra whole lecture

Dr. Talamo is hands down the best math professor! His lectures are very clear for the most part (he derives some of the theorems and can get kinda boring). The content for 1172 is tough in general (thanks to the math and engineering departments), but you're not gonna get a better professor than Dr. Talamo.

Professor Talamo is probably one of the best and inspiring I ever had. I would have a discussion about Calculus' application in real life with him after class and he is very good at getting people to like Calculus. Awesome professor, definitely take his class.

Prof. Talamo saved my calculus experience. After being with an unclear lecturer, he helped me to achieve far higher grades on tests through his clear lectures and after-class help. His examples in class were valuable for the tests, and I didn't miss any sessions of the class because they guaranteed I understood the material. A splendid math teacher

Jim is honestly the best math teacher/professor I've ever had. He's really great at thoroughly explaining everything and does his best to be available to help everyone. Go to his review sessions! He's also an adorable nerd. He wears math t-shirts all the time and likes to make math jokes. Take his class if you can!
Best professor I have ever had.

This guy really is the man very very helpful No lie gives the best lectures I will probably ever get in college Hes funny, cool, confident He cares a lot he created tons of practice problems (worksheets) for students to practice Take notes in class! and review them
Best lecturer ever. Makes a hard class much easier. Is also passionate about math and also teaching.
One of the best lecturers I have ever had. Super clear and easy to understand. Loves math and is very helpful to students. If you do not do well it is your fault not his

He is a very good lecturer who takes time to explain his steps while still moving at a steady pace. You could tell he wanted his students to do well. Offered many pre-midterm/final review days that were very helpful. Highly Recommend. Also wears funny calc-pun t-shirts

Take this Professor if you can! Crystal clear lectures and answers any question asked.  Does his best to prepare students for the difficult tests the math department writes. Highly recommend Professor Talamo.

He gives AMAZING lectures. Filled in for McGinnis after he left, and he was so much better (McGinnis used to be the best teacher for this class, at least so they say). His notes are good, and its not hard to focus. Total nerd, but adorable. Would have had at least a B+ if he was my lecturer all along.
Great guy, actually cares for students. Nice math shirts.

Fantastic math professor. Is crystal clear with his explanations of sometimes difficult concepts, and his passion for math rubs off on everyone. I'm not saying that 1172 is an easy class, but he makes it as manageable as it can be. If you do his homeworksquizzes and go to his office hours with questions, you will be in a position to succeed.

Jim has been a great lecturer. He explains everything pretty clearly and is ALWAYS trying to help students understand better. He's very willing to go over related material that isn't technically in the course if you want to understand better (during office hours). He expects a lot but he gives you everything you need to excel if you work hard.

this class is VERY difficult. 40% on first midterm i thought i understood the material. many have failed calc 1 at osu. i may have to drop. not sure one can come back from this. he seems like a nice guy but he literally writes paragraphs on the board instead of actual problems with numbers, so he always runs out of time and doesn't finish lecture
Great guy. Really good at explaining concepts and going through hw problems. Also likes to wear math shirts, so def take his recitation. Hard class, but would've gotten lower grade without his help.

Jim is the best teacher I've ever had. So helpful, and he would do anything to help his students understand the material. He has a unique way to make you curious about math. His class was amazing and I can definitely say it was he best class I took at OSU.

Best math TA anyone could ask for. The lecturer was not always clear, but he laid out all of his material clearly and in a way that made math easy to understand. Really cares and goes over anything people are stuck on.
Jim is a great TA! He loves math and makes the material as clear as he can.
Jim is great! He is passionate about what he teaches and is extremely helpful. Gives thorough lectures and worksheets to practice.

Jim is great. He is an amazing t.a and makes everything so easy to understand. Hes interesting as well, not a boring old t.a who cant hold your attention. If you just try hard in his class you'll get a good grade.

Best math TA I've had at Ohio State. The lecturer was not the best teacher, but going to recitation with Jim helped me learn everything. He's nice, understanding, a fair grader, and makes the material crystal clear and easy to understand. If anyone gives him below a 5 for helpfulness or clarity, they're insane.
Best TA in the world.  He always wears amazing math shirts.

Jim is an exceptional, friendly, intelligent, and patient instructor/TA. He explains concepts clearly, and his teaching style is exemplary. I was mad at him once for not having the answer key to one of his homework or classwork assignments during the week of a fast-approaching exam so that I could have more time to compare thoroughly my solutions t

nicest guy ever, lets you retake missed quizzes as long as you email him.  explains everything perfectly,  one of the few TA's on campus that wants you to do well in his course. HE SHOULD BE TEACHING THE CLASS HIMSELF!
Excellent teacher, should teach as a career.  Very clear in explaining concepts and problems step by step.
Awsome! Could not ask for a better math t.a.  He should be a professor and not just a t.a.

summary_comment: Professor Kish is widely regarded as one of the nicest professors at OSU, known for his clear explanations and supportive approach. Students appreciate his recorded lectures and accessible office hours, though they note that exams can be challenging and not always aligned with homework or review materials. Overall, many find his teaching effective and his care for students genuine, making him a popular choice among math students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kish is widely regarded as one of the nicest professors at OSU, known for his clear explanations and supportive approach, though his classes require significant self-study. Students appreciate his comprehensive lecture recordings and accessible office hours, but note that exams differ significantly from homework and quizzes, and success depends heavily on thorough preparation.

Ratings.comment: the nicest professor at OSU

Pretty much a class where you need to teach yourself stuff. Two midterms and a final make up a big chunk of your grade. Exams are long and nothing like homework of quizzes. David doesn't make the exams and tried to help but the math department at OSU doesn't set you up for success.
Only understood this class and got a B- because he had a good TA; review sheets don't fully match to what's on the exam

I really enjoyed Professor Kish. I am not the greatest in math, but his lectures are easy to understand and he truly knows how to break down a problem. Plus he records all of his lectures, in case you miss a day. His office hours were extremely helpful so I'd advise to take advantage of them when you can. He's a sweet guy overall!

Prof. Kish is an exceptional and caring professor. I had him for 1148 and he is great at explaining concepts and answering questions. He posts most of the lectures online, but I would go to class in case of questions. He prepares you well for the exams, which are mostly multiple choice, so they are easier than you would think as long as you study.
He taught the material in a great way! I was able to understand everything and apply it to quizzes and tests. He is also cares about what he is teaching and about his students!

I am in my first year at OSU and I am positive that Dr. Kish will end up being my favorite professor that I will have. He is a very kind man and gives very helpful lectures. He responds quickly and cares about all of his students. He extends deadlines and makes accommodations. I highly recommend Dr. Kish.
Nice guy but its a math class so expect to be bored.
He is very good with explaining hard concepts and is a very nice person overall. He puts things into dumb dumb terms which was great for me lol

LOVED Professor Kish! He's such a nice guy and always goes over the material in a good way! I'm not the brightest at math but I found with his lecture style, I did well! Highly recommend him for any math!

David was awesome, as someone who is bad at math he truly cared about my success, making time one on one to help. He's the reason I passed, when taking the same course at other colleges I did poorly. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but if you're on the edge of passing or failing attendance is taken into consideration with grading.

Prof. Kish is an excellent choice and you can really tell that he loves his students. He is always very willing to explain or reexplain and clears any fog of confusion for the lessons. He brings a very positive attitude to class every day. He makes the difference between trying to learn the concepts on your own and going to class night and day.

KISH IS SO AMAZING 100/10 IF I CAN RATE HIM. Having Kish in your schedule = Great Semester/Year

trust.

Professor Kish was amazing! He was the kindest professor I've ever had. He has so many office hours and will add extra ones during exam weeks. He is always willing to answer questions during lectures and genuinely cares about student's well-being. He provides guided notes which is also super helpful.

Had him for 1075 and 1148. Amazing guy, can't say enough good things about him. Always had office hours and was always accommodating and caring. One of the best profs I've had, by far. Clearly conveys the material and answers questions. Always available to help and posts the lectures. Just amazing overall.

I absolutely love David Kish. I had him for math 1075 and now for 1148. He goes above and beyond to help students understand the material, even offering different methods to make sure everyone understands. He is super understanding when sick and missing assignments, quizzes, and exams. Genuinely the best math teacher I have ever had.
Really nice professor, very flexible and his way of explaining concepts is comprehensible.
I really dislike math but Professor Kish was extremely kind and wholesome. Great teacher to be around even if the course material didn't interest me.

David was great, I'm not good at math and started the course nearly failing. David helped and supported through every step, I also used tutoring in the Math basement. Take advantage of office hours and tutoring. If David sees you trying and investing, he will invest in you.

Professor Kish is the literal definition of a dream professor! He is so caring and genuinely wants all of his students to succeed. His teaching style is very easy to follow and he tries his best to be as engaging as possible during lectures. Don't be afraid to ask questions because he will be more than happy to answer them.

Professor Kish is an amazing lecturer. He is so chill and genuinely cares about students! He is really patient with questions as well (doesn't make you feel stupid). Although math itself could get a bit dry but his humor kept it fun and the lectures are entertaining! Easy to talk to as well.
Such a genuine guy, really cares about his students and explains everything very well. I would take this class over again just to have him be my professor again.

summary_comment: Professor Barbu is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, known for extremely fast lectures that rarely pause for questions, lack of prepared materials, and an unresponsive teaching style. Students consistently report difficulty learning from her lectures and often rely on self-study, TAs, or external resources to grasp the course material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Barbu is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, known for extremely fast lectures, poor communication, and a lack of preparatory materials. Students consistently report that attending her lectures is largely ineffective for learning, necessitating self-study or reliance on TAs and tutors.

Ratings.comment:
This professor is one of the worst professors I have ever had.
Extremely fast lectures. Rarely pauses to take student questions. Does not upload any slides or problems in advance. Assumes students know content when content was not yet covered. Summarily: be prepared to teach yourself the coursework OR use the math tutors.
Fire this woman.
Horrible Professor. If you end up with her, attend a different lecturer because you will learn nothing.

I didn't have her for a class, she was my advisor unfortunately. Never let me talk, talked endlessly about things I didn't ask, screwed me into taking calculus twice (on top of AP calc i took in highscool), not responsive to emails, makes it hard for me to follow my religion. 

Seriously dislike her, she should be fired.

STAY AWAY!!! All she does is mumble to the board the whole time. She doesn't face the class at all, and she writes way too fast. It's impossible to learn anything from her. I had to rely solely on my TA to pass this class. Don't bother going to lectures, you'll learn nothing.
literally just mumbled to herself the whole time for every lecture. i never actually learned anything in lecture so it's pointless to go. had to teach myself everything.
For your own sanity, do not take this professor.

every lecture she faces the board and mumbles to herself and says yes we know this so then we do this for the whole time no one asks questions because she doesnt look up. Absolutely no notes or calendar. The notes you get are photos she emails of the board hours after lecture.I have to use the book and teach myself lecture is pretty much pointless

do NOT take any class with Barbu if you have SLDS accommodations. I provided my accommodations before the semester started and discussed with the professor before lecture and she would not accommodate me. it was so bad i had to petition to waive math 1149 as a graduation requirement bc i was being denied my right to an equitable classroom.

I genuinely felt like I was going to have an aneurysm in this class. She wrote way too fast, didn't explain topics or label them, and assumed you knew all of the material. I was told that questions weren't for the classroom and to ask the TA but the TA got mad when I asked questions or said they were going too fast.I learned nothing. Switch classes

oh my god...AVOID THIS CLASS. if you can take this class over the summer PLEASE consider. Basically...The whole department is awful. She uses a chalkboard, can never tell what shes writing, no notes that are on canvas. I utilized the textbook and taught myself everything. actually the most horrendous class ever and i did very well in 1148.
Terrible

She flies through material and does not take questions or look at students. I stopped going after the first week. Attending lecture is extra credit. The tests are awful and so are the exams. I tried to teach myself from the book because her and my TA were unhelpful. This class is near impossible to pass. Do not take it if you can.
Did not even look back at students. Stopped going to lectures after the first couple of weeks. TA as a life saver and the only reason I passed the in-person quizzes.
Literally is just talking to herself

Honestly it's not her fault, OSU's math department just sucks for math1148 & math1149. She crammed a lot of info during lecture and went very fast but she does seem very nice when you speak to her 1 on 1. You'll have to rely on your TA if you want to do good. Exams were open book so use google all you want but it's not easy questions.

Steer clear. She wrote and spoke extremely quickly (and mumbled much of the material) and I ended up not getting a thing out of the lectures despite attending every time. No questions were taken. Neither core concepts or the thought process behind what we were doing was explained. My worst academic experience to date.
She turned her back to us the whole time. She spoke very fast and it seemed like she did not want to be there.

Lol. She's nice when talking to her one-on-one, but she literally can't teach. 

1. Like others have mentioned, she has her back turned the ENTIRE duration of class like she's talking to herself. 

2. She talks & writes so fast as if she's in a speeding contest. 

3. She never asks if students have any questions. 

Should I keep the list going...?

shes seems like she doesnt want to teach us. she keeps her back to us the whole time while reading off of a paper. no real reason to even go to lecture you wont get anything. make use of your TA and connect math resources
Nice professor, but goes way to fast to even comprehend lecture material. Your TA is the best way to understand the material.

Literally the worse professor I have ever had. Lectures are pointless. The TA I had was 100x better than the actual professor. Professor doesnt know what shes doing 95% of the time. I had to teach myself everything. Definitely read all the chapters on the midterms and do the practice problems

TERRIBLE!!!! -Dont Go To Lectures -Do All Your Homework/work ahead -Quizzes are from textbook so look through it before ever Quiz -Your TA is your best bet -DO GOOD ON MIDTERMS!!!!!!! Final Exam is brutal so after the last midterm start going to lectures.

She is a horrendous teacher, worst math teacher I have had in my life. Writes the textbook on the board for lecture with little to no explanation on how or why she get's her answers. Highly recommend you do not take her math class, especially if it is Trig because it is brutal.
Shes just bad. no one goes to lecture because its beyond pointless and you won't learn anything anyway.
Reads the textbook out loud as lecture and likes to talk to the board. You would be better off going to the TAs office hours than sitting in her class.
A bad teacher and the worst advisor
Dont take her classuseless. Unless you are ready to study by yourself.
she think she is wellactually her teaching is very boring and useless.

Barbu is hands down the worst professor I've had at OSU. She talks at the chalkboard, answers her own questions, and doesn't get the class involved. Made going to an 8am 1000x harder, but she takes attendance so you have to go. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER!! I ended up teaching myself all of the material
I learned everything from my T.A. It is really hard to follow the information presented during her lectures.
Do not take her class. She teaches extremely quickly and never really takes questions.  It is almost pointless to go to class I teach myself everything and go to the tutor rooms.

It's really difficult to understand her with her accent. She doesn't teach the material the same way the book does. She never turns around from the black board, never makes eye contact with the class, and never asks if we understand. I stopped going to lecture and learned everything from my recitation teacher.

She taught the material HER WAY rather than the way in the BOOK. She talked way too fast and barely made any eye contact. When aske da question, the answer was still never clear. By the second week of class, no one ever attended lecture because we found we understood more by our TA's
She talked very FAST and you could barley understand her but she was a nice lady. Also she did not write clearly.

She can't teach, but she is very nice outside lectures. I once had a big mistake on my exam, she was willing to fix that, so it pretty much shows that she is nice and really wants you to pass. i had a good TA, so math 131 was much more bearable for me.

Terrible. Talks way too fast and writes on the board like she is insane. I don't think you could even ask a question because she never stops writing on the board or talking to it. Maybe if she slowed down a little and took time to explain what she will do she could even be a mediocre educator.

Ms. Barbu did not teach very well. Her accent is hard to understand, her handwriting isn't clear, and she does not explain things very well at all. I stopped going to lectures because they were useless and just learned from my TA.

Ms. Barbu was really nice and lighthearted, but she did teach quickly. She also didn't use the microphone or the overheads until near the end of the quarter, so it was hard to hear and see since everything was on the chalkboard. Her accent was sometimes hard to understand. But she is not a bad choice.

It's true she teaches quick. But the material isn't exactly a walk in the park. If you really want the A in here, you gotta earn by going to MSLC. Midterms are a bit tricky though, make sure you know the material well
eh
Lecture didn't help much because of her accent and her sloppy handwriting. if it weren't for the TA i wouldn't have passed the class
Speaks incredibly quickly, doesn't answer questions, assumes students understand everything.  Very unhelpful, had to go to MSLC all the time to get by.  Don't take her.
Take her if you can :)

I have never been fond of calc but she made it fascinating. She had a great Romanian accent but she really liked to teach and provided so many examples. Do the homework, practice exams, and you won't have to study too much because you'll know it if you do as she says. Amazing teacher and really cares for her students. I got 100s on all her exams.

SEI.Subject: ARTSSCI
SEI.Class Name: Arts and Sciences Survey: Mathematical and Physical Sciences

summary_comment: Professor Jin's teaching style is characterized by its unpredictability and reliance on uncurved exams, which can be challenging due to the rapid pace and disorganization. Students find his explanations limited, particularly for complex topics, and often feel condescended to when seeking clarification. Despite some positive aspects like available pre-lecture materials and a non-cumulative final, the overall consensus is that his approach is ineffective and detrimental to learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jin's teaching quality is generally poor, characterized by unpredictable and challenging exams, a disorganized lecture style, and a lack of effective explanations or feedback. Students found his exams to be overly difficult, especially the final, and often felt condescended to when seeking clarification.

Ratings.comment: 2415 with him was a goofy experience. The class jumps around a lot in difficulty (partial differential equations are the hardest part-be warned!), and your grade relied mostly on a couple of uncurved exams. There were three exams: an ok first one (mean 74), a way too easy second one (mean 81), and an brutal final that nuked grades (mean 64).
Pre-lecture slides and notes are available online. The final is non-cumulative.

"Does this make sense" is this professors favorite line. If you try asking him to explain something he freezes and never fully explains a problem. With tests, he does not provide explanation on what you did wrong and/or provide feedback, just number grades (typically he messes up grade scores too).

Doesn't know how to teach to students that have never seen the material and can't explain things if you have questions. He is obsessed with theorems & proofs. His tests are completely unpredictable to what is on them and he doesn't give any review or guidance on what to study other than "memorize the lectures and textbook." He is kinda funny tho

For some of the difficult topics, it helps to watch the Pearson videos on the topic before lecture and treat the class as a flipped classroom. He moves a bit fast and teaches using example problems so it might be a bit hard to get used to it but if you study the notes and take time to understand each example, you will do well on the exams.
I like non-cumulative final!

Bottom line: this professor was terrible. The exams were ridiculous, and he was super condescending. I went to his office hours a couple times, and every time he verbally insulted me for not knowing "basic knowledge" of multivariable calculus. The grade I got in this class was not at all representative of my knowledge on the material.

By far one of the worst professors you can have for 2173. Notes and lecture style is usually very disorganized. Exams are by far the worst out all the sections, with a good portion of the exam being proofs & content not directly related to the homework. Is condescending when students ask for help, and is ONLY here for another degree. nothing else.

He's generally likeable and pretty funny but his tests are very concept heavy. The only preparation he will give you for tests is to "study the lecture notes" because his style of exam question is often not found in the homework. Lectures are very confusing so watch the textbook video on the topic beforehand and take very good notes during class.

His lectures aren't great but if u take thorough notes, nothing not covered in lecture will be on the exam. It also really helps to watch the videos from the textbook to give u a good foundation for the content. Also the exam problems are usually the easiest of a certain topic. He will also hint at which problems are going to be tested.
He is really nice, and he is happy to help students.
This is a really nice person, with prepared organized ppt.

He's the least helpful and fair professor I've ever had. He does not explain concepts well, is quite condescending, and doesn't prepare you well for exams. He lets his mood affect his decisions. For example, he got angry and said, "I am going to put an impossible question on the exam that none of you will be able to solve (and he did)" He's awful.
Nice guy. can improve his accent.

Has a very hard time creating a line of reasoning with the course material and it makes it seem as if he is teaching random topics that do not link together at all. Because of this, it was very difficult to understand what will be on the test. Furthermore, the review sheets that are posted are very sporadic and not helpful.

Overall I like him personally, it is clear that he wants us to understand the content. However, we were not given enough practice material that related to quiz/exam content. I would go to lecture and feel so confident afterwards, only to be completely lost on the quiz. It would be beneficial to give out more homework with exam/quiz questions.
love it, big boy knows how to teach
Love it
Avoid.

DO NOT TAKE. Not only his he and his handwriting extremely difficult to understand, he was easily the rudest and most condescending prof I've had, and I don't think anyone ever walked away from lecture having understood anything. Asking questions is futile because he never answers anything directly. Recitation and practice problems saved me.
Felt like I didn't really learn much from the lectures and relied heavily on the textbook.

He's new, so I will cut him some slack, but his lectures were not good. He is not easy to understand, and he kind of puts you down for not understanding the material. He encourages questions, but he judges you for your question if it seems too easy. I never understood anything in the lectures. I only learned trig from my recitation.

summary_comment: Professor Veiga offers an easy class with straightforward homework and tests, though her lectures can be slow-paced and her notes are posted online. Quizzes and exams are generally manageable with adequate preparation, but the final exam carries significant weight. Her explanations focus on proofs, which some find unnecessary, and she is available to assist students as needed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Veiga offers a relatively easy class with clear expectations and straightforward assessments. While her lectures can be slow-paced and her handwriting poor, she provides accessible resources like posted lecture notes and practice exams, contributing to the overall ease of the course.

Ratings.comment: Class wasn't that bad. Her handwriting is pretty bad though but she posts the notes after lecture. It was online homework about once a week which was really easy to get a 100% on. 2 midterms and a final. Do the practice exams and you'll do pretty well on midterms. I didn't do as well on final (slightly on me). Had quizzes about 1 every other week.

Super easy class. Actual lectures were really slow and there honestly wasn't a lot of material that we covered through the entire class. Homework was incredibly easy maybe took 1.5 hours a week at most with the regular homework and a bit more with written homework. Tests also weren't bad just do the practice tests ahead and you'll be good.

Prof. Han Veiga is a decent professor. She explains all the "proof" which is very much skippable, and examples are few. Homework is generally easy. Periodic quizzes are also generally easy. Exams are generally easy, though our final was 40% of our grade, which is crazy. This is an easy class and she will help you if needed at any time.

summary_comment: Professor Kiers is a fair and approachable instructor who explains concepts well and prepares students adequately for exams. His assignments are manageable, though exams can be challenging. While his office hour explanations can be tough to follow at times, he is generally more lenient than other instructors in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kiers is a fair and approachable instructor who explains concepts clearly and prepares students well for exams, though his office hour explanations can be challenging. His assessments are test-heavy, with a significant portion of the grade coming from midterms and a final, and while the exams are challenging, he provides ample opportunity for students to ask questions and understand the material.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kiers is a fair instructor. If you go to his lectures and do his homework, you should alright. He gives a fair amount of homework, but it is not too difficult. I thought his exams were fair. However, his explanations in office hours can sometimes be a little hard to follow. He is much more fair than other 2568 instructors though.

Explained the material well & lecture wasn't too boring. Exams are pretty hard and the study material isn't great; end-of-chapter exercises are assigned but are way harder than exam questions. It's not impossible to do well but you need to be prepared to work for it

Dr. Kiers is a very nice guy who explains the concepts well. Majority of your grade is 2 midterms and a final, so its pretty test heavy. However, I believe he prepares you pretty well for them. He's not the most generous with partial credit but he will answer any questions you have. Overall I really liked him

summary_comment: Professor Cordero is known for his clear and organized lectures, providing ample practice problems and well-structured notes. He is highly responsive and available during office hours, making him a supportive instructor. Students appreciate his thorough explanations and efficient teaching methods, though they emphasize the importance of attending class regularly to manage the challenging material effectively.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cordero is known for his clear and organized lectures, providing ample practice problems and well-structured notes. He is highly regarded for his thorough explanations and availability during office hours, making complex concepts more accessible to students.

Ratings.comment: Julian is rly nice and often asks if students get confused. Calc is a pretty tough subject, but Julian did lots of practice problems in class and posted his lecture notes. Even though I ended with a c+ that is completely my fault because I often skipped lectures and recitations and was also taking other heavy classes.  I recommend Julian!

Dr. Mejia is a good and fair professor. He is good at simplifying concepts and his lectures are a lot more lively than others. It did feel as if the progression of the semester did take a hit on lectures, but Calc 2 is a pretty concept-dense course, so it is understandable. Anything you could see on an exam, he made time for in lecture.

Dr. Mejia-Cordero is a great lecturer and knows his stuff. The material of Calculus 3 can be challenging at times, but its very manageable if you make sure that you close gaps in knowledge early, since a lot of things build off of the earlier concepts quickly. His notes are amazing and extremely organized. But SHOW UP TO CLASS. Its worth your time.
very organized, very prepared, lecture very cohesive, tests not that hard because the tests don't cover that much a ton of material.

Lectures were very clear and intuitive, and he provided guided notes which were clearly organized. Resources were easy to find outside of class, though the homework program used was a bit extreme in length, and difficult to use at times. Even so, the clarity of lectures and quizzes make the drudgery of the homework worth it.
He gives clear lectures and goes through plenty of examples.  His office hours are great and he responds to emails quickly.

This was my second time taking calculus so it was more like a review, but compared to my high school calc teacher this experience was much better. His teaching was efficient and straightforward, so lectures were always engaging and easy to digest. He did plenty of practice problems and was always willing to do more. Absolute Chad if you ask me.

This was my second time taking calculus so I did not have to pay too much attention in his lectures but he is by far the best math teacher i've ever had. He does a lot of practice problems in class and is very clear with his steps and helps you understand why he did what he did in his work.

This guy is very good at introducing new topics to the class and getting them to try simplified practice problems. If you attend lecture and actually pay attention and go along with his in-class participation practice, you should do just fine in this class. I found it to be very helpful. Definitely take Math 1151 with him if you get the chance!

While calculus sucks, this was my second time taking it and he made it much less painful. His lectures are easy to follow and super helpful. He's extremely nice and not at all intimidating. The only bad aspects about the class are things out of his control and decisions made by the department. If you have to take calculus take it w him!

summary_comment: Professor Onofrei teaches Calculus 3 in a straightforward manner, focusing on clear explanations and non-cumulative exams. Her classes are structured with regular homework and a series of manageable exams, making the course accessible and fair compared to other math professors at OSU. While the lectures can be somewhat dry, the consistency and clarity of her teaching contribute to an overall positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Onofrei's calculus 3 class is known for its straightforward structure, consisting of five non-cumulative exams and regular homework assignments, making the course manageable and fair according to students. Her explanations are clear, and she provides ample practice material, though some find the lectures somewhat boring.

Ratings.comment: Professor Onofrei's calculus 3 class is very straightforward. Attend lectures, take homework every week / every other week, and there are 5 equally weighted exam grades. If you pay attention in lecture, the homeworks and the exams are very easy, and she doesn't overcomplicate the math when explaining it.

Dr. Onofrei's class was very straightforward - 5 unit tests basically, 17 quizzes(2 dropped), and 10 homework assignments(1 dropped). No weighted grades, so homework is a main contributor to grades. She uses Mastering for everything, so it is pretty easy. She gives out good partial credit; fair grader. Not a bad lecturer, explains content well.

She makes the class fair and doable out of all the other math professors that I've had. Class consists of 5ish exams and none of them are cumulative. Homework is reasonable, covers everything in lecture and quizzes are good review of what is covered in lecture.
Very fair teacher. 5 tests, only on the previous 3ish weeks of material. Not too much homework, and plenty of practice material was given for each exam. True class difficulty was probably around 2.5

Overall, as a prof. she'd be a 3 for me but compared to other profs. I've had/have heard of in OSU math department for Calc 1 & 2 she'd be a 5. Had online class (recorded lectures). Course used Pearson software MyMathLab for homework, quizzes, and exams. About 3-4 hours work a week. 5 exams non-cumulative and no final. Pretty solid overall.
One of the best math professors I've had. Gives lots of examples and the exams are just like the homework.

This course was not bad, definitely depends on if you enjoy calc. You have homework and two quizzes every week. Four times per question on homework and two attempts per quiz. Homework reflects the five non-cumulative exams exactly. Attendance is not mandatory. Homework examples were extremely helpful. (Online with meeting times)

Dr. Onofrei is a fine prof. Expectations for homework & quizzes are clear; due dates rarely ever change. No midterms, instead gives 5 non-cumulative exams that each cover the most recent chapters. Unless you LOVE math, lectures will be boring. My class is online, and her class is not too bad. I imagine her in person section would be more difficult.

Not bad. Perhaps she could've spent more time explaining the conceptual side of things, but I rarely found myself learning outside of class. No midterms or finals, instead there were 5 exams over each unit, none of which were cumulative. Spent like 30min-1hr each day and it was an easy A

She gives clear examples of what you should know for the tests, and homework mirrors the exams almost verbatim. You have a lot of chances to get points, and she's generous with partial credit. Doesn't go into much detail on theory, but I liked that since it wasn't relevant for exams. As long as you stay on top of your work it shouldn't be too hard

Dr. Onofrei is a solid teacher. Her lectures are practice problem heavy, and can be light on concepts. Which I found helpful But the majority of my respect for her came from how flexible she has been due to COVID. Our last test (class had no final) had severe technical issues, and rather than reschedule into finals week, she cancelled the exam.

Do not take it with her. She is egoistic and rude. All she does is write notes in class with no clear explanation. You will not receive any feedback for your homework assignment. I got an A in her class, but I did not learn anything useful. She is the definitely in the group of worst teachers in OSU.

Awful teacher.... dont ever take her for anything. She may know what shes talking about and she tech the information well but she could care less about the students. Homework is graded toughly and the difference between grading on exams is drastic. 5 people could have identical work and no one would get the same grade. Rude/misunderstands often.

Was rude to students asking questions on multiple occasions. She teaches a very well organized course, and is a fantastic lecturer. I cannot tell if she is rude and deliberately obtuse or simply uninterested in fielding student questions.

Great lecturer! Her system of 5 exams and no final is extremely nice. Exams are difficult but extremely fair (average typically a C). Partial credit is almost always given. Accent is perfectly fine. Do not expect a curve - grade is brought up by homework (Ximera) due to the weighting of the course. Always willing to answer questions and help!

Queen. Yeah, she teaches an 8 AM but she teaches it like an 8 AM. Her accent is 100% understandable. Her tests are difficult but there's nothing on them that is a surprise. No final, but 5 exams is actually a huge plus because you get a buffer from the first test. However, I will say that some people in my class definitely needed a shower.
She writes fast and a lot. Uses an old school projector but posts notes online. Attendance not mandatory but encouraged with extra credit. Exams are fair, homework is fair but out of a book.

Good lectures, her TAs graded fairly. No midterms or final - essentially just five chapter tests (which were all very fair). Has a bit of an accent but nothing crazy. Didn't go to office hours so I can't vouch for those. Our class did not have a curve.

Avoid if possible. If you're stuck with her, get help from your TA or go to tutoring because she does not want to help. Once spent 10 min yelling at students for correcting her when she was wrong. After she "convinced us" she was right, she looked back at her notes and confirmed we were correct. Best part of the class is her accent. Tests are hard.

Paying attention to her lectures is very important, and they are very helpful as well, but with the grading scale, every homework assignment is graded somewhat harshly, and without any useful feedback, but they contribute heavily to your final grade. The tests can be difficult, but she does prepare you adequately for them, and write good feedback

Lectures aren't that great. She doesn't allow time for questions but if you're decent at math and you get the homework done and keep up then you'll be fine. If you're not that good at teaching yourself math then she's not the right professor for you because she's not that accessible outside of class and she won't always understand your questions.
Definitely not recommended

I failed the first exam and got an A on the rest of them. It was sort of a wake up call. She teaches directly out of the book and if you go to class you should never be surprised by anything on the exams. Most of the time exam questions are taken directly from lecture. Homework assignments are graded very strictly. She is also a very quick writer.

Onofrei is a worse person than professor, and as a professor she's already awful. I don't think I've ever had a professor as rude as her, and her grader was a snarky little brat that mirrored her perfectly. Her exams were really challenging, her lectures unhelpful, and the hw immensely time-consuming. Such a vicious waste of my time and energy.

She's currently doing 1 bonus point for attendance on each day attendance is taken randomly throughout the semester, 12 times. She always takes attendance the class after the last exam when she passes them back. She has been very rude to people asking questions and has grading criteria you must adhere to. Focus on the example problems & its ok.
Average was about 60

Some people are intelligent and really good at research, but they are unfit to teach. I hope Silvia is one such person- or so i hope. I am not sure about her research, but as a student having taken her class i can say that she is objectively one of the worst professors i've had to deal with. I wonder why OSU hasn't fired her yet ?
worst professor I've had at ohio state

Avoid avoid avoid avoid this teacher. Linear algebra is an easy subject but she will make your life so much harder than it needs to be. Homework will be graded very hard so get a solutions manual and don't be surprised to miss points on the exam. The teacher is incapable of teaching the material and practically reads from the textbook

She is very professional and expects you to act the same. Make sure to get to class on time, especially for tests. She teaches at a good speed, and doesn't like to be corrected. You need the book because there is written homework. Also if you go to class you get bonus points, which you'll need in this class. Overall she conveys the material well.

one of the worst professor in OSU. For a 3 credit hour class, she gives 5 test. Yes, 5. Every week you have to do one online homework(20 questions) and one written homework (5-6 questions). She is very rude to students, not interested in helping at all. So if you have questions after class, get ready for rudeness. And if you have other choices, avoid.

Probably the least favorite professor I had. Unwilling to help outside of class, laughed at students in class, bad attitude, and just super strict. Very rude as a person. Accent you can get used to. Handwriting is questionable. Lots of homework. Unreasonable grader.   Personally, I suggest avoiding her big time.
Makes topics harder than they need to be. Strict grader. Would recommend taking the other 2568 section.

Explains concepts very clearly and in a way that is easy to understand. Gives 5 tests instead of midterms and finals and questions are almost exactly like examples worked through in class. She posts lecture notes online though so as long as you at least go over those this class should be pretty simple
Took abstract algebra with her. The class was HARD. For the final exam, she gave over 70+ hard problems for review (HOW CAN WE FINISH?!).

Her lectures are structured and she teaches you the material that will be on the homework and tests, however her grading is extremely tough. She will take off points if the answer is not written just how she wants. I never missed class so I got extra attendance points which helped, however her tests were some of the hardest I've ever taken.

She made a difficult class easy. If you approach her after or outside of class, she seems  intimidating  but wants to see you understand the material and methods of solving problems  rather than just giving you the answer. Only thing I really disliked about the lass was how little interaction there was.

Took abstract algebra with her. This class would have been fine had she explained anything or had been honest about what was on the exams. The final consists  almost entirely of a topic that she poorly spent a total of 1 hour and 45 minutes covering at the very end of the semester. That is an idea of how the entire class is. Avoid if possible.
Dr. Onofrei is a fantastic professor. Her class is pretty difficult for a 3-credit hour course, but it's rewarding. I highly recommend taking her if you're looking for a challenge.

Not a good professor. The notes are decent and are relatively easy to follow. The material is very hard and the class is structured poorly. However she is extremely rude, not helpful outside of class, and not interested in helping students. Classroom environment felt heavy and she just made me feel awful walking out of her class.  Please avoid.

The textbooks she chose to use for class were worthless. She teaches Abstract Algebra topics in no logical order and tends to jump around in the book without going into any detail of definitions or relevant proofs. The homework has nothing to do with anything taught in class.  She is often very rude to students in the class. Avoid if you can.

Dr. Onofrei is a really great professor. Her in-class examples and homework questions are exactly like what she puts on exams, and she always leaves a day or two to review in class for exams. I'd go to class because her notes are really great, but she also puts them online so it's your decision. Feel free to ask her questions right after lecture.

Dr. Onofrei is the best math teacher I have had at OSU. I had her for 2153 (calc 3) and 2568 (linear algebra). She goes over many examples in class that are similar to the homework problems and problems she puts on exams. If you are interested in math and are willing to learn and work hard for your grade, she is the teacher to pick!

Dr. Onofrei is the best math professor I've had at Ohio State. She covers material in depth and makes sure to thoroughly review before tests. She is very helpful both after class and during office hours if you have any questions. She is straight-forward about what is going to be on the examshow she is going to grade them. Overall great professor!

Overall, Dr Onofrei was not a very good professor. She was sometimes difficult to understand and spoke quietly. Her explanations of the material were jumbled and inconsistent. When students asked questions she was not helpful and often rude. Her exams however were not difficult and reflected the homework and example problems.

i took this course last semester, the teacher was pretty nice, feel free to ask her question right after the lecture. i got almost 100% in the first and second exam. Final was fine due to my personal issue. She is the best teacher i ve ever seen.

Silvia is not a good professor. Granted, there are no good 2568 professors. She is rude to students often, changes the syllabus left and right, and lies to you about what material will be covered on tests. Avoid her if you can, because this class is going to be very rough with her.

She seems nice and everything she says is pretty clear. Small accent, but better than 99 percent of professors. No quizes, homeworks due every week, and two midterms. Don't have to go to class, as the book is pretty clear cut, but it would be a good idea. She goes over some examples that are identical to your homework.

Real talk- Dr Onofrei was the best math instructor i've ever had.  Through the whole course she challenged me to think visually, not just memorize formulas, by using the chaulkboard effectively.  The problem sets are hard, but doable if you're willing to power through and/or be really clever.  Exams are easy if you redo the psets and examples.
Dr. Onofrei is a good lecturer, and makes good use of the chalkboard during class. She angers when students ask questions, but is otherwise clear and logical.
She was hard to understand and with the switch to semesters there was so much crammed into it. So hard

With the switch to semester WAY too much was crammed in  and no in depth explanations were given. The class moved way too fast and tried to do both clac 2 and 3. Exams were ridiculously difficult. She posted 15mins before the exam that there'd be no curve given. She got snappy when students would ask questions. She does speak well, though.

This is the first year since switch to semesters and it seems like the math department crammed too much into this class. the prof is forced to rush and not much is explained. The exams are difficult but not entirely impossible, however without a large curve i don't expect many people to get an A. More the course than the prof but she can be rude
Silvia is awesome. Gives great notes and test questions are identical to homework questions. Not to mention her beautiful accent. Just put in the time go to class and do the homeworks

She was always behind on lectures even though everyone had trouble keeping up with her notes. Really rude during lecture, but helpful in recitation. Some test questions are identical to the suggested homework. Definitely possible to get an A.

I just take her Math161.01 this quarter.Even though I'm a freshment,but I think Silvia Onofrei is the best professor of all the stuff I met this quart. I attend her every class.Her class is really interesting.She is a good person. And I also remember some words she said in class. Really want to say thank u to her.
I got straight A's in high school. I think I just failed my final. Kids left the test in tears.     Unless you are honestly a calc EXPERT, don't do it.

I don't know what these people are talking about... She's really rude - she makes you feel stupid if you ask a question. She just does a ton of examples after taking merely 20 seconds to explain the concept. I had an A in Calc one, now I'm barely passing even though I go to the tutoring center EVERY day. She skips steps like CRAZY too. AVOID HER!
Her accent is beautiful. She is very helpful and smart. I personally loved her. She made the class more bearable and easier to understand.

Calculus is calculus, but she actually explains things, which I've heard that tons of professors don't. And her accent is cute and doesn't make her hard to understand in any way. I agree with whoever said to do old test problems. That's your best bet for succeeding.
I loved this professor. She is very nice and her accent is adorable. Her practice problems are very helpful. Use the tests from previous quarters to study from.

Calculus is really not an exciting subject, no matter who's teaching it, but her accent was cute and she'd even make jokes to the 350ish of us in the lecture. As long as you have a good TA, you should do well.

She is a very smart calculus teacher.  If you do the extra credit project and study for all three midterms, you should be alright.  Just get a good T.A. for recitation as well.  Her notes are online if you ever miss class.

Great lecturer. Slight accent, but it isn't a hinderance after a few days, and becomes somewhat endearing. Explains concepts very well, gives good examples, and prepares you very well for tests (which are department wide, and somewhat unpredictable). Attend lecture, do the webworks and you'll do fine. Best math prof so far. Would recommend.

Great professor! After having a disappointing teacher for 152 Dr. Onofrei was a relief. She explains things very clearly and there are absolutely no surprises on tests and quizzes. The best way to study for them is by doing the homework. Highly recommended.

I definitely hated this class, but at no fault of the prof. She  goes through all the material and teaches clearly. If you're not hopeless in math like me, you'll learn well. Try to get some past exams to study from, that will help you greatly.

This was an awesome class and she was a really good teacher.  I had her for both 151 and 152 and loved both classes.  She goes through old exam questions which here at OSU the math exams don't change too much quarter to quarter.  Great teacher!

This class is pretty tough. I didn't go to lecture much, and regretted it when it came time for the exams. At least go to recitation. So much is covered it is hard to teach it to yourself. Take a look at old exams, they will help you.

I love Silvia. She doesn?t just put up powerpoint slides or overhead sheets and babble on about theory. She writes down what she is talking about as she goes along and gives you a lot of examples. She definitely understands that most of the kids in this class are just taking it as a GEC and she teaches math at our level. Would definitely recommend!

The math department at OSU is a mess, but she is one of the best lecturers available. She goes over many webwork problems, including the difficult ones, and she has a passion for math. For exams, make sure to get a copy from a friend or request one from her during office hours, as the questions are inane.

She is an excellent professor!    Her lecture notes are great and she covers lots of example problems in them,more than most professors.  The midterms and final are very difficult but that goes for all Math 151 classes b/c OSU Math makes them not the lectures.

Well, she's not the greatest lecturer, but she's not the worst either. Her lectures were relatively clear, although they were sometimes difficult to understand because of her accent and occasional mistakes in examples. Overall, avoid this class if you don't have to take it, but if you do, she's an ok lecturer.

You can tell she has an interest in teaching and the students. She goes over a lot of example problems which helps for webworks but not for the tests. But this class is so hard. If you don't have to take this class, stay far away. The only reason I passed was because of the curve.

She tries really hard, enjoys teaching, and is helpful, but nothing about this class could get me to understand the material. I don't recommend taking this class in college if you did not take calculus in high school.

Shes really helpful and tries to make the subject fun, but fails pretty miserably.. I had a horrible time studying math this quarter and the only reason I did well was because of our excellent T.A. Dr. Onofrei made the class seem sooo boring and dull! I would really not recommend her.

You can tell that she tries, but I absolutely hated this class. The textbook was among the worst ever written. After a slow start the class quickly degenerated into a massive amount of computations rather than focusing on techniques in number theory. I honestly feel like I learned more about number theory in algebra than I did in this class.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Hiary is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and genuine care for his students. He closely follows the Spivak textbook, provides clear and organized lectures, and offers immediate assistance through prompt email responses and flexible exam periods. Students consistently praise his fairness in grading and his willingness to help, often noting his quick turnaround on homework and his patience in addressing student inquiries.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hiary is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and genuine care for his students. He is an excellent lecturer, provides clear and helpful notes, and ensures that exams and quizzes are fair and closely aligned with the course material.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hiary is a great professor who clearly cares about his students. Our graders were extremely difficult so he actually took over the entire grading for homework a month or two into the semester. Quizzes and exams were very reasonable and he even gave hints on difficult problems. He is a great lecturer and follows the Spivak textbook very closely.
Prof. Hiary is an excellent lecturer and you will rarely leave class confused. He will regularly stop the class to explain something if someone is confused on the material

Professor Hiary is wonderful. You can easily follow his pace and he always replies to emails within several hours. If you cannot attend the class for some reason, he is always happy to give you his note. Exams are reasonably difficult and highly related to what was discussed in class. Just attend the class and you should be fine.

Ghaith was phenomenal, I would definitely recommend! He is extremely knowledgeable/prepared and his lectures are very organized/clear. His grading is so fair and forgiving/generous. His grading turnaround was UNREAL too, usually same-day. He truly cares about students' needs & preferences, and he also just had a wonderful personality and attitude.

The sole best professor I have had so far at OSU. If you have the opportunity, take professor Hiary. His lectures were very helpful (although occasionally a little boring) and his quizzes/midterms are straightforward and are a good reflection of your knowledge. His final is difficult but it is made up for by a curve and bonus points.
This is the professor you want for this course. He is a great lecturer and genuinely cares. He is an expert in the material. He is very open and kind with any and all questions.

One of the best professor I had during campus. He is considerable and care about students' feelings as he set a specific exam period for international students with different time zone. Willing to answer questions patiently even the question is stupid. Easy to talk to and can understand difficulties faced by students. You should definitely choose!

He is actually the sweetest human being ever. All he wants is for you to do good. He is always willing to help. I would email him about a homework question at like 1am and he would respond immediately. He was ALWAYS willing to help with everything. Very clear about his teaching. His lectures are easy to understand and just a great professor!

Ghaith is an awesome professor. He explains topics very clearly and always asks if students have questions. He is also very happy to help during office hours and offer help. He made a difficult class much easier. Plus he offers bonus points and there is a very generous curve at the end.

Professor Hiary was very good at explaining calculus concepts, and was always helpful in office hours. The concepts were pretty easy to learn by going to lecture and doing the homework. However, the final was very rough, and although "cumulative" it focused VERY heavily on the last few lectures. Just study a lot!!

Dr. Hiary really cares about the students and is very helpful during office hours. He is always willing to accomodate office hours to those with class conflicts. His tests are hard but recitations are really useful since he goes over most of the stuff beforehand. He makes a list of things we should know before the exam.22
Very kind professor. No heavy homework and midterms are easy. Gives sample before exams which is extremely useful. Hard final but curved a lot.

His lectures are mainly repeating what is written in the textbook, and the quality of lecture is fair. However, he is very willing to help and it's strongly recommended to go to his office hrs for questions. If you read the textbook carefully and study hard, you would be fine.
I felt that I learnt a lot in this class. The professor worked hard and was very helpful during office hours.
The class covered a lot of different materials. The mock tests for the midterms and the final made it easier to study for them.
Good

Avoid him if you can. Lectures are terrible; copies the book into his "notes".  His homework problems are more difficult than test problems, and account for 20% of your grade. Exams are really similar to practice exams, but still pretty difficult. Final was worth 35% and about twice as hard as the other exams.

summary_comment: Professor Fowler is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate teaching style, particularly in subjects like linear algebra and number theory. Students appreciate his dedication and the way he makes complex topics accessible and interesting. While some note the need for supplementary study and the intensity of exam preparation, his lectures are praised for their clarity and depth, making him one of the most respected professors at OSU.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fowler is highly regarded for his engaging and passionate teaching style, particularly in subjects like linear algebra and number theory, making complex topics accessible and interesting. Students consistently praise his dedication, respect, and ability to make lectures both enjoyable and rigorous.

Ratings.comment: A pretty good course that covers a lot of introductory knowledge in different areas of mathematics, especially number theory. The professor grades easily.
really good lecture! lead me to real math.
James Fowler is simply the greatest Professor Ive ever had. If you get an A in his final you get an A in the class.

Professor Fowler's linear algebra was the best class I've ever taken. He can lecture on distributions like he's doing stand-up comedy. Very rigorous. Everyone respects him. I had no idea people could be as nice as Professor Fowler is. He puts in so much effort. People show up to lecture because they want to.
I think Jim Fowler might just be the best professor I've ever had. Made linear algebra one of my favorites. Would highly highly HIGHLY recommend.

Dr. Fowler was the most interesting professor I had at my time at OSU. You could tell he was very passionate about the subject. I didn't do great in the class but I still found it very interesting and it encouraged me to follow the path of linear algebra. He always had students in his office hours and he would host Twitch review sessions.

His online textbook is purely intended for you to do BEFORE class so you can ask the right questions and get exposure during class. It's definitely insufficient for actually learning the material. He's very passionate about mathematics and about teaching - he held online office hours at 9 PM every week so we could get help after normal hours.

We used an online textbook that was the worst textbook ever written. Only study material for the test was a practice exam he puts out three days before the exam so get ready to cram for the exam on top of whatever else you have going on for the week. The textbook provided had no additional problems to practice with. I would not recommend.

For my Calc 3 class, we used an online book that him and another professor created... it is terrible. Usually you go to the book to learn and understand the concepts taught in class, but instead it was another homework assignment. Avoid his Math 2153 classes. We were guinea pigs for his online textbook and it was not a good experience.
Real passion for math.  It seems he would go off on math tangents sometime.  Struggled to get a C in his Linear Algebra class.  I really like the guy!
I am liking his lectures on coursera a lot. He is very passionate and explains concepts in a way that they seems easy.

Jim is great. He is very passionate about mathematics, as is clearly reflected by his high-energy lectures. He explains concepts in a clear and organized fashion, and will definitely go out of his way to help his students. So long as his busy schedule allows, that is.

He's a great guy, but I found the class very stressful.  He didn't assign homework for our class, which was definitely a disadvantage for students.   I studied the practice exams hard and did above average on exams.  Looking back, I don't feel like I learned a lot, and he went off topic frequently in lectures.  I somehow got curved to an A.

Jim is such a nice and quirky guy. He truly has a passion for teaching calculus and he will work with you outside of class until you understand your stuff. Expect challenging exams, but he is there to make sure you understand the concepts--in a way that you will remember it 2-3 years down the road. Highly recommended. Best calc professor.

Jim is a math god! He is a genius and gives very enthusiastic and entertain lectures.  I didn't learn much from lectures though, as he does go off topic talk about applications.  I liked this though.  Recitations provided much more assistance, but I mainly worked out of the book to learn.  It was a true privilege to hear Jim lecture.

He can get off topic sometimes, and can go more in depth than he needs too. Recitations are life savers. He is very interested in math and loves the topic and shows that which is infectious and makes students want to learn. Gives very difficult exams, but the curve at the end is amazing. Don't expect any assigned homework, but you need to practice.

Good professor, sometimes slightly confusing but always willing to explain himself, you just have to ask. He'll also give hints on the tests (which are sometimes very hard) if you ask. I really enjoyed the class overall.
Very engaging, fun and instructive.
He is simply awesome. His attitude and smile is super infectious and he makes you want to do maths.

Professor Fowler was an awesome guy and teacher, and he understood that learning Calc II and III in one semester was very difficult due to the rapid pace of the class. Because of how fast he had to move through material, he couldn't go through too many example problems, and that left the vast majority of learning the material up to the student.

WIthout a doubt the best professor I've had.  I would highly recommend taking any class of his.  He is extremely clear and will spend as much time as you need to go over confusing material.  He is way more concerned with helping his students than moving through the material quickly.  He gives out example questions for quizzes and exams.  Best prof!
Dr Fowler rules!
He made my first semester in osu much more fun. Because of him, i start loving math and decide to take a math major. Take his class whenever u can, and u won't regret it!

Great Professor. Explained material in a way that helped you understand the concept, but without confusing the hell out of you. Great sense of humor, willing to answer questions, and follows the structure of the book. Genuine about helping you understand calculus. I could not reccomend this professor more.
He was great.  He is the first math teacher I had that made me enjoy the class very much.  Entire class is incredibly fair.

Extremely entertaining.  He's a brilliant man, with very useful things to say, if he gets time to say them all. His quizzes are good study tools, his practice exams are realistic, and his exams and grading are very fair.  He's a good guy, but he's not much of a teacher.  He'll tell you about math, give you tools, but its up to you to learn it.
Always explained course material.  Exams were very tough but he curves them as he sees fit.  Would recommend him highly.
Great teacher, made a boring class rather interesting.  Exams were tough, but he is a very fair grader.  I'd take another class from Jim if i'm ever given the opportunity.
Best professor I've ever had. He is extremely helpful and interesting in lectures. After taking this class I took his other classes just because he was teaching them.
This guy is awesome. Best math professor I've ever had at OSU. Take his classes if you can.

The best way to describe him is wacky.  He does a good job teaching the material and  hes a pretty cool guy to talk to.  The tests can be tough but hes fair and will curve if the exams are bad.  Take him if you can.
Great guy. Was taking this as a required class, but I actually looked forward to class by the end of the quarter. Straightforward, easy to talk to, very fair grading. Highly recommend.
man the Best Class a OSU, if you pass the final with an A you get a A in the class who wouldnt want that!
This guy is my favorite professor yet.  He is very funny, and teaches very clearly.  2 midterms and weekly homework assignments and quizzes aren't so bad.  Lectures are very fun to go to.
Great professor. You can tell he loves math and love to teach. He will make you interested in the topic even if it seems boring. I signed up for an 8:30 am class just so i could have him again.

He is a very engaging teacher and really fun to be in class with.  He really helps students learn the material and makes lot of jokes while till managing to teach the subject better then anyone else i have seen.  I would say to take a class just because he teaches it.

summary_comment: Professor Mixon is known for his challenging and demanding course, which requires significant self-study and preparation. Students find his lectures abstract and difficult to follow without additional resources, and emphasize the importance of supplementing his material with external sources. The class workload, including lengthy quizzes and complex homework assignments, can be overwhelming, though many appreciate his approachable personality and willingness to engage with students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mixon is known for his challenging and demanding course, where students find the lectures abstract and difficult to follow without additional study. His class requires significant time commitment, particularly for quizzes and homework, and many students recommend supplementing his lectures with external resources to better grasp the material.

Ratings.comment: Would not recommend this class. Quizzes on Friday take numerous hours and will screw your grade if you do poor. Does not offer curves. Exams are not terrible, but lectures are so abstract that you will not understand a single thing unless you do outside work.

Dustin is a good guy, but he's not very good at explaining stuff clearly. His lectures are hard to follow and don't teach you how to solve problems. His Friday quizzes will take you 3 hours minimum. That being said, the class is pretty fun because of how much he encourages group work. Also, he gave us pizza and told us he has "daddy issues."

The quizzes in the class are extremely difficult and the projects take 20 hours minimum to do, not to mention that you have to meet up with your classmates on the harder questions. The professor also doesn't use a textbook for this course, so you have to rely on his lectures and find supplementary videos to watch. Do not recommend.

Dustin Mixon has a great personality. I enjoyed talking to him the time that I did. However, his class is very hard. He is very proof oriented so trying to understand the material is difficult. Supplement the lectures with youtube videos and read his lecture notes. If you don't understand the homework, that is a good indication you need to study.

While this class is only supposed to be 3 credit hours, it feels like 10. Literally he doesn't describe things well in lecture and the hws are time consuming as a result. The eigenquiz hws take forever to do and are difficult. Quizzes on fridays and exams are terrible as well!

Honestly I feel like I'm learning everything on my own! He gives abstract lectures lacking examples and expects you to figure out the actual concepts for solving problems on your own. Hws aren't helpful for exams because their just proofs and no actual examples to practice questions like on the exams. Eigenquiz and quiz fridays are difficult

Professor Mixon is a really cool guy and you might chuckle a little in class. His lectures a full of content and he just uses the whiteboard so be ready to write and attend class. His homeworks and "quiz fridays" are tough as well. The class is tough, but he's willing to hear feedback to make changes. He also will take the time to get to know you.

Don’t get me wrong, Mixon is an awesome guy and is extremely passionate about the work he teaches us. The issue is the work he gives us is far more challenging than it needs to be and feels almost like a graduate level course. People I know in other classes are succeeding far than almost anyone in my section. Avoid if you’re a non-math major.

Eh he's ok but his lectures are extremely abstract and leave many confused. Doesn't give examples and any clear structure about what's gonna be on the exam. Homework feels like busy work and is time-consuming because he didn't describe things very well in lecture.

summary_comment: Professor Tien is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills, with students praising his clear explanations, thorough examples, and considerate approach to student needs. While some found the initial content challenging and the professor's energy levels inconsistent, many emphasized his dedication to helping students truly understand differential equations, often recommending his classes enthusiastically.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tien is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills, with students praising his clear explanations, thorough examples, and willingness to help students understand complex concepts. However, some students found his classes less engaging due to perceived lack of energy and motivation.

Ratings.comment: I didn't enjoy the content of the class.  The professor lacked energy and looked like he was always tired, which in turn made me tired.  I was an ok class but it really took a lot for me to get motivated to attend classes.

Easily the best lecturer I've had in the math department. Dr. Tien does a good job balancing application, computation, and theory, and motivates all the topics covered. His exams are fair if you study a normal amount, and he is very available outside of class.

Tien changed my life. Amazing lectures, starts with motivating examples to show how whatever we're learning is useful then goes on to do some examples. Lectures are super structured and easy to follow. Homework was significantly harder than the exams and exams were very fair. Best math teacher i have had ever!
His sample exam is very helpful for students to prepare for midterm and final. If I have a chance, I like to take his course again.

OSU needs to clone Joesph and make his clones teach math. Thats how good he is at teaching. He also cares so much about people and is willing to answer even the dumbest questions. Its clear he wants people to learn and I should have realized this sooner. Its not about getting a good grade, its about learning how diffy Q works. LET HIM COOK!!!

BEST lectures I've had from the math department. He cares a lot about students and will go out of his way to help/ accommodate you. He explains confusing concepts clearly and answers questions thoroughly. Lots of examples in lecture which were super helpful.
he is very considerate for students. I would definitely take his class again

The greatest Math professors in Math department. He explains math concepts clearly and did many examples in class which helps a lot. Exams are fair and he graded it fairly. Just do the homework you will do well in this class.

100% the best professor I've ever had in the Math Dept at OSU. Genuinely cares about his students, even past their understanding of the material. Always happy to meet outside class/office hours if you ask, always answers questions during lecture, and cares about the students learning and enjoying the class. No harsh grading either. 12/10.
Professor Tien makes the content of the course much more easier than I expected. His lectures are inspirational and informative, and he is also a very approachable person.
