The best professor I've ever had. Informative lectures, quick responses, and clear explanations. Take him if you want to pass the course and truly learn something.

Dr. Tien is who you want for this class. Easily one of the best professors I've ever had. He could not have explained the content of this course in a more clear, easy-to-understand way. Very friendly and caring person as well. Overall, 10/10 professor

Prof. Tien is a gem, probably the best math teacher I've had. He's down-to-Earth and really cares about you understanding the material. Everything he says makes sense and if you still don't get it, he's pretty accessible outside of class. Highly recommend him!
Amazing professor. Would definitely recommend. Take him!!!!

Informative lectures that help clarify material from the textbook. Cares about students a lot and is helpful in office hours. I disliked the class itself but the professor was so good that he made it bearable.

Joe made a relatively difficult subject very easy to understand. This was my first exposure to mathematical proofs and I'm very glad I had Joe as a lecturer. The exams were very fair and he's a caring person in general so I would definitely recommend.

Professor Tien is a great math teacher. This class is all proofs and could be very challenging with the wrong professor. Joe will go over the same proof 5 times if he thinks the class doesn't understand it. Very caring and wants everyone in the class to enjoy math (he does math riddles in class sometimes). Book for the class is helpful and only $10

Dr. Tien is a caring and passionate teacher and makes sure his students stay engaged and succeed. Math 3345 content is very proof-based and not always the most interesting for non-math majors, but he does his best. His lectures are very helpful and exams and homework is fair. Class may be difficult if it's your first time doing proofs.

You really don't need to go to lecture because he just derives equations and it makes everything seem so confusing. If you just do the homework and make sure you understand it all you are truly guaranteed an A on the exams.
WAY TOO MUCH THEORY!! He never did examples which were helpful. Could have skipped lecture every day and just read the textbook.

Joe is a decent professor. His lectures aren't super helpful because he goes into too much theory.  However, he does try to "dumb down" differential equations for the class, which helps a lot. His exams are fair, with some being pretty easy and others being pretty challenging. Overall, he is a good professor and you should do fine in the class

Joe Tien is by far the best math teacher I have had. His explanations to differential equations start basic, and he gradually increases the complexity. He keeps students engaged, and prepares you for applied Diff EQ. Test are very fair. Differential Eqns are a difficult topic regardless of the teacher, but Tien makes it as easy as possible.

summary_comment: Professor Kim is highly regarded for her clear and well-structured lectures, which are accompanied by detailed notes that make following along easy. She is particularly supportive during office hours and recitations, where she offers extensive help and ensures students understand the material thoroughly. While her midterms can be challenging, the overall class setup and her willingness to assist students contribute significantly to a positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim is highly regarded for her clear and structured lectures, detailed notes, and effective explanations of complex concepts. Students find her office hours and recitations particularly helpful, and many recommend her for her supportive approach and fairness in grading.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kim is a great professor. Her notes are very easy to follow along and are outlined well to understand. She explains the concepts very well and is very helpful in office hours. Very lenient grader and knows what she's talking about. You can get a good grade if you put in effort and follow along. Make sure to go to recitation. Those helped a lot.

The midterms can be difficult because there are so few questions but the lectures are always straight forward and she provides completed notes so you can choose to write your own or simply follow along which is nice.

Heejoung was overall a good professor. Tests were tough but fair, and she doesn't curve the class at all. That being said, her lectures and notes were easy to follow, and overall the class was a good experience. She records all of her in-person lectures, so you're not forced to go to lecture all the time.

Professor Kim is a fantastic professor. She was a little difficult to understand at first but after a week of class, I had no problems. The class is set up with two lectures and then a recitation. The recitation has graded group work and is extremely helpful in understanding the material. Exam heavy class but I felt ready for them.

Dr. Kim can be a bit hard to understand during lectures because she talks quietly, but she is an amazing professor who explains the material very well. Her office hours were extremely helpful. Midterms and final are straightforward, similar to problems done in recitation and on homework. Would definitely recommend her to anyone taking this course.

Dr. Kim was awesome. She did a great job conveying the information during class and was alwaying willing to offer more help during recitations, over email, and during office hours. Any time I needed help, she was always willing to sit down and work with me on anything until I understood it. Go to class and you'll do great in Dr. Kim's class.

summary_comment: Professor Wicke is highly regarded for her kindness and accessibility, making her an excellent resource for students. While her lectures can be challenging to follow, her exams are well-communicated and straightforward, provided students complete the homework and attend classes regularly. Students appreciate her patience and willingness to help outside of scheduled hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wicke is highly regarded for her kindness and accessibility, making her classes approachable and supportive. While her lectures can be challenging to follow, her clear communication about exams and her willingness to provide extra help contribute significantly to student success.

Ratings.comment: I actually had Prof Wicke at NJIT & she was an amazing professor. It was intro to probability &  she was an extremely kind teacher. Her exams were clearly communicated with her students so it was hard to fail. As long as you do all the homework &go to every class, it will be super easy. She is the best & super accessible after class for extra help!

I loved Dr. Wicke as a person. She was really nice and really good about answering questions in emails, office hours, and is very accommodating and will meet outside of class and office hours if you need to! She never made me feel dumb for not understanding! She can be very confusing in lecture though, but exams are pretty easy!

summary_comment: Professor Leibman is highly regarded for his knowledge and clarity in teaching, often staying after class to answer questions. His lectures are lecture-heavy and theoretical but he is extremely helpful and caring, with a generous curve on exams. Students find his material challenging but rewarding, and appreciate his availability and clear explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Leibman is highly regarded for his knowledge and clarity in teaching, often staying after class to help students. He provides detailed feedback and curves generously, making the material, while challenging, ultimately rewarding.

Ratings.comment: Amiable guy. Attendance is not required but you can ask him questions on the lectures and he can answer all your question. He has two lecture notes that are updated almost everyday. Knowledge is abstract and dense but curve generously at the end. Give detailed feedback to email.

Very nice guy. Gives clear explanations in class and good feedback on exams (if you ask) and homework. The majority of the difficulty comes from the class. The content is very hard. The median grade was ~48 on midterm 3(/5). He grades very harshly, but all the tests are reasonable and the curve is very generous. For our class: 46% -> C+, 75% -> B+

Dr. Leibman is an amazing professor. He always made himself available for help. He always seemed to have a deep understanding of topics. Lectures were very clear and the exams always seemed fair. Class is very time consuming and difficult at times but very rewarding. I would recommend taking a class with Dr. Leibman if you ever get the opportunity!

Lecture heavy and very theoretical, but a great professor. Extremely knowledgeable and helpful, would stay after class to answer questions every single day. Great for smaller classes. Curved very generously. Be prepared for lots of exams.
Very caring and responsive to emails. Curved very generously.
Great Professor. Very clear and helpful.

Great professor, among the best in the department. He is well prepared and seems to know everything. He seems to put a great deal of effort into teaching. Assignments are modest and exams are fair; he wants you to learn and enjoy the material not worry about your grade. All around a great lecturer, take any course with him you can.
Great guy, really quiet, good for small classes. Amazing at math and helpful
Had him for two honors math classes. His first one (Math 191H) was very difficult, but once you prove you're smart he goes easier on you. He's one of my favorite math professors at OSU! <3
Extremely intelligent, lectures are very clear, and in general he's a really nice guy. Do all of the homework, study hard for the midterms and the final.
Great professor, teaches well. Class is certainly difficult, but there is a generous curve. If you are interested in math and ready to learn, this is the class for you.

summary_comment: Professor Lakos is known for her clear and helpful lectures, which are essential for understanding the material, but she can be frustratingly strict with grading, particularly on tests. Students appreciate her efforts to assist them but note that her frustration with students' misunderstandings can be palpable. Additionally, some students have reported feeling uncomfortable due to private discussions during class and harsh grading policies.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lakos is known for her clear and helpful lectures, and her genuine desire to support her students' success. However, she can be frustratingly strict in grading and sometimes becomes visibly annoyed when students struggle with concepts or forget formulas, which can be demotivating for some students.

Ratings.comment: Professor Lakos gives pretty good lectures and seems like she wants to help her students succeed. However, she sometimes gets frustrated when her students don't understand a concept or don't remember a formula after not using it for weeks. Also, she sometimes would discuss private issues with students in front of the whole class.

She was mostly nice and seemed like a good person. Great lecturer, but would sometimes get frustrated with students for not understanding a concept. Read the textbook before class to get a head start. Tests were worth a lot and were graded harshly. Study study study!
The class was very lecture-heavy. Grading is fair, but very test-heavy. Wording and notation is very important in grading, but that's more a matter of the class than the professor.

I had her for both Calc 3 online and Linear Algebra in person. She's very good in person, and was a fair (if tough) grader and also pretty nice. Her lectures are also very helpful in understanding the material, but make sure to look at the textbook beforehand. Do not take any of her online sections though, it will be a very unpleasant experience

The class was taught well and it was very clear what kind of answers/responses were required if you wanted to get good grades on homeworks and exams. Nela is a generally amiable person and it was obvious that she cared about the success of her students. Homeworks were sometimes long but always manageable and they helped immensely for the exams.

Really nice as a person but unforgiving when grading exams. Homework isn't too bad, but can sometimes be VERY long. Grade is composed of 4 midterms and 10 homeworks. Her lectures arent helpful, she just writes word for word from the textbook.

Lakos is a professor that can be funny when she wants to. Overall the class could've been better. As being someone who has always excelled in math this was the worst class I've taken. It was entirely based off Theory and Definition Memorization. If you don't demonstrate concepts the right way you can kiss your grade goodbye.

I would say to avoid Professor Lakos at all costs, but she's currently the only Calc 3 lecturer at OSU. During office hours she once told us there are "no stupid questions," then proceeded to berate a student because "it was already answered in class." I requested a review of my final exam (TA addition error) and she took points OFF other problems.
Worst class I've ever taken. Professor Lakos does not care about her students, if you ask her a question she will simply repeat it back and ask why you don't know it. Avoid her classes!

Rude/shameful responses to questions online, indifference to students having conflicts "because you have drops so it doesn't matter lol", poorly organized notes, bad lectures where you basically just watch her solve practice problems in her head rather than her actually teaching the content to students. Overall, worst teacher I've ever had. Avoid.

Awful experience. Professor was extremely rude, unhelpful, and made you feel bad if you asked questions. Exams are 80% of your grade and are nothing like the lectures that she reuses. Exam time is very short and hard to finish. Do not take her class if at all possible. Does not accept late work under any circumstances or have any sympathy.

She goes really in depth to topics during lectures that, at the end of the day, dont matter (ie, why formulas work when all we need to know is how to apply the formula). She is also pretty rude when you ask questions and kind of acts like youre dumb as if this isnt calc 3.

She recycles her online lectures and doesn't remember them to help you out. If you do end up needing help, she's very rude about it and only points right back to her lecture notes. No real help at all.

Her lectures and homework don't reflect with the quizzes and exams it she is very nasty. If you email her she would help but come as rude or sometimes doesn't help you with what you're asking. Her lectures don't help at all and is very unorganized and she is very lazy and doesn't put a lot of effort into the class.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Lakos. The class itself was tough, there's really no getting around that, but her lectures made it much more engaging. She explained confusing topics very well, and peppered in a few jokes from time to time! As long as you pay attention to the lectures and do the review assignments, you'll be fine!

I took this class during professor Lakos first time teaching asynchronously, and it was very difficult. I feel like I didnt really learn much but did okay on most of the assignments. I think she would be better in person, but online, her recorded lectures were confusing and often too long.

Professor Lakos is a caring person. However, her lectures were complicated and unclear. It seemed like she overcomplicated many concepts because the textbook explanations were a lot simpler. Also, her midterms were especially difficult and fast-paced. Even though exams were open note, I would suggest consolidating your notes into a couple of pages

watch Professor Leonard on YouTube and get ready to teach yourself. although Professor Lakos seems like a kind lady, the best decision I made was to stop watching her lectures because they were confusing as hell
She doesn't like to talk to students outside of class.
Her lectures are very difficult to understand.

Lectures are disorganized. Homeworks and take-home quizes take an insane amount of time to complete. Exams are based on a weeding out process that involve questions that are not covered in the class. The allotted exam times are short. Slow exam-taker? The insufficient exam time can lead you to perform less than your best. She doesn't curve grades.

This class is very easy. Lectures are helpful, and exams are way easier than any of the practice material given out. The textbook is also a good resource to get a deeper understanding. My only wish is that proofs were at least presented on some of the topics (Green's Theorem, Jacobians, etc). Overall, an easy intro to multivariable calculus.

Her lecture has nothing to do with the exam. The example explained in the video is always simpler than the exam, but the exam cannot be used as a review reference based on her lecture. The exam time is too short. It takes a lot of extra time to understand the book. If you listen to or not listen to her lecture video, you will get a poor grade. RUN!

Worst professor in my college life. Extremely disorganized lecture. Basically ended up watching YouTube videos and teaching myself most of the time. She just lectures in a way nobody could understand. Try your best to avoid her if you can.

Professor Lakos has a thick accent, which makes her lecture difficult to understand. She is also not friendly. If you reach out to her outside of class, she would be very rude and do her best to ignore you.

This is the worst math class in my college life. The professors classes is not clear and the sample is useless. Especially the questions in Carmen quiz for midterm are all not mentioned in the class. Better to choice another Professor!
She is a nice person, although the class itself was terrible. She gives you lots of homework and quizzes every week. Her lecture is difficult to understand.
Useless lectures, thick accent

This is an honors class for 5 credits. It goes fast and if you don't pay attention and put it a lot of work outside of class, you'll be in for it. However, that doesn't make it bad. If you put in that work, you will leave this class much better at reasoning about math than you were before. I recommend it, but only for those who want a challenge.

This class is going to give me nightmares for a while. I somehow managed to get an A, no thanks to Dr. Lakos. Her lectures were mediocre at best. I have to thank YT and the MSLC for picking up her slack. She demeans you if you ask her a question at office hours, no matter how courteous you are. If you can, switch to another professor.

Although I thought that she was a very sweet person, I did not think that she was very good at lecturing at all. She also has a thick accent that is hard to get used to. The class is also very hard if you don't put in substantial outside work.

Take this class with another professor. Prof. Lakos tries her best to engage students and keep the class moving, however, her pace is extremely fast and hard to keep up with. I had spent a lot of time on youtube to prepare for her class and tests. Her tests are fair (4-6 questions), however, some questions lack any partial credit.

So I managed to pull an A out of this class somehow, but it was not easy. The lectures to me did not help much, but the online textbook and the math tutoring center picked up her slack. The exams have few questions and were rough, the class average was always at a C- or lower for the exams, compared to the other professors A- exam average. Beware.

Dr. Lakos cares about students, she crafts very clear lectures and allows for student participation. She pays attention to where the class is and pauses for questions and clarification. Best calculus teacher for me. I struggled with other professors at OSU who did not seem tuned into the class.

Unprofessional and condescending. You'd better pray that you understand everything perfectly because if you ask questions she will berate your existence. Expects you to understand everything, so if you're going to office hours better hope you don't have any questions.

Her lectures were fast paced and she assumes we understand all the material when we arrive. I completely understood homework but still struggled to get higher than a D on any of her tests. Posts reviews however the test is Nothing like them. Overall pick a different professor

If you have another option available for this class, Id cease it. Some tested material on exams was only briefly mentioned in lectures and not present in the textbook/homework. Dont expect to ever get a response back via email. Recommend taking with another professor or at CSCC. This has been my worst experience with the OSU math department.

She's good at teaching and explaining math. Her demeanor can come off as condescending but seems like a cultural difference and it's pretty funny. Cares about students and our learning. Standardized system for HW and take-home quizzes. Gave extensive reviews for tests which were similar or easier than reviews. Organized lectures with examples.

Awful. She talks down to students. You're supposed to know everything BEOFRE she teaches. She always says you should know this when someone asks a question after she asks if there any questions. Exams are NOT like the homework or practice exams. Ignores emails and messages. Wasted 60% of semester on group practice problems during recitation.
The worst teacher I have met in OSU, tough exams and useless lecture. Too fast pace in the lecture, you can learn almost nothing in her class.
Math 2153. It becomes pretty difficult after 2nd midterm.
horrible, awful doesn't care about her students. Not helpful during office hours she is mean when you ask her for help. Reviews are nothing like exams. and harsh grader.
Actually took 2153, but there was no option. Most suck midterms I've ever had.
A math professor who genuinely cares about your education. She inspired me to take more math.

I basically went to all her office hours and scraped by with a B. If you dont understand a topic and go to her for help, it is likely that she will snap at you. Overall, I dont think shes a bad professor. If you truly want to understand the concepts, you need to put in the work. The online and written homeworks are essential.
Dr. Lakos has been my favorite professor so far. She really cares about her students and is very good at explaining key concepts.
Great professor, would recommend office hours, very caring.

Diff EQ was  hands down the hardest class I've ever had. I made 1 mistake on a test and she literally failed me over it. Doing the homework was like working a full time job. Literally 35-40 hours a week. She snaps at students. Her office hours were packed with students every time. If you need 2415, save yourself and don't take it with Lakos!
Actually cares about the students. If you put in effort, she'll definitely notice it.

Ridiculous amounts of extremely difficult homework, confusing material (not even math), and uses a completely different textbook than other sections. Even though I got an A, I don't recommend this course; there are easier alternatives. Nela as a professor though isn't terrible, but definitely a tough cookie. If you hang in there tho you will get A.

Not an easy course. She includes many different concepts into her problems so that they relate to the future scientists and engineers in the class. Tests weren't detailed though and she prepares you well for them. Always collects one problem from the assigned homework each week, usually problem #5.

Always do the homework, and you will get an A. I didn't attend many lectures but, I thought Dr. Lakos was very funny sometimes and she would frequently pause in lecture to allow us time to try solving problems before the solution is revealed which helps a lot. I suggest organizing your work well for the most partial credit.

Professor Lakos has to be one of the best lecturers in the math department. She makes everything super easy to understand and has no problem explaining something in a different way if you didn't understand it the first time around. She really tries to connect with her students and foster an interest for the subject in them.
Really great lecturer, kept the class moving at a fast pace and enjoyed the material.  Can be kind of rude sometimes, but she's helpful and an excellent professor.

The absolute BEST math instructor I've had! When starting the course I was doing terrible but after going to office hours, my grade improved a great deal. I truly recommend visiting office hours on a regular bases.

She was a well organized teacher. the examples she gave in class were basically the questions that were on the test. The midterms/final were uniformed across every different teacher so she did not make her own tests. The quizzes in recitation are doable (never really studied). used the book for extra problems DO the hw its helpful. STUDY her notes

She was one of my favorite professors my freshman year. Do the assigned homework and go to class and recitation. On top of that, do the optional review exercises before quizzes and exams. If you prepare well for exams it should be an A or a B type of class.

Sometimes it is hard to understand her as English is her second language. Her notes are posted online so lecture isn't required, you can usually learn everything in recitation and get a better understanding than in lecture. Overall she wasn't bad but not great.

Class is hard as hell, thankfully you have her to this you through it. You will really gain a better understanding of the corce material from her class which leaves you better prepared for other corces

Nela is a great lecturer. Her quizzes are straightforward if you attend lecture, but her exams are very difficult. Although the book is likely never referenced, use it and prepare more than the mandatory homework requires. She is a fair grader, but expect exams to mirror only the content of the quizzes, not the difficulty level.

Best math teacher at OSU!!!  I had no problems understanding her, and she does an excellent job explaining difficult material.  Here quizzes, mid-terms, and final are reasonable.    Study hard and you'll be fine!  If you are going to need to use math a lot, she is for sure the teacher to have because you will really learn the material!

She's definitely a love or hate professor, and personally, I loved her. The class was in general very easy and she makes a notable effort to make sure everyone understands the material. Best way to prepare for the midterms is study the quizzes, and for the final, study the midterms.

Couldn't really understand her a bit. Not helpful, she was never available when she said she would be. Midterms/Final were ridiculous but with immense amount of studying you can pass. She wants people to do well, but I can't say I learned a lot. Be prepared to do a lot on your own.

Wonderful teacher and SMART. Very clear and organized teaching style and very helpful--she wants everyone to get a good grade. Tests and quizzes are difficult but doable if you do practice problems and understand everything crystal clear. Very very fair grading, even if not curved. She replaces midterm grades if you do better on the final.

An awesome professor.  After 162 I made sure to take 263H with her. She was always available after class for help and taught extremely well.  Tests and quizzes were hard, but graded fairly, and there is in fact a curve in all her classes

Worst class EVER. Had a 81% going into the final. Final was insane. Got a F. DOES NOT CURVE THE CLASS, no matter what. She doesn't help if you go to office hours, she yelled at me constantly if I did not understand something. never responds to emails either. another teacher gave out a take home midterm and she didnt. would advise to NOT take her.
Hard as heck. Doesnt give study guides while others do. Tests 200% harder than others from the same class.
She's the sweetest woman. Really nice ans ungodly smart.  Her class is just really hard and rather fast paces.

She's a great professor. Very nice and knowledgeable. Her tests are hard. I thought I failed the second midterm, but I ended up getting a B- on it and an A in the class. So don't freak out about a bad midterm, its not the end of hope.
Very good math teacher!
Great and Enthusiastic Teacher! Pretty clear and straight-forward during lectures, and willing to help with an programs in the course.
she cant be understood if in back of class and her slides are really small
She is by far the best math teacher I have had here at OSU

Go to lectures and you should be fine.  She is always prepared.  However, her tests are different types of problems than her quizzes and homework.  You have to go to the test prep sessions to prepare for those... Good teacher, over all. Sticks to the syllabus.

She's easy to talk to and understand but not necessarily the most helpful at office hours. Asks questions and she will help you though. Her exams aren't easy but you can do quite well if you do the practice problems; she will give opportunities to earn points back if the class struggles though.

Lakos is one of the best in the math department.  She is challenging but very fair.  If you regularly do the practice homework and demonstrate that you're making a good effort, getting a B or higher is not difficult at all.  Moreover, she's very nice, and she genuinely likes teaching.  She dedicates a lot of time to her students.
She is a great prof, if you are willing to work hard and study math regularly. I love her teaching style.
Tough class, but a very sweet and helpful lady.

Good prof, but difficult.  I rarely got finished with exams in time, but I didn't exactly study all that much either.  Interesting accent, and she's passionate about what she teaches.  Good prof overall.

Nela is awesome!  I don't like math and shouldn't have even taken the class, but I'm glad I did.  The material is undoubtedly tough, but Mrs. Lakos is as helpful as you want her to be.  If you go to her office hours, she will do everything she can to help you learn the material and succeed--I did not deserve the A- I got in her class.

It takes a little while to get used to her accent, but okay after you get used to it. Homework can be long/hard, but quizzes aren't too bad. Her tests are very similar to her quizzes so you're well prepared and know about what to expect. A funny lady, but she does have her favorites. Ask questions and pay attention, and you should be set.

I also had her for 161A.  She's very passionate about what she teaches.  However, she goes very fast through the material, so watch out!  Definitely do the homework.  Recitations may not always be the most useful, depends on the TA.  Study study study for the quizzes midterms and final!

Lakos' class is ridiculously hard, and she gives a lot of homework that she thinks easy, but is difficult for those of us who are not geniuses. Still, I loved her! Office hours, she was so helpful, and she is the sweetest woman ever. If you must take H161, definitely take it from Lakos. She won't let you fail if you try really hard.

Many test questions based of quiz questions. She explains things clearly and goes over the theory but never holds you accountable for it. Allows you to replace midterm grades with a portion of your final exam. Great teacher and not a hard class if you put in the effort.
diffacult to understand, and doesnt speak english good.  if in her class i recomend switching to another proffesor becasue it will be extreamly boring.
Difficult to understand, went very fast through material. Hard to bargain for points on exams. Very knowlegeable, though. Do the homework!!

Best teacher I have had at OSU thus far. Only my honors geometry, honors precalculus, and Calc AB teachers in high school were better teachers. Clear and helpful. You will get used to her accent, and once you do, it pays to stick with her for the whole series. She appreciates good students.

Nela knows all the material very very well.  She also is very good at explaining the material and gives great examples in lecture.  She knows when students are struggling and is very willing to help.  Overall Nela is a great professor, probably the best I've had.
Great teacher. I really like Nela

Nela is fantastic. She's one of the best math teachers I have ever had - normally, I struggle with material like this, but Nela made it clear and almost self-explanatory. Very willing to help out students, and she can tell when people aren't getting it.  Nela's great!!
I love her - I understand her well enough (and she can tell when you're having trouble), and she's passionate about what she's teaching and skilled at getting it to you.

She was a little difficult to understand at first but her manner of lecturing was clear and she spoke loud and made attempts to lighten her accent.  She was always willing to help and kept you very informed about what was going on in the class.
Very hard to understand and very hard period.  Not much of an option for FEH, but knew the material, just not how to teach.
Very good professor, but writes difficult exams
i loved her
im pretty sure that nela is the smartest woman alive.  also,  she can communicate that knowledge pretty well.  overall, was a great professor.
An amazing teacher. In fact the best one I have ever had.

DO NOT TAKE 151C!!!  The first thing we learn in the class is that we will not be able to pass a regular math class after taking this class... the teacher tells us to ask questions often, but yells at the students and makes them feel stupid.
Very hard to understand, likes to teach mainly theory in class.
Great Teacher

I had her for my entire math series (161, 162, and 254) and I was pretty glad.  She taught us what we needed to know and didn't waste so much time on thoery like every other math prof out there.  She just understood that engineers don't care about theory
pretty helpful.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

summary_comment: Professor Andrews is generally seen as a friendly and caring individual, but his teaching effectiveness is widely criticized. Students find his lectures largely ineffective and often skip them, opting to learn from other sources or recitations. His poor handwriting and tendency to get sidetracked during lectures further hinder comprehension, making the class challenging and potentially detrimental to students' performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Andrews is generally considered a friendly and caring individual, but his teaching effectiveness is widely criticized. Students find his lectures and handwriting poor, often skipping them in favor of self-study or relying on posted notes.

Ratings.comment: My thing with this professor is that he is a great guy - super friendly and caring. However, his lectures are a waste of time. I feel bad saying it but he is just not a great teacher. His handwriting is super messy and he does not go over topics well. I skipped all the lectures and taught myself what I needed to outside of recitation.

He would get distracted in lecture a lot, meaning he would have to finish the notes after lecture and then post them. His teaching is decent, but it's definitely not fast paced. His handwriting is extremely bad, meaning that I could in no way skip the lecture, even though he would post the notes, because it was so hard to understand.

The content was straightforward, as it was out of an ALEKS textbook and website. The handwriting was sloppy on lecture notes and tangents made it difficult to follow sometimes, however, they were always posted after class. It's not attendance based at all but he will never cancel lectures. One quiz a week, 3 midterms, a final, and homework grades.

His lectures are totally pointless. You would be better off reading the textbook and teaching yourself instead of going to his lectures. The recitations are pointless too, they just do the same problems he did in lecture. My suggestion is to just teach yourself in a way you understand.

It seems as if they try to make the class as hard as possible. Exams are significantly harder than the material they teach in lecture and recitation. TA's are somewhat helpful but you need to study your ass off for an A. Darry is terrible at communicating and gets a lot of his own problems wrong even. Very exam heavy as well. Dont take this section

Darrys a nice guy. Hes not a great professor at all. I learned nothing from attending his lectures. Theyre optional, I wouldnt bother going. You cant read his handwriting, which is hard when hes solving math problems. Dont bother with the textbook either. As long as you go to recitation religiously, youll be fine. Final exam is cumulative.

This class was unreasonably hard. I have always been a strong math student, but I struggled in this class. Lectures are pointless and only go over basic problems, not to mention you can't read his handwriting. Also, the exams on Carmen were nitpicky and destroyed my grade. Do not take this professor.

Definitely the worst professor I've had at OSU. Terrible at teaching and doesn't get through anything in a lecture (maybe 4-5 problems) because he gets so off track. Math 1130 should be an easy class but he made it 10x harder. He tries his best to be a nice professor and teach, but I really think he needs to be reevaluated as an instructor.

Darry is a really nice guy, but not really that great of a professor. He always came late to his lectures, and we weren't even able to get through all of the course material. Be prepared to read the textbook a ton if you want to do well. The tests were extremely difficult, and I've always considered myself good at math. Ask for help if needed.

He's a nice guy and is funny, but that's it. You better have 11/10 self-studying skills cause you will lose knowledge during his lectures. He makes a mountain of mistakes every lecture and he spends half of class arguing with his students about simple addition. We were a month and a half behind other calc classes. Tests were not that hard tho.

Worst prof Ive ever had. Hes constantly making mistakes and doesnt realize until he stares at it for 10 mins. Exams are 80% of the class, and are on things Ive never seen before. Lectures are a desultory attempt to explain concepts, but spends all time on simple problems. Exams look nothing like anything weve done. Dont take this class.

Dr. Andrews's lectures are of absolutely bad quality. He often uses a whole lecture to solve an extremely easy computational problem. If your professor is Dr. Andrews, consider following the same course of Harvard University. That is clearer and deeper than the lectures by Dr. Andrews. I followed it and scored over 95 in two midterms.
Nice guy, but not a great teacher, think it before you take.... and good luck!

Worst teacher I've ever had. He is truly a nice guy and I feel bad saying it, but it's the truth; he is a very bad teacher. When students have questions, I always want to interrupt him and answer myself because he always gives complicated (and sometimes incorrect) answers and the whole class ends up being more confused than before.

Darry Andrews wants students to do well, is understanding and will help you in office hours and is willing to give points back.  Didn't always go to lecture because his handwriting is terrible and couldn't read half the notes.  Should do fine in 1130 if you've had any remotely upper level math in high school, not too hard of a class

Darry Andrews is a nice guy who has absolutely no idea what he is doing. Honestly, his teaching ability is so lacking there is almost no purpose in going to lecture, just try and teach yourself everything and you should be okay.

Andrews is horribly unclear and can never figure out the smart board in the classroom, lucky to do two problems a lecture. Says to ask TA for help, TA says to talk to prof for help, horrible instructor.

Lecture is impossible, so unless you have a good TA, you'll have a difficult time in the course.  However, if you take advantage of math tutoring hours and the study guides he hands out, you should pass.

I've literally never had a worse professor than Dr. Andrews. His lectures are pointless, Doesnt know how to work anything on the computer. Study guides dont cover anything that's actually on the Exam. Stay far, far away from taking his class!!!!!!!!!!!
He is awful at teaching... Students are correcting him often.

Dr. Andrews is a really nice professor, but tends to explain concepts in lecture in very round-about ways. If you have a good TA though, you will be fine. Just make sure you do all the suggested homework problems and go to your recitations.

Darry is a horrible lecturer. He does not know how to use basic tools like powerpoint or the smart board correctly and his handwriting is so bad you can't understand the notes even if you wanted to. I went to a different lecturer for the whole semester and used my book for any additional help and got an A. Avoid this professor if you want an A.

Darry seems like a good guy but v his v lectures are awful.  I haven''t really learned a thing yet and I have attended every lecture since day one and take  notes. He over complicates concepts and examples.  He comes off brash when lecturing and seems to think it''s the TAS job to v teach us everything he''s just reviewing the concepts.

Dr. Andrews was extremely helpful when I went to see him at the MSLC or at his office hours, however, lecture was pretty tough to sit through. He wasn't great at using the computer system and his handwriting is illegible. Not that hard though if you are above average at math.

Andrews is not a good lecturer. His handwriting is atrocious. Study your hardest with hopefully a good TA. Mine was alright and I still did poorly in the course. Trust me, if you can take a different lecture, do it. He sometimes plays music on fridays, and makes jokes in class, but when it comes to teaching, its a rough life.

Quit attending lecture after the first month. It was pointless because he over explained the easiest concepts and didn't even touch on the confusing ones. Avoid this professor unless you are good at teaching yourself. If you are bad at math like I am, he is of absolutely no help. He seems like a good guy, just not a good professor.
Over explains everything. Lecture is pointless because he constantly makes mistakes and make concepts harder to understand.

Hes great at teaching, especially when you go to his office hours. Problem is, he never really tests you on what you were taught. Theres always a minute detail that kills everyone on tests. Last autumns class average was a 55%. Get outta this class, hes a great guy, but he cant test you well.

He's a nice guy, yes.  However, like most people who made comments on here, he is pretty tough.  What upset me most about the class was that he screwed around in lecture and kept getting our class behind.  And when he did problems, he did the most basic general concepts, which you think would be nice, until you saw his exams. Rediculus

This professor spent very little time reviewing the type of problems that appeared on his exams. Most of his class time is spent covering the extreme basics and then he procedes to put the hardest possible problems on the exams. Even the TA's say his exams are almost impossible to get a good grade on. Do not take him!

Very poor professor. Final grade curved to a D+/C-. I did better than average and only got a C-. Very strict grader. Partial credit rarely given on quizzes and homework. Very unfair and unorganized professor
If you really want his help go to his office hours. Yes his handwriting is bad but he makes a lot of sense
Has very bad hand writing. Can't understand what he is writing. Boring lectures.

He is an okay teacher, but his handwriting is absolutely awful. If you are a notes person, don't take him. Also he is more of a big picture math guy. If you need lots of examples to understand, this is not your teacher

The professor clearly is not going over his own notes prior to a lecture.  The results are predictable - struggling with problems chosen for the notes, lecture pacing slows to a crawl, and comprehension of the material by the students does not occur.  Seriously, I learned more from the TA.
its an osu math class so dont expect it to be easy, but if you follow his midterms and hw assignments its not bad

Not a horrible teacher. You can understand him, but the only negative side is that he sometimes makes some errors in the examples he gives and us students catch most of them. Exams aren't too bad, follow the review tests he gives, know a lot of homework problems too, most of them you'll see again. Tests were alright but not super easy.

he knows math, but it doesn't translate in his lectures.  Spends about 5 minutes of each lecture struggling with his computer (rotating the display, choosing the right color, etc), and another 10 going through easy math parts of the real problems.  He does have notes online though, so that's good.
He is a terrible teacher, I've had him twice and both of my bad math scores have come from him, avoid at all costs.
Good teacher.

Professor Andrews undoubtedly knows his math, yet seems to not be able to teach the material as well as he knows it. He would make mistakes while teaching and be corrected by students at times. However, if you are looking to do well in his class then seek help from him because he is helpful.

He has been the best teacher I have ever had in math.  I think most of the people who have been making comments are probably freshman who are used to teachers babysitting them and receiving inflated grades.  Dr. Andrews does not make up the tests and gives us who ATTEND lecture plenty of helpful hints about the midterms. No other lecturer does this
Absolutely the worst lecturer. Very nice man just horrible in conducting a class. Overall class sucks!  Lectures and exams do not coincide. GOOD LUCK!

I did not like this class at all. Darry put people to sleep every time in lecture. He was nice and polite but the man can not teach and he takes forever to get through one problem. If you get him as a teacher just pray for a good TA you're gonna need it. You're better off sleeping in than going to lecture..I wish you luck!

He was incredibly confusing. He didn't work many examples in class, and when he did he would do them in the most complicated way that would take twice as long as it should. He rambled on a lot and if I wouldn't have had an amazing TA I never would have done as well as I did.
He screws up all the time and is hard to understand. Furhtermore, he takes forever to work simple problems and does not do difficult example in class

He's a very nice person who's willing to help you via office hours and email... but he takes so long to explain things in class and rarely, if ever, did all the examples he had prepared for class in the alloted time (had to look at notes posted on the website for them).  I felt as if the teacher could have been a lot clearer in explaining things.
No Comments

That man put me to sleep almost every class period!! There were lectures that I just didn't go to becuase he was just so boring. And if he just would stop stuttering and repeating himself maybe it would help!

If I hadn't failed the class before and been through the material once before I would have failed again. This guy is unclear, rambles on about unimportant things, doesn't cover the material only copies the explantations out of the books so you have no examples to go off of. Avoid this guy unless you want to have to take the math class again.
My instructor was clear in his presentations. His pace was just right. Plenty of examples were given throughout the class.

Can we say boring! He spends most of the time talking about what is not important and less time talking about what actually matters. He is so unclear about what he is tryin to convay to the class.  Don't not take him!!

Alright, early Winter quarter as it may be, I STILL felt the need to say i think it's going to be a LOOONNNNNGGGG 10 weeks with this guy calling the shots.  easy to understand--but then again he gives it in the Mr. Roger's style, explaining what COLOR buttons to push on the calculator.  Go Bucks!

summary_comment: Professor Terry is known for her rigorous in-person teaching style, with no online lecture notes or homework submissions. Lectures focus on delivering definitions and mathematical proofs with little application or explanation, making them challenging for students who miss any class. Despite fair and straightforward exams that largely mirror provided review materials, the lack of interactive elements and detailed explanations in lectures contributes to a generally dry and sometimes unengaging classroom experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Terry focuses on delivering in-person lectures without online resources, relying heavily on in-class note-taking and in-person homework submission. Her exams are generally fair and straightforward, but the lectures can be dry and lack interactive elements, making them challenging for students who prefer more engagement.

Ratings.comment: Everything is in person. No online lecture notes, homework submitted in person. If you attend every lecture and copy her notes exactly as written, the exams are easy (homework require more thought). She teaches the course like a textbook - straight to the point with math proofs and definitions, but no indication of how to apply more thought

Professor Terry was a very fair and good professor for this Math course when compared to other professors. Even though 90% of the grade for this class is exams, the exams are very fair. The questions are mainly from or variants from the review packets she gives out. She also is ironically funny in class which makes the lecture somewhat enjoyable.

Be prepared to go to every lecture (which are snooze fests) if you want to do well in her class because she doesn't post her notes online. Tests make up 90% of your grade but they really aren't too hard and I felt they were quite fair. I know there's way harder profs for this class so she's not a bad choice relative to other options.

Dr. Terry does an okay job presenting the material, but a lack of opportunities for student participation makes the lectures dry. Since there is a grader for homework, there are very few opportunities to get direct feedback from her, making exams a shot in the dark. Her grading scheme is unforgiving (90% from exams), but she does curve.

She cannot give lectures without her note.
Only give the definition without explanation.
Just choose other professors.

Feels like a high school class. This might not be super unreasonable, but our homework is due in person unlike every single other professor which does online submissions. Lectures are vague and seem like her just spewing her thoughts onto the board with no explanation, just "here's how you do this". Also, seems boring and uninspired during lecture.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Mathematical Logic II: Model Theory

summary_comment: Professor Miller is a knowledgeable and helpful instructor who provides clear lectures and offers extensive support during office hours. While his lectures can be lengthy and occasionally slow-paced, students find his detailed explanations and willingness to assist in understanding complex material valuable. However, his infrequent classroom presence and occasional difficulty in connecting with online students have led to mixed reviews.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller is known for his thorough knowledge and willingness to help students, particularly during office hours, although his lectures can be somewhat slow and lengthy. His exams are generally fairer than homework assignments, and he provides comprehensive support through office hours and posted lecture materials.

Ratings.comment:
He doesn't show up a lot, but please go to his office hour, he's amazing.

By the way, an advice to avoid losing points foolishly: don't trust your group members too much --- you will never know if they are humble or honest until you truly check their parts.
Difficult course, good professor, and reasonable curve!
Clear lectures, the exams are uniform but less difficult than written homework.

Very good lectures, but a little slow, stays after class for questions and has office hours. He is very knowledgable and is willing to answer/help any student with their questions. Has great exam review with questions to do in class and at home. Posts all lectures online in case you miss class or want to review.

Professor Miller was overall a good professor, though his lectures could drag. I found that he was far more helpful in his office hours. The tests were fairly hard and there was lots of homework. Pay attention in recitation and definitely see him for office hours.

Like Im awesome so I still did great, but I took an online version of the class and I saw the dude once and never again. It was quite difficult stuff and the lectures took like two hours even though they were online slide things. I just did not feel like he gave much of a crap about us and would not recommend the torture of this class to anyone
Very solid professor!

I loved this professor. While some lectures may have felt a little boring, I really liked how he broke down each topic and explained the reasoning behind it. I also loved going to his office hours. He was very helpful at explaining topics more and talking math behind the course if I wanted to!
Solid professor. He goes over all the concepts super thoroughly and slowly to make sure that we understand, even though the material isn't easy. Much more helpful than the other Calc 2 professor.

Even though his lectures were not fun, when I ask him for help, it was somehow more fun than his lectures.

He gives a review sheet usually one week before midterms and I think they are helpful. Many of the midterm questions are similar to the review sheet problems. I thought the midterms were a bit hard but fair for sure.
Overall he's great

Dr. Miller was nice as a person but my biggest criticism is how long it took him to grade exams as well as put up practice material, which in my opinion there was a lack of. His class is definitely passable but I recommend materials such as Paul's Online Notes if you feel you're not getting enough practice/understanding.

I really liked Miller as a professor. His notes were very organized and legible, which I really appreciated. We also weren't assigned a ton of homework in 2153 which was nice. The midterms are kinda brutal. Just show up to lecture and put time + effort into the homework assignments and you'll do fine in his Calc 3 class.

Good professor. I will say he does sometimes go into proofs and explanations that he doesn't really need to in lecture, which may cause you to drone off and miss some other important stuff. There isn't a curve but he does adjust point value on the test, not sure how it works though. Good guy too and loves math.

Jason Miller is a good professor, while Calculus 2 can be a hard class, his lectures are very well explained. I never went to class because I think he is a bit slow for me, but I would watch his lectures on 2x after and they are very well presented. He also understands students' schedules and can be flexible with due dates if you let him know early
I had math 1152 with him and he was a fine professor, then I took math 2568 and it became my nightmare.

Prof Miller provides lecture notes and extra practice for exams.Lectures are well organized and he stops every now and then for questions.Very accommodating if you can't go to class in person(zoom links, posts recordings).The class is difficult,but not impossible.Stay on top of Ximera assignments, go to office hours, tutoring, or your ta for help!

He is a greate lecturer. He prepared all the materials detailedly and carefully. Actually, I have learned a lot from this class. Everyone konws that Math 1152 which is calculous 2 is difficult, but professor Miller explains every concepts carefully and answer every question patiently. I wish all my lecturers in later classes can treat us like him.

Overall this class had a lot of assignments, but none of them were terribly taxing. I found the class very do-able and the material was very straightforward. I liked that he did not put trick questions on exams. He also rounded my grade up at the end without me even having to ask him. Super reasonable and nice.

math 1116 is okay, but boring. not sure if it is because it was online due to covid or because prof is boring. the homework is kind of difficult and takes a while to complete. it is basically explaining math, so if writing is difficult, let alone math is difficult for you, you might want to reconsider. i know a lot of people pass/failed this class.

Will give out a take home quiz (that takes a lot of work to complete) and makes it due in class 2 days later (Not enough time). His lectures are pointless. Dont go. He goes over proofs and pointless theorys for 85% of the time. The other 15% is useful examples that you can find on Carmen because he posts his notes there. Boring, dont take w Him

He does a good job making a notoriously difficult math class more bearable. The content can be dry, but he does his best to keep you engaged. He's great at answering questions and he posts his notes and videos of his lectures online.

This class?... Not great. Lecture was necessary but it was not always interesting (I do enjoy it when he gets excited about math, however). Our section did consistently below the mean of the entirety of 1172. I don't know what he did with Taylor Series though because those things make more sense than anything else I learned in the course.

Very boring lecturer. I came from a very good math program at my high school and this class was pitiful. There are ways to make math exciting and engaging for people who aren't even that gung-ho about the subject, but Miller made it dry and unrewarding.
Had him for an online class (Excursions in Math), the material is a little weird, but the class is very fair. Definitely do the lessons and keep up with the class so the exams aren't too hard!
Went to lectures, but they assume you've taken Calc in high school and know some stuff
Good

I really enjoyed Jason as a lecturer. If you bring your exams to him, it is possible that he will give you points back. It is not necessary to go to every lecture, especially if you took AP Calc in high school. Study the practice exams. If you work hard and ask for help, you can get an A. Don't forget about the MSLC tutoring website for practice.

Very boring lecturer that makes you automatically sleep when he starts going over the theory behind different formulas. He complicated the concept 10 times more. No curve for the class and even though the syllabus says that he rounds grades its all bs because I was at 88.6 and didnt get rounded to 89(A-). Keep up with the material or fail.

He is a very nice lecturer who wears the same outfit everyday, but I do not like him very much because his classes are too dry to understand. You have to spend more time on this subject. He never skips class even we had a fire alarm, u know, we took the class in ring-rang. Generally, he is a good choice if you can focus on him in all 55min.

Jason proves to be a good choice for the Calc I teacher. It's a pretty standard course despite the professor but Jason has a good grasp on teaching the concepts behind what will be mostly midterms and quizzes. The lectures can be dry but he does teach what you need to know.
Lectures very boring and repetitive, online lectures much better
He may wear the same outfit everyday but he has a special place in our lecture's heart!

I thought he was very good at explaining calculus, which can be a hard thing to do. 1172 is a hard course but Miller made it easier. Wears the same outfit everyday, and is a really nice dude. Go to his office hours for the projects and he will just give you the answers.

Dr. Miller does fine with lectures. Nothing special, but makes them engaging enough so as to not fall asleep. He does what he can with a "weed-out" class for freshman engineering majors, so most of the course material is not up to him but rather the course coordinator. Still, you won't go wrong with him if you have a choice.
Jason was very clear and if you go to class and actively engage you should have no trouble with this course. Study up because exams are 5/7 of your grade

His lectures are quite boring but he does a decent job at presenting the material clearly. He's kind of a mysterious person, especially considering he wears the same black champion shirt to lecture every day. His tests are difficult, but fair, and the homeworks for the most part are easy points.
Great lecturer, also ready for class and explains things clearly and easy to understand.
1172 is hard with any teacher. Jason made it easy. Great in office hours
I love Jason.  Very good teacher, explains the material well.

Jason is a great lecturer and explains topics really well. Although the course material is really difficult,  his lectures give you a clear picture on how to solve the different types of problems and their variations. He also seems like a genuinely nice guy who loves math.

Jason is awesome. He was easily the best T.A. I've had at OSU. He was the only reason anybody in the class managed to pass (although the generous curve at the end helped as well.) He was extremely knowledgable and always very interested in helping students. Only fault is he sometimes slow in returning homework in a timely manner.

summary_comment: Professor Urick was known for his unconventional teaching methods, including dousing students with water for incorrect answers, which some found entertaining but others deemed unprofessional. Students reported feeling demeaned and unsupported, with many noting that he often avoided answering questions and canceled classes at the last minute. Despite his intelligence, his approach was widely perceived as ineffective and demoralizing.
summary_comment_short: Professor Urick was known for his unconventional methods, including dousing students with water for incorrect answers, which some found amusing but others deemed unprofessional. Despite being intelligent, he often made students feel inferior and was criticized for avoiding questions and canceling classes at the last minute.

Ratings.comment: TOP lad.... stood at the front of class with a super soaker and absolutely drenched people for getting questions wrong... righteous stuff
Had a tendency to pour water on students when they got answers incorrect. Super unprofessional.

Honestly just not a good guy. Demeaning with his vocabulary. Needed a bit of extra help and my questions were deflected and left unanswered. He is borderline unreachable and would cancel class at the last possible minute, rumored to be due to impromptu beach trips. Never felt so talked down to by an individual

This Guy went out of his way for kids to do bad in his class.  He would never answer any questions in class and was not a good guy overall.  Really wish I had the chance to leave the class when I did.

He once walked into office hours with a 5-gallon container of purified water slung over his shoulder, and proceeded to dump its contents onto a nearby female student. Thereafter Jacob immediately began to boisterously celebrate, punting the empty gallon at the ceiling and beckoning observers to chant as he completed a victory lap around the room.
taught me fractions :)
Professor Urick poured water on a female student. He is a funny guy, but way too smart to understand.
Very intelligent guy. However, he has a tendency to make you feel inferior upon asking for help

summary_comment: Professor Gerlach is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and deep knowledge in mathematics and physics. Students appreciate his accessibility, willingness to help, and ability to encourage critical thinking and understanding. While some find his material challenging, many credit him with significantly enhancing their grasp of complex concepts and express deep gratitude for his mentorship.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gerlach is highly respected for his exceptional teaching methods and deep knowledge in mathematics and physics, effectively encouraging student engagement and understanding through accessible and detailed explanations both inside and outside the classroom. Students appreciate his patience, willingness to help, and ability to inspire a lasting interest in physics, though some find his exams challenging and less forgiving.

Ratings.comment:
He is a very nice and great professor, and he knows how to teach. He really wants to let you understand. He encourages you to ask questions in the class and he will even give you a penny for finding his mistake. 
Accessible outside the classroom, and very knowledgeable, will answer your questions in math, physics and engineering.

Professor Gerlach is such a great lecturer and mentor to general relativity. He apperantly has vast knowldege on mathematics and physics. He is trying to help you build solid pictures on physics. You may think the course is lack of examples. But he is super available and willing to help everyone! Talk with him outside of the classroom. Respected!
Outstanding professor, who used to give you a penny if you caught him making a typo/mistake on the whiteboard. Kept you alert!

I took a class in General Relativity from Professor Gerlach in 1973. He set me on a course of learning Physics, in which I previously had no interest. He was the biggest influence on my way of thinking ever.  I have spent 40 years pondering and reviewing the things he taught me. I am very grateful to Professor Gerlach.
Very good teacher.  I learned a lot from him. He makes sure you understand and if he sees the class does not understand a topic well he would revisit it.  His way of teaching is really good also.

The subject matter is not lightweight.  The concepts are difficult to convey in the best of worlds...but if you have the patience to persevere so does the instructor.  I managed to learn more from this instructor than any other at OSU.

I totally agree with the last respondant. Incredibly difficult hw and final. Takes off points without explanation. Very nice guy, but it is hard to connect concepts from day to day as we seem to jump around and dont follow the book
Am I taking crazy pills?  This guy is bad.  Unfair harsh grader, litte-no feedback on hw, impossible take home exam.  knows his stuff and nice guy, but bad proff
Do not follow his syllabus. He is the top guy who monitors other faculty in the department. An young professor was changed from 601 and 602 to other courses after a student whispered to Gerlach.
As long as you show up and pay attention, you can do quite well in this class, and learn a lot.  However, under NO CIRCUMSTANCES should you EVER ask for a take-home final... He'll eat you alive.

He is an excellent professor and teaches great mathematical techniques. His English is very good. The only thing is that it needs a lot of time and effort on the student's part for the material to sink-in.
The material was very difficult, but he made it easier and was also funny!

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Calculus of Variations and Tensor Calculus

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Mathematical Methods in Relativity Theory I

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Mathematical Methods in Relativity Theory II

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Calculus of Variations and Tensor Calculus

summary_comment: Professor Ko is considered a knowledgeable and caring instructor, but her teaching methods are widely perceived as ineffective. Students found her lectures disorganized, delivered too quickly and softly, and often boring, leading many to prefer reading the textbook and doing homework over attending classes. Despite the challenging course, some students still found her to be a good professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ko is considered difficult due to her rapid and quiet speaking style, which makes lectures hard to follow for some students. While she is seen as understanding and caring, many find her lectures disorganized and boring, and prefer self-study over attending classes.

Ratings.comment: Not good. She was understanding and cared, but I think she doesn't teach well. She spoke extremely quickly and quietly, so good luck hearing in the back. Lectures were disorganized and horribly boring. Homework was tedious. Exams were fine. I stopped going after Spring Break, it was easier to read the book/do HW than go to class.
Good professor, difficult course

summary_comment: Professor Sutherland is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging lectures, which include humor and regular review sessions. Students appreciate his thorough notes and exam reviews, though some find his pace challenging. Overall, he is seen as a knowledgeable and supportive instructor who helps make complex topics more accessible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sutherland is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging lectures, which include humor and thorough coverage of material. Students appreciate his helpful exam reviews and accessible office hours, though some note that the pace can be fast and the content challenging.

Ratings.comment: Took Professor Sutherland for 1148 and 1149. Trig is more fresh in my mind, this semester there was only two midterms, one final, homework due every two weeks, and a total of three take home quizzes. His exam reviews are essentially what your exam is going to look like, very helpful. Would definitely take another class with James!

Prof Sutherland is great and cracks jokes in class making the class engaging. Don't miss lecture or you will fall behind!! Three midterms and a final. Make sure to utilize the practice exams as they benefit a lot for the exams in the class!!
Great professor very prompt and helpful with any issues

Solid choice for 1148. I wasn't even in his section but attended his lectures because my friend was in his class. He's very thorough and his notes cover  all the tiny details that are hard to pick up on your own. His exam reviews are also excellent.

I felt he went very fast during the lecture. It was too rushed in my opinion. I also didn't understand his notes. He wrote all his notes by hand and sometimes didn't understand what he was writing. He was an okay professor.

Excellent teacher and not your average math professor. I am by no means a math person and was scared about this class. He keeps lectures lively, and his office hours are great as well to go work with other students in the class. 10/10 would take again!
Super smart guy and passionate teacher. He'll work with you if you put in the work and are serious about learning and doing well in the class.

Great professor! College Algebra is not easy but he made it a class that I looked forward to. The course moves fast and the quizzes can get tricky. Make sure you attend office hours and any review sessions for super useful feedback and tips.

His lectures are easy to follow along and organized. Everything that's done in class (notes/worksheets) are uploaded on carmen. Although lectures aren't required, go to lectures! His lectures and especially his review sessions are very helpful to prepare for the exams. He's easy to talk to and really helps you understand things you need help on.
I liked this professor, but he was kind of hard to read and it was hard for me to come to him with questions because I felt stupid.

The class was easy and this professor was very helpful! All of the notes taken in lecture were posted on Carmen which made it super easy to follow along. He stops and answers questions when needed. Overall recommend!

He is a truly wonderful and caring professor who is passionate about teaching. He said that 1148 is his favorite class to teach because of the different math backgrounds student come from, and you can tell. He color codes the math problems and breaks them down into super simple steps. I really loved his class and cannot recommend him enough!
Hes pretty chill and nice! He also is really good at responding to emails and questions!

The set up of this class is awful. The professor does not make, see, grade the exams. The 4 exams make up nearly the entire grade. Quizzes & MMLs have no impact on grades. My TA was great and the only reason my class survived the course. James was quite rude and very unapproachable to students. People refused to meet with him knowing it didn't help

This class is difficult, and you really need to go to as many office hours as you can to get a good grade. As a TA, James was great!! He expected a lot out of us, but was encouraging for the most part. He took a bit of time to grade our weekly homeworks, but he was always very busy. Overall, a great guy and very helpful.
Great math teacher. Explains really well, and makes sure that the classs success is his priority.

James was a great TA! He was always willing to help us with our homework (we needed a lot of help lol). Sometimes he didnt know the answers to stuff, but he always tried his best. He is a tough grader when he grades the homework, so make sure that you are extremely detailed in your responses.

James was the bomb! The class can be difficult but it's an appropriate amount of work for a five credit hour class, you'll get out of it what you put in. James is committed to helping his students who reach out to him and is very available for questions and help. He's also very quirky and fun!
He's a good boy.

James is great! He's really responsive when it comes to email and he's an excellent TA. He goes over the material in detail, he works hard to ensure that everyone understands, and he's a very forgiving grader. I knew someone who had a different TA for math1148 and she was scoring lower on tests than I was despite answering the same way.
