summary_comment: Professor Pei is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, particularly for MATH 2177. Students find his handwriting extremely difficult to read, often confusing symbols and making note-taking nearly impossible. His lectures are fast-paced and hard to follow, with poor enunciation and minimal interaction with students. The overall teaching quality is severely impacted by these issues, leading many to advise avoiding his classes entirely.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pei is widely regarded as one of the worst lecturers due to his illegible handwriting, low speaking volume, and difficulty in setting up assignments and exams. Students find his lectures challenging to follow and often struggle to take useful notes, leading many to resort to self-teaching.

Ratings.comment: His hand writing is VERY hard to make out. You won't be able to tell the difference between a + and a t. Taking notes in class is extremely difficult and his low speaking volume doesn't help. He's awful with setting up assignments properly and any exams with the SLDS office. Given the poor handwriting, you will be practically teaching yourself.

MATH 2177 professor. Extremely hard to understand in lecture and can barely read handwriting. Only resources are homework solutions and lecture notes. They are extremely hard to read, so they aren't much help anyways. By FAR the worst professor I've had. The average on the final was a 37%. The curve helps, but I would still avoid at all costs.

Do not take this professor. One of the worst I ever had. I had him for MATH 2177, and the lectures are hard to understand, posted notes are extremely difficult to read, and the average score on the final was a 37%.

Dr Pei often begins a topic with its proof (rather than an explanation), then immediately jumps into examples. His handwriting is messy and he doesn't clean the chalkboard before lecture. He enunciates poorly. He sometimes pauses for minutes to figure out the next step in a problem. (I had Dr Pei for MATH 2177, not 2415, but it wasn't an option)

Take my review with a grain of salt, as I dropped his class after the first week, math 2177(not math2415, 2177 just wasn't listed). Makes zero effort to interact with class, post no resources on carmen, gives no time for class questions, lectures are very fast paced and writing is very difficult to read, even towards the front of the class.

One of the worst professors. He's the better option for diffeq but still one of the worst. He just reads tb examples for his messy and boring lectures, and he's an AWFUL grader. He took 15 pts off a question bc I got part a wrong and he "assumed" the rest would be incorrect too- I had to ask for points back. Get ready to self teach the entire sem.

Worst professor I've ever had. Impolite, never seems like he wants to be there, never tries to interact with class. Never has clear instructions when asking for help, grades completely different than any other course help received (Got 10/10 on a homework by grader and tutor, got 5/20 from him on the same problem) AVOID. AT. ALL. COSTS.

dude had a stick shoved up his ass. wouldn't give half a point on my exam to boost my grade from a B+ to an A-. Boring lectures that are hard to focus on, and seemed kind of frustrated sometimes when answering questions after class if you didn't get it. exams weren't too hard, HW wasn't too much, not hard to get a good grade with effort. but still

summary_comment: Professor Borland is highly regarded for his dedication to student success and his genuine care for their learning outcomes. However, his teaching approach emphasizes self-study through online materials, which some students find insufficiently supportive, particularly given the complexity of exam questions. Despite these challenges, many students appreciate his clear explanations and engagement during lectures, though they caution about the rigorous grading and the necessity of extensive self-study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Borland is highly regarded for his caring nature and ability to explain complex concepts, though his teaching style relies heavily on self-study through online materials and student-led discussions. Despite mixed feedback, many students appreciate his dedication to student success and preparation for exams, though some find the course structure challenging and the grading strict.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher who loves helping his students!

Most of the material in this class is expected to be learned outside of the classroom, with very vague online lessons that he assigns to you. The types of problems on the online lessons are much less complicated than the ones on quizzes and exams. For each lesson, you go over a worksheet in class with other students instead of being taught by him.
Dr. Borland is amazing! He is extremely caring and genuinely wants his students to succeed. He is great at explaining concepts and is also very kind.

I took math 1151 with Dr.Borland over the summer and loved it! Dr.Borland does a great job at explaining the content and he provides a lot of practice problems to do! Even though lecture is not mandatory I recommend it along with attending every recitation, since those problems are like the ones on the exam.

Lecture is alright but does not help, have to go in for TOP HAT! There are no curves even if they tell you so and you get no points if you skip even 1 step on midterms and final. BEWARE this calc class will most likely have you sit back another semester. Grading is the worst and you have to get all your information from watching online videos.
Great professor who knows his stuff and made 9 am lectures not too boring. The course is set up to make people fail, but he prepared students very well for the exams. Seemed like a genuine guy.

if you guys have a choice to select dr. borland! Not only did he care and answer our questions during lectures, he always engaged with his students. he would explain concepts in an understanding way! the calc department is notorious for being hard, but not the prof's fault. just prepare to put a lot of extra work in outside of class!

Math 1151 is the worst class I have ever taken. It is a lazy excuse for teaching students calculus. Dr. Borland did nothing for me all semester. They just post other people's videos and make you learn Calc on your own. Dr. Borland also takes 3 weeks to answer a simple yes or no email. Just watch the Organic Chemistry Tutor on Youtube...

Dr. Borland is a professor who is very engaged in the subject he teaches. The only bad part about the class isn't his fault, just the midterms are notoriously difficult and nothing like we go over in class or recitation.
Very passionate about teaching and always was available to help.
Best professor and math teacher iv'e ever had (Freshman standing though). Extremely open for questions and explains concepts clearly.

Dr. Borland was an incredible professor. He explained concepts clearly, was interactive with the class, and did a great job keeping people engaged. Always willing to answer questions. He clearly cares for his students. While attendance was not mandatory, I enjoyed going to his class in the morning. And if I missed a lecture, he records all of them.
The professor works a lot for his students and clarifies everything with absolute clarity.

Dr. Borland is by far the best lecturer I have had. He gets straight to the point, and gets class over with as fast as possible, but answers any questions you have. Best thing is, he posts all of his lectures online, so if you happen to miss a class, you don't have to worry about falling behind.

Professor Borland made an infamously tough class significantly better. The grading is tough and sometimes even unfair, but that's done by TA's so you can't really blame him for it. He provides great lecture notes online and teaches with passion. Can't recommend him enough!

I love this man so much. This class is pretty tough, but you can tell that Alexander is passionate about math and is always willing to help you after class/during office hours. I would recommend taking thorough notes and reviewing them after class. Something that also helped me was making review sheets since the exams were online/open note.
Borland was alright. His lectures were boring and he struggled to respond to emails but that's really it. The class was 'synchronous' but you could skip lectures and watch them on your own time.

Dr. Borland genuinely cares that students not just pass the class but get something out of it as well as he's very passionate about math. The class itself is pretty challenging and a lot of work but he consistently encouraged students to reach out for help and ask questions. Go to lecture and recitation, I found both endlessly helpful.
Excellent professor for a historically difficult class at OSU.

Honestly one of the best professors especially since this class is typically a harder one. If you go to every lecture and try to show up to recitation you will do fine in the class. Try to spend at least 1 hour a day on this class to actually understand the concepts.

This class is extremely challenging, but Dr. Borland makes it a lot better than it could be. There is about 3-4 HW assignments and readings due every week, plus a total of 5 midterms and 6 written HW assignments. Dr. Borland is very clear about the expectations for the class, and his lectures are helpful and fairly well-organized.

Alexander Borland taught as well as he could for this course. You can cheat on the online Ximera homework but if you do so you will surely be lost on written homeworkds and midterms which are worth a very large portion of your grade. Going to lectures and recitation (if ur TA is good) is the most beneficial thing you can do for your grade.
Best math lecturer.

This class truly sucks. Borland writes good notes that you follow along with, but is just so incredibly boring and monotone. Fell asleep in his class way too often. After a while, I stopped going and just looked at his notes and retained more of the information that way. Very homework and test heavy, good luck!
Hard class

Calc 1 (MATH1151) is one of the hardest classes you can take at OSU. But Dr. Borland makes it SO much better. He is so organized and really nice and always responds to emails quickly and answers questions thoroughly. Trust me, you definitely want Dr. Borland for Calc instead of any other professor.

Mr. Borland is a very good teacher but there is a lot of curriculum so he moves extremely fast and doesn't fully explain everything. I ended up with a bad grad in calc but I didn't put in a lot of effort, his notes are very clear and he knows what he is talking about

He seems like a nice guy but this class is extremely difficult if you work a lot or have a ton of other classes. You need to leave a lot of time to study and do homework as there is a midterm every two weeks, written homework every two weeks, about 2-4 assignments due every other day, and the final is cumulative.
Difficult class. Such a great teacher though.
Very good

Dr. Borland was super cheerful every morning for online lectures and tried to answer every single question. If something is confusing, he tries his best to clear it up for students while being respectful and not demeaning. Very heavy homework class but it is very helpful in preparation for midterms. Office hours very welcoming but email takes long.

Borland is a great prof for one of the harder classes you might be taking during the semester. His lecture format was extremely helpful and using notability you can follow along easily. He stops lecture to answer all questions and you can even email him for help. The first test is impossible but don't get discouraged, it gets easier from there.

Just like in any Calculus class, you need to practice to be successful. Professor Borland was always willing to help if you asked for it and found ways to explain the topics so they were somewhat interesting.

Dr. Borland is a great lecturer. He managed to make calc interesting and almost fun for person whos never liked math. He makes online lecture interactive and never makes you feel dumb for asking questions. Definitely show up to his lectures, theyre more helpful than the Ximera textbook by far.
Probably the best math teacher I have ever had. He genuinely cares for his students.
Makes the content approachable, one of my better teachers.

Honestly, the math department at Ohio State is really difficult but Dr. Borland makes it easier. He goes over everything in depth during lecture. There was a LOT of homework, but overall good professor. Make sure you do the practice exams because theyre pretty similar to the real exams
He makes Calculus fun. And his cat is soooo cute!

Love this man. Calc is super hard and time consuming, but he makes it fun. Hes engaging during lectures and has office hours often. He cares about his students and wants you to succeed. First exam is literally impossible, dont freak out if you fail it. His cat is also the cutest thing ever and he is often sitting in the back of Borlands zoom video

Terrible online teacher, dont listen to the other reviews. He doesnt slow down when you ask, doesnt explain things when you ask, and is extremely hard to reach. Also has really annoying mannerisms that make you not want to listen to him. Switch if you can.

Dr. Borland was absolutely awesome for my calc 1 class. His online lectures were entertaining and for the first time ever I enjoyed my math class! The course itself is pretty busy, so I would recommend making attending lectures a priority and study often. If you have the choice, definitely choose Dr. Borland!

The absolute best math teacher I have ever had. I took Calc 1 in high school and had to retake it here at OSU, he made everything so easy to understand. He somehow managed to make online lectures fun and had time fly while in them. I hope I can have him again as either a prof or TA in later math classes.

Borland is my absolute favorite professor of all time. His (online) lectures are incredibly fun, and I actually look forward to going to them. The class is a lot of work, but he makes things as easy as possible to understand. He also cares a ton about his students, and has been open to giving extensions on things if you're having a tough day/week.

Borland is a fun professor who makes calc 1 interesting by being passionate about it. He is very engaging in the online lecture and is always in a good mood in office hours. If you show up to the lecture early he is usually already there vibing and happy to chat. That said, 1151 is def a class you cant slack on and dont skip lectures.

Borland is great when it comes to online lectures. Per the nature of the course, you do need to do the homework with effort to succeed, but Borland sets you up for it. He has office hours often and is eager to help students.

I had him online because of the pandemic and even though it was online, I think he is one of the best calc 1 professors at osu. The exams are difficult, but they are same for the every instructor. Highly recommend of others

By far the best math teacher I've ever had. Explains the material well, and doesn't skip over important stuff. Lets you know when something will be on the final and goes over it in detail. He has a way of explaining things so that anyone can understand.

He is so nice and helpful. He made me feel really comfortable asking questions and never acted like I was dumb. He is by far the best teacher I have ever had. Plus he was always in a good mood and made calculus significantly less terrible and I would not have passed this class without him.

summary_comment: Professor Tanveer is generally regarded as a challenging instructor who struggles with engaging students during lectures due to poor handwriting and a tendency to move quickly through complex material without sufficient explanation. While some students appreciate his care and willingness to help, many find his teaching style ineffective and difficult to follow, leading to poor understanding and performance unless supplemented with external resources.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tanveer is widely regarded as a challenging instructor who struggles with engaging students and has difficulty conveying information clearly, often relying heavily on the textbook. Students find his lectures hard to follow due to poor handwriting and unclear speech, and many struggle with the material, especially without a strong background in mathematics.

Ratings.comment: Not a great lecturer and often times started droning off, without stopping to engage students. Office hours were much the same and you really have to know how to phrase your question the right way if you want to get a decent explanation. The curve at the end was amazing, but it keeps you from knowing your grade the whole semester.

This course is difficult if you didn't take BC in high school. Office hours are very very helpful. Does not give good feedback, but the curve at the end is amazing. The content is hard, but very fun. I struggled in this class, but he was very caring and determined to help. Truly loves teaching.

I'm going to be honest here, he was one of the worst math professors I've ever had. All he did was spit complex theorems from the textbook and expected you to apply them at the highest level. Avoid if taking Linear algebra at all costs.

I found it very hard to follow his lectures, he had pretty bad handwriting. I literally just learned from the textbook, and the exams were a ridiculous percentage of the grade, like 89% or something. So if youre not good at taking exams, good luck

Not a great professor by any means, he doesn't have legible handwriting nor speaks very clear so he is hard to understand. When I went on a week break in the middle of the semester he was difficult to work with and I was forced to do homework at a destination wedding since he wouldn't allow me an extension. Tests seem easy but he grades harshly.

Just writes the textbook during lectures and goes extremely fast. The tests are a harder more complex, difficult to understand version of what is taught. Thought this class would be nicer, but man I am barely hanging on right now...
He is impossible to understand and just yells the textbook at you but in a way that does not make sense. In other words, he doesnt really teach and you have no idea what he even wants you to do.
Nice guy, enjoys teaching, I hardly ever showed up to lecture and didn't do most of the homeworks, but did solid on exams
Gives a lot of homework, but exams are extremely straightforward with easier problems than a lot of the homework. Grades very fairly and explains concepts very clearly.
Note is clear and readable. Oral is understandable for foreign students. Recommend this professor.

He is very helpful and patient. as long as you pay attention to the class, did the homework. exams are easy. Many questions on the exams are from quizzes, homework and lecture notes. The questions are pretty straight forward.
Tough exams, tough final. But a good teacher.
Midterms were extremely straightforward, similar to the easier homework problems.  Go to lecture and do the homework and you will do well in the class.
midterms were easy, with the final having a few tricker problems.  in class notes very helpful and covered everything you needed for the exams.  homework was required and extensive but beneficial.
Favorite professor ever.  Very Fair, and very interested in helping students.

I agree with the comments regarding homework and deadlines.  Ever have one weeks' worth of work make a packet too thick to staple?  This is alleviated somewhat since the homework was graded fairly generously.

I think Dr. Tanveer is a very good teacher, although he is very strict. He gives long, difficult homeworks. The exams are fair though. This is a very difficult class, and he expects you to work hard. A slacker would do bad in this class. Utilize his office hours before quizzes and exams. He's really good about helping people out.

First off, this professor is oblivious of everything. He knows what he's teaching, which is fine. BUT the majority of the class had no book for nearly a week and a half and he still had homework due the next day. Books published by OSU are horrible and he assigns homework two days before it's due. Am I the only one that thinks this is crazy?

summary_comment: Professor McDonald is known for his challenging tests with low average scores, which he heavily curves to allow students to pass. While some students found his lectures helpful and appreciated the curve, many reported that office hours were unhelpful and that his explanations in class were difficult to follow. Students also noted that the homework was time-consuming and graded rigorously.
summary_comment_short: Professor McDonald's teaching quality is inconsistent; while some students found his lectures helpful and appreciated the heavy curve on tests, others reported unhelpful office hours and extremely challenging homework and exams. Overall, his classes are known for their difficulty and the necessity of significant self-study.

Ratings.comment: He was not very helpful in office hours. The test averages were low at about 40-50% with a heavy curve so people could actually pass. There was only one midterm, so be mindful of how well you understand the material conceptually.

He is the worst most unhelpful professor ever. The curve had to be so big the A was at 70% but do NOT let that fool you. The average was a 30%. Also make sure you HAVE to take his class. He teaches the proofs class that  I didn't need to take so I was stuck for no reason. There's a WAY easier numerical version.

I never struggled with math until I took McDonald's Linear Algebra. I spent many hours every week doing the homework which was graded very tough. I went to office hours almost every week and it was only helpful because of all the students helping each other, not him helping us. The tests are hard with averages of 40-50% but there is a big curve.

Dr. McDonald did a good job explaining things in lecture and was helpful in office hours. His lectures were very long and a bit dry, but I felt like I understood the material well with a little help from the textbook. Although his tests are challenging, he curves heavily. He also gives a lot of points for homework which made the class feel fair.

This guy is the reason I have a rate my professor account. I was a 4.0 student, but Alex didn't seem to think so. His weekly homework took me 6 hours to complete, and I regularly got 70% on those assignments. His lectures are unprepared and impenetrable. I feel like I need a PhD in mathematics just to understand what he is saying. FIND ANYONE ELSE!

summary_comment: Professor Katz is highly regarded for his engaging and light-hearted teaching style, which includes frequent jokes and a willingness to help students outside of class. While his exams can be challenging and require significant preparation, students appreciate his fairness and commitment to their success. Overall, Katz is praised for his ability to effectively teach complex mathematical concepts and his supportive approach to learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Katz is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which helps maintain a light tone in the classroom. His willingness to assist students outside of class and his clear explanations of complex topics contribute to his effectiveness as a teacher, although his exams can be challenging and require significant preparation.

Ratings.comment: I took Math 4575 (combinatorics) with Katz. He's very quirky and has engaging lectures, and tests are fair. Will mention his cousin who's a criminal at least once.

Good professor who had good lectures. Always tried to joke around and be relatable with his students. Class is very lecture dependent and he doesn't post recordings online (although he does post notes). Tests were extremely difficult and were curved immenesly after most of the class failed or couldn't finished. Decent professor overall.

Katz is everything you want in a professor and more. He was always willing to take questions, always able to help outside of class and always kept the tone light . He teaches a tough course with confusing topics, but his lectures actually teach his students and he shows his thought process. This is something other math sorely profs miss.

I found this class very difficult especially at first, but Dr. Katz wants everyone to do well, if you go to lectures and office hours for help with the homework you should do solid. I was considering dropping at one point but ended up with an A. Need to study for the exams though, they are very difficult but he curves them.

He never put practice exam answers on Carmen in advance. I have finals the following day but I don't have the practice exam answers yet. Students cannot check grades anytime. Disorder arrangement on Carmen's system.

Professor Katz is easily the best math professor I have had. I took him for 2153 and requested him again for 3345 and now again for 4575. If you do his lecture, laugh at his jokes, and do the homework (which is reasonable) you will do really good on his exams. He doesn't try to trick anyone and is willing to help outside of class always!

I did pass fail for this because it's pretty difficult. He is always there if you need help after class and office hours. Wants you to succeed and always breaks things down when you don't understand it. There's weekly homeworks and 3 exams, so keep up on the homework and you should be good!
Hate calc 3 but Eric is great! You'll be fine if you do all the practice questions before exams. Be prepared for his jokes!

tests are unpredictable bc otherwise people would memorize proofs but overall fair. thought he was terrible for the first couple weeks but once you get used to the bad jokes and overall goofiness he's a good teacher, especially in office hours. The hw wasn't terrible especially with a group and he grades pretty leniently on tests and the paper

Funny guy. He's really quirky, so he makes the class more enjoyable with drawings of dinosaurs and stuff. The material isn't that hard in and of itself, but his lectures are pretty proof heavy, and I found that I understood the material better combining the lectures with actually reading the book while doing homework. Exams are straightforward, too

summary_comment: Professor Luo is a dedicated and knowledgeable instructor who organizes his lectures well and communicates concepts clearly, despite a thick accent that can be challenging to understand initially. Students find his course demanding but fair, with no online resources provided and a strong emphasis on attending classes. While the class is tough, Professor Luo is approachable during office hours and genuinely cares about students' success, often giving a decent curve at the end.
summary_comment_short: Professor Luo is a dedicated and knowledgeable instructor who organizes his lectures well and communicates concepts clearly, although his thick accent can make understanding challenging. His classes are demanding and require consistent attendance; however, he cares about students' success and provides support through office hours, and he curves grades fairly.

Ratings.comment: took this class last few semester. IT WAS NOT FUN. he gave the whole class a fakehope by saying that if maybe u have computational error, he would let that slide since we cant use calculator, but then when i did some computational error, he said that he wont let that slide and marked me wrong a lot cause i got some computational error mid comput-.
Gives good examples during lectures. Will answer questions by email in a timely manner after class.

Professor Luo has an extremely thick accent that is still sometimes hard to understand even at the end of the semester, but it has gotten easier to understand with time. 

If you skip class, you will fail. There are zero online resources, no recorded lectures, nothing. Don't go to class = fail. Very hard course, solid professor though.

This class was very difficult but he curves plus all of the tests were completely fair (no surprises). On top of that, his lectures are super organized and well planned out, definitely a solid professor for this class.

Very difficult to understand, even after 2 semesters. It was kind of difficult to communicate with him also. Unintentionally interrupts you when you're trying to explain a concept to him. Despite this class being tough for me for all these reasons, he seems to care about your success a lot. Tough, but gave out a decent curve at the end, I think.
His class was the hardest I have ever taken at OSU. It could be because of the subject matter though. He does not curve but is accessible at office hours.

Has a thick Chinese accent, but hes clearly fluent and is not hard to understand. He takes effort into account in his grading and has clear expectations. Doesnt use carmen but has a full schedule of assignments and important dates in the syllabus. Communicates concepts really well! Comes prepared and answers questions fully. Would recommend!!

Had him for both 4547 and 4548. Really a great professor, and I left the sequence really feeling an understanding for the subject. The information is overwhelming at first, but he's extremely clear with what he expects you to know on the tests and does not deviate from it at all. Also he's extremely helpful in his office hours.
Very solid pick for diff eq. His accent is pretty thick, but you get used to it. Tests and quizzes are super easy. He gives hints to the test questions at the beginning of the tests.

He's very clear in lecture, has incredible review sessions, and chooses very reasonable problems for exams.  I recommend attendance.  There wasn't a Carmen page so it was hard to estimate grade throughout.

Great prof. Accent is heavy, but you will get used to it or not even need to. He writes out very clear examples on the board, and will sometimes even do the homework problems. Very kind and will work with students. Exams were just problems very very similar to class examples and homework. Go to class and do the homework and you'll be fine!

Useless teacher. Accent very heavy, hand-writting very poor, even math symbols are poorly written. Makes frequent digressions, and its impossible to know if he is making one, or solving part of the problem. comes lates, flees the moment the bell wrings. Had Bora for a TA, he is the reason I got a good grade. Final was super easy.
Overall, a great professor.  Wenzhi's section was my best in the 540 sequence by far.  He's a little hard to understand but covers the material well.  Recommended.
I learned the material really well because of what he wrote on the board, despite the severe Chinese accent. The midterms and final were really fair and exactly what was on the homework.

Issue challenge! Wenzhi was one of my most favorite teachers. He really did help many of us understand some difficult material. The accent is tough to adjust to (for instance it took me most of the quarter before I realized that 'derta' was 'delta') Fun stuff and made an impression on all of us.
Pro: went over hw step by step.  Con: Midterm and final can be difficult somtime
Pro:went over homework step by step make sure you understand them, and fair midterms. Cons: difficult final.
very easy class, but only when he is the lecturer.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Supekar is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, as evidenced by students who praise his clear explanations of complex concepts and his thorough preparation of students for exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Supekar is known for his exceptional teaching quality, as he clearly explains all concepts and ensures students thoroughly understand what is needed for exams.

Ratings.comment: Amazing TA! He explained all of the concepts very clearly and made sure we knew exactly what was necessary for all the exams.

summary_comment: Professor Husen is known for his rigorous grading on homework assignments, often deducting significant points for minor errors, making it challenging to achieve high scores. Despite this, his tests are relatively easy, closely mirroring the homework content, which allows students to perform well if they thoroughly review their homework or attend office hours for additional support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Husen is known for his rigorous grading, particularly on homework assignments, where deductions can be substantial; however, the tests are generally easier, largely replicating the homework content, making thorough review of homework essential.

Ratings.comment: He grade very toughly for every homework - e.g. you may be reduce 25% points for one question (out of 7 questions). But the test is easy, basically as same as the homework content. All you need is doing a review on homework (and/or attend office hour).

summary_comment: Professor Husen is highly regarded for his passion and care in teaching, making complex material accessible and ensuring student understanding. He is described as both a knowledgeable and supportive instructor, though some find his lectures challenging without additional support from TAs or supplementary study. Overall, his teaching approach is effective for those willing to engage actively with the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Husen is highly regarded for his passion and care in teaching, making complex material accessible and ensuring students understand the concepts. Despite some mixed feedback, many students find his teaching effective and valuable, particularly when combined with recitations or additional study.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Husen is an amazing professor who loves what he teaches, and wants you to love it as well. The material is difficult but he explains it in a great way. He's extremely caring and more than willing to help answer any questions you might have. I hope to take another class with him in the future.

Bill is one of the best math professors I've had. This class can be difficult at times, but he explains things very well and the exams are fair. He also offered midterm corrections which was very generous.
Husen is a respected professor. He cares about students.
He is a kind person and a good professor.
bad professor

His lectures just confuse you more than anything. A lot of people (including me) only attend recitation and grades have improved since then. He rambles about unimportant details and is very dry. Hopefully you have a good TA to make up for it

The best math teacher I've ever had. Overall the class is fairly challenging but he presents the material in a way that really helps students to learn it. For exams he usually will put several proofs on the exam that were done in class and/or homework so if you practice those enough you will do fine.
Dr Husen is helpful and I liked the way he delivers the material. The problems in the exams mostly come from HW problems and examples in the book and class so I highly recommend going to lectures.
Husen is an excellent teacher in that he teaches the material in a very clear way. His exams are reasonably challenging, but very fair. He is a picky grader, though.

Very good at teaching/explaining the material especially when most of the class is confused. Lots of homework, which are good for practice. Exams were not too difficult. Material was pretty straightforward, too.
Very goos, understood everything he said. Put the work in and do the book problems and you will get an A.

If you're in business calc, chances are you're not great at math. It'll challenge you, but Husen is very clear. Textbook homework is not mandatory, but DO IT. At least some. This class is all about practice, so after lecture do maybe half the homework and it'll take you less than 30 minutes. Over-prepare for the second midterm as well.
I am not a math person at all.....but I enjoyed his class. As much as I hate Business Calculus, Husen was pretty cool and explained things decently. If you're a math whiz, you can get a B+ easily.
Bill is a nice guy and wants to help. His class is not easy, but if you do work then you'll get a good grade. He tells you exactly what he wants and is fair about it. great professor!
Very good teacher. Very clear and was always willing to elaborate where needed.

Husen is one of the best professors I have ever had, made all the topics clear and his tests were more than fair. If you can get him, do it, you will learn a lot and might even enjoy the class at the end.
He's very understandable and teaches well. He makes you feel very confident about doing well in his class.

My favorite math class I've taken at OSU. Dr. Husen taught the material very well and for engineers. He focused on applications, not theory, and gave many useful examples. Loved his mini-projects on the Fourier Transform and image compression. Very interesting and great class for engineers. He's very nice and tests are very fair. Recommended!
This is an amazing instructor. Very easy to understand. Explains everything really well. I wish I could've had him for all my math classes. I would definitely recommend him!

Best math professor/teacher I've ever had! VERY clear, explains things VERY well and lectures are organized. If you keep up on the work and go to lecture on occasion it is super easy because he actually teaches it!
This guy is my favorite! He explains everything very well and works through a lot of examples.
Good Math Prof. Works through problems and explains things very well. Devoted to helping students. He even reviews in lecture before every test. Wish I could have him for M132!

Good lecturer, he is American, and speaks very clear English - a huge bonus in Ohio State's math department.  His lectures are straightforward, and examples are easy to follow.  Go to lecture, do the homework, and this class is a breeze.  (The curve brought my grade down though, bummer).
The class was easier than I expected it to be.  He makes his points clearly and covers the material throughly. Do the homework and go to lecture if you want an A.
Best math prof @ OSU. Taught how he thought would be most clear even if it meant going a little astray from the book. Go to his lectures and pay attention. This class was a breeze.
good teacher, but only if you understand him the first time he makes a point.

He wasnt great but he wasnt terrible.  He just rushed through things, and wasn't exactly clear about everything.  If it wasn't for my T.A. this class would have been a tough one!  But probably would recommend over the other profs. who are mostly foreign and tough to understand.
Best math teacher I have ever had. Clear teaching and easy tests..Go to class
Good Guy.  Very helpful during office hours.  Based on professors my friends had, I had the best. Husen would go over stuff on exams the class before.

Amazing professor...this is the second time I've had Husen..once back in MA 150 and now for 571. Both times he made the subject crystal clear and the exams were fair and representative of the HW....be careful, the final was substantially harder than midterm

Calc at Ohio state is so lame. Don't balme husen, the class is meant to be a weed-out for pre-professional students. Stick with it, unless you're a physics/engineering/math major you will never use this stuff again. Husen is a pretty good lecturer. Go to class.

He's not an exciting lecturer, but he goes over all the material clearly and is a very approachable guy. Tests were fair and if you know the material well enough (Can learn it w/out attending lecture) you should do well.  Better than any other Math Lecturer I've had or even heard of...good guy
good teacher i switched into his class way better than Wong. goes over everything well test are kinda hard but final is easy. i suggest going to MSLC if you want to do good!

It was a hard class.  He sometimes went way too fast and it was hard to catch what he was talking about.  I wish he would do more examples in class.  His tests seem somewhat easier than the quizzes, and he's got a descent curve.

This class was impossible. Exams were impossible. Quizzes were alright. Used to think i was good at math before this class. Probably a really hard class regarless of which professor teaches it though.

Dr. Husen is an excellent professor.  Thanks to him, I understand not only how to do the math but why it works.  Reviews and exams are straightforward, no tricks.  Going to class (imagine that) and seeing examples helped me get an A.
Great lecturer. Learned a lot in his class. Made some hard topics easy.

Husen seems to enjoy teaching. I would say of all the possible lecturers, he truly is one of the best ones in Math. He is interested in what he does and comes prepared. He is willing to help you before or after class. However, do not miss his lectures, because he goes fast and his examples cannot be found in the book.

I really didn't like the subject matter of the class.  Husen spends a lot of time doing theorems and proofs, which went past me.  Fortunately he does examples later, and these are very important.  He's pretty helpful too if you talk to him.  WARNING: the first 3 weeks are like a joke, so get an A while you can.  The material gets abstract and hard.
His tests were qutie difficult but there was a ten percent curve (in my section, at least) I managed to get a B+!  Just don't expect what is on the notes and quizzes to be on the midterms and finals.

He's a good guy, pretty nice and is always trying to look out for the students. However, he goes a really fast pace, so you can't ever expect to have down time or miss a lecture cause he covers so much.

I SUCK @ math...but Dr. Husen was very clear and made me feel like I actually understood what he was talking about. He is very helpful and seems like a pretty cool guy. It seems like he enjoys what he does and that makes it so much easier to pay attention in lecture. Math sucks, but if you have to take it, I would definitely recommend Dr. Husen.

His lectures were very helpful and almost impossible to skip.  Tests wern't a good representation of the material learned in class, however, the test that can be found on his website (they're hidden, so look for them!) are EXACTLY like the ones he gives (same order and everything with a few numbers switched). Overall, wonderful teacher!
Such a good teacher! He made the class easy
AWESOME! I am sooo thankful I got him because some math lecturers make it impossible to pass!
Great professor for math
The class was pretty boring but he explains things very well. He is a really cool guy and a good professor.
He is a really laid back guy, and it's easy to learn off of him. I liked him a whole bunch!
Mr. Husen was a good professor, but by the end of the quarter I hate math now.
Cool guy who teaches well. He's not one that likes to listen to himself talk or make you feel stupid.
No Comments
No Comments
This guy is the****, probably the best teacher in the unniversity makes everything clear and helps peeps out

This professor is awesome! He explains things better then all the highschool math teachers I had.  If you are taking math 150, or any other course this guy teaches, do what you can to get into his class.  He really is a great professor.
This guy sucks! If you want an example don't expect one from him.

Excellent teacher.  Explains topics clear as day.  I had no calculus experience before college and this guy explained things so well that I hardly tried and got an A-, only because the class was not curved due to the average passing.
Excellent teacher, best Math 152 teacher Ohio State has!  Does example after example during lectures so when tests and quizes roll around you have already seen the questions most of the time!
Great Guy, really good at what he does. Doesn't always look it in his appearence. But good professor.

This was a very hard class and the exams were hard and u need to study alot to pass them. Although he uses alot of examples, he was unclear when he taught    and sometimes hard to follow, nice person though.

A very sincere guy who makes the class half decent.  Although math 152 is hard, he made it a lot better than he could have.  Makes some funny jokes and keeps class interested.  Lots Of Examples!!!! I loved that about him.
Best Math Teacher I have ever had.

A great professor.  The class is hard (as is to be expected) but he is always glad to help.  He's one of the few teachers that *wants* to teach rather than use teaching Calculus as a way to pay for research.
He is extremely hard.  He does go over examples but often goes very fast without taking the time to explain things.  I was good at math until I took this class with this professor.
Best math prof that I have had so far at OSU. Teaches you what you need to know.

He does not explain things in a language I could understand.  If you love math and it comes naturally to you, then you will be fine.  If you stuggle at it, though, and need extra help...choose another prof.!!
Class is standard, but exams kick your BUTT! He makes every concept and picks THE HARDEST problem to do for it...watch out
Easiest math class you'll ever take.  Forget the homework, try to stay awake in class, and DO THE PRACTICE MIDTERMS.  They are exact clones of the tests. oh, and no final!
Best math professor I have had at OSU. Makes the subject very easy. Do the practice exams and you will be fine, and go to class.
No Comments

I've learned a lot more from him than any other professor at OSU. He makes the course challenging, and the exams are horrible, but I learned a lot. I would rather have him than a professor who practically hands the students "A's"
No Comments

Math 571 is more challenging than Math 568.  Husen teaches both, but I would personally only take him for 571 because he actually proves the theorems that he puts on the board. If you pay attention, you should understand them and do well. Do the homework.

He is lazy. His lectures don't flow because it is obvious he doesn't prepare for them which makes them difficult to follow.  He doesn't work out example problems completely, pure laziness. Class always ended early and he made exams pretty difficult.

Often uses algebraic tricks without explaining how they work. Exams are very very difficult. Pick the hardest parts of the book and learn only that and you nmight get somewhere. Seems annoyed when asked for help.

This guy knows his stuff.  He thinks, speaks and communicates clearly.  I think he might be the best teacher for Math 571.  If you study hard, you can do well (and learn linear algebra) in his class.  He's the best non-honors math prof that I've had here.

He is a horrible teacher. Didn't respond to e-mail. No curve in the class, I got a D despite studying for hours. Very unfair, and gets angry if you ask questions. Expects you to just know everything on yr own. I learned from the book.

Review sheets not at all on par with his midterms.  Usually midterms are too long for the exam period.  It was easier to study from the book than it was from his notes.  Lectures did not prepare you for homework, homework didn't prepare you for midterms.
he got angry at the class when we forgot something we learned back in 10th grade math, gives decent notes, but be sure to study cuz his tests are much harder than his review sheets

He always seems available for help.  Lectures sometimes hard to pay attention to with lots of proofs and such, but gives review which is very difficult.  Tests/homework pretty difficult but pretty big curve to make up for it.
One of the best teachers for Calc. Exams are tough
Straight forward guy.

His lectures were pretty good but he didn't seem to want to challenge his students (for example he didn't give us a final because he didn't want to grade it).  This could be good or bad depending on if you like Math or if you are an Engineer :).

Knows his materials.  Speaks using complex mathematical terms, but somehow you understand exactly what he's trying to say.  Lectures clear and helpful, tests over basic/easy (class avg. around 85%).  Study the review sheets to get an A on every test!  :-)
He's very straight forward.  No trick midterm questions.  A very good teacher overall.  Also his midterm and final review sheets are just about all you need to ace the tests.
confusing
great to talk to if you needed help, very fair
No Comments
No Comments
Very straight to the point and, speaks softly.
decent
Good teacher!  Material starts out very easy until the first midterm.

summary_comment: Professor Dean is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by her understanding and approachability. Students praise her for being exceptionally sweet and patient, noting that she stands out as one of the most supportive professors they have encountered.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dean is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by understanding and kindness. Students consistently praise her as one of the most approachable and supportive professors they have encountered.

Ratings.comment: Amazing TA! honestly if you do have to take this class try to take it with her, she's been the most understanding professor I have ever had here, Shes super sweet and understanding.

summary_comment: Professor Chen is highly regarded for making complex subjects more manageable through thorough example problems and clear explanations, though the pace is quick and the exams are weighted heavily. Students appreciate his accessibility, care, and humor, despite the challenging nature of the material. His teaching style is effective but requires diligent effort to keep up and excel.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chen is highly regarded for making complex subjects more manageable through thorough example problems and clear explanations, though the pace is quick and the exams are weighted heavily. Students find him caring, helpful, and effective in preparing them for assessments, despite the challenging nature of the material.

Ratings.comment: Makes a difficult class relatively easy. He does a ton of example problems so the tests are not that hard. There is a lot of content and he goes pretty fast. But overall pretty good professor and sets u up well for the tests.
Very lucky to have him for MATH2174. By far my favorite professor, even if the content is hard.
Dr. Dong Chen is my hero.

Dr. Chen is a genuinely caring professor. Linear Algebra/ Differential Equations is a difficult class, but he did his best to make it accessible. Besides presenting the material in a clear way, in lectures he'd often allow 5-15 minutes for students to attempt problems. During which he'd walk around and answer questions. This practice was so helpful

Professor Chen is a good teacher, he cares for his students and is very helpful. However, this course is difficult and is 80% percent exams. The exams aren't graded harshly but you will have to work efficiently as there is not a lot of time. Dong Chen does a good job teaching this hard material and I thought he was very funny as well. I recommend.

Dr. Chen goes relatively fast in lectures so you have to keep up in order to understand the content. HW's are lengthy but a good chance to earn points as it is the only other thing in the grade book besides exams, and also are great review. He's very easy to reach outside of class, and is a kind and funny teacher.
The test are weighed very heavily but he is a good lecturer. Difficult to get a good grade but can tell he cares about teaching. Accent is difficult but you can get used to it.

Dr. Dong Chen is a nice enthusiastic teacher. The biggest issue with taking 2174 with Dr. Chen is that concepts are only explained by DENSE definition and examples. Linear is too conceptual for his style of teaching. Class is 500 pts total. 200 final, 100 each midterm and 100 HW. No curve. That's it. Notes are light speed, illegible. Use internet.

His lectures are clear. He is willing to give examples and is willing to answer question. A respectful teacher. Exams are timed. You may not be able to finish them if you don't review the lecture notes and practice enough after the class. Overall, he is great and can be helpful if you want to be successful in this course.

He simultaneously goes through notes super quick and slow making it hard to follow him. His thoughts are all over the place and he does not really answer questions. Avoid him for linear algebra, he is horrible at teaching it.

His exams are rather straightforward however I cannot say the same for his quizzes. The grade is very heavily dependent upon the quizzes and exams. His lecture notes are quite unorganized and he does not provide many resources if you are struggling with material.

Lots of diagrams to show ideas, very good at explaining things in different ways. I wish there were more practice problems, ended up just using Paul's online math notes which was enough for everything
Dr. Chen was a great professor and always came to lecture with a smile on his face. He was easy to understand and taught difficult math at our level.

He can explain things clearly step by step so if you can really go to every class and listen carefully, you can get an easy A, but if you want to skip one class (though you can), you can understand nothing after that.

Dr. Chen was helped me a lot and he care about his student and response emails quick. The exams from the Math Department is hard and they did not even provide answers for review problems, but Dr. Chen will pick some of them and make it understandable.

The math department at osu makes all exams really difficult, but he does a really good job at preparing you for those exams. The accent is a lot at first but you get used to it quickly and I now think he is one of the best math teachers I've ever had. You can tell he really cares about teaching.

summary_comment: Professor Tychonievich is regarded as a competent and supportive instructor, known for his reasonable assessments and willingness to help students. His lectures can be challenging and abstract, focusing heavily on proofs, which some students find difficult to follow, while others appreciate his structured teaching approach. Students generally recommend him, noting his fairness and dedication to helping students succeed, though they also highlight the demanding nature of his courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tychonievich is considered a good lecturer with clear exams and a willingness to help students, though his classes are noted for being challenging and abstract, often requiring significant effort to understand the material. Students appreciate his fairness in grading and readiness to assist, but some find his teaching style and explanations difficult to follow, especially towards the end of the semester.

Ratings.comment: Took 3618 and 3589 with him. Ended up dropping 3589 for unrelated reasons. For both classes tho, the material is just flat out hard. He is a good professor. Very reasonable tests/quizzes/exams. Talking to him outside of class shows a more engaged and understanding guy. Unfortunately the university's math department just.. sucks.

Solid choice for MATH 3345. Overall, he was a good lecturer, gave reasonable tests, and was a nice guy. Towards the end of the semester his explanations got a little more difficult to understand, but also the material was just more challenging. Homework was due every week and was never unreasonably difficult. Overall, I would recommend!

Prof Tychonievich is probably my favorite professor, he has clear lectures and prepares you for his exams. These are rigorous classes he teaches, but he is able to break it down so if you go to class and study a little bit, you will get a decent grade. Most fair exams I've had at OSU in terms of difficulty/preparation.

I took 5632 and 3589 this semester and cannot understand why the department assigned these two important courses to Michael with no other instructor available, who I believe is the worst instructor of the OSU math department. Exam and HW always out of the range of class topic. Instructor has trouble explaining course content.

Michael is a great professor compared to other OSU math teachers. He is always ready to help students, has no accent, grades your work and replies to your emails quickly. Exams are frequent and sometimes difficult, but he will give curve. If you work hard, you will definitely receive an A.
The lecture is not clear, the homework and exam are difficult, and we do not learn from his lectures. Not recommended.

The class is very abstract and he teaches mostly by proofs and you are tested on your ability to prove abstract ideas. Aside from this, Tychonievich wants you to pass and understand the course. He also stresses talking with him/ making an impression for future reference (grad school etc). Not very approachable. Read research journals as well.

Professor T is a bit quirky, but he is very regimented in his teaching process which helps with the difficult content of this class. Weekly quizzes and 3 exams are the only grades. Keep up with the optional weekly homework that he assigns. If you do this, you will likely find the quizzes much easier that the practice problems you studied.

He is not an AMAZING professor, but he's definitely not a bad one either. He lectures pretty clearly. Exams are fair and it was very clear what would be on the midterms. He threw a curveball on the final though, and as a result he curved the class a hefty amount.

Tychonievich is an all around great professor who was good at explaining concepts for students to understand. Lecture slides were very dense and wordy, so don't even bother taking hand-written notes (you won't be able to keep up). LaTeX notes would be good for this class. Makes small mistakes a decent amount but nothing terrible.

Amazing instructor. Probably the best instructor who taught me Calc. I used to struggle a lot in calc in high school, but with this professor, I am doing great. Sometimes he goes fast in solving and does not write all the steps, but you can stop him at any time and ask. However, he should ask us if we have any questions more often.

Michael is your typical math lecturer. Hes a nice guy but he often goes off on tangents about random things we dont need to learn. Hell do examples in lecture and then say, We dont need this in this course though. You learn the most in recitation where you have quizzes. Show up to lecture and recitation and you should be fine.
He is one of the best professors in the Ohio State. His lecture is clear, and the test looks exactly like the homework and quiz. Make sure you do some work on his class , and then you get an A.

Michael was a great lecturer at the beginning of the year and you can tell he really loves math. When we got into some more complex topics, however, he struggled to articulate them with the necessary clarity and simplicity for us to fully grasp them. Lots of homework but the exams were not bad and an 80 is an A in his class.

Going to office hours helped me a so much with this class. He is consistently available and is a very fair instructor. My only warning is that he can ramble on (about math) forever so make sure you get your questions in even if you have to stop him.

Very smart, knows the material. Gives an unfair amount of homework, often due on the same day as quizzes. I found him to be condescending and rude if asked to explain basic concepts. Unapproachable and not flexible. I guess I learned what he was teaching? But an unreasonable amount of work and incredibly rude person, difficult to work with

The homework are hard but if you spend enough time on them you should do well for the class, seem like he choose the hardest one. Tests are tough but it's curved and after all probability is a hard subject.

Knows what he's talking about, but sometimes goes too deep into theory that we don't need for the exams, which can be confusing.  But he curves the exams based on "exam difficulty" rather than score distrubutions. I somehow ended up with a B even though I had around 50% on both midterms and the final. He's pretty funny when he goes on tangents too

Homework and lectures were really confusing. Pretty much everyday I had no idea what he was talking about in class. He went really deep into the theory/proofs that we didn't really need to know. That being said, tests weren't too bad as long as you understood some basic concepts and definitions and I ended up with an A in the class.

Very smart Professor. Gives many examples in class. Homeworks were several weeks behind lectures - hard to do the homeworks and also learn what was being taught. Can sometimes get off topic. Tests are made from questions in booknotes. Really really practice and rework notesexamples. Very difficult class if you do not (personal experience).

Michael is smart and he knows what he is talking about. He gave great examples in class to help you better understand the material and do the HW. Expect around 20 HWsemester. This course is all about practicing so be diligent, review the in class examples, do the HW carefully and make sure the textbook is read on time, then you should be fine
Really helpful in office hours, his really into logic so it sparks interest even though the materials are really hard.  Students get a chance for extra credits.

He is very nice. All the problems on exams and quiz are very similar to homework, class note and examples on textbook.  If you finish all the homework and read the textbook, the exam should be easy for you. And attendance is not mandatory.

Dr. Tychonievich is an incredibly smart man however, this did not make him a great teacher. The course is for engineering students so I expected applicable mathematics. Dr. T though loves math and just drones on and on about proofs and never actually goes through how to solve the problems. It was frustrating and I ended up just reading the book.

1172 is not the easiest class, and given the wrong professor, you could find yourself memorizing numerous long and hard formulas. But Prof T teaches you the concepts, so you have a solid understanding, and need not memorize anything, thus making the class that much easier. Very approachable and obviously loves what he teaches. Highly recommend.
Overall, Tychonievich is a smart guy who runs a pretty fair class.  Quizzes, midterms, and final all had recyclable problems on them, and the HWs weren't too bad.  Curves the class in the end.
Extremely easy class. Really boring lectures but your allowed notes for exams so those are really easy too.
Very difficult class but with hard work it isn't to bad.
So good
A great professor!!!!! He has is very passionate about Math and he teaches it fairly well too. You can learn a lot if you go to his class and LISTEN!
Exams are really hard but if you are above the average you will most likely get an A

Good professor for this class. Tychonievich is a logician, and 3345 was a logic and proof writing class so he did a fantastic job. Exams were fairer than any math class I've taken yet, and he offered a lot of extra credit. His humor is really nerdy which was awesome. I would definitely recommend.
It's really easy class. I got A.
Expects a lot from students. But gives a fantastic curve. Do not be ashamed with a 65% on his exams. That's where I was and got a B+.

He is a really nice man and is very interesting. The exam is very hard, but he gives a good curve. You shouldn't only review the textbook for preparing the midterm. This class only fits JENIUS! Luckily we have a helpful TA!

Tychonievich is never prepared for class and is just a mean person. He makes tons of mistakes every lecture and doesn't really teach. I learned most of the material from my TA and the book. He will often come to class with nothing prepared and make examples off the top of his head, and often can't solve them.

summary_comment: Professor Merriman is generally available and supportive, allowing resubmissions for improved grades and encouraging group work. However, her lectures can be challenging to follow and sometimes confusing due to her occasional mistakes or difficulty in explaining concepts clearly. Despite these issues, she provides constructive feedback and helps students learn from their mistakes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Merriman is generally available and supportive, offering opportunities to resubmit work for improved grades and maintaining an approachable demeanor. However, her lectures can be challenging to follow and sometimes confusing due to her occasional mistakes or moments of uncertainty.

Ratings.comment: I took her class at Davidson. While her lectures were hard to follow at times, the workload and assignments themselves were fairly easy to complete. Most of our assignments came from the textbook and she was always available during office hours. She takes a while to get back with grades but allows for you to redo any assignments you scored low on.

Dr. Merriman is very nice and makes herself available outside of class but this course was terrible. Sometimes it felt like she was learning along with us and it was confusing for no reason. I never knew what my grade was and it would take a month to get an assignment back. Often she would spend 20 minutes fixing her own slides. DO NOT TAKE!

sometimes she can get confused so it makes everyone confused, but overall this class was super easy geometry. She loved making us do group work and we could correct and resubmit homeworks for full credit back. The class is easy but she’s not that good at explaining or teaching. Also she can sometimes have an attitude but otherwise she’s fine

Gives good feedback and lets you to resubmit homework so that you can learn from mistakes and apply the feedback. Classes are a mix between lecture material and group work. Multiple times a week students are split into groups to look at examples and try to solve future homework questions.

Had her for Number Theory. She's really sweet and very helpful, but her lectures can be a bit hard to understand and she makes mistakes or gets confused sometimes. Generally good, just pay attention and be prepared to ask questions if something doesn't make sense.

summary_comment: Professor Thompson is widely regarded as an exceptional math instructor who clearly explains complex concepts and prepares students thoroughly for exams, which are noted for their fairness and lack of surprises. Students appreciate his fairness, clear expectations, and engaging teaching style, often citing his British accent as a positive attribute. His approach ensures that students can succeed by simply attending lectures and taking notes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thompson is known for his clear and effective teaching methods, making complex material more digestible and preparing students well for exams with no surprises. Students consistently praise his fairness, fairness in grading, and his ability to explain concepts thoroughly, along with his approachable and friendly demeanor.

Ratings.comment: Do NOT be fooled by the math 4547 reviews and think this class is easy with Daniel. Math 4547 is the most hardest and stressful class I took. I did not understand everything Daniel taught right away. However, it is clear Daniel is teaching proofs as simple and effectively as possible. He also gave the most fairest exams and quizzes in my life

Dr. Thompson explains concepts really well and has a grading guide that gives you a 100 on the assignment or quiz if you get above a 93. So getting an A gives you 100. He is really nice and caring and gives fair exams. Definitely prepares you well and makes sure you know the important key concepts. knows what the difficult material is

Dan is the best math professor I've ever had. He made 3345, which is typically really frustrating, really digestible and interesting. the material was boring but he did what he could to make it enjoyable and was great at answering questions. His expectations were clear and reasonable

Professor Dan is the best math professor I have had. He explains the material clearly and he only expects you to understand the basics of the course. The exams are extremely fair and he prepares you very well for them. He's just a super nice guy overall and he's pretty funny too. His British accent is a bonus as well. I highly recommend.

Dan is the best professor I've had at OSU!  He is a great lecturer and the tests and homework have no surprises on them.  During office hours he is extremely helpful.  He is so much better than any other professor for this class! And his British accent is a plus.
Literally the best professor I have ever had. Just go to class and write down everything he says, and you'll know how to do all the homework and everything on the exams. Super nice guy too.
Extremely fair. Everything on the tests is went over in class directly. No surprises at all.
One of the best Math professors at OSU. He's very clear and reasonable. Plus his accent his awesome
Daniel has been one of my favorite instructors I've had at OSU. He is a very thorough lecturer and really seems to enjoy teaching. Take him if you can. You won't regret it.

summary_comment: Professor Bergelson is known for his rigorous and demanding approach, emphasizing independent learning and deep engagement with advanced mathematical concepts through his own research. While his classes are challenging and require significant effort, they are highly regarded for their depth and the substantial knowledge gained. However, some students find his teaching style and grading methods difficult, citing issues with attendance policies, lack of textbook coverage, and unclear feedback on performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bergelson is known for his rigorous and demanding teaching style, where he expects high standards and extensive self-study, often focusing on his own research. While his classes are challenging and can be intense, they are highly regarded for their depth and the significant learning outcomes they provide, though his unconventional teaching methods and grading practices may not suit all students.

Ratings.comment: He really cares about attendance. If you miss one class or late for one class, he will be mad at you. And also he doesn't follow the textbook at all. Instead, he spent all his time talking about his research, which nobody cares. Also his test is super heavy. And you don't get a chance to know your score till the end of the semester.

You will learn a lot and become a better mathematician by taking any Bergelson class. He wants his students to be competitive with others at the highest levels (i.e., schools like Princeton and MIT). Expect no lectures on material from the book, you will be expected to read that independently. Professor Bergelson likes to teach about his work.

Professor Bergelson is somewhat of anomaly. I've taken two courses with him and they were the two best courses I've taken in college. You will need to work very hard to keep up, and will be required to know mathematics not directly involved with the course material. His class isn't for everyone, but you'll learn a great deal from him if you try.
take his class. lots of work, but you'll learn a lot. his class is the class i have learned the most material in in my undergraduate career. yeah, it may be tough, but what class worth taking isn't?
Getting an A in this class was the achievement of my life, no I  am not kidding. Sleeping is a luxury when taking his classes
Took a reading seminar with him, and he regularly insults students, interrupts them, and generally couldn't keep out of the way of the class.  F.

Terrible. We took two midterms and a final, and never found out our grades on any of them. As far as I can tell, his assignment of grades was completely arbitrarily. He assigned tons of homework, checked it only for completion, never lectured about anything in our textbook, assigned "bonus" problems that weren't bonus and did not have office hrs.
Like a Russian Santa Claus, only instead of presents, be gives you homework.

Something of an anomaly. He's able to explain concepts very well, has a sense of humor and works to make students active. However, he commits the cardinal sin of teaching - refusing to teach. He teaches what he wants to teach and nothing leading to it.
Despite the huge workload he requires of his students, he explains concepts clearly and is the most interesting Math professor I have had at OSU.
He is very hard, but in the end, it turned out to be one the best classes I have ever had.

Antichrist. I dropped the class after four all-nighters in the first two weeks. He wants nobody but genuine mathematical geniuses in his class, and uses public insult as a disincentive for all others.
Wonderful sense of humor. Prone to ridicule students who are not at the needed level. May ask student to bring vodka (without extra credit).

summary_comment: Professor Wang teaches a well-paced class with a focus on clear explanations and student success. The class consists of 13 assignments and emphasizes understanding over heavy workload, though attendance is not mandatory. He values thorough lecture delivery and ensures students have ample time to digest material and complete homework on time, with no late submissions accepted.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wang offers a well-paced and easy-to-follow class with a focus on understanding the material thoroughly. He values student success and provides supportive lectures and assignments without requiring excessive work.

Ratings.comment: This class is very easy and has 13 assignments total. You don't have to attend class but it does help since he gives good lectures

I personally found Professor Xiyuan Wang's class to be well paced. He gives you enough time to digest material and plenty of time to do homework but submit it on time because it's weighed heavily, and no late submissions are accepted. Overall, I recommend his class for 2177, he wants his students to succeed.

He is very kind and cares about how well he explains a subject. Will introduce a topic by breaking it down to its why and how, then expand upon it. He does examples, but then won't do super hard problems. Not a lot of work, just a lot unknown about what you need to know.

summary_comment: Professor Davis is widely regarded as an ineffective lecturer, characterized by monotonous, dry, and often unengaging presentations that simply read from PowerPoint slides. Students find his classes difficult to follow and highly unsuitable for those seeking active engagement or detailed explanations. The class content is primarily derived from the textbook rather than the lectures, and while the exams are generally fair, the overall teaching experience is overwhelmingly negative.
summary_comment_short: Professor Davis is widely regarded as an ineffective lecturer, characterized by extremely monotone and boring presentations that read directly from PowerPoint slides. Students find his classes difficult to engage with and often turn to textbooks for understanding, citing his lack of explanatory depth and poor teaching methods.

Ratings.comment: His lectures recordings are VERY boring, extremely monotone, and probably about 15 years old. I would recommend not taking this class unless you truly have to.
He is a very boring lecturer.. super monotoned. However, it is a very easy class to pass (not get an A) just can be overwhelming at times.

Very boring to watch lectures. If you have really bad ADD/ADHD like me, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!. It was impossible for me to be able to focus during his recorded lectures, was not able to pick up any information. Talks in a very monotone voice, not someone whos excited about teaching.

He is probably one of the most boring lecturers I have ever had. He speaks in the most monotone dry voice and the lectures are just recordings of him reading off of the power point slides. He posts practice sets with solutions and the quizzes are just the same types of problems so its almost impossible not to pass this class.

His recorded lectures are just him reading the slides word for word with no extra input. Recitations are just him reading off the work from the practice problems with no explanations behind them. His exams are only 40 questions but all the questions are worth 7 points, and he will put questions on there that we were never taught how to do.

I made a last minute switch into his class and it was the WORST idea. He seems like a smart guy but has no idea how to teach. Doesnt come with examples prepared. Confuses himself when trying to make ones up on the spot. Doesnt understand anyones questions and still tells them theyre wrong. Ive learned everything from the textbook. AVOID!!!!!!

YIKE.  He is just not a good teacher, there's no other way of putting it.  He's a nice enough guy and his midterms are fair.  He also gave a take home final and the class had a reasonable curve so I ended up doing alright in the class, but the man is almost always impossible to follow when he's teaching.  His class is a slog.

This man is a horrible teacher. Anything you learn will be from reading the book. However, his midterms and quizzes were pretty fair, although the final was awful. You won't learn anything from lectures, since they are mostly incoherent math related babbling. Read the book and learn your definitions, and you will do ok.

Mike Davis is the wrost professor I have ever had. Every day he shows up late and has nothing prepared for the day. We spend most of the day in silence as he tries to figure out what he wants to try and say. He constantly makes mistakes and doesn't use any grading system, so you never know how you're doing. The tests are close to impossible. avoid.

Absolutely awful. Takes him the entire class to do a problem(incorrectly). True and false questions worth +2,-2, or 0 so you could get negative points on an exam problem. Refuses questions outside of class. Refuses to use carmen or let anyone know their grade. Cant stress how much of a nightmare he is.
Requirements were made clear, easy quizzes and a lot of practice was done through homework.  You'll get out what you put in for this class.
extremely clear and helpful - definitely good
Oh. my. god.  The tests were so. easy.

Simply copies down profs from the textbook, usually word for word.  Provides a few examples in class and will do a couple of HW problems in class.  Will not teach you anything you cannot read in the book which actually works nicely with the independent study based 500 level courses.

One of the worst math professors I've had here at OSU. Pompous, arrogant, etc. Given a 60 page "pamphlet" as a textbook, with no answers to any of the exercises and he gives 0 supplemental material. Prepare to re-read each 2 page section (test over 4 sections at a time) about a thousand times. hard as hell

Switch sections or teachers if you get this guy. He can barely work out the problems in class, and expects you to do insanely hard ones on the midterms. The most annoying thing was right before we'd take a midterm, he'd say "took it easy on you guys.." then it would be the most difficult thing ive ever taken. Scatterbrained, moody, and just bad

Horrible. I still dont know what the cheap tricks were on the midterms and his overall structure of the class is terrible. I suggest you take 153 if you get him as a teacher and skip back into 263 after that class because this could potentially drop your nice GPA because this class is hard.
Mike Davis doesn't give a damn about anything.  Great guy.  You get out what you put in.  period.
