He is a smart professor and overall a good guy, but he is terrible at teaching. Many times he never knows how to solve a problem from the beginning. He just makes it up as he goes. His explanations are difficult to follow and often not the easiest way to get to an answer. Lectures are not very helpful. I learned everything I needed in recitation.

Only go to lectures to hear the hilarious things he says. Some include "OK this will blow your mind" or "Don't you want to come to class early so I can answer the questions you have wrong?" Seems like a nice, smart guy, but has very poor teaching skills.
Awful

He is a very intelligent person but doesn't seem to take the class seriously.  He is a decent teacher but everyone that's **** in the previous post probably didn't go to lecture.  It was my first time taking calc and I ended with a near perfect score.  As long as you read the book like every other class you'll be fine.

soo awful and i think i have to have him next quarter too. he looks like santa clause and resets his pocket watch first thing every class. ugh. worst ever. midterm and final questions were ridiculous. we never went over those kinds of examples.
If you have him for a 100 level math course, be prepared to teach yourself. Very poor at communicating.

This man has got to be one of the worst math teachers ever. He is corrected by students all the time in his lectures and gives us studyguides with answer sheets that say, "The answers may not be correct."

Questions himself, and not in the "I want you to catch my mistakes" way. Seems to know what he's teaching, but can't relay the information in an easy-to-learn way. Advice: If you don't have prior calculus experience, learn from the book, your classmates, or ask questions in recitation. Great guy though. Ask the right questions, get good answers.

Attending lecture is absolutely pointless.  Hearing this man speak will cause you to doubt everything you previously knew about mathematics.  Make sure to attend recitation and read the book and you should get through ok.

completely useless to go to lecture.  He doesn't even know what's on the syllabus and he pretty much just teaches whatever he wants and he does so incorrectly.  Stick to the book and attending recitation and you should be fine.

Most generally useless professor you could ever have. The only benefit of going to his lectures is to occasionally copy equations of the board-but he usually copies them down incorrectly, so double check anything you get from him. If you have him for 151A, you should just get used to reading the book and stick to attending recitation.

The least helpful professor I've had since I've been at Ohio State. He rambles on endlessly in class and on the board, is very difficult to communicate with, and his exams were very difficult. He cited in my H161 on our final exam that he took a question off of a graduate level exam and put it on our exam. Not fun.

Professor Davis is a tribute to academia at The Ohio State University.  Incidentally his son, James Davis, is well on his way to becoming as respected and influential in his field, line service, as his father is in his.  Cheers gentlemen.

He would not be the best math professor at OSU, but his quizzes and midterms are fairly easy, and he is so generous about grades.  He is really nice and friendly.  He will also go over homework even number problems which will help your homework grade.  I am pretty sure his class is easier than other honors classes and you will get an A if you workh

He get's stuck in problems pretty often but nothing that he can't get over after a minute, and in general much clearer than the one other calc teacher I've had.  Extremely mellow.  If you ask him during quizzes he tells you if you're wrong or right :) Exams aren't too hard, I got a B in H161 but I aced his second exam.

Awful. He writes examples on the board, only to stop in the middle of the problem and decide that he either doesn't know how to explain or else he doesn't know how to do it. Socially awkward and doesn't connect well with students. Made the class much more difficult than it had to be.
He looks like Santa. He is very mellow. He teaches well, and seems really down to earth.
soooo boring.. fell asleep even when i wasn't tired.  not clear and pretty confusing.  makes a lot of mistakes on the board.  but i've heard other H161 aren't that great either.
everything went well except simple harmonics
very shabby looking, really difficult
No Comments

SEI.Subject: ANIMSCI
SEI.Class Name: Data Analysis and Interpretation for Decision Making

SEI.Subject: ANIMSCI
SEI.Class Name: Data Analysis and Interpretation for Decision Making

SEI.Subject: ANIMSCI
SEI.Class Name: Data Analysis and Interpretation for Decision Making

summary_comment: Professor Bernal is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at OSU, known for his willingness to help students understand course material both during and after lectures. His organized teaching style and passion for mathematics make complex concepts accessible, though his non-native English accent can sometimes affect fluidity. Students appreciate his thorough review sessions and extensive resource sharing, which aid in exam preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bernal is highly regarded as one of the best teachers at OSU, known for his willingness to help students with questions both during and after lectures. His organized teaching style and passion for mathematics make complex concepts accessible, though his non-native English accent occasionally presents minor challenges.

Ratings.comment: Esteban publish notes to carman after every class. It is very helpful to do a review after class.

Esteban is one of the best teachers in OSU. Why? Because he WANTS to help answer your questions during and after lectures.  

The midterms and final can be a bit hard/varying since it can have a question from lectures, quizzes, homeworks, or midterm reviews. So look at all of those in separate days and don't cram and you should be solid.
Mr. Esteban was a good teacher. He was very organized when teaching.
Really good professor. Accent but its not a big deal. Exams and quizzes were pretty chill.

Overall good teacher. He's passionate about math and pretty good at teaching. He's not a native English speaker, so his speaking isn't always fluid, but he does well answering questions and showing concepts.

While the class was extremely difficult, that was not the fault of Esteban, but just the University itself. Esteban himself is a fantastic lecturer, and despite being slightly shy that doesn't stop him from making people's days.

Esteban was by far one of the best teachers I have ever had. I think he really enjoys math and made learning fun for me. As a freshman who took business calculus in high school, I didn't know how Calculus 1 would go, but he tries to really prepare you for the exams. I would take future classes with him again in a heartbeat. GOAT
Esteban gives decent lectures and come midterm and final time he usually shows really good examples and sends out a lot of resources.

I had Esteban as a TA Autumn 2021 for Calc 1, and he was amazing. I learnt more in his recitation about the topic than I did in lectures from the professor. Go to his office hours, he is really helpful 1-on-1.

Esteban was a good professor, but his lecture notes could be found online and were exactly what he said in class, so attendance didn't matter. LOTS of practice problems were given for exams and are identical to the test content. Lots of tests but if you do the practice exams and understand those problems you will do fine.

His lectures aren't very organized and he can be difficult to understand. I stopped attending his lectures and started going to a different Math 1151 professor's lectures, and this helped me a lot more.

summary_comment: Professor Kautz is highly regarded for her genuine and caring approach, making her one of the best math instructors her students have encountered. She is known for her engaging and humorous lectures, which effectively explain complex concepts, and her availability to answer questions. Her classes are praised for their clarity and consistency with assessments, though some students found the flipped classroom format challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kautz is highly regarded for her genuine, caring, and humorous approach to teaching, making complex concepts accessible and engaging. Students appreciate her clear explanations and willingness to answer questions, though some found the flipped classroom format challenging.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Kautz is one of the most genuine teachers I've ever had. She's caring and fair when grading. Only dilemma was that it was a flipped classroom. I would have done better if she was the one teaching me, not ALEKS or Edpuzzle. This was a CSCC math Department failure, not hers.

Jaime is literally the coolest professor ever. She is super kind, & makes lectures interesting by connecting math topics to completely random things that make it easier to remember on quizzes/tests! There is a weekly quiz/test but in the notes there are clear examples for what to expect.

If you can take math with Professor Kautz, TAKE IT!!! One of my favorite math teachers ever including high school. She is hilarious in lecture and explains things so well. I never had a professor who was such a great explainer. I learned a lot by her lectures and Aleks that I didn't really need to go to recitation. Easy A if you go to lecture.

I loved this professor! She tried her best to engage her students in lecture and was very funny. She was really good at explaining different concepts to our class and I really enjoyed her lectures. Lectures were not mandatory and she always posted the notes online right after, so if you missed it was no big deal. Super kind and helpful, 10/10!!

Im terrible at math, but Jaime always gave lectures that I understood. She is very funny and caring. Shes probably the best professor you could have. My only complaint is that the course is very test heavy. The quizzes usually have only three to four questions on it, so if you mess up on only one problem, you get a bad grade.

Professor Kautz was an amazing teacher. She answers all your questions and is very nice and funny. She knows what she is talking about and i was very lucky to have for for lecture and recitation. The test were directly from class reviews and homework problems. I took her class online, there was a lot of homework but not to bad.

Dr. Jaime is very cool! Although I hate Math, she is still one of my favorite professors. She is very relatable and easy to talk to. Also, very patient&hilarious!. If she wasn't a Math instructor, I would take her class again. Highly recommend!.(The textbooks is only needed for a few quizzes, but it won't help with the majority of the work.)

I absolutely adored Jaime. She's one of my favorite professors so far. She makes the lectures feel incredibly welcoming. I'm not one to ask questions, but I asked plenty questions and they always got answered! She's a wonderful professor and I recommend her to anyone who gets the opportunity to take one of her classes.

This class was easy and she is there to help you if you needed it. Also first day shes like if youre sick dont come youll ok be. So attendance was based on if you wanted extra help. I recommend Lectures, but if you want skip recitations.
she is very cheesy but is honest, and easy to talk too

I failed my 1075 class last semester. But this semester, I learned the same exact material and everything stuck to me and I passed. Jaime is really cool and fun and makes sure you understand the math. Recitation helps a lot, but going to her lectures help.
Jaime can really help you understand math a little more, as long as you go to class and pay attention. I highly recommend her and she connects with the students too.
Best teacher ever. Recommend 10 out of 10 times

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Math for Middle School Teachers I

summary_comment: Professor Darbinyan is known for his theoretical approach to teaching, particularly in math 2568, where his lectures complement textbooks well and his homework problems are highly beneficial for exam preparation. However, some students find him unapproachable and dismissive in office hours, while others describe him as a challenging but effective instructor who provides clear homework assignments that closely mirror exam questions. Overall, his teaching style is demanding and requires significant self-motivation and initiative from students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Darbinyan is highly regarded by some students as one of the best in his field, noted for his detailed lecture notes and helpful homework assignments that effectively prepare students for exams. However, others find him difficult and unapproachable, particularly in office hours, and criticize his communication style and lack of engagement with students.

Ratings.comment: The lectures were based on his own lecture notes that was a very helpful complement to the textbook. Homework pacing was good, the homework problems were extremely helpful in grasping the material and preparing for the exams. Attend the lectures, do the homework problems, don't feel shy to ask him questions, and you will be fine.
Very disrespectful in office hours, did not want to help students succeed.

One of the best professors I have had. Taken in math 2568.
Really, really tough for common reasons in STEM. The lectures are pretty theoretical, so I would go to office hours, and ask for examples. If you take initiative, and come up with questions, he will be very helpful.

For 2568 he honestly wasn't a terrible professor. The material presented was difficult but I read the book the entire semester which isn't too long and clears up a lot of things that are left confusing during his lectures. He gives less homework than a lot of the other professors and the exams are almost exactly the homework questions he assigns.

Typical 'bad professor'. Anti-social, gave little feedback, not enough time to take tests. Made worse by that the fact that the professor seemingly avoids communicating with students. He would often tell students with questions "we went over that" and leave them confused. Honestly feels like he doesn't actually want to teach. Avoid him.

summary_comment: Professor Molloy is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and genuine care for his students. Students consistently praise his availability, patience, and willingness to help, often noting that he offers extensive office hours and responds promptly to emails. His ability to make challenging material accessible and his commitment to improving student grades through generous grading curves and additional resources contribute significantly to his positive reputation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Molloy is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and dedication to his students' success. Students consistently praise his kindness, availability, and willingness to help, often noting his multiple office hours and quick responses to emails.

Ratings.comment: I love M3816 because it helps me prepare for the SOA-FM exam. Additionally, Professor Molloy is super kind with his students—he provides extra resources for us to study, and he is always willing to help us.

Molloy is the best professor I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and is almost always available. The course was decently hard, but he teaches it very well and is always looking for ways to improve student's grades. Wish he taught more of the classes that I have to take.

Molloy is the best professor I have ever met at OSU. Please take his course. He will try his best to improve your grade. Every time I go during office hours, he is always patient. He replied to the emails so quickly.

This was a difficult class material-wise but Molloy is a great professor and really cares about his students. He wanted students to do well, and he curved all exams by around 10-15 percent. He offers office hours a lot and is always available over email. He is also willing to discuss the actuarial industry with students. Take 3618 with him!!

Martin is one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. Too many of my professors have "office hours" for 1 hour a week (not sure how you can consider it office hours plural if it's a singular hour), but Professor Molloy has office hours for multiple hours/day at least 3 days per week. Go to lecture and study the material and you'll do fine.

Martin is the best math proffesor I have ever had at OSU. He is so kind, helpful, and is great at explaining. If you participate in class, whether right or wrong, you get credit for it. He is always available on zoom if you need help. Go to class, pay attention, ask questions, you will get an A. If you are taking MATH 3618, take it with him!!!

summary_comment: Professor Sirvent is highly regarded for her kindness and caring nature, making her one of the most approachable and supportive professors at OSU. While her PDE course is challenging, particularly due to the difficulty of homework, her lectures and exam questions align well, and she provides ample opportunities for office hours and additional support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sirvent is highly regarded for her kindness and caring nature, making her one of the most approachable professors at OSU. Despite the challenging nature of her PDE course, she provides clear and concise lectures and offers ample support through office hours and homework help, ensuring fair exams that align with the material covered in class.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Sirvent was extremely kind and caring, one of the nicest professors I've had at OSU. Though, the PDE course was pretty challenging, so I do suggest going to her office hours. Homework was super hard, but the exams were fine. Exam problems and difficulty matched the level of examples from lectures and exam review days.
Maritza is a very excellent professor. She takes care of all the students. I have a good sense in her course!

Homework in this class is way too hard and not covered at all by the lectures. The exams aren't terrible, but there is nowhere to find similar caliber problems of the exam. Definitely avoid this section if you learn by example like I do.
I love Prof Sirvent with my whole heart! She is so energetic and funny, but also delivers the most concise and educational lectures I've ever heard. I wish I could take her again!
She is not a bad teacher but her exams are so random and not covered in class. Minimal curve at the end. Final was impossible.

The thing with Maritza is that she is an amazing person, but a terrible lecturer. Half the time shell forget what shes talking about in class on the spot. She doesnt give any prep or motivation for the kings were learning so things seems out of nowhere. She does make up for it by giving ridiculously easy exams. Some studying will get you A.

We all know partial differential equation is hard, but Professor Sirvent makes it less suffer. Great lecture, great notes. Plenty of homework help you understand. Exams are fair and a little curve will help you get A

I loved Maritza but hated this class. I originally only went to lectures and was doing poorly but I started regularly attending office hours and she was insanely helpful and really good in the one on one settings. Also, once she gets to know you, she will be more than happy to just chat. A total gem.

Maritza is the kind of professor who loves what she does, and wants to help her students be as successful as possible. Her lectures were never dull, and even if the material was somewhat boring she found a way to make it lively.

Dr. Sirvent-Leon is a wonderful professor. She is very clear in expectations, and the syllabus is laid out well. She assigns homework relevant to the exams which is nice. Her lectures are very clear and she is able to communicate material well. Very willing to help you succeed. I suggest also completing problems in back of book. I learned a ton.

As a person, she's adorable and super sweet. Definitely wants you to do well, but the class is pretty rough. You'll be completely lost in the homework, and the book is totally useless. Exams are simplified down to the most basic examples, which saved my grade. Class is taught exactly the same as Lakos's class, so as teachers they're pretty similar.

Great teacher, patient and willing to help for any reason necessary. The class, however, is not very good, and too much time is spent on really easy topics. MATH 2415 could use some work, but the professor is excellent.

Not a very good teacher. She is often unclear in what she is writing on the board and spends the entire week doing a single example that she starts over at the beginning of each class. She is nice though and will help out when you ask.  The Gregory Baker textbook used is absolutely atrocious.

Maritza made this class a lot easier than it could have been otherwise. Always really clear during lecture and uploaded notes online when other lecturers did not. Available to students. I have negative comments about 2415 but not Maritza as a professor. She is teaching this class the best it can be taught, but the book is awful. Tons of homework.

There was too much homework and they were hard to solve. But, the exams on the other hand were very  easy, and this what made this class to be one of my favorites and easiest even though it was not an easy subject. She was very nice and helpful if you asked her.
Good at explaining things, fair class
lectures are not clear. Hard and a lot of homework. The lecture notes were not helping for the homework. and the homework are nor related to what she and the book explain.

She is so adorable and nice! She has an accent, but it does not distract from her teaching. Sometimes she gets a little confused with what she's doing, but she always figures it out. She's a good teacher! Just make sure to take notes, do the homework, do the take home quizzes, go to recitation to take the quizzes, and study! Need textbook to study!
I felt like she was sometimes hard to understand and when teaching she often stayed on one topic for a long time then fly through another. And she often got off topic but she is a very sweet lady
Hardest class I have ever taken. Do not take unless 100% necessary. Tests were impossible, quizzes every week, so much homework. Very difficult to understand.
Easy  course and good professor.
She knows here stuff when it comes to calculus. Extremely helpful in all aspects.
If you have to study calculus, I would highly recommend this professor!

She is a very nice professor, you can learn a lot in her lecture. There are 3 midterms and 1 final which are not very hard if you take notes and pay attention to the homework online. And she is very helpful in office hours too.
Maritza is nice and funny, but when it comes to tests they aren't always reflective of what you learned in class.
As long as you keep up with the course via the book,  you should be fine. She is very helpful in office hours

Lovely professor, very easy to approach and ask questions. Very enthusiastic and patient. Will work with you in any way to ensure you are not at risk of failing. Have not heard of a single person in 100 person lecture who did not like her.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Partial Differential Equations for Science and Engineering

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Partial Differential Equations for Science and Engineering

summary_comment: Professor Joshua is widely regarded as unorganized and ineffective, with significant issues regarding communication and organization. Students report that he does not use Canvas, relies on a poorly maintained HTML website with broken links, and frequently misleads about quiz content. His lectures are described as long, quiet, and difficult to follow, with one student noting that they watched YouTube lectures instead. Overall, Professor Joshua is considered a poor choice for this course due to his lack of responsiveness, unclear communication, and subpar teaching methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Joshua is widely regarded as unorganized and ineffective, with poor communication and lecture delivery. Students consistently report issues with his unresponsive nature, unclear lectures, and reliance on a poorly maintained personal website rather than official platforms like Canvas or Carmen.

Ratings.comment:
Dr. Joshua is extremely unorganized and does not use Canvas. He has an HTML website with many broken links. His lectures are very long and quiet. I watched DaveExplains on YouTube instead. We had to ask him to fix a lecture because he reuploaded lecture 5 for 17. Grading system heavily skewed (45% final dropped me from 95% to an A-).
Do not take.
Run! The professor is very irresponsible, if you really want to learn something about linear algebra, go to Fei-Ran Tian's section!

Entirely quizzes and exams with no grade boosters. Horrible at lecturing. Gave misleading information about quizzes leading to me not watching enough lectures for some quizzes despite watching 3 every week and trying to stay ahead. I read this page prior to taking him and thought it'd be fine, don't do what I did and please find another professor.

Does not respond to any emails. Does not show up to office hours. Lectures are confusing. He gives misleading information about upcoming quizzes. For example, he made an announcement that a quiz would cover a specific set of lectures, but when I took the quiz there was material from future lectures for the next week. Worst OSU professor.

Course content is not difficult. However, this professor makes this course very unenjoyable. He is unorganized, does not use Canvas, does not input grades correctly, and does not respond to emails. Additionally, his teaching is not good. His speech is soft and hard to understand, and his handwriting is borderline illegible. Avoid if possible.

This is the worst professor I have ever had throughout my four years in College thus far. He never checked his email and he didn't show up for office hours.

He was dismissive whenever I tried to bring problems up with him. 

He seems to not care about his students at all.

His lecture videos are hard to understand and his handwriting is hard to read. The course grade is ENTIRELY quizzes and exams, with weekly quizzes. He does give partial credit, however. He uses his own website instead of Carmen, and has used the same Carmen page for multiple semesters, removing past students so they can't view the page anymore.
Notes and recorded lectures took some time to understand but overall great teacher and easy class.

I'm only two weeks into him as a professor. Thus far, he A)failed to describe or at the very least failed to emphasize the required format for proctorio quizzes (that is stated in one line on his password protected website he uses instead of carmen) and B) refuses to provide an answer key to the homework that is not turned in nor graded.

I took this class over the summer and he was accommodating and friendly. The grades are just based off quizzes and exams, and they are all insanely if you watch the lectures and do the sample problems (with answers!). Sometimes theyre the exact same questions. He does have an accent and fancy handwriting that can be hard to understand at times.

First of all, this course is asynchronous and there is not such a slide or exact textbook to learn. Everything is from his lecture videos, but it is really hard to understand or keep track of his videos. His writing illegible, which will take you a long time to watch a video. To watch 50 min lecture, took average of 80 minutes for me to understand.

He is the worst professor I've ever had. Having him on zoom didn't help. His mic was low quality and you could not understand a word he was saying. All he does during lecture is read his pre-written notes to us, and his handwriting is impossible to read. Normally I'm good at math, too. Switch out of his class and find a different professor asap.

Does not respond kindly to emails; really doesn't care about feedback from students and takes offense to feedback. Is an asynchronous class, despite that when I signed up for it, it said it was synchronous. This could either be a good or bad thing depending on student. Illegible handwriting, cannot hear his voice in the recorded lectures.

I currently have him for online class because of the pandemic. No one can understand his lectures. The audio is terrible and his handwriting is equally terrible. Please take the class with someone else if you can.

My goodness, I thought I'd seen the worst with Calculus 2. I had Roy Joshua for linear algebra, and I can confidently say that is it the most stressful course I've taken in my entire life. His handwriting is very hard to read, he takes weeks to respond to emails, his lectures are not at all engaging and dull, and his test prep sucks.

AU 19. Sit in the front or else you'll have no idea what he's saying (soft talker). Had his own website where he had links to uploaded notes, quiz answers, etc. but he did not upload a majority of them/links were broken. The midterms were basically a compilation of the quizzes, so not too hard. Read the book and go to lecture to get a decent grade.
Prepare to learn the material on your own

Basically just steps through the proofs without much explanation of thought processes or how you would actually come up with them. Quizzes/tests don't have any big surprises, you'll know what's going to be on them and what to study (i.e. what proofs to remember how to do).

I would give Roy Joshua a worse score, but there are so many terrible math professors here that he was actually fine by comparison. There were weekly quizzes but they were pretty easy. Exams also weren't too bad, and he pretty much told us what the questions would be beforehand. I'm pretty sure the curve was pretty large as well.

Hard to describe him as a professor. His accent & handwriting can be hard to understand, and his quizzes and hws are pretty hard (they're not worth much in the overall grade though). Thought I was gonna get a C the whole semester but somehow ended up with an A-. His midterms aren't bad/ come from practice tests and repeated problems in the notes.
I'm going to have to retake this class. Be ready for proof after proof after proof. Barely can understand his accent. I can never read his notes. Ugh.

Not a terrible class. He can be pretty hard to follow at times but goes over topics several times that are important. Exams aren't impossible and his grading is decent for the most part. Do the homework and take good notes in class. Practice exams, if he posts them, are pretty helpful.
Talks really fast and faces the board when he writes so its hard to takes notes sometimes. Examples that he works out in lecture multiple times will 100% be on the test.

I am taking him for 566 now. Basically the thing about this professor is to check his site and check to see if his old tests are up, he reuses them so you have the answers. If not go through and do as many problems in the book, he takes quiz and test questions directly from it. His grading scale is really easy, 35 gets you a D.

The class was very easy. He was not a tough professor, but he was not the best professor. His handwriting is very illegible sometimes, and he mumbles a lot. More often than not, he would lecture straight from the book, so that the examples in class were the same as they were in the book. However the class was fairly easy!

This class is so bad, he is probabaly the second worst teacher i have ever had. He goes to the board and just goes off in his own little world. At the end of class he is the first to leave. He did not prepare us well for the final.
Sucks, but if you have any old quizes or midterms they will be simular. Final was hard and did not pepare us well!!!!
He doesn't always know what he is doing.  The material on the exams is much harder than the material taught in class.  Be sure to read the book if you take this class.

He does not know what he is doing. He does not speak clearly. If you are a flash note taker, go ahead and try. He is not organized and give extremely hard exams. Please stay away from this prof or else you are going to regret your whole life like me.

summary_comment: Professor Ko is perceived as having mixed teaching qualities. While some students found her lectures straightforward and her notes detailed, others criticized her for speaking too quickly and breezing through material, making it difficult to follow. Her exams are generally easy, but her lectures are seen as less effective for learning compared to recitations, and grading can be harsh, especially on theoretical questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ko is perceived as an irresponsible instructor who does not effectively convey complex Calculus 3 concepts, leading many students to struggle and seek alternative sections. While some find her tests easy and note-taking helpful, the majority of feedback indicates a disconnect between her teaching style and students' ability to learn the material effectively.

Ratings.comment: An irresponsible professor. Do not recommend for students really want to learn Calculus 3!
Easy tests but irresponsible professor, do not recommend for the students who really want to learn the knowledge of Calculus 3.

Calculus 3 is moderately complex, but Dr. Ko's teaching attitude was problematic. She didn't take her lectures seriously. Her exam questions aren't complicated. I took her class for one month in Spring 2023 and then dropped out and enrolled in Sean Sanford's section in Fall 2023 (I got an A-) because I couldn't learn anything from Dr. Ko's class.

If you have Dr. Liling Ko in your Calculus 3, you are lucky enough compared to your peers. Even though she had trouble explaining some complicated concepts, you can still understand them through her notes. 45% of my peers get an A range as the final grade in AU 23. You will get an easy A as long as you do some practice before her exams.

I truly feel like I learned a lot from Dr. Ko's lectures and would take another class taught by her. Her lecture style is very straightforward, but her notes are very detailed and easy to follow. Do the practice material she gives you and you will do well in this class.

Dr. Ko's class hinges on the willingness to understand the material. The class gets harder and the lectures get faster but are always manageable. At times, I did have to spend time outside class to make sense of the material. Homeworks can get long but are pretty straightforward. Midterms were on the easier side. She wants you to do well.
Professor Ko speaks incredibly fast and breezes through the material without giving students time to understand it. Exams are very theoretical and are graded harshly.

Her lectures are alright, but I felt like I actually learned more in recitation. She talks a bit fast, which makes her hard to understand at times. Also one of our midterms was "accidentally too hard" (oopsie :) ) which tanked a lot of our grades, and we were pretty upset about that as there is no curve in the class.

she got awesome, sound notes that she used to teach the lecture. It's understandable that sometimes she might go too slow but we can finish our course anyway. It won't be a problem to go too slow. It's a problem if she didn't answer students' questions or care about students' interpretations. But she does answer patiently and care

As a person, Dr. Ko is kind and caring. However, her lectures can be a bit dull and the course is structured unforgivingly. We had consecutive exams the last two weeks of class, worth about 40% of our grade. Doing well early is imperative to succeeding in this course as there is no curve. The actual tests and grading are pretty standard.

Ok lecturer, but goes too slow or too fast through material sometimes. The main problem was our final (75 avg), which was a very different format and much more difficult/technical/detailed than the SP22 one and our midterms. Also can be frustrating b/c she makes at least 1 or 2 mistakes on every lecture/exam and has to waste time fixing them.

Ko is a very good professor when it pertains to being straight to the point with content which I respect. The only criticism I had with her class is that she tended to go very fast through her lectures which was very hard to keep up with at times. Overall a solid math professor.

I would not recommend this professor unless you have a large amount of time to spend learning on your own outside of class. OSU's math department and this class are already difficult enough but this professor has little empathy for anyone not keeping up. Tests are graded very harshly with very little work counting for partial credit.
She goes incredible fast when the lecture is hard, and extremely slow when it is easy. And she would not show how to achieve the answer step by step even for the first time.
Great professor to take. She would agree with most of the requests if it is reasonable.

Prof Ko is a very nice and considerate professor. The material is very straightforward and it is what it is, but she obviously has a rich knowledge of mathematics and her deliberative work shows through in her thoughtful lectures. She is a great first time professor and will only get better. If you struggle to follow in class though, watch Youtube.

For a first time professor, pretty good, could have been much worse. Straight-forward lectures with in class examples and blank notes given ahead of time so you can follow her work.  Her exams are very fair and intuitive, with simple calculations and easy numbers. Strict but not unfair. Major downside is she can be hard to follow in class.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

summary_comment: Professor Dutta is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching skills, delivering well-prepared and clearly explained lectures that make complex topics accessible. Her assignments, while challenging, are manageable with the support of group work, and her exams are designed to be straightforward, often mirroring practice exams. Students consistently praise her responsiveness and willingness to help, making her a highly recommended instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dutta is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and clear explanations, making complex material accessible to students. Her lectures are well-prepared and well-organized, with a focus on thorough understanding through detailed step-by-step problem-solving. Homework is challenging but manageable in groups, and exams are designed to be straightforward, with opportunities for improvement through dropped scores.

Ratings.comment: Ms. Dutta is an angel. Her lectures are amazing! The homework is difficult but group work is allowed. The tests are very simple.

She is a very nice woman! The lectures were very clear and very good! Homework is a little difficult, but teams are allowed to complete it. There are three midterms, but the lowest grade drop allows trial and error, and the difficulty is not high. The final exam is also easy.

Great professor, every lecture was well prepared and well organized. The homework is a little difficult but teams are allowed, and up to 40% of total grade. Midterm and Final exam questions are very simple, and Midterm has three exams but the lowest drop score. Highly recommend Dutta!

Very solid professor, homework are total of 40% and could be allowed to be completed in groups. Three midterms are very easy and the lowest score would be dropped, which provided room for error. The lectures were well prepared, with written content explaining concepts and projections on the spot. Highly recommended!

Ms. Dutta is an excellent professor. The course itself is challenging, but she pays attention to the explanation of knowledge points so that every student can understand them. I recommend choosing her.

Amazing lecturer that was able to gauge during class time whether students were comfortable with content. She was very good at answering questions and I would frequently stay after class so she could explain concepts more in depth. As a life science major, calculus was never my strong suit, but Prerona made the content much more digestible.

The material is tough but she taught well. She teaches by explaining the concept and then doing practice problems while explaining every step, which is super helpful. There is a lot of homework but the exams were extremely reasonable and were very similar to the practice exams.

She provides students with extremely clear, condensed notes on each topic during lecture but those go really fast, so it's important to review and do the Ximera. Worked great for me because I can't learn math listening to word soup anyway. She responds to emails in 2 seconds and is a caring professor. Very welcoming of questions during lecture.

Considering Calc 2 is one of the hardest required math courses, Dutta did a decent job explaining and showing examples of most concepts. If you actively pay attention in lectures, show up to recitation, and ask questions, you will get through the class. While she does talk fast, if you seek out help and practice(!!), you will be fine in the end.

She talks super fast and sounds very stressed, doesn't help that her accent is very heavy also. She rushes through examples and often leaves most of the students confused. The entire class starts chatting in confusion every time she pauses during a lecture.

summary_comment: Professor Volkening is known for her clear lectures and her dedication to understanding her students' needs, though her initial grading can be very detailed and sometimes perceived as overly strict. While some students find her approach beneficial and recommend her, others struggle with the heavy theoretical focus and the abundance of lecture materials, which can make note-taking challenging and the homework grading particularly rigorous.
summary_comment_short: Professor Volkening is known for her clear lectures and dedication to understanding student needs, though her initial grading can be quite strict before adjustments are made. However, her approach to linear algebra is heavily theoretical with minimal examples, making it challenging for some students to follow along and take notes effectively.

Ratings.comment: Took differential equations with Volkening at Purdue. Very clear lectures and takes time to fully explain questions and get to know students. Her grading started off as unreasonably picky, but she realized that students were being graded too harshly and adjusted her grading style, showing that she wants the best for her students. Would recommend!

I aced all previous calc classes, but cant get past Volkenings Linear Algebra. Her plethora of lecture material make it impossible to take notes. Very little examples done in class, mostly just thms and theoretical things (NOT HELPFUL). HW is graded extremely picky, even compared to my other engineering classes. Take another professor if possible

summary_comment: Professor Park is highly regarded by many students as one of the best instructors, known for her caring approach, accessibility, and effective use of grading curves to support student learning. However, some students find her lectures confusing and criticize her exams for covering material not taught in class, leading to significant stress and potential grade discrepancies.
summary_comment_short: Professor Park is highly regarded by many students as one of the best instructors, known for her caring approach, accessibility, and willingness to address student difficulties. However, there are significant criticisms regarding the exam structure and grading, with some students finding the material and exams challenging and the grading process harsh and unclear.

Ratings.comment: One of the best professors I have had. Lucky to have her for two courses. Dr. Park is caring and receptive to feedback, ie when a majority of the class struggled on a homework question she would review it in class and would determine if the question was unfair or how to best assist us on the question.

Dr Park has been the best math teacher, let alone professor, that I've had so far. Although her lectures can be confusing at times she always makes sure to allow questions. She is also relatively accessible outside of class times. Given the material in the course she made me understand almost everything. Additionally she uses a heavy curve to help.
Her lecture is always inspring. And we are free to ask her any questions during her office hour and after class. She's super nice and gives large curve for exams. You can learn a lot from her course.

YOU D BETTER DROP FROM THE COURSE! Shes the WORST professor ever. Exams did not cover material from class. Yes, Prepare to getting points off for vague reasons on the exams. Any discussion with her was a torment. Not allowed to learn and use any linear algebraic materials outside the course, or just prepare to receive a warning letter from SOMEONE

There's a disparity between things from the lecture and things from the exams. Be aware of getting points off for vague reasons on the exams and assignments. Avoiding or dropping this class would be recommended for good mental health.

You do not know your actual grade in the class till the end of the semester and she purposely makes exams very hard. Her homework's are much harder than what she teaches in class and is not much help outside of class. She grades very strict and her notes are extremely hard to follow as they are not well organized.

summary_comment: Professor Sankar's teaching style varies widely according to student feedback. Many found her lectures confusing and unhelpful, preferring recitations and external resources like TAs and Khan Academy for better understanding. While some appreciated her availability and willingness to help outside of class, the overall consensus is that her lectures were not effective in conveying the material, making the course challenging without additional support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sankar's teaching style is inconsistent, with many students finding her lectures confusing and unhelpful, often turning to TAs or external resources like Khan Academy for better understanding. Despite some students finding her helpful outside of class and appreciating her willingness to meet outside office hours, the overall quality of her lectures is generally poor, leading many to question their value and opt for alternative learning methods.

Ratings.comment: Took AP Calc in high school but wanted to prepare more for calc 2 and 3 so I retook it.  I knew a good portion of the topics and her teaching style eventually made me stop attending lectures as I felt she was confusing everyone.  I learned 10x more from my TA during recitations and from highschool than I did from her lectures.

She was definitely more helpful than most of the linear algebra professors at OSU. She did well explaining really difficult lecture material and was always ready to answer any questions, being super helpful for homework assignments and questions during office hours. Class is still really difficult, but I would recommend taking it with her.

Amazing professor. She is brilliant and it is more than apparent in lecture. She is very helpful in office hours and is willing to meet at other times if you're unable to attend. While attendance wasn't mandatory, going to class can clear up a lot of potential confusion from the notes.

The lectures did not make a lot of sense and confused me more than I already was. She would answer questions but her way of lecturing made the material difficult to understand. Going to recitation and having the TA explain the material was more helpful than the lectures.

She is a pretty decent professor in terms of explaining concepts.  Helps to have a basic calculus understanding coming into this class (AP, high school, something to get your feet on the ground and running). Exams and written HW for this course are graded by TA's who, in my opinion, gave decent feedback.
Soumya just didn't teach very well. That's about it. The material was not well covered.
Was helpful outside of class, however, the lectures made me leave even more confused than when I went in. Khan academy will save you here. Not a fan

I came into Math 1150 already having a transfer credit. Just wanted to review. The lectures are worthless, confusing, goes over time every class. Give yourself adequate time after class to get to the next one, or plan to just walk out during lecture. Be prepared to spend a lot of time on the homework. 1-2 weekly quiz, 5 midterms, 1 final.

Her lectures are awful and a waste of time. I came into college with calc experience and she would just confuse me. she doesn't explain anything and when she does she just explains theories that don't make any sense. The only reason she gets a 2 is because she genuinely cares and is trying to improve her lectures but they just are not good.

Soumya was very nice but not a good lecturer. She explains topics in theory with few practical examples. She also tends to overexplain.  I often left lectures more confused, so its important to have a good TA to explain things a little better.

The lectures aren't very useful. The only negative thing about this class falls mostly on the universities academic curriculum. It's horrible, the information given and how you're expected to learn it is like being force fed cow manure. It's dry, hard to remember and unless you're ready to spend most your time cleaning it up, it becomes a mess.

Although Soumya wasn't my favorite professor, you can tell that she cares about her students and is willing to clarify for you. I learned a lot from the online homework and attending recitation. It's important to learn the material because you will continue to use it throughout the semester.

Soumya is nice enough, but lecture is unbearable to get through. You can tell she is trying hard, but her teaching is confusing and unclear at times. Most people do not bother to go to lecture because of this. If you don't have a good TA, this class will probably be a struggle for you.

This class is easy - each week there's only one homework assignment and one 3 question quiz that we take in person during recitation. Attendance in lectures and recitation is not mandatory, but you have to go to recitation because Soumya cannot teach at all - everyone stopped bothering going on lectures. Lowest 2 quizzes dropped tho

summary_comment: Professor Genao is highly regarded for his engaging and supportive teaching style, particularly in number theory courses. Students appreciate his encouragement and willingness to help during office hours, though some find the material challenging. Overall, he is seen as one of the best math professors at OSU, known for his passion for mathematics and commitment to student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Genao is highly regarded for his engaging and supportive teaching style, with students praising his encouragement during lectures and availability in office hours. His passion for mathematics is evident in his clear and enthusiastic lectures, though some students found the course challenging and noted a need for more in-class examples and explanations.

Ratings.comment: Professor Genao was a great professor for number theory! I took his class as an elective and I really enjoyed it. He was super encouraging in his lectures, and so everyone would participate. Some of his homeworks were challenging but he was always willing to help in office hours. Probably the best math professor I had at OSU, he's a great guy.

If you have to take 1151, take it with Tyler! He is the only reason I did well. Make sure to participate in lecture and the class is super hard, so try to go to office hours as well! He really cares that his students do well and understand the content, which is awesome. Office hours are SO HELPFUL!

Professor Genao is one of the best math teachers I have ever had. He really cares about his student and their engagement in the course. He tries to get students to participate in the lectures. He is very personable and wants to get his students. Go to his office hours and he will love you forever!!

I do not think he goes over enough examples in class that we see on the midterms. I felt unprepared because he also skips explanations of steps. He is knowledgeable in the material but does not care about outside personal life. You get no extensions. This professor said I should "maybe not have a job" and take a loan out and only focus on school.

Despite not doing as well as I would've hoped in the class, that is not at all his fault. He is a phenomenal professor and really cares about individual students. Super personable if you ever get the chance to talk to him 1:1. Any issues I had were with the math department, not Tyler, and he is truly trying his best to help us succeed.

He is very nice and passionate about math. He allows participation in class. The homework is all online including the quizzes and the majority of your grade is midterms and the written homework once a week. The written homework is the same amount of points as the midterms and basically an at home test, so make sure not to blow those off.

Dr. Genao is a fabulous professor. He is super willing to help out and so passionate about math. If you go to his office hours pretty consistently, you'll get to know him really well, and that can be helpful for little grade boosts at the end of the semester (of course aligning with the math department rules on rounding)

Fantastic Calc professor, always willing to help his students out and provides clear analysis on how to solve problems. He is passionate about math and it is reflected in his lectures. Very lowkey and chill guy who does not have overbearing lectures and is always encouraging his students to participate instead of just talking for 55 minutes. 10/10

Professor Genao loves to talk math and theory with his students. His lectures follow the book and his handwriting is a little messy but he takes no offense to students who ask him to clarify his writing.

summary_comment: Professor Black is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, preparing students thoroughly and organizing sessions effectively. He simplifies complex concepts without being condescending, making learning accessible. His fairness in grading further enhances his reputation as an effective instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Black is highly effective, known for being well-prepared, organized, and skilled at explaining complex concepts clearly. Students consistently praise his ability to make the material accessible without undermining their intelligence, and they appreciate his fairness in grading.

Ratings.comment: Gabriel was my TA for math 1130 and he was the reason I did well in the class! Take his recitation section if you can! He was prepared and organized and knows how to teach! He made concepts easy to understand but wasnt patronizing. I would have failed 1130 without him since my lecturer was so bad. He is also a very fair grader.

summary_comment: Professor Saucedo is highly regarded for his excellent teaching at Virginia Tech, particularly in Differential Equations. Students praise his clear lectures, comprehensive lecture notes, and the alignment of test questions with practice materials, making the course manageable for those who stay engaged with the material. His approachable nature and availability during office hours further enhance the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Saucedo is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and clear explanations, making Diff EQ at Virginia Tech accessible and engaging for students. His comprehensive lecture notes, consistent test formats aligned with practice materials, and supportive office hours contribute significantly to student success.

Ratings.comment: I had him for Diff EQ at Virginia Tech he is easily one of the best math professors I've had

Lectures had great format, were easy to follow. Saucedo explains everything well to ensure student understanding of material being presented. Test are exactly like the practice homework's, quizzes, and in-class problems, not particularly hard if you know your stuff. Also, all lecture notes are posted online with notes from class if you miss.

Prof Saucedo was the best math teacher I have ever had at VT. If you have the chance to take him for Diff Eq, DEF do it. Such a good lecturer- I loved having the notes beforehand that we would fill in during class. Do the optional homework problems if you have the time, they help so much for the weekly quizzes.

I had Prof Saucedo at Virginia Tech. He posted blank pdfs of the notes that we would fill in during class, which helped him go through the material quickly and jump into practice problems. The lectures and suggested problems are like what you'll see on tests and quizzes. Office hours are helpful and he's very approachable. Highly recommend!

A solid choice for diff eq at Virginia Tech. My only complaint was we didn't have much time on exams (hour exams), but then again that's almost all math classes at Virginia Tech. He lectured very well and DEFINITELY do the suggested homework problems from the textbook as they are the exact same type of questions on the weekly quizzes.

Profesor Saucedo was great. He lectures every class and his notes are easy to follow. The weekly quizzes are easy given you did the homework. His tests are easy too, no surprises. He holds a lot of office hours and he responds to emails quickly. The math empo quizzes are impossible, Saucedo has no impact on that though. Definitely recommend him.

New to Virginia Tech as of last semester. One of your best options for Diff Eq. We had no homework, which I found made it harder. Do the textbook problems and you should be ok. He writes and explains things pretty clearly, but is typically writing things straight out of the textbook like others. Weekly quizzes/tests are pretty straightforward.

I had Dr. Saucedo for Diff Eq at Virginia Tech. Great teacher & he understands & explains everything well. He made DE pretty interesting and not too bad. Weekly quizzes were on the suggested homework textbook problems, do this hw for A's on all the quizzes. Tests were similar to the practice tests posted. He Doesn't try to trick you on exams. 10/10

Professor Saucedo has been one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. He makes extra effort and time to make sure that anyone who wants to learn can understand the material. Homework was optional with a quiz every week, with the midterms more difficult than the quizzes. I'm not a math guy and I did well solely because of him.

Saucedo is an AMAZING professor. His weekly quizzes are similar to the non-mandatory homework, so the questions are very fair. The midterms/finals are also fair material and nothing is unexpected. He truly cares for his students and is available outside of class. He also brought snacks/candy for students during the final.

summary_comment: Professor Kutler is highly regarded for his clear and organized lectures, which significantly enhance understanding. Students appreciate his flexible grading system and the substantial homework assignments that keep them engaged with the material. While the class can be challenging, many find it rewarding and enjoyable due to his effective teaching methods and willingness to provide support during office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kutler is highly regarded for his clear and organized lectures, thorough knowledge of the subject, and effective teaching methods, including a flexible grading system that emphasizes homework and exams. Students find his classes challenging yet rewarding, with many praising his availability during office hours and his ability to explain complex material clearly.

Ratings.comment: Great professor! Clear, organized lectures, not much homework, great grading system. Divide grade into 5 even part, which is homework, midterm1&2, final, and best one of previous 4 part! Double your best score!

Great professor, very articulate and thoroughly knowledgeable on the subject, ask him questions and he's able to expand a little bit to help your understanding. Assigns a good amount of homework that keeps you on track throughout a course that builds heavily on itself. Course is difficult but having him really helps.

I took his 4580 class, but it's not letting me pick it. Very good lectures. I showed up to a lot of office hours, and he explains the material very well. If you have a chance to take a class with this professor, it's worth the difficulty.

To be honest, I don't think I put a lot of effort in Math 3345 and I should have went to as much office hours as possible. Something I regret.

But on the flip side, even though this class was hard, it was probably one of the most fun class I ever had just because Max taught it. Max is a galaxy brain, commander, warlord, and GIGACHAD teacher!

Very good professor. A topic like Proofs requires a good, organized orator and Max is absolutely one. HW's twice a week are written by him and serve as fantastic guides through the material. He's also personable and always willing to give feedback. Not a cake walk tho, he does grade tough, but its not too bad. Go to every lecture and you'll fly.

Great professor! If you take MATH3345 take it with him, he is a great professor in a classroom as well as one-on-one during office hours. The grading scale was the best I have heard of: HW, Exam I, Exam II, and Final. The highest grade received on any of these four is 40%, the rest are 20% each. Great flexibility and the tests match up with the HW.
Amazing Professor, graded leniently but gave homework twice weekly. Very kind and always available to help students. Will highly recommend him for Math 3345.
Easy class.

Probably the best professor in the Math department! Max is very a down to earth guy and has no busy work in the class. You can expect usual homework assignments and three midterms before the final exam.

summary_comment: Professor Findell is known for his engaging lectures and reasonable workload, though his grading can be harsh and unpredictable. Students find that class time work is generally easy but does not align well with exams, which often come unexpectedly and are graded late. Despite these challenges, many appreciate his passion and find the practice exams helpful.
summary_comment_short: Professor Findell is known for his engaging lectures and reasonable workload, but his grading can be harsh and inconsistent, particularly for the midterm and final exams, which often do not align with in-class work. Students find the midterm and final exams challenging and sometimes not graded promptly, leading to significant discrepancies in final grades.

Ratings.comment: Class time work had nothing to do with the midterm or final exams. Graded extremely hard and was disrespectful to students about how they did.

Class was semi-enjoyable and not super difficult, but final grades are completely unreasonable. There are barely any homework assignments in the class, so most of your grade is based on the midterm and take-home final. The take-home final has no clear rubric, and is not similar to what we did in class at all.

The class time work was very simple and easy, but the midterm did not have much to do with what we learned at all and he graded extremely tough. The final was a take home final and he said it would be graded before the end of the semester, but it was not  and really hurt some people's grades who depended on this final to bring their grade up.
The actual class time work was very easy and simp

He assigned homework which he would never grade or give us feedback on. We didn't have a single exam. On the last class, he asked us what the final should be. In the end, he didn't grade anything that we turned in. I received an A because I participated in class. But, others received a B with no explanation as to why they earned that grade.

Professor Findell works hard to make his lectures interesting. The workload is reasonable. I'd definitely take a course with him again. The biggest issues with his classes are that the midterm and finals come out of nowhere and often aren't graded before the semester is over.
You'll love him if you have a sense of dry humor. Practice exams are very useful. The homework was the hardest part of this class.

I wanted an easy A, but this is more like an easy C if you don't study for the midterms. But if you do, you'll pass with a good grade. Pro tip: the practice exams almost exactly match them.

He's a passionate guy that gives you the tools to pass if you just do the work. I would take him again.
Condescending and uncaring for students. disrespectful

I'm not a math person and his class was very confusing to follow especially after the first midterm. The textbook is confusing to follow and understand, but his lectures are decent if you understand the course materials. He does "talk to your neighbors" too often. If he used that time to go through examples that would have been very helpful.

took way too long to put grades in which was super frustrating. had no grades in for half the semester even though there was weekly homework. also bad at responding to emails. other than that, the class really wasnt bad if you did the work and paid attention. he was decent

This class is the hardest one I have ever taken. Brad is a good guy and he is passionate about math, but as a prof he is really confusing, gets off topic, and is a hard grader. You have to work extremely hard to get a relatively good grade, but it really isnt worth all the stress. Brad means well, but he isnt a great prof. Good luck with him.

(BTW, I took the MATLAB section/text). His lectures are easy to follow and cover the basics, but if you don't read the textbook in addition you will struggle with the homework/exams. A nice and caring person, and helpful in office hours. His exams covered more of the basics/fundamentals of what is in the textbook, so weren't very difficult.
slow. boring. he likes to say "talk to your neighbor" which is annoying

He goes slow in lecture like really slow, and he emphasizes the basics; the foundation so that you can really understand if you learn a bit slowly However, because of this he doesnt have time to go through the hard & more useful topics & examples that are covered in the homework & the exams. Leading you to figure it out by yourself. take @ cstate!

Brad is my favorite professor I've had at Ohio State. I have had in for two semesters. He barely gives us homework and class is discussion based. The first semester he provided pizza every other class. I enjoy math more when I am in his class.

This class will be your favorite class if you're big into math, if you don't enjoy math, buckle up. Brad is a good teacher and very flexible to meet students needs. If you talk to him about having trouble with deadlines he will for sure help you out. The homework is pretty tough though, you won't do well without going to office hours weekly.

Brad really requires his students to think for themselves. The math textbook is used every lecture and recitation because the activities we do in class are included in the book. Luckily the book is cheap. The homework is difficult so it's important to attend office hours and work on the homework early. Do NOT procrastinate!

Brad isn't as bad as everyone makes him out to be. Sure he isn't the best teacher, but if you attend class and office hours you will do fine in the class. For all those people that said he is a hard grader, they are wrong because Brad doesn't even grade the homework the TA does; if anything this class is dependent on the TA you get, not Brad.

I did not enjoy this class. It was only passible if you went to office hours to work on the homework. I did not like Brad's teaching style at all. We spent the entire class figuring out how to solve problems by ourselves and then were told how it relates to what we are learning in the last 5 minutes if we were even told.

I spent hours and hours completing homework, attending all of the office hours provided and still received a bad grade. Brad makes students feel bad about their ability to be a teacher. This was by far the worst class I have taken thus far. The way this class is set up is rigged. It is also very hard to get your grade to improve.

Absolutely terrible. I was told this class was easier for people who do not like math, that was a lie. The teacher was horrendous. On multiple occasions he would put questions on exams we were never taught how to do. He will give you homework weekly, but don't expect to see the grade you got on it until after the semester is over.
Class sizes are small and you learn a lot so you need to be there every day. Also at office hours every time or you really wont pass.

Pretty bad professor. He used to send emails basically incentivizing people to go to his lectures saying that those who went got ten percent higher grades. Most people still did not go with only thirty out of 130 students going. Go to recitation and study on your own. His teaching style is not useful so I would skip his lectures.

Spent all of my semester doing homework and studying for this class. Had to attend multiple office hours a week to get even a B on the homework assignments and exams. Brad is intelligent and cares a lot about his students, the class is simply just made much harder than needed.

Brad can be a decent professor at times, but I would still have to say he is one of the worst math professors I have had. Be prepared to spend at least 10 hours a week on this class alone. The homework is graded extremely hard and you basically HAVE to go to office hours if you want any chance of doing well. This class takes a toll on you for sure.

He is not a bad professor, I personally just didn't learn well from his teaching style. When discussing math problems and ideas, he would never work out problems during lecture. The only practice I had was during recitation and on my own / homework. Recitation for me was mandatory in order to understand the material.

Brad was one of the better math professors that I have had at OSU. He cares about his students and is willing to work you through any questions that you have. The homework and exams would have been very difficult without attending his office hours so make sure you find time to go. If you  work hard you will get a lot out of Brad as your professor.

You have to work hard for this class. Go to office hours or you will not do well. Do the sample problems he gives you, some will appear on the exams. Stay organized or you will regret it. He can be very confusing at times and can talk down to you, but he does care about each of his students and wants the best for us.

At first impression, Dr. Findell seems boring and stiff. But once he gets to know the class, he's really nice and loosens up a lot, and is always willing to help you. Go to his tutor room hours because he was extremely helpful on homeworks and studying for exams. Class material is somewhat difficult but not terrible. Overall a really nice guy.

summary_comment: Professor Koenig is highly knowledgeable and passionate about teaching mathematics, particularly in areas involving proofs, which he finds challenging for some students. While his lectures can be difficult to follow due to a quiet speaking style and occasional mumbling, he is fair, helpful, and genuinely cares about his students' understanding, encouraging questions and thorough preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Koenig is highly knowledgeable and passionate about teaching mathematics, particularly proofs, which can be challenging. While his lectures can be difficult to follow due to his quiet speaking style and occasional mumbling, students appreciate his fairness, helpfulness, and dedication to ensuring understanding.

Ratings.comment: Class was very difficult as it mostly deals with proofs, which I personally struggle with. Koenig has a very dry sense of humor but it's obvious he cares about his students understanding what he's teaching and encourages questions. He talks quietly so sit toward the front of the class. Wouldn't take the class again but would take it with him again.

Professor Koenig is extremely knowledgeable about mathematics, and relies on his own methodology of teaching the class rather than following the textbook. However, he sometimes fails to convey information (which is understandable due to the abstract nature of the class), requiring rigorous reading of the textbook.
Dr. Koenig has a dry, but awesome sense of humor. He is incredibly fair, especially compared to other 3345 instructors. I would definitely recommend him for 3345.

Prof. Koenig is an occasionally funny guy with a genuine passion for teaching math. He knows his notes front to back and is great at explaining things but sometimes assumes you know things that you probably don't. Show up to class, take good notes, and study at least a few days before exams and you will pass. Make sure to actually try on the HW.

Dr. Koenig is an excellent professor. He is very clear, his exams are very fair, and his homework is manageable. The course material can be difficult at times, but if you show up and participate it's not bad.

Hes pretty knowledgeable as a professor but the class is difficult. Knows hes taking about. He mumbled through lecture so kinda hard to understand. His final nearly killed everyone though and the topics at the end were brutal. Be ready to be good at proofs.

Pretty cool guy. The only real complaint I have against him is that he talks soft and kinda mumbles and its kinda hard to get what he is trying to say. But he is very helpful and its pretty easy to follow his lecture notes. Also helpful when you ask questions.
Great prof overall! The exams were fair, and there was a manageable amount of homework. My only complaint is he goes over time in lectures by 5 to 10 minutes each lecture.
He explains topics very well and gives great walkthroughs of new and old topics and methods. Although I do not enjoy Calculus, he definitely has improved my views on it.

His lectures are easy to understand, he cracks math jokes which tends to be the normal for most good math teachers at OSU, and although the class itself can get hard, it wont if you ask questions during recitation and send emails. During fall semester he only graded homework and exams and the participation grade recitations was decided by the TA.
Awesome professor! Id recommend going to his office hours if you missed the lectures.

I really wasn't looking forward to this class at all but Dr. Koenig made it way more enjoyable than I thought it was going to be. His sense of humor is great too. Exams weren't too bad and homeworks were reasonable.

Dr. Koenig is a nice professor who cares a lot about making the class interesting and understandable. Very witty guy. He does not make tests as hard as the homework is (except for the bonus question) and keeps grading criteria and length of tests fair. He's amazing and you'll come out with a decent grade and a good understanding of math.
Great lecturer. He loves to joke around. You'll get an A as long as you do your homework.
Best professor I've had at OSU. Hilarious and cool guy, and clearly passionate about math.

Good professor overall. He speaks rather softly so you may need to sit up front. Sometimes he spent a bit more time on proofs than what I would've liked. Roughly 75% of the grade was exams, but they were quite fair exams in my opinion. Awkward dude but is pretty funny at times. No other faults that I can think of. Would take again.

Excellent professor.  He makes sure to explain things in multiple ways and tie everything together for maximum clarity.  He is enjoyable to listen to, and he often cracks jokes about how boring and redundant the material can be.  Highly recommend taking him, he is incredibly fair.

Koenig is the man! Going to his lectures and doing the homework he assigns ensures you will get a good grade, as long as you're taking the time to actually understand the subject material. He is obviously very intelligent and passionate about the subject, along with having a pretty corny and quirky sense of humor. Would definitely take again.

It sounds like he is a pretty good professor for other classes, but do NOT take him for Math 2174! Averages were way lower than other section and he taught everything very abstractly with proofs and theory. Managed to do okay on the first couple of tests but the final (worth 40%) was BRUTAL!!

Math 2153: 3 exams and a Final. No homework ect. to buffer grade. However, GREAT professor. Explains things in multiple ways for all types learners. Skips a lot of material from textbook. Exams are not necessarily easy, but very straight forward/not tricky. If you mess up an exam you kinda screwed. Tip: review chapter before attending its lecture.

Nothing out of the ordinary.  He wasn't a super great professor, but he wasn't a bad one either.  At times it seems as if he is moving a little fast and other times it's the right speed.  If you pay attention and do the homework, you'll be fine.
Great professor, definitely recommend, very fair.  Class is structured to help you get a good grade.  If you show up, ask for help, and participate he will help you grade wise.

He's very shy and awkward. He's a pretty good lecturer and helpful one on one. However his tests are unfair. Half the test is multiple choice with no partial credit. So while the other 2177 classes are getting As your getting low Bs.

Probably the best thing about Prof. Koenig is that he is very down to earth and not caught up in particulars. He likes to joke around in class and show what he thinks are the more "fun" proofs of calculus. He is also very very good at the math, so he can always fall back on his thorough understanding of the topic to help you more

I love this guy. He's got a corny sense of humor that helps makes lectures enjoyable, and he really knows and portrays the subject matter well. He can digress from the material in class, but he always covers each subject thoroughly and is very straightforward about what you need to know. Try to get him if you have the chance, you won't regret it.

Koenig talks quietly in lecture so sit in front.  Exams are very straight forward.  Homeworks every week are very helpful (utilize MSLC or office hours).  Textbook is good.  Lectures are not super helpful.  He gives problems without really explaining the concept.  I learned more in recitation and at the MSLC.
Great Prof. Talks quietly so sit in the front. Very fair.
He is very fair in his class. If you come to class and put in the time with the homework, it is an easy class. If you don't the class can be difficult. His exams are more than fair.

The class itself is extremely difficult.  Professor Koenig made the material slightly interesting, but over all the class was boring.  His midterms were more than fair, if not slightly easy.  Final was harder than anticipated, but he made it open note.

Very intelligent math teacher/lecturer. There aren't any troubling faults in his methods. He has the occasional awkward one-liner (which helps lightens the mood during an intense lecture on triple integrals) and he is very clear and concise with what he is teaching.
