Dr. Koenig was very helpful and a very clear and concise instructor. I have taken several math classes at OSU, and so far he is definitely the best one I have ever had. The only terrible thing about the class is the final. It is multiple choice (with choices A through F) and you get no points for partial credit.
He's pretty easy if you show up to class. Doing the homework is 25% and he usually gives a bonus on every test and quiz. Plus he loves math and he definitely shows it.

Overall, Prof. Koenig is an excellent teacher. His tests are very fair and he is very helpful in office hours. His only drawback is his soft voice (but you can hear him fine sitting in the first few rows). I was disappointed to learn that he will not be teaching 263 this quarter.
Very passionate professor, and interesting/entertaining lecturer. Course was very hard though.
Best of the possible teachers. All the other classes had midterm averages in the 20s. Exams are fair and straight forward. Take him if you can!

If you get this guy you got a gym. Be ready for a blast of mathmatical computation with a fun adventure of humor. He made class fun and was very helpful to students. If you want know your stuff take him. Quizzes and Test are easy if you memorize notes and do homework. Final is rough but is do able. The best math teacher I've had thus far.
Amazing teacher!! His jokes are sometimes kinda corny, but it keeps series and parametric curves worth staying awake for.

Amazing professor. Lectures were often confusing (and cold) and were sometimes hard to apply to the homework. However, the midterms were very straightforward and fair. The final also wasn't bad. Overall, he was a good professor. Just don't get freaked out if you don't understand the lecture - you'll still be able to figure out the homework.

Koenig is an exemplary math professor. He has a knack for explaining things in a manner that is not overly complex and confusing, but also not so simple as to prevent a complete understanding. He was, ultimately, one of the best professors I have had at OSU, without a doubt.

His lectures move fast but he writes everything on the board so it is easy to follow. Even if you don't really follow the lecture, when you get to the homework you realize that you actually did learn something.

Fun professor, keeps class pretty interesting, and he writes everything he says on the board in a way thats easy to keep up with but not so slow you get bored.  Tests are straight-forward and if you've done the homework or watched his in-class examples you won't have a problem.  Strongly recommended.
Nice guy, geeky but somewhat humerous jokes...makes class worth going to, very straightforward with material presented and exams...definitely would take his class again

He was difficult to get used to at first, and his assignments are relatively challenging.  HOWEVER, if you go to his office hours, he is extremely helpful, and he even hosted office hours to help with the take-home portions of his exam.  He's a funny and geeky guy, but his class was pretty enjoyable.  I'd take another class of his any day.

Koenig is a good teacher and a really nice person. His homework assignments are not time consuming, but they reinforce the material and are nicely weighted and if you do them the midterms and final aren't bad. He honestly cares about his students and wants you to do well - he curves generously and gives take-home portions of the tests. Great class.

VERY GOOD PROFESSOR! Class was fairly graded and the exams and quizzes are almost identical to the examples given in class, bonus questions on quizzes and exams.  Homework is very heavily weighted but do it and the exam grades will come easy.  The only qualm I have is that our final was multiple choice with six answer choices a piece.

Excellent professor!  His math jokes spice up lecture.  Homework assignments are reasonable, and tests are very similar.  Generally a fairly easy class, except kinda fast paced and most of the proofs are pretty challenging.  Take it with Koenig, you won't regret it!
funny,helpful,somewhat looks like 'peter parker' geek type

It is refreshing to be taught by someone who speaks clearly and teaches well. Plus, his midterms aren't made to screw you over. AND he curves the final grade really nicely. He's a nice guy. I'd take him for the rest of my math classes, if I could.
Difficult course, but very clear and helpful. Spoke clearly and was a good lecturer. Pretty tough final though, as well as heavily weighted homeworks and quizzes.
Great professor, teaches well, and really cares about how his students do in the class. Midterms are straightforward and based on the homework.
Very intresting lectures. Humorous. Very cool guy and helpful! Check out his shoes if you have him! :)
Helpful guy, is concerned about the students. Funny in lecture, quizzes and homework are average. Midterms were fair, but watch out for the fastball final..I'd take him again.

He was my best math teacher I've ever had.  He has the most amazing choice of shoes and makes funny comments in class.  Although i think he's a straight up gangsta when it comes to the mathematics but his final is no joke.  Nonetheless, it was a pleasure to be in his presence during class.I love him
The course was challenging. He sometimes has a hard time amplifying his voice enough. He teaches a good class and is an average teacher.
Nice guy, wants students to do well and is helpful. Midterms are fair and quizzes and homeworks aren't bad.
pretty straight forward quizzes, midterms, final.  Pretty much lets you know what kind of problems to expect.  I'd take this guy again.

As several other students have noted, it helps to possess a vocabulary that would make the ETS blush (or at least one that can get you a 700+ on the SAT Verbal).  Nevertheless, very knowledgeable but often finishes examples all the way through even though the students should already know how to do s

Seems to be one of the best for 254 that I've heard of but the vocabulary used in leacture can remind me of an English class. Tries to make things pretty straight forward about what will be on exams and seems to care about you doing well.

He's a good professor.  However, he uses vocabulary in lecture that will confuse you unless you already have a PhD in Math.  But his exams aren't bad and they don't stray too far from his HW.  Plus he really wants his students to do well.

Hilarious and geeky guy. Lectures are very confusing, but the homework helps you learn the material and pass the exams. My only complaint was the final that was weighted 50% of the class grade (he dropped the last midterm and its 30% average)

He is a very nice guy, and when you go to his office hours, he helps you out a lot. His examples sometimes help on the homework, but not for a whole lot of problems.  He is a really nice guy, but it is true, he does mumble when he gives lectures sometimes, but If u pay attention, you should be fine

Its sometimes difficult to follow what he talks about during lecture, but he does lots of examples.  Just do all the HW because the questions he asks on exams are very similar.  The exams were easy and an A in the class isn't that hard.
This professor is horrible. He speaks way too softly, doesn't explain anything, and writes extremely small on the board so nothing can be read. All in all, a terrible teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Derdzinski's teaching is widely criticized, with students finding his lectures unhelpful and his exams challenging, particularly the final, which carries significant weight. Many students recommend supplementing his lectures with external resources due to his disorganized teaching style and poor organization. Additionally, several students reported issues with grading and felt they received lower grades than deserved, leading many to drop the class or retake it.
summary_comment_short: Professor Derdzinski is widely regarded as a challenging instructor whose lectures are difficult to follow and not particularly helpful for learning. Students find his exams to be a significant portion of their grade and often require specific tricks to perform well, with many reporting poor exam averages and a lack of support from the professor.

Ratings.comment: Lectures suck but for tests he sends out an email with the topics that are going to be on it and generally sticks to what he says so if u study tests aren't that bad. But final is most of the grade which is annoying and he is not helpful in emails or anything

This is the worst professor I have taken in my entire college career. His lessons follow no structure, he is unorganized, and there is zero chance anyone can follow what he writes on the board. He is EXTREMELY bad at arithmetic, which resulted in errors in nearly every calculation he did. As someone who pays for college themselves, WASTE OF MONEY.

I know many students didn't love Prof. Derdzinski, but if you attend lectures (even if you don't) and stay up to date with the syllabus and the topics covered per week- you will be just fine. I really recommend watching tons of YouTube videos for many chapters as he doesn't necessarily go over things again and again, but I enjoyed his class a lot.

Your entire grade basically comes down to how you do on the exams, which often require either remembering or having previously learned some trick to simplify the problem. Each problem missed results in a sizable penalty to final grade. Exam averages were well below passing, and no curve was applied to exams or final grades.

I would not recommend Professor Derdzinski. I looked at these reviews prior to taking his class and decided to take a chance on him, but I really should not have. I have never once dropped a professor, but I really wish I did in this case. His exam averages are well below passing grades (yes, well below a C-). Please do not take this class.

It says I got a C-, but I should have gotten a B, because he completely forgot to put in my midterm 1 score. When I asked him to input the score, he told me that he did not have the test records. However, even though I took the test, he refused to give me anything but a 0 on that test, causing my entire grade to drop from a theoretical 81 to a 66.

So much to say with so little room.
He is living proof that SEIs do nothing. The horrible ratings here are completely true. DROP HIM IF YOU HAVE HIM. I am retaking this class and there are at least 4 (out of about 24) students retaking this class in my section because of him. He does not follow the textbook and his exams do not follow the lecture

If you have him as your instructor, DROP THAT CLASS! He doesn't post notes online. He doesn't do a good job explaining in class. Reading the provided book is more reliable than his teaching. He got mad at me when I asked for help at office hours. Many students failed his exams. Many even tried to get the math department to do something about this.

Avoid this guy at all costs, drop the class for the semester, get a different professor, literally anything but this section. Nonsensical math vomit lectures brushing off advanced topics as "arbitrary" and ridiculous grader. Uninterested in answering questions or helping students. Class average of 62 right now. Keep the D off your transcript.

He is impossible to understand during class and does not take questions. He is rude and uncaring during office hours. I read the entire book and still got a 50 on the exam. (Higher than the class average of 40, though.) He grades extremely harshly, one small mistake and you get a fourth of the credit on the question, each exam is only 4 questions.

Yeah, I read these reviews and tried giving him a shot to see for myself. I mean, he can't be that bad, especially 'cause he has some good reviews, right? Yeah, no. He is truly that bad lol. I delayed my math curriculum just to drop his class. Rather that than a D in a class that doesn't give curves or use any technology.

This guy sucks. He never actually teaches, he just tells. I can tell that he's so smart and knows what he's talking about but he expects you to be on the same level as him. He starts by teaching chapter 5 and expects you to know everything else. He hated the entire class for asking questions and got mad when we were confused about his content.

Classes are punctual and completely non-interactive. Professor will arrive the minute class starts, write as many proofs as they can on the board without turning to face the class or ask if anyone has questions until the last five minutes, but only to see the exact second they can leave. Exam means were 50%'s with no curve. Avoid them at all costs.
One of the worst professors I have ever had, avoid at any cost.

One positive is that he does not assign much homework. His lectures are dry and he does not seem very friendly. He never responded to emails and was extremely hard to reach outside of class. You can tell that he is a very smart guy and has a deep understanding of mathematics, but that does not translate into his lectures. Good luck if you have him.

Definitely a very smart man. However, it's difficult to understand him. I gave up on in-person classes and watched his youtube recordings instead because I kept needing to go back & repeat. His exams are only 4 questions with short answers; barely any partial credit. So if you're smart and prepared but just don't know one thing, get ready for a C.
I never really understood how he graded and never did corrections on paper.

You basically have to teach yourself class. He's very hard to understand and teaches in a way that is confusing and makes no sense. He will rarely teach the material on the exam and doesn't even test you on the stuff in the study guide. I honestly don't know how he's still teaching here.

Professor Derdzinski is a genius person. He cares about students in office hours. His lectures are dry and long, but if you review textbooks before exams, it will be an easy A. Tests are heavy but very straightforward. There is not many homework per week.

Smart man, poor professor. Lectures were recordings on Youtube with no editing to remove mistakes and long, stammering pauses. Jumped around between topics with no clear connections given between them and explanations were poor at best. I only passed because the book is decent and TheMathCoach and Faculty of Kahn on Youtube helped immensely.

Honestly a little misunderstood on here so far I think. He really is a great guy and absolutely brilliant. Read the section in the 'textbook' before class and it helps your understanding a lot. He goes a little too fast sometimes but he really knows what he's talking about. Unbelievably tough grader.
Nice handsome fellow trying to make people smarter day by day. Easy A.

Good professor in my opinion. 3 homework problems per week and every lecture starts pretty much on time without any sort of small talk. He is very specific on the board when he is talking and makes things clear through his writing (although it is very mathematical writing). He doesn't remind you to do your homework (but it's due every Monday).

Andrzej is amazing at explaining the content of this course in a thorough and easy to understand way. He goes a bit fast but not so fast that it's impossible to keep up with. Midterms are fairly easy and the course load is dealable with. Make sure you read the textbook alongside or even before the lecture.

The worst professor I have ever had. Yeah, I mean it. He is obviously very smart, But he makes every single thing complicated and just talks to student in his way. I basically learn stuff by myself for whole semester. In addition, he graded heavily on exams while every exam has only 4-6 questions. If you miss one, you are screwed.

Great mathematician. Loves imparting his knowledge to eager students. Loves proofs. Office hours are quite good if you walk in with specific questions and are willing to put in the effort to understand what he says. Note that he doesn't like dumbing down ideas. He's a purist so don't take his class unless you love math and like a challenge.

Professor Derdzinski, while a brilliant mathematician, is simply a terrible teacher. He speaks directly into the board while lecturing, never stopping for input from students. If he stays on topic in lecture, it's a miracle - he flies through proofs without explaining any concepts. Midterms were 4 questions each, final was 6. Don't take his class.

The guy very obviously is versed at what he teaches, but is pretty bad when it comes to actually transferring the information. Tests are few, weighty, and there is basically no partial credit (we had a group of ten students approach him on this matter, only to get a short and rude response). If you learn from practical examples, AVOID.

Complains about how the textbook was written, but fails to explain the material clearly himself. Lectures do not prepare you for the quizzes or the exams, so be prepared to read the book and try to solve every problems. Very general explanations about the topics, but will require more knowledge on the exams, even for simple problems.

If you choose to attend his lectures you will more than likely end up staring into space or sitting on your phone more than taking notes. He does not clearly and efficiently go over the topics that are on the tests in class and during recitation he discusses random topics that will never be needed. Basically you will teach yourself the course.

Well-organized prof. tried to cover everything in complex analysis but only tested on major topics so don't get panic if you cant't follow in the lecture.  will post topic(s) before every examquiz and they are fair if you review notes, read textbook(very important) and do the practice problems he suggested. he is fair and wants you to do well!
Excellent professor ... highly recommend.

He makes many mistakes during his lectures so taking notes becomes pointless. Test and quizzes all boil down to remembering some "trick" or be punished with lots of algebra. Sometimes, he will place a restriction on the way you can solve problems - thus forcing you to try and figure out the "trick" or get zero credit. Horrible.

He is the worst instructor I have ever had at OSU and it's not even close. More than half the class dropped when I took the class Autumn 2014. The answers and help he provides to students in office hours is inconsistent with how this mysterious graduate TA graded. Dropped my math minor because of him. DO NOT take this class under any circumstances.

Quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had in my entire educational career. Lectures are abstract and worthless. No solutions are available for any of the practice problems, so you have no idea if you are doing anything right ever. Tests are very short and partial credit is non existent. Avoid if you don't want to take the class twice.

Quizzes and tests were very easy in retrospect. Although, you really have to do the homework problems because his lectures are almost completely abstract and proof-oriented. If you mess up, it's not likely you'll get a lot of partial credit...  You can tell this guy is a genius, it's not a surprise he doesn't want to be in that room.

Second midterm average was a 39 and he didn't curve. He also refused to help the students. With three weeks to go, the entire class went to the math department and requested to switch sections and things were so bad that they let us do that. Do NOT take his class!
Derdzinski is by far, the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. He is of no help and he is the most ridiculous grader I have ever had. Studying is of no avail in this course.

Listen, I read these reviews before I took the class, but I found a few redeeming ones so I chanced it.  90% of people here say he goes into class, talks really fast at the board, and runs away after it's over, and that's the TRUTH!!!  I could go on about how terribly he conducted our course, but I don't have room.

Quizzes and tests were fair, although you have to be careful not to make mistakes. Homework was very light. His teaching was passable, although I skipped a lot. Easy class if you read the book and do the homework.

This guy is your standard foreign teacher. His lectures are difficult to understand.  Shows up late for every class, and exams. His exams are fair.  The first one was hard, but the second was very easy. Final was fair. His exams consist of very few problems, and he gives aweful partial credit.  Without a good ta, this class will be difficult.

Derdzinkski marches rapidly through proofs, and it's very easy to get lost.  I often can't make sense of my notes when I look at them after class because he goes pretty fast and doesn't write every important step down.  In addition, he seems a bit resistant to helping during office hours.  He covers more material than other sections.  Avoid!

Like several before have said, he is late to class and then the first one to leave.  He talks continuously to the board, without giving a second for students to think through each step.  He is extremely unhelpful, in class and in office hours; he just re-reads the question back to you.  I would not have him as a professor again.

Andrzej is a brilliant (slightly scatter-brained) man.  If you ask him questions in his office, he is quite nice and helpful.  His lectures can be hard to follow in real time, but if you review your notes, you will find that you can learn a lot from him.  His tests and grades are fair. With a little bit of effort, you will be lucky to have had him.

Horrible teacher yet extremely intelligent. Most lectures were way to advanced for students in the class. I went to every lecture (don't know why), because I am making myself teach the material. Without a good TA, I would be more lost than I already am. If anyway possible-AVOID
Horrible!!! This guy just eats math books, comes to class, and spits it all out really fast. Doesnt realize other people are actually in the room. Totally awful lecture.
makes things harder than they r, way to fast, jumps around way to much
This man speaks to the board, rushes through examples, never prepares, somehow manages to cover neither theory nor applications adequately, is horribly unsightly and should be avoided at all costs.

Teaches more theory than most engineers could handle, which is the source of most complaints here. Linear algebra background helps for dif eq. (period) Extremely unorganized. He chose a worthless textbook. Easy class, easy exams if you read carefully.
Not a very good teacher.  I suggest making bets on which tee shirt he wears each day.  That was my only   enjoyable part of the class
Horrible Teacher.  Comes in late, talks to the board, doesn't seem to care if you succeed or fail.  Seems to try as hard as he can to trick you on tests.  Definitley run the other way from him.

Always late, late for final. Always wore the same clothes. Found ducks in lake were more interesting. So unclear. Told us something WAS NOT going to be on final, then reviewed it and said we would need it to solve a problem..yup. Final was not as expected. Namely: crazy!

He is not a good professor but he should work for Nasa or something.  You cannot approach him to ask questions because he is late to class and is the first one out of the classroom.  If you take his class I would recommend attending every recitation, to understand what is going on.
No Comments

This guy is somewhat unorganized, but overall, I believe he is a good teacher.  He knows his subject matter, but doesn't explain it the best ways to typical students.  He speaks to the class like they're getting their PH.d.  He tells you what is going to be on tests and is a lenient grader.
This guy is awful.  He takes what should be an easy class and makes it way too unclear and confusing.  Stay away from him.
Anyone who complains about this guy is just plain lazy.  He tells you what is on the tests, gives good examples and his final grades are way nice.
This professor was horrible, I learned nothing from him. I would advise people not to take his class.

A math genius, but imagine a physics student getting lectured by einstien (in german). tough to understand, but practise tests were helpful. I had to retake, as did several friends. It is very easy to cheat if you sit in the back of class (still got a D).

Terrible teacher.  Too smart to teach.  The only way he was helpful is because so many people complained that he now gives practice tests.  He got behind and decided not to teach things that we needed to know for later.  Don't take him.

summary_comment: Professor Tian is highly regarded for his thorough lecture notes and generous grading curve, though his in-person lectures are sometimes difficult to follow due to mumbling. His exams are challenging and often include unexpected elements, but the homework and practice problems provided are helpful. Students appreciate his supportiveness and the fact that the final exam is generally easier than the midterm.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tian is an effective teacher who posts detailed lecture notes online, making up for his unclear spoken lectures. His exams are challenging and often include unexpected elements, but he applies a generous curve, allowing students to achieve higher grades with satisfactory performance.

Ratings.comment: Lots of mumbling in lectures, but posts his exact lecture notes onto carmen. I went to one in person and then taught myself the rest instead because I couldn't really understand him. Practice problems were helpful. Exams were challenging and often had twists that we hadn't seen before. Couple percent curve at the end of the class which was nice.

do not trust his sample problems. The sample problems he provides before all the tests are incredibly misleading and much easier than the exams themselves. beginning of the semester was okay but his notes progressively get worse especially when you get to PDEs. if you are eng, just take engineering math. Also he is NOT consistent with his notation

FRT is a professor who can choose without thinking. Although his lecture does not record attendance, it is very useful. The mid-term exam is quite tricky, while the final exam is very simple; the curve is very generous!
Excellent professor! If you want to learn linear algebra and get a good grade, choose Mr. Tian and you will never regret!
Good guy. Listening to his lecture is useful. Curve is generous. The final is simpler than midterm.

Mr. Tian is nice. He takes care of students. The lecture speaking is with accent but understandable. The homework and midterm are difficult, but the final is easy. The only drawback is test heavy, 35% midterm and 45% final for summer. The curve is generous, we can get A or A- with not lower than 80, and get B- or B or B+ with not lower than 62.

Mr. Tian is the best linear algebra professor at OSU. Go to his lecture, and you will learn a lot. The tests are heavy (Midterm 35% and Final 45%). However, the curve is generous, 87 -- A, 80 -- A-, 72 -- B+, 66 -- B

Very rare good professor in OSU who teaches linear algebra are recommended for students who genuinely want to learn linear algebra, and the grade curves a lot: 87-100 A; 80-86.99 A-; 72-79.99 B+; 66-73.99 B; 62-65.99 B-; 57-61.99 C+; 53-56.99 C; 49-52.99 C-; 46-48.99 D+; 40-45.99 D; 0-39.99 E.

FRT is wonderful. He explains the concepts clearly with appropriate example. The homework and midterm exam are a little difficult, but the final exam is very simple, which is enough to save the total grade. The only drawback is test heavy, the homework is 20%, midterm is 35%, and final is 45%.

I was surprised by good ratings. He is a good professor, but he focuses on problem-solving techniques without the underlying concepts. If you are taking this class to gain a understanding of ML, it may not be helpful. Be prepared to study for exams while also completing homework assignments that have the same due date as the exam.

Good professor, good lectures, difficult homework, difficult exams (but easier than homework), and big curve! Suitable for students who truly want to learn linear algebra (the lectures are amazing) and only aim to pass (the lowest possible grade is C-)!

Professor Tian's teaching ability is powerful. Although he has a strong accent, he and I are both Chinese, so he let me listen to his class without a language barrier. His notes are also prominent; although it is not mandatory to hand out lecture notes in the lecture, his lectures are worth listening to!

If you are sitting in the front row, you won't hear him much (accent and constant mumbling). Homework and exam practice was useless for the actual exams, you have to do a lot of studying on your own outside of the material he gives you. I'm not sure I learned a lot from him.
Professor does not pay attention to rampant cheating during exams. Homework questions are next to useless, as exam questions tend to be much harder and much different.

He has clear notes in Carmen and does not require any attendance. It might be hard to hear him clearly in class so I suppose the best way to pass this course is to study the notes by yourself.
He will give you sample questions before each midterm and final. He also allows students to bring cheat sheet, which will be of great help. 
Easy A.

FRT is one of the Math Department's best! He is extremely knowledgeable about the course content and can  break anything down to your level when you ask him questions. His homework is straightforward and exams were fair but somewhat difficult. The curve at the end of the class was also generous. He is a little soft spoken, making him hard to hear.

Sometimes hard to understand what he says. He really knows his stuff; he answers questions well. Our tests had true/false problems that are each worth 4%; missing a couple questions can result in a much lower grade. Curve is class dependent; our curve was one letter grade i.e. 89 is an A-, 90 is an A.
Interesting course content. If you really understand the lecture, you will learn a lot.

Mumbles/hard to understand in lecture. But he cares a lot so if u didn't understand something just ask after class.
Huge curve. 74 -> B. 89 -> A. 
Exams almost exactly like the sample exams + he goes over the solutions for the sample exams. Sometimes a curveball question or a proof. Fair grader, lots of partial even for silly mistakes.

His lectures are a bit dry but he provides detailed notes to follow the material. Exams are more than fair, with averages in the mid-to-high B range. Overall, a solid choice for a class that is very professor-dependent.

Just a warning that he doesn't use a carmen page or email you your grades so you have to be very careful when collecting back your HW and MT's. Other than that though he's very laid back and curves individual assignments, so as long as you're not lost in his lectures and do the HW yourself you should do well in his class.

Good professor. While he may be hard to understand because he mumbles/his accent, he makes up for it with great notes. In addition, he provides practice problems for each test, and the exam problems are very similar. Very nice grader. Does not take off too much for silly math mistakes. You'll do fine as long as you understand the concepts.

The Notorious F.R.T.'s class was confusing but good. Not particularly hard, and the midterms and the finals were fair. He does not give anything lower than a C, and he pulls problems from the practice problems for the final. Use Chegg for homework.

He is a good teacher and does lots of helpful examples to make sure to understand the concept. The course can sometimes be very mechanical so at times you have to ask him questions if you want to understand things intuitively and conceptually. But, he's an excellent teacher and knows his stuff inside out.

Dr. Tian is an awesome professor. He was great at explaining concepts and giving lots of examples to help reinforce them. Do the homework and make sure you understand the concepts and the exams will be fine. Go to class and participate. Great guy

He's really hard to understand, and basically just reads from the book. He also never gives any big picture ideas; he just jumps into an example from another page. This class is a very easy, simple take on some very complex subjects, but without adequate effort it can be extremely hard. Don't underestimate this class, and don't rely on Prof. Tian
He is obviously a smart guy, but he is not a great instructor. It is hard to understand him, he doesn't explain what he's doing when he's doing it, and the only grades are 3 midterms and the final
the man can barely speak english

Overall not a good experience, but neither are many math professors at OSU. Mumbled a lot, so it's hard to hear him. Showed procedures on examples, but doesn't explain the why part well. Found that lectures only helped me when reviewing things I already knew, so I learned a lot of the class from the book. And at chapter 6, the book gets unclear.

He knows his stuff but isn't very clear in communicating it.  Beyond just having a thick accent, he mumbled and didn't talk very loudly during lecture.  He gives fair tests and homework isn't that bad.  You have to push him at times to explain some topics since he'll just go off book examples.

Great prof. Clear in explaining concepts and examples. The exams are straightforward and not that hard. You can always do most of the problems as long as you attend class regularly and take notes. Highly recommend

Straightforward class. Exams are 80% straight from the book, 20% very difficult, so averages are around an 85. Formula sheets allowed for midterm and final. Seems to be a curve in the class but he didn't share the final grade nor did he activate carmen.

Dr Tian is a G, he teachin da class fo real mang. Except he got that chinese scar face look on him though. Still teachin it like Dr Dre schoolin em fools out there. Got him for 513 and 514, take his class and u fly like a G6

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra for Engineering Graduate Students

summary_comment: Professor Chmutov is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and accessibility. Students find his lectures clear and informative, with homework that typically takes around three hours per week. While the course is exam-heavy, tests are generally easier than homework, and he provides comprehensive lecture recordings and notes to aid in understanding and review.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chmutov is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and clear explanations, making complex concepts accessible. Students appreciate his detailed notes, recorded lectures, and responsive communication, though some found the homework time-consuming and the class exam-heavy.

Ratings.comment: Great lectures, answers questions very well through out lecture. Homework took max like 3 hours a week. Somehow the tests were even easier than the homework. Overall, cool professor.

Dr. Chmutov taught linear, examples in class were similar problems inhomework. Class is 80% tests but  easier than hw so just make sure you understand the problems/ concepts. He records lectures and posts all notes on carmen. Very helpful when reviewing. The TB you will need to buy or find online, it will have hw answers always! Responds to emails!
Exam heavy course, however, the exams were easier than expected.  Lectures weren't very engaging however were informative and based on the exams.  Homework every week was a bit time consuming.

best teacher for linear algebra, teaches the content really well and makes it easy to understand, all exams had an average of a 90% so as long as you pay attention and do the homework you will be good

Excellent Prof, always cares about you and reply email quickly (I got the response within 8 hours for several time). Provide detailed and useful notes. PDE is pretty difficulty but if you read the material and attend his class, you will be fine. Prof Chmutov is a fair person and sees your progress. You will never fail if you do study and spend time

I learned so much from this professor and he makes the concepts easy to understand. If you put effort into each question on a test/homework, you'll at least get some points for it. My only complaint is that whoever the grader was for my homework was not helpful at all. Instead of circling where I went wrong, they would just write "no" on my answer.

Great professor! Very nice and great at teaching, he made complicated concepts simpler and understandable. He showed many examples in class, taught at a good pace. Exams and homework were reasonable. Overall, I really recommend taking any classes from him!

Hands down the best professor I have ever had. He records every lecture and posts it after class. He is always accessible and actually cares if you understand the material. His office hours help so much and he will allow you to check homeworks. I honestly can't tell if the class was hard because he did such an amazing job teaching it.

Textbook used, but not needed, screenshots were given. Teacher was good, but hard to understand, making hard to want to attend class. Homeworks due every wednesday, not horrible. Study guide was minimal, saying to do x problem in textbook, no solutions given. Midterms were much easier than homeworks and studyguide.

He is the best professor I had at OSU. His notes are very good.His first midterm focuses on the stuff that you just took.He should teach other professors how to teach.HWs were 33.3% first midterm 33.3% final 33.3%.You should definitely take him.
I had him a year ago and he was a great professor. Pretty easy as long as you pay attention in class. Pretty easy midterm and final as long as you know a little bit from your previous math classes.

He isn’t only a nice person, but also a very knowledgeable and fair instructor. He is one of the best professors I have ever had. Lots of homework but very fair and he grades very fair. Highly recommended.

summary_comment: Professor Taylor provides clear lectures that effectively prepare students for exams and homework, with content closely aligned between the two. Her classes, particularly in linear algebra, are challenging but rewarding, moving quickly and requiring effort, especially for those new to proof-based mathematics. While she occasionally ignores the OSU academic calendar, her accessibility outside of class and willingness to address student questions via email make her a strong instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Taylor's lectures were clear and effectively prepared students for exams and homework, though her responsiveness to emails was inconsistent for an online class. She excelled in teaching linear algebra, providing thorough explanations and addressing common student questions, but did not adhere to the university's break schedule for assignments.

Ratings.comment: Lectures were clear and prepped you well for the exams and the homework (exams were pretty similar to homework content). We had a homework and several lectures to watch every week, including over breaks. She wasn't great at responding to emails all the time, which is rough for an online class.

Linear Algebra Asynch. Lectures are great -- clearly has experience teaching L.A. -- in recorded lectures, is proactive in answering questions she knows students commonly have. Does excellent job walking through problems. Is accessible outside of class. Only drawback is she ignored OSU calendar (e.g., regular lectures and homeworks during breaks).

I enjoyed the semester I had professor Taylor, but this class is definitely not an easy A kind of class. It moved quickly and was difficult, especially if it was your first time learning to write proofs. But, she would frequently give help via e-mail and address questions asked in class and the mentors were also very accessible. You will learn lots

summary_comment: Professor Stenzel is highly regarded for his dedication to student success and clear explanations, with many students praising his knowledgeable and caring approach. His lectures are described as engaging and effective, focusing on problem-solving rather than rote slides. Students appreciate his availability and willingness to help, though some find his teaching style less structured, which requires additional self-study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stenzel is highly regarded for his caring nature and effective teaching methods, with students praising his clear explanations, fairness in assessments, and willingness to help. His lectures are known for their clarity and practical approach through problem-solving, though some find them occasionally tangential.

Ratings.comment: Stenzel cares about his students, and his lectures are great. All of the assessments were fair. Wish I could take the class again!
Took him for 2415. Amazing professor. Will answer any of your questions. Weekly Homeworks. If you ask for help he will pretty much give you the answer.

Stenzel is one of the nicest professors you will ever have. You can tell he is very knowledgeable about what he is teaching and cares so much about his students. Just pay attention and you'll do fine in the class.

Professor Stenzel is a great instructor and cares for his students' success. His lectures are very straightforward and involve explaining concepts by working through problems, an approach that is in my opinion much better than slide lectures. Grade is mostly exams and weekly quizzes. Exams problems aren't too complex.
Matthew Stenzel is a great professor! He is super friendly and caring. He answers questions clearly in class and explains the material well. I highly recommend him!

Dr. Stenzel is one of the most caring and enthusiastic math professors that I have had. It's plain to see that math is his passion, and he translates that well into his lectures. He quickly corrects any errors that come to his attention, and answers all questions clearly and concisely.

Professor was great at math but not good at teaching it. Be ready to teach yourself basically. In class he went off on tangents randomly. It was hard not to put my attention anywhere else but him. Great guy though, just maybe not the best at what hes doing.

summary_comment: Professor Han Veiga is widely regarded as one of the worst teachers due to her illegible lecture notes, which she failed to correct despite students' frequent requests. This made the class extremely challenging for maintaining a good grade. Given her poor teaching quality, she should not be teaching.
summary_comment_short: Professor Han Veiga is widely regarded as one of the worst teachers due to her illegible lecture notes, which she failed to improve despite students' questions. Her classes are extremely challenging for maintaining a good grade, leading many to conclude she should not be teaching.

Ratings.comment: Probably the worst teacher I ever had. The whole class was based on her lecture notes, which were not legible. Students would ask what her handwriting said, and she would laugh, say "oops," and not fix it. I think a toddler could use carmen canvas better than her. Very hard class to keep a good grade in. Should not be teaching!

summary_comment: Professor Broaddus is widely regarded as having poor teaching skills, with lectures described as unorganized and difficult to follow. Students consistently report low exam scores and find the final exam particularly challenging, despite variations in the difficulty of intermediate exams. Many advise against taking his course, citing issues with feedback and a lack of effective support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Broaddus is widely regarded as a poor lecturer, known for being unorganized and covering only the basics of linear algebra, yet assigning deeply complex problems. Students find his exams challenging and grading to be harsh, with many warning that his class is not suitable for those seeking a thorough understanding of the subject.

Ratings.comment: This might have been the worst experience I've ever had in any class. Most people did very poorly on exam 1, so he made exam 2 easier. Then he made the final the most difficult exam which is worth 40% of your grade. Very bad lecturer, very unorganized, teaches the barebones of lin alg and then makes questions very deep and complex.

Although his lectures are not as poor as the general opinion states here, a lack of proper feedback on homework and exams make learning from mistakes nearly impossible. When I asked him a question about a homework problem marked incorrect, I was told to go back and look at the chapter the homework came from. Would not take again.

Worst prof ever...Himself doesn't even know what he is teaching...Stopped explaining a few times in lecture just for understanding his own slides.  Everything is copied and pasted from textbook, so learn from textbook folks...Grading is not generous, exam time is only 55 minutes. DON'T TAKE HIM

Am a CSE student with a 4.00 GPA and this class is just not reasonable with this prof. Lectures are awful and the dude seems to lose track of his thought and ramble every 10 seconds. Am hoping for a curve. Unfortunately, I think only reason dude is still around is because he has impressive graduate degrees but probably should stick to research.
Taught realllllly bad and I couldn't figure out what he is talking about..... Don't take his course.

I had to learn on my own in the online 2568 course. The professor didn't care about his students. Online office hours were pointless since he wouldn't discuss homework concepts until scores were released. The median score was a B+. If you want an OK grade for linear algebra, attend his online session. If you really want to learn, do not attend.
Run! If you really want to learn something about linear algebra, go to Fei-Ran Tian's section!!!
Lectures were hard to follow. Midterms and finals were difficult.
If you take notes on his lectures, read the textbook, and are a good student then his class is very doable. Some homework problems are much harder than questions on his tests.

Going into my sophomore year as a chemical engineering student and this class always gives me some funny memories. To be honest, he was probably the worst professor in my experience here. He had extreme difficulty teaching his lectures and was very confusing. Very test heavy. I highly recommend finding a professor that is not him.

I had taken the same math course in China and got an "A-" degree there. The problem is that TAs' grading standards are quite different from each other, and the lecture course is very boring and useless. I only got a "B+" this semester. Are you trying to tell me Asians' math is suck so that I can get "A-" in China but only "B+" in the US???

I was more dependent on my recitation TA and outside tutoring than his lectures. There were times when his lectures were lacking direction so it was hard to follow. Watching the recordings was more useful than attending live, but also, go to tutoring right away and ask questions.

Prof. Broaddus struggled a bit with communicating his thoughts clearly and answering questions, but he made sure to cover all of the relevant concepts in his lectures. The class is very test heavy, reliant on midterms and finals mostly, but there is ample study material for both, and this is mostly up to the math department, not Broaddus.

Professor Broaddus was a poor lecturer, and the material covered in lectures never reflected exam questions. Take the time to learn the material yourself in ximera or watch youtube videos. Best way to study for midterms is to do the practice midterms and figure out how to show your work and explain in the same way he does on the practice midterms

Professor Broaddus didnt teach the best, I had to go on YouTube for a lot of the topics. However, I think the reason calc was hard, even though I took it in high school, was because calc 1151 is a weed out class.

Horrifying experience with Broaddus. I tried studying from his lectures to no avail. I tried taking an exam by studying just his exam prep and his lectures and scored under 30%. He takes weeks to respond to students' emails. Impossible to work with, very hands-off in everything he does. IF THERE IS ANYTHING YOU TAKE FROM THIS, AVOID AT ALL COST!!!
Just not meant to lecture a calc class. Not a great math person but he sure did not help anything. He drags on lectures to the point they are not helping me.

He wastes massive amounts of time in lecture explaining things such as his office hours every single class. The midterms were always things that were harder than or different from the work we were assigned so no matter how much I studied I was never prepared.
Does not explain the content clearly and typically does not get through all of the material in the notes

His lectures were all online and took around the first 10-15 minutes to go over his cover slide and housekeeping items (that didnt need to be repeated every class). He rarely got through all his notes, and I eventually stopped going to lectures and started just reading his notes that he would upload because I couldnt listen to him ramble.

He's difficult to understand, lectures make no sense and he allows students to derail the class. The textbook is on Ximera and the explanations don't make sense there either. If you take his class, expect to heavily use math tutors, YouTube and Khan Academy.

Just a lot of busy work if you ask me. Explanations in lecture aren't the best and he kind of jumps around from going slow in lecture to going quickly and moving onto the next topic. There's a lot of homework if you ask me. The Ximera assignments aren't bad but the Written Homework feels poorly explained. Would not recommend.

So, math 1151 is already hard as it is but this professor did not help the situation at all!!!! You can tell he has no interest in teaching. I re took the class this semester and got a different professor then ended with a B+. Class is hard but with this professor its even worse. Do not take it with him.

Should be a tag saying get ready to teach yourself the course material as this professor is by far the worst I have ever had in all of my years taking math courses. He is very unorganized, often rushing through lectures with little to no supplemental explanation as to how to solve given problems, forcing the student to teach themselves.

He cannot explain concepts to save his life. I stopped attending lectures halfway into the semester and started watching YouTube videos explaining the same concepts and my grade actually went up. The exam averages are always terrible as well. Take this class with anyone but professor Broaddus.

The lectures felt incredibly disorganized. He was rarely able to answer questions during lectures, usually either responding that he doesnt know or by giving a vague and unhelpful answer. For 75% of the lectures, his writing was unreadable even over screen sharing via iPad, and it comes across like he does zero prep and has never taught before.

I only got an A in this class because I took Calc 1 in high school too. Lectures lacked planning & direction to the point where it felt like a waste of time to watch them. People would ask questions about an issue with a test or grade & he would respond in a way indirectly saying "tough!" It felt like he didn't care about students' success at all.

I was so good at calculus in high school and I absolutely loved it! I now hate calculus and am doing very poorly. The fact that Im considering switching my major and might not pursue something I love because of this class is concerning. To make things worse, youre grade is based almost entirely off midterms! This sucks if you have test anxiety :(

He spends an entire 60 minute lecture doing one basic problem and then expects us to be able to do about 8 problems in 40 minutes for the midterm. Also there were 6 midterms which meant we had a midterm every other week. And any week without a midterm we had written homework due. The midterms are nothing like the homework or reviews. No curve.

This was the worst class I have taken so far. During lecture spending 30 minutes on a problem to find out he computed it wrong is worrisome. Lectures were not that relevant to actual material. I felt like he was making up what he was going to say as he went along. Too much writing and not enough practicing of problems.
Terrible lectures makes the material harder than it needs to be when explaining. Had to switch professors because it was an awful experience
Lectures are hard to follow and you cannot read his notes

He teaches like it's his first time. He can't articulate main concepts which makes the homework difficult and time consuming. Final was 40% of the grade, and he doesn't curve. However, he is organized and allows the use of formula sheets in exams.
The lecture is a mess and not well prepared.
Dr. Broaddus posts good notes online for his lectures but does not explain the content very well in lecture.

1161 is a very tough calculus 1 course. Almost all lectures are just introducing new contents. The homework on Carmen is not easy and takes time, and the exam is even tougher. Some times the recitation may be helpful. The grades are curved so you may get a fair grade.

Professor Broaddus is clearly very smart and knows the math well. However, his ability to convey information about the material is limited at best. His lectures are hard to follow and the difficulty of homework rarely matches the caliber of the exams (that is, the exams are far more difficult than any of the homework).

He knows the math very well, but sometimes has difficulty conveying it. He is willing to help whenever you have a question; however, he will not typically go out of his way to make sure you understand the material--thats on you. I love math, so the content was simple for me, but I could easily see how it's confusing for a non-math-oriented thinker.
Class is hard, very unclear

I feel like I would have had a harder time in his Calc 1 class if I hadn't taken it the year prior in high school (so the content was largely review and still fresh-ish in my mind). Had to sit up close to read his handwriting, but if you do that you should be fine as far as legibility goes. Attending lectures isn't mandatory, but recitation is.

This class was interesting and I actually liked Broaddus. He does seem to struggle with communicating his thoughts sometimes however he is very helpful and easy to ask questions. Tests were hard, averages on exams were very low (67 and 58 for midterms, 51 for the final) but its all curved so it doesnt matter. Just do the homework and study

Dr. Broaddus was a good teacher, however, his class was extremely hard. 2 other sections of 345 were being taught with different teachers and ours was always several chapters ahead with much much harder tests. Averages were always in the low 50s. Avoid taking his 345 if you can, not because he is bad, but just because his tests are impossible.
Test material is much more difficult than what is presented in class. I learned much more from my recitation instructor than I did from Broaddus. Try to attend a different lecture time if possible.
Material on tests is much harder than what is taught in class. Good luck.

summary_comment: Professor Banerjee struggles significantly with teaching complex concepts in an accessible manner, often focusing on theorem proofs without adequately explaining them. Students frequently find his lectures confusing and his handwriting illegible, leading many to recommend finding alternative sections or instructors.
summary_comment_short: Professor Banerjee struggles significantly with teaching complex concepts in an accessible manner, often focusing on theorem proofs without adequately explaining them. Students find his lectures confusing and his handwriting illegible, leading many to recommend finding alternative sections or instructors.

Ratings.comment: He's clearly a smart guy but he doesn't know how to teach hard concepts in an easy to understand way. Lectures are just him proving theorems. He tries to get the class to chime in but then everyone stares at him confused because nobody knows what's going on. Very generous curve in the class and he will give points back on homework if you ask him.

He is by FAR the worst professor I've ever had. His handwriting is illegible, gets lost on almost all of his own examples during class, unhelpful in office hours, and is terrible at explaining all the concepts. His examples in class were always way harder/more confusing than was expected of us on the homework and on test. Find a different section.
I've never had a professor like him before
Literally take anyone else other than this guy

Talks much too quietly, handwriting is barely legible at times, and is not the best at staying on topic with the things that we are tested and given homework on. I've heard that there are much much much better professors for this course, please seek them out if given the chance.

I had a very difficult time with this professor. His handwriting is almost illegible, and he often stands in front of the board, blocking the work. He often confuses himself with his own work and is constantly erasing and rewriting things that he later realizes are wrong. He isn't great at answering questions; I'd avoid this professor if possible.

summary_comment: Professor Talamo is highly regarded for his effective teaching and generous extra credit opportunities, making it difficult to fail. However, his classes require significant time commitment, particularly for the team portions of exams and extensive homework, and the course structure can be challenging. Students consistently praise his knowledge and willingness to help, though some find his lectures demanding and the course load intense.
summary_comment_short: Professor Talamo is highly regarded for his effective teaching and generous extra credit opportunities, though his classes require significant time commitment, particularly for the team portions of exams and written homework. His lectures are dense but valuable, and students appreciate his willingness to help and provide feedback, making it challenging but ultimately rewarding to take his course.

Ratings.comment: Jim is a good professor. Take his class if you have the chance. There is extra credit offered on the midterms and separate extra credit later in the semester so take advantage of it. The team portion of tests and the written homework take some time (2-4 hours) so plan accordingly. Jim is a legend.
Nothing to complain about, good structure to the course. Will say the "team" part of the exams are pretty hard, so make sure you get a good group.
simply the goat

He knows what he is talking about but I found it hard to focus in his lectures. There is a lot of homework and the format of Ximera sucks but it is manageable. Exams have so much built in extra-credit and revision opportunities so it is really hard to fail (which is good cause they pretty much make up your entire grade)
He teaches very well - many wish that they had him as their teacher in later math courses.

He's a great professor but the structure of the class (which is his brainchild) is ridiculous. The only way to truly succeed is if you dedicate the majority of your week to learning the content because of the sheer amount of it. You're basically learning Calc 2&3 at a summer semester pace while also trying to balancing the rest of your schedule.

The best professor I have!! Responds to questions fast and is willing to help find groups. The extra credit is given generously, allowing you to earn back half of the missing points on the exam, and also a few points for finishing extra homework. Get yourself a good group and practice the practice exam (really similar to the actual exam).

Goated calc professor, lectures were helpful, although I'm sure you can do well without attending them. You get corrections for the midterms which are a life saver. Written homework and team portion of the midterms can be very very time consuming (~3-4 hours). Exams are very reasonable and are very similar to problems from homework/sample exams
Teacher is great, but the amount of assignments and time commitment this class is, is kind of insane.

Chance to get over a 100% on midterms and finals. I ended with over 100% in the class. Corrections for midterms give half credit back per question. Pretty good lectures but I did not really pay attention I just learned it from homework and recitations. Great guy. Team midterms and written homeworks are time consuming.
Literally and biblically him

Great teacher who makes Math 1172 a lot easier to understand and provides a ton of resources for the class. Unfortunately he is a little bit inaccessible because he is so busy and is lowkey kind of mean if you ask a dumb question or for help sometimes. But he made this class pretty easy and very bearable for Calculus 2.5.
really informative lectures, super helpful and accommodating. offers half credit back on exam corrections, so not a difficult class to get a good grade.

I had late senioritis and got a 46/120 after not trying on the first midterm. I got focused and scored 91 and 88 on the next two midterms and got a good score on the final which got me to pass. Definitely go to lectures and recitations. Do his handouts for every topic really gives you insight for his midterms. Great lecturer and explains thingseasy

Currently in this course, one of my all time favorite professors. He posts so much content for you to use depending on your learning style (lecture vids, online interactive free textbook, guided notes, practice questions & exams) and is a fantastic lecturer. Lectures are optional, but go. Cheat sheets on exams & midterm test corrections is a plus.

Can be extremely biased and has favorites despite what all the other ratings say. Helpful to some but unhelpful to those who he doesn't look highly upon based on his own opinion. Exams are difficult and are usually harder than any practice exam. We had no test corrections but I heard the students now do so i'm not totally sure what that is like.

Makes a hard class easy. Open note, open resource midterms. Content is pretty hard. Online lectures are more helpful than in person ones, but I'd probably get a way better grade if I showed up to class. You can do zoom or in person lectures and you're not restricted to your specific lecture time; you can show up to any lecture he does.

Jim was a great professor. I really enjoyed his online format of the class and that made it easy for me to do the work whenever. All exams are online and open note so getting a good grade is very easy.

Jim is the course coordinator for ENGR Calculus 1172 and he post amazing recorded lectures for students to watch before coming to class. The lectures he makes are super clear and super helpful. I enjoyed 1172 even though it could be challenging at times. He also has an obsession with donuts which is entertaining.
Has a very organized class. If you put in a lot of work, you well 100% do well in the class. He has a strange obsession with donuts but is overall a chill dude and easy to talk to.

This class is set up in a way that your grade is almost entirely a function of your effort. Jim provides countless resources to get to know the material and has revisions on exams for half-credit back. While this class is not easy by any means, you WILL pass if you put in effort.

Jim is kinda cool but this class sucks ass. Like who even puts a midterm the day before spring break. This class is low key pretty easy though. I also don't like Jim's voice that much. He seems kinda fruity low key.

Talamo is a great lecturer! 1172 has a lot of homework, but the class is generally easy to do well in. I took AP Calc AB before this class but I have heard that others who took Calc 1151 instead struggled more in 1172. 50% of ur test grades are take-home with a group, and the other 50% are individual and timed but can be redone for half credit back
He taught a very difficult class in a way that made it manageable. Not memorably good but definitely helps students get through the class
Would never take him again and thank god I don't have to. Class is difficult and he is arrogant and clearly has favorites. Ximera our textbook is horrible and the exams are hard!

Talamo is passionate about math and teaching and it shows. Overall, I felt he did a good job explaining topics. The class is very test heavy, and the tests were difficult, but revisions for up to 50% credit were able to be done. There were also group tests. Lectures were asynchronous which took up a lot of time, but they were well done.

Jim Talamo is a great professor and great guy. Very well organized lecture notes and clear recitation lectures. The tests were quite difficult - especially considering the fact that there were 5 - however he tries his best to prepare you. Easy to reach outside of class.

This course is horribly set up and lacks a clear structure to support student learning. I passed this class by being carried by other students. It was extremely difficult and time consuming. Definitely did establish a basis of knowledge, but get ready to do a TON of studying. The class is made up of 85% midterms and final.

He had very clear lectures that had neat notes to follow along with. Truly cares about students understanding the material and is SUPER kind. The homework is the most time consuming but just start it early and it isnt bad at all, most of it will be revisited on the exams. The study guides are always very similar to the exams.

Lazy. Have fun sitting and watching lectures while Jimmy flies through the material expecting you to follow. Live class is just him going through problems which is helpful however this is the closest youll get to him responsively teaching to a group of students. Figure the homework out, and go to the tutor building. You will hate doughnuts after.

Lazy. Reused his prerecorded lectures from during covid instead of having in person class and actually teaching. When I saw his ratings I was excited to take his class because they were so good and everyone described him as such an outstanding professor. He's not.

I loved his lectures, and he was very helpful in explaining difficult topics. This is a hard class, so make sure you put the work in and go to office hours, even if you don't have a question. Dr. Talamo cares a lot about his students' success, and is really nice.

Probably one of the best Math profs. at OSU. His notes are so easy to follow and understand. Exams are difficult but that is because 1172 has standardized department exams but he does a very good job of communicating material when in person.

Talamo is a great teacher. This class is the engineering calculus weed out class, so it is going to be really hard and difficult, but Talamo couldn't do a better job in the lectures. He really does a good job of explaining things and his notes are pretty clear. You have to put in ALL the work to get a good grade, so you'll have to step it up here.

I took 1172 via webinar, so his classes weren't required, and the lectures were posted on carmen. Jim is super nice, funny, and very good at helping students understand the content. I would gladly have again.

Talamo is easily one of the best professors / teachers I have ever had. He is extremely knowledgeable and intelligent, and actually cares about your understanding of the subject. Even with a class of almost a 1000 students (there was like 900 something in Fall 2020)! Definitely the best calc professor at OSU.

The textbook is free. He is a great guy and built the class properly for the pandemic. He is understanding, but they gave him way too much work. Check handouts if stuck on take home tests. The UTAs are terrible and don't grade properly. Often you have to go to him for regrades since the UTAs are incompetent. Great professor overall.

Talamo is a great lecturer. insanely smart and expects a lot our of his students, so be prepared for a fair amount of online homework (XImera, ugh), but he is such a great teacher. Was very helpful every time I went for questions after class and also offered to regrade my midterms when I noticed things were mis-graded. Very entertaining as well

Overall great prof, which is rare for the math department lol. Super nice and really cares about the success of his students. He took a really difficult class and made it easy to learn by offering a lot of additional practice, some extra credit, and exam/quiz revisions. He was always happy to answer questions and flexible to his student's needs.

One of if not the best professors in the math department. Failed 1172 first time and got a B+ my second time around with Talamo. Genuinely wants the students to understand the material and do well. Makes a very difficult class doable.

Very good lecturer. He tends to stare at the board a lot so sometimes will miss if people have a question. Really cares about if his students succeed. He responds very quickly to emails and carmen questions. He has been very helpful during COVID-19, even though the math department has been horrible. Always posts his lecture notes.
Jim is a funny guy who really tried to get the students to understand the math being taught!

summary_comment: Professor Asta is generally considered a kind and caring instructor who is willing to help students understand difficult concepts. However, her lectures are often described as disorganized and confusing, particularly for introductory-level courses. Despite these organizational issues, students find her office hours and one-on-one interactions helpful, and appreciate the use of curves in grading, which eases some of the stress.
summary_comment_short: Professor Asta is a kind and caring instructor who puts significant effort into helping students understand difficult concepts, though her lectures can be confusing and the course is disorganized. Despite these issues, she adjusts content to help students and provides helpful resources like office hours and a generous grading curve.

Ratings.comment: Professor Asta is an okay teacher.  Her lectures were kind of confusing for this being an introduction level stats class, but she was very kind and would explain things if they were confusing.  The course is disorganized.  The tests are curved which was helpful.  The homeworks weren't too bad.  You will be okay if you're in her class.

Professor Asta was a solid teacher for Stat 3201, she had a lot of examples in class that were similar to the exams, the class material itself is pretty difficult, she graded on a pretty heavy curve which was nice, office hours were very helpful

She's a nice professor, but there were many issues. She was very disorganized and often didn't upload things she said she would and would sometimes take several days to respond to emails. My biggest issue, though, was not her fault. The course has VERY few grades, and we sometimes wouldn't practice a concept until 2-3 weeks after we learned it.

She's a little disorganized and I think that the content she covers gets covered way too fast to work. Sometimes she doesn't explain concepts too well either. That being said, she is really kind in regards to one-to-one zoom calls. Adjusts the content to what she already covers in class. Be ready to work hard though, this class was difficult for me

She is very nice and really takes time to answer questions and clarify for her students. She can sometimes seem to be disoriented and won't upload homework on time and seems to really rely on her notes instead of doing problems on her own.

A pressing issue I've run into with Prof. Asta is lack of organization. We receive homework back over 3 weeks late, get exam practice problems the day before the exam, etc. Lectures are quite boring, as we follow the same routine each time. Above all, however, she is kind, caring, readily available, and truly wants her students to succeed.

Professor Asta is a kind, caring professor and I recommend her for STAT 5550. HWs not too difficult and tests are fair. My only complaint: Lectures are poorly organized, notes are somewhat haphazard and not easy to follow.
I really enjoyed Dr. Asta's lectures. Dr. Asta is a kind, caring, and understanding professor. I would just prefer if we spent less time on the first two chapters and more time on later ones.
It was an excellent course. She taught the class really well. Her assignments were really helpful in understanding the material. Now, I intend to take the next level too(Stat 6302).

SEI.Subject: STAT
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Probability for Data Analytics

SEI.Subject: STAT
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on Research Topics in Statistics

SEI.Subject: STAT
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Probability for Data Analytics

summary_comment: Professor Snapp is known for making difficult concepts enjoyable and accessible through engaging teaching methods and a high level of interaction. His classes are demanding but rewarding, with a focus on in-class learning and active participation. While his teaching style can be challenging for some, those who adapt to it find it effective and appreciate his humor and accessibility.
summary_comment_short: Professor Snapp is highly regarded for making complex concepts enjoyable and accessible through engaging teaching methods and a humorous approach. However, his unique teaching style can be challenging for some students, potentially leading to frustration if they struggle to keep up with his pace or find his explanations unclear.

Ratings.comment: Bart made class very enjoyable and easy to learn for very hard concepts. He always gave feedback and was eager to help students.

Bart has a very unique teaching method, from my experience, and I think if it works for you, you'll do great and enjoy the class, and if it doesn't, you can get a bit frustrated. Bart is very willing to help you succeed in the course, and gives you everything you need to do so. If you take this course, you cannot afford to skip class.

I took Bart's geometry 4507 class, which contained many very difficult concepts. Although the class was hard, Bart did a phenominal job teaching it and neatly organizing and building up the content to make it understandable. Made class fun with his great humor. Only con I have is nothing is online to learn from so if you miss class then ur screwed.

Nice guy, high energy and keen to help but really bad at explaining things so there's really no point in asking. I often left class confused. Pros are that quizzes are online and open note, workload is light and attendance isn't mandatory.
If you are not a native speaker don't take this class. Sometimes he says fast and it can be hard to catch up with him. Exams are unpredictable and may include lots of handwriting.

Bart Snapp is a great professor. Funny and quirky. He does make a difficult math class actually enjoyable. He provides lecture notes and will work with the whole class to fill out the notes. You submit the notes for homework grades. He will solve all homework problems in class if you attend lectures and ask questions. Exams can be unpredictable.

Math for Architects with Dr. Snapp was probably my easiest class in college. Homework is generally completed in class and he will provide plenty of help. If you get problems wrong on an assignment, you have another few days to fix the issue and he'll give you the points back. He's a hilarious teacher too!

It was a tough class (it broke my 4.0) but I really enjoyed having Bart for 4580. I'm sure he is just as excellent for other classes, but abstract algebra is clearly a topic close to his heart. I would recommend Bart for any class; he is clearly very smart, but also funny and accessible. He also adapts lectures based on student questions.
Fantastic professor and fantastic class, if you get the opportunity to have Dr. Snapp as a lecturer, do it.
Lectures are insightful and entertaining. He provides textbook-quality lecture notes, so there's no paying for a textbook. Try to get him for any math class you can!

Hands down the best math professor I had in OSU. He is very passionate about teaching. He also gave us a Ximera online textbook for practice and understanding the material. Although he tried to make the materials easier to understand, calculus 3 is still very difficult. Be sure to do the practice exams before the midterms and final.
Great professor. Lectures were always interesting and funny. Very helpful office hours before exam.
Bart is a very hilarious and passionate professor, and he did his best to make a hard course easier and more interesting. Also, he curves the grade after the final was graded.
Good fun guy in lecture. If you like math and do they work then youll like this class and do fine. There is usually a curve though.
Go to his office hour to ask about the group projects. He is a great lecturer.
Great guy, everything he said made perfect sense.
Bart is hilarious and genuiely interested in teaching. However the class is extremely hard. It's LIKELY to get a bad grade even under such a great 2153 professor.

Professor Snapp is not only brilliant when it comes to Calculus, but he keeps lectures entertaining. He is also one of the minds and developers behind Ximera, a free online textbook service, so students don't have to pay for the textbook. A print copy can be obtained for $5.
Best I've had so far.

Bart made me actually like calculus! He makes his own online, interactive textbook that is FREE! There is homework due every lecture day, but if you follow in class and in the textbook, it's not bad. Also, he gives practice exams that are 50% of the real exam! He is funny, and wants you to understand the material.

Fantastic teacher! I enjoyed every lecture thoroughly and was fully engaged from start to finish. Classes are taught in a unique, fun and engaging way, and help alot with the material. Bart himself is comical and kind, and is a amazing teacher who cares about the success of his students. 11/10 would take again
Great guy, truly cares.

Bart was the nicest professor. The material is difficult but he tries to teach it in a way that is easy to learn and he consistently adds humor to both his slides and lectures to keep the class interesting.

So much good to say about him. His lectures are amazing as he goes over tough subjects while sprinkling in humor. This makes the lectures so much more enjoyable. Great teacher, and encourages questions, giving back great responses. Uploads lectures online, so if you miss class don't worry. If you put in the work, you won't regret it. A+ teacher.
Bart's lectures are so interesting and he gives out many examples to help you understand the concepts. Exams hold heavily in the proportion of the grade.

Bart was definitely one of the best teachers Ive ever had. His lectures were interesting and helpful with the homwork and exams.. The most important part of his class was to pay attention in lecture during the example problems and do the textbook assignment , because thats where all the homework and exam questions come from.

Dr. Snapp was one of my favorite professors at OSU. He made me actually kind of enjoy calculus! Lectures were engaging, homework was reasonable, and Dr Snapp made it very apparent how much he loves his subject, which always is good to see. He was very accessible outside of class too, with office hours 4/5 weekdays. He wants his students to succeed.

Hands-down one of the best professors Ive ever had. Lecture times explained major concepts in bite-sized pieces. Advice: go to class. He wrote the textbook(Ximera), knows all the stuff.
