I SUCK at math at OSU, and Ive never had a higher grade until this class. Relatable, 10/10, you actually become interested in math even if its not your major.

Bart is easily the most entertaining professor I've ever had. He is great at making math interesting and grabbing the attention of the whole class. Really cool guy who makes me excited to go to class. If you are a student who prefers slow, methodical, and organized professors, it may take a bit to adjust to energetic/impromptu teaching style.

Really incredible teacher, and freaking awesome person too. You can tell he's constantly doing what he loves: doing math and teaching math (he also is a guitarist in a band, but you didn't hear it from me). Easily my favorite professor I've had here at OSU so far. Enjoyed learning Calc 3 because of him  honestly can't recommend enough.
Best Professor Ever!!! He is the reason I choose to minor in Math!

Dr. Snapp is by far the best math professor I've ever had. He teaches you how to think for yourself and makes high-level math jargon really accessible. He's very encouraging but definitely makes you work for your grade. He's got a great sense of humor and really cares about teaching math instead of just doing math.
His homework almost has nothing to do with your exams. He is intelligent, but he is not a good teacher.

The lectures are fairly large, so you will most likely never interact with Bart himself. The lectures are well executed, and along with the assigned homeworks and practice exams should prepare you well. There are two midterms and a final that make up your grade. I found the two midterms to be easy with the final being somewhat difficult.
Love Bart

He records all the lectures and puts them on Carmen which is great. Online textbook (Ximera) is part of the homework and it's free. It might seem confusing at first but if you spend LOTS of time reading over and practicing it and re-watch the lectures, you'll get the materials eventually since Calc 3 is not meant to be easy. Huge curve at the end.

This was one of the worst classes I have taken. The online textbook that he wrote with Jim Fowler was not very helpful in actually reinforcing material or just being a extra resource that I could use when confused. Exams are difficult that are all conceptual, and the homework gives no sort of practice with those types of questions.

Take a 90's teen guitar hero. Make him 40 yo, give him a PhD, and you've got Bart Snapp. He's funny, approachable, and a little anti-establishment with his teaching style and his own online 'textbook'. Occasionally, he's a bit scatter-brained while solving example questions, but his lectures are generally well organized and easy to follow.

He is interesting and explains material well, but the class was extremely difficult. The homework doesn't prepare you for the final and is very basic. I thought the final made me fail, but a super generous curve (a little over 10% at the end) was given out luckily. Doesn't believe in quizzes and doesn't make you buy a textbook, which is nice.

Dr. Snapp always had very engaging lectures. He has a great sense of humor. He is good with answering questions, and wants to make sure students understand. The material isn't bad in the beginning, but the class moves very fast and gets challenging quickly. Exams are a huge majority of your grade.

Bart is very knowledgeable about the subject but the way the subject is taught was at a faster pace than expected. The homework though good practice only covers the concept in basic ways. The best way to excel would be to religiously attend his office hours and participate in them. Ask many questions about the intricacies behind the concepts.

Although Bart is very approachable and friendly his class is very tough. Bart weights the exams to 80% of your grade. So bad grades on exams a bad grade in the class. Also, I didn't find the recitation to be supplemental the lecture at all. However I will say the homework was very doable but wasn't a clear representation of the exams.
Great professor, obviously cares about teaching well and making sure the students have everything they need to learn.

Bart (who is very informal and funny) is a good teacher of Calc 3 and has a good grasp on the concepts - so he's able to explain them in a lot of different ways. Like most classes, to get a view of the content as a whole you have to put in a little effort but probably one of my favorite math classes (was my first at OSU).

Seriously, take math with this guy. He's one of the best in the math department. He posts his lectures online, but I was always motivated to go because he made me smile/laugh every lecture. He wrote the online textbook for the class (which was SUPER helpful because it was a similar style to his tests) so no need to buy one. Doesn't get much better.

He's an incredibly enthusiastic lecturer. He made attending class enjoyable. He's understanding, and he's willing to slow down for anybody who can't keep up. Receptive to questions, and doesn't consider any questions stupid. His teaching makes the class so much easier. I sometimes wish he was my dad too.

He's an excellent teacher, which makes up for the fact that the exams are usually unnecessarily difficult.  He re-graded my final exam and gave me some points back, which bumped me up to a C+ instead of a C.  His lectures are entertaining, and he does a great job of answering students' questions.  The math department sucks, but he's great.

Very entertaining lectures, as others have said. I also liked his lecture style of using sharpies on printer paper for slides. It seems like he puts a fair amount of work into preparing slides and then uploading them online, he really wants students to do well. He doesn't know what will show up on exams but he tries his best to guess.

He's very lively. I don't think it's possible to fall asleep in lecture. He tries to see what level your understanding is and goes off of that. Holds many office hours and if you can't make it he finds time for you. He can think of problems for you to solve on the spot and they really help. I would definitely take one of his classes again.

Bart is hands down the best math professor I have ever had. He's always there for students during office hours and after lectures. He will do everything in his power to ensure that his students succeed. The who don't do well in this course often don't put in the time to practice the material. This class was many things, but it wasn't boring.

Had a very basic math lecture with Bart and I assumed it would be the same boring thing week in and week out. Some how Bart managed to make things funs and exciting and made me look forward to class. He's funny and super smart.

He is funny and entertaining if you like calculus. He is very unclear sometimes and his notes are often unorganized and he doesn't give very many examples. You may think you know what you are doing but then when you go to take the test, there are a million curve balls thrown your way.

Calc was the biggest struggle with my freshman year, and I did not do well. However, this was due to many personal reason and the fact that I had a god awful TA. Bart himself is absolutely phenomenal, probably the best math professor at OSU. He's quirky, inspirational, and loves his job so much. He's always available to help and is just a great guy

Bart Snapp is the greatest Calc teacher you could have. I took his class and made it out with an A- without having any previous Calc experience. He'll teach you his way of doing Calc, which may be different from the book, but still very helpful. GO TO LECTURE! No need to buy the book, just get the MyMathLabs access; it'll come with an online book.

Bart Snapp is a phenomenal professor to have for Math 1151 - (Calc 1). His averages are ALWAYS higher than other professors. Take this professor for Calculus, or any other math course if you want to get a good grade. He goes over past exams in class.

Dr. Snapp is definitely one of the best professors you could ever have. Always ready to help if you need it. He makes dreams come true. Very good at teaching. Only class my first semester I actually felt like I was learning in. Gives amazing lectures and kept me engaged. Ask questions! He is always ready to answer

Bart was a great professor, and made the lectures interesting and personal to each student! Treated a class of 250 as a class of 25, and tried to get to know you. I have never seen a lecturer ask for problem requests at the beginning of class or one that  walks up and down the aisles.

He genuinely cares about the students, and he puts online videos of every lecture. Also he's pretty funny in a quirky way. He does all he can help, in spite of the math department heads who ruin everything...

Bart was great. He was very personable, understanding, and willing to answer questions. He was also quite humorous in class and answered emails promptly. During lectures, he made the material relatable and easier to understand.  He was scatter-brained occasionally in lecture, but I'd definitely choose his class again.
Bart is absolutely amazing. Best calculus professor I've ever had. He'll solve each and every one of your problems. He is extremely humorous and keeps everyone interested.

The best teacher I have ever had.  His class is hard but if you start the problems, he will direct you to the right answer.   Ask questions in class and go to office hours.  He is a wonderful teacher. Classes are hard, but its doable.

Bart was the best math teacher I ever had. He was so enthusiastic about teaching.He has an upbeat, fun personalty. He is very knowledgeable and has a way of teaching calculus so that it is very easy to understand. His class had the highest test scores on every midterm. His motto is to practice,practice,practice. Do that and you'll do fine!

Bart was a very fun teacher and very personable, especially since he let us call him by his first name. He made his own textbook for this class so that cut down on cost for the class. This class was a math class for architect majors so we got to learn math specific for our major, and even do fun projects like building 3D shapes and coloring!

Bart is a great teacher.  I had him for Math 108 and 109.  The class is very hard, just make sure you go to class and take the time to do the homeworks and study for the tests.  Bart makes the class very enjoyable though.  He also wrote me a letter of rec for grad school! :) If you have to take these courses, make sure you take them with him!
He was one of my favorite math teachers I have ever had. He will definitely challenge you, but he is VERY willing to help. Go to the lectures and you'll be just fine.

summary_comment: Professor Kerler is known for being a knowledgeable and caring instructor who often rounds up grades and provides generous grading. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow, and some students find his teaching style and class structure difficult, leading to mixed reviews.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kerler is known for being a knowledgeable and caring instructor who curves grades generously and cares about his students' success. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow, and some students find his teaching style and organization lacking, leading to mixed reviews regarding the overall learning experience.

Ratings.comment: He was a great lecturer and was a very generous grader. Homework assignments were rough but the tests were very fair. He even rounded my grade at the end of the semester without me asking!

Dr. Kerler is a very kind professor who cares about his students and their success. Although a lot of content comes from the (free) textbook, he does a good job elaborating on the material to make lecture worthwhile. His grading scheme is very friendly, and if you put reasonable effort inside and outside of class, you should succeed.

10 HW during the semester, 5 exams. HW typically 5 questions from book. Exams were easy as long as you had a general understanding of the topics. Final was similar, just covered all course material and had more questions. Lectures a bit hard to follow while taking notes, so I didn't take any and just listened during lecture and read the book later.
I would run as far away as possible from this professor. I actually really enjoy math but he made it impossible for me to ever wanting to take math again.

Ok this professor is extremely smart. He makes up his own lecture material and can explain anything you'd like. He is concise and clear. He cares about his students and curves if necessary. Take his class if you can handle math or enjoy it.

Worst professor I have ever had in 3 years at Ohio State! Linear Algebra is easy, unless you take it with Kerler. Listen to everyone elses advice! If you have kerler, drop his class, dont enroll in it, avoid at all costs! Avoid him like the plague or you will be sorry!

Took an easy linear algebra class and made it impossible. Completely disorganized and was usually late or barely on time for class. My grades actually IMPROVED when I stopped going to class and just read the book. Complete joke of a professor and I expected more from OSU. You really dropped the quality ball on this professor OSU.

He's not a great teacher in this relatively easy subject. He's way over simple calculus and researches crazy stuff like "Topological Quantum Field Theories." I once heard that he wrote a book on time travel also. Anyway, since math 151 is review for most students it shouldn't be much trouble for non-dumb kids. I got an A easily. Just keep up!

I'm an A student in college. My only B+ was in his class. Words can't explain how awful this professor is. If you have him, you need to drop this class. If you are forced to take Math another quarter, do it. You will regret it if you do not drop the class.
Worst Prof i have ever had. didnt learn one thing in the class. drop his class!!!

alright.. he SUCKS!. I was always good at math in high school and then I got to his class and struggled so much.. I hardly went to lecturs though because it wasn't even worth it.  You can tell that he's really smart and knows what he is talking about but he has no clue how to transfer that information to others.
Very organized teacher and he really knew the subject matter, but I felt he was lacking in his ability to teach the students what we needed to know.

He is a terrible professor! He mutters constantly, and never really reaches the point that he is trying to make. The tests are impossible, cause they asked questions which were barely talked about in lecture. I would probably say he is the worst teacher I have ever had.
Not a bad prof, but not a good one either.
He is not a good teacher. Drop his class right now!
He can't explain things worth a damn. thank god i took calc in high school.
Very clear, very simple, straight German-style instruction. Fellow students mostly idiots,  very stupid. Ohio-State -- what can you expect? I liked very much his humorless jokes.

People tell you to go to lectures-for Kerler there is no need. he mumbles and never gets his point across. If there is a problem that is too difficult for him he will just pass it up. BE SURE TO GO TO RECITATION!  Park is probably youre best bet for a good TA. If you have kerler as a prof, i recommend attending a different lecture; he is useless

ABSOLUTELY AWFUL. I got an B+ in 15O, i'm pretty good at math but I got an E in his class, worst grade of my life.  His lectures cover maybe 10% of the exam problems, but the problems he does cover are 10x harder on the exam.  The entire class averaged a 55.1% total.I retook the class with another professor and got another B+. GET OUT OF HIS CLASS!
i can't even begin to explain how much he can't teach.he cracks jokes every once in a while, but theyre not funny. Every other calc class seeme dto have an advantage over ours in the exams.
His accent is easy enough to get over, but you will still have no idea what he's talking about.
Ugghh.  This guy makes Calculus 10x harder than it should be.  I got an E in his class.  If I take calc again, it's not going to be with Kerler.

ABSOLUTELY POSITIVELY HORRIBLE!  i can't even begin to explain how much i hated going to his class.  i didnt learn one thing.  never passed an exam and didnt pass the class.  he basically screwed my GPA.  for god's sake get another professor for this class.
If you have kerler i recommend sitting in on another professors lectures. All 151 exams are basically the same, Curve is about 10% so not bad on that respect.

class wasn't as bad as everyone wanted to think it was.  I got a 30/80 on a midterm and still got an A.  The final wasn't bad either i got a 190/200, the class is not that bad and you need to take it for most majors.
Terrible, search for another Prof
SUCKS
He is an idiot.  He is a jerk.  And you cant reason with him.  He is always wrong. If you have him, go to a different lecture..BEST thing you can do.  It will save your grade.
Bad teacher, bad TA, bad class... need I say more?

Terrible teacher. Impossible to understand. He spent the entire 48 min. working on one problem when he'd ultimately realized even he couldn't do it. I failed every midterm and got a 96/200 on the final and still got a C with the curve though.

Kerler was the absolute worst teacher I have ever had.  He's a smart-ass prick who gives out test that are harder than any problem you see in the homework or recitation classes.  Our class average was 50.1 he does an awful job in explainations of problems, no curve, and makes constant mistakes.

He is a very bad teacher. My grade improved when I stopped going to lecture and just learned the stuff on my own. The tests have nothing to do with homework problems. Basically, if you're really smart you'll do well...I you're not... good luck.
His voice would be loud and soft and he would make mistakes but not tell you where to correct them. He was just very hard and he made me not want to go to class.
Tests are nothing like homework problems or quizes. Has a good sense of humor though.

I understand why people think he's a bad professor but I think he's kind of cute and I guess it was easy for me because I had taken calculus in high school, but for those that didn't then I guess it would have sucked.  He wasn't the worst though.
He needs to test over what he teaches, basically there's a problem with the entire structure of the math department, and things need to be changed.
strong german accent but still pretty easy to understand. i completely understand what he does i lecture, but the tests are always a lot harder. he really tries, and will help you if needed.

Calc. was at least understandable in H.S.-but he made it seem like like rocket science, taught in LATIN!  He wore the same red shirt every day, called calculators "computers" and called himself "vertically dyslexic". I ended up with a C+ in the class, but actually failed it without a curve......
No Comments

if you didn't already take calculus before in high school, you're pretty much screwed unless youre really good at teaching yourself stuff youve never heard of in your life. mumbles and has a heavy accent. lecture and practice problems never even slightly resemble exams. good luck:)

Wow, this guy is horrible! He has absolutely no idea that the students gain nothing from attending his lectures. Thank god Matt was my TA. in 10 minutes i learned from Matt what it would take Kerler 2 lectures to explain badly.

this guy sucks. he doesnt know how to teach.. he shows us the hardest possible problem in class and expects us to understand his mumbling****. his midterms are **** cuase he doesnt even look at them til the day of the exam because they are departmental exams.
No Comments

Watching him teach would be comical, if it weren't my grade on the line. He just mumbles incoherently, and expects us to know exactly what he is talking about. Very disorganized; he failed to show up for a test. His personal hygene is lacking.

Not a good professor. Just mumbles on like Bill Murray from Caddyshack. Doesnt really explain things, just does them and expects you to understand. Not very helpful, just refered me TAs. Put me to sleep.
cant understand, mumbles for a while then shouts in lectures, examples are not well explained, Quinlan is a great TA though
He is terrible.  The review exams online are nothing compared to his.  He makes everything complicated and hard.  He is just aweful.
If you get him, my only words of advice are to drop the class ASAP.  He is pathetic.  If you get Avi Silterra as a TA, do yourself a favor and shoot yourself.  You will thank me later.
i dont understand how this dude made professor, he suxs hard core.Does not clean his cloths nor apparently himself.i had to drop this class. Definitily avoid avi silterra, he is kerler times ten.
Makes no sense, mumblesand is not clear. Avoid at all costs

This guy is more of a neanderthal than an educated professor, mumbles and smells repugnant. Biggest head of any professor I've ever seen. If you can decipher his grunts then you'll be fine, if not (which is far more likely) then you are officially screwed
If Quinlan is your TA, you should be fine, if not... RUN!
I cannot understand this guy AT ALL...the only thing that is worse than his lecture is the horrible teaching of Avi Silterra as a TA, avoid this combination like the plague
No Comments
No Comments
Mumbling and lateness issues. Has trouble bathing regularly. Does not change clothes often.

He teaches like a tornado!  If you can understand a mumbling german accent and garbled math, then you might be okay in his class.  On the other hand, if you're like me and require an explanation of the concepts being taught, then DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!

If you have him as a professor, you will be shafted. One, you can;t understand him and two, he isn;t prepared. Also, don;t if possible, get him as a prof and Avi Silterra as a TA, because you are on your own!

summary_comment: Professor Sheldon (referred to as Jenny) is highly regarded for her dedication and support, despite the course's difficulty. Students appreciate her understanding nature, willingness to help with assignments, and efforts to ensure student success, though they note the grading system can be confusing. Her passion for teaching and commitment to her students' persistence and well-being are evident, making her a sought-after professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sheldon is highly regarded for her dedication to student success, despite the challenging nature of her courses. Students appreciate her understanding and willingness to help, though they note the unique and sometimes confusing grading system.

Ratings.comment: This course is very difficult but Jenny is very understanding and helpful when it comes to help with assignments. The grading scale for this class is a bit odd but it allows for you to not do amazing on tests but still do relatively okay. I enjoyed having her as a professor, it's clear that she wants her students to do well.

The grading scheme made little sense and was way out of left field. She does allow for corrections, but how the scale is set up, you could get A's on almost all of the assignments, but if you get even one C your highest possible grade is a C+. Additionally she has the students, mostly, teach themselves. Also tries to pass being mean as funny

Jenny is absolutely amazing at teaching a class that is quite hard. Elem math for teachers is not for the weak but it's a course that helps build your persistence to do well. Jenny gives you lots of tries so a good work ethic and attitude will likely result in a good grade. Already scheduling for Jenny's class next semester- she's that wonderful!

Jenny is a great professor and very caring towards her students. I had her for 2168. You must go to class, it is very participation heavy on the white boards! Interesting material and she is passionate about teaching math.

Jenny is absolutely amazing! The grading is really wacky but she understands that it is a hard course and WANTS you to succeed. As with any class, it's important that you speak up if you need help because she is so understanding and happy to help. Definitely try to take math 1125 with Jenny and don't give up!!

Jenny is by far the best professor I've ever had. 1125 is an extremely challenging class, but not impossible. Jenny really cares that we do well and understands that this class is challenging. Office hours are a lifesaver because of the weird grading system and all the homework. Find study buddies to ask questions and prepare for timed assessments.

The grading scale for this course is very different, but Jenny and the TAs want you to succeed. The semester will start off rough and shaky, but Jenny makes an effort to make sure you feel comfortable and confident in the classroom.

Jenny is a fantastic teacher! Make sure you take MATH 1125 with her! This class is challenging, but as long as you try, you will do well! I would really utilize all the office hours. It makes class and understanding the material so much easier!

Professor Sheldon does a really good job when one-on-one. She is super helpful in a difficult class with a difficult grading system. Sometimes the lectures aren't great, but I would recommend going to her office hours and asking for help since she is good one-on-one.

TAKE JENNY FOR 1125! This is definitely the most challenging class I've taken at OSU, but with Jenny's instruction, it was made easier. Jenny truly wants her students to succeed. My advice (will make more sense once you take the class): get your reassessments done early, use the textbook for help on your explanations, and go to office hours.

Jenny is honestly such a great professor but is judged by the hard tests and complicated grading of the class!! She was super helpful and understanding and made the class fun! However, the grading system is certainly unique and can be frustrating to figure out how to succeed. Overall shes a great teacher teaching a hard class.
one of the hardest classes you will ever take. no partial credit given it's all or nothing. professor is somewhat helpful but NEVER lenient with points. good luck.

This was by far the most difficult class I have taken at OSU. The grading system is unique- you have to fully understand content, or not at all. Yet, Jenny is an incredibly understanding, kind, and funny professor. She is always willing to help and work with you. If you demonstrate effort, you will have the opportunity to succeed!

First teacher I've had in college that I felt like really cared about my well-being. We often split up into breakout rooms, which I think was actually helpful for my learning the material. Very different from other OSU math courses, at times it felt more like classes I'd have taken in high school, but in a good way.

Jenny is one of the most helpful, dedicated professors I've ever had. She spent countless hours in n out of class helping students. I had many 1 on 1 meetings with her bc I needed the extra help, and w/o I would have probably failed the class. I've had all A's except one B, and I could barely pass this class. Class info will be helpful in future.

Jenny is a great person and gives you lots of opportunities to gets points but the structure of this class is horrendous. The worst class I have ever taken. It truly kept me up at night. The entire class is a guessing game. Hours spent on 1 homework for 1 word feed back and no points. You teach yourself everything or rely on classmates help.

The whole structure of this class made no sense. Every lecture was spent in breakout rooms where more than half the class time was wasted. It would take us 5 minutes to do the problem but we would reconvene with 5 minutes remaining to go over each groups answer. There was literally zero instruction and the textbook is how i made it. take at cstate

One of the hardest courses I've ever taken, but Jenny provides so many options to get your grade up with Reassessments, and she will meet with you outside of office hours if needed to help you with concepts (DFUs) definitely would take her classes again if I could because she is passionate about what she does.

Jenny should definitely be reported for the way her class is set up. There are no letter grades in this class, only outcomes. She grades way too harshly. She also never teaches and has us rely on our peers to teach each other. So basically some of our tuition is going to a professor who is trying to sabotage our grades

Jenny grades with a system based on Outcomes you have to get through hw and exams but its impossible to do well in this system. The criteria to hit an outcome is very wordy so you think you know what youre doing but its so wordy its unclear and she almost never gives you the outcome. She doesnt grade all of the hw problems you do either.

I'm sure this class was great before outcomes, yet it has made this class almost impossible. Grades are based on how many outcomes you master, but you have to hit every single point of each outcome perfectly to receive a DFU. The only way to get DFU is on hw or exam but they dont even grade all of your work. Class is all group work and no teaching.

By far the hardest class I've taken at OSU. This class is literally a game. During class, we had to learn from our peers and she did nothing but grade. This whole class is just set up to make you fail. Your grade is based off how many outcomes you can "master."

By far the best professor Ive had at OSU! The class is inanely difficult but you will walk away having learned so much. If youre on the fence of taking 1172 or 2162 take the latter. She focuses class around discussion ideas instead of just computations. Tests are hard but homework and quizzes are weighted a good amount too so it distributes.

She is awesome! I really admire her stamina on teaching a whole classes of students with so many questions with solving their questions as well as bring new contents for a whole class. The pace is fast, but her discussion is really a good place to think over the classes. 80% points of all quizzes will be marked as all points so it's totally fine.
Jenny is a very good teacher. If you put in the effort, you can be successful in her class. The material does move quickly but if you stay on top of things and work hard, you will do well.

Jenny is a good teacher, but this class is the most difficult I have ever taken. Very little partial credit given on tests, which are pretty hard to begin with. Jenny does her best to get us through this class, and her lectures are pretty helpful. If you have the option, DO NOT take 2162, but if you do and have Jenny, you could do much worse.

Jenny is a great professor! The class is more difficult than expected, but if you work hard to understand things you'll do fine. There's weekly quizzes, weekly homework, and 3 exams. It's a decent amount of work but really not too bad. Jenny is great at explaining things and genuinely wants to help you, I really enjoyed her as a professor!!

Despite her being an excellent teacher, I do not recommend anyone to take Math2162. I didnt miss a single lecture, got almost full credit in all the homework but still couldnt get a good score on this course. Dont take 2162 Unless you are a math wizard. It is not fair to say Jenny is a bad teacher, its either this course is too hard or Im dumb

Jenny was a wonderful professor for Math 1125. She gave us a lot of opportunities to talk about our ideas in class and that helped me work through what I was struggling with. You do get a grade for attendance and participation that can help increase your score at the end of the class, so show up and speak up!

While Jenny cares about the students in her class, she does not communicate the material well at all. Recitation is where I actually learned the concepts and how to do problems. I would not recommend 2162 to anyone taking any other honors class because the workload is so much and the tests are difficult due to how much information they cover.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Jenny as my professor for 2162. It's a super hard class but she really cares about her students and having them understand calculus. She gets to know everyone's name and is very helpful with questions. She can be a little quirky at times and is really into class participation but still a solid professor.

Pros: -Extremely helpful during office hours -Learned everyone's name (100/class) and connected with everyone -Challenged us  Cons: -Occasionally came across as clueless -Lectures were very similar to the book (pro maybe?)  Jenny's class was ridiculously hard. That's not really her fault, considering you are flying through calc 2 AND 3.

I felt like she didn't actually teach us in class. Lectures felt like recitation and recitation felt like a study hall. I felt that you had to read the textbook outside of class to actually understand how her 'lectures' (lecture  giving the class a problem to work on and kind of guiding us when we got stuck) related to what we should've read.

Dr. Sheldon values her relationship with the students, as she called students by name in two classes of 100+ people. She was good during office hours and tests were fairly created and graded. Yes, the class was hard, but "Honors" isn't supposed to be easy. She was great during office hours. The students who put effort into the class did well

2162 is a horrible class and I do not recommend it at all. It is not required for FEH, and it covers part of calc 2 and all of calc 3 in only one semester, which is way too much material. The class this year was not even curved. We didn't get enough examples in class, and a lot of points would be taken off on tests for small errors.
A lot of material over a short amount of time. Lectures are a lot of material with few examples. Easier to take calc 2 and 3 separately

Jenny is a different professor to say the least. The amount of material covered in class is too much to have a comprehensive final, and the work you spend only one day on in class is too hard to grasp in such a short amount of day. The semester is spent rushing through two textbooks and the information doesn't stick because of the difficulty level.

Odd professor; she makes jokes, but they're often in leu of student behavior and their answers to her questions. She once referred to below average academic performing students as "bottom of the barrel". Her lectures are helpful and she does a nice job teaching the material, I would just prefer a professor with a more professional demeanor.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Math for Middle School Teachers I

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: History of Mathematics for Middle School Teachers

SEI.Class Name: History of Mathematics for Middle School Teachers

summary_comment: Professor Haburcak is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality at Ohio State University. Students praise his responsiveness, helpful office hours, and fair exams, noting that he covers material thoroughly in lectures and homework. His supportive approach and commitment to student success make him an outstanding professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Haburcak is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, consistently receiving praise for his responsiveness, helpful office hours, and fair exam policies. Students appreciate his supportiveness and genuine desire for their success, finding his lectures and assignments comprehensive and relevant to exam questions.

Ratings.comment: If you're taking any OSU math, choose Dr. Haburcak! He's the best professor I've had. Always responds to emails quickly, has super helpful office hours (these are key if you're struggling), allows personal cheat sheets, and gives fair exams. Make sure you do well on all homework as there aren't many grades, but his class is worth it. 100% recommend

Professor Haburcak is an amazing professor. He is very sympathetic and accommodating to students. Exams weren't that hard and questions are fair (everything covered in lecture and homeworks.)  He  does his best to help his students out and really seems like he wants his students to pass.

summary_comment: Professor Tseng is known for being a challenging instructor with minimal engagement in student support. Lectures consist primarily of the professor reading from the textbook, and office hours are infrequent and unhelpful. While exams cover complex material not addressed in homework, the homework itself is relatively easy, and the professor tends to grade leniently. Overall, his teaching approach and accessibility make the course difficult, though some students manage to succeed with minimal lecture attendance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tseng is known for being a challenging and unhelpful instructor who assigns extensive, often redundant video lectures and provides unclear grading guidelines for exams. Students find his lectures ineffective and his office hours difficult to access, leading many to rely on the textbook instead.

Ratings.comment: Horrible professor who puts in no effort to help students, and extremely tough and unreasonable grader. AVOID AT ALL COSTS I don't know how he is still teaching.

Some weeks he would assign six hours of lecture videos that are just him reading the textbook to you. I stopped watching them after a while and just read the book to do the homework. Practice exams were either extremely helpful or nearly useless, exams usually cover concepts much more complicated than any homework problems.
Homeworks are a little length but easy grader. You are given the entire day to work on exams and exams are easy.

12 assignments, 2 exams and 10 hw.  Exams are much harder than homework and use different terminology than the lectures and homework. The "lectures" are practically just the prof reading the book to you. Office hours are always the day after hw is due, discouraging hw questions I assume.

His office hours are random so he's hard to access. His lectures are prerecorded from years ago with a bad mic, the book is more helpful. The test questions he gives are higher level concepts that the homework doesn't tackle. He grades pretty softly, the test averages were always mid 80s but I left feeling unsatisfied with how little I learned.
My grade went up when I stopped watching his lectures. Not impossible to succeed with, but isn't a professor's job to teach? Unclear grading guidelines for exams, too.

If you have no experience with a proof based math class, this will be tough for you. Take Math 3345 first to get more comfortable with it. I pretty much never watched the lectures and read only from the textbook and found the hws/exams easy. The homeworks can get very long and tedious, but only 2 or so q's are graded.
Very knowledgeable, and helpful to students when they need help.

If you want to learn, don't take him he does not teach. If you want a good grade, he is a total unknown since he has a random curve it seems so you are at his mercy. Honestly don't know how they let this guy keep teaching. Literally (not figuratively) an 8th grader using resources on the internet could do a better job.

He does not do a thing. Avoid at all costs. The department has admitted that the course is a mess. The professor puts in no effort; the textbook does all the teaching. Very little partial credit and very particular. The first exam was mostly problems of a type we had no exposure to. The worst and most apathetic professor I've ever seen.
The exams are weighted a lot and the final was really hard. He also rarely responded to emails and never engaged with our class.

No lecture online after transforming to online courses. Ask as to study on our own. Don't do it. There is no grading scale on why you earn such a grade at the end. Everything seems to be assigned on your own, and you will obtain a random grade.

I can tell that professor Tseng is a very knowledgeable mathematics guy. However, probably he may want to put more effort into teaching in the future since it seemed like he did not really care about his students.

summary_comment: Professor Sharma is highly regarded for her effective teaching style and comprehensive support, particularly through her detailed explanations of complex topics, extensive use of resources like videos and animations, and generous opportunities to earn back lost points. She is known for being approachable and helpful, especially during office hours, though some students find her lectures fast-paced and require additional study outside of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sharma is highly regarded for her effective teaching style and comprehensive explanations of complex topics, which students find particularly helpful through her extensive use of visual aids and additional resources. While some students note that she can be demanding and fast-paced in lectures, many find her office hours invaluable for clarifying concepts and improving understanding.

Ratings.comment: I had her for both 2173 and 1172 math courses. I liked her teaching style and how she explained hard topics. She also gave a lot of resources that were very helpful like videos, animations to visualize hard concepts and had a lot of opportunities to get points back. Her office hours are where I learned the most and she was very helpful overall.

She was very helpful for questions and easy to talk to. Lectures aren't required since she posts the material afterwards and she does write fast in lectures. I had a family emergency and wasn't able to take the 2nd Midterm, and she was able to exempt me from it and help with any questions I had for the final.

I would give her a 5 compared to the other professor in 1149, but in reality Professor Sharma is good. 1149 can be difficult, but she is super helpful. Be mindful in her lectures, she WILL call you out for ignorance and distractions. She can go fast in the lectures, however, so I recommend gradually doing the homework to fully process the subject.
Struggled with explaining content during lecture, mostly test/quiz heavy class, much better learning when you visit her office hours and ask for help there

Bad at explaining the content in lectures, the only reason I was able to succeed was by doing practice problems in McGraw Hill. She expects people to respond to questions in a full lecture hall after not explaining and gets irritated when no one answers.
Not helpful and does not explain material well.

1172 is a challenging course, but I think Vaishavi did a good job teaching alongside Jim. Don't be like me and skip going to lectures because if you do, your grades will tank. 1172 requires you to tryhard, but if you do, Vaishavi should be there to help you do good.
Make sure you are doing assignments to fully understand course work!`

Dr. Sharma is a good teacher. Math 1172 is a hard class regardless of who the professor is. She utilizes a reverse classroom philosophy. Students are encouraged to watch lecture videos/read textbook before coming to class as lectures are example problems. I would recommend going to the free tutoring at the MSLC and utilizing all resources.

Professor Sharma is very kind and wants you to succeed. She is available outside of class if you need help. The class is very test heavy but you can revise midterms to get points back. Professor Sharma gave great examples in class but sometimes the lectures felt pointless because of the flipped classroom model where we watch lecture videos at home

Vaishavi gives good practice problems and work-throughs in class, but other than that lectures aren't super helpful. She expects all students to learn the material for that class beforehand, which makes going to lecture feel pointless sometimes. As for the class, it was unorganized and grades werent given back until much later than they tell you.
Does not spoon feed.
Overall she is a great professor.  I found Calculus to be very challenging but I found our classroom instruction extremely valuable.

summary_comment: Professor Henderson is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes the classroom environment comfortable and enjoyable. However, some students find his pace rapid and his explanations sometimes insufficient, particularly for those who are not strong in calculus. Despite these challenges, many appreciate his approachable nature and commitment to helping students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Henderson is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes the classroom environment comfortable and enjoyable. However, some students find his pace rapid and his explanations sometimes insufficient, particularly for those who are not strong in calculus.

Ratings.comment: he's funny, relaxed, and engaging. it's comfortable asking him questions and cares about helping students.
Nik is a funny guy and is very laid back but he speeds through practice problems and is not very good at explaining topics. Kind of expects you to already be great at calc before taking the class.

I haven't even finished this course yet but I wanna come on here and say avoid Nik as a TA for math 1151. He lectures in recitation like you are math prodigy in calc. To me that is the worst teacher you can have especially if you are not very great math. He also doesn't answer your questions properly and instead leaves you hanging.
This man is so nonchalant and constantly joking. Lectures aren't mandatory but definitely go or you'll be lost at the next lecture. There are extra credit assignments, too.

Nik is awesome! He doesn't take attendence but you will probably fall behind if you miss a lecture or two, so I'd recommend being there as often as possible. I would take 20 more classes with him if I could.

summary_comment: Professor Poole is a highly regarded lecturer who provides clear and detailed notes but is often criticized for his monotonous teaching style and lack of engagement. Students find his lectures helpful for understanding the material and performing well on quizzes and exams, provided they stay up to date with homework. However, many students also note that his classes can be quite boring and recommend finding alternative professors if a more dynamic teaching approach is preferred.
summary_comment_short: Professor Poole is known for his detailed and thorough lectures, which are highly informative but often described as monotonous and lacking in interactive explanations. While some students find his notes and online materials helpful for learning, many others find his teaching style boring and struggle with the lack of engagement during lectures.

Ratings.comment: The most boring lecturer I have ever had to endure. Writes on the chalkboard for the entire time with little to no explanantions. Does not teach how to use financial calculator, which would make the class much easier. If you want an A and/or to pass Exam FM, take any other professor!
Even though the material is hard to grasp at first, he makes it really easy to learn. Definitely would take his class again if possible!!!

Prof Poole is a good lecturer, he writes clean notes that are easy to follow and lots of good examples. I dont care for the online homework, and the class was generally fairly tough. That said, he has good online material to help you prepare and he is a good professor. Can be boring, but its hard to make this material exiting.

Prof. Poole always came to class very prepared. He gave lectures while writing incredibly detailed notes. While the lectures were very informational, they were also very monotonous making it a bit boring. The HW, tests, and quizzes are all pretty simple as long as you stay up to date. Tests questions were exactly like the quizzes.

Homework does not reflect quizzes or exams. Only one try for homework and are not shown correct answer immediately. (No examples) I found his lectures somewhat confusing, I bought the coaching actuaries FM exam prep. It helped some but I felt I did not correlate with the class enough so I had to drop.
Most monotonous professor Ive ever had. Hate his demeanor. Harder than other section with different professor.

Dr. Poole was in my opinion a very good professor. If you stay up to date with the hw and show up to class, then the quizzes and exams aren't bad at all. His tests basically focus on the lecture notes and the exam reviews. I worked hard and had no problem doing well. Dan is also a pretty nice guy and lowkey pretty funny. These reviews are too harsh

If you want to learn something and willing to do some practice for an A, he is your best choice, his lecture is all you need to know,well explained and helpful example, unlike other professor in OSU math department, at least in his class, you work hard you get a good grade, and that is a rare thing in OSU higher level math class
His lecture style is beyond boring (lots of writing paragraphs and long examples on the board), but he actually knows the concepts and explains them decently well. His tests are very fair.

Might be the worst professor I have ever had. There was no partial credit, no grey area when it comes to doing a problem with him. If you have any doubt in your mind about a problem with him chances are its going to be wrong. I could say with confidence that if he is your only option,wait a semester. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. VERY DIFFICULT AND NO HELP

Poole is very slightly above average at explaining everything but not the best. You will most likely understand what is going on but not have a true grasp of why everything works like some professors can give you. His exams aren't too hard but the quizzes usually require a lot of algebra which can make it easy to make mistakes.
Did not explain the material well at all.  Left students more confused after the lecture than they were before.

Taking this class with Dan Poole was an absolute nightmare. He is pretty good at lecturing but when he is he uses the most abstract examples to explain the material. Often he would be going to fast for me to comprehend which was really discouraging. The exams were insanely hard. This was worst experience i have had in College.

His lectures are exhausting and he writes on a chalkboard and talks at the same time so it's a bit hard to take notes and retain the information. He is pretty helpful if you attend his office hours. However, he makes calculus harder than it needs to  be. AVOID HIM!!
Easy to understand. Lectures were explained in a clear manner.

Poole was an awesome calc professor. He explains material well, and he was super helpful for me in office hours. All of his examples came from the book, which was fine with me especially if you need to skip class. Lecturerecitation examples and homework were much harder than the actual exams, so if you understand those you will be good to go.

Good professor, talks about what he needs to in lecture. If you go to lecture, listen and take notes you will know all you need to know for the exams, especially if you follow along with the example problems. If you have any background in calculus the class will almost be boring for you.

He's kind of awkward but very nice and extremely helpful if you ask him direct questions. Lecture is pretty good, he mostly regurgitates material from the book but some of the examples and explanations are quite helpful. My biggest critique: not very available. Office hours on monday and friday 10-11? come on man.
Easy A. He is cute!

Honestly, he just takes the notes from the books. However, he does do some examples which are helpful. Lectures are long and boring but he actually gives good information, he is just boring. If you need help, he can explain concepts pretty well and go over practice problems with you.

Took college algebra and trigpre-calc. at OSU and got very high A's in both. Then, I enrolled in Poole's class and had to withdraw to save my GPA. I took away nothing from the lectures, and spent more time trying to figure out how he got from one step to the next than actually listening. He knows the material well,but doesn't convey it effectively
Very boring and doesn't engage the class, find myself going to other lecturers because he is so boring and I feel like I don't learn anything
Took everything from his lecture straight from the book but didn't even explain it as well as the book. Might as well not go to class because the lectures are usually useless.
Lecture is very clear and helpful. Most of the time I don't even need to go to recitation.
Very good professor. Explains material clearly and is always willing to answer questions. Exams were easy too. I highly recommend trying to get him as a professor
He was very helpful in recitation. Was willing to go over any problem you needed. Ask any questions you need.
He was my T.A. For math 151 and he explained things so well, I learned more from him in recitation than I did in lecture for sure.  Get this T.A. if you can!
He is a GREAT TA! He isnt clear 100% of the time, but will work with you to let you know what he expects from you. He is also a TA for Math.

summary_comment: Professor Costin is known for her structured lectures and effective use of in-class examples and homework for exam preparation, though she occasionally makes mistakes that she corrects. She is generally regarded as a helpful and caring instructor who is responsive to student emails and offers support during office hours, though some find her explanations unclear and her lectures can be challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Costin is known for her well-structured lectures and effective use of homework and in-class examples in exam preparation, though she occasionally makes mistakes that she corrects. She is described as helpful and patient, often available during office hours, but some find her explanations unclear and her lectures can be challenging due to the rapid pace of material covered.

Ratings.comment: She structures her lectures very well, and the exams are largely based off of the in class examples and homework (a lot of the questions on exams are hw questions). She also allowed a cheat sheet for all exams which made life much easier. She also does make mistakes during lectures frequently, but corrects them. Good teacher and good lectures

Professor Costin's class was strange.  You had lecture 5 days a week, where recitation is just another lecture.  This class is busy, and the homeworks become difficult as you progress in the course.  You can not use the textbook to help you because she copies her lecture exactly from the textbook.  Not a bad calc class if you have a light schedule.

This course consists of basically 5 lectures a week covering huge swaths of material at a time, basically the course covers all of calc 1 and the first half of calc 2. Thankfully she gives fantastic lectures so the textbook is mostly only used for getting the hw problems. While its fairly easy to get an A, the content is still very difficult.

In-person: Her lectures are great and she wants to help students during class and office hours. Homeworks can be difficult, but understanding them helps for tests since tests are similar to homework/notes. Online: No recorded lecture (read from book), limited office hour, a lot more work given. You are essentially learning from the book.

Rodica is so sweet & brilliant! Although she is a bit unclear in her explanations in lecture at times, she was always available for help outside of class. And she is super patient with you! i was at office hours 2-3 times per week & she was always happy to see me. never annoyed. Tests are actually easier than you'd expect and she is a easy grader.
She cares a lot about her students but she is not effective at explaining the material. She makes a non-trivial number of mistakes during lectures which can throw you off.

Even though she crazy, but Dr. Costin is real nice. She willing to help if you holla at her during her office hours. Real helpful, even though class was aigh. But if you want A in your grad classes, take Costin!

Very helpfull instructor. Explains linear mappings, finite dimensional vector spaces very well. Always answers e-mails, i have never seen an instructor more helpful than R. Costin. I recommend Dr. Costin to all students studying dynamical systems, her specialty is differential equations.
Very nice lady, but very poor lecturer. Didn't follow what the class was suppose to be. Class is easy but you'll get more out of it if you take it with someone else (and you wont be bored to tears)
She knows maths but she is quite boring. And her notes are not too great either.

I really liked her as a professor.  She explained stuff well and her exams were fair.  She goes pretty slow too and her lectures are well organized, so you can follow easily and understand what's going on.

Rodica is a great teacher. She is super excited about math and knows what she's talking about. Her midterms stayed true to the review sessions she gave in class.  Office hours weren't the greatest--I felt like we were annoying her more than getting help. Other than that, I would recommend her!
The class itself was pretty boring but Rodica was a very relaxed teacher, and made class casual. The midterms were take home, and therefore almost guaranteed As. Do your homework, though!!

Rodica is one of the best math teachers I have every had.  She knows what shes doing and class was always fun because we could joke around with her. Theres homework everynight and if you want an A in the class you better do your homework that night. DO NOT WAIT UNTIL THE WEEKEND TO TO HOMEWORK! Exams are easy if you pay attention. Good luck!

Rodica is a decent teacher.  She goes over the homework everyday in class and does most problems you don't understand on the board. The midterms are relatively easy and there are lots of bonus points. The only thing I didn't like about the class is that I felt I wasn't really learning the concepts because they weren't explained very clearly.

Convinced me not to take the H160 series.  She's interested in the subject, but it doesn't transfer to you.  Ridiculously easy midterms (over 100% on all three), no quizzes, easy class, but boring.  Take to pad the grade, not to learn anything.
No Comments
No Comments

Very nice but not a very good teacher. Sometimes messes up with her english. Goes over all homework on fridays. Wait until the end to decide if you want to write down the notes, most are just useless.

summary_comment: Professor Ogle's classes are challenging and require significant effort, particularly through consistent engagement and use of supplementary resources like unstuckstudy or external explanations. Lectures can be dry and largely consist of slide readings, though in-person sessions are recommended for better understanding. Exams are test-heavy and graded harshly, often without partial credit, making the class difficult to navigate without thorough preparation. Overall, student feedback is overwhelmingly negative, with many advising against taking his class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ogle's class is challenging with tough exams, but the material is manageable with consistent effort. However, several students found his lectures dry and of poor quality, recommending in-person classes and self-study over his online materials.

Ratings.comment: Ogle's class is quite challenging, but unstuckstudy can be a helpful study tool alongside the textbook. Stay engaged, as his lectures can be dry. Expect tough exams, but the content is manageable with consistent effort.
Not much to say, I think all of these reviews speak for themselves. Avoid at all costs

Ogle knows the material extremely well and does an excellent job explaining it. Apparently his online lectures are low quality so I recommend in-person. He's very technical, but his class is easier than others I've seen. I also recommend finding intuitive explanations online. Also very test heavy but they were at least take-home exams in my case

His lectures consisted of reading directly off slides pulled directly from his unofficial online textbook full of errors. Lots of T/F questions on hw & exams were graded all or nothing. Very cruel in office hours & berated students all the time. I performed better in class after ditching his lecture videos & learning the content on my own.

Ogle's lectures were terrible. He read directly off the slides and did not provide any examples of concepts. The midterm and final were worth 25 and 50% of the grade and he graded them very harsh. True/false questions are worth lots of points, they are extremely confusing and no partial credit is given. Do not take this class if you can avoid it.

Worst teacher I have ever had at Ohio State. Horrible lectures where you can barely understand what he is saying. Homework and exams are graded very hard and the small amount of feedback you do get takes about a month for them to submit. Also only about half of the problems you do for homework actually get graded.

Wouldn't recommend, teaches in a very theoretical way that is difficult to understand and doesn't do many examples. I was teaching myself and homework felt like a scavenger hunt in the textbook he wrote himself. Has office hours, but isn't helpful. Grading on homework and midterms is harsh and unhelpful and the final is worth 50% of your grade.

The professor gave short lectures with a variety of sound issues that were difficult to understand. He used his own textbook which had syntax errors that prevented a variety of figures from appearing. The midterm and final were absurdly long. Only about a quarter of homework problems are graded and those didn't tell you what you did wrong.

If you're going to take this class with Ogle I recommend getting a different textbook than the one he wrote and provided. Funny guy, but terrible lectures that don't help with the homework. Says that as long as you do all the assignments and exams you'll be fine 2 pass. Had a 65 that he rounded to a C-, but I have to retake because I needed a C.
Don't take with Ogle, online or in person.
A perfect example of the minimum effort put into teaching a class. Basically what others said, don't take this class because it's online. It is worse than you think.

His section of this class uses a textbook that he wrote, so it is just as confusing as the notes. He explains everything in a very technical way that you need a Ph.D in Linear Algebra to understand. He makes you feel bad for getting questions wrong in class and is a very strict grader. Final exam is worth 50% of your grade

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS, SERIOUSLY! I read reviews and said, eh, how bad can it be? This class is impossible to do well in and I even with tutoring. I do well on homework, but I bombed the midterm and went from an A to a C. Want to know why I bombed the exam? Three true of false questions, graded with no mercy and also no feedback. Horrible prof.

This guy's a real stick in the bum. Grades no more than half your homework only to draw giant X's across your homework. Exams lengthy and time-consuming that, whilst at home over multiple days, requires you to dedicate a stupid amount of time. Lectures suck too. Horrible.

Worst Professor Ive ever had! His class consists of him ignoring all of your Carmen messages and emails, only posting lectures at either the afternoon or at 10pm on a Friday night, grading 2/6 problems on homework assignments that take hours, and not helping with homework for office hours. His lectures are just reading slides and doing no examples

Horrible lecturer who just reads from the textbook and does no helpful example problems. The other lectures he links to on youtube are better, but don't cover everything in the class. The homeworks and exams are extremely time consuming and impossible to get good grades on because of a ton of true/false questions that are graded very harshly.

Listen to everyone else: dont take this class with him. 4 HWs that take hours to do and only 25% of it is graded with no feedback. Lectures are read straight off the terrible ximera book he wrote. No examples at all. Office hours are little to no help. Similar HW problems cant be found anywhere. Even other textbooks dont help how hard this is

Avoid Professor Ogle AT ALL COSTS! His class is insanely difficult because his lectures are not helpful at all. He does not work through practice problems during lecture, but expects us to be able to solve hw problems without any help. He refuses to help with hw problems even when you show up to office hours at 6PM on a Friday - I do NOT recommend!

This was the worst class I have ever taken and the only class I have ever failed. The professor didn't care to help at all, he graded 5/20 questions on every homework with no partial credit, and the final exam, which he forgot to post, was worth half of the final grade. Can't recommend that you don't take this class enough. Ogle is the worst.

I took his class online during the spring 2021 term and his class was easily the worst I've taken at OSU. It seemed like it was his goal to interact with students as little as humanly possible. His textbook is just essentially a list of theorems and the homeworks are scavengers hunts from the book. On top of that he's the toughest grader I've had.

If I could get him a negative rating I would. This is everything I've endured this semester: 1) A ridiculous amount of true false questions for no partial credit 2) Doesn't explain what you miss on homework 3) Literally forgot to post our FINAL EXAM 4) 1 midterm with a d average 5) Final exam took 3 days to complete and was 50% of my grade

Probably the worst professor I've ever had (at least in an online class.) He barely even teaches, preferring to just read the textbook word for word in a monotone while barely explaining any of the concepts or definitions he comes across. Homeworks are too complex, and there's barely any partial credit. Also, the final is worth half the grade.

Honestly, classes were a drag. Your only available resource to learn is either the book, or the audio version of the book in which the professor reads word for word from slides directly ripped from the book. If you were hoping to get feedback on your homework, you better hope its one of the questions he grades and doesnt write ???. Dont take.

The worst online class I've ever taken. "Lectures" consisted of reading slides dragged straight from the textbook. He never does any examples that use actual numbers and each lecture was only about 15 minutes so it's not like he didn't have time. Grading was rough and no feedback was given. I learned more from Google and StackExchange than class

I took his class during the summer. You had to finish 20 written questions in each homework and only 5 questions would be randomly selected to grade. On the midterm or final exam, a T/F problem has the same point with a handwritten question including 5 small questions. which means if you got wrong with all T/F problems, you may lose the exam.

The lectures for this class are simply the prof reading the book. The book was awful, sometimes words essential for understanding were redacted or blocked by a yellow box? Absolutely no partial credit. No explanation for the grade you receive. Very very few points in the class overall. Rude in office hours. Seems not to have read the book at all.
He does not try. Drop this class and beg to take it with someone else.

Not good at teaching. His textbook is very dry and difficult to understand. Lectures are just the textbook read in a infuriatingly monotone voice. Focuses far too much on abstract, making it difficult to learn. Final had material that we had never actually worked on before, only read briefly. Feel like I didnt learn anything about linear algebra.

Everything is messed up! You get no good resource for learning linear algebra. The recorded lectures are just him reading the textbook on Ximera. Gradings rubrics are unclear. For Homework, they only graded random questions rather than grading every problems. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE is the best choice.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS AT ALL!!
the lecture is not helpful, you need to use the textbook

Bad, everything was so bad. There was no clear communication throughout the entire course. Grades rolled in weeks later, which was nice since we received no instructor responses for the majority of the semester. The lectures were so bad. He literally read the textbook word for word, and there were little to no examples in a MATH class. Do not take

This man is very unorganized, says he will upload a lecture one night then finally get around to us 4 days later. Day of the mid term exam, says he will upload it this evening. The man doesnt upload it till almost midnight EST. The finally exam had material that were not covered by his horrible lectures or the lectures he linked on YouTube

Drop any class you have with this prof. The lectures were online and he read straight off of his PowerPoint which was all theory with 0 concrete examples. Get ready to learn everything in your own as half the time he doesnt even upload the lectures and you have to beg him to teach the class. Exams are tough, homeworks take 5-10 hours to complete

Homework is due once a week, but they are pretty long problems. He doesnt even record his own lectures. He takes someone elses YouTube videos and posts them to a platform that we access to do this class. The YouTube dude isnt that great of a teacher (he basically teaches Ogles online class).

This class is for the kind of person who learns better by learning how to do things on their own. The textbook is hard to understand and the only video lectures he posts are of another professor that don't line up with the class. The info is easy enough to find online though and the exam questions are much easier than the homework questions.

Let me start by saying that I took this class in person rather than online. While his online class is rather infamous (avoid it), I'd say that he is an excellent lecturer in person. He can be a little mean sometimes but students that participate in the in-class discussions (i.e. he calls on students randomly and frequently) actually learn a lot.

He shouldn't "teach" an online class if he doesn't feel like actually teaching it. All he did was give us videos by some random guy from another school which didn't relate to the topics we were learning at all and give us the link to the textbook (which he wrote himself and has very few examples and is extremely difficult to understand).
Not the best teacher but not the worst either. He can have an interesting sense of humor if you get to know him. Put in some effort and you'll do fine.

I took Dr. Ogle's online class for 2568 (Linear algebra). My problems with this class: -Method of teaching is 1.) watch some videos from another prof 2.) read the textbook then 3.) do the homework. Literally did not give us any other resources -This guy wrote the textbook and it's awful. Impossible to learn from -Told me to teach myself everything

He is an old school professor. He never engaged the online class except reviewing the homework and exam. He use some lecture videos from YouTube. He does have math talent, I just feel he is poor at teaching.

The online textbook was very complex, had little relevance to the material, and had few examples. He also did not teach, but rather posted online lectures from a random lecturer that did not line up with the course. Only communication was though piazza, where he would respond very late and post homework very late. No feedback on homework or exams.

So he had an online textbook for this class with no examples, didn't point out what you did wrong on homework, only what you missed. There were online lectures from another random professor from a different school that barely lined up with the textbook or the order of the homework. Would not take his online class again.

Honestly speaking, if you don't have a solid mathematics standard like a graduate student or upperclass mathematics major student, you might find his lecture and textbook to be super-tough and hard to understand. Even if you are a math major student, you might not want to choose his class.

This class itself is awful and the material is entirely up to the professor, but if you can keep up with what is being said in lectures and meet with him a couple times to go over HW, you might actually learn something, which cannot be said for most professors in this course.

honestly i have never struggled in math before. taking this class as a freshman has ripped me apart and is the hardest thing ive taken. i am confused all the time and feel like he doesnt explain anything well at all. i would not recommend this professor at all.

He has great lectures where he clearly identifies how problems are solved from the beginning, and gives good example problems that will help you with homework and tests. The homework is heavy and very long but it helps you learn the material. Tests are very straightforward - he gives you review problem that will help you do well.

I had him for 2568. Tough class, even tougher grader. However, I found that even though he wasn't the nicest professor, he pushed me to be better. He emphasizes knowing your definitions, which is crucial for beginners in proofs. His lectures are cool. Good stories, really insightful. This professor changed the way I think about a lot of things.
Tons of homework. Tough exams. No curve.
Tough grader who did not willing to give partial credit!! DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR'S CLASS

I can tell that he professor is very intelligent, but he is kind of old school. There are a lot of homework, but you should expect that for a math course. The exam is not tough, and the grader is cool, but the average is a low 60. The lecture is not that useful, and you will definitely need to read the book. Otherwise you will not get the concept.

He has to be the most condescending professor I've ever had. He will interrupt you when you're trying to ask questions, and always has to be the loudest. He thinks you should just "get it" right away, it should be easy, when in fact he's just blabbering straight theory at you the whole class, and he wonders why no one gets it. NOT RECOMMENDED!

This teacher totally have no idea how to arrange the homework and test. I took his math2568 in Summer and we have to do at least 30 problems per week and we even have to hand in it in midterm week. The exam was not too hard but it's super time-consuming. He talked a lot of theories in the class but get lot of impossible matrix  transform problem .

This Teacher is not someone you should take if you are a student that depends on lectures. If you are good at reading the book and learning then its best not to attend class as he is extremely confusing and goes off-topic quite often. Overall he doesn't care about his students grades, and best if you take another teacher.

This class was the bane of my existence.  I was a math major at the time (haha) and to be honest I learned a ton of great stuff but and am thankful I took it but the homework is absurd in difficulty and time consumption.  The teacher is brilliant and does try to share his knowledge but he's not very good at actually teaching and helping the student

Crichton lacks respect for students and the teaching process in general. He will boil in frustration when you struggle. He will blame you for your bad note taking, attendance, heritage, ignorance, etc. At no point will it occur to him that he is a bad teacher.  Crichton, if you are reading this, please consider another profession.

The course is tough but he makes the class harder than it needs to be. He moved extremely fast through the material and most lectures were confusing. Would often show up 30 or more minutes late to his office hours, and even then those weren't very helpful. He once yelled at me for not knowing something I had never seen before. Don't take him.

2 weeks in and I dropped it as fast as I could. He will never answer your email- so don't even try ask him about office hours. When you finally get to office hours he tries to rush you out of there asap. Lastly, if you're a girl- good luck! Get ready to be ignored & undervalued compared to the rest of the boys in your class. Find a different prof!

If you take his summer Linear Algebra class, you WILL learn the material. His lectures are very participatory in that he expects students to be able to complete his sentences. Many times it's easy to do if you're paying attention. Sometimes not. His lectures are like having a textbook read aloud. He is very precise and specific. He's good but hard.

TERRIBLE TEACHER. DOES MORE DEFINITIONS THAN EXAMPLES IN CLASS. TALKS RANDOMLY MORE THAN HE TEACHES. ASSIGNS A BUNCH OF HOMEWORK BOOK PROBLEMS BUT ONLY GRADES 4 QUESTIONS PER HOMEWORK. EXAMS ARE IMPOSSIBLE. HE BARELY CURVES FINAL GRADES. OFFICE HOURS ARE USELESS, BECAUSE HE MAKES THE MATERIAL EVEN MORE CONFUSING. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS !!!!

SWITCH OUT OF HIS CLASS AT ALL COSTS IF YOU CAN. this guy is the absolute worst! This class is hard enough without him being an awful professor. Time consuming/impossible HW's and boring abstract lectures that leave you more confused then you were. Take someone else if you want your sanity.

Awful professor. Gives you a condescending look for every question you ask or wrong answer you give in class. Learned nothing in lecture, had to rely completely on the book and homeworks to learn the material.
Absolutely horrid. He assumes you know the material very well and does not explain all of the steps he takes. He is also very boring and monotoned.
Lectures were very boring and difficult to keep attention during. Sometimes lectures were useful, but usually he covered only the easiest of the material that most of the class already knew.

Continuously rambles through class, with a monotone demeanor. Tries to lighten up class with dry humor and overcomplicated math puns. Does a poor job of relaying examples to students and continuously goes against his own grading scale. I highly advise you not to take Dr. Ogle's class.

Fast paced (summer) class. It get really tough if you get even a day behind, but if something's not making sense he's able to explain it in a different way that it'll make sense to you either after class or in office hours (someone's always at his office hours). The grader's cool, too (though I don't know if this changes every term).
He always seemed annoyed with students. He didn't seem to handle questions well and was unhelpful preparing for exams. His version of review is basically reading the text book to the class.
Very monotone. He is an OK lecturer and tries to inspire class participation, but many of his explanations in lecture are abstract versus concrete examples.

He has a very dry sense of humor but is actually extremely funny.  Once you get used to how he teaches you will find the class very easy.  He doesn't show much emotion but he loves mathematics.  If you saw him outside of the classroom and didn't know him you would think he was mad at the world. Good teacher and the tests are exactly how he teaches.

Lecture is completely useless. Go to recitation, write down all the practice problems, do the odds in the back of each section you learn, get help with ones you can't figure out from your recitation teacher, and you will ace every midterm. I guarantee if you put the effort in, you'll do great. Really not a difficult class, way overrated.
Lectures were nearly pointless and I learned very little from them. Strongly recommend doing practice problems. Midterms are very difficult, but department makes them so he really can't be blamed.
