Only uses theorems and variables to teach his class. Gives really easy examples during lecture and puts the most difficult ones on the exam, would not recommend taking him unless you have a lot of experience in calculus already
He's the realist og I know
Very difficult but you will really understand linear algebra if you can keep up.
He was very helpful if you went to his office hours. Also his classes encouraged participation, which in a math course, is very rare.

Some exams were impossible for me because I had never taken calculus and it didn't click until halfway into the course(retook it and got a B because I never went to class because I thought I knew the material already)Departmental exam difficulty wasn't his fault, but him showing up in the last 5 minutes of his office hours just to shirk me off was.

He really knows his stuff but this class is super hard esp because of the midterms and final.  Do the hw and ask as many questions as you can. if you dont procrastinate too much then you should walk out with a B or so.
A really nice professor! I love his lecture. he is so smart and lecture was very informative.

The only good thing about his lecture was that it will put you to sleep. He uses big words and tries to make himself sound smart, rather than teach. I went to him for help once and he made me feel like an idiot. It is possible to do decent in his class if you took Calculus in high school but I would NOT RECOMMEND this guy at all.
Doesn't give a lot of examples in class. Monotonous voice. I had to rely on my TA A LOT.
does not teach well only uses theorems and definitions to teach however does not back it up with examples. find another teacher if you can prepare to fail final exam
His lecture does match with his extremely difficult exam!!!

He's an interesting teacher. Interesting in the way that I cannot describe him. He does have some unfair grading (i.e. little partial credit on exams) and his lecture is hard to follow. It is a bunch of words, theorems, and definitions. But overall, it isn't too terrible, if you have a good TA.
He gives alot of words and not alot of examples. He is an alright professor. If you can change the way you learn math, he'd be a great professor.
Awful

This professor is just so-so. His writing on the board makes me hard to identify. His class is kind of boring, but he sometimes gets a little funny too.(Just A LITTLE!) So I suggest you that if you don't want to go to his class, just read the book and maybe you can get an A(MAYBE!).

Took him in the summer for 571. Very, very difficult class. Moved extremely quickly. Graded very strict. Little partial credit on exams. The pace of the class made it considerably more difficult than it should have been, and it was not helped by his teaching style.
This professor makes Linear "Algebra" more complicated than it needs to be and goes over the materials too fast. I won't recommend taking him.

This is the most difficult math class I have ever taken.  The exams are not difficult, however there is not enough time to solve every question and then check your answers.  Never say "like", it is sandpaper to his ears.

Assigns a lot of homework.  Tests are tough.  However, he explains topics very well.  He's very "to the point".  Overall, he's a good teacher.  Do the homework, and study hard for tests and you'll be fine.

Clear and was able to explain topics well. Also very boring and tests were tough. Doesn't do very many examples so unless you have a good TA (I didn't) you'll be teaching yourself a lot of the material.
VERY hard exams.....class averages were usually around a 50...sometimes lower, one time higher... Unfair for the most part (coming from a student who had a 4.1 in high school)
Very good teacher.  Good at explaining all topics.  Overall a very smart guy.  I would definitely suggest him.

Difficult but fair professor.  I'm a fairly good student and I got a B, but I learned a ton of linear algebra.  Uses notation different than the book, so attendance is pretty critical.  As commented, earlier tests are about speed the final is very cumulative.  Tests were true to the (long) homeworks.  No major surprises.
Lots of examples and good explaination....tests were hard though

I thought this class was easy. He gave bonus exercises, which really helped a lot. Even with that, there was still a big curve. The only thing that sucked was that his tests usually had one question that involved definitions.

He's good. Very clear and _professional_. One problem is that his explanations become complicated for the sake of clarity. Somewhat dubious relation to engineering after the first chapter, but the class is still very interesting. Homework assignments are long, especially in the beginning, and exams are a time crunch. Very difficult, but good class.

he does not explain anything at a student's level of understanding. Very intelligent but do NOT take him especially if you are taking calculus for the first time. He wastes time going into irrelevent details and by no means prepares students for the standardized final.

Tough Teacher.  Definitely knows what he is teaching, has an incredible ability to reason through extremely complicated concepts.  If you go to class and really try and learn what he is saying, the class will be fine.  That being said, probably better off with another teacher.  Ogle is pretty tough.
Late to Class, assigned overzealous amounts of homework combined with a lack of teaching makes him the worst teacher I have ever seen. Avoid taking his class at all costs.
Boring, Late to Class, ridiculous amounts of homework.40 problems a week from 5 sections, thats at least 1 section a night, thanks for wasting every waking moment of my free time.
Very bad teacher ! Please dont take him....he's not helpful and takes pleasure in failing students.
Decent teacher, teaches alot of theories, and little examples.  Test are rather simple.  Very monotonic in his lectures.

He often spoke over our heads and seemed to take pleasure in doing so. Most of us got 5's on the AP Calc class but you wouldn't know it by our grades. He was available to "answer" questions,but made the material more confusing. He knows that the class is really difficult, so as long as you get at least 50%. you'l probably escape with a C.

I had a mixed experience. I wasn't really a fan of him originally because the class is so hard and he is sometimes confusing.  What's good about him though is that he really does want his students to succeed.  If you email him asking for help, he will be very good about helping in class or his office hours.  He understands that  the class is hard.

Terrible teacher.  He won't help you at all when you ask him a question. Does not always seem like he knows what he is talking about.  He works half way through the proof than has to erase it because he did it wrong.  If you can, drop him immediately and get another professor.

Hard to say whether or not he's a good teacher. Some days he's really nice and other days he bites your head off. Assigns a lot of homework and tries hard not to answer any homework questions directly, although he's fine with lecture questions. Tries to make the class hard when people are doing really well. He seems like a nice guy, but isn't easy.

This class can be hard or easy...he made it ridiculously hard.  Assigned at least 15 problems every week that had 2-5 parts to them so they took forever to do.  Will not help with homework and won't even give answers AFTER you've turned it in.  If the class does well on the first exam, he just makes the next one harder...take someone else!

Drop now, you pour soul. The homework is ridiculously time consuming, and the exam is too long for the time allotted. Uses a notation that is different from the book -- his notation makes more sense, but this will only confuse you more on hw. Doesn't seem to care if half the class fails. Stops lecture when he feels like it (25 after sometimes).
He presented the material well and was alway willing to help.  However he is a very hard grader.
No Comments

This is a difficult class compounded by an overly difficult teacher.  Lessons are convoluted and they stray from the book heavily.  DO NOT TAKE CLASS FROM THIS PROFESSOR IF YOU ARE AN ENGINEER!!!  This class has absolutely no relevance to engineering after the 2nd chapter.

I didn't think the guy was that bad. He is a little boring. Although, he does crack the occasional joke (albeit dry humor). His curve is minimal at best. For example, the cutoff for an A is 92 or something like that. But, you can do much worse than Prof. Ogle (see Dynin, Alexander) for math.

That dude sucked.  He looks like Agent Smith from the Matrix.  Always good for a linear algebra guy.  I always wanted him to say Mr Anderson but he never did...   DON'T TAKE HIM!!!!  Oh, he used the exact tests from previous years.

I thought his explanations were clear and his presentation methodical.  He was helpful outside of class as well.  His grading is unforgiving and somewhat harsh, but at least it was consistent with everyone.  I would take him again.

Absolutely terrible teacher.  Gave no curve in the class where a large number were failing.  Gave almost no examples in class. This combined with his lectures being completely different from the book both in notation and content made homeworks impossible. Very condescending and degrading to students

The subject matter is quite difficult, but he makes it relatively clear.  His style and notation differs from that in the book, but he still assigns book problems that are often too tough to handle.  Very easy to mess up on the 2 midterms.  Unfortunately, he doesn't curve.  Good luck getting an A.
It's a hard class, no curve. Unless ur really good with the material, don't take this class.  It's hard to get an A.
I think he is great, his tests were not that hard, and though he might seem booring, his lectures do give out really good ideas that saves you a bunch of time if you apply it to homework and tests.

Absolute worst Math teacher ever!  Both times I've had him are the two worst grades I have ever gotten in Math.  He strays from the book, is boring as hell, and comes to class late.  Unless you are forced to take his class, DON'T!!!
Unclear in his teachings and hardly showed any care in student's progress.

Three  midterms .  I ACED every one (one perfect).  average of them was in the 50%'s.  Then was unfair and made final too hard.  got a D.  Ended class with a B because of NO CURVE.  He failed over half the class. I deserved an A, others deserved to pass!
Always late to class, and he wasn't even very helpful.
BORING AS HELL, I couldn't even go to lecture.
This man's more boring than an Al Gore interview.  He's quite peculiar looking.
blahhh
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Jing is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, characterized by his willingness to assist students and creating a relaxed classroom atmosphere. Students consistently report a positive learning experience and would be willing to take his course again.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jing is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, characterized by his willingness to assist students and creating a relaxed classroom atmosphere. Students consistently report a positive learning experience and express a desire to take his courses again.

Ratings.comment: Handsome, willing to help, with a chill classroom vibe, good experience, would take again

summary_comment: Professor Cuenca is known for his genuine passion for mathematics and clear, concise lectures, though his exams are often perceived as difficult and heavily weighted. Students appreciate his helpfulness during office hours and his willingness to adjust exam grades. However, some find his teaching style challenging and his midterms particularly tough, leading to low averages and dissatisfaction among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cuenca is known for his deep passion for mathematics and clear, concise lectures, though his exams are often perceived as difficult and heavily weighted. Students appreciate his helpfulness during office hours and his willingness to adjust grades, but many find his teaching style challenging and some advise avoiding him for introductory courses.

Ratings.comment: Class was fine, but the midterms were too difficult.

Genuinely, nobody loves mathematics more than Cesar. The content of this course is difficult, but don't confuse it with Cesar's teaching ability. His lectures are clear and to the point. He's an extremely nice guy who simply loves math. He is a strict grader, but he does adjust and curve the exam grades. He's extremely helpful in his office hours.

One of my favorite Math profs at OSU. The class content is very challenging but he breaks it down and explains it very well. I attended all of his office hours and he was very kind and supportive. He's a tough grader and rather blunt but a great professor. Very open to suggestions and helping students succeed. Go to office hours if you need help!!

If you have to take Intro to Analysis, do not take it with Cesar Cuenca. His midterms are difficult and weighted heavily. He also doesn't care about student feedback. His lectures are hard to follow and he insists on letting the textbook be the primary resource for the class. This intro class shouldn't have been as hard as it was. Avoid.

Has to be one of the worst profs I have ever had in the three years that I have been at OSU. There are only two midterms and they were both extremely difficult and worth a lot of your grade. The class average on the first exam was a 50%. He says that he might have made things too hard but then does nothing about it and rarely gives partial credit.

summary_comment: Professor Tiglay is known for her helpfulness during class and flexible grading policies, allowing students to perform well despite missing some lectures. However, opinions vary significantly; while some praise her clear lectures, detailed explanations, and generous partial credit on exams, others criticize her unorganized lectures, difficulty in understanding complex concepts, and unexpectedly challenging final exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tiglay is known for her helpfulness during class and flexible grading policies, allowing students to perform well despite missing some sessions. However, opinions vary significantly, with some praising her clear lectures and availability, while others find her lectures unorganized and her exams challenging.

Ratings.comment: She was very helpful when I actually attended class. Now, at the end of the semester, I didn't go to class for the entire last month and still finished with an A. I did miss points because of attendance, but the way she grades tests with the partial credit allowed me to score high on every test. My class was a hybrid class, so lectures on your own.
Would highly recommend, great at lectures and instructing, though it might depend on how you learn. Personally   I like how she grades exams

Dr. Tiglay was a very kind, and understanding professor. I am not the best source when it comes to her teaching since I had already taken this class in high school, but she was always good at answering questions about problems and being flexible if you had to miss class even though it was mandatory.

Dont take her class. Shes not helpful when you ask questions she just rambles and doesnt answer - exams are so difficult cause of how she grades - notes and lectures are just jumbled and confusing! The final project is so much work but only 16 points. Dont recommend although shes a nice lady.

Lectures are very good, with many examples. I would suggest going to all lectures and reading the book prior to class. Homework is from the book and is optional, but I highly recommend doing it, as test questions look very similar to homework/lecture questions. She is available often for office hours, in fact I would go there as often as I could.

AVOID AVOID AVOID. Lectures are very unorganized and she completes multiple steps in her head without telling the class why or how to complete certain steps. Does not explain concepts in a manner that is easy to understand. I've been an "A" student all through college math classes until this class. I will be lucky to end with a C.

The first time I took this class with Rao Vidynath and personally I think she blew him out the water. She gives hw problems from the book that you arent required to do but its a good practice. She tries to give you as much points as possible on exams questions you got wrong. Gave extra credit in my class.

AVOID. I took Dr. Tiglay's class to polish my Calc skills (haven't done Calc since senior year of HS). Everything was a breeze since I took AP Calc, however her Final Exam. Terrible. Class average was a 45%. Highest grade in the class was a 54% with the 15% grade curve. She literally puts new material on the final that you never cover in class.
honestly a really good teacher!

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! Although she is a very nice person, she is a horrible teacher. Her notes are all over the place and her example problems are completely different from the questions on the test. She is always confused and when asked a question gets more confused. She awards little to no partial credit and is a very hard grader. Stay Away!!!

LISTEN! She is an extremely tough grader and gives little to no partial credit. She does not give very good feedback at all, and when she does, questions were not answered and more were added into the mix. When you have to add A thirty point curve to the final exam you know something went wrong. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! LISTEN TO THIS WEBSITE'S COMMENTS

She is  extremely passionate about the courses she teaches. In favor of this professor, she really does care about the student. She makes herself available for the student and takes time out to answer questions about homework. Unfortunately, her teaching style is extremely confusing and her tests are pretty moderate if you study. Good luck!

She always seems very confused. Students had to correct her almost every day. She tries to answer your questions, but does not answer them well. Sometimes she would forget until the end of class to hand out notes after lecture is done. Very unorganized. Does not do well with explaining things. Would not recommend her to anyone.

Awful teacher. messed up multiple times while teaching and had to start all over and had to be corrected by students. seemed confused most of the time and didn't teach in an organized way. went through lectures fast and not very nice.

summary_comment: Professor Huang is a knowledgeable lecturer who teaches the material effectively but struggles with creating a relaxed classroom environment, which can make students feel nervous. His lectures are helpful when combined with office hours, where he is open to answering questions, though these sessions are often crowded. Students find the exams to be conceptually challenging and heavily based on homework and lecture examples, making consistent practice essential for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Huang is a knowledgeable lecturer who teaches the material well but struggles with creating a relaxed classroom environment, leading to nervousness among students when called upon. His exams are challenging and conceptually heavy, often requiring extensive understanding and practice, though his office hours are helpful for clarifying concepts.

Ratings.comment: Make sure you understand all the concepts on the homework. I didn't, so that's why I got a B. Use his office hours to clear up your understanding of the concepts. His lectures are decent, but the exams are very conceptual and demand a lot of understanding and practice to do well.

He is a good professor who has a true passion for the material. The homeworks are long, but they really help you understand the material. Make sure to participate in class, because it may help you if you are on the edge of the grading scale at the end of the semester.

Generally ok/good lectures and are helpful in office hours. Respectable mathematician.

HOWEVER, there is no TA nor recitation for this class. The prof has 2 office hours a week for BOTH sections that are always packed and that is it. No study guides, no practice finals, not accessible for questions.

An amazing lecturer who is always open to answer questions and re-explain things during the middle of lecture. His Linear Algebra class is quite hard but it is very fair in my opinion. The midterms and final are heavily based on the homework and examples from lecture. Only grades are homework and midterms and sometimes homework is super long.

Not an option but I took 4530. Anyways, I went to almost every office hours and it barely improved my grade.  I ended up purchasing chegg just because of this class. Even after purchasing chegg I still didn't get the grades I wanted. Tests are too hard and can have content that wasn't reviewed. For second midterm I got 57% and was above the mean.

- His accent takes a little getting used to
- He doesn't record lectures
- He doesn't take attendance
- He doesn't use slideshows, only the chalkboard

Dr. Huang knows the material and teaches it well, but he doesn't do a good job of creating a relaxed atmosphere during lectures. People are nervous whenever he asks a question to the class.

He does not offer any recorded lecture videos or notes on Carmen, but he does not take attendance as well, which means you have to attend his in-person class EVERY TIME or you will miss something covered. Exams are extremely difficult and the avg is only 50% and you need to pay extra much more effort for this 3 credit course. Again, VERY HARD.

Math 1152: Calculus 2. Applied Math student here. He is the nicest Professor I have taken at OSU, but the DAMN COVID-19 broke out in March 2020. I could definitely reach an A if is in person!! He prepares for every lecture carefully. Really willing and accessible to help students after class. I would definitely rate a high score for Prof. Huang.
he's always willing to help students
Professor Huang gives very clear and concise lectures. The homework can be challenging but he is very helpful in Office hours. Almost always ran out of time on test.
His accent was very thick, but I got used to it as things went on. While he may not explain things clearly, he knows his stuff and is always willing to help.

Exams are extremely difficult and given not enough time. Exams are basically entire grade. Lecture is hard to understand due to his accent. Exams graded very hard. Hardest class at OSU. Had an A in Math1151 (calculus 1) and now a C- in Math 1152 (calculus 2)
Super nice and caring professor who teaches a difficult class, he seems to genuinely enjoy teaching and he is super funny

My biggest problem with Prof. Huang's teaching was a lack of resources. No feedback on homework, no practice tests or solutions to study. I had to buy a subscription to Chegg for the sole purpose of giving myself practice problems for the final. His lectures are okay but he can sometimes be sassy when you ask a question.

Professor Huang's calc 1 lectures are by far the least interactive among all the other professors, by comparison to my peers. He essentially only does practice problems on the board with little to no conceptual explanation. Additionally, the tests are not graded in accordance to quiz grading standards which makes it difficult to know what to expect

Calculus 1 was the hardest class that I have taken in my entire life so far. I did not really enjoy my professor either because he didn't really make the lecture interactive. Lecture normally consisted of him giving definitions and working questions on the board. Recitation, however, was very interactive and helpful. Be prepared to work very hard.
I am not criticizing his intelligence. He is very smart and knowledgeable about the material, perhaps TOO knowledgeable... I did not pass his class and ended up having to retake 1151 during Sum19.

Professor Huang is a pretty decent professor, and he explained the material relatively well. That being said, the subject is a little complicated and you definitely have to put in effort yourself. Don't buy into their being a big curve, we only had a curve of roughly 1%, and definitely read the textbook. Homework is graded very tightly too.

SEI.Subject: MATH
SEI.Class Name: Linear Algebra and Differential Equations for Engineers

summary_comment: Professor Kahle is highly regarded as one of the best instructors, known for his clear and detailed explanations without overwhelming students with tests or quizzes. He focuses primarily on homework, fostering a deep understanding of combinatorics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kahle is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for providing clear and detailed explanations without overwhelming students with tests or quizzes, instead relying on homework. Students strongly recommend both his course and him to others seeking a deep understanding of combinatorics.

Ratings.comment: Excellent professor, one of the best I have ever had. Clear-cut in detail (but not overwhelming), and he did not give any tests or quizzes, only homework. I would recommend this course and Professor Kahle to anyone interested in truly learning combinatorics.

summary_comment: Professor Carolyn Johns is widely regarded as having an extremely challenging teaching style, particularly in calculus courses, with tests often significantly more difficult than the material covered in homework, lectures, or recitations. Students find her grading standards to be harsh and inconsistent, and many advise against taking her classes due to her lack of helpfulness and tendency to make grading errors without correction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carolyn Johns is widely regarded as having an extremely challenging teaching style, with tests significantly more difficult than the material covered in homework, lectures, and recitations. Students find her grading to be harsh and often frustrating, with many recommending avoiding her classes altogether due to her unhelpful approach and tendency to make grading errors.

Ratings.comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!! This is likely the most difficult calculus class for no valid reason. The lessons, homework, and recitations don't do much to prepare you for tests. The tests are a whole nother level of difficulty. The only way you could take this online course is if you're crazy smart when it comes to math. Good luck

Carolyn Johns made this class exceedingly difficult for me. I was entirely unprepared for the first exam that I took for her class because the homework, online lectures, textbook, and recitation for her class were nothing like the test and offered no preparation. I transferred to another section to escape the grade slaughter. Do not take her class.

Calculus at Ohio State is just generally hard, but when you factor in Carolyn Johns' impossibly hard grading standards, it gets worse. Even one of her TAs said he had never taught a class that was graded so harshly.  She might be a lovely person, but she is not a lovely professor to have.
Would not recommend taking any classes involving her. Not helpful at all. Makes mistakes in grading and refuses to rectify said mistakes. Most frustrating instructor I have ever had.

summary_comment: Professor Giovanni is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, offering detailed explanations and effective preparation for quizzes. Students find him extremely helpful and easier to understand than the main professor. Quizzes are frequent but straightforward, allowing students to consistently achieve high scores.
summary_comment_short: Professor Giovanni is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, providing detailed explanations and extensive preparation for quizzes, which are typically easy to excel in. Students find him exceptionally helpful and easier to understand than the main professor.

Ratings.comment: Giovanni is one of the recitation profs for Sean Sanford. Gio is the best! He is so helpful and explains everything in detail. He was easier to understand that the actual prof. Quizzes every other week usually consisting of 1-3 questions in 15 min. He prepares you for each quiz very well. It is very easy to get 10/10 on most quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor Wagner is known for making complex concepts accessible and for being a supportive instructor outside of class. However, his classes are heavily test-driven, with exams being quite challenging, particularly the final, which averaged around 50%. Homework is graded rigorously, adding to the overall difficulty.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wagner excels in making complex concepts accessible, though his classes are test-heavy with relatively easy tests but tough homework grading. Despite the challenging exams, students find him helpful outside of class, yet the significant weight of exams can lead to low overall grades.

Ratings.comment: Professor Wagner is a very nice professor and made hard concepts easier to understand. While this class is very test-heavy, most tests are generally easy. The one issue is with the homework assignments, which are graded extremely toughly.

I took linear algebra with Professor Wagner and it was the most difficult class I've taken here at OSU. The professor was nice and helpful outside class. However, exams were super difficult. 70% of your grade is based on midterms and a final (30%). The final exam average was 50%. I studied a lot for his exams but ended up with a bad grade.

summary_comment: Professor Gu is known for his easygoing demeanor and ability to simplify complex concepts, making them accessible to students. Tests are generally straightforward, and he is lenient with grading. However, his lack of online lecture notes necessitates attending his classes, and homework must be submitted in paper form rather than through Canvas.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gu is known for his easygoing nature and ability to simplify complex concepts, making them easier to grasp. His tests are generally straightforward, and he is lenient with grading, though students must attend his classes to access lecture materials since no online notes are provided, and homework must be submitted as paper copies.

Ratings.comment: Weichen Gu is an easygoing professor, and he makes generally complex concepts seem easy to understand. The tests are mostly easy, and he is a lenient grader. One thing he doesn't do is post online lecture notes, which means you have to attend his class in order to get the material. In addition, homework submissions are paper copies, not on canvas.

summary_comment: Professor Ferdinand's teaching quality is generally poor, according to student feedback. Students report extremely low homework and test scores, with one exam having an average score of only 57%. Lectures are described as confusing, with unclear definitions and a heavy emphasis on detailed explanations for simple problems. The class structure, including daily attendance grading and timed, stressful exams, has led many to advise against taking the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ferdinand's teaching quality is consistently low, as evidenced by very poor homework and test scores, and many students found the class difficult and stressful. Lectures were often confusing, with unclear definitions and a heavy emphasis on detailed explanations for basic concepts, leading to high stress during timed exams.

Ratings.comment: This is a class that starts with 1, the homework score is very low, the test score is very low.

Worst class and professor at OSU. This is a 1000-level class; the first exam mean was a 57. That is absurd. It is math you learned in 4th grade (4th grade is generous), and you are expected to write out 500 steps to find x in y=mx+b. A, you should not take this class. B, If you take this class and get Vic, drop it immediately.

I feel like I ended up teaching myself more the content than he did, spent lectures lost and confused. We also never got clear definitions for the content we were expected to know and incorporate into the homework and exams. Exams are timed and typically at night on the computer which became very stressful. Do not recommend!

Cons: If you want a review math class, just find a different course. Difficult grader on homework- you have to explain why you did every single step in every problem. Attendance graded every day. Talks a lot. Class long for no reason

Pros: Exams resemble study guides. He seems to care. Don't really need to pay attention. Homework ~every two weeks.

Good intentions. Yapper. Bad jokes and a little out of touch. Makes easy things so confusing. I excelled in HS math thru calc, took this as a GPA boost- I feel like I understand math less after talking his class. Homeworks are graded on explaining the obvious and unnecessary. Never got a 10/10 on HW. Attendance graded out of 3 for every class.

Vic is a nice guy but not the best professor. I took the class because I wanted an easier math class, but it wasn't what I expected. There is a weekly homework packet that is due every week. Exams can get complicated because you have to over-explain everything in this class. I recommend taking this class online and avoiding this professor.
Really disappointed with this professor. He is more interested in telling jokes than teaching. Every problem with the class he said is the fault of the "department". Avoid at all costs

If you are neurodivergent, I don't recommend taking a class with Vic. He is an incredibly kind person and it is clear that he cares about his students, but the way the course was set up was very limiting and explanations could be very confusing at times.

Worst teacher or professor I have ever had. I am only a few weeks in to be honest but it is awful. The class is super easy material but we are expected to write 7 steps out for super simple questions. It is tedious and graded really harshly. Avoid this professor.

Horrible professor. Nice guy, but does not know how to teach a math class. Extremely unorganized with his notes. Luckily I had many past experiences with math so I pretty much knew the material, but if it wasnt for that I wouldve failed this class due to the terrible and unorganized way of teaching. Do not recommend

Dr. Ferdinand is incredibly difficult to understand, he spend the entire class period making jokes about math and tries to teach content in the last minute. So hard to follow, will say things like watch out for this about how the tests are graded but is never clear enough to be helpful. If youre not naturally good at math, DONT TAKE HIS CLASS.

He's really cheesy Dr ferdinand is not the best professor but definitely not the worst he genuinely cares about students and wants all of them to be able to understand the content the hardest thing honestly is the class just make sure you're understanding everything You can bomb one of the midterms but you need to make sure you can bounce back

He's really dorky and tells a lot of jokes during his lectures, but he cares about his students and tries to explain things as simply as possible. His lectures mostly consist of him writing out problems on an overhead and talking them through. Online homework once a week, and a short quiz every week in recitation.

Vic is a great guy and you can tell he really truly enjoys teaching math, but he is so hard to follow. If you aren't great at understanding conceptual math I would look for someone else. Vic is great at going on long metaphorical tangents that explain why math stuff works, but without my recitation & textbook I would've probably failed the class.

Vic was an absolutely incredible professor in my class of 11 people. He could get off topic and loved to make jokes that were confusing, but in a smaller class setting, it was easy to get back on topic. Still, I've never known someone who cares so much about his students and their success. If you put in the effort you will learn so much from him.

Vic is very condescending and will make you feel like a complete idiot. He contradicts himself constantly; I never really knew what terminology I was/wasn't allowed to use in the class which was very frustrating.  If you participate in class and go to the tutor room you may get out with a B but it will be very difficult.

I did not rate this professor because he was HORRIBLE!! jokes weren't funny, off topic often, boring and anything else you can think of that is really bad! Pros- he is a really nice person genuine, and the class didn't take attendance because of the class size

He is confusing but is helpful if you ask for it.  Lectures get boring and he tries to fit in what he wants in the last 2 minutes.  He gets off topic sometimes. Overall I didn't mind him as much as everyone else did and did fairly well in his class, you just have to know exactly what he is looking for as he is a tough grader.

Vic makes it hard to understand the material. He is unclear with what he is teaching at times. I passed the class with an A, but I taught myself the information more than he taught me. When you ask questions, he makes you feel stupid at times and doesn't even answer them for you. This class was only frustrating because I had Vic as the professor.

He is probably the strictest grader out of all the professors that teach MATH 1125. Also he doesn't really explain anything and I feel like when i go to lecture I end up more confused. The T.A is more helpful.
Vic is a very confusing when he tries to explain stuff. But his jokes are so unique. Don't count your hatches before they chicken!

Good guy and a good TA. He really cared about students and tried to make sure the material was understandable. The class isn't the easiest but Vic did make it a bit easier by showing us a lot of examples during recitation.  He would also work out any problem you would ask.
Not helpful at all. I dreaded going to this class daily. He is a really harsh grader and the midterms/finals are difficult. Also his jokes are NOT FUNNY! If you have the option try and get Betsy.
Very picky when explaining. I still have not found what he wants from the homework.  Jokes are really not that funny. Makes simple things seem extremely confusing.
Vic is the MAN. Great professor, awesome guy!

Vic is a very poor professor.  We mainly taught ourselves in groups how to do the problems with very little guidence from him.  It was a boring class that I dreaded going to everyday.  I had to google concepts to do math homework.  His test are extremely difficult.  Afford him if all possible.

Vic really cares about each student.  He would be willing to stay after class or meet before class with people to make sure they were understanding material.  While the information is not the most exciting ever, Vic tries his best to make his side interesting.

Had him a few years ago for Math 151. He's a very good professor, but man, sometimes he is just excruciatingly boring. I really struggled to pay attention sometimes (although that was more my fault than his). He has a really weird sense of humor and tells jokes that are so bad that they are hilarious. Very helpful to stay after class/office hours.

He is awful, If you can avoid getting him do it. His lectures are so incredibly boring and he makes no sense. we were ALWAYS behind, and we would take quizes on information we learned 2 weeks prior. Bottom line is try your hardest to not get him, he is a nightmare.

Had him during winter quarter. Kind of a weird guy, but he tells some jokes that are usually so bad that they're funny. He was decent at teaching the content and answering questions, but he sometimes overcomplicated simple questions, and he was a very picky grader (you HAD to write down every step you took). Other than that, he was great.

I have a love hate relationship with Vic. I love that he was genuinely interested in helping students if you came to him. I hate that he was such a tough grader and expected so much. He was hard to understand in class, and made dumb jokes. Love Vic as person, not as a teacher.

He is very helpful! I was going to miss a class before the final and he stayed after class and went over all of what was to be covered the next class. I had him at 8:30AM so, the jokes really didn't go over to well, but it could have been because everyone was still tired. :)

Vic is a very friendly guy that teaches extremely well! As a student taking an OSU course for the first time, he taught really well, and was very helpful. His funny jokes and stories helped reduce the stress, and he's a very fair grader. GREAT PROFESSOR! Wouldn't mind for Math 152. I don't know what these people mean, never had a bad experience.

Vic is a great teacher, I dont know what these other people are talking about. Sure sometimes when he gets talking its a little difficult to get him to stop but he teaches the material well, and tells really funny/corny jokes. I really recommend him
Great teacher! Amazing teaching techniques, keeps you really engaged! I love his jokes! Great guy and an amazing teacher, I just finish Math 101 and I'm really going to miss it!

What a great guy. He does a great job teaching theories. Makes himself available for help in the lab and really does a great job. Very nice guy and tells ridiculous jokes. Sit in the front of class and participate to really do well

Vic is a horrible professor.  Can't get his point across and wastes time trying to.  Pickiest grader I have ever had. Althought he is funny, its useless to be in the class but yo have to because attendance is mandatory. Overall=horrible.

Vic overall is just not good at staying on topic and clearly stating what he means. Just cannot get his meaning across because he gets lost on pointless tangents. I simply ignore him when he is lecturing and pay attention only when he's finally addressing the problem at hand. That and I learn mostly from my group members when we word together.

I took Vic for both 105 & 106, and have miss him during 107.  At first, he seems like a very hard teacher but once you get to know him you will appreciate him.  He is very willing to help you, even if you are not in his secion of the class.  Go to him when you need help.
very picky
picky grader

I wrote the last comment but wasn't finished with what I wanted to say. Vic's style of teaching is exactly what every classroom needs!! He doesn't talk about useless things or waste anyone's time. His classes are worth taking and I plan to take more of his classes even though they are not required for my major b/c Vic is awesome and I learned a LOT

He is NOT a bad teacher. He is trying to get people to think how their explanations sounds to children. He is very specific on word use and if you go to class and use the words he likes, he grades quizzes and tests very fairly. Homework is a lot of busy work, but not class. I learned a lot.
The class is very boring and he can deff confuse you when it is not needed. Must go to class and do homework.

He's boring and talks too much about nonsubject related things. His class is mostly busywork. I learn everything I need from resitation (don't skip it, it's the only time you'll figure out what's going on). Lots of homework and lecture will seem to drag on forever. Would never ever choose to take a class taught by him.
He is an awesome professor, but I had to work.  I wanted to try whining and crying to get my grade, but he would not tolerate that, I actually had to work

Vic is a nice guy who does not communicate his thoughts well.  He doesn't explain things well and he gives out a ridiculous amount of homework.  If you have a good TA that will help, and taking advantage of the tutor room makes a huge difference.  All I can say is good luck, because this class will be your life for the duration of the quarter.

I worked my butt of in this class and still struggled. I never had a problem w/ math til now. I'm not great but come on!! Somehow w/ a D on the midterm and a C- on the final, I ended w/ a B for my final grade. Whatever...I needed that grade
This class was very difficult...He was not a good teacher...He did not prepare our class for Midterms or Finals...
This class is so hard
had a wonderful way of confusing the crap out of students.  complicated simple problems, and didn't prepare well for exams or homeworks.  if you get him, pray for a really good TA
I saw him on the street and he was pretty cool then, so i am giving a good rating. You're soooo cool dude!!!!
Has an interest in teaching, but tends to way overcomplicate very simple math problems.  He'll keep going an going on the same topic.  The class does make you think and he's always willing to help.
Not as bad as his reputation if you do his work and go to classes.  The curve is unreal and if you do the work you'll do fine.  People don't do well because they won't do the homework.

Don't take him for this course. Go to CSCC and take it. You feel like you understand the material and then the test comes and it is completely different. Tests are so long that you will not finish in time. The tests are all theories.
zzzzzzz
His lecture's sucked, expected way too much without giving time to work up to those expectations, did not give nearly enough time for exams... however there was a huge curce.
Awesome. One of the nicest math teachers I've met. He was really good at explaining things and never made you feel dumb. Roxana was an awesome TA. I really liked Ferdinand as a prof.

You do mostly group work, which is good because he doesn't lecture...ever.  He won't give you answers and wants you to explain EVERYTHING in detail.  The tests are hard because of the time limit you have, but there is a great curve.  Go to every class or you will be lost.  Do your homework.
Vic is not a bad teacher, he just makes his tests too long!  Curve is nice, and if you don't let the concepts scare you, the class is not too bad.
teaches concept and can be hard but if you need help he is there to help. Everyone fails his test, but there is a huge cure. I got A's in 117-105-105, but he made me think.
He is crazy!!
Not an easy class, but a great teacher.  Very helpful.  He tries to keep it interesting...but watch out for the final!
This guy is the man.  All you have to do is show up at this class and he breaks everything down very clearly for you.  He tells some bad jokes, but that's ok.

summary_comment: Professor Wang is a dedicated instructor whose passion for the subject is evident, though his teaching style can be challenging due to his accent and complex explanations. Despite this, students appreciate his willingness to help and stay after class. Some find his lectures difficult to follow, but many still recommend attending for those who can understand him, especially noting his flexibility and support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wang is a dedicated instructor whose passion for the subject matter is evident, though his teaching style can be challenging due to his English proficiency and sometimes confusing presentation methods. Despite these challenges, students appreciate his willingness to help and stay after class, and many find success when they can understand his lectures and attend recitations.

Ratings.comment: He was hard to understand but that just made me pay attention more to get what he was saying. He was a great teacher and his interest in the subject showed. Overall I really liked him as an instructor.

I took Math 151 and then took Math 132 and it was extremely easy. I took the night class which was only 2 times a week and some/most of the days we did not go the entire time. Reviews before the midterms of 'very' detailed questions. Easy 'A.'

Very hard to understand, for his english is pretty bad.  Also he was confusing in the way he taught the material.  Goofy guy, means well.  Always willing to help. But hard to follow and understand material presented.

Not the greatest teacher but very understandable. Took 6 quizzes and almost everyone I would get at least 1 problem wrong yet I always got a 10/10. Even though homework isn't mandatory he looks favorably on those who do it. If you can get him definitely try for it.

If you can understand him, attend recitation..you should be fine....he stays after class to answer questions and tries to be a clear as he can with the subject matter...very flexible and understanding

summary_comment: Professor Dynin is widely regarded as one of the worst professors, with students citing his heavy accent, difficulty in understanding, and poor teaching methods as significant issues. Many students found the class extremely challenging and stressful, with low attendance and high dropout rates. While some appreciated the depth of the material, the consensus is that his teaching style makes it nearly impossible to grasp the concepts without additional resources or significant effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dynin is widely regarded as one of the worst professors, with students citing issues such as poor communication, difficulty understanding lectures, and challenging exams. Many students recommend avoiding his class unless they are committed to putting in significant extra effort for the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Aweful. Stay away.

Without a doubt the worst professor that I have ever had. We started the class with ~55 students and ended with ~20. He hardly ever did examples in class, he spoke quietly and faced the blackboard, he did not explain many of the topics well, and he skipped entire sections of material on midterm review days.

Cannot bear this class anymore. I took every note from the blackboard and read them again and again. Got no clue even when I highly concentrate. I immediately dropped this class after 2 weeks. I don't know if another professor would be good. But know won't be worse and I may have chance holding the high GPA
Dynin has a very heavy accent and is hard to understand. He doesn't explain the material well and often confuses English words with something non-English.

Only take this class if you want to a thorough understanding of linear algebra. You will have to work harder and most likely not receive the grade you like by the end. I enjoyed the class, so I recommend it if you go into for the learning opportunity. I absolutely do not recommend it, if your looking to just get by, because you wont.

Nice guy but, has a heavy accent, speaks very softly, makes mistakes on white board, has a hard time understanding where the mistakes are when you ask him about them (usually starts explaining something else until someone goes up and points it out), difficult tests on theory (so you better understand everything), and does not curve.

Drop him while you can. You honestly cannot understand anything he says. He doesn't follow the book, he does it his own way and if you don't do it his way, you are wrong. I learned from the book and got a 26 on my first midterm because I did not do it his way. I dropped because i did not want to fail and screw my GPA.

Not helpful at all and he says that you are supposed to read the book and do homework BEFORE his class to prepare for the upcoming lecture. Whew, good luck to anyone taking this... He also tells you the first day that he does not use numbers and also says that you will not get an 'A' in the class. He talks to the board and not the class.

Just drop, you cannot understand anything he says.  He teaches with his back to the class and mumbles. He laughs at the class when someone asks to do an example.  No one passes his class.  Save yourself the trouble and drop or don't even take his class. other classes average 90 or above on tests and his class it is around 40

The very first thing he said, day one, was that his lectures wouldn't be following the book.  He expected us to do all the homework and reading prior to class.  If we're supposed to teach ourselves how do the work before lecture, what is the point of lecture?  And when the test material has nothing to do with lecture or the book...

Nothing good to say about this prof. I met with him during his office hours, he gave me 15 minutes to ask my questions, there was no appointment after either. He doesn't enjoy his job, he seems to dislike answering questions and when he does, they are extremely difficult to decipher through his accent and 'theory'.

His lectures are really helpful if you really pay attention in class, although he has a very strong accent. Besides, his exams are really hard (I just got 61 in the 3rd midterm and I got the second highest score). Anyway, in his MATH 513, 80 percent is an A, why not do it?

He is the worst professor I have even had in my life. The level in exam and homeworks does not much(exams are way harder!). He allows open note during mid term and open book and note during final, but does not really help. You will find some problems that you have never seen in either in book or lecture. Do not recommend anyone to take this class!

Prof. Dynin is a brilliant mathematician. He is also, however, incredibly hard to learn from. His writing is illegible and if he speaks loudly enough for anyone to hear him, his words are incomprehensible. Expect to spend plenty of time outside of class reading the (wonderful) book. Open-note tests are 100% theory (some not in the book) and proofs.

Dr. Dynin is a fine fellow and clearly a brilliant mathematician, but has substantial flaws as an instructor. Expect to learn the material thoroughly, but note that the his exams are excruciatingly difficult and will not correspond in difficulty to either lecture or homework problems. Notes allowed on exams, but not useful. Do not expect an A.

Drop NOW. Don't think just do it. Even if it costs you an extra year at Ohio State. He is a TERRIBLE teacher. He is useless in class and he tests are incomprehensible. Go to the dept. chair and ask him to put you in a different lecture or don't take the class if your don't want to destroy your GPA.
Arguably he has one of the most lenient grading policies I've encountered. That said, he is an awful lecturer, prone to mistakes and lack of clarity, and he makes really difficult exam questions.
TERRIBLE! Thank god I dropped him. He talks to himself and not to the class. He can't write. He can't speak. Drop immediately. I'm surprised he is allowed to teach at OSU.

It was hard to understand both his speaking and writing, and he made a significant amount of mistakes during lectures and on exams. The exams were based on his lectures and you can use your notes. I thought he was helpful in office hours if you are patient and I never got the vibe that he was a mean person.

It's an atrocity that this guy is a teacher after all these years.  Has some kind of crazy vendetta against the book, despite the fact that you can't understand anything he says unless he's screaming at you.  The worst professor I've ever had, refuses to write anything but theoretical examples on the board.

If you like failing this is the class for you. No one can understand what he says and the average on our final exam was a 37. He does let you use any notes/HW/Book but it doesn't matter because the tests come from his own theory and do not match the book or homework. Does not curve! Exams are  impossible! Not helpful during/after class! DROP NOW!

Absolutely horrible teacher and person.  Gets offended if you ask questions because he is so bad at speaking the english language.  GET OUT WHILE YOU STILL CAN.  Even with the curve it is nearly impossible to get a decent grade.  My class average was probably a 60% C.

The course itself is not that hard, but the professor makes it impossible.  Be prepared for theory and no numerical examples. The exams are not completely impossible, but close to it. If you get this professor, drop the class or switch imediately!
Worst Math professor I have ever had. Can not understand his writing or his speaking. Exams are impossible. Getting a good grade is impossible. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!

What a joke. I heard stories... but I didn't believe it. I dropped before 3rd week because I wasn't going to let this **** make me get a "W". He gets mad when you answer questions, and he screws up on his notes A LOT. Then he thinks you are making fun of him when you ask him about his mistakes. Don't take him, or drop IMMEDIATELY!
Worst professor I've ever had.  DROP HIS CLASS BEFORE IT'S TOO LATE!
No Comments
No Comments
If you get this guy, with a white glove, you should seriously reconsider your life!      ..... I mean, taking this class!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Ridiculous, does not use the book, teaches the board, cant hear him, does not like his job, hates people who ask questions.  if you have him, drop the class.
not helpful, hard to understand, teaches to the board, very unreachable.

Not as difficult as most people say, honestly - yes, the Russian accent can be hard to understand at times, but it's still math. The good curve and being able to use class notes on exams is nice, and the pace is rather easy, about 1 chapter per 3 weeks. If you're not great at math, he may not be the best professor but certainly not the hardest.
WOOHLLL- Right
One of the scariest people I have ever seen.  When he starts yelling at the class in Russian it gets even scarier.

You cannot understand this guy and he is probably the toughest professor I have ever had....Only plus was that the class was curved and a 60 or above got you at least a C....Trust me, you WILL need the curve....No average during the three midterms was above a 60
Mumbles a heavy accent into the chalkboard.  Extremely hard exams.  Be Afraid!
I had all the mid-terms and still got a C
If you find yourself in his class transfer out as soon as possible.

Very possibly the worst math professor I have ever had. You cannot understand a word he says because of the accent and he mumbles into the chalkboard. Tests are much more difficult than the material presented through homework, lectures, and recitation. If you must have him as your prof I wish you luck, you will definately need it.
The guy ****ing sucks

This class was the hardest that I have ever taken, not b/c of the material, but because Professor Dynin made it hard.  I'm a good student, I study hard, and have an A- GPA, but received a C in his class after hours of studying, and I think I got lucky.  AVOID THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL COSTS!!!
Worst Prof. Ever
Impossible to understand, mumbles into the chalkboard, never know quite what he wants, test material not from class notes...hated his class :(
challenging, but a really great teacher

im a good math student, got an a- in 152 b+ in 153 and had to drop this class in the 7th week b/c i was gonna get like a c-.  this guy is the worst teacher ive ever had, he doesnt care at all about you learning, he wont give reviews sessions either...ive wasted 3 hrs of my life just arguing w/ him

This guy is a total frickin nut job!! He is all about the theory and you practically have to write write a novel explaining the theory on the midterms. I got a D+, its the worst grade i have gotten. AVOID AT ALL COST!!!

This guy is terrible.  He teached theory that I swear he makes up.  The way to get through the class is have an awesome TA and make incredible study sheets that you can take with you to the tests.  Even then, there may be no hope.

Don't be fooled by his syllabus. You know, the part where he has that email from the former student telling him how great he is. This guy is a nutjob. "Dr. Strangeglove" should be avoided if at all possible. Unless of course you enjoy not being able to understand your incredibly angry prof.
only bad grade i ever received!

This guy is something else... beware of the glove... he is hard... his tests are hard but not impossible... he is hard to understand... but it isn't impossible... i studied and got an A- (i got a C+ in 153 so im not like a brainer either) it is worth working through. good luck!
I got mad for this teacher, but he is helpful if you visit him so I could get A-.
i think it is a deliberate act of malice on the part of the math department to put their worst professor (and possibly history's worst math professor) in such a monster of a course.
what can i say
Worst professor I've ever had. Avoid taking this class with him! He mumbles to the board and can't teach. Beware- there is no curve.

Pray that you have a good TA.  I went to lecture 3 times, all for exam reviews, because lecture was a waste; I couldn't understand him.  I crammed for the midterms and final and got an A but he doesn't curve, make sure to make study sheets that have all of the theorems on there.

He is by far the worst professor on campus. He mumbles and only never does an numerical examples. I feel bad for anyone who has had him or is going to have him in the future.  He's been teaching for 43 years and his ass needs to retire

Worst Professor ever, his writing is barely legible absolutely know curves and he teaches only theory no examples at all.
He thinks this class is Math 366! Don't take his course.

****!!!.he cant teach

I can't understand a word he says - way too theoretical, too many pictures, not enough examples with numbers like you're supposed to use in math

A horrible professor. Does not curve the class even if the class average is failing. He is very unclear with his thick Russian accent and unorganized lectures. Does not give a **** for the students. Worst professor ever!!!
You better be ready to work your ass off....
RUN FOR YOUR GRADES!!!
you cant understand a word he says

Okay kiddos: Avoid anyone who starts their first lecture with one rubber glove on and the line "I'm here to shock you.". He did this the first lecture, and I ran out after that, opting for another section. I kid you not, save yourself (and your

This guy really sucked as a professor. I couldn't even stand to look at him after his first lecture because I disliked him soooo much. He shouldn't be allowed to teach math at OSU. He teaches based on his own theory and his exams are horrible.
hes not a good teacher.
Why does OSU keep a person like him - good for research but not as a teacher.  Come one OSU, shape up!

You registered for math 254 but you will get math 999. If I were you and I had to take this class, live in the TA's office. I.E. Martin Nikolov. He is an excellent remedy to Dr. Dynin's disorganized unorthodox methods.

This communist still thinks the cold war is going on. He enjoys writing tests and conducting lectures that are udderly confusing. Don't waste your time buying the book either, you don't use it, and according to him it is all wrong anyway.

Heed my warning and DROP IT NOW! Even with notes, the midterm class averages were 63, 52, 42. If you decide to take the class, you better throw away your textbook and tape record the lectures because it's all HIS theory. PS: he wears a creepy rubber glove
RUN!!! NOW!!!  Sure you can use your notes/textbook on the exams, but doesn't help much since his exams our based on his own theories!
You won't get the short end of the stick in his class - you'll get reamed with the long end

GET OUT NOW!!!  Absolutely the worst professor I have ever had.  No curve, horrible teaching, does not follow the book.  You cannot understand him, he is really creepy, and the tests are BRUTAL.  Like I said, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!
One of the worst math classes I've had, which is saying a lot considering how bad the math department is here.
I think his name before coming to America was Himler or Geobbels, if you get what I'm saying. Incredibly difficult. All theory.Run run away!

As has been said before, he's obviously very learned, but understanding his accent, which is incredibly thick in and of itself, it made even harder by the fact that he always speaks with his back to the class.  Terrible, terrible instructor.

Absolutely the worst professor in my three years at OSU.  Can't understand his voice, barely understand his scratch on the chalkboard.  Exams are brutal and do not reflect what textbook gives you for homework assignments.  Avoid him at all cost!
He knows his stuff, but makes it impossible for the students to learn. His tests are the hardet, no curve, absolutely no help from him.  Avoid him if possible.
To the person in Math 151: Wait untill you take Dynin's Final and get your grade. Then you'll find out that your going to get  the short end of the stick  for lack of more appropriate termonology
Seems like a very learned person; very fair and generous in grading midterms

I went the first day out of curiousity...  He said he would run his class different than the others by giving theory in class which isn't in the text book.  He was creepy and wore rubber surgical gloves in class.  I dropped it.
He is the worst ever. He gives the hardest tests andthere is no curve
hard class nto made any easier by horrible prof
No Comments
he was unclear w/ what he wanted. I got a 'C' and he's evil
Worst professor ever.  If you like failing, take this class.

summary_comment: Professor Guo is highly regarded for his clear teaching style and thorough explanations, making complex differential equations accessible. He invests time in ensuring students understand the material and provides valuable support during office hours. While his office hours can feel slightly awkward, his teaching quality is consistently praised.
summary_comment_short: Professor Guo is highly regarded for his clear teaching style and thorough explanations, making complex topics accessible. He invests time in ensuring students understand difficult concepts and provides fair assessments, though his office hours can feel slightly awkward.

Ratings.comment: He is great! I had him for diffeq. Pretty much the best as far as math teachers go. He teaches clearly and goes through all steps on the board. If you're confused he will take time to make sure you understand. It's hard stuff, but if you do the homework the quizzes and exams aren't bad. Nice but slightly awkward in office hours.

Sheng was an amazing Calculus 2 TA. He always came to our recitation prepared to basically reteach us all the material from the previous lectures. Though we did have weekly quizzes that were tough, they were graded fairly, and he reviewed commonly-missed problems. He also encouraged us to think for ourselves and realize we can do the hard math.

summary_comment: Professor Diego Penta is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts accessible and engaging. Students praise his clear, passionate, and informative lectures, which effectively prepare them for exams. His dedication to student understanding and willingness to provide additional support outside of class contribute to his outstanding reputation among mathematics students at OSU.
summary_comment_short: Professor Diego Penta is highly regarded for his engaging and effective teaching methods, making complex mathematical concepts accessible and understandable. Students consistently praise his clarity, passion, and dedication to helping them succeed, often recommending his classes over others.

Ratings.comment: I gave Diego Penta a 5 star review because he was the best professor I had in the Math department at OSU. His lectures are not boring, and he really cares about helping you understand the material. Definitely take his class.
He's like having Tony Stark as your math professor
Amazing lecturer who provides exactly what you need to succeed in both 1151 and 1172. Very clear, passionate, and informative lectures.
Really great calc professor, had him for calc 1151 and calc 1172 (Engr Calc A) one of the best at OSU
Diego was a really good lecturer who explained difficult things in way that anyone could understand. He was also very willing to help students outside of class.
Math 1172 is known to be a difficult weed-out class, but he makes it easier. Students with other lecturers would often come to this class instead of their own because he was so good. Plus he's hot.
Diego is a really good lecturer who emphasizes in lecture exactly what you need to know for midterms and quizzes. If you're taking 1172 this is the guy you want. Plus he's actually good looking
Easy midterms, hard quizzes.
The best professor I have ever had. I learned more about math in one semester with him as my professor than I have in my whole life. OSU should give him a raise.
Probably the best professor I have had at OSU, definitely in the math department. If you want to pass 1172 this is the guy to go to. Funny, smart, and great lectures.

Diego is one of the best lecturers I've ever had. He always made sure to cover everything he needed to, and did so in a way that minimized confusion. He made lectures entertaining and clearly knew what he was doing. I even submitted some of my midterms back for regrading and he gave me points back. I only wish he taught my 1152 class :/

Diego is a great lecturer, he presents the material in a great way and he is pretty funny too. If you skip lecture, you'll have a difficult time on the exams. Although Diego is probably one of the best, the math department still makes the class and the exams pretty difficult. Attend lectures, do the homework, go to office hours.

The math department finds a way to make Calc 1 a lot more difficult than it needs to be. Penta had decent lectures, and would deliver material in a clear manner. He was open to answering questions, and would ask students if they understood the material.

Penta is a great professor that made Calc 1151 fairly easy for me. After struggling to keep a B- in the beginning, after going to office hours and putting work in, I ended with an A. I am taking Math 1172 next semester and I am lucky to have Penta again. He truly cares about students and explains concepts very well.

For people who didn't take calc in high school, 1151 is horrible. However, he knows how to teach the material well and is very caring and funny. Just pay attention in lecture and don't be afraid to ask questions- he'll answer them.

Math 1151 is the death of freshman. This statement will be thrown around a lot. However this man can save you. Stop using your phone, listen and attempt to understand his logic behind the way the material works. If you understand how it works> you will be able to apply the knowledge in quizzes and exams.

I already took calc in high school so this was the easiest class ever for me and honestly a waste of time. I have not been to lecture but maybe 3 times all semester and i never ever study. Im about to take the final tomorrow but I'm assuming I'm gonna end with an A.

I had Diego in Au 2016 for math 2162. The class was hell but Diego made the material easy to understand. He genuinely cares about his students. He is very easy going and is one of the greatest professors I've ever had. Definitely recommend Diego for whatever class he's teaching. This dude knows his stuff.
Cool dude

I did not know that math could be thought so well before taking his class. he simplified complex and abstract notions to an easily understandable mental visualizations for the students. He is passionate about what he does and is super fun to interact with. Strongly recommend his calsses!

I'll put it this way--Calc sucks. It's a lot harder than it should be and most students don't do well in it because they don't put in the excessive amount of work they need to in order to do well. However, if you have Diego, then it won't suck as much because he's probably one of the best professors in the department.

Good professor overall, but the class is graded solely on quizzes and tests. He also told us the whole semester there would be a curve, but in reality, he just lowered the percent requirement to get a C or D, so the people at a B- to A- got no help. He taught the material well and the extra credit helped on quizzes, but some exams were tough.

Great professor you can never miss as a student at Ohio State. He is so caring about his students and keep students informed of any necessary information. He explains things very well in standard American English. His class is well organized and very informative. Must take his class if you could have a chance.
Great teacher, explains things very well.
Great professor! Willing to help you. If you show effort, he will bump your grade at the end of the semester. Gives lots of extra credit.

Diego is one of the best professors I've had. He makes the class fun and interactive, and does a good job teaching the material. His midterms were extremely fair and he was generous about partial credit. My favorite thing was group quizzes. The only thing I disliked was he followed the text to the tee for lectures. I strongly recommend getting him.

The class I took was differential equations, which is difficult anyway you slice it. Penta taught the course with passion and although the class is almost entirely lecture, he made it interesting. He isn't afraid to laugh, he allows questions, and does everything in his power to help you. He teaches hard classes, hence the difficulty rating.

summary_comment: Professor Roldan Roa is widely perceived as disorganized and inconsistent in her teaching approach, frequently changing due dates and failing to maintain clear communication with students. Her classes are seen as overly simplistic, with many students finding the material covered in middle school, yet she struggles to explain more complex concepts effectively, often spending excessive time on basic ideas while rushing through more challenging topics. Students also report issues with her availability and responsiveness outside of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Roldan Roa is perceived as disorganized and inconsistent in her teaching approach, frequently changing due dates and failing to provide timely feedback or updates. Students find her explanations slow and often overly simplistic, particularly for basic concepts, while struggling to cover more complex material effectively.

Ratings.comment: I took this class, thinking that it would be some sort of math applicable to my major-- I thought wrong. Erika seemed to have system in the first few weeks, even posting summaries of her lectures and the busywork. This all changed as time went on; She would not reinforce any due dates, never put in grades, rarely passed back papers, etc...

We were told we could pick our group and topic for our final presentation, which counts as our biggest grade in the class. BUT Erika suddenly decided to assign partners and picked our topics for us, completely taking the creativity out of the project. We got assigned super boring topics and are expected to talk for 40 minutes about it which sucks.

This class is very very very easy. You literally have a workshop once a week, which is just simple problem solving using shapes. There are no midterms or finals, just a final presentation. Erika is very disorganized and constantly changes her mind. One time I tried to reach her, only for her to tell me she lost her phone the week before............

I think Erika thinks she is doing a good job of teaching, as her method is to simplify easy concepts and basically tell a story throughout the hour long class that finally reaches the point of the lecture, such as that a triangle is a two dimensional shape. I usually do my other homework during class or go on social media.

Honestly this woman is a mess. She doesn't follow the syllabus, does not answer emails, and doesn't put grades in often. She is terrible at explaining herself when you ask a question, and spends 50 minutes trying to explain easy concepts, such as the Pythagorean theorem.

Erika thinks she knows what she is doing but she has no idea that we have learned most of the content in middle school. She takes 50 minutes to explain easy concepts. When you actually get to the difficult content she goes very fast and doesn't teach it well. She is very inaccessible outside class and irresponsible, always changing her due dates.

summary_comment: Professor Qin is highly regarded for his responsibility, clarity, and approachability. Students appreciate his willingness to help and his clear explanations, though some found his accent challenging. Overall, he is seen as an effective instructor who helps students navigate difficult courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Qin is highly regarded for his responsibility, clarity, and approachability. Students find him very helpful, both in and outside of class, and appreciate his clear explanations and willingness to assist.

Ratings.comment: He is a really responsible and nice teacher. You can make appointment very easily with him, and he is always willing to help. I do not think the homework is too hard so far, and you can always ask him for what you can not figure out. Also he explains things very clearly. Math 3607 is not a easy class, but he is a nice teacher to help you survive.
Best professor ever! Thank you! I do learn a lot from this class!
Dr. Qin is the best. Explain everything clearly. Very approachable after class. Respond to emails in seconds! Highly recommend!
Math 1172 is a hard course, both to learn and to teach. Prof. Qin has done a fair job given it was his first time to teach. Super nice person!

He is a very nice guy. Ready to help outside class and provide useful material before exams. Sometimes hard to understand. But he explained things super clear if you go to him after class or during office hours.

Dr. Qin is an excellent instructor. He worked through many examples in class to make difficult concepts clear. Moreover, he always drew connections between the abstract math result with the physics and real-life examples and provided motivations for every topics he wanted to introduce, which is quite helpful and amusing! I highly recommend him.

Tong Qin was an awful professor. He never explained the concepts as he worked through them, and his accent made him very difficult to understand. If you take him I recommend finding another lecturer to attend.

summary_comment: Professor Ponomarev is widely regarded as ineffective in his teaching methods, with students finding his lectures boring, confusing, and difficult to follow due to poor public speaking skills and lack of vocal projection. Many students advise seeking additional resources such as TAs or the MSLC to supplement his instruction. Overall, his approach to teaching is considered unsuitable for most students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ponomarev is widely perceived as ineffective in his teaching methods, often described as boring, confusing, and difficult to understand due to poor public speaking skills and lack of projection. Students found his lectures unapproachable and frustrating, with many advising against taking his course unless absolutely necessary.

Ratings.comment: Boring and confusing lectures. Not approachable. Not understanding - tried to insist I take a makeup midterm the day after a grandparent's funeral in Cleveland.

My main complaint is that his public speaking abilities are horrendous. I could barely understand what he said because he mumbled and spoke into the projector. Luckily, him and the TA gave similar review problems to what were on the exams, so my advice would be to study those. The practice final was very similar to the real final, too.
Awful. Beware

I always felt that I was good at math, but he confuses me, and I had most of this material in High School calculus.  Hard to understand, mostly because he doesn't project his voice and doesn't use a microphone.  If you aren't great at math, expect to spend a lot of time with your TA or at the MSLC.
