He's basically a snoozefest.  He gets off topic on the most random things during lecture and then makes a lot of mistakes on the examples.  You would probably learn more from reading the book than coming to his lecture.

Paul was the worst professor I ever had. He refused to teach from the book. He refused to answer my questions. He refused to go to office hours. He constantly spammed my email with over 15 emails per day. His teaching was arbitrary and whimsical. Every time I tried to ask him a question he ridiculed me and my viewpoint. He flirted with the girls.

He's very fast in class, and it's because undergrad material is too simple for him to explain to people that arent on his level of thinking. I am by means as smart as he is, but I feel comfortable asking him questions outside of class. Basically, he's a professor that is very willing to teach those that want to learn...
Brilliant at math, not at explaining material or communicating with people. Would recomend taking someone else if possible, but hey, he speaks english which is a rarity in OSU math.
This professor is undoubtedly knowledgeable in Math, however, he is completely incapable of communicating. It may sound hackneyed, but GET A DIFFERENT PROF.
Wasnt helpful at all and couldnt teach at all. He came in late and talked to the wall. this guy needs help and to get laid

Midterms were really easy and his lectures usually came from examples from the book.  If you follow along with the book during lecture you should be able to understand.  He does have a hard time communicating, but he does know what he is talking about.  grades were not an issue.
Horrible prof.... makes random refernces to things like squirrels.... the most pointless lecture ever... gets confused when someone asks a question.... Run.... Run away and dont look back...

absolutely useless professor. he knows math but is completely incapable of teaching it. goes off on random tangents- once went on about how camels have different kind of humps when asked whether or not the class is curved. don't go to lecture, it's pointless, because you won't learn anything from him. if at all possible, GET A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR.

Good at math. Seems smart.  Handicapped in communication skills and teaching categories. Dude made me feel retarded and stoned when he tried to explain the simplest concepts to me which I already knew. Skip lecture, go to recitation, and fill out survey letting him know he sucks.

This is the worst professor at the university.  He knows his math but he can't convey it to students.  He often messes up examples.  He also gets off topic a lot and talks about completely irrelevant thing like trisecting a line, which he once did for an entire lecture.
Terrible lecturer. Didn't explain anything. Hardly any example problems. He would get confused alot and change numbers without explaining what he was doing.
same as all of the rest... i hsowed up for syllabus day and survey day to let the school know what i thought of him

Really horrible lecturer, he obviously knows math but is incapable of explaining things in a logical way. Don't bother going to lecture, go to your rec. and become friends with you TA. Tests weren't that bad, but in order to do well you do need to get extra help from the TA. If u didn't take a similar class n high school your going to have problems
terrible lecturer. always mumbled. if you get him your better off just skipping lecture and going to recitation only. It worked for me.

Gives too much vague theory which doesn't really enhance understanding.  Most days it take him about 20 minutes to describe what I must later sum up in a single sentence.  Only take him if you can easily compile vague info into a concrete idea.
talked about things totaly off topic like trees and ladybugs no idea what he was talking about good class to slep through also loved his moustache
decent teachers not very good at explaining things hard to follow during lectures

Kinda comical..I liked some of his jokes..Tests were fair with exception to some of the Final's answers...those were interesting...Good, solid, low key, doesn't ask us any questions and just lectures. professor though...

Absolutely horrible teacher. He may be extremely brilliant but he does not know how to teach. He never completes his sentences and assumes that his students understand his incomplete thought process. Seriously one of th worst teachers I've had thus far in my education.

Ummm he had really bad jokes and seemed to make things harder than they should have been. i got a B- on the 1st mdtern (didnt finsh) and a A- on the second ( i finished)...with my hw and quizes and final, i squeeked out with an A. I had a really awsome TA. MIke Comerford ROCKS

Where to start? I stopped going to lectures, because quite frankly, you'll learn better in recitation. But his lectures are boring, and you'll be more confused when you leave. The quizzes are easy, but the Test, can be retarded, depends on how you know the material. I recommend, skipping the lecture starting after the first intro class.
Rambles on in class about pointless stuff.

I went to the first couple classes until I realized what a waste of time it was. He goes off on these tangents that have nothing to do with what he's teaching. He's not clear at all. If you have a question, he'll either do half of it then move on, or say that he can't answer it because we should know it already.
I never went to lecture because he didn't make any sense.  I used the book and learned through my TA.

Ok, so, this guy is one of the most boring professors on campus. I stopped going to lectures because it's easier to just teach yourself or wait for recitation. Half the time, if you ask, "How did you get that?" he'll just reply with "trial and error", and still won't explain. Do take his class, just don't go to lectures.
so boring
JUST don't know how to describe it
worst math professor ever! talks bout the weather and useless information. everyone stopped going pretty much after the first week
Very hard to understand. Way too many tangents.

His exams are extremely reasonable, but his teaching is not. He is the worst professor I have had thus far. His makes mistakes all of the time and gets confused on examples when even looking at the solutions in the back of the book. Not to mention, he walks into class at least 5 minutes late consistently.

This man is insane.  Had lecture in a room with unidentifiable metal object always on the floor.  Used to tally the amount of times he would step on it.  Didn't follow the syllabus at all and prooved every single thing we ever did.  This man is an absolute boar.  Famous line: "Dont believe me? I'll prove it"  no one cares Paul...
He's the man.
Nice, helpful, had great examples and held a good review session.

def a weird guy. went to the first two lectures, walked out early and never went back. total bore, laughs at his own corny math jokes and really isn't that great of a teacher. My TA def taught me everything.
Very good teacher.
The class was fine, but he was very boring
The absolute worst professor you could take for this class. He talks down to you when you go to his office to show him a grading mistake his TAs made. I could only stand one lecture with him.
This professor would come into class every day with pits driping in anticipation for math.  Its too bad though because he really wasnt that good at teaching it.

ZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZZ... That's all I did to get a good grade. Not to mention knowledge to Calculus beforehand helped a tad. I wish he would've used the board instead of that stupid over-head thing. That's so 1998.
very good teacher
He does a good job in a course which requires him to cover a lot of ground in a short period of time.
Anyone for Calculus?

This man is the worst teacher I've ever had! He didn't teach anything aside from writing out problems that no one knew how to do and then not explaining what he was doing. He gave me a 0 for problems on the exam that I had the right answer for! :(
Pretty good

He would teach and confuse himself....then have to look at the back of the book to see if he was even doing it right.....sleeping at home is more productive than going to his lecture, because at least you will have a bed to sleep in instead of a desk
He made it way more confusing than he needed to.  He just rambled and rambled about stuff we would learn later on - never talking about stuff we needed to know for 150.

Lets just say he is lucky there are not 0's on this survey. If you are in this class do not go to lecture. No one does. He rambles in pointless directions. My TA could not speak english and sounded like a robot. I just went to math room and did the HW

This was discrete math, and most of the material was really easy.  But leave it to this fool to make it complicated. He goes off on too many tangents, just wont get to the point. There is a curve, and the homework represented the exams pretty well though.

The guy is very good at math, but always makes things overly complicated. often it takes him over 30 minutes to get to the point.  he bumbles around a lot too and makes dumb jokes. exams are ridiculous...
excellent at math, yet not so excellent at teaching.  The class is easy, but he somehow finds a way to complicate all his explinations.  His sweety pits shows his excitement towards the subject.

He's very good at math, but insists on teaching me where the formula came from, and why it works.  While this may be of interest to math majors, I simply want to know how to do it.  He's very unclear and gets confused often.

very brainy guy, very smart, very good at math. but all that knowledge is lost on us poor dumb college folk cause hes terrible at communication, doesnt know how to present material in plain english or explain it clearly, genearlly cant relate to students
HIs test aren't that bad if your TA is good, but if you don't have a good TA, your probably screwed
I thought that he taught math in a way that was easy to understand. I thought it was fairly easy, but I went to every lecture.
The only mathematical thing he did well was go off on tangents
It was so good that I don't go...

After finding out he couldn't make it as a stand-up comedian, he decided to teach math at OSU.  He makes lousy jokes, never explains what he does, and gives very difficult exams.  Hopefully, you'll get a good TA.
Hard to follow and understand. Exams were extreamly difficult.  Prey you get a good TA.
Had absolutely no personality and made lecture the absolute worst class of my day! Didn't provide any extra help.
Exams are very difficult, however I rarely went to lecture...I usually do wonderful in math and I got a 52 on the final.  However, the TA was awesome...
So hard to understand what he's thinking or saying. Goes off on tangents a lot too.
No Comments
Someone compared him to the giant guy in Happy Gilmore.  I thought it was funny, and agree with him.  This guy is horrible.  I had him for math 150 and 151 :S
No Comments
No Comments
talks in circles, never explains his point. and makes NO SENSE!
makes lousy jokes, talkes fast. Exams are impossible
He speaks tooooooooooooo fast...
He was the reason I didn't go to lecture. I would've rather hurt myself.

summary_comment: Professor Delaubenfels is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills, making complex mathematical concepts accessible and enjoyable. Students consistently praise his clear, structured lectures, his ability to simplify difficult material, and his engaging sense of humor. His thorough explanations and availability for help contribute to high class averages and positive learning experiences.
summary_comment_short: Professor Delaubenfels is widely praised for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex mathematical concepts accessible and engaging. Students consistently commend his clear, structured lectures, sense of humor, and availability for help, often noting that his classes are among the best at OSU.

Ratings.comment: I've heard bad things about other linear algebra instructors, but Ralph is the man. Lectures are clear and he's great at explaining things. A rarity in the OSU Math department.

This guy makes math fun. I don't care what your background is. He makes the hard material seem very simple and straightforward. He even has a really great sense of humor. He speaks extremely clear with no accents . He pauses and leaves plenty of time for questions. I would highly recommend this guy to anyone.

Absolutely fantastic professor. Class average is extremely high while course material is not.  He tells you basically exactly what is on the test and explains every concept thoroughly and in a way easy to understand.   Also, this man is hilarious.  He has a very nerdy sense of humor and is a pleasure to listen to.  I highly recommend him.

Dr. deLaubenfels is the quintessential professor - other professors should strive to teach as well as he does. His lectures are immaculately structured, he speaks clearly and with gusto, and his ability to explain complex subjects in a simple manner is much appreciated. I appreciate his jokes, too. I actually *enjoy* math class with him.

Professor deLaubenfels is a master at teaching,  setting the standards to which all teachers should aspire.  He talks clearly, slowly, and loudly, frequently stopping   for questions.  He always illustrates abstract concepts with outstanding examples.  His explanations are always crystal clear.  He is also always available to help.

One of the best profs I've had at OSU. This man made a run of the mill stats class one of the better parts of my semester. He makes the material as easy as possible, his tests are extremely easy, and he's extremely helpful in office hours.
Easy A for stat if you take decent notes. Allows formula sheets on the exams. Homework is optional. Textbook was only worth buying for the practice problems, but he also gives sample midterms.
It's not that the math in this class are easy, it just the way he taught and plan out the whole course make tough materials easy.

Amazing professor! I hear about other people getting this hard hw and impossible exams and I am so thankful for this guy! I hope he keeps teaching Math 2568 because I learned the material and it wasn't difficult. He gives non-mandatory hw and he even says the tests are hw problems with changed numbers. Very straightforward. Learn the proofs though.
Best math teacher I've had yet. Very helpful and tells you all you need to know with no bs and no surprises, the way it should be.

The best math professor I've had here. The textbook and content is confusing, but he rehashes everything in simpler terms and makes it easy to understand. His exams and quizzes are based on his sample tests and homework assignments so studying is not difficult. Homework isn't mandatory, but you should do it. Take this class with him!
best lecturer ever
Such a great professor. I highly recommend him. He not only loves the subject, but loves helping to ensure everyone gets a good grade.
He is so good at teaching and exams are easy!!!!

If you aren't a math person and want to knock out a GEC, take it with him! Wonderful at explaining things, very clear, and the three exams are very easy! There is even a study guide that is exactly like the exams!
exams are extremely easy!

This guy is the man. Great lecturer and teacher. Class is easy because he is a great teacher and you understand the material, not because he makes things easy. Also hilarious in a unique way. Would recommend him to anyone.
This man is hilarious. Having said that, he's an awesome math teacher. His class is VERY easy. I didn't go to class to learn, but to hear this man speak.

This guy was my first math professor at OSU. He was incredible. A master of pedagogy. He made things interesting and didn't bore you with stuff you didn't care about. Also a really likable guy who spoke incredibly eloquently, one of those guys you could see smoking a pipe at an outdoor cafe in France, stroking his beard and writing profound things.

One of the best math teachers you could ever encounter. If you dont have a valentines day gift, take his class and will tell you the correct equation to do so. Funny in an odd way that when you tell the jokes outside the class room that you can not make them as funny as he does. Oh And a genius professor who doesnt use calculator.
he got 55 years of teaching experiences; you won't be miserable
very good teacher! helpful, very clearly explains things. i'm terrible at math, and he made it a stress-free math class. he also has a pretty good sense of humor.

He really did understand that those taking the class were not very interested in math. In fact I never really felt like I was in a math class. Tests were the easiest part of the class. plus he was kind of funny.
It was a really easy class. We only used the book for the homework problems. Labs were annoying but always easy. He was a really nice guy and easy to understand too.

deLaubenfels is very clear in his expectations. He realizes that people taking 116 aren't too excited about math, so there aren't any gotcha questions/demeaning comments. Very fair grader, good teacher, willing to help outside of class. Highly recommended.

The best math teacher out there. He made everything absolutely clear for everyone who doesn't get math. Highly recommend him. You are allowed  cheat sheets for the exams which pretty much help you get an A or B. Practice exams are practically identical to the actual exams.
Good speed through materials
Very straight forward. Sample midterms are exactly what's on his merterms/finals. Study those and your golden.
116, Great class for the math phobic! It's painful at first but with a little practice and effort the class was cake. Got a B+ and Im math-retarded.
I hate math with a passion (always a C or D student) and was panicked about math in college. But because of his clarity during lecture it was so easy it was almost frustrating...definitely recommend!

Definitely agree with the below. Tests are straight-fwd. My best prof at OSU so far.  Did a great job teaching a not so easy subject - good at simplifying and relating information.  Very helpful.  Really wants students to understand.  Very smart.  Sometimes funny in an odd way.  Definitely recommend
Great professor.  If you have the opportunity to take him, do it.  Has a good sense of humor and keeps math interesting.  Like others said, tests are very straightforward.
Tests are easy if you understand the material, does not try to trick the students.  Does not curve, but makes up for it with straight-forward tests.
He is very willing to help and loves to teach.

I hate Math with a passion, but he made it somewhat bearable. He's American and actually speaks English very well, gives tons of examples, etc. A problem with Math 152 is that some TA's are simply better and more helpful than others, but don't blame Delaubenfelds - he's a great lecturer.

Such a nice guy! So helpful! Is willing to spend all his time to make sure you understand. Go to lectures and you won't even need to study for the test. If you miss a lecture, he does a good job covering everything twice or more. Such a sweet guy!
very easy class

Wonderful teacher!  Extremely clear lectures.  He genuinely wants students to do well.  I dislike math, and I got a solid A.  One of the best math teachers I have ever had.  TA's can be a mixed bag, but the lectures make up for whatever is lacking in recitation. I can now say that I actually enjoyed his class.
good english lecturer. didnt mamke the course harder than it already was.
The best professor.  Made everything clear and always willing to answer questions.  He was more than fair and had a genuine interest in how students do.

I LOVED this guy! He was so nice and such a clear, understandable math teacher. He was fair and did almost everything he could to help make the class as easy as possible (which it was). He also throws in corny jokes, which is always fun. Great teacher!
He was really helpful, but he leaves you to earn your grade, he's not going to spoonfeed the material to you, and neither are the often hard to understand, and sometimes incompetent TAs.
good english lecturer. funny stupid jokes. did his best to make a bad subject fun.
Great teacher, very helpful. clear, and English,

Ralph is awesome.  No calculus teacher had ever explained to me what, exactly, calculus was for, but he did this the first day.  I'm still not going to be taking 153, as math really isn't my thing, but he kept it from being miserable.  He explained everything clearly, didn't give too much homework, and always let us out of lecture early!

So his lectures aren't tough and the recitation is great. The only problem is that the midterms are completely different and about ten times harder than what we've reviewed in class. It's kinda frustrating. He does his best to help though. And his corny jokes help. Basically in his class I sleep like a baby, I wake up every two hours and cry.
VERY clear lecturer, uses unique teaching methods, is a fair grader, and very patient
Sample midterms and final were very close to the actual tests.  Made sure students understood the material.  Overall a good professor.
very clear, great examples, simple exams, boring lectures but usually end early, one of the easiest classes ever, one midterm avg was 98. good teacher

Do the HW = doing well on quizzes & exams. Do the sample exam & guarantee yourself an A on exams. Teacher is a no-nonsense teacher who effectively gets through the material during class, "gives you a break!" & always lets you out early.
Great Professor. Wants everyone to understand and do well. Presents information slowly and clearly.  Take his class.

Since you can use a formula sheet and you have sample midterms and finals (with VERY similar problems) the class is fairly easy. Attend lecture for simplified notes--otherwise you will be lost. It is easy to not get an A, but attend class & youll be fine

He knows his stuff, goes slow and makes sure the class is with him. Great lecturer which was important because the subjects gets a little intense  after 4 weeks. Need help, just ask him? He knows how  to get you to understand.
Very clear, easy class, good teacher gets the pont across clearly.
Doesn't collect homework which I think is important for a math class.
Great professor.  Explains material rather than just surfing through power point

Great teacher, clear about material, makes it easy to understand, always willing to help or answer any question, quick to respond to emails, study guides very indicative of what you'll see on midterms/tests.

I agree w/person below... ralph is a great professor, he makes the material very easy to understand, and is very willing to help... also many of the questions on sample midterms are verbatim on the midterms. Definitely Recomend
He's very nice and willing to help.  He explains things well and tries to make sure students understand.  He lets class out early and then stays for a while to help students with homework problems.

summary_comment: Professor Wyman is highly regarded as an effective and supportive math instructor, particularly noted for his helpfulness and ability to assist students both in and out of class. Students praise his thorough provision of necessary information for success, though some find his lectures confusing and recommend supplementary materials. Overall, he is seen as a valuable resource, especially in upper-level courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wyman is highly regarded as an effective and supportive math instructor, particularly noted for his helpfulness and ability to assist students outside of class. However, his lectures can be confusing and less useful for learning the material, with some students recommending additional resources for better understanding.

Ratings.comment: Pretty nice teacher
He was the best math teacher I ever had.  Funny, helpful, will help in his office.  He even set up a computer account for me to perform linear algebra.  (This was in the 80s)
Very confusing grading system for tests.
Best math teacher ever! Had him for 582 and 504 and couldn't be happier! Yes yes yes yes yes
Very helpful.  Provides all the information needed to succeed in the class.  Can sometimes be hard to hear if his mic isn't working.
He was a good professor but he is old now. The class will confuse you a lot. Try to buy a study manual of EXAM FM/2. To be honest, completion of the study manual is everything you need to get an A.
cooool class
Wyman is good hearted but his lectures are definately useless.  The class is easy and he's a good guy, but don't bother with the lecture unless it's a review for the midterm.
He seems to have a detailed knowledge of topics outside of mathematics, including, of all things, the Latin text for a reverse Catholic mass.
Hard to follow and understand, but class was easy overall.  Lectures are a waste as long as you have a good TA.  Just review old midterms and go to recitation and you'll be fine.
No Comments
If you take any class with Wyman, make sure to sit in the front of the rows to hear the funny things that he says.
his lectures were really hard to follow but tests are VERY fair.  and he was very available for extra help

Alright. I only attended three of his lectures. I couldn't sit through them without laughing out loud. He sounds just like that guy from office space. Thank god my TA graded soooo easy. If youget him, don't attend lectures, waste of TIME. He seems like a nice guy,just stop teaching math. Call me.

When Wyman wanted to teach, he was very effective. The problem is that hardly ever happened. He was extremely unprepared and half assed each and every lecture. He used smeared overheads that weren't legible and talked so quiet you couldn't hear him. You could tell he really didn't give a damn nor did he want to be there.
the worst. ever. EVER.
Only math i ever liked.

horrible teacher. hard to understand, sounds like Milton of Office Space and looks like Col. Sanders. He was horribe. i am glad that i had a good TA. Without her i would have failed. hope you dont get him.

He sounds like the Col. Sanders(the professor) from the movie Waterboy. It was hilarious at first, but became too hard to take his class serious. I stopped going to lecture after the first week and still got a B. Easy class.

Worst professor I've had. Didn't provide a textbook. Often (admittedly) wrote handout notes the day before class. Relied on Maple rather than working things out himself. Assigned homework and midterm problems without doing them himself, warning students "This might be too hard, I'm not sure yet."
He is hilarious. He is a lot of fun to listen to especially when he is just talking and not teaching. Very interesting man.
Hot Dog, this guy's awesome!  The most excited, funny math teacher I've ever had.  Very fair and decently easy.
Great guy overall.  Very clear and very knowledgable.

summary_comment: Professor Saldana grades generously, often including small proofs and providing extra points, ensuring most students receive an A. His course is described as easy, particularly compared to 1151, with minimal actual calculations required and mostly high school-level material. While his teaching style is not highly praised, his grading system is considered very favorable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Saldana offers a relatively easy course with generous grading, often awarding extra points, which helps most students achieve high grades including A's. However, his teaching style focuses more on review of high school math concepts and includes minimal new material, and some students find his teaching approach less effective for learning new content.

Ratings.comment: Grades very gently. Most assignments/tests will include a small proof.

Gives everyone lots of extra points so almost everyone ends up with A. Attendance is NOT explicitly mandatory, but has assignments to turn in before EVERY lecture, so get ready to work. Overall pretty easy course. He is not pretty good in teaching, but grading is awesome. and material is just a review of high school math course.
He will give you the chance to get all your midterms literally 100 out of 100. The course itself is even easier than 1151 cuz no actual calculation involved. Just take his class and get A.

summary_comment: Professor Clark is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex mathematical concepts accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise his ability to clearly explain ideas, connect them to real-world applications, and provide supportive guidance both in and out of class. His dedication to student success is evident through his understanding approach and the high-quality practice materials he provides.
summary_comment_short: Professor Clark is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and ability to explain complex concepts clearly, making the material accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise his knowledge, clarity, and willingness to help, noting that his approach significantly improves understanding and performance in the course.

Ratings.comment: If youre taking 1151...... take his class...!! Youll pass trust me. Do the Recitation sheets hw and test review youre golden

I normally hate math but Duncan was one of my favorite professors. Super knowledgeable and is very good at clearly explaining concepts and answering questions. If you show up to class and pay attention, you will definitely do great in the class.

I agree; I had Duncan as my TA for 1161 and 2162. He is helpful in class and in office hours and has a knack for really making the material approachable, understandable, tangible to students -- he not only explains things clearly and in multiple ways, but also explains their relation to everyday life, games, math tricks, etc. 10/10 would recommend.

Had Duncan as a TA for Math 1161. He's genuinely the best math instructor I've ever had, and I'm really glad he was my TA. He recognized when quizzes and written homework in the class was a little more difficult than it should have been (he didn't write either) and graded accordingly (minor points for minor slip-ups, etc). He's hilarious and great.

I had to move home mid-semester and had several issues with commuting, but Duncan was incredibly understanding and helped me when I needed him. His practice exams and quizzes are VERY close to the actual exams, so make sure to do those! Overall, he's a really nice/ smart guy and I'd recommend him over others I've had  in the math department

I've always hated math with a burning passion but Duncan is an amazing professor and makes the material feel more accessible than ever. He's willing to work with you outside of class and he's very nice about answering any questions during lecture. For the first time in my life I don't dread going to math class!
Duncan was a great TA.  He lightens the mood by making jokes and he teaches the material very well.  Also very helpful in office hours or during recitation if you have any questions.

summary_comment: Professor Wang is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, making complex material accessible and straightforward. Her lectures closely follow the textbook, providing clear and well-explained content, and her exams are generally fair, aligning closely with the material covered in class and homework.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wang is highly effective at simplifying complex material, ensuring clarity in lectures, and maintaining straightforward exams with no surprises. Students find her approach consistent and reliable, emphasizing the importance of attending lectures and completing homework for success.

Ratings.comment: I really enjoyed this professor and felt that she made a very difficult class much easier and straight forward. Just do the homework and pay attention to her test reviews. She never put a curve ball on the exam.
Lectures stuck to the book, were pretty clear and well explained. Her tests were fairly easy for the most part, just do the homework and pay attention in class and you will pass.

summary_comment: Professor Adali is highly regarded for his positive attitude and dedication, consistently wearing the same outfit which students find endearing. His teaching style focuses on working through problems rather than lecturing, making complex concepts accessible. Known for his friendliness and willingness to help, he significantly enhances the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Adali is highly regarded for his positive attitude and dedication, consistently wearing the same outfit which students find endearing. His teaching style focuses on working through problems rather than lecturing, making complex topics more accessible and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Absolute legend. Always in a positive mood and happy to help with whatever the class asks. Wears the same outfit which you have to respect. In class, he only works out problems and never lectures, which is so nice because he can dumb-down a lot of the work. If you can choose, take Ali and you will not be disappointed!

He's a really nice guy! Definitely a wacky guyand I would say there's a 50% chance you're going to think he's really annoying and a 50% chance you'll find him really endearing. But if anything he's super smart & will go out of him way to help you.
Makes recitations enjoyable! Love how friendly he is! And he is known for his white and blue striped Abercrombie & Fitch sweater! This man is a LEGEND
Legendary, he wore the same sweater every class for the first few months I love the dedication and consistency

summary_comment: Professor Sun is highly regarded for his ability to make complex mathematical concepts accessible, earning strong praise for his clear explanations and detailed proofs. However, his lectures often lack practical examples, focusing heavily on theoretical aspects, which can be challenging for students who prefer more applied learning. Recitations are recommended to better understand the material and prepare for exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sun is highly regarded for his ability to make complex mathematical concepts accessible, earning strong praise for his clarity and detailed explanations. However, his lectures often focus heavily on proofs and theory, with limited example problems, which can make the material challenging to grasp without additional study, particularly through recitations or self-study.

Ratings.comment: Top notch lecturer and guy, in general. Made math comprehensible to me in the first time in my life. 10/10 recommend him for 2568.

He knows his stuff and is a decent teacher yet his lectures include few to no example problems. His lectures also focus primarily on proofs, and if you zone out or don't attend lecture you miss a lot about the method to solving problems. Exams were mostly theory, some application. Attend recitation to learn the material well and see examples.
He is one of the best math professor I have ever had at the Ohio State. He manages to make his class super understandable. He explains each concept and theory with detailed proofs.

This professor went way off topic for what this course was supposed to cover. We were promised a class that taught us how to apply this math. His tests were nothing like the other classes section. I would have loved to learn more and not see a million proofs I'll never need. His lefties are nothing like the tests. Ridiculous. Just ridiculous.

This class was pretty average in terms of an upper level math course. Thick accent, but this is my 4th semester of calculus and I've always dealt with this. His teaching is based primarily on proofs and theory which can get annoying and difficult. BUT he is a very reasonable and extremely nice guy which I can appreciate. You'll get what you put in.

Don't take Wenbo. The curriculum for 2177 is supposed to focus on calculations/application. All Wenbo does in lecture is provides definitions and theories, but never explains how to use them by doing practice problems. Also, his exams test theory, which we aren't supposed to be covering. I stopped going to lecture to teach myself.

Wow. This guy is not good. He explains the bare bones of the concepts, then tests are EXTREMELY HARD. On this last test, he switched a variable out that he had used to explain something and gave an extremely difficult question over it. Take the other professor! Quizzes and tests are ridiculous. I'm so angry at the dif bt what we learn and the test.

Spent time in lectures on proofs that you didn't need. Accent is hard at first but you get used to it. Recitation is key in this course. He didn't give any examples in class which made homework and exams challenging. I didn't go to his OH as much as I should have, but when I did go he was helpful. Overall, not too great.

Not a bad professor. He spent way too much time proving insignificant proofs, when all you need is the formulas. His accent is hard to understand at first but you get used to it. Hardly any examples in class - it was important to pay attention in recitation. Not too bad overall, easy quizzes and homework was fine with hefty curve on the hard final.
Although it was difficult to understand his accent, he always try his best to explain to the students. The quizzes and hw were very easy. The tests are reasonable. He is the best.

Wenbo was an alright professor. I enjoyed his lectures at the beginning of the semester, but he wasn't able to explain anything well when we started learning harder material. Overall, if you're stuck with Wenbo, don't worry about it too much because he's not that bad and his tests were reasonable.

Dr. Wenbo is by far the best Calculus teacher you can find in OSU. He is knowledgeable, extremely intelligent, and a great teacher overall. Just by attending his lectures, you would not have to study at all. The tests would be challenging, but because Dr. Wenbo is such a fantastic teacher, it seems easy. Take this teacher

summary_comment: Professor Karpman is highly regarded for her thorough knowledge of the subject matter and effective teaching methods, making her classes enjoyable and valuable. Students appreciate her willingness to help and stay after office hours to assist those in need. While some find her lectures challenging and require additional study, her support and encouragement of collaborative learning enhance the overall experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Karpman is highly regarded for her comprehensive knowledge of the subject and her effective teaching methods, making her class enjoyable and valuable. Students appreciate her willingness to help, clear explanations, and supportive approach, though some find her lectures can be challenging without additional study outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Great Professor. Knows the material and teaches it very well. Would gladly take the class again.

One homework a week with expected practice and reading for each class (not turned in for a grade) That I didn't do. Enjoyable to have in class. Practice tests help study/cram. One page of notes allowed for tests.

Prof. Karpman is an incredibly helpful lecturer. She'd do anything for her students. Even when she's explaining things, she seems like she puts a lot of effort to explain it in a way that she's not demeaning and students don't get offended. Her teaching was good, but not exceptional. She provides a lot of learning resources.

Dr. Karpman is so helpful when you ask her questions. She gives clear expectations of what she wants to see on hw's and quizzes and is very accessible outside of class. She even stays past her office hours to help students if they have questions. She's also a great lecturer and explains the content very well. These reviews are way too harsh

Her lectures are kind of confusing so you need to take a good amount of time outside of class to understand the material, but she is super helpful in office hours so I HIGHLY recommend going. She also encourages her students to work in groups which is nice. She does make a lot of mistakes in her notes so you have to pay attention to catch them.

I took calc bc in highschool (had a rough time with series) so her class wasn't bad, and was an indepth version. It'll definitely be fast for someone who hasn't taken calc before. She's really helpful during office hours so if you don't understand a concept, ask her anything. She really encourages group work so homework is super easy.

She does give us a lot of assignments which are very hard to work them out by oneself, but she encourages us to work together. And the greatest thing is she gives tests question very basic. There is a huge difficulty gap btwn assignments and tests. And she is very understanding, she agreed us to have group quiz and extended the homework due days
Probably one of the best professors I've ever had. Easy to understand and knows her stuff. I would take her class again in an instant.

Karpman is new and is clearly controlled very heavily by the math department's regulations. Her lectures are fine (she writes on paper and uses a smart camera to project it which is nice) but I know there are better calc professors out there. Its hard, but calc at OSU isn't supposed to be easy and Rachel doesn't have any control over the exams.

If you have never taken calculus, good luck.  She does not teach well in lecture or in office hours. I got my first C in my academic career in this class even though I completed worksheets, watched videos on concepts, did extra practice problems, and went to the MSLC constantly.

I've heard about the infamous math department at OSU, but came into Calc 1 with an open mind. Sadly, Karpman lived up to the horrible reputation of the math department. In short, she does not teach. She merely shows examples, and if you have no prior Calc experience, there's no way you're going to pass the class. Her lisp is also very distracting.

Rachel is an okay lecturer. She presents the information, does not teach it. I took a decently hard calc class in high school and had NO idea what was coming. The math department at OSU is ruthless and your prof doesn't make your test. Test makers you have no contact with make incredibly difficult midterms  that are very frustrating. Good luck.

This class is a very hard class if you have not taken Calculus before. The midterms are way harder than what is taught in class. Rachel does not teach the information, just presents it. To do well in this class you will need to go to the MSLC or find a way to learn the information on your own.

She does not prepare you well for the midterm exams. The sample midterms given were nothing like the actual ones. She does not present the material clearly. She often uses confusing shorthand in her notes that is very confusing when you go back to review. Learn the most you can from recitation classes.

She does not go into detail in lecture whatsoever and seems to expect that you have a prior knowledge of calculus. She not very willing to help and has trouble explaining concepts that you don't understand. Lectures hardly relate to midterms at all. I had to get a private tutor in order to understand the material.

we have many cal lecturers this semester. and she's not the best one but still ok. I didn't use the textbook. sometimes she's really hard to understand. I just took what she wrote down on the board and reviewed that after class. she sometimes was really hard to follow and didn't make clear about the examples. recitations help me a lot.

Dr. Karpman focuses more on the theory behind the problems and concepts rather than working out examples in lecture and lectures about the derivation of a formula rather than just giving it and doing examples.  She is difficult to understand due to her heavy lisp and is difficult if you haven't taken calculus before.

She presents information - she doesn't teach information.  It is difficult to understand her - talks with a lisp. She works lots of examples, but does a poor job explaining WHY the solutions are that way.  Had to get a private tutor to really learn material.

summary_comment: Professor Guo is known for having a thick accent and quiet voice, making lectures challenging to follow. Despite this, his online notes are clear and helpful, and he is willing to assist students who put in the effort. However, many students found the class difficult without additional study and recommend seeking extra help or resources.
summary_comment_short: Professor Guo is known for having a thick accent and quiet voice, making lectures challenging to follow without additional resources. Despite his expertise and willingness to help when approached, his teaching style and delivery often leave students struggling to keep up, especially those without prior mathematical background.

Ratings.comment: His notes were easy to follow (great examples and theorem definitions), but he himself was very hard to understand. I would listen to music in the class while taking notes because I couldn't hear him anyway. In the few times I emailed him, he was very responsive and helpful. I just wouldn't take him again. Also the TA's were awful for this class.

Dr. Guo does indeed have a fairly thick accent that is often hard to understand, but he does care about his students and really knows the course material. Lectures were hard to follow, but his online notes were very helpful and clear. The class also does not have many grades or homework assignments, so be sure to practice problems on your own.

He talks quietly and has a thick accent, making it hard to understand what he's saying. He doesn't go into much detail and periodically asks "clear?" or "questions?" during lectures and most times I'm so lost I don't even know what I would ask. There aren't a lot of grades in this class, so exam grades are really important.

Ruchi does not speak clearly or loudly, so sitting up front is necessary. make time to do practice on your own because he only speaks in formulas and theorems. If you are not naturally math minded, make time to do problems with class mates and discuss questions.
Is willing to help if you work for it. Lectures are fast and sometimes hard to follow and understand. Recitation was a must for me to understand the material.

If you studied calculus in high school (like me) then this teacher is pretty good because he provides sufficient explanation such that you can revise what you learnt in high school. However, if you did not do calculus before coming to his lectures, it might be difficult because he goes over concepts pretty quickly.

He has the thickest accent ever and his handwriting it impossible to read. The entire lecture is just notes and no working problems or peer interaction. I honestly stopped going and taught myself everything in recitation.

Famously in one lecture at the beginning of the year he did something and asked okay? And the whole room said No! And he said ok moving on. I basically had to teach myself everything and I wish I wouldve changed sections right away. All of his notes are handwritten and very hard to read and he doesnt speaking facing the class or loudly.

summary_comment: Professor Zheng is highly knowledgeable but can be challenging to follow during lectures, often leaving students reliant on textbooks. His exams are primarily multiple-choice with few questions, making small mistakes costly. Despite his passion for teaching and willingness to help, his teaching methods and tests are generally considered difficult and potentially unfair.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zheng is highly knowledgeable but can be challenging to follow during lectures, often leaving students reliant on textbooks and TAs for clarification. Exams are primarily multiple-choice with limited room for error, making even minor mistakes significant.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Zheng clearly knows his stuff but lectures can be hard to follow from time to time, a great TA really matters for this class (I had Reeve Garrett he was awesome!). He does tell you exactly what will be on the exams but a small mistake can be costly since they are all multiple choice. I didn't find his conceptual way of teaching to be helpful

Dr Zheng can be hard to follow at times and doesn't cover all the topics in lecture and so you will need to be prepared to read the book. He seems to care about teaching and wants student to do well. HOWEVER, the exams are multiple choice exams ranging 8-12 questions per exam, so one small mistake and your losing 10% of your exam grade per question

Zheng is an interesting professor. He has true passion for the course, but his methods for teaching and testing students are odd. His lectures are confusing and often leave you relying on the textbook. His midterms are the worst part of the class. They are multiple choice, ranging from 8-12 questions. This may sound easy, but it's very aggravating.

He is very hard to follow in lectures, so be prepared to read the textbook to get most of your information. He tells you what is on the exams; however, there is usually at least one question that will blow you out of the water. His exams are about 8-10 questions that are multiple choice, so you receive no partial credit. Easily my worst professor.
Prof. Zheng is the best Math Professor!!! He is very smart. He'll give you a good grade as long as you work hard!

Fangyang is a super cool guy. You can tell he really cares about teaching. For this course, I had a rough time and I'm not sure if it was due to him or me. I would say for this course do not get behind or you will be in trouble. Office hours with him are helpful.

Professor Zheng is a very nice person to start off with. He welcomes all questions asked by students, and expend on actual math related topics in class. He understands and is genuinely interested in Math. His test might be a little unrelated with the hw. He expects you to read the textbook and ask questions instead of he repeating it in lecture.

He's easily the worst professor I've had since I got to OSU. His lectures are impossible to follow unless you are some sort of math genius. He expects you to understand concepts from 1172 like you learned them years ago and they are common knowledge. He doesn't know how to do his job basically. The homework is nearly impossible.

Very easy professor and cares about students. He knows we are engineers and does not try to destroy us with terrible proofs. His exams are very fair. His lectures a bit hard to follow but recitation will make up for it.
Fangyang is a boss. The dude has a PhD from Harvard. His lectures are dry and kind of pointless, but he tells you exactly what is on the exam and he is very willing to help you out if you need it.
Lectures are dubious at best. However, he tells you exactly what topics will be on his exams, so this makes up for it.
Great professor. A little confusing at times because he's a genius and assumes you can follow him but tests are very fair!

Profesor Zheng is one of those inspiring teachers that wants his students to perform their best. He made me want to learn math. He is very helpful and encourages students to ask questions. He is also very fair, in that he will help students through harder homework problems during class. Also, class usually got out 10 minutes early :)

Dr. Zheng is an extremely helpful professor who is really interested in seeing students succeed. He does scare quite a few students to drop the class during the first lecture, but he really just wants smaller classes to maintain his excellent level of teaching students.

Best teacher I've had in the crummy math department. Totally fair grader, lays things out clearly before midterms and final so students know exactly what to expect. Laine Noble was also an EXCELLENT TA for this class.
Greatest ever. Smart, nice, helpful. Cares about students.
very good professor, skips the theorems/proofs and tells you exactly what you need to know
simply the best
actually teaches the material, and does so very well
Zheng was a great professor, the first 2 chapters made sense and were easy but the third chapter made no sense. The final is terribly hard But he curves so 33 percent get A- or higher.

MY FAVORITE PROFESSOR!  i was so scared the first day because he warned us that if we werent willing to spend lots of time on work we would fail, but he wanted to get a smaller class size.  SO helpful and SOOOO good at teaching math!

best math teacher at OSU... down to earth, friendly, and cares more about the fundamentals than semantics (unlike some of the other arrogant professors who think everyone needs to be a math major); midterms vary in difficulty but he curves and wants everyone to get by with decent grades

Dr.Zheng is the best math professor at ohio state.  He does try to scare you off on the first day, but if you stay in his class you will learn a lot in lecture.  With him I didn't have to understand things outside of class.  He curves willingly, and is a super nice guy.  I wish there were more math professors out there like dr. zheng.
He is so nice and helpful. Def. go to his office hrs if you need help.

He is the best math professor I have had so far. He has a little bit of an accent but not to bad. He likes smaller classes so he tries to scare you on the first day but after that he is a really nice guy. His midterms were very straight forward but the median was high on the second midterm so the final was really hard. Overall great professor.
Listen carefully in class... he'll give subtle hints for what will be on the exams.

Professor Zheng is the best math professor I have ever had.  He is really helpful and explains everything to a T.  He also answers questions clearly.  His tests are really straight forward, no surprise questions.  Take him if you get the chance!
No Comments
Hard class but he makes it understandable.  Go to his office hours, he is extremely helpfull one on one.
Great professor.  He gave great examples and taught the material very well.  I would recommend Fangyang to anyone.

Prof. Zheng is a VERY good professor. Always gives good examples and ALWAYS wants to help. His test are hard but the grading is fair, with a nice curve on the end. If you decide to take him, prepare to work hard for a good grade!
I dropped this class twice because the other professor I had sucked ballz.  He can teach the material so you can learn it... but you must study hard!
he is the best math teacher.

He cares about you. No matter what he says, his test WILL be hard, but he is SO much better than 95% of the other math profs.  Will be glad you were in his class. Just study hard and you'll really learn this stuff.  He explains things slowly and clearly.

Only gave a 2 for easiness because the material is so difficult.  Definitely the hardest math I ever took.  This guy is very clear in lecture, but does go a little fast.  Very tough tests, but the curve is also fair.  You wont go wrong with Fangyang Zheng

Excellent professor! Lectures are clear and helpful, but tests are somewhat hard (but fair).  He tries to scare away students during the first week of class, but don't let him intimidate you!  Will have to work hard for a good grade.
Super professor!!  Made multivariable/vector calculus understandable and interesting, how many professors can you say that about???
goes out of his way to help students learn and is very understanding.  hard tests, but not unfair
No Comments
Very helpful! Good communication, deep knowledge, easygoing guy. Highly recommend!

summary_comment: Professor Harting's teaching style is generally clear, though some students found it lacked clarity and did not provide sufficient time for thorough understanding before progressing. She offers detailed instructions and assigns challenging weekly homework and three midterms (each worth 100 points) plus a final (worth 200 points). While being present in class is not mandatory, students must be well-prepared to succeed, and she is described as very helpful.
summary_comment_short: Professor Harting's teaching style is generally clear and she provides helpful instructions, though some students found her pace too quick without sufficient time for clarification. She assigns weekly challenging homework and relies on three midterms (each 100 points) and a final (200 points) for grading, with attendance not mandatory if students are prepared for exams.

Ratings.comment: Overall teaching style wasnt very clear and did not give enough time to make sure we understood before moving on.

She gives very clear instructions and easy to understand her teaching. Three midterms (100 pt each) and a final (200 pt). Homework is assigned on a weekly basis, a little challenging compared to the question compared on the midterms. Being present in class is not mandatory as long as you know what your doing before the midterm. She is very helpful!

summary_comment: Professor Daw is dedicated to his students' learning and actively encourages participation and questions, making his classes engaging despite the challenging material. While his accent can be initially difficult to understand, students appreciate his availability and willingness to help, often staying after class or setting up appointments. His tests are known to be rigorous, but his teaching is effective, and many students find his efforts worthwhile.
summary_comment_short: Professor Daw is highly regarded for his dedication to student learning and willingness to help, though his teaching style can be challenging due to his fast pace and accent. Despite these challenges, students find him extremely supportive and helpful, often staying after class to assist students and offering extra hours for tutoring.

Ratings.comment: You can tell he really cares about his students' learning. He really encourages participation and is available at any time for questions or concerns. I learned so much from him, and he really tries to help you think for yourself. If people tell you he's a bad professor, it's just because they struggled in the class, because 1172 is DIFFICULT.
He was hard to understand, and that gave me a hard time to perform in the class. He is nice to ask questions, but it did not really help much.
It takes a few weeks to get used to Daw's accent, but he really does care about his students. He is always willing to help and truly enjoys what he teaches.
Daw is a great teacher for 1172. His tests are hard and he teaches fast but he is always super helpful when you have a question and stays after class if you need it.

Daw was a great professor. He was much better than the previous professor I had taken Calculus with. His accent takes a while to get use to, but his helpfulness makes up for it. He even has extra hours if you need them. I would highly recommend Daw.

Dr Daw teaches FAST. There is a lot of confusion and his tests are maximum difficult. However, his intention is to teach, not to torture, and working hard WILL pay off. He is a decent teacher and a very good man, but not an easy prof.

Daw's class may not be the easiest, and he may not be the easiest to understand but he is very helpful and is willing to stay after and help you understand or set up appointments. Also set a huge curve at the end, so dont get discouraged.

summary_comment: Professor Swang is highly regarded for his clarity and fairness in teaching calculus, making complex concepts accessible and straightforward. His lectures are well-organized, with detailed notes available online, though attending class is still beneficial for some students. He is known for his caring nature and responsiveness, which contributes to a supportive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Swang is highly regarded for his clarity and fairness, making complex concepts accessible and ensuring students understand the material thoroughly. His lectures are well-organized and detailed, with all materials available online, though attending class is still recommended for a deeper understanding and support.

Ratings.comment: Ted is one of the best and most fair lecturers I have had so far at OSU. He cares about his students and makes calc as easy as he can. Although you don't need to go to class, if you do, you will get an A.

Ted is a great guy who cares about his students. He is very helpful in office hours and he is quick to respond to emails. The class is the same every year so the exam and final reviews are almost the same as exams. I would definitely recommend Ted

Prof. Swang was easily the clearest math teacher I've had in my academic career. He made everything very easy to understand and although sometimes his pace was frustratingly slow, it made the class better overall. I really appreciate how much he seems to care about his students.

Ted Swang taught me business calculus, which is the easier route to complete calc. He was an amazing, kind professor who posts all of his lecture notes and has extremely clear lectures. I had a great TA so I didnt go to lecture as much as I shouldve, but seriously a greaprofessor,lecture notes taught me everything I know
Go to lecture and be engaged. All lectures and notes were posted on Carmen afterwards, however he is very clear and takes his time in explaining.

Never been a math person, but Ted makes the information very clear and easy to follow. He's such a fun and genuinely sweet professor, and cares about your grade. I never had to go to office hours or get extra help because everything is very clear and precise.
Teddy is the man. I never went to class, he posts all his lectures and practice assignments online.

Ted Swang does a good job of making his lectures clear and concise. I am not great at math but I was able to work through the notes and do the questions from lectures with ease. He writes out everything that he says during lecture so, you really don't have to go to lecture and can just read the notes he posts online.

Good lecture, basically lays everything out for you. If you can follow the examples in lecture you should be fine on tests and quizzes. I made the mistake of buying the textbook when I literally have not opened it one time, so I would recommend no textbook.
Teaches the math so very clearly. Easy to follow. Lovable man. Willing to work with you. Would highly recommend.

Ted makes his lectures very easy to understand and is also more than willing to help students outside of class if they need more help. His notes are very clear and straightforward and I would highly recommend his class.

I would recommend Ted to anyone taking Math 1131! He had a style of teaching that helped everyone in the lecture understand the material. Lectures and recitations are optional, but quizzes and homework are done in recitation. Ted is also very helpful in office hours and cares about his students success.

summary_comment: Professor Carlson is highly regarded for his clear explanations and helpful approach, making his classes accessible even to those without prior advanced calculus experience. Students appreciate his thorough knowledge and dedication to learning, though some find his lectures challenging due to extensive proofs. Overall, Professor Carlson is seen as an excellent instructor who supports students both in and out of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Carlson is highly regarded for his clear explanations and helpfulness, though some find his lectures challenging due to detailed proofs. Students appreciate his knowledge, fairness in grading, and dedication to learning, often citing his office hours as particularly beneficial.

Ratings.comment: I never knew who this man was until I woke up one day and my roommates had put a picture of him on the wall. Ever since then I've wanted to take his classes and I finally had the chance last term. 10/10 I love Tim Carlson and got a sweater with a picture of him on it. My roommates and I all have matching Tim Carlson sweaters

Professor Carlson is great, I really enjoyed his class. The material isnt too difficult and he explains it very clearly. Fair grader and gives back feedback. Very doable even with a full schedule. Homework takes a long time but if you understand the assignments you wont have an issue getting a good grade.
Great teacher, very helpful in lecture and office hours. Does spend a lot of time with unnecessary proofs during lecture, you can usually ignore these if you understand the concepts.

Very clear and concise when explaining himself.  He often goes of explaining proofs that don't need to be known.  Moved very quickly, so you need to make sure you read all the details in the book.  Tests had basic problems from each section and were relatively easy. Very smart and willing to listen/help. Having a good recitation instructor helped.

Tim, Tim, Tim...he is a very cool guy who is very very smart. If you go into this class haven taken AP Calc in high school it is pretty much a review. Don't need to go to lectures at all if u look over which sections he will be teaching and you think you know them. Tests were the EASY problems from reviews. Very picky grader-show all work.
Extremely good professor.  Knows his stuff, is very clear in lectures, easy to learn from.
Prof. Carlson is a great Instructor. Cares only only about learning and does not care for administrative crap. Fantastic help during office hours. Very inspiring during lectures.

Great guy, his lectures are a little hard to follow especially when he's writing proof's, but he is very helpful in office hours. Well show you exactly what you need to do in office hours. Also encourages the students to think for themselves. He also gives great practice problems which are pretty similar to midterms and finals.
Great teacher. Very helpful in office hours. Encourages students to learn.
Couldn't ask for anything  better. Great professor.
very knowledgable, well organized lectures.  charming and great boyish handsome looks.
a class on ultrafilter Ramsey theory. Very knowledgeable, and easy to learn from. I highly recommend a course from Tim.
Good teacher overall.  Very willing to help.

summary_comment: Professor Harper is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and patient approach, consistently offering valuable assistance and support to students through various means including office hours and tutoring sessions at the MSLC.
summary_comment_short: Professor Harper is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and patient approach, offering quick and useful assistance and maintaining readily accessible office hours and tutoring support. Students consistently praise his ability to explain concepts clearly and his willingness to help those who need it.

Ratings.comment: He is a very nice person and I respect him. he can offer me the most useful help quickly.

He was my TA and he was amazing at explaining things and had so much patience for people that didnt understand! He offered office hours and he tutored for the MSLC so he was always easy to get in contact with if you need help!

summary_comment: Professor McGinnis is highly knowledgeable but struggles significantly with teaching effectiveness. Students find his lectures confusing and often too theoretical, with many preferring to self-study using the textbook and online notes. While his exams are challenging and require substantial effort, some students managed to perform well despite the difficulties. Overall, his classes are demanding and not recommended for those who prefer a more traditional teaching approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor McGinnis is highly knowledgeable but struggles significantly with teaching clarity and pace, often making simple concepts difficult and explaining them in overly complex ways. Despite this, many students find the material manageable with self-study and additional resources, and some appreciate his depth of understanding and theoretical approach to calculus.

Ratings.comment: Daryl was pretty average. I thought he sucked when I had him, but he was ok when I look back on him, having now took linear algebra, which was much harder. His lectures can be long, but try to pay attention, study a little bit outside, and you'll be fine on the tests. Don't be afraid to ask for help, as it'll be worse later on if you don't.

Gives very little partial credit, exams are really tough and he makes the class much harder than it needs to be. Expect questions far beyond the textbook and in class examples. He just doesn't care for teaching and it shows

This guy is incredibly smart. His problem lies in just that. He almost explains things in such an advanced way for a calc 2 class. Great theory guy and really lets you understand the reasoning behind everything. The tests are made by the department so pretty challenging.
He was very confusing and made simple math a harder than it needed to be.

He is a very smart guy, though his lectures are horrible. He hardly Explains the concepts, merely showing the online notes. He would be better served as a theory of math instructor as whenever he goes over a topic he describes it in some arbitrary way of playing in a sandbox or grocery shopping

Professor McGinnis was overall not a bad professor. He gives a lot of homework, especially for a 2 credit hour class. I got a 100% on the first midterm and a 90% on the second, so the class is definitely manageable. Our final was take home to compensate for the hard homework and midterms. Expect to read the textbook; it's more useful than lecture.

Daryl is very smart but he is an awful teacher. To make matters worse he gives out loads of homework, even over spring break. Notes are on the board as he wizzes through them, class has been LESS than helpful. If you take him, you will have to teach yourself everything. This material is extremely difficult, and taught as if you're a mat major AVOID

McGinnis really knows his stuff. He puts his notes online so that you can reference them . However, when it comes to lectures he just reads off the notes. He also goes really fast. I also had a bad TA so the class was difficult. However, if you read the book and go to the MSLC you can do fine.

Professor McGinnis might have been one of the worst teachers I have ever had.  He always seemed to be arrogant if you went to ask him a question, and his lectures were just going over online notes previously given to you.  If you work hard you should be able to do decent, but you may need to look for outside sources for help.

Online, he is by far the most helpful lecturer I have had. All of his notes are online along with test prep etc. In lecture, he mumbles and reads off pre-written slides that he scrolls through waaaay too fast. Most people I know end up falling asleep because he's boring and the pace is too fast to keep up anyway. Thank God for my amazing TA.

McGinnis definitely knows his stuff. He has all his notes online, however during class he just went over these notes. Made it really hard to pay attention with no actual problems being done in class and if it wasn't for such an amazing TA, my gr would have been worse than it already was. Some like him, I didn't learn anything from him.

I had McGinnis as a TA, and he was very helpful, considering I had a terrible lecturer. He is very smart and knows a lot about math. Quizzes and amount of homework problems were fair. The only thing that disappointed me was that he sometimes would try to answer a question with a "similar" problem that ended up looking nothing like what you asked.

mcginnis is a fantastic lecturer. he keeps you interested in class, always has good examples to relate to, and after attending his class a few times you'll discover he is very bright. he makes complicated things easy to understand. great at answering questions. doesn't mess around with dumb stuff, he tells you what you need to know and how to do it

If you are taking 151 this is the professor you want to have. He posts all his notes online, as well as old quizzes that are identical to those which you take during the year. He provides great examples and tells you exactly what you need to know. I left another lecture to come to his because I heard it was the best and he sure didn't let me down.
Super nice guy who posts lecture notes and helpful materials online. He is very good at explaining things and is a great professor. TAKE MCGINNIS for MATH 151.
Daryl is the man. Best TA in the universe. He's got swagger. Amazing skills with chalk and really good at explaining math. Take his class.

Awesome TA. Explained everything really thoroughly, gave us tons of examples and posted old quizzes and tests online so we would be able to study better.  Came off as kind of a jerk at first, but really a good guy once you get to know him. Definitely saved my grade in 152.

Exactly like what's said below.  If you want to get a good grade in 132, he's going to show you how to do it.  Go to every one of his recitations and you will know what you're doing.  Kind of comes of as a jerk at first, but he's really a great guy. Sometimes he might even say something funny.

By far, he is the best professor teaching 132. His notes are all online, and are incredibly detailed, but not complicated. Lectures are crystal clear.I think he curves final grades though not 100% sure about this), so if you work and study hard you actually have a chance of getting a good grade. Highly recommended, take him if you can!

He expects you to do what you need to in order to learn material.  Collected one hw assignment over entire 10-week period.  Quizzes once a week, 3 midterms in a quarter.  He's a nice guy, and he looks like Orlando Bloom.

Gotta love the online notes. Recomend printing them out and looking them over bofore class so you can just follow along as he does go kind of fast. Answers your questions well. Overall, a solid teacher.
Great teacher, all around nice guy. Lectures are clear and everythings online, so it's actually possible to get an A. Not too bad to look at, either.
Dr. McGinnis was an awesome teacher. His notes were very helpful and he put things in a manner you could understand. For a hard course like 148 he made it much easier.
an awful, sarcastic TA that should not be teaching

McGinnis care about his students.  He repeats what he says becuase he wants his class to understand the concepts.  All of his notes are online and you dont have to attend lectures except to get a better understanding of his notes.  He cares about all of his students. If you take 132 TAKE MCGINNIS!

Excellent teacher. He is the best for 132 and teaches the 3:30 section. His online notes are extremely helpful even for those with different lecturers.  Probably the best teacher I have had so far at OSU.

McGinnis is one of my best prof ever. He knows whats going on and his explanations are clear. You don't have to spend much time on writing notes, caz he has his website that has downloadable notes, it's extremely easy. Neat and prepared! Recommanded!!

Really good teacher. Lectures go at good pace and you don't have to go if you don't want, all material is online (this is helpful when your 132 teacher sucks and you can access his 132 notes!!!) Definitely wish I had him for all my math classses
Mysteriously resembles Johnny Depp in the movie "Chocolat." Good teacher, very clear. Puts all his notes and examples online so you can still learn even if you don't feel like going to class.

McGinnis, was I would say the best teacher you could get for 132.  He repeats information a lot, but that is just so it is drilled in our minds, he is clear in his speaking and teaching of the material.  Extra-help wasen't very useful he was always on his cell phone, but he allowed make up grades on missed quizzes.  All in all a good experience.
This guy was awesome.....always asked for questions, to clear up any uncertainties, extremely helpful, wish we had more profs as personable as him

Speaks english clearly, neat handwriting, explains the concepts and devotes a lot of time to answering your questions. I wished he incorporated more class interaction; something that most night classes tend to have.
he looks like johnny depp!

Again, calculus is difficult at times and boring most of the time. However, McGinnis is very helpful, explains things well, and spends a lot of time answering students questions.  From what I've heard about other professors who don't speak English, McGinnis is a much better teacher.
No Comments
very clear on what he's teaching. willing to help. he if wrote the test they would probably be easier.
helpful, explains well. good guy
Knows his stuff; Devotes much time to student questions; quizzes/tests are fair

summary_comment: Professor Edgren is widely regarded as ineffective in his teaching, with students noting significant discrepancies in grading compared to other TAs. Lectures are criticized for focusing heavily on proofs and theorems without providing practical problem-solving examples, making the material difficult to grasp. Students recommend attending every class and recitation, emphasizing the importance of additional study and resources like MyMathLab.
summary_comment_short: Professor Edgren is widely regarded as ineffective in his teaching, with many students noting significant discrepancies in grading compared to other TAs. His lectures are criticized for focusing heavily on proofs and theorems without providing practical problem-solving examples, making the material difficult to grasp.

Ratings.comment: He is a TA for Math 1151, AKA Calculus 1. He's absolutely awful. Compared to other TA's if you can help it, try to get a different one. He will give you a D on the exact same work that another TA will give you a B on - he will fail you if you're not careful.

Neil is a nice guy, and he does care about getting you to learn something. His lectures were terrible at the start of the year as it was a ton of writing down theorems and a huge lack of problem examples and how to solve them. He improved greatly as the year went on tho and let me do homework in his office hours every week and was always helpful.

Go to every class and recitation. This is a hard subject, and he's not the best lecturer. He moves through the material quickly and is much better 1 on 1. I love math and probably spent about 5 or 6 hours per week doing homework or inside the tutor lounge and barely made the A-. Book is useless, just get MyMathLab.

His lectures are maybe the most pointless thing I've ever attended for Calc 1. He solely goes over proofs and theorems, but only after he sets up for the first twenty minutes of class. The information given is most likely irrelevant to the actual coursework as well.

summary_comment: Professor Parshall is highly regarded for his thorough teaching and engaging lectures, though his courses are known to be challenging. Students appreciate his honesty, sense of humor, and willingness to help, as well as his availability during office hours. His detailed notes and clear explanations of concepts contribute significantly to student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Parshall is highly regarded for his thorough teaching and dedication to student success, though his classes are challenging. He is known for his clear explanations, helpful office hours, and strong commitment to student understanding, even going so far as to argue on behalf of students when necessary.

Ratings.comment: Great guy who is super honest about the course. The class itself is a lot of work but he does his best to work with his students and see them succeed. He also has a great sense of humor and is just a great guy to talk to. Truly the best professor that I have had in college so far!

Hans' linear algebra class (SP2020) was great.
