I normally don't like math too much, but he was very good at explaining things conceptually, and his lectures and homework lined up well with his quizzes and exams. His office hours were a godsend. I think he's leaving OSU soon. If you're taking his class at his new university, you're in good hands.
Hans is very knowledgeable and a pretty solid teacher. The material is not a cake walk, but he teaches it well and thoroughly. Only complaint is he sometimes has a snotty attitude

Great professor with great lectures. Content is difficult but he's very explicit about what he wants you to study. Keep up with the homework and you'll do fine on quizzes. He cares a lot and is very helpful in office hours and will make extra appointments if you need.

He was a pretty good professor just teaching a tough course. He really tries to explain things well to students and wants you to ask questions if you have any. He can be sarcastic at times but its nothing too bad. The course 1172 is extremely tough however. Try not to take it at all costs; especially if you already have AP BC credit.

Hans is probably the best calc 2/3 teacher there is. Do the homework and go to lectures. He post notes online, gives note skeletons before class (give you the graphs and problems before class so you dont have to spend time writing them during the lecture). GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS, he specifically makes them 3 people so he can help Everyone.

If you take practice exams & go in for help, you will succeed. Class is a grind and the math department is extremely disorganized, but Hans is a great guy and excellent lecturer. Skeleton notes are super helpful and if there are grading mistakes on exams he takes care of it instantly. Overall awesome class thanks to him.

Amazing lecturer. Very prepared most of the time and tells you exactly what to expect on exams and how to study for them. Puts lecture skeletons and full notes on Carmen. Really cares for the students and will argue the math department if they do something unfair to the students.

Smart guy who knows what he's doing. Very clear, organized lectures. Very clear about what's expected of you. Takes notes on a projected iPad. Office hours are very useful if you come with questions. Will 100% argue with the math department for your sake if something's wrong. Cares very much about the class especially if you go to him for help.

Hans is probably the best 1172 professor at Ohio State. He posts his lectures to carmen which helps when stuck on homework. He is very upfront about what the department expects you to do. His office hours are amazing. I got an A because he prepared us very well for exams and is very easy to understand and follow. TAKE ALL OF THE PRACTICE EXAMS!!!!!

Lectures are very organized and easy to follow along with, and Hans is very approachable when you need help. Most of the issues with this class are out of his hands and are due to the math department. Get help early on if you're struggling with the material. The tests suck making sure you really understand the concepts is the best way to succeed.

1172 is terribly hard and the Math dept. is awful, but he hates them as much as we do. His lectures are very interesting and funny, and he truly cares about teaching. I learned a great deal from him, but the math dept. screws everyone on the tests anyway. I would have been completely lost if not for Hans' great lectures.

1172 at OSU is a really hard class but Hans made it interesting. He is very young, and like most young professors is actually interested in teaching. His office hours are very organized so your questions will actually be answered. He makes the lecture interesting and tries to get the math department to work with the students.
Math 1172 is definitely a rough time, but Hans is very engaging during the lectures and provides great notes.
Funny dude with good lectures. Math dept sucks, but he makes the class manageable.

Hans is a pro lecturer, although he can be a bit of a jerk and make you afraid to ask questions. He will argue with the crappy math department to try to help you, very clutch indeed. Make sure you email him first if you have problems. There are tons of resources available for you, and he points them out to you. Calc 2 is hard, 100% go to the MSLC!

Hans is definitely one of the better Math lecturers at OSU. He genuinely wants students to learn and is always available outside of class. Although MATH 3345 is a relatively hard class and his exams were quite challenging, he set a reasonable curve after each exam and arranged extra credit quizzes every week.

Hans is one of the best professors I've had at OSU, and is one of the few who went out of his way to be helpful. Has very flexible office hours, gave a few bonus quizzes, gives useful test feedback and genuinely wants you to do well. He responds to emails very quickly and is very reachable that way. Finds a way to make a very hard class manageable.

Hans is honestly one of the best profs I've had at OSU. Dude not only had super clear and helpful lectures but he's also really willing to help you outside of class in whatever way he can. He's younger so a lot of it probably comes from his understanding this generation's college-aged students. I HIGHLY recommend him for whatever math he's teaching

1172 is an extremely tough class, be ready to do lots of homework and spend many hours studying. Hans doesn't make the test, the math department does and they do everything in their power to make it difficult. Hans personally is not a bad prof. Extremely intelligent and has an ego because of it. Good at teaching though, very clear speaking
He was available outside of class and did his best to get us all through the horror that was calc 2. Solid prof, would take another class taught by him.

Hans is a really good lecturer. He explains things well for how short amount of time he has to teach the material. 1172 is all of calc 2 and 1/2 of calc 3 so it is a lot of material in not much time so Hans does a good job explaining things that are important. Him and Talemo are both great professors for this class

Even though I didn't perform as well as I had hoped in this class, I really enjoyed having Hans as a lecturer. He was very enthusiastic and explained things in a way that could be understood easily. 1172 is a hard class, no matter which professor you end up getting.

He is a great lecturer, knows his material well although makes silly mistakes constantly. He speaks very clearly and has clear handwriting and is sure to write out every thing you need for the exams. Be sure to do extra work outside class though, do lots of the optional worksheets. The course is hard, no curve and no extra credit opportunities.

Be prepared to put a LOT of time into homework and more time into optional work. Read before class if you want to have any chance of following the lecture. Exams are very hard and LONG. No curve and no extra credit opportunities. Fast lecture, doesn't write out notes, bad attitude.

summary_comment: Professor Osborne is highly passionate about calculus and math, making her classes engaging and encouraging group participation. While students appreciate her energy and approachability, some find her class demanding and challenging, particularly due to extensive outside work and unexpected written assignments. Her grading can be perceived as harsh, leading to mixed recommendations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Osborne is highly passionate about calculus and math, making her classes engaging and encouraging group participation. However, her grading can be harsh, particularly on exams, and she assigns papers in math classes, which some students find unusual and challenging.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Osborne is very passionate about Calculus and math in general. She makes the class interesting and encourages group participation. I would definitely take a class with her again!
I thought that she was a good lecturer. She was always very energetic and was nice during office hours. You definitely need to put in a lot of outside work for the class, though.

She's really nice as a person, but we had papers in her math class. It was the weirdest thing ever. I have never taken a math professor who requires you to write papers. Just don't take her if you hate writing. Also, the grading on her exams was ridiculously harsh in my opinion. I wouldn't recommend her. At least she was really nice.

summary_comment: Professor Delgado Carrillo is widely regarded as having one of the lowest teaching quality ratings among math instructors, with students finding her classes extremely challenging and unhelpful. Her grading is reportedly harsh and inconsistent, often punishing students for variations in problem-solving approaches. Her teaching style is described as confusing and ineffective, making it difficult for students to grasp the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Delgado Carrillo is widely regarded as having extremely poor teaching quality, making even basic math concepts difficult to grasp and nearly impossible to excel in due to her harsh grading and confusing teaching methods. Students find her classes overwhelmingly negative and challenging.

Ratings.comment: In 14 years of math courses, this was the worse course I have ever taken. The math is so easy but Moicna makes it impossible to get a good grade. She will tear your answers to shreds and If it's not explained in the same way she would do it you will be punished. Not to mention her class is miserable, she never makes any sense of teaching.

summary_comment: Professor Neal is highly knowledgeable but struggles to simplify complex material, making it challenging for students who lack a strong foundational understanding. Students often find his lectures and notes difficult to follow due to their technical nature and lack of clear examples, leading to confusion and frustration. While some appreciate his passion and office hours, many recommend finding alternative instructors or seeking additional resources to supplement his teachings.
summary_comment_short: Professor Neal is perceived as knowledgeable but struggles with teaching clarity, particularly for students new to advanced mathematical concepts. Students find his lectures and notes dense and lacking in practical examples, leading to confusion and difficulty in understanding the material.

Ratings.comment: He doesn't know how to dumb things down for someone who's only taken 2153. The textbook is useless. Homework problems are much harder than anything done in class or in the textbook. It's also a MATLAB section so there were many visits to StackExchange to figure out how to do anything (because like I said the textbook is useless). Don't recommend.

Do not take a class with Neal Edgren! He is way too smart and, therefore, does not know how to dumb things down so that his students can understand the material. His notes are extremely wordy and he provides little to no examples in his notes. He is useless in his office hours and you leave more confused than you came. Find a new professor early!

Lectures are fast paced but he writes the notes with you on his iPad (if that makes sense). Has a lenient grading distribution but grades homework hard. If youre used to Ximera participation points it will be a rude awakening.

Took this class online and in person. Would not recommend this style of class, but Neal was a nice guy who taught my recitation. Don't ask him any questions in class because he gets nervous and can't answer. He's smart, but bad at explaining. I wish he taught a different subject because he seems great.

So Neal was my recitation TA for calc 1 (math 1151). I had Bobby Ramsay for my lecture prof (he's great). It's clear Neal loves math, but man, if you don't, you're not going to understand him or want to pay attention to him. I guess I am just disappointed because my 1150 TA was so good.

2162 is just hard, and I don't think Neal really made it easier. During lectures, he did a lot of technical proofs that were confusing instead of going through example problems. He is good at explain problems one on one but overall as a lecturer doesn't explain concepts in a clear manner. He also mumbles a lot.

Neal knows a lot about math, but he focused on trivial details of some of the topics rather than the topic as a whole. During recitation, he sometimes didn't know the answers to his problem. He also stands right in front of the examples, which was irritating. This class was very difficult in general, but I don't think that Neal made it any easier.

Neal loves math and it shows. 2162 is a hard class to begin with, but Neal made it interesting for me. He goes through a lot of proofs with few examples, but that is what the homework is for. The exams are hard, but the exams are the same across 2162 professors. I loved going to his office hours and just listening to what he had to say.

I'd stay away. Class was way too tough for him to be such an incompetent instructor. The one and only good thing about him is that he's helpful when it comes to asking for points back on midterms, etc. , unlike other specific instructors in the math department.... His lectures can be hard to follow. I had to retake the class...

First, I do not recommend taking MATH 2162. Second, Neal is a good Professor with a lot of proofs, but they are so important to the exams. That is why exams are so hard in this class. There was a little curve as well. If you love Calculus, take with him, if you don't, don't.

2162 is hard no matter who you have. Neal teaches from the book and did a lot of proofs that no one understood. The tests are about your problem solving and application abilities; it's going to be something you haven't solved before, and you can't freak out. I liked Neal because I love calc. If I didn't, class would be hard.

Like a lot of math types, Neal knows his stuff but given the complexity of the material, he focuses on unimportant things like proofs and derivations at the expense of examples, making it hard to convey what's important. The exams are also really hard, but there was a decent curve.
Do not take 2162 whatever you do. Avoid it at all costs.

He does not explain the material much at all in class. He'll also go 5-10 minutes over the time period every day so if you have a class immediately after math you'll miss material. His lectures are confusing and jump around from sections so good luck taking notes. You have to teach yourself everything.

This is the worst professor at OSU. His lectures were confusing and never made sense. Hi only mode of talking is mumbling nonsensically. He never showed us how to do problems. He is condescending towards students and doesn't know what he is talking about half of the time. He ruined my freshman year of college - he is just a horrible person overall.

Neal was awful. His lectures tended to be very confusing and unclear or super pointless. He will also confuse himself occasionally and make bad jokes, which is often distracting. Expect to learn most stuff from your TA and textbook. He's accessible outside of class, but I don't know if it'll help. Overall, math dept. gave us LOTS of hw & bad exams.

The fact is Calc 2 is hard no matter what professor you have. You have to attend lecture, recitation and visit the tutor room. Neal is a good prof. He can sometimes get theoretical in lectures, but most math lecturers do.  He was willing to help explain things that again weren't clear at first. Be prepared to put a lot of time into calc 2.

Avoid this guy at all costs. He doesn't teach to the exams, is vague and unprepared during lectures, always runs over time on lecture, has difficult office hours, and overall is not helpful. I had to attend another professor's lecture in addition to this one in order to learn the material. Awful.

Neal seems nice enough, but he is terrible at teaching what you need to know for this difficult course. He explains the theories for things, but rarely makes it through the entire lecture and confuses people with his "jokes". He seems like someone I'd hang out with, not learn about Taylor Series from. Avoid at all costs.

He is not a good lecturer. He consistently runs over time during lectures. Even with the extra time he takes he only gets through half the lesson and has to have the TAs cover the other half. He is consistently unprepared for lectures and most times is confused about what he is saying. Overall just don't take his class if you can.

Neal is a nice guy, but he isn't very good at explaining the material. His lectures are as though he is reading the textbook, and he likes to go into more of the theory behind what we're learning. Make sure you go to recitation if you have him and do lots of practice (utilize the worksheets online). As long as you put effort in, you can do well.

I really enjoy Neal's lectures. He explains things well and when he doesn't get to touch on something he makes sure to let his TA's know to touch on it in recitation. He seems like a genuine guy and he tries to make sure everyone understands before continuing. I'm doing better in calc 2 than I did in calc 1 and I believe part of that is him.

Edgren has no idea how to explain concepts in a simple way to students. This would be fine in a higher level math class, but in Calc I it's a real pain. Additionally, his lectures always run over and he has to frantically explain the concept he spent fifty minutes discussing in a roundabout fashion. You better hope you get a good TA.

Professor makes topics much more difficult than they should be, makes up examples that don't make much sense, lengthy unnecessary proofs of theorems, goes right to the end of class time, leave very confused and have to typically reach yourself, because of lengthily examples he doesn't get to all the topics you need to know.

His lectures are not very helpful and he will go over a lot of stuff in lecture that you don't actually need to know (lots of proofs).  The tests are unnecessarily hard because content that is straightforward is made more difficult.  Hope that you have a good TA or you will have to teach yourself.

Lectures are fast paced and designed to cover a lot of material as quickly as possible. Explains concepts in a mathematical sense but don't expect any real world application. Requires a lot of focus and work outside of class to be prepared for difficult tests. Dry sense of humor that most people don't catch but hilarious if you get it.

Essentially reads from the textbook and gives convoluted proofs for concepts while occasionally going on unnecessary tangents. Lectures almost always go over time and are almost useless for understanding this class. Recitation is where I learned everything in this class. Exams are rough, and Neal does not help you prepare for them.

Literally reads the textbook to you in lecture. Most times, the textbook explains the concepts/problems more clearly than he does. You are definitely better off just looking over online lessons from the MSLC than attending his lectures. Tests consist of a few straight forward problems, and the rest not so much.
Horrible lecturer. Doesn't explain material very well and is very boring. Math department makes tests really hard.. He's not very helpful in office hours either. TA's are better than him.

Horrible lecturer. Doesn't explain material very well and is very boring. His tests (and all the tests for Calc I) are hard. He's not very helpful in office hours either. Failed the first two midterms, got a private tutor, and ended up passing. The class is also curved, even though they tell you it's not.
Terrible, his tests are meant to confuse you and fail you
There is an horrible first midterm

Lecture is exact same thing from textbook. Boring and disinterested. Gives proofs for a lot of rules that are unnecessary. Unprepared. I got a 5 on Calc AB and his tests were so difficult and lectures of new material were so poor that despite doing the homework and studying for hours I received a C

As others have said, much more into the theory of calculus then practical applications. I didn't have too much trouble learning from him. I had AP Calc AB in high school though. If you ask for help and go to office hours he'll help you. Exams are tough, keep that in mind. They give you questions that really make you apply your knowledge of calc.
He is pretty nice and willing to help as long as you ask for it. But he can be very awkward, making it hard to talk to him.
He's confusing in his lectures, he jumps around so much.  He gives his notes straight from the textbook so the lecture is pointless
Material covered in recitation and lecture is not helpful for the test.

Edgren does not help in office hours, he dances around your questions. The TAs do the same thing, and if you haven't taken a calculus class before you're better off waiting until another lecturer's class opens up.

Edgren is alright, but he focuses more on theory than on the application. Oftentimes, this leads to students to not pay attention during lecture, and then miss parts that are important. However, he does have a good understanding of the material and is willing to help.
Tons of HW, unclear lecture and handwriting, better not do it
It feels like Neil just goes off the book everyday and isn't prepared as should be. Plus the exams are harder than the examples he gives us.
Dr. Edgren does a decent job teaching the material, he is much more interested n the theory than the application however.  If you do the homework and ask the right questions you'll be fine.
Avoid if possible. His lectures are anything but clear,  and he makes his exams extra difficult for 1161 because we've all taken calculus before.
Neal is great when he reads from the book, but lord help you if you try to understand the concepts of what he's teaching.

Exactly what you expect from a math engineering based professor. If you go to his office and you genuinely have a soul, he will look out for your best interest. The key to this class is getting a TA with a name you can spell and pronounce.

summary_comment: Professor Schweinhart is known for his caring nature and dedication to student learning, but his teaching style often leaves students feeling overwhelmed and confused, particularly regarding practical applications of mathematical concepts. While some students appreciate his thoroughness and patience, others find his lectures and grading methods challenging, with many recommending against taking his courses due to poor organization and unclear explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schweinhart is known for his caring nature and dedication to student learning, but his teaching style often leaves students feeling overwhelmed and confused, particularly regarding practical applications of mathematical concepts. Many students find his lectures and grading policies challenging, with some describing his classes as poorly organized and difficult to follow.

Ratings.comment: He's caring and wants to help. However, he expects students to love math and dig deeper by ourselves, rather to realize that math is only a tool for most of us. He doesn't show how to apply the theorem and formula, instead he will show how the problem can be complex and "interesting" to figure it out, which makes us more confused.

Worst professor Ive ever had. Aced all math classes throughout high school and college so far, this class was so poorly taught. No organizational skills, is rarely available for help and when he is you will leave more confused than you came. 0/10 recommend taking math4530, which is such an important class for many majors, if he is your prof.
He is tough grader on everything. He gives questions on a topic he never mentioned as homework. Unclear lecture, unclear explanation... Don't recommend taking his linear algebra.

The worst math prof I've ever seen at OSU. Honestly, I aced all math classes since high school until in college, not sure whether I could ace again. He's so bad at logic flow and structure. He doesn't understand what to elaborate more for easier understanding. He's caring enough, but bad at explaining. His class is basically a one-man show.

Dr. Schweinhart is a decent professor. He somewhat lays out what he expects students to know for tests but the graded HW's are all out of the textbook (which is terrible) and we don't really learn all the material necessary to complete the HW's. Especially when there is no partial credit. Exams are broad, no clear cut guide. In class notes are eh

The best Math professor I have ever met. He is extremely responsible and patient. And, he really concern about what students learned and received form this course. If you truly want to learn some staff, come to his lecture.

Hard class but he does a good job teaching the material. He is quick to respond to emails and a very fast grader (we got our exam grades the night we took them). He also gives nice curves on the exams. He's somewhat unorganized: we used two different textbooks, and not a lot was posted online (no lecture notes). Overall a good professor.

summary_comment: Professor Niemeyer is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which many students find enjoyable and memorable. However, his lectures are often criticized for being disorganized and lacking clear notes, with some students finding them difficult to follow without additional preparation. Despite this, many appreciate his willingness to help and provide feedback, though his teaching methods are not universally praised for their effectiveness in preparing students for exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Niemeyer is known for his eccentric teaching style, often sharing anecdotes and using overheads instead of structured lectures, which can make it challenging for students to follow and retain information. Despite being described as easy-going, funny, and empathetic, his approach is inconsistent, with some students finding his classes engaging and helpful while others find them disorganized and difficult to learn from.

Ratings.comment: Tom is an alright guy, but not a horrible recitation teacher. The guy teaches like its 1980 still. he thinks hes right 100% of the time and gets angry when you confront him with an opposite viewpoint (most of which were taught by the actual lecturer?). Often jumps around, shares anecdotal stories, and neglects to write down half of what he says.

Very smart and knows what he is talking about. Used to write tests and knew exactly what would be on our midterm to prepare us before. An absolute wizard. Funny. Tends to get chalk all over his clothes when he's teaching.

He's great! Showed lots of examples in class and would happily answer any questions you have. He makes the class simple but yet makes you stay on your toes. 10% of your grade comes from very easy online homework that is usually 10 questions due every couple weeks, 10% quizzes that are given every couple weeks and 80% from exams that aren't hard.

Nice guy, as others have stated, but that doesn't matter. At all.  Prefers to write things on an overhead instead of having a lecture prepared. Often jumps around, shares anecdotal stories, and neglects to write down half of what he says. Mumbles, assumes too much, and makes the class more of a chore than it needs to be.   Read the book in class.

Your usual easy and very lenient professor. Build a relationship with him throughout the semester and he will like you (for an example, approach him after class and just talk to him) Skipped all the time and participated in class and still passed.
Mr. Niemeyer is a perfect math professor. Great with feedback and helps with any and every question until the concept is understood. Very empathetic would highly recommend to anybody taking math

Niemeyer is a generally nice and funny person. However, as a trig professor I would not recommend him. His lectures are so scattered it is nearly impossible to learn the topics. He tells many personal stories which are entertaining but not helpful when it comes to test time. He does not use a microphone and mumbles very often.
Tom is easy going and really funny. He makes learning math fun, and is by far my favorite T.A.

I like Tom. He's funny and makes things interesting, but he can be unclear at times. He does give lots of examples which do help and if you're willing to take the afternoon class and stay a bit afterwards, he'll help you with any questions you may have! Just a cool and relaxed guy.

Tom is a very nice guy, very personable. He doesn't care if you attend class. With that being said he is very all over the place. And doesn't stay on topic which makes it difficult to understand. He also makes no time outside of class for his students with the exception of a little time before class starts.
cool dood
I'm a first quarter freshman, and I already know that he is one of the best TAs I will ever have. He always answers your questions. I'm so happy to have gotten him.
I loved Tom! The best thing was he would hold separate review session before every midterm which were incredibly helpful! My favorite TA so far!
BEST TA YOU COULD POSSIBLY GET AT OHIO STATE...no doubt about it!
Best TA at Ohio State.
Extremely helpful and mad math as enjoyable as math can be made.

If you get a chance to take a class with Niemeyer, DO IT! He will answer any and every question you throw at him, and outline what exams are going to be like to the best of his knowledge. He really is out there to help, and you can tell he loves teaching. Niemeyer is a great guy, one of the best Math TA's @ OSU, I can't imagine many being better.

Tom is a great teacher. He can and will break the material down to a level you can understand. If you have trouble with Algebra, Tom is your Prof. He'll get you through it as long as your willing to make the effort.

I love this man.  It took me 3 attempts to get through the class and he was the only one who could do it.  He was always available to help and did an amazing job of personalizing his teaching methods to the individual's needs.  He's wonderful.

Tom is a very helpful TA who takes as much time as needed to make sure that you understand what you're doing. No matter what Prof you have, he will be able to explain the material clearly. Helps you correct mistakes instead of just marking them.

Tom was an excellent T.A. for me.  Not only did he help with any problem, he explained it slowly and very clearly so I understood it.  What really impressed me was how he took the time to learn and remember my name, that meant a lot to me.  Very good guy.
Best TA ive had so far, tom is very helpful and personable with everyone. he explained things in the easiest way possible, and i really have a hard time with math

summary_comment: Professor Niemeyer is perceived as a humorous and relaxed instructor who effectively addresses students' questions during recitations. However, some students find him off-topic and unorganized, with grades heavily dependent on TAs rather than the professor's instruction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Niemeyer is highly regarded for his humor and relaxed teaching style, effectively addressing students' questions during recitations. However, other students find him unorganized, prone to tangents, and ineffective in delivering the material, leading to grades that heavily depend on the TA's ability to teach the course content.

Ratings.comment: He is a really good professor in my personal point of view. He is humorous and pretty chilled. In his recitation I could get all my questions answered.

This recitation teacher gets off topic easily- most of the time will use the whole recitation to talk about his time as a past student at prestigious universities. Grades tough, calls students out, brings no materials to recitation so if you don't ask questions theres no use in going.
TERRIBLE professor. Unorganized and goes on tangents. Your grade will totally depend on your TA and his ability to teach the material, which is much more difficult than 1148.

summary_comment: Professor Glick is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and genuine care for student success. He excels in making complex concepts accessible through clear explanations and straightforward exam preparation, often using review sheets that closely mirror test questions. While some students find him initially awkward, his unique style is appreciated for its clarity and helpfulness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Glick is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, clarity in explanations, and genuine concern for student success. His classes are well-structured, exams are manageable, and he provides extensive review materials that closely mirror exam questions.

Ratings.comment: Max is awesome! He makes a point to try & learn all the students' names and genuinely wants his students to succeed. I am not a math person but I found his class to be quite enjoyable due to his cheerful demeanor. The class was very straight forward and Max will inform you what you should know for the exams; a trait not seen in most math classes

Professor Glick is really great. He explains content really well and is also very helpful during his office hours. His exams are not too difficult and definitely doable. Overall, he is really nice, and I would definitely recommend him as a professor.

Max is a little awkward and is funny without meaning to be but that's okay because he explains everything really well. He breaks down problems into simple steps that are easy to follow. His review sheets for exams are extremely helpful, and his exams were all relatively easy.

He is one of the best math professors i have had at Ohio State. he's alittle awkward which was off-putting initially but it just adds to his charm. the class was engaging and i actually liked the content. if you just go to class, do the homework, do the review problems, and read over your notes before the tests, you'll be fine.

I hadn't taken a math class in 3 years because I wasn't confident in my math abilities. The class was actually really well structured and if you read the text book and go to the MSLC or Office Hours, you'll be set. Do that Early too. He is my favorite math professor I've ever had, honestly.

Max glick is awkward and quirky, but that doesnt deter from his teaching. He teaches the class in a way that is clear to understand and easy to look back on to study. I did not need to open the textbook once to get a good grade in the class, just because he teaches so well. His TAs are very helpful too. He has amazing review sheets for midterms.

You have to go to lecture or else you will not understand anything!! He will always answer you're question, but be sure to listen carefully because his voice is quiet. Max is really nice and the midterms are A LOT like the review sheet. Very good prof considering the rest of the math dept.

He is very awkward, but as the year progresses it gets better. Though I wish this class was more application driven, I thought he was fairly clear in lecture, w/ hw problems from the book. The tests were very reasonable, with a majority of the questions mirroring problems from the review sheet. Considering the math department, you could do worse.

Dr. Glick can seem a little nervous and quirky while he teaches but as the semester progressed he seemed to be more comfortable. He can actually be pretty funny at times and seems to understand the plight of being a college student. His tests were incredibly easy and were exactly like the review sheets he gave out.

summary_comment: Professor Smith is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching methods and supportive approach. Students consistently praise his ability to simplify complex mathematical concepts, making them accessible and easy to understand. His dedication to helping students succeed, combined with his extensive experience in both high school and college education, has earned him a reputation as one of the best instructors at Ohio State.
summary_comment_short: Professor Smith is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching methods and ability to simplify complex concepts, resulting in improved understanding and better grades among students. His approachable and supportive demeanor, combined with his extensive experience in both high school and college education, makes him one of the most effective and beloved instructors at Ohio State.

Ratings.comment: Mr. Smith is one of the best professors that Ohio State could offer. In our class we called him Papaw cause he was a sweet old man. There is homework given everyday and he collects every other. Everyday he passes out guided notes and handwrites everything. The midterms and final were easy and so were the quizzes as long as you pay attention.
Explains math problems very well and makes it seem so effortless!

Mr. Smith is seriously the best professor I've ever had. I'm not sure what it is but his method of teaching is so simple and literally every lecture you will be like "how did I not get this in High School? so easy!" I have always been HORRIBLE at Math, or so I though, but I got one of the highest grades(if not the highest) in his class.

Incredible Professor - wants his students to succeed and is willing to help you in any way possible. He cares an incredible deal for students and knows that students find the work difficult - will give you time. Incredibly personable and funny in class. Makes difficult material palatable.

Awesome. His approach clearly works for those who just don't get math. First A's EVER on any math test in my life. If I'd had him in high school, I wouldn't have to take this class now. He's nice and can be funny, too. Wish he taught the next level class, I'd rearrange my whole schedule to take him.

Mr. Smith is phenomenal. I have always never gotten math and it has never truly clicked for me, until this class. He is extremely helpful and taught high school for about 30 years and college the past 12 or so. He knows not only the subject matter, but knows more importantly how to teach! He is one of the best teachers at OSU! Take him!

If you are just starting out in college math, this is the professor for you!  Mr. Smith has a great teaching style.  VERY helpful and genuine.  He will go out of his way to help you.  My first A in math ever.

I am horrible at math and bombed the quizzes, but Mr. Smith helped me out so I was able to pass. This is by far the type of teacher I wish I had for every class, he goes out of his way to learn his students names, greets people on campus, and has a great teaching style. I'm glad I had him in class. Take him if you are bad in/hate math.
A++ he is always ready to help and makes sure you understand just do the homework pay attention in class and the Grades flowing

His teaching style is a little different and he talks really fast, so make sure to pay attention. He kind of reminds me of Lewis Black. Very passionate teacher. If you don't understand something he will make sure you do.  I got my very first A on a math exam EVER in my LIFE with this professor. He's really good.
I saw him tudoring student an hour before class almost every day.  He has a real intrest in helping students.

Loved his class and I hate Math. I previously failed this class w/ a different prof. He has been a coach and everything has rules. It just clicked for me the way he taught. Wish I could've had him for 075 the next quarter but he wasn't teaching it. Nice guy, especially if you come to class and he sees that you're trying.Wants to see you succeed.

He is to me the best or among the best instructors at Ohio State maks sure you are paying attention and his style of making you learn was great by giving you Home work every day made me take his class serious to me he made me feel comfortable learning maths

I've always had problems with math, but he really made this class interesting, he made sure you were paying attention, and he wouldn't move on until everyone understood. I think he is an excellent teacher, and would highly recommend him.

If you are an athlete then use this professor.  Otherwise, man is all over the place and good luck getting an 'A'.  He pounds on the chalk board, yells in class, doesn't use the book, grades are based on mid-terms, and when I told him that I was concerned about my grade and felt like I was trying my best, he told me trying doesn't matter. Ew.

summary_comment: Professor Heersink is regarded as a solid and helpful instructor who provides comprehensive notes and practice problems, though his lectures can be fast-paced and his delivery sometimes boring. Students appreciate his kindness, fundamental explanations, and availability during recitations and office hours, though some find him a bit awkward. Overall, he is seen as a good choice for those willing to put in extra study time.
summary_comment_short: Professor Heersink is a knowledgeable and helpful instructor who posts detailed notes online and is attentive during office hours. However, his lectures can be fast-paced and his delivery style is sometimes described as boring or awkward.

Ratings.comment: A solid 1152 professor overall.

I thought he was really a helpful professor and he did a good job of pointing things out in his notes that the test makers will try to trip you up on. I like that he puts practice problems in his notes and he has been super nice and helpful whenever Ive asked him any questions. The class goes pretty fast but thats not his fault thats just 1172.
Boring voice and too fast

He was okay at explaining things, but personally I found recitations to be more useful in this class. He posts his full notes online after every lecture which was nice. I'd still recommend going to lectures so you can see him work the problems out. The textbook is free and online.
Dr. Heersink is a very kind and cool professor who cares about his students success. He explains things very fundamentally making it easier to understand topics.

Professor Heersink is a very good professor, he is very helpful in his recitation and office hour. He posts notes for every lectures, which are very helpful. The pace of this class is very fast, and the material is hard overall. If you want to get a good grade, you really need to spend A LOT OF TIME after class. Overall a good experience.

A little bit awkward but that does not affect the teaching. Puts his filled out notes online after class and takes time to solve and explain questions students have. It can also be discerned he is very talented in mathematics. He is a good choice, no problems here.

He knows his stuff for sure, but he's a little awkward. He would call people out for not paying attention or talking too much, which was a little weird. But he was a nice guy and cared about the students.

summary_comment: Professor Loper is known for his challenging teaching style, particularly in Abstract Algebra, where students find it difficult to stay engaged due to his slow pace and the lack of clear grade tracking through Carmen. Despite his kindness and genuine interest in student success, his approach may not suit all learning styles, especially those who struggle with math or prefer a more interactive teaching method. Office hours are beneficial, but the tests often require a different set of skills than the homework.
summary_comment_short: Professor Loper is known for his challenging teaching style, particularly in subjects like Abstract Algebra, where students find it difficult to stay engaged due to his slower pace and the abstract nature of the material. While he genuinely wants students to succeed and offers reasonable test curves and helpful office hours, his approach may not suit all learning styles, especially those who struggle with math or prefer a more interactive teaching method.

Ratings.comment: This guy doesnt use carmen, so you will never know your grade nor will you know what is going onit was so hard to keep up with. Theres not much to say about him, hes kind, but if you learn in a way thats different from anyone else & struggle with math, dont take his class. He is slow and its easy to lose attention in his class.

Class was tough because of the subject matter- Abstract Algebra.  But, he's genuintely interested in seeing every student succeed.  He's very reasonable in curving a test, expecting the average to be up to a B instead of just a C.  His office hours are helpful.  Tests are very different from the homework problems, tests being more basic knowledge.

summary_comment: Professor Vandehey is highly regarded for his clear and understandable lectures, effectively addressing student questions and reviewing difficult topics. Students praise his ability to explain complex concepts thoroughly and his supportive nature during office hours. He is consistently recognized as one of the best professors at Ohio State, known for setting clear expectations and helping students achieve success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Vandehey is highly regarded for his clear and understandable lectures, effective question answering, and supportive office hours. Students praise his ability to explain complex concepts thoroughly and his dedication to student learning and success.

Ratings.comment: Lectures are easy to follow and understand. He's good at answering questions and reviewing topics students are confused on. Also just a super cool/nice guy and helpful in office hours. 1172 is course coordinated so he didn't have any say on exams; just do the recitation handouts and practice midterms.
Prof. Vandehey is a quality professor. He is good at explaining complex concepts and going through examples while explaining every step.
Loved this guy, one of the best professors I've had in a long time. He made his lectures so easy to understand and really wants you to pass.
hidden gym at OSU Best math teacher
One of the best professors I've had at Ohio State. He is so clear with what he expects on tests and never tries to trick you. I felt like learned so much in the class with him.

summary_comment: Professor North is known for her caring and accommodating nature, and she effectively uses online lecture notes and Matlab to teach challenging material. Her tests closely mirror practice tests provided, making them more predictable, although her classes can be difficult and theoretical, requiring significant self-study. She is generally effective at helping students during office hours but can struggle with simplifying complex concepts.
summary_comment_short: Professor North is known for her thorough understanding of the subject matter and her willingness to help students during office hours. However, her lectures often focus on theoretical concepts and proofs without providing many practical examples, making the class challenging and requiring significant self-study.

Ratings.comment: Prof. North cares and is accommodating of circumstances. She gets to the point and posts lecture notes online, so you don't need to come to class, unless you have to turn in HW. Homework is challenging, but tests are very close to practice tests she gives. Book is hard to understand, so take to youtube. She teaches with Matlab. She curves well!

I feel like Paige gets a bad rep because she is actually really smart and an alright professor. She did make the class way harder than it needed to be though, and has trouble dumbing things down. She made the class purely theoretical and you had to use the book because she wouldn't always cover the homework.

Lectures are worthless for learning how to do the problems. Only goes over theorems and proofs of them. Does not do any examples in class. Does not go over any of the Homework and lectures do not prepare you for the hw or exams. Barely any partial credit given on exams and no explanation of what you got wrong on the hw. Textbook is worthless.

Class is pretty much all proof based, with very few relevant specific examples. The assignments and exams are graded very harshly, and the homework was mainly over material that was not even taught yet. Overall, the class was much harder than the same class taught by other professors.

Dr. North is nice person and is willing to help you during office hours if you don't understand the material, but she has a hard time dumbing down the concepts and make the class more difficult as a whole. Not to mention her final is extremely difficult and nothing like the normal difficulty you would expect from class, (which is very difficult).

Paige is extremely intelligent and has a hard time dumbing down the concepts for lecture. You have weekly homework and what is on your homework typically feels nothing like what you learned in class, so reading the book becomes basically mandatory. Overall, she'd be a great teacher but I think she is genuinely too smart to teach this course.

Professor North did a solid job, considering it was her first time teaching when I had her. The material itself was easy but the material was poorly taught, which made it seem a lot harder than it actually was. There was no homework from the textbook, but I found myself frequently reading it to make sense of the confusing lectures.

She leaned more towards the conceptual material of linear algebra. Make sure you go to lecture because she takes a lot of time explaining the fundamentals and proofs. You will see questions on the exam asking you to prove the exact fundamentals she explained in lecture, so attending class is a must. She has no mercy when grading.

She tries very hard, but this was clearly her first time teaching and she has a long way to go. Wants you to do well and tries to explain things in office hours, but does a poor job and comes across as her not understanding the subject. I'm sure she does, but she doesn't know how to actually teach it yet. Give it a year before you take her class.

summary_comment: Professor Schoenecker is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex mathematical concepts both entertaining and accessible through his engaging sense of humor. Students appreciate his patience and willingness to help, noting that he goes above and beyond to ensure understanding. His approachable and nerdy personality, combined with a clear explanation style, contributes to a positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Schoenecker is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex mathematical concepts both entertaining and accessible through his engaging sense of humor and clear explanations. Students appreciate his patience and willingness to help, noting that he goes above and beyond to ensure understanding.

Ratings.comment: By far the BEST math professor I have ever had! He does a great job teaching the material and also makes it extremely entertaining with his sense of humor. P.S I also received 12 extra credit points on my second exam after asking about his pet lobster. I encourage you to do the same.

I was a terrible math student in high school (failed the 2nd semester of Algebra 2 by about 15 points), but I got an A with Kevin. I went to his office hours once, and he was willing to take the long time I needed to understand what was going on. He'll seem kinda nervous in front of a new class for a few weeks, but after that he'll loosen up.Funny.

Our class never really understood what he was talking about. He always tried to make jokes so it wasn't too boring. He tried to make sure we understood what he was doing. He was cute if you like the math nerd type :)
Fun, great teacher.
Nice guy, good at explaining things.
I loved this guy. He gets right to the point, everything is as clear as possible. He has an adorable personality and good-looking too :)

he's a math geek with a dry sens e of humor which keeps class somewhat entertaining if you do the suggested homework and go to class you'll do fine, he explains things in class much better than the book does because the book is useless aside from the fact that all of the homework is in it. If you have to take math 148 take him!
Kevin has a really dry sense of humor. Made this terrible class kind of enjoyable.  Doesn't like office hours, but he is helpful

Kevin is a great teacher. He is a bit reluctant to have office hours, so you kind of have to ignore his reluctancy and not take it personally; but once he gets over it, he's really very helpful. He keeps class fun and entertaining, which can be hard to do in Math, and he explains things clearly. I'd take a class with him again.
A-fricken-mazing. Really good looking, good character, FUN!
Fun!
extremely funny!!! makes class enjoyable and interesting. highly reccomend him!
kevin is one hot tamale. and he's a very good teacher.
He's really clear, and explains things well.

summary_comment: Professor Overman is highly knowledgeable in his field and offers practical, industry-relevant insights in numerical analysis. While his teaching style and workload are challenging, he excels in accessibility and genuinely cares about his students' understanding and career prospects. However, some students find his materials and problem statements unclear and his grading harsh, with mixed reviews on the effectiveness of his office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Overman is highly knowledgeable in his field, which shines through in his lectures, but his teaching style and extensive workload may not suit all students. Despite some criticism regarding his materials and clarity, many find his practical approach and accessibility outside of class to be valuable, particularly for understanding numerical analysis and its industry applications.

Ratings.comment: Professor Overman is very knowledgeable in his content area and it shows. His teaching style may not be for everyone and the amount of work might be difficult; however, his accessibility outside of the classroom is where he stands out. He cares about his students' understanding of practical numerical analysis and marketability in industry.
You have to work hard in this class -- but he teaches you a lot.
He was the worst teacher I have ever had--and that was back in 1989.

His book is terrible.  Its a 2000 page pdf.......  Did he not have the book edited?   Its like he just wrote down whatever he was thinking and it turned out to be a 2000 page book.  His scatter brained nature is 100% reflected in his writing/hw problems.  It seems like he has never taken the time to go back though and improve his material

This was one of the most helpful courses I took in Math Department. HW was hard and took a lot of time, but the problems were interesting and a good practice. His tests were not so hard if you understood the homework problems. He's really not a bad professor at all compared to lots of other professors in the Math Department!
Unclear problem statements, harsh grading, unhelpful at office hour.
The teacher is the WORST teacher i ever met. His problems were dumb and unclear. and he is fussy all the time.

He is not your typical math teacher, and he can be quite entertaining at times. He does move a little fast, but he tries to be practical by showing you real life examples. He also tries to base his tests off the homework. I went to his office hours a couple of times and both times he was very helpful.

Okay, he's fast-paced and scatterbrained but not as bad as these first ratings suggest. There are plenty of unclear, boring math professors; at least you can't deny that Overman is entertaining... Exams are long, but the curve is pretty good.

HW was hardly ever returned.  Everything was graded extremely tough. Teacher taught as if we already knew the material.  The book was hardly used, often bashed by Overman, and was more expensive than the other 415 class.  Overall Overman was an interesting person, seems to have potential, but seems to need to have more experience teaching.

The homework was really hard and time consuming and graded harshly, but he wasn't a bad professor. He was alsays willing to help and go back over things if people weren't getting them. He does hate Microsoft, but it is entertaining to hear him rant. I think I go more out of his "guinea pig" 415 section than the normal section.
Hates microsoft thinks he's all 1337 but he's now.

he is truelly some character alrite. he really hates microsoft  homework is really difficult, be prepared to spend about 15hrs on math hw alone in one week. and still not understand wat you are doing.   note, during the last week of class, we only recieved half of our homework back.  its was jolly good ol time,   need to know matlab for th
This teacher is the worst teacher that I have EVER had!
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Solomon is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and accessibility. Students praise his detailed explanations during lectures, his availability for office hours, and his ability to make complex material understandable. Despite challenging homework assignments, his thorough exam preparation and patient approach in office hours ensure student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Solomon is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and accessibility, making his lectures engaging and his office hours invaluable. Students appreciate his patience, humor, and ability to clarify complex concepts, often leading to strong exam performance due to his thorough review sessions and clear explanations.

Ratings.comment: Amazing Prof.! He is so great. Although you may find the hw is very hard, he will explain almost questions during lecture before the deadline. So, as long as you appear there, you will fix them. He will give students the range of questions of exams, and his going over lecture is so helpful. Almost the same questions will appear on exam!

Prof Solomon is one of the best math prof Ive had. He is super accessible(12 hrs a week for office hours). He is an excellent Algebraist and teacher. Funny guy too. Homeworks have 10 questions and take about 10 hours per hw. Exams were extremely easy but tests on all fundamental concepts of the range. He has retired though, sad face.

I'm not the biggest fan of Abstract Algebra, but he presents the material in an extremely reasonable fashion. His first exam was brutal but the next one and the final were more than fair (I think to make up for that first midterm). He's extremely nice and helpful outside of class, too, and gives you options for extra credit.

Dr. Solomon is the best professor that I have ever had in college life. His class is inspirational and informative. Do not be panic if not understand the material, go to his office hours or ask after the class. Dr. Solomon will patiently explain everything again and again until the material touch your mind and become a part of your knowledge system

I graduated from OSU in 2016 Dec and am currently in graduate school studying financial mathematics. I miss Prof. Solomon a lot. He is my favorite professor. Every time I study hard math, I remember his class. His class is one of my most precious memory in life.

Took him for History of Mathematics and was one of the most interesting math classes I have ever taken. Dr. Solomon is so kind, compassionate, and absolutely hysterical which makes going to (mandatory) lectures fun. One easy exam (review sheet IS exam), 10-page paper, and in-class presentation. Easy A + actually learning a lot = amazing class! :)
amazing professor. interested in helping students and an absolute genius. also has a great sense of humor. highly, highly recommend him

Excellent professor for abstract algebra-teaches the material, and you get to see directly into the mind with a gift for this kind of material.  Helpful in office hours.  Nerdy Brooklyn Hebrew voice is an entertaining bonus.  I sympathize for non-math-majors who had him for calculus, though.  IQ off the charts.
Great teacher if you're a math major :)

He was very helpful; he was almost always available in his office. His lectures were easy to follow; he wrote the book so he could easily make up for any wholes or faults. The homework was time consuming, and the assignments were long.

This is the worst teacher I've ever had. Instead of testing us on the basic concepts introduced in class and discussed in the book, he based all the tests on stupid "tricks".  The exams are ridiculously hard.  He isn't helpful to students.  I went to all the lectures, did all the homework, and have a 3.9 GPA, and I got a B- in this class.

The best person you could have for group theory.  He's hard and you'll have to work your ass off but you'll learn group theory inside-out.  He grades all homework himself, gives useful feedback, writes up solutions, etc.  And he has a great sense of humor.
Doesn't explain things at all, takes the long way on everything, and just confuses you.
Most annoying speaking voice I have ever heard. Lecture is completely useless.
Awful. Worst time I have ever had in a class. He should not be teaching undergraduates.

Generally a good teacher, but assumed that everyone in this introduction to calculus course had already had calculus before.  Therefore about half the class failed both midterms, which most of us blame on him not realizing that there are many of us without prior calculus experience.
Spends entire lectures explaining things that if you would ask him, he would say you don't need to know.

You will not stop laughing the first time you hear him speak (ummmmmm....aaa)LOL!!! Besides that he is your typical nerd-like math teacher who is too involved.  His TA's grade very harsh and so does he!!! Stay away at all costs.
This guy wrote the book for the math 580 series.  If you want to do anything with math other than teach high school, avoid the 580 series, and his book, like the plague.
Your doomed to fail.  Trust me.  Switch Professors before its too late

Habitual lateness is very irritating, as well as almost always going over alloted time for class. He tends to assign difficult homeworks and then not look at them, much less grade them. Somehow, often doesn't even know the homework he has assigned.
Run away.

summary_comment: Professor Needham is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, effectively explaining both conceptual and theoretical aspects of the subject matter. He is praised for his detailed and descriptive lectures, and his ability to break down complex problems into manageable parts. Additionally, he offers extensive support through review sessions and extra office hours, making him an invaluable resource for students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Needham is an exceptional lecturer who effectively explains both the conceptual and theoretical aspects of his subjects, making his classes engaging and informative. He is highly dedicated to student understanding, offering additional review sessions and office hours to ensure students excel in their exams.

Ratings.comment: Great professor. Explains concepts well and will show the conceptual as well as the theoretical aspects in lecture.

Best instructor! Tom perfectly explains the content in a very logical way. He is super good at drawing graphs in 3D by hand, which is very helpful for visualization. Besides, Tom would have review sessions or extra office hours to help students with the exams. If possible, I am willing to work with Tom again. Love Tom!

Tom is one of the best math lecturers I've had in my two years at OSU. Tom tries his best to make sure his students can understand the fundamentals before he boosts a topic to a more difficult level. He also introduced and broke down very complex problems in class in amazing detail that allowed us to tackle most other problems with relative ease.
Great teacher. It might be easy to zone off but his lectures are very descriptive and he goes into good detail. Going to office hours helps and I'd definitely want to have Tom again.

summary_comment: Professor Huang has a mixed reputation; while students found his lectures challenging to follow initially, they noted his genuine interest in his subject matter. Despite this, many would not choose to take his course again, though they acknowledged that he was not entirely poor in his teaching.
summary_comment_short: Professor Huang has a mixed reputation; while students found his lectures challenging to follow initially, they noted his genuine interest in his subject matter. Despite this, many would not choose to take his course again, though they acknowledged that he was not entirely poor in his teaching.

Ratings.comment: Was hard to understand in lectures but I got used to it as the semester went on. While he might not be the best at explaining things in class, he definitely shows he is interested in what he's doing. Overall, I wouldn't take him again but he wasn't horrible

summary_comment: Professor Fontes is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and ability to convey complex concepts clearly, earning him accolades from students as one of the best professors they have encountered. His lectures are well-structured and engaging, and he demonstrates a strong passion for teaching, often staying connected with his students both inside and outside the classroom. However, some students find his teaching style challenging and his handwriting difficult to read, noting that while his lectures are valuable, the course can be demanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fontes is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and ability to convey complex concepts clearly, earning him accolades from students as one of the best professors they have encountered. Despite some challenges with lecture readability and a test-heavy curriculum, his passion for teaching and commitment to student success are consistently praised.

Ratings.comment: The best professor Ive ever met!!
Dr. Ernie is a good chicken nugget. Great smol bean. Good lectures.

Ernest is literally the best professor I ever seen. He is not just good at what his teaching, but also now how to build connection of knowledge for students. Ernest also love teaching students. I have been college for 2 years and never seen any professor is better than Ernest at professional knowledge and passion.

Fontes is a very good calculus professor. His lectures are well setup and it seems like he actually likes teaching. The class setup was very similar to other calculus courses. 80% exams, 10% HW, and 10% ximera textbook. The review exams he gave us really helped for the exams. His handwriting is pretty bad though, it is hard to read what he writes.

Intelligent man who conveys the content extremely well. I say test heavy because there are three midterms and a final (the averages on them are around a low C range). Ernie is a great lecturer to have going through all those tests though.

If there was a teacher at OSU worth having, it's Ernest. This man is so smart and gives the most useful lectures. While the class is extremely difficult, attending office hours provides you with the information needed to do well on exams. He truly cares about his students and wants them to succeed. This man got me through Calc 3 and is my icon.

Dr. Ernie is awesome if you got him for 1151! His lectures are good at breaking down the hard parts of calc 1 and his notes get posted online. Still go to class because he is good at answering questions and his office hours are also really helpful, and you'll learn to love using Top Hat. Also a funny guy and makes lectures interesting.

He's a very hard teacher. Nice & funny dude. Not a great teacher. Hope he reads this. He made simple calc I learned back in AP into complex forms. The curriculum is, of course, doable and rigorous but Dr. Fontes teaches it in a hard way. Calc is NOT hard. Dr. Fontes makes it hard.
The best math teacher ive had in my academic career.

summary_comment: Professor Olsen (referred to as McCabe in the comments) provided clear outlines and expectations from the start, which was appreciated. His lectures were well-structured, with detailed templates provided beforehand, and he effectively explained complex concepts through multiple approaches. However, he sometimes struggled to answer questions directly and got lost during explanations, and his teaching style was noted to be less engaging compared to high school calculus teachers mentioned by students. Despite these challenges, he was supportive, especially through additional office hours, to help students
summary_comment_short: Professor Olsen provided clear difficulty levels and outlines from the beginning, which was appreciated. However, his ability to answer questions in real-time was lacking, and he sometimes struggled to stay on track during lectures.

Ratings.comment: From the start, the difficulty and outline of the class were very clear which was great. However, McCabe struggled to answer questions and often got lost in his problems while teaching. I had some very good high school Calculus teachers, and he was lackluster compared to them. He was super nice and great about attendance and participation though

McCabe gave very great lectures. He uploaded lecture templates to Carmen before class so we could follow along with him. Also, he explained difficult concepts in multiple ways so we could all understand it better. He did have several subs throughout the semester, which made the class a little harder, but he made up for it with extra office hours.

summary_comment: Professor Boros is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching, with students praising his clarity, fairness, and dedication to student success. He sets clear expectations from the start and ensures that class materials closely align with assessments. His engaging and supportive teaching style makes complex concepts accessible, and students consistently recommend his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Boros is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and clear communication of standards, making him one of the best math professors at OSU. Students consistently praise his approachability, clarity, and dedication to helping students succeed.

Ratings.comment: Professor Boros was the best math professor I have had this far! He truly cares about his students and wants his students to succeed. The standards for his class are made very clear on the first day of classes and he sticks to them throughout the whole semester. If you can take a class with Dan Boros, do it! You won't regret it!

He was an awesome math professor, best I've had so far at OSU. You need to go to class! Most of his quizexam questions will come from your notes and homework assignments, or they will at least reflect that material.

Dan is the best math professor I've had at OSU. He's really nice and helpful and seems to love teaching. His exams and quizzes are fair- if you study and practice the material you will do very well in the class. Highly highly recommend!
Awesome! Easy to understand and very helpful!
Fantastic teacher. Very clear. I highly recommend.

Great teacher! He makes examples seem so easy in class yet they're exactly what needs to be known for exams. If you take good notes and review them often, you will definitely earn a good grade. He always leaves time in lecture to make sure that everyone is comprehending what he is doing on the board. He's so personable and animated in lecture, too.

I would follow him to the moon and back. He subbed...just subbed for my Calc. I lecture and in less than hour I learned more with him than a whole week with my regular lecturer. He explained things very clearly and his examples were simple and made sense. You rock Dr. Boros!

very good professor. But this course is demanding. If you want to get good score, you need to review the notes frequently. pay attention to the material he covered in class. the homework is helpful as well.
Presents material very clearly and organized!  Really enjoys math and cares about students.

Best teacher I've had so far. He is a great guy, very organized, and communicates the subject matter well. Always helpful at office hours. Exams are very fair, and he really wants everyone to do well. Makes material seem interesting, and he genuinely seems to enjoy his job.

I took him for 161 and 162. He was great! very good teacher and his tests are very fair : ) if you know the material, you will get an A. If you slack off, you will (like you should) get a lower grade.
Best math teacher I've ever had.  His enthusiasm for the subject make the class interesting and he makes the most complicated subjects crystal clear.  Take his class!

Excellent Teacher.  By far the best teacher I have ever had in my life.  Incredibly talented at explaining difficult topics.  His exams were challenging in a good way, and his curve at the end was very helpful.  I thoroughly enjoyed this class.  If you are up for a good math class where you will learn but be challenged, take this class with Dr. B.

He was one of my best teachers at OSU. He is really great guy!!! His exams were great. I got an A with 100% of grade possible however his exams were not easy at all they were really reasonable. GREAT TEACHER. You are really lucky if you are in his class. AND make sure to go to lecture.
Dan is super excited about teaching his subject and that enthusiasm makes his class interesting to go to. He is also very good at explaining concepts especially at office hours
Very helpful and reachable.  Very invested in his students and their comprehension.  It is a challenging class but if you ask for help, he will get you to understand.
Probably the best math professor for engineers at Ohio State. If you're up for a faster-paced math class, I highly recommend him!!
Dan is a great professor! He's genuinely interested in his students and gives crystal clear explanations as well as pointing out mistakes that students commonly make.

An incredible teacher.  I really enjoyed his class.  His enthusiasm and playfulness were incredible.  My favorite teacher thus far.  If you have him, make sure you don't get Ozge as your TA, she is horrible.  If you have Ozge, transfer to the other section ASAP.

Dr. Boros is a very enthusiastic teacher who tests you on exactly what he teaches. There are a few important proofs that he goes through but overall he has plenty of examples and cares about how well you do. Do the chapter reviews because there are usually a few problems verbatim on the midterms and finals. I would highly recommend Dr. Boros.

Boros is a cool teacher, he is highly excited when teaching math. His exams were easy as long as you did the recommended homework and attended class. His final was a tad bit harder but he is fair in grading. Take the suggestions he gives; for instance, he will tell you to do the chapter reviews before exams, DO THEM!

Dr. Boros was a very likeable man and I thoroughly enjoyed my time in his class. He was always enthusiastic about the topic, which was a nice change of pace from typical, boring math lecturers. Midterms were easy, the final was a tad more difficult but nothing impossible. I highly recommend Dan Boros.

summary_comment: Professor Seman is highly regarded by some students for her thorough and clear teaching style, ability to explain complex concepts, and genuine passion for the subject matter. However, others find her classes challenging due to her fast pace and the emphasis on self-study through homework and exams. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some praising her as one of the best teachers they have had, while others consider her one of the worst due to feeling rushed and overwhelmed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Seman is known for her thorough and clear teaching style, effectively explaining problem-solving methods and making complex concepts accessible. However, some students find her classes move quickly and feel rushed, and there are concerns about her ability to manage multiple teaching loads, which can affect the clarity and comprehensiveness of her reviews.

Ratings.comment: Avoid

She was probably one of the worst classes I've ever had. She was not understanding of the classes we had outside of her's. She tested us on material that we did not go over in class and would say it was something that we should understand how to do based on what we were taught. Delanie will take of point if work is not written out in words.

Delanie moves very quickly, though efficiently. Asks if anybody has questions frequently, but feels rushed. Homework done through an online system, can be a lot of work. Exams are standard difficulty... no group work or participation required. TA's offer lots of tutoring possibilities. Do all the practice exams offered!!!

She is by far the most amazing teacher I've ever had, she is the best at explaining and has a real passion for the subject which reflects in her teaching and makes everyone in the room as excited as she is. Very understanding and will always make time to see you if you need her. i wish every teacher was like she is! 1124535/10 highly recommend
Very thorough and clear. Goes in depth with how to actually complete problems. Awesome! Her voice is super calming too. Best teacher I had at OSU.
Good math teacher, teaches at OSU and CSCC so her office hours are horrible. Is pretty clear with what she wants. Very easy to understand, doesn't put up with much madness in the classroom.

She is trying to teach at OSU and CSCC at the same time and I believe it is effecting her ability to keep track of  classes.  Her review days are not really review days she will give you a few problems and tell you to work with the person next to you normally leaving you more confused and not truly reviewing anything.
Wonderful teacher. Explains everything very well and made it easy to understand. If you struggle with math, take her class!

Simply the best math teacher that I have ever had, and math classes aren't as enjoyable as they were with her at the head. She makes it easy to understand, and is amazingly welcoming. Wish I could have her for every math class.

Such a great professor! I hate math but she makes it easy to understand and you can tell she really enjoys teaching. Her class is very straight forward and the quizzes prepair you for exams. I recommend taking any math class with her!

I am terrible at math, and Delanie made it interesting and accessible for me.  I don't think this class was easy, but I was at least able to understand it.  I looked forward to going to class because of Delanie's passionate teaching style and infectious positive attitude.  Best math professor I have ever had.

summary_comment: Professor Parker is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively explaining complex concepts and providing comprehensive support. Students find her not only knowledgeable but also exceptionally kind and understanding, making her a standout instructor in Math 1148.
summary_comment_short: Professor Parker is an exceptionally effective teacher who clearly explains complex concepts, earning high praise for her comprehensive teaching approach. Students find her not only knowledgeable but also extremely supportive and understanding, significantly enhancing their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Ms. Parker is a wonderful teacher. She very effectively explained the concepts of the course, something the actual Professor was unable to. She is incredibly nice and understanding, a real gem of a instructor.
VERY VERY helpful. Made Math 1148 comprehensive!
she's great! she helped me way more than the professor that she was TA'ing for.

summary_comment: Professor Rizvi is highly regarded for his clear teaching methods and commitment to student understanding, grading assignments and assessments promptly and fairly. As chair of the Math Department, he ensures accountability and expects students to engage with the material.
