His approachable demeanor and willingness to assist both in and out of class contribute to a positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rizvi is known for his clear teaching methods and thorough explanations of mathematical concepts. He maintains high standards, ensuring students understand the material through patient and fair grading practices, and is highly recommended by students.

Ratings.comment: Was helpful in trying to make sure all of us understood the math concepts. Would go over all the questions we asked, graded quizzes, homework and tests fairly fast.

Teaches the math very clearly. Willing to work with you in and out of class. Makes sure you have an understanding. Light homework, literally just two short problems a week. Very personable fella. Would recommend.
Chair of the Math Dept. If you're not doing the work, he'll call you out

summary_comment: Professor Antonides is highly regarded for his passion and energy in teaching, making complex ideas accessible and the class engaging. However, students note that he can be condescending at times and may cover material not relevant to exams. Despite this, he is consistently helpful, provides thorough feedback, and genuinely cares about his students' success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Antonides is highly regarded for his passion and energy in teaching, making complex ideas accessible and ensuring classes are engaging. However, students note that he can be inconsistent with the material covered and sometimes includes topics not relevant to exams.

Ratings.comment: Great guy, very passionate about teaching, but can sometimes be condescending when responding to questions. Sometimes isn't very consistent with what knowledge we needed to know and taught things that weren't even covered on the exam.
Great guy. Good at making complicated ideas easy to understand.
Very helpful explaining things taught in lecture.
Always made the class entertaining, and explained things really well.
Very energetic and personable. He definitely cared for our success and learning. Tests were hard but fair, and he gave practice tests and study guides. Highly recommended!

Joe is very knowledgeable  about math. He just struggled learning how to think about math from the perspective 1125/1126 uses. He can let his intelligence take over and not focus on what we actually need to know, but he is very personable and tries to accommodate the wants of the class. He gives thorough feedback and works to help those who ask.
Joe was my TA for Calculus 1. He was always really helpful in office hours, and he was really down to earth and funny which made the class enjoyable.

summary_comment: Professor Parsons is known for his clear teaching style, often using direct textbook material. While his exams are straightforward and office hours are helpful, the lack of grading flexibility and the high stakes of each question can make the course challenging, as evidenced by some students' negative feedback.
summary_comment_short: Professor Parsons is known for his clear teaching style and availability during office hours, though his exams are not curved and can be challenging, particularly due to the high point value of each question. Some students found his recitations more rigorous with additional quizzes and a steeper grading curve compared to other sections.

Ratings.comment: He's a nice dude--everything he taught from was directly from the textbook, but even if you didn't understand he'd clear it up during office hours. The exams were fine, I guess he didn't really curve but it was alright. Pretty nice class.

Recitation had quizzes while some section of the same course didn't. No curve while some sections had large ones. Three midterms while some sections only had two. Every question on the test was worth too many points, which means you could not get an A if you made total three wrong through the semester. I was regret choosing his course.

summary_comment: Professor Krul is a highly regarded, straightforward teacher who genuinely cares about his students' success. He is known for his fairness and approachability, helping students, especially those who struggle with math, to better understand the subject. His dedication to student success is evident in his supportive and personable demeanor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Krul is a highly effective and fair teacher who genuinely cares about his students' success. He is known for making complex math concepts accessible and approachable, helping even those who previously struggled with the subject to understand and succeed.

Ratings.comment: he is a great, straight forward teacher who deeply cares about his kids.

He is a great,fair teacher. It is not his call as to how the math dept heads handle people with accommodations.The math dept @ OSU id not accommodating at  all when it comes to accommodating the needs of people with dyscalculia.
Nate was one of the best teachers I have had in a long time
Helps those who dislike math finally understand it. Approachable, personable and really wants his students to succeed.
helps if you go to class
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Jones is highly regarded for his clear and organized lectures, which effectively convey complex mathematical theories. Students appreciate his straightforward approach to expectations and his willingness to help in office hours. While his exams are fair and based on the material covered, some find the homework challenging due to a focus on theoretical understanding. Overall, Professor Jones is praised for his dedication to student success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jones is highly regarded for his clear and organized lectures, focusing on both the theory and practical aspects of mathematics, which aids in understanding complex material. Students appreciate his straightforward approach to expectations and his willingness to help, making him an effective and supportive instructor.

Ratings.comment: I took him for Math 2177 and even though the material was really hard I understood it. Don't screw up on the exams though.

Corey is a really good professor. His lectures are organized for the most part and he is really straightforward about what he expects from you on exams. He is helpful in office hours and wants students to do well on exams.

Great professor and person. Flexible grader and genuinely wants students to succeed. Doesnt put trick questions on tests. If he doesnt have time to properly cover material he wont expect you to know it. Very helpful in office hours and straight forward about his expectations for tests. Gives you plenty of time to get help on homework

He tends to focus on the theory behind the math rather than how to actually do the problem which can make homework and tests a little rough but overall he's a fair grader and you'll learn the material just fine.

He is the best professor I have ever taken at OSU math department. His lectures are clear and helpful which make your time worth it, He does give a lot of homework each week. His exams are not hard at all. If you go to the class and review his homework problems before the test, there is no reason that you can not get an A. Truly recommend!!

Lectures are interesting if you have any interest in math and usually even if you don't. Two midterms and final were all very reasonable, and midterm two was heavily curved. Office hours can clear up any confusion from lectures, but were usually unnecessary. Attendance is not mandatory but recommended and can help in anticipating exam questions.
Corey was the best!!! Really helpful wanted you to learn would not have survived this class without him I hope he sees this and knows who it is :)

summary_comment: Professor Dell is known for his harsh grading methods, often using large red Xs to indicate incorrect answers without explanation or partial credit. His recitations are perceived as unhelpful, as he quickly moves past questions when no one knows the answer, failing to provide clarification or further examples. Students find his approach unsatisfactory and unfulfilling.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dell is known for his harsh grading methods, often using large red Xs to indicate mistakes without explanation or partial credit. He is perceived as unhelpful during recitations, quickly moving past questions when students are unable to provide answers.

Ratings.comment: He was always way too mean with grading and he would just cross things out in a big red X. He never explained what was wrong, and he never gave partial credit where it could have been fair. During recitation, if no one knows the answer, he just moves on to the next example, not helpful whatsoever. Not once did I have my answer fulfilled by him.

summary_comment: Professor Tsumura is highly regarded for his comprehensive approach to teaching, printing out detailed notes and hosting lectures online. His commitment to student success is evident, with tests closely aligned to homework and practice materials. While some find the final exam challenging, he ensures fairness through curve adjustments. His clear care for students' understanding and willingness to address questions further enhance his overall teaching quality.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tsumura is highly regarded for his comprehensive approach to teaching, providing detailed lecture notes and placing lectures online. His commitment to student success is evident through his availability to answer questions and his use of practice exams that closely mirror the actual tests.

Ratings.comment: He prints out notes for the whole class and puts lectures online on his website! Just a really helpful professor overall that wants to see you succeed. Tests are basically like the homework.

Really would recommend Yu for this class.  My only complaint is that the final was crazy hard for some reason but he curved it so it turned out okay. Even though he puts lectures online, I would still go to class.  Homework is problems from the book so make sure you have it. For the first two exams, questions were similar to the review guide.

Attendance is taken for points. 9 weekly book HW probs. Slight accent but definitely manageable. Biggest thing is know how to do all of the problems on the practice exams he gives. Midterms and Final had very similar problems in terms of concepts from these pracs. I didn't pay attention in class and just read the textbook before exams and got an A.

He has an accent, but you get used to it quickly.  He gives practice exams and a practice final that are very helpful - study those and you will do fine.  He goes through material at a decent pace, though some material is boring (that's linear algebra for you).  You can tell he cares if you understand material and is open to questions.

summary_comment: Professor Del Negro Skeehan is highly regarded for her thorough and engaging lectures, which she punctuates with frequent question checks to ensure understanding. Her clear explanations and structured assessment method, including weekly quizzes, Aleks homework, and four exams, contribute to an effective learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Del Negro Skeehan is highly regarded for her thorough and engaging lectures, which she frequently pauses to ensure student comprehension. Her clear explanations and fair grading scale, along with the structured Aleks homework and regular quizzes, contribute to an effective learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Willa is the best TA for MATH 1148. The lectures were confusing, but Willa made Prof. Seress' notes easier to understand and there were tons of practice problems. She was always available for help.

The best math professor i've had in college. Very thorough in her lectures & stops to make sure no one has questions, which can be hard in such larger lecture room. Math is not my favorite subject, & I tried to take this course at CSCC but had to drop it because I bombed every quiz. The grading scale is nice. Aleks HW. 4 exams. Quiz every week.

summary_comment: Professor Swang is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and clarity in explaining complex mathematical concepts. Students appreciate his comprehensive lecture notes, accessible teaching style, and willingness to help. While his lectures can be lengthy, they are structured to ensure thorough understanding, and his assessments are straightforward and manageable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Swang is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for thoroughly explaining concepts and ensuring student understanding. His lectures, while sometimes lengthy, are clear and comprehensive, and he provides extensive online notes and supportive resources, making the course manageable even without attending every lecture.

Ratings.comment: Had him for Math 1131. Takes his time during lectures which can make them seem like forever sometimes, but overall amazing at teaching material and making sure his students understand it. Always posts the class notes online so if you miss class it isn't a big deal, short homework assignments only due once a week. Would definitely take again.
Great lecturer; honestly, I'm surprised the department doesn't give him more complex courses to teach. He might very well be the best lecturer in the department.

Hands down the best math teacher I've ever had. He explains everything thoroughly so everyone can understand. He seems very nice and accessible, willing to help out his students. If you pay attention an A is definitely attainable, there are weekly homework and quizzes but nothing too crazy.
Absolutely love Ted. Didn't go to a single lecture and pulled out an A. Notes online were plenty sufficient to grasp the subject matter and recitations reinforced the topics covered in class.

Swang is an amazing professor. Very clear during his lectures, posts all notes online, homeworks are short and very easy, a lot of quizzes but only 2-3 questions, tests are very straight forward and he gives plenty of review

Hes a really good teacher, explains things very well, and trys to make sure you grasp the overall concept before diving into problems. His lectures notes are really good because he literally writes EVERYTHING down!

Interesting character... Nonetheless the lectures are clear and concise. The class is pretty extensive considering its 5 credit hours. There's no textbook so thats a plus. He always posts notes from each lecture online and replies very fast to emails if you have questions over the topics! He makes calc as easy as calc can be.

Best math professor at Ohio State. He makes learning Business Calculus easy. This is my second time taking it after I failed it the first time. I'm on par to get an A this time around. Cannot recommend taking calc with Ted enough.

Awesome professor!  Took him for Linear Algebra over the summer and he was always willing to meet with me and talk about the subject and answer questions (even when the scheduled time for his office hours ended).  I am lucky to have been taught by him and cannot recommend him enough.

Ted is a very good TA and explains the concepts really well.  He doesn't waste time going over useless material as a lot of math professors tend to do.  Definitely made up for the professor I had not being very good.  Prepares you well for quizzes and exams.
very helpful and patient ta improved my grade
Really knows his positions. He's just as good in one on one tudoring sessions as he is in groups. Don't raise your hand in class unless you want to get picked on.

Very helpful TA. Explains in detail but may sometimes take up too much class time on certain problems. Very willing to set aside time to help you out. He's really patient too and would not hesitate to clarify.
Overall a cool guys, really knows his math. He is a grad student and sometimes has trouble conveying ideas, but he usually is excellent at explaining ideas and theories.

summary_comment: Professor Kwa is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and engaging lecture style, which significantly enhance students' understanding and critical thinking. He is known for being approachable, humorous, and genuinely committed to his students' learning, often providing clear guidance on test formats and content. His teaching methods are effective, and he is consistently praised for his helpfulness both in and out of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kwa is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching methods and ability to change students' thinking approaches. He is known for being approachable, humorous, and thorough in preparing students for exams, often providing clear guidance on test content and offering extensive support both in and out of class.

Ratings.comment: In my opinion he is the most amazing people i ever met in my life .. He CHANGED the ways I do my thinking. He is very open to every student who really want to learn. What impressed a lot is his thinking' way and the way he speak is very precise and accurate. Not only that, i think he is very funny and that is what we need in lectures!

Lectures are pretty useless since it's decently hard to follow this 5ft tall, 110lb asian guy as he scribbles on the blackboard as fast as he can.  I attended less than half of the lectures and did not feel like it hurt my understanding at all.  The only thing I liked about Kwa was that told what type of questions are going to be on his tests.

Not only is Kwa a great teacher, but he's hilarious as well. He works pretty hard to make sure everyone understands the topic, and on top of that,he tells you what the tests are going to look like beforehand.  Show up to class and do the practice problem he suggests and you should have no problem getting an A.

The best math teacher I have had at OSU. Extremely helpful in and out of class. He teaches you only what you need to know and does lots of examples that are just like the exams. Kwa is funny and genuinely wants everyone to make sure gets each problem before he moves on.

If you don't like Kwa at first it's because you haven't gotten to know him. He is definitely a bit quirky, but is very interested in teaching and you can tell he enjoys it. He doesn't try to trick you on the tests and prepares you well with weekly assigned homeworks. Read the book for extra clarity.  He has an accent but it does not interfere much.

Kwa is an excellent teacher. He will be one of the more up-beat math professors you will ever have. He is very approachable and eager to help. He won't move on unless he is sure he has answered your question. His tests are fair and quite easy because he tells you what each problem on the test will cover. No trick problems either. They're like hw.

If anyone gives Kwa less than a "5" for helpfulness, then they're insane. He puts notes online, puts homework and exam solutions online, is always willing to help in office hours or email, and is a fair and punctual grader. He is a very friendly guy and yes, sort of weird, but he's an outstanding professor, and you should take him if you can.

Easily the best math professor I've had at OSU.  Exams are hard but fair, because he tells you what types of problems to expect.  Goes very fast in class, but  always encourages students to ask questions, and is very helpful in office hours.

He is an odd man, goes over material very fast.  I personally did not learn a lot from him in lectures but mostly from the TA I had (Dan Poole). Midterms were hard but fair, he tells which problems types to study.
Interesting guy to say the least. Knows his stuff though. Tells you what excatly to study for in the exam, so you should have problems with him. Oh and be sure to do the homeworks!

He seems like a nice guy BUT he is very incomprehensible and so are the midterms. explains material the hardest way possible compared to the example in the book or internet solutions to some problems. just be ready to work really hard on your own - Don't count on his teaching to pass. he does give notes online though!
Best math lecturer I have ever had, and pretty funny.

I don't know what these other people are talking about because our class average was in the upper 70's for both midterms. And in lecture he gives a ton of examples and asks people if they have questions non-stop. He is hysterical and his accent(which does not effect his clearity) adds to the funniness of the class. He is one of the best professors!

Lectures are not as helpful as they could be, but most math classes depend on the TA in my experiences. He gives 2 sample test before each of the midterms and finals. The first sample midterm he switched a question up and the avg was a 55ish but second midterm and final where pretty close to the samples. do the hw and study the samples, its not bad

Overall, not a bad professor when compared to others from the department.  He is a little strange but its not a bad thing.  Gives lots of examples and has supplemental notes online for students to look over.

summary_comment: Professor Cavey is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and approachability. Students find his recitations particularly helpful in clarifying complex concepts, and many attribute their success in the course to his guidance. He is known for being patient and willing to discuss advanced topics, making him a valuable resource for students interested in deeper mathematical understanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cavey excels in making complex concepts accessible through clear explanations in recitations, and he is highly approachable and willing to provide additional support outside of class. Students consistently praise his teaching abilities and his willingness to help them understand both course material and more advanced topics.

Ratings.comment: I often left lecture confused, but recitation was very helpful because he knew how to explain things more simply than my professor.
Only reason I passed Calculus I. I was often very confused in lecture but recitation always made me understand things so much better. Excellent lecturer and super approachable.

Ian cares students who like or don't like math. As a serious math student, I learned a lot from him during his office hours. He is willing to talk with you about more math beyond Calculus One (for example, linear algebra & advanced Calculus) if you ask him about it during office hour / via email. Last but not least, Ian is really good at teaching.
The only reason I passed this class, super chill guy, super approachable, realistic grader, all around perfect.
He is the best prof I've ever met! Clever and handsome guy!

summary_comment: Professor Little is known for his high-quality teaching, characterized by an effective and supportive teaching assistant who enhances the learning experience significantly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Little is known for his high-quality teaching, effectively engaging students and fostering a deep understanding of the subject matter. His teaching is complemented by an excellent Teaching Assistant who provides additional support and clarification.

Ratings.comment: Great TA

summary_comment: Professor McGregor is known for his comprehensive coverage of course material and extensive use of practice exams, making the class more manageable than expected. However, his lectures are often described as dry and difficult to follow, with many students recommending supplementary resources or prior calculus experience to succeed. Overall, while the content is considered manageable, success largely depends on effective studying and test-taking skills.
summary_comment_short: Professor McGregor is known for his comprehensive coverage of course material and the availability of detailed notes and practice exams, making the class manageable despite its challenging content. However, his lectures are often described as dry and difficult to follow, which can leave students feeling more confused rather than clearer about the concepts.

Ratings.comment: Dan was very good at explaining the tough material this class covers and this class was way more manageable than I had anticipated.

He is kinda a boring lecturer but you cant really make calc that interesting. He posts all of his notes on carmen and gives you lots of practice exams to study from. I showed up most of the first half of the semester and not the second, and will still end with a high A. If you turn in the homework and actually study, it is much easier than 1151.

I liked Dan! Granted, his lectures can be dry and a little too wordy at times, but how interesting can calc really be? Plus you can easily skip his lectures and review the slides later. Take AT LEAST a week before his midterms and final to review every practice test and practice problems multiple times. If you prepare well, his class is an easy A!
Harder than MATH1130, but not by anything other than the course material. A is very possible.
Easy content and mid terms match up pretty well with the practice exams.

I took both college algebra and business calc with Dan. I found what most of the people said on this forum to be true. He normally makes you more confused by using only math jargon, or by giving you definitions. Quizzes and HW dont really count the majority of your grade is made from tests so if your a bad test taker like me your screwed.

Professor McGregor certainly knows what he's lecturing on, however I believe he does a poor job simplifying the matters as I often left the course more confused after it, then I did at the beginning. Make sure your TA who teaches your recitation is solid, and you'll be fine.

Professor Mcgregor is your average math lecturer (boring). I would suggest having some calculus before this class (I took it in HS) or else you'll have trouble keeping up in lecture. Attendance isn't mandatory and the class is graded off of 3 midterms, a final, and homework/quizzes in recitation that are all easy if you know limits/derivatives.

I had Dan for my recitation and lectures. He was constantly late to classes and failed to manage his time properly throughout the class. Lectures were a waste of time, but recitation was necessary for quizzes and homework. Overall, he is a decent teacher but very boring.

Dan is extremely unorganized and repetitive. He is consistently redundant to the point of annoyance and is late to class and recitation most days. He was my lecture and recitation instructor and never gave back papers in an appropriate time period while other recitation instructors graded most assignments in less than a day. Wouldn't recommend.

Dan is a nice and helpful TA. Always pauses to get any questions after writing something out on the board from students to make sure they get it, and is happy to answer any questions in length about the coursework.

When students ask questions, his answers usually cause more confusion.  He changes test questions without working through them - he admits to doing this and doesn't allow for retests when he assigns an overly-difficult problem.

summary_comment: Professor Moscovici is known for his challenging and demanding approach, with homework assignments that often take several hours to complete and are graded harshly. Lectures are marked by occasional confusion and difficulty in following due to computational mistakes and a quiet speaking style, though he is praised for being helpful in one-on-one settings. Students consistently report that the exams are difficult and that there is minimal support or resources provided for studying.
summary_comment_short: Professor Moscovici is known for his challenging and demanding approach, with tough exams and significant homework loads that can take many hours to complete. Despite being highly intelligent and helpful in one-on-one interactions, he frequently struggles with clarity in lectures, making small computational mistakes and failing to emphasize key points.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely horrible professor. He often messes up problems and confuses himself during lecture, and will always go 5-10 minutes over. He assigns homework, and will suddenly decide to change a problem the day before it is due. No respect for students when answering questions.

Homework every week that took 5 hours + was graded harshly. Grade was just homework, one midterm, and final. Exams were hard. No study resources + I didnt always understand lecture so I had to read the textbook often. Everyone says he doesnt curve but I think he did at the end. Quiet talker. Willing to regrade homeworks. Makes good jokes.

Insanely smart and helpful one-on-one. But makes lots of small computational mistakes in lecture. Often fails to state the important results of a proof, getting lost in the details. 1 MT, 1 final (very difficult) are most of the grade. This class is supposed to be easy - and I've seen other instructors tests - they aren't nearly as bad.

His handwriting is difficult to read and he speaks very quietly. Very often makes algebraic mistakes, or calls things by the wrong name for an extended period of time. Homework is often 5+ pages and is graded only on the hardest problems. The final exam is 44% of your grade, no study guides are provided, and it's difficult to know what it covers.
Cons: - Very quite voice. I can never hear him. - His accent makes him only a little understandable - tough class Pros: - I think he was helpful on one-to-one
This is one of the toughest professors in OSU math department. No curve and no tests over what you learn. Take a different professor or drop it when you still can.
Tons of homework. Overall good intention, but material is confusing and his proofs only add to it. As a student who got As and Bs on all the main test and quizzes, I nearly failed his Final.
Unless you are a math major, or plan to make this class part of your daily routine - avoid at all costs.
good

Wonderful prof. Has a good sense of humor. He shares his intuition with the class, and provides the motivations for definitions and theorems. Obviously a master of the material, and able to call on diverse areas of mathematics for analogies, and tie them to a whole. Blackboard skill could use some improvement: go from left to right, partition board

He gives kind of long homework assignments.  Follows the text for the most part, but tries to prove some results on his own.  It's helpful to see multiple takes on a proof though.  Sometimes it didn't seem like he wanted to teach.
He is a great professor! I think students have to be smart enough to catch his idea! Preview and Review are important in this class. You can never get a A without hard-working.

This is one of the worst professors i have ever had. No curve and no tests over what you learn. He is a book teacher that can't make his own stuff. He reads word for word from the book in class. Moreover the stuff he teaches isn't in the test. I'm an A math student he gave me an E. Do your self a favor take a diffrent professor or drop it.
terrible professor
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Meghaichi is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively clarifying complex concepts and making difficult material more accessible. Her assignments and assessments are fair, provided students stay current with their studies. She is consistently praised as one of the best math instructors her students have encountered.
summary_comment_short: Professor Meghaichi is an outstanding instructor known for her exceptional ability to explain complex mathematical concepts in a clear and understandable manner, making difficult material accessible to all students. Her approach ensures that homework and exams are fair, provided students keep up with the coursework.

Ratings.comment: Great professor! Explains concepts clearly and makes tough material easier to understand. Homework and exams are fair if you keep up. One of the best math instructors I've had!

summary_comment: Professor Kok is known for his high-quality teaching, consistently receiving praise for his thorough explanations and supportive approach in the classroom. Students find him very helpful, both during lectures and office hours, appreciating his clarity and accessibility.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kok is known for his high-quality teaching, consistently receiving praise for his thorough explanations and supportive approach in the classroom. Students often highlight his helpfulness and the clarity of his lectures as key aspects of his teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: He's a very helpful TA.

summary_comment: Professor Whitaker is known for her thorough and clear explanations, making complex topics accessible. She maintains a structured approach to her lectures and is highly supportive, often staying late to ensure students understand the material. However, some find her lectures somewhat dry and prefer the additional support from TAs or her office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Whitaker is known for her clear and thorough explanations, making complex topics accessible. She is highly regarded for her approachability and willingness to help students, though some find her lectures can be somewhat dry.

Ratings.comment: I think she explains everything extremely well and thoroughly. She's like a mom. Her worksheets for homework are up-to-date with pop culture references. She is clear and sticks to an agenda.

Imagine taking a class taught by Amy Farrah Fowler from The Big Bang Theory and you'll get the idea. BORING as all hell, hard to stay awake. I ended up skipping most of the lectures; that's the benefit of the class, it's so big she'll never notice. Just go to recitations and hope you have a good TA, that's your best bet for actually learning math.

If you pay attention in lecture and do the problems along with her you will do well. She is great about re-explaining material if the class is struggling. Uses up all 50 minutes so when people start leaving with a few to go she gets flustered. I never had to come to her for help but she keeps office hours and adds more close to the exams.

Had her at UK. Lectures can be a little dreary but you need to go. She is extremely kind and will gladly help with any question no matter  how  basic. She really does want her students to learn and succeed. We had a substitute professor one day and the difference in teaching ability was astonishing. A good choice for getting your math UK Core done.

Dr. Whitaker is an awesome teacher! She makes every thing very clear and easy to learn. If you go to class and take notes you will do just fine. There are 4 Exams and 4 mini exams in this class. The lowest grade on a mini exam is dropped as well as the lowest exam grade. If you get A's on the first 3 exams you don't take the final! There is no book
Really nice, she is an American woman who speaks great english and is understandable, uncommon in the math department. Very helpful. Take her class.
Teacher is friendly, down-to-earth (realistic), and very helpful. She writes clearly on board, speaks clearly and prepares you well for exams/assessments.

Erica was the only reason why I passed this class and actually did well. She went above and beyond to help the students understand what is going on, especially since the prof was rediculous.  She is by far the best Math teach I have had at Ohio State.
She is a great teacher as long as she doesn't have a migraine.
She is a little scatterbrained but explains thing well unless she's complaining about a headache (which happens quite a bit). Does review sessions for exams which are helpful.
Excellent teacher.  Explains everthing very well.

She is a perfect example of a great teacher.  Not only is she extremely nice and helpful, she is an excellent lecturer.  She provides plenty of examples that are of the same level as test problems, but she explains things so well that she makes everything, even the tests, seem very easy.  As said by the previous reviewer, HIGHLY recommended!
EXTREMELY nice! Brings cookies to class and gives handouts for long problems so you don't have to copy them down. Goes at a nice speed and is through in explanations. Highly recommended.

best TA I've ever had. spoke clearly, very into the class, would go out of her way to help, gives lots of chances for points, doesn't assign a lot of hw but makes you do it well so you learn it.  Feels like a kindergarten teacher teaching really hard math.  super nice and very smart. hope i can get her agian
Better to study on your own then to go to class!!

If you're ever gonna take calc 2 course, make sure Erica is your instructor. She makes you understand the complex stuff in easy way, so that everyone understands. If you think you're bad at math, take her course. You'll never forget how easy it was.
Lectures are clear and she makes the concepts easy to pick up on.  Recitation is usually more helpful than lecture, but not with whitaker.  If you are taking math 151, take her class.
SHE IS THE BEST MATH TEACHER THAT I HAVE HAD AT OSU. SHE MAKES THE MATERIAL EASY TO LEARN. THE TEST ARE VERY STRAIGHT FORWARD.

She is one of the best Math 151 profs at Ohio State. Very clear in what she teaches, even with the harder stuff. She's also very helpful and a nice woman. Her tests are somewhat difficult and she grades a little tough, but not terrible for 151.

summary_comment: Professor Greene is widely regarded as a poor lecturer, often unprepared and unable to effectively convey fundamental concepts. Students frequently struggled to follow his lectures and found themselves needing to teach themselves the material or seek help elsewhere. Reviews consistently advise against taking a class with him.
summary_comment_short: Professor Greene is widely regarded as ineffective in his teaching, often unprepared and unable to clearly explain fundamental concepts, leading many students to struggle and seek help elsewhere. Students consistently advise against taking his classes, citing confusion and a lack of useful instruction during lectures.

Ratings.comment: He came to class half asleep most of the time. I stopped going to lecture half-way through the semester since i found it pointless. Trust me, do NOT take a class with this instructor.

Ryan Greene wasn't the best math teacher in the world, but I am sure he is not the worst either. When I needed help. he was there. Spent a lot of time teaching myself the material. So it was ok I guess.

Ryan was not the ideal math professor. He was not prepared for class and did overly complex examples without clearly explaining the fundamentals. 1172 is a hard class already so it took a lot of individual time. He was often sarcastic and at time rude to the students. It's a hard class regardless of the professor.

He was just overall a very bad professor. He does't come prepared to class and just fumbles his way through as many examples as he can in the class time. He doesn't really explain what he's doing so you're basically stuck teaching yourself.

His lectures were very wordy and he didn't give many examples of what he was talking about. Overall he was just hard to follow when he solved problems. He was slightly sarcastic too which didn't help when answering questions. Odds are if you get him as your lecturer you will be asking your ta for help and not the professor.
Terrible teacher. Do not take him if possible.

I often sat in lecture and stared at the board in utter confusion because of the lack of clarity in his lectures. He tries to speed through and cram as many examples in 55 minutes as possible, but he never explains how he got from point A to point B unless you raise your hand and ask and then his answer aren't always helpful. Very spacey.

Ryan Greene is a nice guy. He means well, he definitely is spacey. He comes to class with no papers, his quizzes are to make an octahedron in a group. This is a mandatory class for architecture and landscape architecture. This class is basically geometry and it is easy. Taking notes seems pointless but I would still write it down.

Ryan Greene is the worst excuse for a professor that I have ever had the displeasure to encounter. He takes easy geometrical concepts and dumbs them down to where they don't make any sense. If teaching was considered talking at a chalkboard and writing down every word you says, as you says it, he would be fantastic at his job.

had him for math 151A 152A and 153A... wonderful TA. only TA in during my my time that would hold review sessions before exams in given classes.  almost always in his office for questions, great help on tests and hw
This guy knows his stuff. And he's quite funny. There were also quite a few times he explained something that was unclear during lecture. He is a pretty sweet recitation guy.

I had him in the Summer when the TA teaches the full class.  No syllabus, no organization, no explanation.  He liked to show off how smart he thought he was.  Would make up questions and then realize they didn't work.  Avoid him if possible.

summary_comment: Professor Munther is highly regarded for his clear explanations and effective teaching methods, which significantly enhance students' understanding of mathematical concepts. Students consistently praise his dedication and care in ensuring that everyone grasps the material, making him a standout figure in the math department.
summary_comment_short: Professor Munther is highly regarded for his clear explanations and effective teaching methods, which significantly aid students' understanding and performance. Students consistently praise his dedication and approachability, though some note occasional challenges with quiz timing.

Ratings.comment: The professor is very nice he explains the material clearly. Also he gives bonus questions to help ur grade

He is the best math teacher that I ever had in my life. People like Dan Munther are valuable to the future of math education. His methods of teaching and his desire to make sure that everyone understands the material makes him great. You should get to know him because you will certainly never meet someone from the math department like him.

Dan was one of the best TA's that I've had here at Ohio State.  The only red flag I had with Dan was the fact he would often give quizzes before the corresponding homework for a section was due.  This drove some of the quiz averages down to 50% and it was extremely frustrating at times.
Great TA. Very helpful during office hours. Quizzes are average difficulty, no issues with grading. Entertaining in recitation.

Dan the MAN! Wow was I thrilled I switched to his TA session. Very caring and kind and gentle meek soul.  Knowledgable about math and very easy on the eyes!!!!!!  I hope I can take every math class with him or someone like him.  What would OSU be without Dan?
Dan was an amazing TA. So helpful,funny, and personable. he really cared about whether or not we understood the material. He really prepared us for the exams. Awesome guy.

Daniel has been very helpful and kind and gentle especially when I was distraught and uncomfortable he made me fully aware of math and integrals so to speak.  I would highly recommend you leave your present class and enjoy the show!
No Comments
His personality really added to class, he wasnt so dry which is very easy to be as a math TA.
Dan is the Greatest Teacher at OSU!

Dan is the man!!! If you are not good in Math, take his class. He explains everything perfectly and really cares that his students understand the material. Dan will go the extra mile to ensure you understand the material. Take Dan if you want to pass and you are bad at Math like I am. Dan is the best Math teacher I have ever had! Thanks Dan!
Dan is AMAZING!  Honestly, the best TA ever!  Take advantage of his office hours, he's extremely helpful... he's the reason I passed this class!
Dan made this class enjoyable. He has a great personality and teaches well. If you need anything take advantage of office hours.
No Comments

He is the hottest Math TA EVER! If you need a reason to go to class, he's it! He is very helpful at office hours, and can sometimes be funny. His quizzes aren't that bad, and he made sense of our crappy lecturer. I recommend switching to his class if you can!

summary_comment: Professor Burghelea is widely regarded as one of the worst lecturers at Ohio State University, noted for his unclear teaching style and lack of explanation, which makes the material difficult to grasp without significant additional study. Students consistently recommend seeking external resources, tutors, and supplementary materials to succeed in his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Burghelea is widely regarded as one of the worst lecturers at Ohio State University, noted for his unclear teaching style and tough grading standards with little partial credit. Students emphasize the necessity of extensive self-study and attending every class to succeed, though many advise avoiding the course due to its challenging nature and lack of support resources.

Ratings.comment: He's the worst professor I've had at OSU so far. He is very unclear in his teaching and a tough grader (little partial credit). OHowever, he really prioritizes improvement, so if you fail the first midterm it is possible to redeem your grade with future exams. To do well you must devote a lot of out of class time self-teaching the subject.

Dr. Burghelea is one of the reasons I changed my major (from math). He gets frustrated if you attempt to ask questions (or even attend office hours), and can be very derogatory. I would highly recommend a tutor and using outside resources because the book he requires is absolute drivel, and there is no TA or recitation.

I consider this class quite easy IF YOU ATTEND EVERY CLASS!!!  Being extremely smart, prof. Burghelea really CANNOT understand why students could not follow. Thus,except for the 1st midterm (when he believed we are idiots) , the left two ones (and the final) were almost EXACTLY THE SAME as the review problems!! Just do them and read the book!!

Worst lecturer I've had in three years at OSU. He talked at the board and didn't explain what he was doing or why. He would erase things before we had the chance to write it down or even see what he had written. We had no recitation, so there was no TA to help. He also doesn't give any partial credit on exams. Avoid if possible.
One of the worst professors in the OSU math department. Do not take!
Terrible professor.  The worst I have ever had at this university to date.  Highly recommend avoiding.

Worst professor I've ever had. Impossible to understand both his lecture and his handwriting. Wouldn't have learned a thing if I didn't spend hours on Khan Academy or working with other students on the weekly homework sets. Also there was no recitation when I took it, but if there is now it may be better. Also tests based on lectures not the book.
This course is one of the best course I ever take in OSU. If u come to the class,especially the recitation. it will be easy to take the exams.
he is one of the best instructors I have met in OSU. Please take his classes, especially the recitations. Trust me, sit in the front.
worst teacher I ever meet. his class is very boring, I get nothing from his class.
He is without a doubt the worst professor I have ever had.

Potentially the worst instructor I have had in my 2 years.  He is impossible to understand and is not legible.  The vast majority of the class was forced to learn through the recitations, making it difficult. Highly recommend dropping the course if you have him.

Dr Burghelea is an effective lecturer and writes largely fair exams. If you attend class (which many don't), he will teach you useful problem-solving skills not in the book. Honestly, I found you can receive an A without reading the Boyce/DiPrima text. Lecture style is not particularly engaging, though.

This class has rather thick material but the exams are easy. However, he gives NO partial credit. NONE! He isn't a great lecturer honestly but is more helpful in office hours. I went to the other 571 class several times to make things clearer. He wouldn't be my first choice but if you do have him there is hardly any work in MATLAB which is a plus.

It is pointless to go to class. One is better off spending the time they're supposed to be in class at the library and teaching yourself. Doesn't take questions, never takes a breath, doesn't use examples, and worst of all HE CANNOT BE UNDERSTOOD BY ANYONE. Switch sections immediately
No need to go to class.  His examples in class are worthless, and incomprehensible.  Is not very helpful, gets agitated when asked questions.  If you have a good T.A. you will pass the class.

Not great, but not as horrible as others have written.  If you have a decent TA you will do just fine, test pretty fair.  He seemed like a really nice guy that yells only when he gets really excited about math.  (don't sit in front, he spits because of his accent)

He was easily the worst professor I have ever had. He clearly had no interest in teaching, and he couldn't have care less about the students in the class. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS UNLESS YOU ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO!

He pretty much caused my failure in math (as well as in H263). Incomprehensible. Go through things once and expect everyone to understand, and terrible with helping students, if he even tries. He gave out evaluations in the beginning of class and wanted us to fill out while he was lecturing, so no one had chances to write anything bad at all.

Not recommended.  He is difficult to understand, and is pretty intimidating.  If you go to office hours, he doesn't understand what you ask half the time and does not explain things any better than in class.  I would definitely avoid his class.

Okay lecturer, okay class; but I have literally never seen an instructor be so openly rude to students.  Repeatedly snapped at students for asking questions.  He even seemed to realize he had gone too far a few times.

Dr. Burghelea seems like a bad professor only if you don't choose to take full advantage of the resources that he makes available.  In my time taking math courses, there have been few teachers to spark a genuine interest in math.  Dr. Burghelea's class was well taught, challenging, and interesting enough that he is among the three best I've ever ha
Not helpful at all. Comes off as mean and he really could care less if students learn or not.  Dont know what he is even saying half the time.

Couldn't stand his class.  Very hard material and his accent is pretty bad.  He did say cute things once in a while because of his poor english but that's about the only bonus.  It was hard to ask him questions because he would interupt you 5 words in and start answering his incorrect interpretation of what your question actually was.

Burghelea is highly intimidating, rude, and difficult.  He does not do the homework prior to assigning it, and he is not at all helpful during office hours.  He gives no partial credit on exams, and he has an arbitrary grading system.  It is quite possible to completely understand the concepts but to be unable to do decently in the assessments.

He has a thick accent, and explains things in an overly complicated way.  He isn't very helpful, even during office hours, and makes you feel stupid when you ask questions.  Test scores are very low, because he gives next to no partial credit, and you have to learn most things on your own with the textbook.

This guy represents a typical old professor who is not able to pass down information clearly. His accent makes his lecture very confusing, especially when he's presenting new material. Read the textbook and learn by yourself is the only way to do well. Exams are not bad since they are basics, but it's hard to do well since no one knows the material

This guy is the epitomy of grumpy old man.  He normally teaches topology and is just so ridiculously smart that he has a hard time dumbing it down.  He gets extremely agitated whenever we ask questions or dont get it and snaps a lot.  Tests werent too terrible but he gives little to zero partial credit on anything which affects the final test grade

summary_comment: Professor Calinescu is widely recognized for her effective teaching methods, particularly in making complex mathematical concepts accessible and engaging. While some students appreciate her fairness and helpfulness, others find her grading to be inconsistent and her exams overly long without time caps. Overall, her teaching style and approach to mathematics are highly valued, though her grading practices and exam structure have received mixed reviews.
summary_comment_short: Professor Calinescu was highly regarded by some students for her clarity and passion for teaching mathematics, making many develop a love for the subject. However, others found her grading to be unfair and her finals excessively long, leading to mixed reviews overall.

Ratings.comment: Professor Calinescu was a great math professor. She made me love math, how crazy is that? She helped me a lot and was very clear on every aspect of what she was teaching. The best math teacher I ever had.  P.S. - I did a lot of work to actually get an A.

So here's the deal.  These comments are useless because Calinescu is going to teach at Yale.  I am not sad at all to see her go.  Her grading is the most unfair I have ever seen.  "Do exist such a and b?"  I guess that's what you get with a Russian teacher.  Honestly, I am glad OSU will never see her again.  Her final was ridiculous, 14 problems.

Could not disagree with the person below more.  I think a lot of people liked her but I did not.  Yes she's a decent lecturer but is a very unfair grader and is not very personable.  Don't ever get part A wrong on tests or you'll get it wrong multiple times.  Very lengthy final with no time-cap.  Class is not curved at all.
Hot teacher, and also very fair.  Actually puts a time cap on exams (if she can do them in 10 minutes, they're short enough).  I think that's a good thing :) I'm sick of not finishing exams.
Decent lecturer for a math class, homework and midterms were very, very easy.
Hottest teacher I've had at OSU.   Otherwise, she is a decent professor.  Material isn't too difficult.

Not bad.  She's helpful and you can tell she's interested in teaching and the material, and she tries to help students.  HW and exams are pretty easy.  Despite this, still one of the worst classes I've ever taken.  You might think from the title that you do applications:  you'd be wrong.  Get ready to learn theory.
her accent is to DIE for!
She is hard to understand...talks quietly and does not seem to have much common sense...only goes through examples she has prepped prior to class

It's kind of hard to understand her at first. She goes very fast when she does examples on the transparency so make sure you raise your hand and tell her to slow down. She also talks very low, so if you want to hear her well, sit in the front few rows. Honestly, if your TA is good at explaining things, you don't need to go to lecture.
Can't do any problems not already done on a transparency. Aside from that, very average.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Bosna is a highly knowledgeable and clear lecturer, especially in linear algebra, where he effectively explains concepts from the textbook better than the book itself. However, his exams and class material are known to be challenging, requiring extensive study and memorization of numerous theorems, with no class curve. His teaching style and unique fashion sense, particularly his use of Vibram toe shoes, are notable but do not compensate for the difficulty students face in passing the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bosna is known for his rigorous teaching style, where exams and material covered in class are demanding and not closely aligned with homework, which focuses more on memorization of theorems rather than application. His lectures are clear and well-structured, especially for subjects like Linear Algebra, though he may not allocate much time for questions and can be unhelpful during office hours.

Ratings.comment: Tests and quizzes bear no relation to the homework. They often require formal proofs, something he does not teach. Expects you to memorize the 100+ theorems by number.

Good teacher for Linear Algebra. Usually teaches right out of the book, but that's OK because he's much clearer than the book is. Doesn't really give much time for questions. Wears Vibram toe shoes to class, which is a definite plus.
The exams and material in class are very tough. Expect to spend quite some time studying and doing the homework or you won't pass. Class isn't curved.

I had Bora for accelerated calculus 1 at OSU.  I thought he was a great professor.  He really explained everything well and was there to help students.  The homework was online so you just need to online access code.  I found the midterms to be easy but the final was sort of difficult.  Like most math classes, the course was not curved.

Bora's fashion style will always leave you in awe. Greatest dresser I've seen. Other than that, he teaches Calc lessons crystal-clear. The tests (especially the Final) are difficult but not because of the teacher.

I would definitely recommend you take the regular 1151 course rather than the accelerated course. It does not count as an honors credit and only will lower your grade in the end. No curve for the class even with some very tough midterms. Missed the next letter grade by a point and Bora did nothing.

I highly recommend you do not take his class.  I took AB calc in high school, got a 5 on the AP test, and studied often for this class, but still did terrible.  When attending his office hours, I found he was very unhelpful.  Any questions asked, he acted like they were a burden to answer.  Highly recommend you switch classes if you have him.

Bosna is a turkish super genius who wears vibram toe shoes, and sweater vests over tee shirts with athletic shorts on a regular basis.  He was very clear during lecture, and eager to repeat anything if a student asked.   Although I got a good grade because i had taken high school calc, a lot of people found the class to be pretty challenging.

Had Bora for 1161. Absolutely worst experience I've ever had with a math class. A pretty nice guy and not a horrible teacher, but the lack of a much-needed  curve at the end, along with extremely hard exams messes up any chance of getting a decent grade. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Take 1151, you'll thank me.
He is a great lecturer and is easy to learn from. I enjoy his class.
He is a very great and helpful teacher. He bent over backward to extend his office hours when I needed help.  Math 1152 is just a tough class, but definitely not due to Bora!
Understood everything he was saying but it was a horrible class. Never learned anything that was on the homework or test, it was as if he was teaching a different subject all together
Great teacher. He reminds me of my high school teacher. Although I am a Chinese, I can understand him effortlessly.
Best Math TA you will ever have!!!!
Great TA. I would recommend him to friends!

Very nice and reasonable grading. Very clear with his examples and he really tries to help, since he makes extra time for Office Hours during exam/finals week and tries to work around every students' schedule. Though he speaks with a slight accent, you can understand him clearly. Best TA I'd ever had. :)

Bora is possibly the best math TA ever. His explanations are crystal clear, he writes EVERYTHING down and goes more than slow enough to get everything down and to comprehend everything. He has a slight accent and is a bit akward, but he is so nice and helpful that he more than makes up for it. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
a

Great TA.  Math 152 is a tough class and he knows this.  He will give you many practice problems that resemble ones on quizzes and tests.  Make sure to ask questions if you don't understand something.  He will help you.  He knows all the tricks.
excellent TA. really makes you understand the material
he is chill as ice
No Comments
I think he is an excellent TA who is very knowledgeable. Will make a smart comment every once in a while, but he's cool. Be sure to do the assigned mandatory practice problems, it will help!

summary_comment: Professor Easwaran is highly respected for his deep knowledge of the subject matter and his willingness to help students outside of class. However, his exams and quizzes are challenging, particularly due to their emphasis on true/false questions, requiring a strong understanding of concepts. While some students find his lectures confusing, he is approachable and supportive, offering additional help through office hours and encouraging students to seek clarification elsewhere.
summary_comment_short: Professor Easwaran is highly respected for his knowledge and willingness to help students, though his exams and lectures can be challenging. Students consistently praise his availability and care for their understanding, but also note that his teaching style and organization can be confusing at times.

Ratings.comment: Beware of his negative points on every quiz and final.
Good Guy Good Class!

Amazing professor. Make sure you attend class and do the optional homework otherwise you will get behind and do poorly. Always willing to help the students out. And is flexible about moving the weekly quiz if there is a big test that a lot of students have the next day. Moy has a way of making the students want to do well because they respect him.

Moy is an awesome professor. The class is pretty hard, and you have to know concepts for truefalse questions on the quizzes and exams. He is always willing to help outside of class, so go to office hours! He really cares about his students and wants to make sure you understand the material. Definitely knows his stuff,  I would highly recommend him

I had Moy for two semesters - once for lin. alg. and once for calc.  On both occasions, it was clear to me that he knew his stuff - in fact, when he (rarely) responded to a question with "I don't know" it was with a suggestion for where you could find an answer.   He truly cares for his students and was able and willing to provide advice.

When taking a class with Moy, you will find yourself with a bit of a mixed bag. On one hand, Moy's exams are difficult: many of them have True/False so you have to understand the topics and not plug and chug. In addition, while Moy may be a bit unclear during lectures, he is always willing to help outside of class and cares about his students.

Class is un-organized especially the notes in class is confusing. He sometimes jumps back  when he writes notes. He teaches unclearly and do not explain the definition clearly. He asks us to watch the MIT video online after class, which is obvious that even himself does not have confidence to teach this class well.
You can always ask him for help after class, and he is being very helpful. Though his midterms are not easy, you can get a good grade if you do the practice problems and read the textbook.

His exams and homework assignments were very difficult, not well-representative of what he covered in class. I love math, but hated his class. He taught with little organization, which caused a lot of confusion. He did offer a slight curve at the end of the semester.

He was a terrible teacher.  He said that the homework should have been easy because it was applications of what we had learned in class, but it was not at all.  His midterms were ridiculously difficult and although his final seemed easy, not a lot of people passed.  His grading is very tough and he tiptoes around answers a lot.

He is a nice guy but I cannot follow his lectures at all.  He's not prepared and he says the midterm questions come from homeworks, etc but I don't know how.  His midterms are hard in my opinion and I don't think he teaches what he thinks he does.  He seems to think we know more than we do.

This was his first time teaching this class and I can totally tell.  He does not come to class very prepared.  He does mean well, but is absolutely terrible at conveying the information clearly.  Maybe it's just because it's his first time teaching this class, but he shouldn't teach it again or at least make his midterms easier.
he clarifies everything well and he is super nice! he's willing to help students with all problems about math.
really nice and helpful

Moy is a great teacher and I think I learned a lot from his class. I am an ME major and though I do not pride myself in my maths ability, Moy made this class very interesting and though it is one of the hardest classes I have taken (probably just me), I thoroughly enjoyed having him as a teacher. He is always willing to talk after class too.

Moy is in the top five teacher's I've ever had. He makes sure everyone understands the material. He is VERY knowledgeable and yet also knows how to have fun with it too. I've had quite a few laughs too.

Moy is not a very good lecturer. Several times in 153.02 he came unprepared and stumbled over his words in class. He grades with the median being a C, even in a mostly honors class. Using the median, he effictively places half of his students on academic probation or fails his students. Do not take.

He knows what he is talking about in lecture, but he was very unorganized and had to re-teach some stuff. He will go out of his way to help you, but his midterms and finals are extremely hard and there is almost no way to study for them. You can do all the problems in the book, and go to his review sessions, and it doesnt help

great teacher. i had him as a ta and i feel that he actually cared about me and the other students. goes out of his way to help motivate the unmotivated. creates and environment that enables the students to try and figure it out before he shows how to do it. very helpful.
I had Moy for 263 and 255.  Tough quizzes in 263, but no quizzes in 255.  Amazing!!!  Does review sessions.  Goes out of his way to help you and your grades.  Yes yes yes.

Moy is a really good teacher. The course itself was tough for me, but Moy did everything possible to help. My lecture professor was horrible, so everything I picked up from the class was that which I learned from Moy. He is approachable, and always willing to give extra help, whether its staying after, or holding extra study sessions on the weekend
Moy is a great teacher.  He goes out of his way to do review sessions and extra help sessions for students.  Very knowledgable.  Try to schedule into his classes if you know what's good for you.

Moy is the man. He's taught this class many times and knows where students need the most help. He'll go over anything you want, repeatedly if necessary. This class can be tough if you've never had any calculus, but he does a good job of relating the material. He also went out of his way to have extra exam reviews. Very helpful. Take his class...

summary_comment: Professor Simmons is generally considered fair when it comes to testing, with clear expectations and similar problems appearing on homework and exams. However, his lectures are often criticized for being outdated and unhelpful, with many students finding them difficult to follow or unnecessary, as the material is better learned from the textbook. Students recommend seeking alternative instructors if possible due to the poor lecture quality and his tendency to complicate simple concepts.
summary_comment_short: Professor Simmons is perceived as having poor lecture delivery, often relying on outdated methods and confusing explanations, making his classes difficult to follow without supplementary resources. Despite being fair on exams and providing clear test guidelines, his teaching style is considered ineffective for many students, who found better success through self-study or alternative instructors.

Ratings.comment: Lectures are awful. Does it on a chalkboard, like what is the 1950's? Exams were fair but didn't go to class once besides for exams past the first week and I dont think I was the only one. Better off learning from the textbook all semester, that's what I did.

The one thing that I can say about this guy is that he's very fair with the tests he gives.  A little boring, but fair. I took him for Math 2173, and he was very clear about what was going to be on the tests all semester.  If you do the homeworks correctly, you'll see the exact same problems on the midterms, and you'll likely do well.

Dr. Simmons wasn't horrible. He has an extremely rigid way of writing proofs which overcomplicates everything. Once you figure out how he wants your proofs, you can ignore him and use the book. If you're strong with proofs you'll probably do fine after you figure out his "style." He gives little partial credit so many of the weaker students failed.

I don't know why many students give him a bad feedback...I just take his Math4548 (Intro to Real Analysis 2) this autumn semester and he is a really helpful teacher. He can teach you real things about deep thinking methods of math proofs. If you work hard on the homework and go to his office hours, you WILL get a good grade(A) EASILY!

Lectures were not helpful at all. His explanations in lecture were not very clear. I taught myself every night after lecture because his lessons were lost on me.  He only did problems from the book (which were explained in the book anyway, so going to lecture was pretty pointless). If you can take another teacher's class, do it!

Lectures were absolutely impossible to learn in. I spent most of the semester in the MSLC building and I still didn't do well. If you're a lecture based learner, find a different professor because that's what killed me.

Had stage fright the whole time. Couldn't keep the class quite. After five minutes into the class about half left. Does only examples from the book but changes a few numbers that then confuse him. Starts a problem then says nevermind and does a different problem. Gets scared easily of problems and just stops doing them. Avoid taking his class.
Avoid this professor like the plague. He is too flustered to get anything across to his students.

DROP WHILE YOU STILL CAN!  If you like math and actually want to learn, this is not the professor you want to have.  He struggles with the use of technology during lecture and has no sense of public speaking.  My lecture started with about 250 students and in the 10th week of the semester, the lectures barely bring out 100 students.

I do not recommend him. I got above 100% in AP calc in high school, then I get a 78 and 68 on the first two midterms here. Don't bother asking for help. He's too nervous when he teaches to actually help you learn.  He does some examples that are overall pretty useless. He recommended we not buy the book, bad idea. I would learn better out of it.

Really nervous when he teaches, however this makes him fairly approachable. Tests are very straight-forward, which compensates for his mediocre lectures. Grade wasn't affected by the curve, so if there was one it was probably insignificant, KNOW YOUR STUFF.
Great prof.
I would suggest not taking him! He was not good lecturer. He only used the examples from the book, did not try and teach it any other way. I never went to lecture because he was so bad!

He is the absolute worst math professor you could get. He acts like he has no idea what he is doing- which is probably completely true considering this might be his first year ever teaching. He is unclear and doesn't cover the material well AT ALL. He prances around the stage stuttering and tripping over everything. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

summary_comment: Professor Xia is widely considered a poor lecturer who struggles to effectively convey course material, leading most students to rely on TAs for understanding. The class is manageable as long as students complete the homework, but the lectures themselves are largely unhelpful and boring.
summary_comment_short: Professor Xia is considered a poor lecturer who fails to effectively explain course material, leading many students to stop attending her lectures. The class becomes manageable primarily through homework and the support of teaching assistants, rather than the professor's instruction.

Ratings.comment: Very boring lecturer and doesn't explain material well.  Most people stopped going to her lectures, you're better off just teaching yourself.  Hope that you get a good TA as you will learn everything from them instead.  Overall class isn't hard as long as you do the homework to understand material.

Very boring, very bad at explaining anything, eventually most of the class stopped coming. If you get her, you better hope you have a good recitation TA, that's who you'll actually be doing your learning with.

summary_comment: Professor Heidersdorf is highly regarded by many students for his thorough explanations and ability to make complex concepts understandable. However, his quiet speaking style and lack of study guides can pose challenges for some. His teaching effectiveness varies, with some finding his methods excellent and others struggling with his unprepared and sometimes confusing examples. Overall, his humor and willingness to help in office hours are appreciated by many.
summary_comment_short: Professor Heidersdorf is a highly regarded lecturer known for his thorough explanations and ability to make complex concepts clear, though his quiet speaking style requires students to sit in the front. His teaching approach emphasizes understanding over memorization, and while some find his methods unconventional, many students appreciate his humor and dedication, leading to strong academic performance.

Ratings.comment: Thorsten was a decent lecturer. He took the time to explain and prove each concept thoroughly, which I enjoyed though some people really aren't into proofs. He speaks very quietly so sit in the front. Thorsten was funny in a quirky, German way. He does not provide any study guides so you're left to cover the material by yourself.

Thorsten is the best Math teacher I've ever had! He explains everything so well and his teaching style really works for me. He gives a lot of homework. But it's totally worth it coz if you do the homework and practice enough, you won't have to worry about the exams. I got an A. Sometimes he tells jokes, and it sounds so cute with his german accent.
A great professor. As long as you ask questions when confused, you will do well. A wonderful person if you get to know him.

Unorganized and unprepared. He doesn't come with prepared examples and makes them up on the spot, then halfway through it realizes "this isn't a very good example, but you get the idea". Don't expect the homework or quizzes to be graded in a timely manner and he may lose them, so make copies. Rude when asked what he considers "stupid" questions.
You know he's definitely crazy smart he just explains things is backwards ways sometimes.
He was a really good teacher, and he made everything clear.
Thorsten's lectures were fairly helpful and he made the subject somewhat easy to understand. You will get the most out him though by going to office hours and making separate appointments.
Hilarious and very helpful. love him!

Awesome professor. Definitely take his section if you can. Gives really good/detailed examples, is really happy to help his students, and is really quirky/funny. He's German but you can always understand him.

summary_comment: Professor Noble is generally considered solid, though her teaching style can be confusing due to her questioning approach. Students appreciate her genuine concern for their learning but note that her explanations are sometimes unclear and rushed. Despite this, she offers additional support and extra credit, which is viewed positively.
summary_comment_short: Professor Noble is generally considered a solid instructor who genuinely cares about her students' learning, though her teaching style can be confusing due to her questioning approach. Students note that while she offers helpful resources like extra credit, her explanations and problem-solving methods can sometimes be unclear or rushed.

Ratings.comment: Did a good job of explaining when she did want to explain something, but oftentimes made things significantly more confusing with the questions she asks. Seemed to genuinely care about students, but will always try to get you to do more. Midterms and HW assignments were poorly written, but that's the department, not her. Overall solid professor.

She does not explain well at all. We were put in groups of 4 during our 2 recitations every week. We would have a packet of math questions, we would work on them in groups and then she would pick someone to present that question. She was a bully, and confuses everyone with the answers she gives and just asks a thousand questions back to a question.
Best TA I've had at ohio state, very clear when explaining. Really considers the students input and tailors recitation to students needs. You can't get a better TA than her.

She seemed nice on her happy days, but there were days it didn't seem like she really cared. Overall she tried to be helpful, but her working through the problems wasn't the most interesting or explanatory, and was often a bit fast.
Overall, she is not the bad of a teacher. She doesn't have as much experience because she is rather young, but does offer good help, extra credit, etc.

summary_comment: Professor Sui is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and supportive approach. Students appreciate her generous grading policies, including high scores on quizzes and homework, and detailed study guides before exams. While lectures can be somewhat dry, her willingness to help and provide extra credit make the class manageable and even enjoyable for many students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sui is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and supportive approach, making the class manageable despite its initial intimidation. Students appreciate her generous grading policies, including frequent partial credit, a curve, and detailed study guides, which contribute to the overall positive experience.

Ratings.comment: She is the best professor I've ever had. It is a easy A class. We have 8 quizzes, 8 homework, 2 midterm and a final exam. She is very kind on quizzes and homework, usually the lowest grade on the quizzes and homework is 7 as long as you did the quizzes and homework. Before the exams, she always sent us a very specific study guide.

Dr. Sui made diffeq a really easy class. Lecture is boring, and the homework and quizzes are hard but she basically gives full points if you try. The exams were pretty easy, and she emails everyone a study guide basically detailing each question. 2255 could have been SO MUCH WORSE. TAKE IT WITH DR. SUI

Zhenan was great. She is one of the best math professors I have had. Best advice I can give is go to her office hours she will be way more specific about what will be on the exam. She loves people who show up to class everyday and utilize her office hours. If you do that, you will get a whole letter grade boost.

This class seems pretty intimidating at first, but don't fret too much. Grading: She said for sure there is NO CURVE. This isn't true. There are 50 bonus points and a curve. I had a total of 432 points at the end and got an A. Sui really likes people who participate in class and go to her office. She is super helpful during office hours. That's all

She can be challenging to understand and unclear at times.  However, she is extremely helpful, and really not a bad teacher overall.  She basically gives you 4 or 5 points on all the quizzes, and she gave a big curve to our class.
