Her tests are not easy, but with the free quizzes and big curve, it's not too hard of a class at all.

Don't be fooled! She may be confusing to understand at first, but she is awesome! Every quiz you take, no matter how bad you do on them, you will get at least a 5/6. For half of the quizzes she gave in the year (12 quizzes), she literally just gave everyone a 6/6! If you get an A on the final, you get an A in the class, but final is hard...

Zhenan Sui is my favorite math teacher I've ever had. (I say teacher as she is my first actual professor). While the class is intimidating at first, it becomes very obvious that with some work it is very doable. She gives a lot of partial credit and is EXTREMELY helpful during office hours. Because of her, this class is much easier than  2162.02.
She wants you to do well. Genuinely interested in teaching and helping students! An easy A if you follow the course closely.

She is very helpful answering questions and concepts that may be unclear to students. She is present in office hours, not distracted with emails or other work like some professors tend to be. Her lectures were clear, but as with any class, it's helpful to complete the reading and attempt the homework prior the the lecture on that section.
Great professor. You can get an easy A for this class because she would like to tell you most of problems that will show on the exam.
She did a really good job basically doing problems during recitation.  She also graded quizzes fairly easy

Lectures were fairly dry and interminable. No further insight was gained from going to the lecture than was from reading the textbook. Class was straightforward and fairly easy; managed an A- despite 3 missed homeworks.

summary_comment: Professor Ramos is known for his passion and willingness to help students in office hours, though his lectures can be disorganized and difficult to follow due to his handwriting. He values attendance and participation, often giving pop quizzes for extra credit, which some find unfair. Despite these challenges, he is effective in explaining complex concepts and provides a significant curve on exams, making the class more manageable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ramos is a passionate and generally helpful instructor, particularly during office hours, though his lectures can be disorganized and difficult to follow due to his handwriting. He emphasizes attendance through pop quizzes for extra credit and provides significant partial credit and opportunities for extra points, making his tests fair but challenging.

Ratings.comment: To the review talking about how he gives pop quizzes: yes this is true. However, he clearly says on the first day of class that he values people attending lecture, and the quizzes are for extra credit, so it's more than fair. He's a bit scattered in lecture but office hours will save you. Overall a very passionate professor.

He expects us to put in work and and be attentive in class. Some students don't like that. But what else could you expect from an upper level ENGINEERING math class at Ohio State. I mean, c'mon! If you don't put effort in, you'll do bad. If you put effort in, you'll do great.  It's as simple as that. Also, he's awesome in office hours. Great guy.

-Not a good professor -Lectures are very very disorganized -Hard to follow what he is saying moves from one topic to something unrelated -Gives pop quizzes for credit a lot when he knows people dont show up to class (people don't show up to class because it is very difficult to learn from him) -Avoid taking him if possible 3.5 out of 10

Go to his office hours! He is very helpful and willing to show work to answers on homework and stuff. His lectures are semi-interesting though it can get confusing because of his handwriting which is quite sloppy on the board. He gives a lot of extra credit and also pop quizzes and he hates it when students leave early so make sure to come to class

Sometimes in class he is a bit difficult to understand, but don't be too afraid to ask questions! He is especially helpful in office hours. He cares a lot about attendance and participation, so make sure to come in case of random pop quizzes and tips for what will be on the exams. His exams are very difficult but he gives a ton of partial and EC.

If you want a good theoretical understanding of statistics, take this class! This is his main "fault"! Since this is an engineering course, most students just want to apply Stats without understanding why what they're doing works. Watch Mark D Risser's Stats 3470 vids on youtube before class. You'll have a greater appreciation for Ramos' teaching.

This professor is normally very good at explaining concepts, but halfway through the course the material becomes very confusing. Partial credit is what gets you most of the points on your exam. There is some extra credit available.

He is a very good lecturer, he can make hard concepts easy. Pretty bad handwriting. Tests are very fair. Massive curve to the class. Like around 10%. He made a 3pm bearable for me. Also pop quizzes that are for attendance.

His class was definitely challenging, but easier than most of the math courses I've taken here. If you want to actually learn about stats rather than get an easy A, definitely take his class! His lectures are funny and engaging, and cover both the theory and the application of stats. He also gives tons of extra credit on tests and quizzes.
Love him, incredibly kind and inspirational lecturer! Definitely will look for another statistic class to take with him again!

He is one of the most amazing instructors I have ever met so far! His lectures are hilarious and understandable, he is patient to help you out if you are in trouble. His tests are tricky, indeed! But if you put your work into it, he is not stingy on giving you good grades! Definitely want to give him a hug and love him, really!

He taught in a way that left the class with no clue of where we are or what we were talking about. Switched between topics quickly and without notice. Lectures were very fast-paced. Course was unplanned didn't follow the tentative outline from the start of class. lecture slides were posted weeks later.  Tests didnt look at all similar to the hw.

His tests require you to have a deep and solid understanding about the definitions and everything relating to his lectures. To be honest many of my classmates enjoy his lectures very much, very humorous + understandable explanations about abstract-level details and he is helpful if you tries to reach out. BE PREPARED TO WORK HARD FOR HIS CLASS!
We learn from quiz. Huge gap between hw and test. he think he is hilarious

Ramos, while he represents the material decently there is a huge gap between the homework and tests. He would make a much better grad level lecture based on his emphasis on theory in a class meant for the practical aspects. The extra credit given was purely in response to the 50% averages on his exams.
His stats course is rough, the homework is nothing like the tests and even the lecture doesn't prepare you well for the exams. Be prepared to work hard for a decent grade.

Tough tests, but he gave a lot of extra credit to make up for it if you went to lectures. He's a new teacher, so he is still learning how to run a classroom. Also, his accent is pretty think, so be prepared for that! Overall he teaches the material well, but it's definitely helpful to read the textbook as a supplement.

I really liked this class(not the lecture hall- I hate lecture halls). Many people hated it because he didn't spoon feed us the material but I think that he did a pretty good job teaching the concepts at an abstract but understandable level. The tests can be tricky but if you do and understand the homeworks, you shouldn't have much trouble.

summary_comment: Professor Liu provides clear and relevant notes and materials, and offers review classes and practice exams, making the exams manageable. However, her lectures can move quickly and sometimes lack detailed explanations, making the class challenging for some students, especially non-international ones. While she occasionally assigns extra credit to balance difficult quizzes, her teaching style and pace may not suit all learners.
summary_comment_short: Professor Liu provides clear and relevant notes and review sessions, making exams manageable, though her lectures can be rushed and sometimes difficult to follow. While her classes move quickly and she offers extra credit, some students find her teaching style less effective, suggesting a reliance on supplementary resources like TAs and self-study.

Ratings.comment: I honestly did not learn much by going to class, but by doing the homework and practice exams I was able to do well on all the midterms and the final. The quizzes were unreasonably difficult and confusing, but she gave us an extra credit assignment to kind of balance that out. Overall, not horrible if you have to have her, but also not amazing.

I will suggest this instructor to all students who need to take Math 2153 in Ohio State. Her lecture and notes are really reasonable and related to exam. Exams are not hard even. Sometimes quizzes are difficult but TA assigned those quizzes. She gives us extra credit just because one quiz is non-reasonable hard. CHOOSE HER, you won't regret!
if you're not an international kid, she won't help you as much but she's still a good teacher if you know what you're doing
Very good notes,  have review class before each exam and also have practice exams

The class moves very quickly, but it is doable. The exams are so much easier than you expect them to be. She messes up a lot, but the international kids always fix her, so you'll be fine and you'll always get the correct material. She also posts her notes online, so you only need to go to recitation for the quizzes.

Does not explain/teach well at all. Teaches too quickly. Sometimes hard to understand. Students in our lecture performed significantly worse on midterms/final than those with other lecturers. Began using the online lessons from MSLC instead of going to class which helped a little but I would have much rather learned in person with a good professor
She is pretty good lecturer but the class has too many things to cover.
She's a decent lecturer, but mostly just reads from the book. TA is very important to your success in this class, and get ready to read and self teach.
Awful teacher

summary_comment: Professor Chowdhury is an exceptional recitation instructor known for his thorough teaching methods and clear explanations. He ensures that students understand the material through detailed discussions and by reviewing homework problems, which prepares them well for tests and quizzes. His dedication to student success is evident in his availability to answer questions and his fairness in grading.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chowdhury is an excellent recitation instructor, known for his clarity and thorough explanations, which significantly aid student understanding and performance. His structured approach and availability for questions ensure students are well-prepared for assessments.

Ratings.comment: Phenomenal. Samir is always aware of what he's doing and rarely makes mistakes. He takes pauses along the way to make sure that no one has any questions. He reviews and HW problems that we have and prepares us well for tests and quizzes. Overall just a great recitation instructor. The course would have been much more difficult without him.

Samir is a cool guy, and he is good at explaining things in detail.  If you do not fully understand a subject be sure to talk to him.  1131 business calc is not as easy as some people make it out to be.  if you skip recitation you will fail.

I had Samir for Business Calc recitation. Very clear, speaks with a cute accent, and is genuinely interested in helping students. He's a strict grader, but fair. Also kind of hot so that's another plus. Definitely take him if you can!

summary_comment: Professor Stanton is known for his rigorous teaching style and challenging exams, with some students reporting median scores as low as 55% on midterms. Despite this, he is highly regarded for his engaging and supportive approach, often helping students one-on-one and maintaining a positive rapport with them. Students consistently praise his fairness and kindness, emphasizing that while the class is demanding, it is well worth the effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stanton is known for his challenging classes and rigorous testing, with some tests having low median scores, but he is also praised for his effective teaching methods, engaging lectures, and willingness to help students outside of class. Despite the difficulty, students appreciate his fairness and kindness, and many recommend taking his courses for their high-quality instruction.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Stanton led a tough class and gave especially difficult tests (the median was a 55 on the first midterm!), but he was a great teacher, interacted well with the students, and was even nice enough to help me out after I missed a midterm. He's tough, but he grades fairly and kindly. I'm confident I could have gone up to an A with more studying.
If you are willing to work for the class you will be fine. First exam had a 75% maximum score but was curved so that the highest grade was an A.

BEST professor I've ever met during my 4 year college study. Extremely kind and helpful. Always keeps class entertain and involve every student. Very responsible to students and could remember the quietest student like me. If you have to take those tough math courses, take EVERY effort to select him to understand how a decent professor teaches!!

Going to office hours a lot was very helpful, his one on one explanations are much better than his classroom lectures which are also good, Im just slow. The class is very difficult because of the insane questions he puts on exams. We are even allowed laptops and there were still questions that I didnt know where to begin.

A very good teacher for an otherwise difficult class. One of the lone bright spots of my experience with higher math at OSU. Extremely vibrant professor and highly energetic in his lectures, cares about his students, and is very approachable! Homework collected Fridays only, and you can use computers for exams. Very fair grader. Take him!!
Awesome professor.He really delivers material very clear and is always willing to help students.HW and tests are a little bit hard,but fair.Funny as well.Gonna take his 162H this winter.
Easily one of the BEST PROFESSORS I have ever had!  For any math class check if he has a section for it, then build your schedule around it.  A "Must Have" for upper division courses.
Took MATH 601 under him. Good Prof. Means well. Quite Approachable. But assignments and exams are difficult.

Great professor. Very difficult material, but Prof. Stanton keeps the class involved and entertained. Easily the most approachable math professor I have ever had. Cares about his students and is willing to help as much as possible.

Dr. Stanton is hands down one of the best math professors you will ever have. His lectures are very clear and concise, plus he really does care about his students doing well in the class in terms of understanding the material. His exams were very fair, even though they will be difficult in general. If at all possible, I urge you, TAKE HIM for math!

By far the best professor I have ever had.  Made Math 153 an absolute breeze even though i had heard it was the toughest pre-415 math class. Explained everything great and did a ton of examples to help you understand.  i highly recommend him for any math course.

VERY good teacher.  He gets the material across very ably.  Bring your book to class, as what he teaches is usually straight out of that section.  Tests are hard, but he actually grades them himself:  When you get the test back, he shows what you did wrong, and how to prevent that in the future.  I encourage having him for MTH 153.

good teacher. i understood him in class. very dynamic. not mean, pretty funny. however, his tests are ridiculously hard. i did all the hw (which is graded-fairly) and came to class every day. still ended up with a B and probably failed the final. guess i'm not a math wizz. i'd stick with him just study your butt off for the tests.
Impossible material made managable.  Stanton makes it feel like hes a student along with you.
really simplifies things and makes them easy to understand. tests are hard, but fair. if you go to his office hours, he will help you out even more. good teacher
great teacher, you will actually understand the material if you study hard

summary_comment: Professor Meyer is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and ability to make complex material accessible. Students appreciate his thoroughness and availability during office hours, though some find his grading standards challenging. Overall, he is seen as a valuable and effective instructor in mathematics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Meyer is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and ability to make complex material accessible. Students appreciate his thorough support during office hours, though some found his grading standards strict and occasionally confusing.

Ratings.comment: Dan was my professor the second time I took this class. I enjoyed his lectures hes a great teacher I wish he was my professor this semester for my current math class.
He is an awesome lecturer. He makes the lectures as interesting as possible. Just ignore his opinions on certain topics.
Dan was a great professor Im slightly disappointed I will  not have him for my next calc class

He graded the quizzes pretty strict. He was really helpful in office hours and did his best to make the class make sense. Sometimes he confused me, but it's probably just because it was calculus. I would not had passed if it weren't for Dan.

summary_comment: Professor Khalil, as reflected in student comments, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and supportive approach. Students consistently praise his dedication, noting that he goes above and beyond to ensure their understanding, provides ample resources, and maintains an engaging and humorous classroom atmosphere. His commitment to helping students succeed, particularly those struggling with the material, is evident in multiple testimonials.
summary_comment_short: Professor Khalil, as reflected in student comments, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and supportive approach, making complex concepts accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise his availability, detailed notes, and ability to boost grades and confidence, indicating he has the potential to be an outstanding professor.

Ratings.comment: Osama is the best TA ever. The man is able to make at least one joke every recitation and also helps everyone grasp the student. He basically talks you off the ledge after a terrible and useless lecture. BEST TA BY FAR. #OsamaTheKing

I started out not doing very well in Calculus II, but began going to his office hours and did well afterwards. He genuinely cares about his students and wants to see them do well. You just need to put in the effort and go to his office hours. Best TA I've had so far in school by a mile. He'll make a fantastic professor some day.

Osama was a great TA! He saved my grade. He was always there to answer questions or to help if you're struggling to grasp something. Abundant outside recitation review sessions. He's entertaining in class too! I would highly recommend him. Would take again.
Osama's the reason I'm surviving calc 1. He is a funny guy, always makes himself available outside class, and gives detailed notes on every topic. Great man!

summary_comment: Professor Zhou is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating a strong commitment to helping students understand complex concepts effectively. His ability to explain important ideas clearly and thoroughly makes him an invaluable resource for students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhou is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, demonstrating a strong commitment to helping students understand complex concepts and providing thorough explanations. His ability to effectively communicate difficult ideas contributes significantly to his overall effectiveness as an instructor.

Ratings.comment: Chenxi is really a good TA in OSU, he is really eager to help students and have enough abilities for explaining some important concepts. Moreover, with a good look...

summary_comment: Professor Oremland is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and clear in his lectures. Students find his classes both informative and engaging, and many appreciate his availability during office hours for additional support. His grading is perceived as fair, and he effectively simplifies complex topics, making the course accessible even for those who might find it challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Oremland is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for being extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and clear in his lectures. Students find his classes both informative and engaging, with many praising his fairness in exams and his willingness to provide additional support during office hours.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely loved him as a professor. Got a ton out of his class and visited his office hours frequently just because he gave great advice and feedback. Extremely knowledgeable, helpful and clear in class and his exams were fair. Learned a lot from him and his class was entertaining.
Very helpful. Easy grader. Makes a difficult class easy to understand and skips some of the harder topics.  Would take again.

summary_comment: Professor Yang is highly regarded for his considerate and supportive approach to teaching, ensuring students understand the material through flexible methods. While midterms were challenging, the final exam was easier, making consistent effort throughout the course essential for success. His comprehensive final exam review further underscores his commitment to student learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yang is highly regarded for his considerate and supportive approach to teaching, ensuring students understand the material through flexible methods and additional review sessions. While midterms presented significant challenges, the final exam was notably easier, making consistent engagement with the course essential for success.

Ratings.comment: Tao was a very considerate professor. He was able to work with you to make sure you learned the material. He even held a final exam review that covered everything. Midterms were definitely hard but the final exam was really easy by comparison. Overall, if you do the homework and pay attention in lecture you should be able to do well in this class.

summary_comment: Professor Miller is known for her clear and concise explanations of course material, which significantly aids in exam preparation through her detailed lecture outlines and review sessions. While her classes require consistent attendance and a significant amount of homework and quizzes, students find her approachable and her tests to be generally fair and similar to the practice materials provided.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller is an effective explainer of complex material and provides valuable review sessions for exams, though her classes can be somewhat dry. Students appreciate her clear teaching style and the helpful nature of her exams, which closely mirror homework and review sessions.

Ratings.comment: Boring class but good professor. She's great at explaining material, and the review sessions for the exams really help. There's a lot of homework and quizzes, but the TA's are pretty lenient about them.
She provides outlines for the lectures, but you have to go to fill them in if you want her notes. She's also highly enjoyable- I would take any other course with her.

You have to go to class to get the example problems in the notes. The homework is a huge help to your grade and she lets you bring a cheat sheet to the exams. Explains things pretty well and tells you exactly what type of problems are on exams.
Super nice professor who conveys material in a clear and concise manner.

Just show up for lectures and take notes, she posts the outline of the lectures only so you've got to print the notes every class or download them onto a tablet and edit them there. Tests are pretty easy; very similar to the homework and review. Recitation has nothing to do with lectures, just go and enter the prompts into R and that's it.

summary_comment: Professor Chapman is highly regarded by some students for her sweetness, helpfulness, and clear teaching style, while others find her lectures confusing and poorly organized, with frequent distractions. Some praise her for her dedication to student success, offering extensive support through office hours, review sessions, and extra help, while others advise skipping lectures and teaching oneself.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chapman is highly regarded by some students for her sweetness, helpfulness, and clear teaching style, while others found her lectures confusing and off-topic, with issues of organization and disruptive behavior during classes.

Ratings.comment: Her lectures were confusing, she could not stay on topic. She would stop in the middle of lectures to yell at people she thought were talking. Usually they weren't I think she just thought they were. It was more distracting than if someone actually did talk. She's slow, unorganized, and kind of an old b. Skip lecture, teach yourself.

The sweetest lady that you will ever meet. The most helpful professor you will ever meet. She makes the course worth while. She's a clear, concise, step-by-step instructor. You'll grow to wish she was your own grandmother.

By far one of the best instructors I've taken at OSU. She is so sweet and incredibly helpful. Prior to this class I had little to no interest in math mainly because I lacked a proper understanding. Mrs. Chapman has changed that. She clearly explains each step to every problem. Has detailed review sessions before each exam, she even brings cookies!

She is one of the sweetest professors I've had so far. Really make use of the handouts she gives out and go to her office hours. She is very helpful. Attend her review sessions and practice old exams when she makes them available before exams. Usually the exams are similar.

This teacher actually cares about every single one of her students. If you put the time in you will get an A. Get a hold of old exams, that is all you need to study. Take her and your grade will be much higher than any other professor!

Nicest woman and TA that I have had to date. Gives out her phone number to answer questions at any hour of any day. If at all possible, schedule into her class! Quizzes are straight forward and she gives out helpful hints before hand. I took precalc in high school and got close to a 100% in this class.
She will do ANYTHING for her students. She cares so much about their success and she is the most precious old lady ever. She's the best.

Probably the cutest old woman you'll ever meet. She's also pretty funny, and extremely helpful in that she's always making extra office hours for students and having review sessions. It helps to do your all you online & book hw!

summary_comment: Professor Chen's lectures are described as sparse and difficult to follow, leading many students to find the class challenging and nearly impossible. His responses to questions are reported as incoherent, and his teaching style, which involves direct use of the textbook, is ineffective for those who struggle with step-by-step problem-solving.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chen's lectures are described as sparse and difficult to follow, making the class challenging even for math majors. Students found his explanations incoherent and his teaching style unsuitable for those who struggle with direct, book-based instruction.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Chen made this class nearly impossible, so much so that I had to change professors. His lectures are sparse and impossible to understand; his answers to questions aren't coherent. I'm very forgiving to international teachers, but our language barrier made it impossible to understand the course material. I wouldn't recommend to non-math majors

If you're taking a course just to get credit, and forget the material, then don't take Dr. Chen. He's kinda quiet. Occasionally funny. He teaches directly from the book. If you can't follow step-by-step problem-solving, and learn from it, then don't take him. Read/understand the book the night before, ask questions when confused, and you'll be fine

summary_comment: Professor Fotis is considered ineffective in his teaching role, as evidenced by students' reports of his frequent absences from exams and lectures, poor explanations of course material, and tardiness. Students recommend avoiding him for challenging courses such as Math 2177 due to these issues.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fotis is considered ineffective as a lecturer, frequently missing classes and struggling to explain the material clearly. His tardiness and poor class management have led students to advise against taking his courses, especially for challenging subjects like Math 2177.

Ratings.comment: He is not a good teacher at all. He missed the first midterm that we had, he also was not very good at explaining the material in class. He almost always showed up late to class too. I didn't understand any of the material I learned, and I did go to every class. I would suggest looking for a different professor for difficult classes like Math 2177.

Sam gives great assistance during office hours and is always available to speak to after class. He can be a bit hard to hear during lecture, but overall lectures are great. 1172 (Calc II for engineers) is a feared course at OSU, taking it with Sam made it enjoyable. Don't miss lecture.

summary_comment: Professor Ying is highly knowledgeable but faces significant challenges in communication due to his heavy accent and fast speech. His lectures can be difficult to follow, with many students finding them hard to understand. He teaches directly from the textbook, which helps with self-study but often leads to discrepancies between his teaching methods and those of the recitation TAs. Despite these issues, students who put in the effort can succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ying is highly knowledgeable but faces significant challenges in communication due to his heavy accent and rapid speech, which makes lectures difficult to follow. His teaching methods often differ from those of the recitation TAs, leading to confusion among students.

Ratings.comment: It is difficult to understand him past his accent on occasion, but most of my issue with understanding him was his notation and method of teaching how to do a certain problem frequently did not match with what recitation TAs used. He is very helpful, but the difference between what he teaches and what recitation teaches was very difficult.

Lectures are almost completely useless due to the difficulty of understanding what he is saying. He writes very small, talks very fast in a heavy accent, and speeds through topics. Goes straight from book, so you can attempt to cross reference his work, but in all honesty you better hope you have a good T.A.

Hope you have a good T.A. for recitation. Lectures can be long and it's hard to understand him sometimes. He pronounces many words wrong, but he teaches directly from the textbook, so it's easy to go back and teach yourself. He's famous for rushing "one more example" right before classes ends. Put forth effort and you'll pass.

Hao Ying is very knowledgeable. However, there is a communication barrier. He speaks heavily accented English very quickly. Many students complain that they cannot understand him, I have not had any problems understanding Hao. He teaches directly from the txtbook. Tests are difficult, do the suggested homework. Put in effort and you'll do fine.

summary_comment: Professor Sheshmani is highly regarded for his knowledgeable lectures and ability to explain complex mathematical concepts effectively, often using inspiring examples. However, his exams are challenging and require significant effort, with some students finding them exceptionally difficult. Students generally recommend working diligently and thoroughly studying the textbook exercises to succeed in his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sheshmani is highly regarded for his excellent lectures and deep understanding of the subject matter, making complex concepts accessible through detailed examples. However, his exams are challenging and require significant effort, with some students finding them nearly impossible without thorough preparation.

Ratings.comment: Definitely an interesting professor to start freshman year with - he likes to interact with the class and can get very theoretical. He gives extra credit to those who answer his questions but you have to be right or at least make sense. His exams can be tough although straightforward - you really need to work hard in this class to do well!
He gives great lectures, he really knows what he is talking about. He is clear during the lectures (if you sit in the front row!) but much more helpful during the office hours.

I took math 1172 with professor Artan. This was one of the hardest classes I have ever taken but he was an awesome professor.  He was very helpful explaining the ideas with inspiring examples and make me think math is useful. His exams were not so easy but they were based on the homework problems in the book.

He added materials from harder math classes that were not in the book. He did not appear to care if his students passed or failed the class. I asked him some questions in office hours and he was completely unhelpful. His exams were unbelievably hard and there was zero curve even though the class average was a D. He barely gives partial credit
He tells you himself that the exams are based on the exercises in the book, so if you study those hard you will get a perfect score. His lectures are amazing and he is a super smart professor.

He is really smart and explains difficult concepts very well. He also does tons of examples in class. He is by far the best prof. I've had at OSU. You should work really hard though. Definitely not possible to just sail through his classes.
He was a very good professor!
He is hard to understandhearsee Everyone thought it was impossible  Many people retook class Not a fan of class
Really tough class
Hardest math professor ever. Degrading to his students

Hardest class ever taken. You do not have many grades so take full advantage of the recitation quizzes and homework points because you will need those as boosters. The exams were nearly impossible. He is very stubborn and will not curve no matter what. He seems to care more about showing off his math skills than explaining. Go to his office hours!

Artan was an okay professor. If you see him in office hours he is friendly and fairly helpful, but spends lots more time on the abstract concepts rather than the problems. My largest issue with him was with his exams. His exams were very difficult, and on the final he included material that we never covered in the entire course.

Calculus III with Sheshmani was easily one of the hardest classes I've ever taken. He gives extra credit points if you answer questions in lecture, which is a MUST. These points get added onto midterms and the final. Also, see him in his office hours. He's helpful explaining concepts.

He wants to help you. If you go out of your way to learn the subject by going to office hours, he can help you a ton. Don't expect to do nothing and pass, though. He's not a pushover. That being said, the material isn't that tough if you study. Typing most of the things you're having trouble with in to google helps (Paul's Nath Notes work wonders).
Doesn't fully explain topics all that well.

You can tell how smart he is during the lectures.  He made me think math was awesome that said.  The class is hard.  You need to understand it the material.  You need to understand why equationstheorems work, you arent going to get by if you just know how to plug in the numbers

summary_comment: Professor Kim is known for his deep knowledge of differential equations but struggles with clear communication, often receiving low ratings for his ability to explain concepts and answer questions. Despite this, many students appreciate his efforts to help, particularly during office hours, and find his class examples useful for homework and exams. Overall, his lectures can be challenging to follow, especially for those who miss class or struggle with his accent, and exams tend to be difficult, with little partial credit given for partial answers.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim is known for being knowledgeable in differential equations but struggles with clarity and explanation, making his lectures and questions on exams challenging for many students. Despite his efforts to help, students find his teaching style difficult to follow, especially without consistent practice and attendance.

Ratings.comment: Hard to understand, didn't answer questions well, very unapproachable.

Dr. Kim was a smart guy and was a pretty nice grader, but it was hard for me to understand him in lecture. If you go to office hours he will try to help you, but sometimes he has trouble understanding your questions. Not the best at explaining the material. He also threw a question on the final we had never talked about in class.
He tries his best to help the students. His class examples always help in homeworks and exams. Show up to class to enjoy math and the way he teaches. One of my favorite OSU professors.

Very knowledgeable on the the subject (differential equations), exams aren't too difficult if you attend lecture/pay attention/do the HW. Eager to help you if you have a HW question after lecture or during office hours.

Kind of difficult to understand but you get use to it.YOU MUST STUDY EVERYDAY AND DO WORKBOOK REVIEW PROBLEMS IN ORDER TO BE SUCCESSFUL.I will say the way Exams are graded is flawed but he doesn't decide that the math department does. Just go to him if you have problem& he usually gives points back for correct work. GO TO CLASS OR YOU WILL FAIL.
He was very hard to understand, but on the exams multiple questions that involved work were no partial credit which kills your grade if you make a stupid mistake and did everything else right.

Hard to understand at first with his accent, but eventually you can understand him. If you have him, sit in the front row or it will be hard to pay attention and understand him. Does try to answer questions of students but has a hard time getting the answer out clearly.
Hard to understand and is not very good at explaining. Tests are challenging.
Expect to get 50% on exams for correct answers.
Can't understand him. Tests are really hard.

summary_comment: Professor Kurt is known for pushing students to deeply understand the material, often at the expense of clarity due to his accent. While some find his lectures challenging and prefer easier alternatives, others appreciate his dedication to learning and his willingness to provide extensive support through office hours. Overall, his teaching approach prioritizes genuine understanding over surface-level knowledge.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kurt is an engaging and dedicated educator who pushes students to deeply understand the material, often through challenging lectures that require significant effort to follow due to his accent. While some find his teaching style difficult, many appreciate his fairness and willingness to help, noting that his approach leads to substantial learning despite the initial struggle.

Ratings.comment: Be ready to forfeit your sanity

Overall good teacher. Curves the class by a good amount, so thankfully averages are pretty high. Encourages people to think, which is good. Learned a lot. Hard to understand most of the time, but that's not really his fault that he has an accent.

Oguz always showed up to lecture with a lot of energy and enthusiasm for the subject being taught. He held tons of office hours and was willing to go over questions multiple times. There are easier professors for this class but probably not too many better professors. A on the final gets you an A in the class, which saved a lot of peoples' grades.

Dr. Kurt is the laziest. Almost never prepared for lectures and when he does prepare some notes, they would be confusing with many mistakes. Honestly, I think he does not take teaching seriously and he thinks that students love him because of his stupid jokes. When ever he does something wrong, he would say it was in purpose (but is not). AVOID!
Didn't know what he was talking about, hard to understand but tests were very easy. Had to teach myself everything. Learned more from recitation than from lectures.
Easy Class, okay professor. Kurt is generally good at lecturing/explaining though it takes time to get used to his accent.

Dr. Kurt pushes students to learn above all else. If you want to learn, not regurgitate, he is great. He is dedicated, and willing to help. He is very fair, and, even though exams can be rough, they make you learn. Textbook use was minimal. You must help yourself during the term and do practice problems (required or not), or risk falling behind.

Probably the best professor I've had in college in terms of making you learn the material and caring about his students. Takes like two weeks to totally understand his accent but after it's fine. I usually try to skate by in classes, but he pushes you to really know the material and if you try, he helps a lot. Great teacher

I totally cannot understand what he teaches. This guy never sticks to the syllabus and even test some questions out of textbook range. You do not need to buy textbook because he will not follow it. The difficulty of his exams is incredibly high because he only posts sample exam questions without answer keys. He even makes me wanna change my major.

Prof Kurt's class was disorganized and stressful. No book. Stopped uploading notes halfway through the qtr. Emailed class daily with HW corrections and course changes. Made so many errors on an exam that he had to cancel it and give another. Spent 2 weeks on a topic that was eventually scrapped. If you like anxiety and disorganization, take Kurt.

Worst teacher ever, besides Banerjee. Don't take either one of them and if you are enrolled in their classes, change professors while you can! He is very unorganized, material he presents has mistakes,doesn't know how to teach,expects you to know everything,goes outside of course requirements and set you up to fail while thinking it's all funny.
best teacher ever. it's pronounced       oh-ooth. not oguz.

Dr. Kurt is an amazing teacher, who tries to keep the class excited by being funny. He's really helpful when you go to his office hours a lot, if you don't understand certain problems or lecture. Overall, Dr. Kurt was the best professor.

Dr. Kurt is a cool guy; he is pretty goofy and tries to make class funny. He's sometimes hard to understand with his accent, but it's not that bad. He's always helping students before and after class, and he teaches the class fairly well. Overall, a good, goofy teacher!

His lectures can be a little difficult to understand, but I feel he does cover the material well.  If you couple his lectures with the book, they complement each other.  Tests can be difficult, but his grading system is fair.
He is a good instructor. Easy to understand, fair exams, and fun class..
I strongly recommend him, if you really want to learn something from this class. He makes the class really fun, as you learn some stuff, you could get a high grade. GREAT INSTRUCTOR

He's funny, but a terrible teacher.  If he's on your schedule for 566, I'd advise you to try and switch to another section.  His lectures are confusing and the homework assignments don't prepare you for the impossible exams.
He's funny. I had him his first quarter of becoming a prof and he was very confusing towards the end of the quarter. Not very important to go to lectures but it depends on who you have as a TA.

Terrible teacher.  Made no sense when doing his proofs.  Average on one of the midterms was 33%.  Did curve the class, but no one had any idea what was going on the entire quarter.  Homework due every class.
A good teacher and a good person and enthusiastic.
Awesome, and hilarious teacher.  Really does a great job.
hes funny
I had him autumn quarter and would trade the world if I could have him as my math prof again for math 152.  He's really funny.  His tests were fairly easy as well.  Recommended.

This is the hardest course i have taken at Ohio State. Get ready to write eight two page long proofs for the test.  DO YOUR HOMEWORK !!!!  oguz is a great guy interested in helping students.  meet with him early and often to pass.
You might face a little problem with his accent, but he is really a good & funny in the same time. He is really helpful. He tries his best to help student. I think he won't be a bad choice.

He's not exactly the best lecturer, but he puts the notes up and most of the time they are clear. If you have a problem or a question about the material during class, he is more than willing to answer it for you. Tests are not that hard if you know the concepts well enough to apply them. Go to lecture, ask questions, and visit your T.A. often.
he is freaking great, gotta love this man

Math 151 Calculus.  You learn the most from the bookwork and webworks, not from him.  He usually hints at what is on the exams.  Kinda hard to understand, most people just copy what he writes.  Never asked him for help yet.

He is unclear and writes very small in light colors and makes it hard to read, he is hard to understand and does not explain things clearly he just writes the problem out and moves on. He tells stupid jokes about music which are lame and take up class time. On time he even played music while he was lecturing and it was so loud you could not hear
He's a little bit hard to understand sometimes, but once you get used to the accent -- not difficult -- he's great. And he'll bend over backwards to help. A wonderful guy and a good teacher.
I don't know if it was the material or him but I did not do well in this class... he's hard to understand, but he will definitely try his best to help you, so overall I would say he's a good teacher.

He will do all in his power to help - just ask.  Really.  When he is helping you, he really makes sure to answer the question and focus on what you are trying to understand.  He does care.  I wish I had him as my TA for the rest of math I have to take.
Funny guy, but it's hard to learn when you can't understand a word he says....okee guy okee (okay)
GREAT TEACHER! After failing this class from Myungdfsdhfk Oh, I passed his class with a B. Very interested in helping students, great teacher.
His name is Oguz Kurt, not Kurt Oguz!!  Anyway, Oguz is sweet.
An awesome TA. He is very entertaining and genuinely interested in helping students.

He is an awesome TA.  He made things seem so easy. Made things interesting.  He was very funny.  He cares about the students and is always trying to help and give advice.  All around and awesome guy.  Get him as your TA if you can.

summary_comment: Professor Wang is highly regarded for his dedication to student success, ensuring thorough understanding rather than mere memorization. His tests are fair, and he offers extensive support through frequent office hours where he excel at clarifying complex concepts. His teaching assistants, particularly Kun, are described as exceptionally supportive and understanding, going above and beyond to help students succeed, including providing detailed explanations, review sessions, and even writing answer keys when students miss classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wang is highly dedicated to his students' success, ensuring they truly understand the material rather than just memorizing formulas. His fair testing approach and availability during office hours contribute significantly to students' learning and performance.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Wang cares so much about his students and wants them all to do well.  He makes sure that you understand the material and are not just memorizing formulas.  His tests are fair and it is very possible to do well as long as you study.  He has frequent office hours, where he is fantastic at explaining concepts you may need extra help with.
Kun is awesome. He is really nice and understanding. He explains things well and wants to make sure you understand things. He doesn't grade harshly and is really fair. One of the best TAs!

Kun is incredibly helpful! He always goes out of his way to make sure you succeed in the class. When I was in the hospital he wrote up an answer key for a review that I missed. Before quizzes he goes over everything that you need to know in order to do well. GREAT recitation TA!

He was my recitation teacher, and he was ten times more helpful than the professor. He explained everything in detail and answered people's questions very well. He does problems similar to the quizzes right before you take them. He also gives you questions from old midterms and finals, which are always the same but with different numbers each time

summary_comment: Professor Shapiro is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and deep knowledge of the subject matter. Students find him challenging yet supportive, often curving grades to ensure everyone achieves at least a B-. His passion for mathematics is evident, making complex topics accessible and engaging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Shapiro is an exceptionally knowledgeable and engaging educator who balances challenging content with a supportive and encouraging approach, ensuring that students feel both motivated and valued. His deep passion for mathematics is evident in his teachings, making complex concepts accessible and fostering a genuine interest in the subject among his students.

Ratings.comment: It's usually a tough choice between the professor who teaches extraordinarily well and the one who is helpful and not condescending and will boost your interest in the subject. Shapiro was the best of both worlds. Such a nice & smart guy.
Very challenging class, but that's the point of course. Curved so everybody gets at least a B-. Extremely knowledgeable, good-natured, easy-going professor.
Clever professor with sharp, dry wit. Expects students to be motivated and put in effort for the classes. Does an excellent job of giving a tangible feeling to abstract algebra.

Excellent professor.  Encourages you to think deeply about simple things.  He makes it obvious that he only wants people in the class if they want to be there and can handle it, which might offend some people.  Obviously loves Mathematics deeply, and is willing to talk at length about it.
No Comments

Great professor.  He knows the material very well and is an incredible teacher.  Gives examples that make you think and is willing to talk all the time about Mathematics.  You can tell he loves Mathematics and it is catching.
One of my favorite professors so far.  He was incredibly helpful in his office and his notes/proofs on the board look like theyre out of a textbook.

summary_comment: Professor Hao is highly regarded for his willingness to help students and his knowledge of the subject matter. Despite some challenges in understanding his lectures due to shorthand notation and accent, students find him approachable and appreciative of his efforts to assist those in need. However, his teaching style and complexity in explaining concepts can be difficult for some, leading to lower initial exam scores.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hao is highly regarded for his willingness to help students and his knowledge of the subject matter, though his lectures can be challenging due to his shorthand and accent. Despite these difficulties, students appreciate his fairness in exams and his efforts to assist those who struggle, including offering bonus problems and extra credit.

Ratings.comment: Professor Hao was very nice and kind! Sometimes it was hard to follow him during lectures because he uses shorthand symbols. However, he was always willing to listen to the students' feedback and was always willing to help. He assigned homework from the textbook, and his exams are very fair.
He is a great professor! Willing to help students!!
He is a great professor!!! Willing to help students!! Easy to talk!

It takes a little while to understand him because he has an accent, however he knows his stuff and is very willing to help you if you need help. He always gives out bonus problems to help people struggling in the class. His midterms are similar to his practice midterms, so do the practice midterms and you will be fine.

At first he seems very hard to understand, but he definitely knows his stuff. Take time to really listen and you will learn, his midterms are fairly easy nothing really there to trick you make sure you do the practice midterms. He gives out a good amount of extra credit in a year to help with anyone who is struggling, and they are easy

Professor Hao is close to impossible to understand. He takes topics that should be easy to understand and makes them extremely complicated. Not very approachable because he can barely speak the language. The average on the first exam was a 67%. If you have the choice, choose a different professor for this class!

summary_comment: Professor Palmer is highly regarded for his caring and sweet demeanor, contributing to a supportive learning environment. His class is noted for its ease, with attendance and textbook usage being optional, though he recommends them for struggling students. The course is primarily assessed through four exams and weekly quizzes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Palmer is highly regarded for his caring and sweet demeanor, contributing to a supportive learning environment. His class is considered quite easy, with grading focused solely on exams and weekly quizzes.

Ratings.comment: very caring and sweet good professor. attendance is not mandatory and the book you can use and should if you're struggling, however it is really only used for homework which is optional (he does not collect or grade it)- the class is super easy and the only things graded are exams and quizzes. We have about 4 exams and a quiz every friday.

summary_comment: Professor Mance has mixed reviews; some students find him effective and engaging, praising his care for students and ability to curve grades generously, while others criticize his teaching methods, citing lectures that focus mainly on example problems and a lack of comprehensive coverage. Homework is noted as challenging, but exams are similar to homework, making them more predictable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mance is a polarizing figure among students; while some find him an engaging and supportive teacher who curves grades generously, others criticize his teaching methods as inadequate and his lectures as insufficient for learning without additional study.

Ratings.comment: not a great teacher..

I would recommend Dr. Mance.  He's pretty easy on the eyes too.  Only problem is sometimes I would get distracted by his Pericles-esque calves and toned pectoral muscles.  Every day was Christmas this semester. :)

without practice exam and clear syllabus if you are not good at studying by yourselves, you'd better drop this class. Don't expect that you will learn something from his lecture unless you have a good TA. his exam questions are always comprehensive in details.

Mance's lectures just go over the example problems and maybe 1 or two problems from the chapter. You don't learn much from the lecture's. His homework assignments are tough, but his exams aren't bad (they're homework problems). If you just do as many problems out of the book as you can, you'll do fine. He curves the class a lot too.
horrible professor, doesn't know how to teach, to busy with his research and acting like he lifts weights
Amazing professor. Best Math prof I've had at osu.  Explains things well, cares about students, will meet with you if you have issues with material
Think about this: you can get an A even if you only have 80% on your grade, and if you get 95% on your final exam, you can automatically get an A even if you got 0% on your previous HW and exams.
Very awesome guy! Very care about student! Very funny! Curve a lOt!!!

Mance taught himself calculus in 8th grade and apparently has no realization of how difficult it is for eveyone else. He is nice, but never actually communicates the material.He wastes a lot of class time, then skips sections of material. dont even go to his office hours, he will probably be lifting weights.

Dr. Mance is a cool guy. I strongly recommend him if you are taking 366. His exam was not overly difficult and all the homework problems were in the back of the book. Only tests on examples he works out for you. Do not take Lingfei, he is awful. You can't hear a word he says and he doesn't teach you anything.

DOCTOR Mance, as he viciously underlined on the first day of class, is a smart man but incapable of teaching math. He was always late to class, showed little interest in student success, and seemed to care more about his pink bedazzled cellphone than any sort of mathematics.  So thankful I had a good TA...

He's intelligent overall, but does NOT answer your questions (even if he offers office hours), always shows up late to class, unprepared to teach, and always shows up late to class. Also, during office hours he might rush you because he would rather go workout than help students and talks more about calculus than pre-calc. get a good TA!!

He shows an effort to teach and is enthusiastic and obviously enjoys the subject but he isnt clear and doesn't explain anything he does. he often shows the wrong way to do things and does calculus instead of precalc. have to teach yourself in this class. get a good TA

he is very smart at math, and therefore cannot explain concepts well, he speeds through concepts, doesn't stray on track and uses calc concepts in precalc cause he forgets. will understand nothing, You won't be able to follow. its not his fault,he's good at math but wont benefit you.

summary_comment: Professor PU is a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who genuinely wants to help students, but his broken English can make understanding the material challenging, especially during the initial weeks of the semester. Despite this, he provides clear guidance on what is needed for exams and offers fair tests with generous partial credit. His teaching style and sense of humor are appreciated, though the course content can be quite advanced.
summary_comment_short: Professor PU is a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who genuinely wants to help students, despite significant challenges with English proficiency that affect communication. His teaching style improves with the semester, and while the material is challenging, he provides valuable insights and partial credit on exams.

Ratings.comment: Speaks in broken english but it becomes easier to understand the longer you go on in the semester. The midterms weren't too difficult although the final was really hard. However he tells you what you need to know before each test and he gives a lot of partial credit. Really nice guy and willing to help too. Better than most math professors here.
very willing to help, but his english was so poor it did little good. he's brilliant and used good examples, and gave good study sessions before the tests, but its still very hard

Ming Pu is smart as hell but i think hes back in China now and no longer at OSU...in any case, try to avoid taking him strictly because of his english skills...which suck. His examples are great and he teaches well but, the material is a lil to advanced for his knowledge of english. hes a good dude tho, it depends but u may find him to be hilarious

Ming Pu was a horrible teacher! He spoke broken English and he stutterd! He was a very nice guy and when I met with him in office ours he tried to help but he kept doing the examples that he did in class over and over again. I relied on the book for everything.

I think Pu was nice, and genuinely interested in helping, BUT there was a language barrier and he only did the examples that were already worked out in the book.  For most parts of the class, going to class added nothing to the book.  Exception: Arc length stuff.
He is a good teacher! Go the lectures and you'll understand him a lot better. He's hilarious too! :)

Although initially hard to understand you get use to it.  Funny and seems interested in teaching.  Class overall isnt the easiest so do your homework or look over your notes often.  Tests are fair, if you can try to get someone's old exams to study from.  If you put enough time into the class you will be fine.

Very funny though he does not intend to be. Tries to explain everything, but does not do so very well. Seems to be interested in making sure you understand, but he has a hard time understanding lots of questions. The class is extremely hard though.
he is extremely hard to understand and he skips so many steps while doing problems. he doesn't explain ANYTHING....he basically expects you to know everything that he is doing.

Terrible.....couldn't understand him, couldn't approach him.  I had to start going to a different lecturer who could actually teach.  He made everything so much more complicated than it actually should have been.

summary_comment: Professor Peterson is known for his rigorous and theoretical approach to teaching calculus, which challenges students significantly. While many students appreciate the detailed notes and his willingness to help during office hours, they often find his lectures and exams difficult and lacking in practical examples. Despite the high difficulty level, some students still commend his expertise and consider him one of the best math teachers at OSU.
summary_comment_short: Professor Peterson is known for his challenging exams and rigorous grading, with some students finding his lectures and in-class examples insufficient for mastering the material. Despite this, many acknowledge his expertise and dedication, noting that he provides comprehensive notes and is willing to help during office hours, though his teaching style is not universally appreciated.

Ratings.comment: Overall I just had a hard time with the class. One thing I LOVED was that the final had 4 sections, 3 for each midterm's material, and one for new material. If you did better in the section of the final than the respective midterm, he averaged that section grade with your midterm grade! I had a C- all semester and studied so hard for the final:  A-
Appalling teaching skills, avoid taking class BECAUSE: The test questions are very very hard, average is LOW, the curve is small, and unless you are very interested in math, you will struggle.

He knows what he's doing, but his in-class examples generally aren't going to help you with the hard problems. I always liked his notes better than reading the textbook, but had to wait for the TA or find other examples when it came to finishing homework. He'll work out whatever problem you ask if you go to his office hours.
The class wasn't easy. I had to work really hard, honestly. But he's probably the best math teacher I've ever had at OSU.
All theory, no examples. I could now write you an excellent essay about Calculus, but solve a problem? Probably not.

His lecture is totally useless. I learn this class all by reading the textbook. 60 homework problems that drive me crazy every week...  a very strict grader.. don't take his class.. I want my tuition back..

He doesn't know how to teach. He spends 90% of lecture time on prove, but exams are just some very hard questions he never mentioned on class. What I really need is more examples, the prove has already shown on the book, he just move it on board. I can say that I learn Cal 3 totally by myself, his lecture is useless. You need to read book again.
He is a good guy, but his homework and exams are hard as hell. Dont choose him if you have another choice in 2153.

Since he teaches higher math classes, he treats 1150 students like they're idiots. You ask a question and he replies along the lines of "well, don't you know that?". Has mood swings, I get more confused going to lecture on topics that are simple in the book. I do better on the quizzes when I don't go to lecture.

If you want to challenge yourself, you can take this class. Every week, he assigned lots of homework which is really hard and sometimes you even cannot handle it, and what the worst is not each question will be checked even though you work really hard on it. Also, it is not so reasonable that there is no curve on it!!!
If you prefer to learn from examples, and not theory/definitions the entire class, dont take peterson. Grades the homework as if it was the midterm, no curve.
There is hard homework of 40-90 questions every week. No curve. If you could find another 2153 class, I highly recommend you to drop his class.

I had Nick as a TA. He is a tough grader, but a fair grader. Math is just that kind of subject. His quizzes were tough, but if you can do well on his quizzes, you can do well on the exam! Do your homework thoroughly and you might get a good grade on it. Nevertheless, Nick is a good guy and fun to have for a TA.

If you have him, I would suggest switching. Nice guy, explains the content pretty well, but when it comes to grading homework and exams (numerous challenging problems), prepare to cry or destroy something because he will not go easy on you. His exams are hard and he expects students to understand the theoretical aspects more than most instructors.

WOW. I can only begin to describe the split personality that is Nick Peterson. He's a great guy who does a pretty decent job of explaining concepts, but when it comes to grading your homework and quizzes, prepare to be absolutely destroyed. Merciless

Nick Peterson enjoys nothing more than the thrill of taking homework from students, and laughing maniacally as he destroys the grades of his students with his iron-fisted homework grading powers. On the plus side, he spilled his coffee one day while teaching and proceeded to say, "I'm going to cry." in a manly voice, and continued teaching. Beastly

He is a ridiculously hard grader, definitely do your homework correctly and entirely to avoid failing.  He was compared to Chuck Norris...he is always right and will destroy you if you are not.  Good teacher, but definitely avoid him if you like getting good grades and are not a genius.

Tuff grader which in a math classes isn't a good thing at all, curses randomely in class also very full of himself. Never shows any mercey. Gave alot of homework and his midterms are hard. Honestely he made Math 153 hatder than it had to be.I'd really try to aviod him, he understands math but like i said is not professor type.

A genuinely good teacher! He truly cares about the success of his students unlike the TAs a few of my friends have had the displeasure of knowing. He knows the material backwards and forwards, so if you're having trouble, take advantage of his office hours!I wouldn't have gotten A's in 151&152 if it hadn't been for that supplemental instruction.

He is a strict grader, but he prepares you so much better than anyone else for exams that you like him anyway.  Nice Guy.  Our class scored about 10 percent above the average on every exam mostly because of Nick.  152 is still pretty difficult no matter who you take though.
He's a nice guy but an extremely strict grader. Takes off points for the littlest possible mistakes. Has tons of office hours during finals week. Knows material well and will help you.

summary_comment: Professor Wong is highly regarded for his clarity and humor in teaching, making complex subjects accessible. His lectures are efficient and engaging, though some students find them fast-paced, which can be challenging without attending regularly. While his exams are known to be difficult, past exam papers from his courses are often recommended for preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wong is highly regarded for his clarity and humor in teaching, making complex subjects engaging. However, his lectures are fast-paced, which can be challenging for students who miss any part of the content.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Wong is one of the most helpful and one of the clearest and easily understood teachers I've had at Ohio State. His lectures go quick and they're over before you know it. He uses the same humor a lot, but it always makes the lecture more fun. Would recommend taking classes taught by Dr. Wong.

Dr. Wong (and my TA) are the only reason I passed this course. I took it last year with Dr. Andrews and failed miserably because I understood nothing, wasted my time going to lecture and had a **** for a TA. Dr. Wong and my new TA were so much easier to understand. I'm terrible and math and still did well.

A professor with a solid understanding of the subject. Number theory is a hard class but he maintains our interest to learn. However, he expect you to understand everything he lectured and that could cause frustration when asking about homework questions. Exams are hard, but he curves ultimately. A good teacher overall.

Wong has a pretty obnoxious accent that makes the lecture hard to sit through for 55 minutes. On top of that he repeats the same phrases over and over. He is not a good lecturer at all. He confused me more to the point that I felt like attending lecture was hindering my understanding of the material. If you wanna do well in this class go to mathlab

Dr. Wong is a very good lecturer and he definitely knows how to have some humor.  He teaches the class well, but his tests are hard, unless you know have tests from previous quarters.  If you find some of those then you should get an A on every test.

Dr. Wong is definitely an efficient lecturer. He speaks clear English, as he has been in the states since the late 60's. He has a good sense of humor, and does a good job of explaining subject matter. As with all college level math courses he moves very fast, so do not get into the habit of skipping lectures or you will fall behind.

He's an okay teacher, but 48 minutes is not enough time to go over a section. He puts the hardest problems from the homework on the tests, so study those. If you can find some of his old exams from previous quarters those would be extremely helpful.

He is not British and speaks very clearly. Does everything on an overhead and I didnt like trying to follow along with his notes. Seemed to get very irritated when people asked questions. Just another professor to me.
First thing...he's definitely not British. Don't know where people got that idea. Second, he's a pretty good teacher that wants you to understand it. Speaks very clearly and teaches well.

Dr. Wong taught challanging material clearly and really made sure the class was following along.  This class was interesting, somewhat of a challange, and even fun at times.  Definitely recommend this class, and Dr. Wong as a professor.
Speaks clearly and is very easy to understand. He's nice, funny, and teaches the material clearly. Best math professor I have had at OSU.

I really enjoyed his class.  He is very humorous, has fun, and still explains things very well. Not very difficult as long as you go to lecture.  I also recommend going to the Exam Reviews that the MSLC puts on. Like others have said, his English is very good.  He is one of my favorite professors I have had at OSU. Highly recommend him!
He explains the information very well and really helps students' understanding.

He is the course coordinator, so the its important to attend the lectures. He explains the material pretty well and goes over a multitude of problems. Not my favorite teacher, but good at what he does. Don't be put off by the name! Has a British accent and easy to understand.

Teaches out of book, has british accent but for most part is understandable. Will throw in a Chinese culture lesson or rant on about math nerd stuff every so often. Will also tell you if you haven't mastered your basic algebra concept, "you should GO HOME."

I really enjoyed this class and thought he was a really good and funny teacher.  He made this class very interesting and had a lot of business analysis.  The quizzes and midterms were also fairly easy as long as you do the homework and attend class.
Easier math class I took at OSU. Good teacher. Really funny.
It is a typical math course. He is good at relaying the information to the student.

He is the worse professor I've ever had. I once asked him to help me with a problem and he said "NO" I wouldn't recommend his class to my worse enemy. I took th same class with someone else and A'sed it.

Great prof! The class is unbelievably hard, but he tried his hardest to make sure we all understood the material. Without him I would have done much worse in the class. He is a great teacher but be prepared for Math152A in general... it is still a very hard class even with a very good teacher. I highly recommend taking the class with him

Very hard course, but Dr. Wong goes out of his way to insure that students have a chance to understand the material. Homework assigned weekly is very time consuming, but most of the time it is very interesting homework rather than a bunch of busy work.
good teacher. gets off topic sometimes but he has some funny stories. i recommend him.
Difficult class.  They say Dr. Wong is better than most upper-level math profs that teach this course.  He tries to relate to you and wants to help at least.
This guy is a great teacher and is hilarious.  He tends to move quickly so you need to come to class and pay attention.  He can be slightly tough to understand.  Overall, great guy and great teacher.
Slightly hard to understand but I got used to it quite quick.
This guy is pretty funny.  The only thing I can remember about this class is him saying "you should...go home"
Very hard to understand, and moves very fast through the sections, tests are very complicated and tricky, homework doesn't even help, i got As in all other math classes, but a bad grade in this one
Funny guy, but does move quickly.  It helps if you already know some of what he's talking about or else it's kind of hard to keep up with him.
goes way too fast
He sucks and goes way to fast.
expects too much out of his students... tests are too long, rarely enough time to finish

He's pretty cool, but this is a very challenging class. Test problems are nothing like practice and book problems. If you don't know how to do each problem on the test immediately, you won't finish in time. The doable sections get omitted from the test, it's only hard stuff you get to do.

Dr. Wong is great.  He truly enjoys teaching, and that shows in his lectures.  Do the practice tests and some suggested homework, and you should pass.  He's a great guy who is willing to help whenever he can.
Good teacher. I liked him.

Didn't use the book, because homework was not collected. Take good notes during lecture and recitation, and do the practice tests. He was extremely kind and helpful, because I had to reschedule a final because of illness. Funny at times, teaches you how to count in Chinese!
he was nice and funny at times, but I think the midterms were pretty hard, but my TA wasn't any better.  I would suggest trying to get Oman, I went to him instead and he was really awesome!
he is a really good teacher.  He made everything really clear and if you do the practice tests that they give you as well as the homework you will be fine! :)
HE'S AWESOME

The class was not that hard at all. As long as you do the homework that they assign for you to do, do practice problems and sample tests, you will be FINE! He explains everything really fast, so you have to try to keep up. A good recitation teacher will be helpful too!
he explained very clearly the concepts in lecture and always helped students out also exams aren't that hard if u study previous exams and do practice problems on the textbook
Best Algebra professor in the department. Will teach you how to count to 10 in Chinese multiple times.
He is hard, he doesnt seem to really care about ur grade, jus kinda goes through the materials from the book, nothin new, make sure u have a good TA to help u out
Best upper level prof there is.  He even makes fun of stupid calculus students.

He didn't explain some of the concepts clearly but Moy Earswarn did. Get Moy as you TA and your set. He knows his stuff and wong just gives you the basics so you can figure the rest out for yourself. Got an A in the class, just do the homework and you'll do fine!
Exams are hard. :-(
Class isnt that hard, cracks a lot of Chinese jokes.

Honestly, I did not go to lecture since the first midterm. I felt that the recitations helped me out a lot more than his lectures. Though he was funny, I felt as if he looked down on students like we were inferior to him. I still got an A- in the class thanks to my TA- VAIDY SIVARAMAN! Take him!

if you show that you are willing to try there is no reason that he will not help you. even if you dont nkow what hes talking about, the odd problems in the book are very similar to the material that is being tested on the midterm.
Problems on midterms not consistent with problems from the book by any strech of the imagination. If you are someone who passed his class with an A-or better you MUST!! be gifted.
He's rather funny, and I found him to be nice.  I really can't see him being rude though.
Math 132 is very difficult and second thing this guy sucks.  He is very rude, will not help you at all.  he sucks.  don't take his class.  you will regret after the midterms and finals.

If you want the rudest, most arrogant professor OSU has to offer he is your man.  Midterms are easy, final is impossible.  Will talk down to you and make you feel like an idiot for asking a question.  I cannot overemphasize how rude he is both in a lecture setting and one on one during office hours.
Best professor I've had in 4 years

horrible professor!  He does a lot of examples but does not explain them at all, making them pointless.  He also treats the class as if they are in first grade again.  He WILL NOT help you if you're having trouble.  DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!
very confusing, and always gets off the subject.. i always found myself teaching myself from the book or going to the tutor room and i am usually an A math student
Very Clear, makes the work easy. Nice guy, funny too.
Good teacher.  Really makes you understand the material.
I don't know what he's like outside of class, but he was nice about letting me make up a midterm that I had to miss.

Made material easy to understand, great lecturer, but as a person, horrible.. he encourages us to ask questions but whenever I did, he would yell at me in front of the class, & was very rude to me during office hours. Not a very nice guy..
