I hate this class.  I dropped from the 150's series to 130's because I thought it would be easier and they completely changed the material to the same stuff that's in the 150's.

He sometimes made lectures more amusing than most others I have had, but after missing several days and needing an extension on the midterm, he was very inconsiderate and rude about the situation.  His homework policy is horrible.
Gets off subject a lot...homework is turned in for a grade...class is never let out early...knows what he is talking about
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Alexander is highly regarded by many students for his clear and engaging teaching style, enthusiasm for mathematics, and ability to make complex topics accessible. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow due to messy handwriting and disorganization, and some students find his teaching methods less effective without supplementary resources.
summary_comment_short: Professor Alexander is highly regarded for his clarity and enthusiasm in teaching, making complex topics accessible and engaging. However, some students find his lectures and handwriting challenging, and prefer to rely on textbooks and external resources.

Ratings.comment: Sam Alexander is a great professor.  He has an "interesting" accentmanner of speaking, and doesn't seem to care about his appearance, but he really gets the point across, and seems to enjoy teaching.  His homework can be a bit tediousrepetitive, but it really helped for the exams.  I would recommend him to anyone.

Class was very easy if you have taken calc 3 before, as about half of the class had.  The linear algebra and Differential equations parts were also very easy to pick up. Fourier analysis gets confusing quickly, but it is easy to memorize the formulas and when to use them. easiest college math course yet. (written by an engineer)

Out of all my math professors at OSU, he is hands down the best. I didn't pick up the book once the semester because of his resounding clarity when teaching. Also, he is so easy to listen to unlike other professors where it is a struggle to keep awake.

Very funny and witty professor who is clearly in love with math. Very funny in an odd way but actually a great teacher. Class is pretty easy but the lack of a curve makes getting an A fairly difficult.. Overall a good teacher and very entertaining. Didn't open the book once all semester

He is not a good teacher. He has never completed a problem in the entire semester. He writes all over the board and it gets extremely confusing. As one of the previous students suggested, I would buy the book and ditch the class. He was a completely useless teacher. If you can get away with taking a math class without him, do it.

He knows his math, and gives good definitions. But, his handwriting is messy and he is not organized. He is not helpful when teaching the material, and I had to teach myself from the textbook and online resources. Also, he doesn't help with going over tests, he doesn't want to give back points, when you should get points back because he is lazy.

His lectures are pointless. He uses big words and makes you feel like you are an idiot. He has good intentions but it doesn't come across. Each lecture he messes up and gets confused himself. The class is constantly correcting him. I had to learn straight from the book. If you looking for a class to learn from this is not it. Find another teacher.
Class material was difficult. Teacher was very enthusiastic about material, and willing to help when material is not clear.
He is very upbeat and funny.  The class material was very hard, but he was eager to teach.
Very young and upbeat! Extremely enthusiastic. Never let's the class get boring!
Can't even be 25 years old, very upbeat and enjoyable to listen to..speaks like a college kid

summary_comment: Professor Jain is well-versed in his subject matter and provides thorough information. However, his tests are notably challenging, and the class is generally considered difficult. Students find him helpful during office hours but note that his teaching style and exam difficulty set his class apart.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jain is knowledgeable and informative in his subject matter, but his tests are notably challenging. The class is inherently difficult, though students find his office hours helpful for clarification.

Ratings.comment: He knows the subject well and is informative. Tests are very tough, especially compared to other teachers that have the same class
Not that great of a teacher, he's helpful if you go to his office hours but you've got to understand that the class is just plain hard

summary_comment: Professor Gibbons, or rather Aliska, is perceived as inconsistent in her teaching quality. While some students found her approachable and helpful outside of class, many complained about her lack of clear explanations, frequent errors during demonstrations, and unhelpful recitations. Her teaching style and ability to convey complex concepts were widely criticized.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gibbons, or rather Aliska, struggles significantly with explaining concepts clearly and often lacks depth in her lectures. Students find her approach unhelpful and her demonstrations frequently incorrect, though some note she is approachable outside of class and occasionally brings treats.

Ratings.comment: She doesn't explain anything properly, she assumes everyone understands and she does this thing where she makes these singing noises and sometimes she doesn't even know what she's talking about
I failed precalc twice and withdrawled once, my fourth time taking it i finally found a professor who could explain to me what was going on. Excellent. PS she teaches in FL now

I felt as if she could use more experience teaching the subject matter.  The lectures had focus but lacked in depth and thorough explanation sometimes.  Outside of that, she was very helpful and approachable for all questions.  She made a lot of her personal time available to help students with problems.

Aliska is very nice and has an upbeat attitude. That is about it on the plus-side for her. Many times when she was demonstrating problems, she would make the errors that she was trying to help us avoid doing and demonstrate the problem incorrectly. Oh, she did bring cookies a few time so if you're into that sort of thing definitely take her class.

Aliska's recitations lacked focus and clarity, and she wasn't very approachable.  Also, she sometimes demonstrated problems incorrectly. If you are late to class or miss a recitation (even for a valid reason), she can be a bear.  Additionally, homework must be turned in BEFORE class starts or it won't be accepted/will be marked off as late.
No Comments

Not actually a professor, the TA.  A complete idiot that did not know how to teach. Would move on if didn't know how to answer questions that we asked. Absolutely not helpful. I advise switching recitations as to avoid her.

summary_comment: Professor Warren is a highly intelligent and effective lecturer, known for his challenging exams and homework, which are curved based on class performance. However, his rapid pace and poor handwriting can make his lectures difficult to follow, especially for students who are not strong in the subject or have difficulty keeping up. Despite these challenges, many students find his expertise valuable and recommend his course, particularly noting his willingness to help and provide detailed explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Warren is a highly intelligent and knowledgeable instructor, known for his fast-paced lectures and challenging assignments, which are curved for better performance. However, his teaching style may be overwhelming for students who struggle to keep up, and some find his handwriting difficult to read.

Ratings.comment: He teaches extremely fast. The first class of the semester I was completely lost until a few classes later, I was beginning to get a hang of it. His questions for homework and exams are significantly more challenging than most other math professors but the grades are curved based on the class results. As long as you understand the material,you fine

He is really smart. However, there is one fatal problem with him: his handwriting is really UGLY!!! Also, his pace is kind of TOO FAST! If u are not that smart or have trouble on focusing, u should go to another instructor's section.

He is a nice guy but an awful teacher. This was my first actuarial science class I took and he made me want to change my major. Advice to underclassmen: Take this class with Rick Evans if you want to learn anything/if you are preparing for the FM exam. if Warren's class is the only one open wait until next semester to take with Evans, trust me.
No doubt that he is a genius in OSU. Even though his course is not so easy but his course is highly recommended.

He is the kind of guy that would be a good teacher for genius, but not for a moderate student who wants to learn things proceed in ordered steps. He talks fast and writes on the board very fast. Make sure to keep pace with him or you will quickly fall behind. A lot of people dropped. Consider if you will like his personal style before you take him.

Does not show to his office hrs.  speed of lecture is fast to say the least.  The drop rate was high nothing i had ever seen.  if this is your first probability good luck!  still an all around nice guy...
Great Lecturer, wait until you check out his personal website!
He's amazing and answers any questions, he even emailed me a whole explanation for one question I had.

Dan is awesome. His lecture might be speedy, but he explains everything clearly if you have questions after class. As long as you follow up the notes in class, do some practice problems in the ASM manual, you will be fine. Class materials are well-organized and exams are 10 mcs, which are not too hard. Highly recommemd his class.

Had him for 532 as well. His teaching style doesn't work well with all students. He moves thru his lectures very quickly. Keep up. But, he is interested in helping his students learn the material more than getting a good grade. Students who get a B with Warren usually know the material better than students who get As with anyone else.

It's a hard class but if you spend a decent amount of time studying, doing homework, and reviewing, it's not difficult to get an A, mainly because he has a policy where if your final is better than your worst midterm, then your worst midterm grade is replaced by what you got on the final. Really friendly and knowledgeable. Great course website
No comment
Great professor all around.

I really did not like Dr. Warren's teaching style. I had him for Calc II and discrete math. He goes at a pace so fast that only math geniuses will keep up. Makes mistakes in the notes which sometimes weren't corrected til AFTER I studied them. Very hard tests. Funny guy, likeable, but hard.
GREAT TEACHER! As soon as you get used to his teaching style/tests, you will absolutely love him. He is very fair and knows a lot about probability. Very friendly. Highly recommended!

Dr. Warren is a great professor. I would highly recommend taking is class. His tests aren't easy (and there is no partial credit), but there are three midterms and he drops the lowest. I got out of taking the final because I had enough points for an A. Pay attention to the types of problems he does in class, they tend to show up on the tests.
AWESOME TEACHER.  Doctor Warren was unbelievably helpful and explained things very well.  VERY FAIR GRADER- gave you lots of points for trying.  One of my favorite math teachers by far!

Having taken Math 151, 152, 153, 254, 568, and Math 530, this has been the best math professor I have had.  Dan Warren knows his stuff and is EXTREMELY helpful.  His office hours were golden hours.  His hair is really long too, and he always cracked a random joke here or there.  If all else fails, DRAW A TREE!

By far the best math professor I've ever had at OSU. Sure, the material is hard, but he's EXCELLENT at clarifying it and is so helpful during office hours. Plus, he's an extremely fair grader... he'll give you half credit for making a valiant effort even if it's completely wrong. Also, he has cool hair.
Is really helpful and really clear. Will do his best to make sure students are understanding the material. Exams try to cover all of the material but he doesn't grade them too hard.

Dr. Warren is a really nice guy but he moves very quickly through material. Once you get used to his style of teaching you'll do fine. If you have any questions go to office hours. he is very helpful and explains things well
Cool teacher, explains everything in good detail. I would recommend him to others. He does go fast on material.

Dr. Warren is really hot. Really really hot. That aside, he is somewhat tough, but not terrible enough to warrant avoiding. He speaks english coherently and fluently (which is more than I can say about a lot of math profs at osu), but he tends to move rather quickly on the board in lecture. ATTEND ALL LECTURES and write quickly, and you'll do fine.

he looks like daniel fairday from LOST. he is really nice and helpful and pretty good at explaining the material. i had an A/B in the class until i took the final which was impossible and which i failed. but HE is hysterical and makes going to class actually bearable
Lectures are extremely helpful with very good examples
coolest professor in math 152. very helpful
Very helpful with the topics if you attend class. Found it easier than 151 just because he was teaching. Glad I got him.
awesome professor.

This guy is great at explaining things. When I went to office hours, I went from not knowing anything about the material to understanding it very well. I ended up with an A-, but I should have done better.
REALLY tough. But he's really good if you can follow along.
Extremely difficult, but very helpful

One of the best professors I have ever had at Ohio State. Teaches the material straight forward, no BS; gives you plenty of examples; is extremely helpful during his office hours. This class is for those who like math and those who hate it. Why? Because you will actually learn. And go to class! Missing one day will kill you.

Very clear, laid back guy.  Definitely would recommend him. He lets you know exactly what he expects you to know. Homework is definitely not busy work, only a few  problems but they are sometimes difficult.

Warren is the man! This class is NOT easy but he is very clear and does LOTS of examples. He'll work with you and help you out, not to mention he's a good guy. If you have to take this class, take it with Warren.

best math professor i've had. explains things really well and really cares about helping students. exams are long, but fairly straight forward. very little homework assigned, sometimes difficult but he'll help after class or office hours. usually has 1 concept related question on each exam, but others are similar to examples in notes. great prof!

He is a very good teacher.  His homework can be annoyingly tough at times, but the material in general isn't too bad.  The exams can be kind've tough but are fair and do-able if you know the material.  I would definitely take him again.
understandable but his homeworks and exams were impossible;to learn the subject take him; to get a good grade...think again.
Great guy, great teacher. He was a great teacher who cared, his tests are kinda hard but fair not a lot of surprises, take him if you can. And hes not forign so no understanding problems

Very Cool guy that really wants you to understand.  He understands students pretty well, and his tests are exactly what he wants you to know.  He's not one of those guys that likes you to get low grades and then curves.

I first saw this guy and thought he was the guy that cleaned the chalkboards. He doesn't look like a person that would teach math. Despite that, he was a great math teacher. He spoke clearly and was very good at explaining the material. The test were ridiculous however. I had a B average on the 3 midterms and an F on the final, I passed with a B.
He is very good tacher ; however his exams are so long and you cann't finish them by the given time
One of the best math teachers I've ever worked with.  I didn't quite know what to think when I first saw him, but I would highly recommend his class to anyone.
very good teacher
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Sun is widely regarded as ineffective and unhelpful, with students consistently advising against taking his classes. He is described as vague, unengaging, and fails to provide meaningful assistance or clarification. Students recommend avoiding his classes entirely due to his teaching methods, which involve merely copying content from textbooks without offering practical examples or answering questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sun is widely regarded as ineffective and unhelpful, failing to provide meaningful assistance or clarification during lectures, which often consist of verbatim readings from textbooks. Students strongly advise avoiding his classes due to his teaching methods and the difficulty of self-studying the material.

Ratings.comment: She is very vague with everything and doesn't help students when they ask for help. Avoid her.

I totally agree with it! He is sooooo bad! I taken his math class one week, however, I dropped it! I mean, I would like study by myself rather than he teach because all of things in our books! so terrible!
He's the worst. Ever. Please do not take this class! You cannot learn anything in this class. Do what you can do to avoid him.

Don't even bother going to lectures. He literally reads the examples out of the book word for word and number for number. You can do it yourself on your own time. The class and exams were easy but I taught myself out of the book. If you struggle with math, do not take Dr. Sun's class: you won't learn much.

After several years as an engineering student forced to be associated with professor suited more to engineering work than engineering, its safe to say that this is the worst instructor I've had. Won't answer questions. Writes the book word for word on the board, that's his entire "lecturing." Avoid him or suffer.

Wei Sun is hands down the worst instructor I have ever had at any education level. He refuses to do examples or do anything besides copy proofs that do not help with the ridiculously hard HW, quizzes, and exams directly out of the book. Do everything you can to avoid taking a class with him.
He reads out of the textbook every class. Overall, easy class but going to the lectures were unbearably boring. I did not think he clarified the material well.

This man is awful at teacher. He does not put example on the board, cannot answer questions, talks into the board. By all means do not take a class taught by this man as he is truly the type of professor I dread learning from. It doesn't help that he fails to look at the hw he assigns as assignments can take hours to comprehend let alone complete

Calc was a challenge for me, but I did better upon moving to a different section, so its not just that I suck at it. Prof essentially teaches from the textbook word-for-word in an extremely thick accent. Would not recommend. LANGUAGE BARRIER.
this TA is why I got the awesome grade I did, he did problems that would be on the midterm and final! awesome guy and pretty funny

NOT a good TA.  He just repeats the same stuff from lecture and does random examples from the book, but doesn't take questions from students on specific problems or issues we have.  Really hard to understand.  Did not help prepare very well for the ridiculously hard exams.

summary_comment: Professor Baker is highly regarded for his deep knowledge of the subject and his willingness to help students, offering extensive resources and office hours. However, his classes are known to be challenging, with demanding homework assignments that often take up significant study time. Despite the difficulty, students find that the material is well-covered and that exams tend to be fair and easier than the homework.
summary_comment_short: Professor Baker is known for his deep knowledge of the subject matter and his willingness to help students, offering extensive support through office hours, additional resources, and detailed explanations. However, his classes are challenging, particularly due to the extensive and difficult homework assignments and a textbook that lacks examples, leading to a steep learning curve.

Ratings.comment: I don't even have this man as my professor but he has written the most atrocious textbook that most of the 2415 classes use. In the book steps are skipped, math concepts are explained in conversational english, notation is changed WITHIN THE SAME EXAMPLE, and poor formatting is used. Oh yeah, also, HOMEWORK IS ASSIGNED FROM THE BOOK.

Dr. Baker is great at explaining things and always willing to help. He uses his own textbook which has 1 example per chapter. I really hate it when professors think that their class is the most important in the world. This class was required for my major (Mech Engineering). He makes homework and tests immensely difficult unnecessarily.

Dr. Baker's class was odd compared to many others. Homework is rather substantial, and takes a lot of time. If you can do the homework, you will be fine on the exams. He is a very good lecturer, and is very helpful one on one. I have used content from this class in other classes, and I knew it really well. Great teacher!

He's knows his material extremely well. He offers office hours, tutors, post notes online, screencasts some homework solutions, and will literally do anything to help students succeed. His homeworks are very long and hard but you do learn the material well from them.

Dr Baker is an abstract thinker and he teaches thus. The book is his own creation and has some faults--mostly a lack of examples (only 1 per section). Baker makes his class seem harder than he grades. The material is hard, the homework is a death sentences, the quizzes are a pain and he's picky about 'em. But the exams are fair and easy.

Dr. Baker is the best professor I have ever had. GO to office hours. He will learn your name and is very willing to help out. His class is not easy. The homework is much harder than the exams but if you struggle through the homework each week, the exams will be easy. I have learned more from this class than I have in any other class I have taken.

Dr Baker is very helpful in office hours, however, his homeworks are very difficult and I would spend roughly 15 hours a week on homework. Also, the only examples you will get from him are those in lecture-which are exactly the problems in his book. This class is taught in an interesting manner but is not suitable for people with not busy schedules

This is the best professor I have ever had! He is really passionate and knows what he is saying. Yes, the class is hard. Deal with it! If you try hard, you will get an A and know the material. Go to office hours, he will work out any problem you ask step by step!

Very different than any other math class that i have taken. Beware that that textbook he wrote himself have no examples whatsoever. So if you are used to the traditional style of math learning go for another teacher. However if you really like to understand math get his class.

Great class and a great professor. One of the best at Ohio State. He does kind of answer questions condescendingly though. Yes, his book really only goes in depth on one example per concept, but I didn't find it hard to apply that to other problems. Don't expect things to get any easier. Also, TAKE ADVANTAGE of the videos he posts on Carmen.

Baker is a teacher like no other. He redefines the way math was taught and cuts out theoretical stuff that any science or engineering major does not care about or need to know. His class is very difficult and it will make no sense until a "light bulb moment." He's very forthcoming about it and the class is very fair. Great teacher to have for 415.

Baker is easily one of the best professors I've had so far. The material can be hard, but if you're willing to put the work into it, he will make sure that you learn your stuff. I really liked how he taught the class in a way that  engineers will actually use. After taking the course, I think every math/science class should be taught in this way.
The worst class I've taken. The book that he wrote himself doesn't have enough examples and answers to show you where your mistakes are.

Text book is horrible. Many typos and few examples.  Also, doesn't cover a lot of basic diff eq techniques. I found his lecture style annoying too. He likes to talk about how little you seem to know. The most "formulaic" math class Ive ever taken also.  Because he gives so few examples, his test are regenerations of what you learn in class.
He is easy take this class.

Great sense of humor, but the class is absolutely impossible! The textbook, which he wrote, is confusingly worded and the examples aren't clear, making homework impossible. He lectures straight from the book, so you're screwed if you don't understand it. My TA was absolutely useless, too. She couldn't even do the homework problems.

Awful teacher. I recommend you don't take his class. He rambles about his alcoholism and wrote his own crappy, confusing book which contains no examples. If you take him, hope he isn't your TA too like with me. Go to somebody else's office hours for questions.

His class isn't easy, but if you're an engineer looking for a professor who's going to teach you what's actually useful (not proofs), he spent several years working as an engineer and teaches you stuff that is actually useful in a practical way. Very good lecturer.

Quite difficult if you aren't a math genius, especially when you get into partial diff eqs. His "lecture notes" that act as the textbook are the exact same as his lectures, so if you don't understand him then, you won't be able to go to the lecture notes for help. Terrible questions (one answer was "Ha! Ha!"). Pretty good lecturer, though. Amusing.

An absolutely fantastic instructor. I agree with other comments that he does not coddle his students but he is genuinely very interested in helping students learn and actually understand diff. eqns. If you have problems, just ask him for help and he will go out of his way to make sure you understand the concepts.

Baker in general is a really funny guy, and pretty helpful. I felt the class was pretty easy, the midterms were just a direct copy of his notes in class, while the final was tad harder but not by much. The homework is way harder than his test so don't worry too much if you struggle with them.

Baker is one of the most interesting teachers I've had, but his notes are a little unclear, and he needs to addmore problems the solutions to his problems so student can correct the errors in their thought process.
I like the direction the course is going, but it is far from complete. The class notes are horrible, in regards to both cotent and problems.

Greg Baker is Awesome!  If you are interested in actually learning diff. eqs and their real world applications, take 415 with Baker.  He does not coddle his students, he will only help those willing to work... Amazing class though.

I started off the class not giving him a chance. His first lecture dealt with how hard the class was going to be and if we didn't keep up we would not do well. He is a brilliant man though, and after completing the course, I believe every math/science class should be taught in this manner. If you want to actually learn diffeq, take his course.

He starts class by wasting 15 minutes telling you how great of a teacher he is and how awesome his course is going to make you.  He doesn't you his book, only 'class notes' which is a more confusing version of what he writes on the board.  He is condescending when you ask questions and says its your problem if you don't understand.
This class was taught unconventionally relative to calculus classes at osu, but it was interesting. Don't take it if you don't need it for your major unless you really love math.

I guess you complain about him just because you could not get a good grade due to lack of explaination and testing in the homework. If you take the class and want to do research on it, it is most important to make sure you know how to write interpretation.
Gives 50% weightage on report presentation in "Maths" course. Some times you think you are in a humanity class.

Horrible Teacher! Try to avoid this teacher as far as possible. Expects you to guess his expectations. If you can guess he will assign bonus marks!! Mocks at simple questions. Does not foster an environment of learning.

I guess I can never find a better professor than him. He has been my PhD advisor for 2 years, always willing to help and his class is easy to follow. I think I am very lucky to have him as my professor and PhD advisor.
Breaks the mold as a math prof--I love his out of the box thinking on things, one of the few profs on campus that I could talk seriously about getting help from.

Good lecturer, but all theory and proofs.  Extremely smart guy, gets annoyed with mediocre undergrads like me.  Curve kind of sucks because almost half of the class is graduate engineering students who have almost all already taken Linear Algebra.

The tests were waited EXTREEMELY heavily so you had to make sure to know all teh material and never make a mistake on the tests. He was very nice though. He does get a bit irritated when you ask him too many questions and once her cursed at me.
No Comments
No Comments
A little absent-minded, but enthusiastic and intriguing teaching style. charm.

summary_comment: Professor Keith Edwards is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and ability to simplify complex mathematical concepts. Students consistently praise his dedication, humor, and effectiveness in helping them understand math, often noting significant improvements in their understanding within a short period. His approachable nature and genuine care for his students' success make him one of the best teachers at the institution.
summary_comment_short: Professor Keith Edwards is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, consistently praised by students for his ability to simplify complex concepts and make learning enjoyable. Students frequently highlight his dedication, patience, and effectiveness in helping them understand mathematics, often achieving better results under his guidance than with other instructors.

Ratings.comment: He is not even officially teaching anymore and he still comes to campus to teach trig to those of us who had him last year for college algebra.  Best teacher ever!
Helped me understand math much more clear in a week than my actual instructor has done all year.

You will never find a better professor than Keith Edwards. I have struggled my whole life with math and he is great at breaking it down and making it much simpler to understand. I put attendance as mandatory, but this is just my opinion on the class. Keith himself is super laid back about it. Hands down, best teacher I have ever had.

I have taken this class multiple times, but I never got the C- I needed to pass. Keith has been the most honest, fair, and hilarious professor I've ever had. because of him, I went from failing mostly everything in this class, to getting an A on the first exam. Honestly he is the best professor I've ever had.
The best Math teacher at tOSU

Keith was amazing! He really cares about his students and wants them to do well. He goes out of his way to make sure we are getting the problems. He never got frustrated when he had to repeat explaining a problem over and over again! I wish he taught Math 1149 :( You're lucky if you have him as your 1075, or 1148 TA! 5 stars for this guy!!

Keith is an awesome teacher.  Before having him for a teacher, I really struggled with math.  His class is an easy A.  He tutored me through Math1075 and I transferred to OSU just to have him as my TA for Math1148.  He's the GREATEST!  You won't even need to buy the book; just the access code which will save you $$.

KEITH IS THE BEST! Had him my first semester of college math and now refuse to take a math class he's not a TA for. Forget going to lectures, you won't need to with Keith. Genuinely cares about his students and makes math fun and interesting! If you have the option, get in his class.

If you don't take Keith, you're torturing yourself. BY FAR the most amazing math teacher I've ever had (which says a lot). Math has always been my worst subject but his compassion and desire for his students success makes it easy to learn and feel confident. Keith- if you're reading this- THANK YOU!!
You will understand math if you take it with Keith!

Keith is THE BEST TEACHER EVER. He is constantly working after class to give you notes before you come into class, he gives practice quizzes and practice exams. Math isn't my thing, but he makes everything SOO easy. He explains, helps and he is so open and funny. BEST TEACHER EVER, hands down

Keith is the BEST Math teacher I've ever had. I've failed this class 3 times prior, no joke. I'm now not only passing but I'm getting an A. Explains complex concepts in simple terms&really wants everyone to succeed. I hate math but really enjoy his class...I'd take Calculus for fun if he taught it. Funny&tells great stories! Cannot recommend enough

Keith is by far the best math teacher I have ever had. Math is absolutely not my thing, but he presented the material in a way that I could understand, and without him I would not have made it through this class. He is super funny, cares deeply about his students, and is an awesome teacher. Consider yourself very lucky if you get him!

Mr. Edwards is one of my favorite Professors.   The first time I took a class from him I didn't quite get his humor.  He was completely open to that and solidified my respect for him deeply.  I appreciate his teaching style and understand math better then I thought possible.  I highly recommend him as a Professor!
I've never understood math until now. He explains everything in such an understandable way that isn't bogged down with heavy math terms.

He is a phenomenal professor.  What I most admire is his passion for both math & teaching.  He will break the material down to the fundamental principles if you have trouble remembering previous material.   His lectures are very clear, well-organized, and enjoyable for those of you (like me) that are not good at math!  I passed Math1075 with a B.

He is a great teacher. He helps you whenever you need it no matter what math class you are taking. He's generous with his time. It does not matter as long as he can help. Keith is very resourceful as well.

Honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. I hate math, but loved going to his class. He is hilarious and knows how to teach math in a way you will understand it. He is always willing to help students and truly wants to see his class succeed. Go to class, it's worth it- especially for the help and the laughs!

GREAT teacher! helps you in the most basic way which makes the material really easy to learn! I didn't have him as my TA for 1148, but went to his reviews and got taught the "right" way! Def recommend him!
Keith was the BEST professor I've ever had at Ohio State!!! Without his help I would not have passed math! He's always available and genuinely cares about his students! Great teacher!!!!
best math professor I've ever had

Great! Great! Great! There is no reason to not get an A in this class as long as you pay attention and do the work. He teaches so well to where you understand every lesson. I wish I could keep him for the rest of my math classes.
Best math teacher ever. Clear about the topics but not boring. Willing to help you anytime you need it. highly recommend. Wish he taught 1148.

Keith is awesome! I switched into his class because he had good reviews on here and I'm so glad I switched into his class! I hated math prior to his class. But he teaches it in a way youll be able understand. Im taking him again. Hes awesome! And hes hilarious. As long as you go to class and get tutored on what you don't understand, youll get an A!
Keith is the best teacher. I have ever had. Really down to earth guy. Will help you if you are willing to put the effort.

AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. Take him no questions asked! hes the best math teacher ive ever had in my LIFE this is the second time of me taking this class. I bombed my last 1075 class bc my recitation instructor was god awful, But KEITH IS REMARKABLE! TAKE HIM! never thought i'd get an A in this class without ever going to lecture (not recommended)
Keith was the bomb .com!! for real!! he made math so easy for me at OSU when math wasn't my best subject!!

Keith is so awesome. I struggle with math and generally do not do well in math classes. He explains things so you can really follow along and understand. He wants students to succeed and will do whatever he can to help you. He has a great sense of humor and is easy to talk to. My exam grades improved exponentially from midterm 1-3. He is the best!

I think he thought he was 18. He'd blast terrible music super loud before class, try to be funny, try to hard to act cool. A bit condescending in emails and passive aggressive about attendance. Honestly the only reason people like him is because he gives sample midterms and goes over them the day of. They usually look exactly like the tests.

I have always struggled to understand math. It has been a difficult subject since high school. He teaches the class so you can understand it and I am so glad that I started in that class. If I didnt get it in the class or something went past me in the class, I come to his recitation and he would explain it in a way where any person can understand.

I hate math. Always have due to most of the math teachers I had sucked. However Keith is one of the best teachers I haver ever had. He took a subject I always have stuggled with and was able to conve the information to where I could understand it. I have never earned anything higher then a D in my prior math classes but now I am sitting on an A going into the finial two weeks.

He is the best TA I've ever had! He didn't have you do any homework, instead he went over all the info from lecture in more depth to better understand it. But if your not there then you don't get credit for the homework!  I never went to a single lecture after the first week since he retaught the info better than the professor.
Keith is an amazing TA. He prepares you so well for your Exams it's not even funny. I wish i had him as a math teacher my whole life, i would have got straight A's all the time.
He was the best TA I could have had.

He is an awesome math professor probably one of the best math teachers I have had in my life. He makes everything crystal clear and super easy so the only way you could do bad in this class is literally by doing nothing.

Keith is the coolest TA ever. In addition to explaining everything in the simplest terms  and making sure you know 100% of the material you'll be tested on, he's just an all around awesome person to know. He tells great stories and cares about his students as if you're his family. You'll never meet a better guy or teacher.

Kieth is a great guy and an excellent instructor. He is one of the most helpful professors I've come across. Cuts through the nonsense of the math textbooks and delivers the information to you as it will be on exams. As long as you don't act like a jerk, Kieth will like you and you'll thoroughly enjoy having Kieth as an instructor.
BEST TA I have ever had in my life. Knows so much about math, he is so smart and helpful. He makes math look SOO easy, he goes above and beyond to help his students! Hes GREAT. take it with him

AWESOME TA! Not only is he one of the most caring, outgoing, and funny teachers, he actually knows how to teach! He went above and beyond by providing extra office hours, going over old exams, and reteaching lessons that the professor didn't teach clearly. He makes getting an A in the class very obtainable.

Had for Math 148,decided to have again. Extra office hours outside of class,open to schedule appointments w.students-has more office hours than any usual TA. Keith prepares students for exams and sends practice exams he makes up out. Teaches straight forward, identifies background knowledge needed. Must be willing to put in effort. Funny dude!!!

Keith is a great teacher, one of the best Math TA's I have ever had. I would recommend him for any student! He has more office hours than any usual TA and is willing to schedule appointments  with students who need extra help that don't fit office hours.
Keiths is so far the best TA i have ever had for math and he was really helpful. if you have the opportunity to take him as either a lecturer or TA please go for it

summary_comment: Professor Ravindran is highly regarded for his willingness to help students and his ability to make complex topics accessible and entertaining. While some students found his pace challenging and noted occasional mistakes, many praised his knowledge and his humor, recommending his classes despite the difficulties.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ravindran is highly regarded for his willingness to help students and his ability to make complex topics accessible and entertaining. While some found his lectures fast-paced and occasionally confusing, many appreciated his thorough explanations and his approachable nature, leading to positive overall evaluations of his teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: Always willing to help. Have learned a lot from him.

Hari was such a bae! I usually am okay about math but he made it entertaining and thoroughly explained the concepts well. I took AP calc in high school and he covered pretty much the same material so it was not all that hard! He also let us out early most days. Highly recommend and would definitely take him again!

I went to every lecture and would recommend going. He does problems, and explains the theory behind each section. He is pretty fun, but gets flustered and goes fast, and ends up messing up some of the problems. He does not show every step, so if you do not go to class, expect to ask your TA or spend some time at the MSLC.

His accent was easy to understand, so no problems there. He'd often get flustered with the problems he had up on the board, which made lectures a tad boring. He also has a bit of a temper if people pack up early or talk during class. Overall, he was a good professor who taught well.

I did not find his accent to be a problem at all. The lectures are posted online, but I would suggest that you go to class anyway. There are 3 midterms and a final. There are about 13 online MML homeworks and about about 11 quizzes in which one of each gets dropped. There is additional book homework that is not graded but is helpful for the exam.

Decent professor. His English is pretty good but he talks at the speed of light. You probably don't have a choice in taking his classes or not since they're required for all science majors, but as long as you pay attention and do the work, you'll be okay.

Hari is thoroughly uninterested in teaching, but he's knowledgeable and willing to help if asked. He talks extremely fast and can be hard to follow (accent is fine), but the real learning happens with your TAs (Sam Henke is a god among men). Hari is also hilarious. However, DO NOT take 2162. Hardest class I've ever taken (reg. calc 2/3 works fine).

Loved the online notes--access on Carmen at any time. He's really funny and nice. Tests had unexpected curveball and times and points were taken off harshly. Other than that, do the homework, pay attention in lecture, and practice. I had already taken calc before so it was a very easy A.
This class was very difficult, and having an okay teacher makes it even more difficult.  While Hari isn't necessarily a bad teacher, I wish I had had a better teacher teaching this course.
Not an easy class but the professor breaks in down in lectures so its easier to understand. Go to class and recitations! Professor is very kind and funny so makes lectures easy to sit through.
Homework does not count for points but that does not mean you should not do it. Without practice, the tests are near impossible, but if you put in the time and effort you can do really well.

Hari is a super nice guy, but his classes are very tough. Most of his tests are four or five questions and 130 points. His TAs give partial credit, which is a grade saver. However, he moves fast and sometimes teaches out of a different textbook. The other calculus classes do online activities, while we used book and paper. Go to class!

Hari explains everything in lecture really well and explains why each step is taken in example problems. His notes are his lectures and are very helpful. He tells you exactly what to expect on each exam which helps when preparing. His exams aren't too bad just make sure you have a good grasp on each concept being tested.

The class will be one of the hardest you take your first year and the material is tough, but Professor Ravindran does a good job explaining the material. He is pretty funny in class, but generally just reads off the notes he postsd online. I would definitely recommend doing lots of practice problems, especially the "Why or Why Not?" problems.

All his lecture is in the notes. But you'll need a textbook for your homework. You have quiz almost every week. Test is not really difficult but it's hard to get a good grade when you miss the classes.

His teaching style is pretty much here are the notes, then he does practice problems. The homework is bookwork, not mymathlab. His tests are tough but he tells you what to expect so do plenty of practice problems.

Hari is one of the best professors I've had at OSU.  He makes lots of jokes during lecture and really makes the class fun.  He is always willing to take time to help explain homework problems. I would strongly recommend having Hari as a professor.

summary_comment: Professor Goldwyn is highly regarded for his clear teaching style and ability to make complex concepts accessible, particularly beneficial for students in biology-focused calculus courses. He offers extensive support through office hours and extra credit opportunities, and his exams and quizzes are generally fair and based on the material covered in lectures. While his classes can be straightforward, they effectively prepare students for assessments with reasonable expectations and clear explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Goldwyn is highly regarded for his clear teaching methods and willingness to help students, making the course accessible even for challenging topics like Calculus for Biology. Students appreciate his detailed explanations, extra credit opportunities, and ability to tie concepts into biology, though some found the final exam more difficult than anticipated.

Ratings.comment: I took Calculus for Biology with him and while the regular Calc classes were struggling, we were doing amazing because he taught us clearly, graded easily, and offered a lot of extra credit. Go in for office hours, he's a really cool guy and wants to help. He doesn't want to make you hate Calculus, he told my class. Best teacher I've had at OSU!!

Easy class and great teacher. Good at explaining and easy quizzes and exams. He is also a little hot. I'm not sure if it was just me who thought this was easy. Out of 10 quizzes and 3 exams, there was 1 thing I didn't finish first so I clearly understood the material.
Good professor, recitation is key! I barely studied and flew through the course. He's very helpful in office hours as well.

Pretty straightforward class. Tries his best to tie material into Biology, and does a solid job at it. Quizzes, homework, and exams are fair, nothing too crazy. He is willing to help outside of class if needed.

Josh is a soooo good professor! He is willing to help students outside the class. His lecture is normal but sometimes he make some jokes which become more interesting . He explained the concept very detailed. The test is based on the lecture contents. Sometimes there is a bonus  for exam. Wish to take his course in the future!

He understands what he is teaching very well and takes plenty of time to explain every topic. He sometimes doesn't understand what a student is asking, but this is counteracted by his clarity on the material. He gave small extra credit opportunities on each exam, but the final was harder than expected.

Test averages are high, do not expect a curve in the class. Extra credit (an additional 3-5% of your test grade) was offered after each midterm. Went into the final with an 88.9% overall grade in the class, got a 79% on the final and ended up with a B (bummer). The final was harder than we expected, prepare like crazy for it. Quizzes are reasonable

His class wasn't anything special, but it was straightforward enough. Averages on exams were relatively high, he gave extra credit, and  I feel like I have a fair understanding of the material. It was boring, but I have no complaints.

summary_comment: Professor Frick is known for her challenging exams and willingness to provide extra credit, though her teaching style varies widely among students. Some find her classes straightforward with fair assessments, while others report that her lectures are often unhelpful and confusing, especially towards the end of the course. Overall, her effectiveness as a teacher is highly dependent on the student's prior knowledge and ability to seek additional resources outside of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Frick is known for her challenging exams and willingness to provide extra credit, though her lectures are often described as difficult to follow and not particularly helpful for learning the material. Students generally find her approach to teaching to be less effective, with many preferring alternative resources or other instructors for clarity.

Ratings.comment: That's perfectly normal strategy to discourage / encourage activity in your favor. Manipulation would be a whale coming in and market or below market selling like 5000+ ETH knowing the support is paper thin, tanking the price and encouraging a fire sale from the weak hands, and tripling his stack on the recovery.

She was great. She actually taught the class rather than standing there and getting paid like lots of professors at the college level. She was a fair test maker and grader. The entire course was very simple, if you actually went to class. (key there) I would love to take another one of her classes, best professor I've seen for the math department i
She was nice, easy class if you do the work, until last chapter about eigen values the rest was simple.

Very reasonable professor. Her exams were always very fair and she was willing to help during office hours. Gave out a lot of extra credit on midterms for being able to reproduce proofs on them. The class was very easy until the last three weeks or so, then it became very difficult. Great math class, especially for engineers.

Exams very hard- but she was a very cool prof- most the class failed the first midterm but she gave us a easy 2nd midterm that the majority aced which brought the grades up significantly- material is boring but read it anyone and GO TO you ta's office hrs ull need it if differential equations arent ur world
Worst professor I ever had. Her class is horrible. Useless and boring lectures. Exams and quizes are hard. Asks random & unrelavent questions. Avoid her if possible.

If you dont already have a strong grasp of every concept covered in 161, you better find someone who can teach it to you, because Frick cannot. I litteraly found googling the topics more helpful than listening to her lectures. She spends 30 of your 48 minute lecture doing algebra on the board so you'll be lost when it comes to anything calc-related

Lectures were pretty much worthless. It seemed like she was just spewing information at us instead of actually teaching or explaining things.  This calc should be easier than 152, but the way it was taught was just confusing. If you have another option, take it.

I thought she was a good teacher. One problem I have had with her is that she sometimes makes mistakes on the board but someone usually sees it. If you don't understand something you can ask her and she will stop and answer your question. I managed to get a pretty decent grade in there without ever taking a calculus class before.

I'm pretty sure Fall 2006 was her first quarter teaching because she was very disorganized, all over the place, copies her notes from the book, and generally wasn't a good lecturer. Now I have her for 152A, which is a considerably smaller class, and she's much better. Overall I think she's an okay professor. She does do her best to answer questions

Decent teacher, not really a need for a book, since no homework was collected, but comes in handy.  Exams and Final was exactly like the practice exams.  Review sessions helped, since her lectures were confusing.

Terrible Professor, she bounced around all over the place with problems and always left me wondering what in the world.  Fortunately I already knew how to do 95% of what we did, and the TA for the class was very good. If you talk to her after class though she is very helpful 1 on 1, just can't lecture, she's a real sleeper too.
I hate this class and she is not the best teacher.  She's confusing and frequently flustered during class.  She uses the word "Umm" way too much.  She also copies her notes straight from the book.

summary_comment: Professor Acan is highly regarded for his availability and patient teaching style, often meeting with students after class and responding promptly to emails. While he is noted for being quiet, he effectively explains mathematical concepts and provides clear, fair quizzes that require preparation and practice.
summary_comment_short: Professor Acan is highly regarded for his availability and patience, consistently meeting with students and responding promptly to emails. He emphasizes the importance of practice and self-study for success in mathematics courses, focusing on understanding concepts rather than just procedural knowledge.

Ratings.comment: He is a very nice professor who is willing to meet with you after the class. Also, he responds to email in a constant manner. For mathematics course, besides the help of a professor, yBou have to work and practice in order to get the score you want .

Patient and frequently available for help outside of class. As an educator myself, I appreciated his efforts to teach us how math works, rather than just how to plug and chug numbers. I'd recommend this TA to other students.
He is very quiet!

TA for Math 161.02 recitation: gave fair quizzes that were doable (usually) only if you read/prepared/did the HW/etc, explained topics well when reviewing, and didn't object to taking questions from students and did his best to answer. Has a Turkish accent but he worked though this and verbal clarity was never a problem.

summary_comment: Professor Lando is known for his rigorous grading standards and emphasis on precise execution in mathematical problems. Students appreciate his focus on understanding the process, but also note that minor errors can significantly impact their grades. His approach ensures high-quality learning but requires meticulous attention to detail.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lando is known for his rigorous grading and emphasis on precise execution in exams. Students appreciate his focus on detailed understanding but note that minor errors can significantly impact grades.

Ratings.comment: As a good student who got an A for STAT4201, you wouldn't have guessed my grade for this easy A subject. A simple mistake in the exams and you'll only get 5/20 marks. Knowing how to do is a key in math class, not the correct answers. A simple row reduce mistake and you'll lose almost 1% in the final grade?!?!

summary_comment: Professor Nie speaks quietly and has a thick accent, making lectures challenging to follow. Despite this, her exams are fair and straightforward, often closely resembling the practice problems and in-class examples provided. While some students found her lectures less engaging, others appreciated her detailed notes and the predictability of the exam content.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nie has fair and straightforward exams, with practice problems that closely mirror the test questions, making the grading predictable. However, her quiet delivery and thick accent make lectures challenging to follow, and she relies heavily on written notes to convey information.

Ratings.comment: Speaks quietly and with a thick accent, made the lectures difficult to follow. However, the exams were fair and straightforward. The practice problems she gives are very representative of the types and difficulty of the questions on the exams. Overall, not awful so long as you are able to learn a lot of the material on your own / in recitation.

She's a bit hard to understand with the accent. This was the second time i tried taking the class, and the exams are so much better with her. She has a review the previous lecture, and literally the examples in review was what was the exam was. She doesn't throw any curve balls. Also, she gave me a couple extensions on the homework.
This professor never give ANY practice midterm and solution. All she gave was a paper of textbook question # w/o solution, so be ready to suffer on her midterms.

I would say she is alright. Her speaking-English is not that well, but I can understand her every single words. not hard to find out that her ability on  math is pretty good, because she can response fast to those questions students post on class, the exam is not that hard.

Had her for both 2173 and 2174. The tests were very fair. Usually exactly what we went over in the in-class review session the lecture before. Hard to understand in the beginning, but writes everything on the board. Attendance is mandatory, but a pretty easy A if you attend all lectures.

She honestly cares and wants to help you learn... She just can't. Doesn't speak English very well and has a very hard time trying to get her point across because she just doesn't know how to say it. You'll have to learn from the book. Exams are fair and similar to the problems given for homework.

Her accent is thick and she kinda just stands at the front and recites her lectures rather than engaging with the class. However, I found her written notes on the board to be easy to follow which made the class pretty manageable. Her tests are fair and the in class examples and homework well prepares you for anything on them. Overall, OK.
TERRIBLE. DO NOT TAKE. WARNING: AVOID AT ALL COSTS. TERRIBLE PROFESSOR. Recitation was good though. (different person of course)

I could not understand a word she said and the only help I got was from recitation. There were multiple times in lecture where students had to correct her. If you want to be able to understand what is being taught I would not take math with Nie.

summary_comment: Professor Meehan is widely regarded as one of the best TAs at Ohio State, particularly for mathematics courses. Students consistently praise his exceptional teaching skills, availability, and genuine care for their success, often noting that he goes above and beyond to ensure they understand the material and perform well. His office hours and additional review sessions are highly valued, and many consider him indispensable for mastering challenging courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Meehan is widely regarded as one of the best TAs at Ohio State, known for his exceptional teaching and availability. Students consistently praise his thorough explanations, extensive office hours, and additional study sessions, which significantly contribute to their success in the course.

Ratings.comment: Best math TA you will ever have. 1116 isn't hard per se, but it's confusing  even for experts and  I'm terrible at math. I got an A in his class. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. He helps with homework to ensure you'll get 100% on all assignments, holds extra office hours during exam week. Anyone who didn't do well in his recitations was not trying .
Overall best TA I have ever had. Genuinely took the time to make sure his students had the resources to succeed if they wanted to. He should probably be the head of the math department at OSU.

Sean is absolutely the best TA I have ever had at Ohio State. He did in 1 recitation what the professor failed to do in 3 lectures. His office hours saved my grade and possibly my career. IF YOU SEE THIS MAN ON YOUR SCHEDULE REJOICE BECAUSE YOU HAVE BEEN SAVED

Absolutely the best math teacher I have ever had. Super helpful, has two hour reviews before exams,  which help greatly. If you see his name as your TA, or someday professor you're a lucky individual.

Where do I begin? Sean is not only the best TA ever, but he is such an awesome guy. Without him, I would have failed this class. He created study sessions outside of class, and his office hours are the best. Sean genuinely cares for students. He's the bee's knees, the cat's meow, and simply the coolest guy I have met at Ohio State.

I wish every TA put the time and effort in that Mr. Meehan did. He's a super nice guy, and he speaks English, which is always great and sometimes hard to find in the Math department. I wish he were the lecturer.
Sean saved my life. Best TA I've ever had. Incredibly available, and very easy to understand. Calc I at OSU is difficult no matter what, but having this TA helped as much as possible. Terrific guy.

summary_comment: Professor Antoniou effectively explained complex concepts and was highly responsive to student inquiries, making the material more approachable. While his organization could be improved, he maintained a lively and engaging teaching style that kept classes interesting. His clear communication and helpfulness significantly enhanced the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Antoniou effectively explained complex concepts and was highly responsive to student inquiries, making the subject matter more engaging. While occasionally unorganized, his approachability and humor kept the recitations dynamic and less tedious.

Ratings.comment: He was only the recitation prof. so he wasn't really in charge of the class content or difficulty. But he did well to explain the concepts and was always open to questions or suggestions to help us and use the class time as usefully as possible for us.  He was a little unorganized but funny and at least class wasn't completely dull.
He is adorable. He answers all questions clearly and promptly. Really helpful and made math less tedious.

summary_comment: Professor George is known for her clear and concise lectures, which many students find engaging and enjoyable, leading to high grades with minimal effort. However, her rapid speaking and writing pace can be challenging for some, though she is accommodating and willing to revisit topics for clarity. Her teaching effectiveness is mixed, with some praising her while others criticize her teaching methods and exam structure, citing difficulties in understanding and poor exam conditions.
summary_comment_short: Professor George is known for her clear and concise lectures, which many students find enjoyable and easy to follow, leading to good grades with minimal effort. However, her teaching style can be challenging for some, particularly those who struggle to keep up with her quick pace, and some students have reported difficulties with exam structure and clarity in explanations.

Ratings.comment: Very fun, clear and concise lecture. I got an A in her lecture without much effort. Simply do the practice problems assigned, and show up to lecture and you are fine.

She speaks and writes very quickly which some people seem to have trouble keeping up with but she is willing to go over topics as much as needed to ensure clarity. She has a fun, bubbly personality that shines through even when the material is dull.
She was pretty good at explaining concepts. It was helpful to actually go to class and do the homework, and not terribly difficult either.
Great TA!  Interested in the material, humorous, and pretty good looking.  She does grade very tough though - so mind your homework!

Sometimes the attractiveness of this ta makes it hard to concentrate. Other than that she is an awesome teacher. The other reviews are obviously written by bitter and ugly girls cause its so untrue. The teaching is clear, concise, and very helpful for my class. I got an A which can mostly be attributed to her help.

Does not explain things in a clear way and when asked questions becomes frustrated and annoyed. Only gives 1 hour for exams making each question worth 10 points, so if you don't finish each question, you're screwed. On all three exams the class average was an F and she even admits it might be because she's not a very good teacher.

:( dont waste your time going to class. never lets you out early (she thinks letting you out 3 minutes early is a big deal) explains things in a very complex way and doesn't do many example problems. going to her class does not help you understand better.

Horrible teacher. She can't do simple adding and subtracting in her head. Plays favorites if you buy her b-day gifts. No sympathy for missing class for a death in the family. Writes the definition of everyhting instead of just doing problems. Admits herself that she explains everything in a difficult way.

summary_comment: Professor Gross is either highly regarded as an exceptionally talented and knowledgeable teacher who effectively conveys complex ideas, or viewed as extremely loud and rude, significantly impacting the learning environment negatively for some students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gross is either highly regarded as an exceptionally talented and knowledgeable teacher who effectively conveys complex ideas, or she is perceived as extremely loud, annoying, and rude.

Ratings.comment: Extremely loud and annoying. Also quite rude.

The only thing brighter and more welcoming than her personality is her beautiful smile. What a woman. She maintains extensive knowledge of her field, and is extremely talented at conveying her ideas. Best teacher I've ever experienced.

summary_comment: Professor Lim is known for his clear and concise teaching style, making the material accessible despite an initial language barrier. While some students found the content and exams challenging, many praised his effective communication and helpful notes, recommending his classes highly. Overall, his teaching quality is generally positive, with some noting that his explanations are thorough and his office hours beneficial.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lim is known for his clear and concise teaching style, making complex material accessible. However, some students find his lectures and exams challenging due to a significant language barrier and a focus on straightforward explanations that may not always align with exam content.

Ratings.comment: He is very clear and concise. I like his teaching style.

This is a terrible professor. He was confused from his own teaching. i wouldnt want anybody to fail, so stay way from this professor, unless you want to teach yourself. Not willing to help at all.His exams are hard, not even close to being like what he taught.

I took pre-calc before, so I was pretty bored. When I did go to class, I couldn't understand him. One time a student asked him a question and after taking a few minutes to work on it on the board, he says "I don't know" and the entire lecture hall started laughing.

He wasn't impossible to understand,I just found the content incredibly boring. The only interesting parts were application, which he mentioned once in the course of the entire class. That being said, the class is easy and I got an A while staying awake in class 20% of the time. FOLLOW THE NOTES HE POSTS ON CARMEN. Those were extremely helpful.

I actually transferred into his class to get away from another prof. Best decision ever. After the first day, you get used to the accent and have no problem with comprehension. He clearly communicates the material. Lim practically told us what he was going to ask on the final. Going to lecture very helful but you can manage to miss. 100% recommend.
I took 571 and 572 with him.  I learned a great deal in the class and he explains things very well.  His notes are also very good and to the point.

His accent takes a little time to get used to, but he's a good teacher overall. He explains things clearly and  breaks down each step to problems and doesn't just assume you know the "easy stuff." His office hours were really helpful too.

Changhoon was a pretty good teacher.  There is a slight language barrier at first but once you got used to it, it was no big deal.  Overall he discussed the necessary material and explained it as well as he could.

Excellent professor. He introduces the basics of each section at the start of the lecture, and then spends the whole time doing example problems and explaining how to apply whats being learned. he also tells you when an example he's doing has appeared on old exams, so you know what to study. you couldn't have a more straight forward professor

Lim is very difficult to understand and does not teach the material. He has prepared (sub-par quality) slides that he reads off of. Take home quizzes and midterms/final are the only grade in the class. Language barrier is great, and people stopped showing up because there is no instruction in class. We had to learn on our own.
Awful. If you have to have him, go to the MSLC tutors in Cockins Hall for help. They are the reason I passed that class. Good luck!

Lectures were useless for midterms/finals. Doesn't explain concepts with much depth and clarity. Take at your own risk, hope for a good TA and do lots of practice outside of class. 152 is a pretty tough class.
not a very good teacher. Didn't explain the material well at all. The final wasn't bad but the midterms were a bare.
He didn't explain the material throughly. The grading was fair though. He didn't really seem to keen on helping students. But not terrible of a teacher.

Very helpful and clear. Grade is based on 6 quizzes 2 midterms and a final. Homework is suggested, but make sure you do these problems even tho they are not for a grade because they are verbatim to the quizzes. Midterm 1 is very difficult, midterm 2 is very easy and the final is very very difficult. If you study you will succeed.

summary_comment: Professor LI's teaching quality is mixed; while some students find his classes valuable despite his soft voice, others criticize his poor communication skills, frequent tardiness, and tendency to focus only on textbook material, leading to unhelpful lectures and unexpected quiz distributions.
summary_comment_short: Professor LI's teaching quality is mixed; while some students find his classes valuable despite his soft voice, others criticize his poor communication skills and lack of engagement, citing issues with attendance and understanding his lectures without sitting in the front rows. Overall, his approach seems ineffective for many students, who find his classes disorganized and unhelpful.

Ratings.comment: well, not that bad, still good, he has a soft voice thats true,  but if you attended the class things you learned will exceed your expectation.

He is bad. I sit in the front row and couldn't hear him. This isn't an issue since everything he writes on the board comes straight from the book. Doesn't answer questions and gave quizzes even though he explicitly said he wouldn't.Homework sets take anywhere from 3-5 hours, with one due each week. Practice final 68 was questions!Take Mance for 366

Soft spoken? Thats an understatement. If you don't sit in the front 3 rows you wont hear him. If you don't sit in the front row you can understand him. 5/30 or so people average showing up a day. He said 1+1+11=14 (stupid stuff like this everyday). Its like he isnt even trying. He shows up late 5 minutes everyday. 2nd Worst prof ive ever had.
Soft spoken.

summary_comment: Professor Averill is highly regarded for her clear and well-organized teaching style, with meticulously planned lectures and comprehensive notes. She is known for her thorough knowledge of the subject matter and her willingness to help students, often providing additional support through office hours and detailed explanations. While some students noted that she was a strict grader, they generally found her approach effective and appreciated her clarity and helpfulness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Averill is highly regarded for her clear and well-organized teaching style, with meticulously planned lectures and comprehensive notes. Students consistently praise her knowledge of the subject matter and her willingness to help, though some note that she was a strict grader.

Ratings.comment: She speaks very clearly and you'll have no trouble understanding her. She knows what she's doing and her lectures are meticulously planned. Very knowledgeable in the subject and she's very helpful.

Extremely well prepared and helpful. Notes were clear and was always ready to answer questions.  Goes over a lot of example problems which is good for this class. Her review sessions are always helpful!

She speaks very clearly and her notes are very well organized. She doesn't do a lot of practice problems in class. She was a harsh grader, however she does give partial credit on tests. She is also very helpful after class and in her office hours. You should attend her office hours if you can. Overall good teacher
Awesome. Really good at explaining things, thank god, as the TA's really don't. Oh, and she's American, which is also pretty nice for clarity reasons!
Nice teacher!
talking clearly, extremely helpful teacher
understandable

She might as well have taught Math 132 because everything I learned, I learned in recitation. Unlike many professors which go into too much detail about nothing, she made everything so much easier than it really was. She also posted a lot of useful things on her website. She is by far the best instructor I have ever had.

Isabel was very helpful. She made me understand everything and even gave the class helpful tips, like what to remember for tests and such. She even brought us candy for the final. Really cares about her students.

Excellent TA and willing to help. I wish she was with a better professor for one, and that she didn't collect homework though I suppose I understand why she did. Sometimes she moves a little fast for me to understand and since my professor did also it made it hard. However, she is a great TA and always uploaded notes, etc. to her website to help us

She is a very good TA and you could tell that she put a lot of work in through her OSU website, it is part of the reason I got a decent grade.  I would have have rather had her as my professor honestly...
she's the coolest... probably my favorite TA b/c our class is so fun...
not a very godd TA

She is absolutely AWESOME!  I had her as a TA and she was GREAT, so keep an eye out for her as a professor.  TAKE HER CLASS if you get the chance... you won't regret it--seriously (especially if you're having trouble)
Good teacher....she knows her stuff and is one of the better TA's I have had so far.
Isabel is very helpful and she teaches math in a way that easily understood
Very helpful. Teaches what's on the tests. Good TA.
great teacher if you can get her do it

summary_comment: Professor Pittel is highly regarded by many students as one of the best professors they have had, noted for his patience and friendliness. However, some found his teaching challenging due to his focus on theoretical aspects, which sometimes made the material difficult to grasp. Despite this, he is appreciated for his willingness to help students during office hours and his overall positive demeanor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pittel is widely regarded as one of the best professors, known for his patience and friendliness. However, some students found his teaching challenging due to his focus on theoretical aspects, which sometimes made the material difficult to grasp.

Ratings.comment: Easily one of the best professors I've had.  Patient and friendly.
It's all good
very good!!!!

He tries hard, but he's just not a good teacher.  He is very interested in calculus and loves theory (which I really didn't want to know as an engineering major) but sucks at making thing understandable.  If you're doing badly go to his office hours.  He boosted my grade for going to them.
Boris is a good dude, and he's a great teacher once you learn to understand what he's saying.
No Comments

He is a very nice professor but didn't always do a good job of presenting the material understandably.  He liked doing a lot of theory.  It may have simply been the fact that the material was very hard and the book is not great.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Duke was highly effective at elucidating complex problems, earning strong praise for his teaching. However, some students found difficulty in understanding the material presented by Helene, who started as a TA and only had limited office hours, though they noted she may improve with experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Duke was excellent at elucidating complex problems, making the material accessible to students. However, some students found the teaching approach of the new Teaching Assistant, Helene, challenging to follow and recommended seeking alternative resources.

Ratings.comment: Was very good at explaining problems.

Helene just started teaching as a TA. Was hard to understand some material she taught in the way she taught it. Only had certain office hours. Probably will improve over time as TA but would recommend others.

summary_comment: Professor Walter is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, significantly improving students' understanding and performance in mathematics. Her clear explanations and supportive approach have helped many students, including those previously struggling with the subject, achieve优异的成绩并获得A级以上的成绩。她还会在学生需要时提供额外的帮助，使课程更加易于掌握。
summary_comment_short: Professor Walter is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, significantly improving students' understanding and performance in math. Her clear explanations and supportive approach have helped many students overcome their struggles with mathematics, leading to improved grades and confidence.

Ratings.comment: I loved this woman! She was the best math professor/teacher I EVER had. I took math 075 and 104 with her i passed exceedigly my expectations befor her class i hated math in high school i got D's in math when i took her classes i had straight A's! I recommed her to anybody who has trouble with math she'll help you thru it!

I hated math before her class. I had failed Math 50 the quarter before and retook it with her and I did a lot better. Go to class and do the homework and you should be good. She's really helpful and nice.

She was a really great professor! She makes sure that you understand the material. She pretty rewrites the notes from the textbooks, so they are only used for homework.
