But how she does it makes it so much easier to understand. I'm usually terrible at math but so far have an A-, and will defintely take class again with her!

summary_comment: Professor Woolley is widely regarded as one of the poorest instructors, with students citing his inability to effectively teach, confusing explanations, harsh grading, and dismissive attitude towards students. Reviews consistently describe his recitations as ineffective and his lectures as unhelpful, with many students advising others to avoid his classes entirely.
summary_comment_short: Professor Woolley is widely regarded as one of the worst instructors, with students citing his inability to effectively teach, arbitrary and harsh grading, and unhelpful recitations as significant issues. Many students advise avoiding his classes entirely due to his poor teaching methods and the difficulty in understanding his lectures and sample problems.

Ratings.comment: worst TA ever. didnt explain any of the work he did on the board. we had 40 people in our class, only 5 showed up consistantly when there wasnt hw due or a quiz. the last reciation before our final there were 4 people there. that tells you how worthless the class is. he means well but cant teach. at all.

One of the worst experiences of my collegiate career. Very unclear and often confuses himself during sample problems. Grading is very arbitrary, inconsistent and unfair.Its a mystery that he still has a job. The department needs to reassess his quality as an instructor. Stay AWAY at all costs.

I've had him for two math sections and it's been bad. He will do sample problems in recitation, but be prepared to teach yourself why things are the way they are in each problem. If homework and quizzes weren't turned in during recitation, I would literally never go. The book is more help than him. And he's probably read these reviews but does noth

This guy is a major jerk. He won't give partial credit for problems and grades way harder than the other TAs. He can't pronounce his words correctly and talks down to everyone. He thinks he is the best TA and holds himself way above everyone else. I'm only doing well in the class because my lecturer, Aboughazi, knows what she's doing.

Before I went to this class, I got on this website and read the ratings on him. I was a little miffed, but didn't think it would be that bad- HUGE MISTAKE. The only reason I got a B+ is b/c I was tutored in my dorm. He is useless to approach with Q's, gives no partial credit, talks down 2 ppl, & is a major a hole. Get out while u can, I wish I had.

He doesn't have much to say, if you have questions, he will try to answer them - but he isn't amazing at it.  Go to recitation to take quizzes & turn in homework (then you might as well leave).  DO ALL THE HOMEWORK.  That is the best way to do well.  Not the worst, not the best.  He does speak clear English - which is a BIG bonus in OSU's math!

This is the worst teacher ever. His tests are really hard and he grads them in a very hard way, he don't give any partial credit for the work that you do, so you have to get the steps and the final answer correct other wise you will get a 0 on that problem. Avoid this teacher at all costs, and please tell the other students about that.
Worst professor at OSU. Wants students to fail. Grades harder than any other TA. Switch out immediately!
Rough.

SWITCH IF YOU HAVE HIM. He grades harder than any other TA did. He thinks you should already know the material and makes you feel stupid when asking questions. I went to the MSLC for help.. but HE was the one there. I think he means well..but his teaching skills are not! but I would not recommend him!!

He never really explained things well. I never really understood how he got his answers and he didn't explain well. Math recitations weren't worth going to. But he spoke english clearly, and in the math department at OSU, that's a miracle.

Over half the class failed.  I am in 130 again this quarter and  getting A's.  Worst teacher at OSU I have ever had.  Switch to another class if you have him!!!  I wish I could go back in time and do the same!

The worst professor I have ever had!! Stay away! I am currently in his class now and I will be lucky if I get a B. He does not go over any material helpful material. I am having my first exam in a few days and he did not review anything! He pretty much just stands in front of the class rambling on about nothing! The MSLC will become your bestfriend

Not very understandable... explanations are confusing and the examples he gives are much easier than exam problems. If you are in his section do not take recitation with Aliska Gibbons.  She does not know how to explain anything and will move on to a new problem if she can't solve it.

Always beat around the bush whenever asked a question. He only answered the ones he felt like it. He got upset when people asked questions he didn't know how to answer or when he was corrected. Try to avoid him.
Guy was a joke, did not answer questions instead got offended, his quizzes were much harder than other recitation's by far, also the complete opposite of hot,lol
I thought he struggled to convey the material to the students in a clear and concise manner.
Run and Run from his class screaming and consider yourself worned, really worned. bad teacher very bad.
does not answer questions when asked!
So boring, doesn't make the math and easier. If you ask him something he explains it in some backwards way. Drop this class.
I actually kinda like good ole' Tom. I see that everyone else hates him. He's not a very good recitation professor though. He's not perfect either, but I dunno, I kind of liked him.
No Comments

He is the worst lecturer I have ever had. I stoped going to lecture after the first day. He is an even worse recitation instructor, if you ask him a question he spends 10 minutes not answering it. If you get him as a professor drop the class.

I stopped going to his lectures the 2nd week of classes and taught myself all of the material out of the book and got an A in the class. He's horrible. Thank god my recitation intructor was really awesome, or else I would have dreaded being in this class altogether.
Worst professor I have ever had. He is a horrible teacher who doesn't teach the class anything. A complete waste of time to attend his lectures.
bad teacher..notes given in lecture dont help on homework..had to switch lecturer
Such a terrible professor to have as my first math professor in college.  I'm taking his class right now, and I'm probably going to fail it, in part due to the fact that he doesn't teach anything.
One of the must unhelpful professors.  Rambles on about impossible equations that are irrelevant.  Definitely don't ask for help because it’s pointless.

Spends the entire class proving formulas that are impossible to comprehend for 99% of the students.  Never goes over problems relating to the test, and most of the example problems you will never see again.  Very difficult to prepare for his exams.  Almost half the class failed.

Fat, lazy, uninterested teacher whose sole goal in life is to flunk students. In a class of 25, the average was a low D+, with the highest grade being a 73% B-. Absolutely ridiculous. I genuinely hope he's not teaching anymore, and if he is and you're reading this please drop the class for your sake

summary_comment: Professor Kaygun has a mixed reputation among students. Some find him effective and engaging, praising his clarity and availability, while others consider him one of the worst due to his teaching style and exam difficulty. Overall, his classes are seen as manageable if students put in the effort, though his exams can be challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kaygun has a mixed reputation among students, with some finding him effective and helpful, particularly in terms of clarity and availability, while others consider him one of the worst teachers they have encountered, citing low exam averages and unclear teaching methods. Overall, his teaching style ranges from highly supportive and engaging to confusing and disorganized, depending on the student's perspective.

Ratings.comment: hey

He sprung a pop quiz on us because too many people weren't attending lectures. He teaches by showing practice problems on the board while muttering to himself, never explaining what he's doing. Told us we should be kicked out and sent back to high school because the average on the second exam was a 60% or so.

was great for 151A really helpful and his lecture was important to attend. overall the class was easy, but when i had him for math 152a i did 0 work and got a b- so i guess thats how it goes. overall i would say take him. hes a funny guy

One of the worst professors I have ever had. I am glad I dropped because I def. would not have passed this guy's class. If you actually WANT to take him, youre insane. If you have no other choice but to take him, Good Luck because you just dug your own grave.

Kaygun is the worst math teacher I've had the privelage of having. Not only did he make our second midterm average a 60%, he decided that it should not be curved and left everybody in hopeless abandon to try even getting close to an A. Thinks he's more funny than he actually is. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

i was fortunate enough to have professor kaygun for both math 151 and 152. he is truly an amazing professor who is very clear and concise with teaching this rather dizzying material. always available for questions and always stayed after his office hours to see everyone, even if there was a line. definitely try to take calc with prfessor kaygun!
Awesome teacher. very helpful. Clear. Intelligent. Fair.

His class was not unlike any other math class in that, if you put in the effort, you will see results.  To prepare for midterms, do lots of practice problems from the book.  For the final...good luck.  Its hard and you will see some new stuff.
Horrible...absolutely horrible. Gives exams in which his class average is failing, yet does not curve it. Teaching style is write examples on the board without in-depth explanations for anything.
demeaning, not helpful at all.  i relied on my recitation which still wasn't much better.

A no-nonsense guy with a slightly cynical sense of humor. Definitely much better than just about any math professor at OSU. Does lots of sample problems clearly on the blackboard. This class is definitely tough, and one must study the notes and do lots of practice problems. If math doesn't come naturally to you, be prepared to put in the effort.

He does a nice job. It's a difficult class, but I had an 8:30 section and he was always awake and funny. He takes time to answer questions well. He has an accent, but I never had trouble understanding him. Absolutely try to get Dr. Kaygun!
good teacher.
He liked to put things on the exams that we had never even seen in class.
Can't explain or arrive at theories properly. communication skills are pretty low. lectures are vague and not comprehensive. avoid him if you can.

He is a very good teacher. Gives lots of examples...my only problem was that he didn't always give a ton of difficult examples. Very fair and is concerned about everyone learning. If you feel that your test was graded too harshly, he'll look at it and consider giving pts back.
Really good professor, very clear. Made sure everyone understood the material. highly recommended.
He is a really good teacher and I learned a lot from his lectures.  It was my first time taking calculus and the ideas were presented in a way that made them easy to comprehend.

GREAT PROFESSOR!!!!  It was my first time learning calculus and I actually understand it. He gives so many examples that actually make sense.  His exams are semi-tough but he explains everything on them very clearly.  He really wants you to succeed in his class.  It was the only math class that I have not fallen asleep in so he keeps it interesting

HE'S A ****!  he made me understand everything i didn't understand the 1st time i took this class.  it's refreshing to have someone explain calculus so clearly.  this is hard stuff and he breaks it down so easily.  he's really great.

Really hard class with the worst book; I thought about dropping it but then I went into office hours. Atabey is the best--never miss lectures and always ask questions. People fail his class b/c of not coming to class or doing homework. He's a fabulous guy and funny too--a great teacher deserves great students. Be one, and get an A like me :)
He's a great lecturer His exams aren't necessarily easy, but they cover things that we've actually gone over and should know.  Go to his lectures.  It will be well worth your time.
Dont miss the lecture before any exams!!!!!

He's a great teacher! He utilizes his entire class time but really will help you learn the subject. He is a wonderful teacher, really helpful outside of class as well. You are completely prepared for the exam going into it that it makes the class easy.

Good teacher...always goes til the last minute doing example after example.  tests are challenging but its everything that you have learned.  His class averages are always higher than the other classes.

summary_comment: Professor Kowalick is widely regarded as a poor instructor, particularly in his approach to teaching mathematics, where he is seen as confusing and overly complex. Students report that he fails to effectively address questions and often makes material more difficult than necessary. While some note that he is helpful during office hours, the overall consensus is negative, with many advising against enrolling in his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kowalick is widely regarded as a poor instructor, known for complicating material and frustrating students with his teaching style. Students consistently report that his lectures are confusing and unhelpful, and many advise against enrolling in his classes.

Ratings.comment: Absolutely horrendous math teacher. THE WORST I HAVE EVER HAD. Unlike most recitation teachers who allow the class time to be used for Q&A and clarification, Kowalick attempts to reteach that weeks material and basically butchers it/makes it 100% more confusing than it already was. He also gets annoyed when you ask questions. DO NOT ENROLL IN HIS.

1. The grading on homework can sometimes be ridiculous(don't know if this is Ryan or the department's standards). 2. He is generally a nice guy and can be helpful during office hours. Sometimes I can understand when others call him arrogant.
Ehhh, nothin to write home about, decent but overcomplicates
So terrible at teaching (GTA though) and very arrogant. He makes easy tasks so much more complicated than they should be.

summary_comment: Professor Zhang is an effective recitation TA known for his helpfulness and clarity in explanations. While he occasionally skips over some topics from lectures, he makes up for it with detailed, on-the-spot examples and clear answers to student questions. He has a minor language barrier but manages to communicate effectively despite it.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhang is an effective teaching assistant known for his recitations, though he occasionally skips over some lecture topics. He is highly helpful and patient, providing clear examples and directly answering questions, though there is a noted minor language barrier that occasionally affects communication.

Ratings.comment: Recitation TA. Skips over some topics from lecture. Really helpful. When I asked him about a graph on a quiz, he took the pencil out of my hand and drew it for me. A bit of a language barrier - he sometimes has to ask what certain things are "called". Readily answers questions and provides clear examples.

summary_comment: Professor Salminen is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging approach. Students find him knowledgeable and humorous, with a strong ability to explain complex material clearly. His dedication to helping students, even those struggling, contributes significantly to a positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Salminen is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging style, with students praising his ability to explain complex material clearly and his enthusiasm for teaching. His humor and interactive approach, including yo-yo tricks, contribute to a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Thank you
Very good professor
I found the material for this class really hard, but I think this teacher did a good job of teaching it.
awesome teacher.  explained everything.  loved questions.  loves teaching.  very funny and does yo-yo tricks
He's a great teacher

This guy seemed to like teaching, so that was good.  Kind of humorous, but not so much that he strays from the topic.  Answered question, explained stuff well.  It's an easy class if you do your homework, listen during class, and study.

Adam explained things very well.  I didn't pay attention during the classes before the first midterm, and I told him I hadn't and that I basically needed to relearn everything.  He could have been a jerk about it and made me get a tutor, but he just helped me during office hours.  And if I didn't understand something he wasn't like, "YOU IDIOT!"
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Banerjee is considered uneven in his teaching quality, with some students finding him challenging due to his teaching style and accent, while others appreciate his sense of humor and helpfulness. Many recommend relying on additional resources like TAs and math tutoring for success in his classes. Overall, his lectures are more effective when combined with self-study and outside support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Banerjee is perceived as an inconsistent instructor, with some students finding him helpful and engaging despite his heavy accent and teaching style, while others criticize his approach as unsuitable for beginners and his lack of practical examples. Overall, his effectiveness seems to depend significantly on the student's prior knowledge and their ability to supplement his lectures with additional resources.

Ratings.comment: Professor Banerjee is terrible. If you have never taken calculus before, or only taken pre-calc then you will not do well in this class. He teaches as if you already know the material. There are better professors out there, do not take this one.

Absolutely horrible professor.  He has a huge accent.  He is extremely misleading when he talks about what the exams will cover.  He can't understand students when they ask him questions.  Avoid this man!
He's actually kind of funny, even if all he ever goes over during class are theorems/proofs. He also goes over what type of questions will be on the midterms. Overall, not a bad lecturer.

Not a good professor. His accent isn't terrible, but nothing he goes over in class is useful. I don't think he went over a single example problem. All pointless explanation of theorems. Not helpful either. I asked him what I had done wrong on a  certain test problem and he responded with "it's just wrong." Real helpful....

He is a character. Wears either a black or purple dress shirt and alternates them weekly. He smells, I sat in the 3rd row and had to breath through my mouth the whole time. He's quirky, Friday classes are always funny. Always asks if there are questions but has a hard time understanding what students ask. I have him for 152 and understand him fine.

Lectures were helpful only if you took notes from the book before each lecture. Mostly explained theories and did proofs, which did help if you already had some examples in mind (ie- from the textbook). Attending recitations are a must if you want a decent grade in this class. Accent not hard to understand at all.

Overall, Banerjee is actually a good teacher. He may be a little socially awkward, but if you do what the math dept suggests you'll get a fine grade. Rely on your TA heavily, and go for math tutoring. Grades in Banerjee's classes are typically much higher than with other professors. Cracks stupid jokes, but they're funny. I enjoyed his class.
He's a good guy. Cracks occasional jokes.

Banerjee is definitely an interesting professor at first, however it takes patience to learn from him. He does not give examples of problems during class which may seem hypocritical, however as long as you have a good TA you should be just fine in his class. His midterms/exam scores tend to be higher than other lecturers (which is a godd thing)

Don't go to his class at all. He rarely goes over problems but instead finds it fun to prove proofs that will never be on an exam. At one point he said he was "interested in changing up his class" and went on to teaching chemistry equations. Avoiding the class will most likely get you a better grade.

Banerjee can have his fun moments. He does not give any example problems, he spends most of his time prooving things, has an accent, you CAN understand him and it makes class a little bit more intereseting/funny. P.S. He will always wear black pants, black shirt or purple shirt LOL If you take his class and wears something else please post!!Im out!

Don't bother. If you don't have a calc background, avoid Banerjee since he assumes you have. Thick accent which tripped up myself and several classmates. Exams are universal across the dpt. Hope you have a good TA and can understand accents as most TAs have thick accents too. Not taking 152 from Banerjee this winter if at all possible.
Funny, but clueless. It's sad that we had to teach him what a conjugate was. I think we taught him more than he taught us. Thank god I had a good TA.
he is pretty funny, but he assumes that you know most of what you are doing already. he spends a bunch of time using variables and proving things rather than trying any sample problems... :/

I was unimpressed. Difficult to understand, not helpful during lectures OR during office hours. He did hardly any practice problems and was unorganized. Review sessions before exams were useless and not helpful. Hope for a good TA, and if not, spend a lot of time in the help room for practice and hw. Old quizzes and exams come in really handy

Didnt think he was good at all. Ended up attending a friend's lecture after about week 4 & only went to him right before exams. Difficult to understand, flew through material, focused only on proofs but not sample problems or helping students understand. I got an A only bcz I stopped going to his lecture. Book/old midterms/quizzes will be your BFF.
Funny guy, ..if you don't have calculus experience, the class will prove to be very difficult.  He teaches with the mindset that we already have a calculus background.
I love this guy. Knows his stuff.

Really terrible teacher. Can't understand anything he says and what you can understand doesn't make sense. Going to lecture is pointless. Only take his class if you're comfortable teaching yourself calculus.

Decent professor.  He explains the theory behind everything and leaves the harder stuff on you.  He does have a bit of an accent, but it's not terribly difficult to get used to.  Just go to recitation and you'll be fine.

He Makes sure everyone understand his simple explanations b4 he moves on and leaves the harder stuff to TAs. typical at OSU i think, it all depends on the TA you get and that will affect your grade. the moment you fall behind, it will be over and you will struggle. do all suggested problems they always choose similar ones on midterms/finals
His accent was thick and difficult to understand, but even more was his voice (which, when he's yelling, is very annoying.) Maybe he shouldn't be faulted for that, but neither should his students.

AWFUL professor.  He explains the "theory" of everything, which will NOT help on any of the tests. The book is so hard to follow, so I would suggest using your TA as a means of learning the material.  Also, his accent makes it impossible to understand a word he says, and usually I can deal with accents.

I thought prof. Banerjee is a great professor. He did a good job explaining the basics and then left it up to the TAs to explain the more difficult problems, just get a good TA! Banerjee explained things in plain english and actually cared if his students understood. Once you get used to his accent, you'll do fine.
This is the second time I've had him unfortunately. Going to lecture really is pointless, I have yet to learn anything from him specifically.

You can not understand him very well, going to lecture is just about useless. You're better off teaching yourself. He has a weird way of teaching concepts, which does not really help on the tests. He leaves figuring out the harder stuff for you. I learned way more in recitation.

summary_comment: Professor Valle is an excellent instructor known for his clear explanations and organized lectures, which significantly aid in understanding complex mathematical concepts. While his courses involve challenging exams, students appreciate his availability and helpfulness, though some note that attending class front-row is crucial due to poor audio. Overall, students find his teaching effective and valuable, despite the fast pace.
summary_comment_short: Professor Valle is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and ability to explain complex material clearly, though his courses involve a significant amount of proofs. His exams can be challenging, but he provides easier quizzes and homework that offer opportunities for success with minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: Good Professor. A lot of proofs to learn, but that was the nature of the course.

Great Professor.  Explains the material very well.  Exams are a little tough but quizzes are easy and HW problems are free points if you put a little effort into it. Math is not my favorite subject, however Valle made it somewhat enjoyable. Take his section if you get the chance.

Worst math teacher I've ever had. We spent multiple class periods trying to figure out a problem that he couldn't even figure out. Everyone in my class didn't like him. I will never take another class that he instructs. Had I not already taken this class at Kent State, I would have failed. Math dept needs to redesign the course as well.
Excellent teacher. Very smart and obviously likes to teach- best of both worlds. Very open with his time. Provides great analogies to help with understanding.

This is as good as it gets with a Math prof at OSU. He's just simply amazing! MT's and final were a little hard, but he is really easy to understand. Goes a little fast in lectures, but considering its calc III, u gotta be prepared for it! hard to hear in the back cuz he doesn't use a mic, so sit in the front! Very helpful, fair amount of hw too!!
As long as you attend class, he teaches well enough where you can succeed. If you are having trouble, he happily helps you understand material.

A great instructor, however, not as helpful as some instructors I've had.  But what he lacks for on individual help, he makes up for in his lectures.  They are very organized and he makes references/refreshers on older material so students can make mental connections.  Bottomline is that you'll learn a lot from this guy.
He is a good professor, he teaches a little fast, but he teaches right. I had many college math teachers and he is one of the good one.
He was very hard to understand. Went way too fast. He says he will not help with homework problems but, if you go to his office hours he will do the homework for you.
No Comments

I had this instructor for lecture in math 148. He's excellent. Very clear. If you go to class, and do the assigned homework, you will do well. He's very good at explaining and answering questions. And he obviously cares about his students' success. Holds helpful office hours. Highly recommend!
Very IMPORTANT... GO TO CLASS.  Keeping up with the material is a time eater, but do it, and go to office hours, and you will do well.

summary_comment: Professor LO is highly regarded as a dedicated and approachable instructor who spends extra time with students outside of class. However, some students find his teaching challenging, particularly in math, due to unfulfilled promises of curve grading, ineffective practice exams, and strict grading policies.
summary_comment_short: Professor LO is highly regarded as a dedicated and approachable instructor who spends extra time with students outside of class. However, some students found his teaching challenging, particularly in math, due to unfulfilled promises of curve adjustments, ineffective practice exams, and strict grading policies.

Ratings.comment: He is a nice guy and spent time with students for answering questions out of office hours.
Great instructor!

He was the worst math teacher I have ever had. He promised us curves that we didn't get, gave practice exams that were essentially useless, and never offered partial credit on stuff. GET OUT WHILE YOU STILL CAN if you aren;t amazing at math

summary_comment: Professor Mehta is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching in mathematics, particularly in calculus. While her lectures can sometimes be slow-paced and potentially boring, students consistently praise her ability to explain complex concepts clearly and her helpfulness in providing sample problems and test preparation advice. However, some note that exam content can diverge from in-class material, requiring additional effort and self-study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mehta is highly regarded for her exceptional ability to explain complex mathematical concepts, although her lectures can sometimes be dry. Students find her very helpful, especially when it comes to exam preparation and understanding course material, though they note that additional effort is required outside of class.

Ratings.comment: Best math instructor ever.
her lectures might be boring sometimes but she knows how to explain stuff also very helpful

Honestly u may probably not be able to find a better teacher for Math. I had two different teachers fall & winter quarters. Had Ms Nashali in the spring. She's the best. Explains very well(try other lectures), gives you sample problems, tells you what will not be tested. However in every course u have to put in much effort especially Math courses.

She was helpful enough to a certain degree, but the exams were a bit unfair and unrelated to what we learned in class. Overall though, she seemed pretty nice and I certainly learned the principles of Calc 2.
She is all I could ask for in my first two quarters in calculus. She is a BOSSSS #loveher

152.02 went very well with Nishali, and she is great at explaining concepts. She goes a bit fast sometimes, but she's helpful, too. Sometimes you have to use the book problems to understand, because it's easier to figure out what it is exactly that you do not know before you ask her for help.

I was in math 151.02. The lectures were helpful. She posts her notes online to follow along in class. The exams didn't follow what was done in class some of the time so that made it difficult to study. But overall she 's a good teacher.
If you go to class and do the review packets you should be fine! not that bad of a class. also go to recitation and study for the quizzes.

She tends to contradict herself during the class period.  Also, the exams and midterms were not at all like the problems done in class or in the textbook, so they were very hard to prepare for. Honestly did not learn very much.

Yes the lectures are boring but they are straightforward, clear and right from the book. Really helpful if you ask questions. Midterms/Finals are extremely fair; everything on it was on the review sheet.
horrible lecture.... easy class if u work from the book

summary_comment: Professor Moore is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by a strong commitment to student learning. He is described as very helpful and enthusiastic about educating his students, making him an excellent choice for both courses and TAs.
summary_comment_short: Professor Moore is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating a strong commitment to student learning and actively encouraging students to seek knowledge. Students strongly recommend obtaining him as a Teaching Assistant due to his effectiveness in facilitating understanding and engagement.

Ratings.comment: Very helpful, wanted students to learn.  Highly suggest you try to get him as your TA

summary_comment: Professor Christopherson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and engaging demeanor. Students consistently praise his ability to keep classes lively and entertaining while effectively conveying complex material. His energy and willingness to help ensure understanding make him a standout educator.
summary_comment_short: Professor Christopherson is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, which keeps students attentive throughout the lessons. Students consistently praise his thorough explanations, energy, and willingness to help, often recommending him as an excellent instructor.

Ratings.comment: Probably the best math teacher I've had.  Great teacher, and keeps you entertained.
Great Job ! Very helpful and way cute :)
Best Teacher Ever.
hell yeah
he's very energetic and there is never a dull moment.  he taught the material well and was very thorough on his examples. I would recommend him as a teacher to anybody who took his class.

He's very upbeat and there's never a dull moment in his classroom.  He's very... hyper? for a teacher, but he keeps your attention on the material. He's willing to answer questions and will make sure you understand. He made me laugh a lot, not through telling jokes, just his physical comedy. I loved having him as a lecturer and would recommend him.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Ross is an effective and knowledgeable instructor who covers a lot of material in his lectures, making his classes challenging but rewarding. Students consistently praise his availability and willingness to help during office hours, which significantly aid in understanding complex topics. While his exams are known to be tough, they reflect a deep understanding of the subject matter, and many students appreciate the thorough preparation they receive.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ross is an excellent lecturer known for his thorough explanations and challenging exams, which test comprehensive understanding of the material. He is highly supportive during office hours and approachable, though students find his classes demanding and recommend consistent effort and preparation.

Ratings.comment: Ross is a really good teacher. His exams are pretty tough but that's due to him wanting you to have a complete knowledge of the topics you learn. He is always available for help and is friendly. He may seem scary at first but he is a nice person that loves math.

I had Dr. Ross for both 1161/2162. Lecture at times could be rough and overwhelming because he had to cover so much material, especially second semester. Reading the text before class helped a little. This class was really hard, and the thing that saved me were office hours. He was extremely helpful and would literally walk you through problems.

Dr. Ross did a great job during lecture in explaining concepts. His midterms were challenging but not impossible. You just have to see past the part that is "scary" and the problems can be solved nicely. I had him for 1161 and 2162. Very very helpful during office hours and a cool guy in general.

Dr Ross is a devoted professor--however is class is not easy. Math 2153 is full of "filler" material to give students a general knowledge of mathematics used in higher levels. This means you will memorize formulas for tests and then forget everything. Decent quizzes, moderate exams, good curve. If you want to learn more, take 4551 after 2153.

Had him for 1161, and got him again for 2162. Goes fast in lecture, but that was due to the amount of material he had to cover. Midterms are challenging but the curve is typically big in the end. You will have to put forth substantial effort to receive a good grade but I am glad I had him as my professor. VERY helpful when you come in for help.

Great lecture however the exams are geared towards students who do nothing but math.  You will really learn the material but if you are worried about your GPA find another lecturer or study math every night for at least 2 hours
Difficult exams, but excellent lecturer.
Awesome professor, hard midterms and finals but he is really helpful and humorous.
Very difficult midterms. Easy quizzes. Next to no use of textbook.

The best professor I have had here. He is extremely helpful and also a good guy. He helped me in office hours twice a week. I am not even in his section for 2162 now, but I still go to his lectures and his office hours. Midterms are extremely challenging but there is a high curve for his honors classes. Take him if you get the chance.

The material itself is not hard. Do well on the quizzes and you'll be fine. He is an outstanding professor, but he stretches the midterms to really make you think. Never used the book, never assigned homework but DO MY MATH LAB.

He lectures quickly but that's more due to the amount of material than his teaching. I thought he was a really good professor, always more than helpful if you went to his office hours. Midterms and exams are slightly harder than homework but not impossible. Averages were lower but that means a bigger curve!

I really like dr. Ross. He is a really good teacher and really teaches the methodology and reasoning behind a particular procedure. His tests are hard but the averages are low and his classes curve high. Recorded our lectures so could watch it after, very convienient :)
assigns cumbersome homework problems instead of those that assess what you learned. Boring lectures. Recitation helps a lot more.

Great professor. Covers all material in lecture that will appear on quizzes. Like any other class at Ohio State, if you put the time required into it, it is easy to keep up and even ahead of the material. Dr. Ross was my first professor at Ohio State, and was one of the best I've had so far.

No point in going to lecture. He doesn't do a thing to help anyone understand, he's just trying to get through the lecture and material. Don't buy the book. You can do well by going to recitation, doing the online homework and studying for the midterms and finals by doing the practice exams they provide for you.

Good professor. He goes quickly in lecture, but if you attend office hours, he will always help you as much as possible. His tests are very difficult (41% average on the last one) but it allows for a good curve. Read the book before going to lecture, and ask questions while he is lecturing. Don't be afraid to ask him for help.

I had Christopher Ross as my lecturer for math 148.  He was a bit hard to understand due to the way he talks, he moves pretty quickly through the notes, and his handwriting is difficult to read if you're not sitting close to the board.  Some other reviews said he was intimidating, but he always helped me if I stayed after class to ask a question.

Probably one of the worst professors I've ever had. Teaches things so fast you barely know whats going on. To survive his class you'll need to spend a lot of time at the MSLC and teach yourself. I actually dropped the course because I was failing and I took another professor the next quarter and got an A.

Professor Ross's class was very difficult. His lectures are impossible to follow unless you've seen the material before and know it like the back of your hand. Tests were very difficult as well, class average was usually about 50%. However, he is very helpful in office hours and will work through any problem with you.

Stopped going to lecture half way through the quarter and just started reading the book instead because he moves through things so quickly and I kept improving my grade every test. So I'd worry more about the book and bookwork than going to lecture and IF you go to lecture read the book first so you can keep up with what is going on.
He doesn't care that he makes his class really hard and everyone is struggling. Be prepared to learn from your TA more than this chump.

Very arrogant and annoying to listen to. You never learn anything through lecture and have to teach yourself everything. He is kind of funny just because he gets such a high for math, but I do not like him as a professor.

Stingy with partial credit, and only cares about students who go to his office hours. Comes off like your dad - helpful, but you're left feeling that you disappointed him: "If only you'd read the textbook, you'd have an A.  But you didn't listen, because you clearly take after your mother.  And your mother can't differentiate worth a damn."

Chris Ross is easily the best math instructor that I have ever had, and he was just my TA. He has an abrasive personality and seems holier than thou, "because [he is] holier than thou," as he puts it. Excellent teacher, helped me understand two quarters of calculus with average professors. Don't expect easy, but he is entertaining.
Excellent TA...also going to be an excellent (but difficult) professor
Ross was extremely helpful both during recitation and office hours. I chose a particular section of 263 this quarter just so Ross could be my TA again.

Horrible. Maybe it was just the class, but 162/153 was the hardest class I've ever taken in my entire educational career. Having a TA who was sarcastic, dry, and an overall @$$hole did not help. I went to him for tutoring and homework help, and he just spit out a quick explanation. Be prepared to spend way too much time at the MSLC.

I just found out he's my TA for Math 415 and I couldn't be happier. He is the reason I passed 153 and 151. His teaching style is fast, but he is very helpful if you go to office hours. My first impression of him was someone who liked to hear himself talk, but give him time; he really knows how to teach well. Watch out for the corny jokes, though!

Go to every recitation and take notes. Ask questions when you have a problem and he will answer it well.  If you have Christopher Ross, you are lucky and will be taught enough to pass the class.  My lecturer was horrible.  Ross saved my grade.

He is a great TA and is always willing to help students. Not the easiest guy to approach, but he will help you with anything you want in recitation, office hours, or any time you schedule. If you go to office hours, he will help you with your homework. Homework and quizzes are all pretty reasonable. He makes lots of corny jokes, but I enjoyed that.
Try to keep up.  He teaches one speed - lightning fast!

He has pretty hard tests and quizzes.  You will need to bust your chops to get a good grade in his class. I pretty much did 3/4s of all the suggested problems and ended up with an A. He's really helpful though, so definitely go to office hours as much as possible.

Very helpful T.A. Also flexible. If you need help with anything he will find time and he knows what he is talking about. His grading is a lot harder than expected, but managable. I would definitely recommend him. He also makes very corny jokes but what do you expect?
Helped if you asked..very blunt in class. Overall good TA

Very helpful TA, if you get Ponomarev go to Ross' office hours and he'll help you with all of your homework and anything you don't understand. Overall very helpful, does grade  a little hard. He is very willing to help if you ask, if you need more help than office hours is more than willing to add more in. Great guy saved me from failing 150.
weird, nerdy makes corny jokes but is overall a helpful guy. i never went to any lectures just his ressitation
No Comments
No Comments

Harsh grader.  Doesn't care about you unless you go to one of his office hours.  Won't except homework if it's even ONE MINUTE late.  Can't even dress himself properly - clothes wrinkled and mismatched.

summary_comment: Professor Rosenblatt is known for her strong grasp of the subject matter and clear explanations of both theoretical concepts and practical applications in differential equations. While some students find her lectures challenging and her exams difficult, many appreciate her availability during office hours and her focus on practical problem-solving skills.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rosenblatt is known for her strong grasp of the subject matter and ability to explain complex concepts clearly, though some students find her lectures challenging and prefer more practical application. Overall, she is considered a fair and supportive instructor who emphasizes theoretical foundations and is accessible during office hours, though her exam questions can be quite different from the practice problems covered in class.

Ratings.comment: She knows her stuff and is helpful. New to this class though so she needs time to adjust. Don't listen to all of her poor ratings from the calc 1 noobs

I am very surprised about the negative comments. Dr. Rosenblatt was a very strong lecturer for ODE/PDE. She doesn't skimp on the theory, but also explains the applications and process for solving differential equations. She was always available for office hours and was very clear about what types of problems to expect on exams. I highly recommend.

She is pretty easy to understand when explaining concepts. Her tests are awful, though. I studied for the final four days in advance, had a high B average on tests, and got a D+ on the final. Also, our average for the first test was an E (F). Don't take this class if you don't absolutely love math and are good at math. It will kill your GPA.

Very good teacher, don't pay attention to the other comments.  She explains everything very clearly and is extremely fair about homeworks and exams.  Average was about an 80% on exams so you can't be that mad.  I learned a lot and she focuses on the practical things which I love.  Great teacher, give her a chance because she deserves it.

Dr. Rosenblatt was great at explaining material.  She used everyday language and really showed the underlying fundamentals of the mathematics.  The second midterm was a bit rough, but she acknowledged it and made up for it.

Without of taking pre-calc in high school, this class would of been an even bigger struggle for me. She does not explain things in an "easier" way but instead uses straight from the textbook definitions. I would recommend avoiding her lecture class.

She is very confusing and does not teach efficiently. We spend most of the time proving theorems instead of practicing. And what we do practice is much easier than the problems on the exams. There is too broad a spectrum of the types of problems that might be on tests. Maybe if she specified which types we should study, the class would be better.
I would rather not spend class time proving theorems when I will not have to prove them in the future.

absolutely awful. not helpful at all. unclear lectures. terrible at explaining. writes illegibly, and doesn't even write what's important. tests are also made waaaaayyyyy harder than necessary. (as in having dimensional analysis during a CALCULUS midterm with a very small time limit already. is also on a vendetta against any decimals being used.
She is so hard to understand. And she is terrible at trying to explain how to do problems.
So confusing, so hard to follow..not loud enough, doesn't write big enough. TOO FAST..overall "this guy" is not happy about this class.
This class is awful. She goes way too fast and doesn't explain how to do problems. First midterm was terrible, nothing like any of the practice problems we did in class or on quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor Medynets is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and relevance to exams in Math 415, making his classes worth attending. He focuses on problem-solving that aids in preparation for quizzes and midterms, though students find quizzes and tests challenging. While some recommend his class, others caution that studying extensively is crucial, especially for the final.
summary_comment_short: Professor Medynets is known for engaging lectures that are beneficial for understanding the material, which prepares students well for quizzes and midterms. However, quizzes and tests are noted for being challenging, and some students find his teaching style not particularly helpful or recommendable.

Ratings.comment: I was very happy I got him as a professor for math 415 compared to the other professors that teach it. Lectures are worth going to, would do problems that are helpful for quizzes and midterms. Quizzes were very hard, but the midterms were fair. Study EVERYTHING for the final. Very nice guy!
Quizzes and Test are very tricky. Not helpful at all. Not recommended

summary_comment: Professor Puliyambalath is known for his challenging exams and strict grading policies, with no curve applied. While some students found his teaching excellent and appreciated the importance of homework and practice tests, others described him as a poor lecturer who failed to effectively convey the material, leading to low grades despite their efforts.
summary_comment_short: Professor Puliyambalath is highly regarded by some students as an excellent teacher who ensures thorough understanding through detailed homework assignments, though he does not curve grades. Conversely, other students found his lectures unhelpful and tests extremely difficult, often without any curve, leading to poor performance despite their efforts.

Ratings.comment: Impossible to understand.
took both 153 and 254 with Pasha and got an A in both. Doing the homework problems is very important to make sure u understand every single detail. there is no curve at all!!!

Absolutely the worst teacher I've had at OSU. I went to all of his lectures before midterm 1 and got around 50%. I decided to stop going to his and go to a different lecturer and got 75% and 70% on midterm 2 and final. He has no idea how to teach or give a fair test. Also, class average: 60%. My average: 61%. My grade: D. Good luck.

Pasha was an excellent teacher. One of the best at OSU. The only issue is that he does not curve the class at all. Not even a little bit. Again, you will get absolutely no curve. However, Pasha is good enough at teaching that it is worth it to take the class.
Pasha was EXCELLENT. The quizzes and tests were fair to the material he taught us. Do the practice midterms and finals..they are very similar to the real thing!

Terrible teacher. He's very boring in lecture, speaks with a monotone. Exams are difficult and there was really no curve with my class, which was what I was relying on. Got an A in 152, D in 153, thanks Pasha!! (not)

An OK professor.  I didn't mind that his tests were challenging but I feel as if they were not curved enough in the end.  Worked extremely hard in this class only to come out with a C-.  I feel as if my level of understanding of the course does NOT AT ALL match up with the grade I received.  Take with caution.

lectures are worthless I did not go to more than one a week and read the book and did fine, I had him for 150 too and he was the same. Nice guy friendly but not a good teacher in class tests are some of the tougher ones I have had in calc but fair. oh ya and you have a ton of homework that is not easy worth a lot of points not to mention weekly qui
A great professor in math department at OSU. He knows the material well, and he's always willing to help. Exams are very fair. I ENJOY MATH AFTER TAKING HIS CLASS!!
Great Prof! Tests can be tough, but only tests you on what he covers and no curveballs. Very helpful during office hours.

Pasha was awesome! Really cared about helping students learn and making it as simple as possible. He wouldn't try and talk above your head like all of the other math professors here. Exams were somewhat difficult but if you use his practice problems you should have no problem.

summary_comment: Professor Bronish is an excellent and passionate instructor known for his precise and clear teaching style, making complex topics accessible and engaging. While he is known for strict grading, particularly on exams and labs, students consistently recommend him for those seeking a deep understanding of the subject matter. His approachability and willingness to provide additional insights make him stand out among other instructors in the CSE department.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bronish is an excellent instructor known for his precision, clarity, and passion for the subject matter, making class both interesting and challenging. While his grading is strict, students find his teaching invaluable and highly recommend him for those serious about learning.

Ratings.comment: Excellent instructor. Spoke with precision and clarity, made class interesting, and was clearly passionate about the material. He's a strict grader, but if you're interesting in actually learning something rather than just an easy A, highly recommended.
Best CSE teacher I've had in Ohio State. He is a great teacher, but expect a lot too. So expect a lot of work on closed labs and hard grading on midterm and final.

Very, very good teacher, but a very hard grader.  He taught everything very well, in a way that it was easy to understand.  However, his grading of the midterm and finals were pretty strict.  If I could have him as the professor, and have the assigned graders do the midterm/final, he would be the best CSE teacher I've had yet.

Derek Bronish is one of the best TA's I've had in the CSE department. He provides many insights into everything including things you won't need for a particular class but you might be interested in. He is very approachable and helpful.

I learned a lot from him and made me very interested in the field of computer science. In fact, he finalized my decision of switching from ECE to CSE. Explained everything well and was knowledgeable not just about Resolve but about software engineering principles. Exams and labs were easy.

Derek is leaps and bounds better than other CSE grad students that I've had. He knows his stuff and conveys it just as well as a high level professor might, but is much more approachable. He is also very flexible in his office hours which is a big plus.

Pretty good for a grad student. Sometimes can't answer questions but cares enough to do follow-up . Doesn't really teach for the test (standard 221/222/321 exam), but stresses points which are important to programming in general. Overall, not perfect, but definitely not bad. Certainly more interesting than some of the other CSE teachers out there.
Derek is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He's very clear about what is wanted and he articulates with understanding.

Derek was a good TA.  The material is really hard for those who actually need the class.  None the less Derek definitly trys to help his students in his own words and offers tips and memory tricks.  One of my best TA's.

Derek is attractive, but I do not find him 'hot'.    Attractiveness encompasses physical aesthetics.  In any case, he was very explicit during the few times I attended recitation and even managed to improvise some comic-relief on certain occassions-- but perhaps I was the only one laughing. By far one of the few instructors I don't despise.

Derek is a good teacher, but gives difficult tests. He makes sure he is available for office hours and offers help with questions...Its hard in recitation becuase time is already sooo limited but he tries his best to answer our questions and prepare students for the tests...Good TA!

summary_comment: Professor Larry is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and supportive approach, consistently helping students understand complex concepts and providing thorough feedback. Students praise his availability and willingness to extend office hours, making his classes stress-free and conducive to learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Larry is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, consistently helping students understand complex concepts and providing excellent feedback on assignments and quizzes. Students praise his availability and willingness to extend office hours, creating a stress-free learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Such a great TA! I struggle with math and RJ was so helpful and explained things so well! He is always willing to help and provides excellent feedback on quizzes and homework. Also posts grades very soon after quizzes are taken. Best TA I have had at Ohio State.
He is the best TA in the world!
GREAT TA!

He is a great TA...i understood everything we went over and at the same time learned... his class was so layed back and stress free!! always willing to help and extend his office hour if needed!! I WOULD TAKE HIS CLASS OVER AND OVER...NICE N EASY!!

summary_comment: Professor Tsikkou is known for her clear and structured teaching approach, following the book closely and providing helpful in-class examples. She assigns a reasonable amount of homework that is generously graded, making the course accessible as long as students keep up with the work. While her office hours are limited, she responds promptly to emails and addresses questions efficiently.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tsikkou provides clear and structured lectures that follow the textbook closely, with helpful in-class examples. Her teaching is straightforward, homework load is manageable but not overly so, and she offers generous grading. While office hours are limited, she responds promptly to emails and addresses questions effectively.

Ratings.comment: Follows book, in-class examples really helpful, straightforward. Reasonable amount of homework (I'd suggest you do a few extra for practice & time, though), very generous grading. Not difficult, as long as you don't fall behind on homework. Office hours were limited, but replied to e-mails and answered questions very quickly & clearly.

summary_comment: Professor Min is known for her clear and straightforward teaching style, which helps students understand the material if they pay attention and do the homework. However, her heavy accent and tendency to teach directly from the book can make lectures challenging for some, especially those without a strong math background. Despite these challenges, many students appreciate her ability to provide relevant examples and make the subject more approachable through her engaging personality.
summary_comment_short: Professor Min explains concepts clearly and effectively, though students note that understanding requires attentive listening and reading, especially for those less comfortable with math. Her lectures are most beneficial when combined with homework practice, and she provides relevant examples for exams.

Ratings.comment: She explains things straightforward and clear. You have to pay attention and read if you aren't good with math, but if you understand the homeworks her lectures make sense

She is not good, i'm not sure however if any of the other 151 teachers are any better. She has a heavy accent, she puts up problems straight from the book so her lectures aren't much help. It's hard to get a good answer to your questions from her. And she says "Rahhh?" a lot.

Min was a good prof and she explained things really well! Gave relevant examples to what would be on the midterm and even final! You'll have to work hard but she's the best for this class and her personality makes you not hate math as much.
AWESOME! highly recommended. midterms are not horrible. the final was a BREEZE. loved her she made my day with her jokes!
She was a good math professor if you already had a decent math back ground.  She often skipped steps and had to be corrected for missing signs and mixing up definitions.

Decent math teacher, can be difficult to understand at times.  Handwriting can sometimes be sloppy.  Exams were difficult but it is Math 254.  All homework is in the book and quizzes are similar to homework problems.

151 is going to be a hard class regardless of who your professor is.  If you do not have a background in Calc then it may be a very difficult class.  Professor Min teaches right from the book and may be hard to comprehend for the first week, but after getting used to her accent I think she was a pretty good lecturer.

It's a hard class, but 151 is going to be hard whoever your professor is. She does teach right from the book, but does a good job of answering questions in a lecture with over 200 people. She becomes easy to understand after the second week of class, and she works at a good pace so sometimes you get out a few minutes early.

This class was a breeze. She teaches very well and is a very entertaining person. Her English isn't perfect, but she tries. It never hindered my learning. I only wish I could have her for every math class.
I agree with what the previous person said, but I think they rated her too highly.

Professor Min was a OK teacher going through the class. However, our final was nothing  like the problems we had done before.  Also, based upon my grades, the averages and standard deviations of the class, there's no way she curved the final grade, as she said she would in the syllabus. Nice person, but not good for your GPA. Inconsistent teacher.

The tests were hard. They were few questions and if you missed one, your grade went down quite a bit. She was hard to understand but I got used to her accent. She teaches straight from the book. Do the homework! It's not mandatory but it helped.
Very nice person, most in class examples from the book but I think that is how most math classes are. Totally depends on TA too how well you do in this class.

She teaches pretty much straight from the book, examples and all. This is not too helpful because if you get stuck or do not fully understand something, looking at the book does not help any because thats what you were already given. Learn to love the tutor center...

Teaches straight from the book, which isn't really indicative of the departmental exams that you take.  Therefore she didn't really prepare students well for testing.  Hard class made worse by a subpar teacher, and the only TAs assigned to her class in the spring quarter had thick accents and were even harder to understand.
She tries but she is a bad teacher only teaches the examples out of the beginning of the chapter no point in going to class, will be teaching yourself, so get used to reading the book extensively

She is very nice and makes the textbook information easy to understand, but her tests are RIDICULOUSLY hard!  The exam material is not the same material that is covered in class.  I always studied hard and felt wholly unprepared for the exams.  The lecture and recitation material does not prepare you for her exams.

It's tough to understand her. She doesn't exactly prepare you for exams, but instead just teaches right from the book. I started attending a different lecture from an american and his class was much more helpful.

She is nice person and trying to help you if you have a problem. But the course itself is hard and the exams are ridiculus sometimes. Well I think it is important to get a good T.A. to get good grade for this class.

Quite honestly, I feel like this course would have been a lot harder for me if I hadn't taken AP Calculus in high school.  Her lectures are mainly explaining the example problems in the book.  We had Webwork in the course rather than regular homework from the book, and she was very helpful w/ that.  She is really nice. The course is really hard.

Many who English is their native language may feel she is not sufficient, but I think she is ok. It is true that she use everything from the textbook, but it also means you do not have to use textbook. For me, the webwork was only to practice and get not bad score. Quiz was quite easy but mid term was a little bit harder.

Although shes a nice person, her english is very rough and its hard to hear and keep up with her in class. either way she takes EVERYTHING right from the book and does not prepare you at all for exams and such. also not hot. the asian teacher that teaches before her is a fox. she doesnt even try

Her accent is difficult to understand in the first week or two, but you get used to it.  She is funny and is a good teacher overall.  She is very helpful any time you need help or have a question.  She is the type of teacher I wish were also my friend.

nothing special, she gets the job done.  For the math 130 series it's more about having a good recitation teacher anyways.  She actually could be quite funny in lectures, often times making fun of herself because she is chinese.  I would give her a B rating as a professor.

Honglin was a good enough professor. She is understandable, and she is funny at times. She knows what she is doing, and the midterms are fairly representative of the material. My only qualm was that she spent a lot of time helping out people who shouldn't have taken the class. If your major starts with "g-e-o", please take biology as a tech elec.

summary_comment: Professor Runco is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively simplifying complex mathematical concepts to make them accessible and understandable for all students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Runco is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively making complex mathematical concepts accessible and straightforward for her students. Her ability to simplify difficult ideas significantly enhances the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Take a math class with her! She's so good at teaching.
Very good at explaining difficult concepts. Makes math seem easy.

summary_comment: Professor Stephens is highly regarded for his effectiveness in teaching Math 151, known for being very helpful and maintaining a light-hearted approach that makes attending recitations worthwhile. Unlike some instructors, he does not rely solely on the textbook, instead leveraging WebWork problems, recitation exercises, and past midterm questions to prepare students. His teaching style is particularly beneficial for those with a background in calculus who are looking to excel in the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Stephens is highly regarded for his helpfulness and humor, making the challenging Math 151 course more manageable. He focuses on practical problem-solving techniques and provides valuable resources like WebWork and past midterms, though he occasionally minimizes textbook usage.

Ratings.comment: Math 151 sucks but Keith was very helpful and pretty funny. Recommended... the professor for this class (Banerjee) was useless. Made going to recitation easy. Didn't use book once. Problems from webwork, recitation problems, and old midterms can get you by if you've had calc before and you're decent at it.

summary_comment: Professor Lee is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students citing his inability to effectively communicate complex ideas, reliance on simply copying textbook content during lectures, and failure to adequately prepare students for exams. Exams are noted to be difficult and often cover material not sufficiently addressed in class, leading to low average scores and frustration among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lee is widely regarded as one of the worst teachers, with students criticizing his poor communication skills, lack of clarity in explanations, and failure to adequately prepare students for exams. His classes often consist of simply copying from the book, and his tests are known to be extremely difficult and not reflective of the material covered in class, leading to low average scores and no curving of grades.

Ratings.comment: He is the worst!he cannot put his thought into language at all and all he does in class is copying the book. if u ask him questions in the office hour, he blew u off. Once I asked why my answer is incorrect, he said the answer key is online. I knew the answer is online but I wanna reason why my particular thought is not correct ok??

Smart guy who cant teach linear. Misled about what kind of material would be on first midterm and sorely underprepared by his lectures I got a 50 on the 1st midterm. I stopped going altogether and just taught myself out of the book. This got me a 90 on the 2nd midterm and a 93 on the final. You do the math; no pun intended.

One of the worst math professors I have ever had.  His tests do not cover the important topics of the material and are somewhat irrelevant at times.  Additionally, all examples he shows are from text.Therefore, there is no additional or new ways of showing information presented.  His tests are very hard and average hovers around D.DO NOT TAKE CLASS

No Contest, the worst teacher I've had for any subject.  His tests contain questions that require methods not explained in the text book and since you can't understand or learn anything from him, you are out of luck.  Gave me a 0 out of 20 points on a midterm problem despite getting the correct answer and showing all of my work.  Terrible teacher.
do not take.

Dr. Lee basically worked the example problems from the textbook on the board in class every day.  The exams, though, were incredibly difficult and many of the questions were only quickly covered in class while other important topics were left out of exams.  Exam average was below 60 percent, but he didn't curve the class. Very difficult to get an A
Gangyong is funny but not very good at teaching.  The only good thing is his review sheets for midterms and final. If you can do all the review questions you will be fine.

He was very hard to understand. He did not present ideas clearly. He spent too much time on things that were irrelevant to the subject matter. His explanation of concepts lacked clarity and continuity. The most helpful thing he does for his students is give them review sheets for the exams. However, the exams are very long.
Nice teacher, very interested in helping students learn but has communication issues- especially when trying to teach new-to-the-student concepts.
Funny guy...helpful hard to understand sometimes but laughs at himself for his English
Willing to help, funny and generally nice!

summary_comment: Professor Castravet is known for being disorganized, with lectures that lack coherence and little connection to the textbook or homework assignments. Despite this, she has a significant impact on students, particularly inspiring some to delve deeper into abstract algebra, as evidenced by her influence over multiple semesters of both undergraduate and graduate students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Castravet is known for being disorganized, with lectures that lack coherence and little connection between class discussions, textbook material, and homework assignments. Despite this, she has also inspired some students, particularly in abstract algebra, though her teaching style and exam structure have been criticized.

Ratings.comment: Prof Castravet is very disorganized and her lectures make very little sense. The textbook and the homework are very unrelated to things discussed in class. Her tests are 3 questions and homework is graded way too detailed. The only reason I didn't fail this class is because of the large curve at the end of the semester.
Dr. Castravet inspired me to pursue abstract algebra. In total, I had her for 3 semesters' worth: 2 undergrad, and one graduate. Back then, she was at UA, and it is a shame UA could not keep her.

summary_comment: Professor Ozcakir is highly regarded for her knowledge and friendliness, though her teaching effectiveness is somewhat hampered by the course setup. Students appreciate her availability during office hours and her willingness to help, but many find the class challenging and wish for more support outside of these times. Overall, while she is smart and dedicated, her ability to convey information clearly can be an issue.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ozcakir is well-regarded for her knowledge and friendliness, though her teaching effectiveness is somewhat undermined by issues with course structure and availability. Students appreciate her willingness to help but note inconsistencies in her presence and communication skills.

Ratings.comment: She is a pretty good professor. However the course setting is totally a disaster.
A really nice and friendly instructor who knows her material well !

Ozge is pretty damn awesome. The material is hard but she tries to help you in and out of class.You have to do the extra work outside of class but none the less she is pretty Great. And HOT IN PERSON!

Not a fair teacher.  Assigned homework, graded it, but did not help with the assigned problems.  She was very helpful during office hours, but would not help us outside of office hours, in particular during class.  Also, she is teaching a specific section of FEH students, and yet there is no teamwork building exercises in her class.
Very smart, but has a hard time conveying what she is thinking

She seems very nice. But it looks like she has some relationship problems. Had her last year and she was really good at teaching, but recently she doesn't seem herself. I would recommend her if she resolves her problems. otherwise you'd be better off with some other TA. She grades fairly and is willing to help, if you could find her on campus.

summary_comment: Professor Ravisankar is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and dedication to his students' success. Students find him clear and thorough in his lectures, with a strong emphasis on problem-solving. While some note his thick accent and fast pace, they consistently praise his availability and willingness to help outside of class, making him a standout instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ravisankar is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and dedication to his students' success. Students consistently praise his clarity in lectures, availability during office hours, and his strong commitment to helping them understand complex mathematical concepts.

Ratings.comment: Siva was great. Enjoyed the class. Incredibly helpful in office hours.

Born in India, has thick accent, talks and writes fast. Overall, a great teacher. Interested in helping students. Lecture isn't mandatoy but it is extremely helpful for the material. He does have a habit of talking about irrelevant things. I recommend him.
Hard class overall but he was an excellent teacher and cares about his students and their success in the class.
Sivaguru asked us to call him Siva. He was really clear during lectures and helpful outside of lecture. and he is adorable which definitely helps.

Siva was by far the best teacher I have had at Ohio State.  If you have the opportunity to take his class, I DEFINITELY would.  Absolutely unbelievable teacher.  He really cares about hist students, math, and teaching!!!
born to be a math teacher. After reviewed all he's taught, u can do all the problems on book
Ravisankar was at least 5 minutes everyday, but his excellent teaching more than made up for it. He does MANY sample problems and answers questions on the spot very nicely. Highly reccommended.

summary_comment: Professor Flicker is widely regarded as one of the poorest quality math professors at OSU, with student comments citing impossibly difficult exams, confusing lectures, and a dismissive attitude towards student inquiries. Lectures are described as pointless and structured poorly, with many students recommending avoiding him entirely and seeking help from the math lab or recitations instead.
summary_comment_short: Professor Flicker is widely regarded as one of the poorest quality math professors at OSU, with impossibly difficult exams that typically result in failing class averages, and a poor attitude towards student inquiries. His lectures are often seen as confusing and unhelpful, and many students advise avoiding him entirely.

Ratings.comment: Terrible

Poorest quality math professor at OSU (and I've had 10 now). Impossibly difficult exams (class averages were in the failing range for every exam). Bad attitude toward students who ask for help. Says everything is "obvious." Avoid at all costs.
Gets sidetracked easily and loses his place often. I think his lectures confuse, more than clarify, the material. He has a cool accent.
His lectures are pointless.

His accent is difficult and his lectures are pointless. He reads right off the projector slides that come straight out of the book. I took calc in HS but somehow got a C in this class. Try to find a diff prof for this class or really utilize the math lab with the TA's. Nobody checks your calculator for exams so put in some programs w/ the equations

The lectures were pointless: Often he made mistakes and generally it was hard to grasp concepts: Going to Recitation is a MUST. On the positive side, seems like a very nice guy, maybe I just had a bad experience.
Absolutely no point attending lectures because he doesn't explain things in a clear or structured manner. Avoid him at all costs.

Yuval was a nice guy and very knowledgeable.  However, 60% of the problems assigned for homework were not even graded or discussed in class.  Also, reviews before midterms were not very valuable.  Although I made it out alive, I think I would have enjoyed the other section more.

Don't even think about taking a class with him. He is useless, his hws are tough, and he won't do any of them on class.Exams are hadrer than hws. He just uses example from the book in lecture. i made one of the worst decisions in my life to take it with him
Not good at conveying his knowledge to students.

His explaining of the concepts was not great but not bad either. The homeworks were very time consuming but very useful. And he would spend a good deal of time going over them in class. I went to his room a few times and he was really helpful. Good teacher overall.
Helpful outside of class, and he gave me a good grade so I can't complain!

Heh, I skipped all of his lectures except the first week to see if he was good. Gave him a redeeming shot on the midterm review, and left 10 minutes in because he's simply that useless. The book was very helpful in that class, but expect to teach yourself everything if you have him.
Very willing to meet with students when approached outside of class - don't hesitate to contact him!
definitely knows his stuff when it comes to math
The lecture was terrible because he couldn't explain anything.  I had to rely on the TA to teach the material.
He obviously knows math but he does not know how to teach. He was very confusing and I think he needs to try a different career because teaching is not for him.
Yech, I didn't learn anything in class with him.  He was very confusing, I suggest you find a tutor or be ready to study a ton on your own.
I had never failed any class (after 3 years) until I took his! He can't explain anything.  If you get his class, try to find it with someone else!

He is a very nice person, but not a very good professor. He knows what he is talking about and will try to help you, but does not have very good communication skills. But like any other math class, you do not need to go to lectures if you can figure it out on your own from the book.
Haha- poor guy didn't know what he was talking about. I'm sure he does, but he doesn't have a good way of communicating the info to students:(
he is the reason that i failed 132, if you get him get out of that class.  he couldnt even do the problems straight out of the book right!
