worst teacher to ever be on the face of this planet
He is very unclear and unprepared
No Comments

Extremely unclear. Comes to class late/unprepared. Does the example problems in book (just changes the numbers) - still makes mistakes. I couldn't understand what he was saying most of the time because of accent. Class started at 80+ students, ended with average of 20 or less per day. Stay clear.

Seems as if he goes out of his way to ruin problems.  He spends five minutes on a problem, then goes back over it, makes corrections to his own problems, then repeats.  He must think it is funny to confuse a class of 100 students.
I managed to spend an entire quarter in his class without learning a single thing.  He's quite incomprehensible and very unhelpful.  Our class started with 25 students and ended with around 12.
Horrible.
He was so lost during his lectures that not even the book could keep me in his class.

There was no relation between homework and exams; lectures were impromptu and consisted of him stumbling through examples, screwing them up, and finally abandoning them as "too hard."  Our class average was below 50% at one point!  Worst prof I
No Comments
No Comments
Thought I didn't like him, but adjusted to his style of teaching liked much more

summary_comment: Professor Snider is highly regarded by many students as an exceptionally clear and knowledgeable instructor who is willing to dedicate significant time to office hours. However, some find him intimidating and strict, with a tendency to call on students during lectures, which can be challenging for those who are less confident or prepared. Overall, his effectiveness as a teacher varies widely among students, with some finding him indispensable and others deeming him difficult and overly rigid.
summary_comment_short: Professor Snider is highly regarded as one of the best TAs, known for his clarity, willingness to spend extra time in office hours, and deep understanding of the subject matter. However, some students find him intimidating and strict, with varying opinions on his teaching style and grading criteria.

Ratings.comment: One of the best teachers ever.  Most helpful

Dude is clear as could be. Strict, but more than willing to spend FAR more time in office hours than he's required. He can be a little gruff, but he warms up halfway through the semester. Without a doubt, best TA I've ever had.

Intimidating and patronizing. Be prepared to answer questions because he will call on you even if you don't volunteer. I'll give him credit though- he knows his material. If you study hard and suck up you'll be fine, but if you put minimum work in and are shy- good luck!

I've only had him for recitation, but from I've witnessed, he is a terrible teacher. I found him both patronizing and annoying to listen to. He is one of those graders that requires the answer to be found just the way he desires, not another correct way. He allows for zero shortcuts and is very anal. He also takes attendance every day. DO NOT TAKE!
amazing TA. couldn't ask for a better one. easy quizzes. he's the only reason why i passed math 131, haha.
An amazing TA. So helpful and so kind. Does a great job of explaining the material and thoroughly understands the subject matter. Got a 98 in the class because of him.

Best math TA I have EVER had. He is actually interested in teaching math and he will help you understand it if you don't! He strongly encourages you to use him as a resource. I actually enjoyed waking up to go to his class.
No Comments
Explains Math better than any teacher Ive ever had and definitely ranks as one of the best.
ron was the best math teacher i've ever had. he explains everything & answers questions.  he answers homework problems if you ask also. great man.

summary_comment: Professor Fessel is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, clarity in lectures, and dedication to student success. She effectively works through problems, making her lectures invaluable, and her exams closely mirror the material covered in class. While her final exam can be challenging, she remains supportive and accessible, offering help through office hours and emails.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fessel is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, clarity in lectures, and commitment to student success. Her lectures closely mirror exam content, making them invaluable for preparation, and she is known for her accessibility and willingness to help students through office hours and emails.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Fessel was hands down the best math professor that I have ever had.  She was crystal clear in lectures and worked out problems while talking through her thought processes.  She wants all her students to succeed.  She definitely cares.  Don't skip her lectures because they are helpful!  Her exams are almost identicle to lecturesreviews.

She is a fantastic professor and lecturer. Her midterm exams were just like what we practiced in class and from the review problems. She is very open to questions and wants you to pass. The final exam was difficult.

Very good professor. Wants students to be successful. Always willing to answer questions via email or office hours. Notes are taken from the book, so best to see her directly for any questions or problems you may find yourself stuck on. Midterm exam questions very fair and similar to homework review problems. Final exam was quite difficult.

summary_comment: Professor Oppenheim covers the necessary basics effectively, though his lectures can be challenging to follow due to his accent. While his exams are generally fair and not excessively difficult, they require significant preparation, especially given the use of obscure problems from the textbook. Students find his teaching quality mixed, with some noting his ability to explain material clearly and his sense of humor, while others find his lectures dry and unhelpful without additional support from TAs and self-study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Oppenheim covers the necessary basics effectively, though his lectures can be challenging to follow due to his accent. His exams are generally fair, with a moderate difficulty level, and he provides helpful policies like a generous curve and lenient grading on homework and quizzes. However, some students find his teaching style dry and his explanations lacking, particularly without prior calculus experience.

Ratings.comment: This lecturer covered all the basic stuff you need to know. Tests weren't easy but they weren't as hard as some of the other students below claim. The curve helped to push the grade up and his policy on homework and quizzes (where any grade above 80% considered full credit) helped most of the students to get full credit in those.

Oppenheim does have an accent, but the real problem  understanding him is that he never explains anything.  He copies definitions and examples from the text directly and then moves on.  On review day he can't solve his own homework sometimes.  Pray for a good TA if you've never seen this stuff before.  Last two tests were insanely hard, be prepared

He has a heavy accent, and lectures covered basic concepts. TAs were most helpful. The final was IMPOSSIBLE and lots of m.c. so be sure to do well and prepare for midterms. He used obscure problems from the textbook, and my TA predicted some.  Don't rely on past calculus knowledge, and do lots of obscure practice problems.  HW was annoyingly long.

After the first week, his accent became understandable.  Pros: Doesn't spend much time on proofs. Exams are fair (70%-80% average). Clear handwriting. Has good anecdotes. Ends class early. Wiling to work out any problem  Cons: Some lectures are very boring. Final was designed by other professor and was nearly impossible (was multiple choice).

Other reviews complain about his accent, but I did not find him very hard to understand. Not a bad class if you have taken some calc before, but lecture can get kinda dry sometimes. Recitation was pretty helpful, and midterms were not terrible if you studied for them. Do the problems from the book!! They help.
Overall he is a good teacher. His accent can be a little heavy, but he usually explains the material well and highlights the important points. He can also be very funny.
When he tells you, in his thick accent, that a question won't be as hard on the midterm or final as the example he's going through, he's lying. Be prepared for some rough midterms.

Probably the least helpful professor I've ever had.  Don't bother with lecture, it's difficult to understand and he has a tendency to rush important topics.  Read the text, go to recitation, pray for easy test problems.  This class was difficult for me even when I was doing fine in all my other classes because the lectures were so unhelpful.

Has a weird accent making it hard to understand sometimes. Overall not a bad professor, but could do a better job lecturing. The weekly quizzes in this class are a pain. Do not be afraid to ask him questions after class.
Pretty good professor.  Teaches right from the book, but is helpful if you approach him after class or at office hours.  He doesn't have power points online, so go to class.
Lectures are confusing and handwriting is pretty bad. I stopped going to lecture and just went to recitation and read the textbook.

As noted in previous comments - he is very nice and very helpful (he always had time for students - he met anyone who requested outside the usual office hours). The course wasn't easy, but I learned a lot. His tests were very fair, but you did have to study and know your stuff. In my opinion he is great teacher if you really want to learn.
Teaches straight out of the book and nothing more
Good lecturer for math; best I've had, understandability wise.  Generally provides useful examples and doesn't dwell too much on things like proofs that aren't tested on.
An excellent teacher!!!
Good teacher and a really nice guy - he did above and beyond: he gave me (and other students) special office hours, because I couldn't make the regular office hours.

He does have a strong accent, But it didn't bother me. I found sitting at the front helpful. He did a great job making sure he covered everything that would be on the test. If you go to lecture, take notes, and pay attention, you should be fine. I did not attend office hours, but imagine he would be helpful in that setting.

He is hard to understand. His handwriting is poor. He copies all of his "work" straight from the textbook (making his lectures pointless). He rushes through everything. In short, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!
aas a strong accent, but nice professor and friendly.
Has an accent, but it didn't bother me

He is extremely hard to understand and always rushes through the lessons.  Professor also teaches straight from the textbook and gives no other knowledge of the subject.  He has a strong accent and is hard to understand.  Do not take Calculus with him if it is your first time, I learned the hard way and will most likely fail.

summary_comment: Professor Werner is highly regarded for his fairness and thorough explanations, often praised as one of the best math teachers at OSU. Students appreciate his detailed reviews and fair testing, though some note his lectures can be repetitive. His recitations are particularly valued for enhancing understanding, with many students finding them far more helpful than the main lectures.
summary_comment_short: Professor Werner is highly regarded for his fairness and thorough explanations, making him one of the best math teachers at OSU according to students. His tests are described as fair, and he provides extensive support through weekly quizzes, homework, and recitations, which significantly enhance students' understanding of the material.

Ratings.comment: He was a great professor, and probably the most fair of all my past math teachers. He would give reviews for all the midterms and exams, and all of the problems on them were harder than the actual test questions. He does quizzes and homework each week but he is a super easy grader. If you want an A, take this course with him.
Really good teacher. He explained concepts well, and his tests were fair.
Nick is the best math teacher OSU I've had. He explains concepts very well. His tests are fair, and he is great at answering questions.
Very thorough, not very sympathetic though.

Great TA. Knew what he was talking about and was always very helpful. He was also very understanding. He would always stop and go over anything if anyone had any questions. Explained the material better than the lecturer.

Repetitive, I know, but amazing TA. Without recitation twice a week I wouldn't have understood this class at all. I learned more in a 20 minute review with him than a 48 minute lecture. Plus his extra credit questions were hilarious!
Great TA.  Much better than my prof (Fiedorowicz) for explaining the material.  His lecture is completely worthless, if it weren't for recitation with Nick I would be completely lost.

summary_comment: Professor Valenzuela is highly regarded for his thorough and methodical teaching approach, making complex mathematical concepts accessible. Students appreciate his care and willingness to provide additional support, though some note that the department's resources and exam structures present significant challenges. His clarity in teaching and engagement in helping students improve their understanding are consistently highlighted.
summary_comment_short: Professor Valenzuela is highly regarded for his thorough teaching methods and caring nature, making complex mathematical concepts accessible to students. Despite challenges posed by the department, he consistently offers additional support and maintains an engaging, often humorous lecture style.

Ratings.comment: Fantastic, caring post-doc. He knows his stuff, and is very methodical, which is great for mathematics
He does his best with what the math department gives him. Always willing to see you if you think you need extra help. His lectures are pretty engaging, and he's pretty funny too.

Gabriel is a great lecturer. The math department itself is where the real issues with the Math 1151 course lies. Gabriel makes do with what he is given from the department and really tries to communicate with his students about what's going on with grades and such. He's very nice, super helpful, and extremely caring. Also can be funny!

Had Dr. Valenzuela for Math 4580, one of the hardest undergrad math classes. Very caring and helpful professor, really goes the extra smile to help students. English is his second language but it barely makes a difference. Curved each exam as well so our grades were reasonable. Definitely a great professor to have.

not necessarily a bad review on the teacher, mostly the department itself. The professors teach one thing, then the department makes an exam on completely different information. Everyone struggles (our exam2 average was a 50%) I understand its a weed out course but it's unrealistically hard. I would be happy to end with a C,but i currently have a F
Very clear. Especially compared to the horror stories of other linear algebra professors. He's definitely the best from what I've heard of others and would definitely take his class again
Gabriel was the only part of calc I that I genuinely enjoyed.

He was a great person and nice guy, but he would spend most of class on a problem then with 5 minutes left, he would get the wrong answer and tell us to find where he messed up, basically used the textbook to learn. I went to office hours and worked hard but nothing helped. The tests were like none of the sample problems or quizzes
Professor Valenzuela will go to any length to help you. Great lecturer and always does his best to clearly portray the material to students. My favorite professor so far.

summary_comment: Professor Yan offers a challenging yet manageable course, effectively clarifying complex material through detailed explanations and extensive practice problems during recitations. Students find his TA sessions particularly valuable due to his willingness to provide additional help through numerous examples.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yan offers clear explanations and helpful recitations, making his class manageable despite its difficulty. He provides numerous examples and is supportive in his assistance.

Ratings.comment: Hands down one of the most difficult classes that Ohio state has to offer, but Pan Yan really clarifies the material and makes the class extremely manageable. His recitations are very helpful and he does tons of practice problems and explains them very well. If you can, definitely get him as your TA.
He goes over many helpful examples and is always willing to help

summary_comment: Professor Minemyer is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and genuine desire to help students succeed. His lectures are clear, engaging, and easy to follow, and he goes above and beyond to ensure students understand the material. Students appreciate his friendliness, humor, and availability during office hours, which significantly enhance their learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Minemyer is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and genuine desire to help students succeed. His lectures are clear, easy to follow, and engaging, with many students praising his friendliness, humor, and willingness to assist outside of class.

Ratings.comment: He doesn't write the exams for MATH1152, so he can't determine how difficult they will be. He's an amazing lecturer and very helpful outside of class. Just bring a list of your questions to one of his early office hours and you'll leave understanding the material much better than before.

Barry is so genuine and awesome, he really wants you to succeed. He offers a lot of help and his lectures are very easy to follow. Best professor I have had. He is a great guy and although the class is tough, he will do what he can to ensure you do the best you can.
Barry is hilarious. He made lectures interesting and made sure help was available if you need it. Calc 2 is hard but he is definitely one of the best professors to take it with.

Barry is an amazing teacher. He is really good about answering any and all questions during class even if he's in the middle of explaining something. He just really wants everyone to understand what is going on. Of course the class is difficult because it is calculus but he is so good at teaching that it feels a lot easier. Lot's of jokes & stories

I started skipping my other calc lecture to go to this one.  Totally worth waking up for the 8am class.  He saved my calc grade- I would have failed with my other lecturer and I ended with a B+ once I switched lectures!
Barry is by far the most friendly and funny professor I've taken a class with. If you can, take any class with this guy. He's amazing.
He's super friendly! He's more than heppy to help others, and is super understanding and chill.
Best teacher that I met in osu. His lecture is clear and easy to understand

summary_comment: Professor Chen is known for his challenging exams and thick accent, which make his lectures difficult to follow. Students find his teaching style dry and unengaging, often recommending sitting in the front and using external resources for better understanding. Overall, Professor Chen is considered a poor choice for this course due to his communication issues and the difficulty of his assessments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chen is known for his challenging exams and thick accent, which make lectures difficult to follow. Students consistently report that his teaching style does not effectively prepare them for the exams, and many advise avoiding his classes altogether.

Ratings.comment: He is very hard to understand so if you have him definitely sit toward the front of the class. The exams are pretty hard but he gave a lot of partial credit so even if you feel like you fail an exam you might actually do okay. Lectures are incredibly boring and dry. I ended up on my phone most days. He's a nice guy though.

Haoije Chen is a bad professor not just because of his accent that makes his lectures hard to understand but for not even attempting engagement of any kind. In a class as conceptually difficult as Calc III it's important to incorporate an understanding of the fundamentals, and instead Chen breezes through example problems and makes exams difficult.

He doesn't explain how to do the problems, he just solves them and expects that you can follow along. Very broken English. The TA and Professor don't communicate what the final will be like, so review problems given by the TA are easier than what the actual Midterm will be like. Don't take this class with him even if he is the last option left.

Avoid at all costs. Exams are just ridiculously tough compared to the review problems and quiz problems he has you do. I hate to be that guy, but his English is pitiful. Calc 3 is already difficult enough as it is. If you unfortunately find yourself in his class and it is too late to drop, look up Prof. Leonard on Youtube. Salvage what you can.

Awful, don't take this class. I really enjoy math and I got straight A's in Calc 1 and 2, but I'm really struggling in calc 3. The exams and quizzes are terrible and the proffesor is hard to approach, I wish I dropped it , that's the biggest regret. Will probably have to retake it again I think.

JUST DO NOT TAKE THIS MAN! HE IS A DISASTER!! He loves to trick students in Midterms and final, speaks half English, hard to understand, tricky and cheeky. He should not be teaching here, it is highly questionable why he was hired for this position.

I just want to give one unsolicited advice: DO NOT TAKE HIM! Makes exams extremely tricky and hard for students, very hard to understand his Half-Spoken english. No idea, why the math department chose him as a professor.  Just one thing to say: One of the biggest regrets of my life was to take CAL 3 with him!
He has a thick accent and is very difficult to understand. His quizzes and reviews are so much easier than exams so the exams are hard to prepare for.

I honestly couldn't tell you if he is a good lecturer or not. Neither I nor my international roommate (from China) could understand a word he said. Because of this, his lectures are extremely dry. Beyond his accent, his teaching style seems very unorganized. If you need a strong lecturer to succeed in class, I'd highly recommend dropping.
Complete every single homework problems, and the midterms and finals will be a breeze. No quizzes, 3 midterms and 1 final. No extra credit offered either.

Multiple choice exams, horrible if you have test anxiety. Consistently bails on office hours, at least the ones I went to. English is broken and solves everything via proofs. No online presence for review material or assistance.

His lectures zip by, just write down the key points and all examples for the exam. His language is clear. He is VERY helpful during office hours and if you go, it's evident that he enjoys helping his students. HW assigned from book way harder than what you'll see on exams. Exams mostly multiple choice and similar to review set assigned from book

His accent is hard to understand, but you can get all the information from what he writes on the board. I used the book a lot to really understand what was going on and doing his practice problems is essential to doing well on the quizzes/exams. His exams are completely mathematical and straightforward unlike other professors who test on the theory

He's a good professor, I enter the class nearly 2 weeks later than the regular student, and he just delayed all the deadline of my homework. I am not good at math,once I go to see him by walk in hours and bring the online homework to ask him, helped me to solve the homework! Before the exam, there's a review section that will give you all formula

His accent makes him difficult to understand in class, but if you go to his office hours he is extremely helpful. The quizzes can be tough, but if you do all the practice problems he assigns and understand them you will almost certainly ace his exams. Overall his lectures are not very helpful but if you do the work outside of class you will do well

I was skeptical coming into this class, but am actually grateful I had the opportunity to take it with him. Tests are incredibly straightforward; know how to do every practice problem he gives you and you will get an A. Quizzes are a little more difficult, but he also drops the lowest score. Definitely take it with him if you have the chance.

100% of grade is from tests. Tests are basically book questions. Will answer any question you ask. Got a B+ because I never ed studied until night before exam, nor shown up to class, nor had a textbook. Failed very quiz, aced the exams. Over all very easy
No homework but the tests and quizzes were pretty hard. You'll need the textbook to do the practice problems he gives on Carmen. Thick accent, but if you sit up front he's not hard to follow.

This professor SAVED MY SCHOOL YEAR. I was in my 2nd semester redoing Calc 3 and after bombing the 1st midterm i realized i needed help (I never needed help in school b4) He really does care if his students understand the material and if they pass the class. Sure, his accent is hard to get past, but Come in office hours and he will help you learn.

I took notes on just about everything he put on the board and it was key to my success.  His speech is pretty much a non factor in his teaching, though you learn to pick up what you need. From time to time I had questions after class, and he was happy to oblige. He had review classes before the exams to go back over the key formulas, super nice.

He can be hard to understand, but after a little bit of time, his accent is easy to get used to.  His quizzes are hard, but they don't really count toward your grade much.  He gives very fair tests.  Overall, he's not bad, but he's certainly not the best teacher I've ever had.

Was pleasantly surprised by this teacher.  Thought he would be difficult to understand but explained all the material quite clearly.  The tests are straightforward and he wants his students to pass.  He decided to drop the lowest quiz grade and the end of the semester to help boost students grades.
Do not take his course !!!!!! It seems that he has no idea of how to give a lecture. He is talking to himself all the  time. However, he could perfectly help you getting enough naps.
Not hard

Hard to understand (his speaking and writing). Did not appear to know the material he was presenting as he constantly stood at the board with his book in hand copying from the book. Not helpful to students and would give up when reviewing quizzes and exams and ask the students for the right answers instead of working out problems on the board.

summary_comment: Professor Bean is known for being a rigorous lecturer who ensures high standards in his class, though his infrequent and unpredictable office hours make it challenging for students to seek additional help. Despite this, he offers generous extra credit and bases quizzes on homework assignments. While some find his lectures straightforward and easy, others describe them as somewhat boring due to their clarity and focus.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bean is known for being a rigorous but fair instructor, though his lack of consistent office hours and limited availability at the MSLC made it challenging for students to get additional help. Despite this, he offers generous extra credit and bases quizzes on homework assignments.

Ratings.comment: The real only complaint I have about Mr. Bean is his lack of accessibility. He rarely held office hours, and they changed frequently. The MSLC room for the class is smaller than my dorm room, so getting help was difficult. Mr. Bean actually gave a lot of extra credit, and made the quizzes based off of the homework, which was very generous.

This course itself is very hard, and I don't think Andrew let anything slide. Grad student lecturer I believe. Not many grades go into your final grade. 5 homework quizzes (& you don't get to use the homework on them). Two questions worth 10% of your grade for each quiz. Yikes. Not a bad lecturer, but pretty boring.

Stats are something most college students fear but this class was very easy. Andrew is extremely clear and straight to the point. He provides outlines for his lectures. The class isn't that hard. You even get to have a note sheet for the tests! They just want you to pass. He tries his absolute hardest to make this class tolerable and easy.

summary_comment: Professor Clemens is a highly regarded instructor known for his engaging and laid-back teaching style, which many students find charming despite his challenging handwriting and occasional difficulties in explaining concepts. While some students found his exams straightforward and his teaching methods innovative and effective, others struggled with his teaching approach and found the material difficult without prior knowledge. Overall, his commitment to helping students and flexible homework policies are widely appreciated.
summary_comment_short: Professor Clemens is highly regarded for his engaging and laid-back teaching style, which many students found enjoyable despite initial challenges with his handwriting and explanation clarity. While some found his exams straightforward and his teaching methods innovative, others noted issues with his pacing and time management, leading to gaps in coverage and occasional confusion.

Ratings.comment: Although his handwriting sucks and sometimes he has trouble explaining things, everyone in my class loved him by the end because there's just something charming about him. He's pretty funny and makes the class feel very laid-back. I met some really awesome people in my class and it was honestly one of my favorite classes by the end.
Not the best professor. Only thing I liked about him was that his exams (which he wrote himself) were just over basic concepts.

GREAT PROFESSOR!  Very different style of teaching, he uses packets of about 6 problems that you start in class (with him lecturing/helping) and finish for HW.  Great HW policy, very flexible, no reason not to get an A. Highly recommended

Herb does not teach you what you need to know, after our first midterm he had to apologize for not teaching us everything on the exam and for telling us to study for the wrong things. the class average was a 50% Avoid him if you have never taken calc before, but if you know what your doing its a very easy class.

"Professor Clemens has achieved the Aristotelian ideal..."...the person who wrote this was Clemens himself, a complete waste of time.  Part of the reason the OSU Math Department is becoming lower in quality each year.

He is a great teacher. He sometimes does not manage his time well, on occasions we were unable to get certain topics we needed to cover. He is more than willing to help students. His exams are fair and manageable, meaning no curve is usually needed.

The class format was interesting.  We filled out worksheets which were to become our text.  He's a notorious "step-skipper" when writing out various calculations which makes some lectures and notes hard to study from.

One of the best teachers I have ever had! Made the material easy to understand and would not move on until we understood it. I loved the structure of the class. In class we worked in groups on the worksheets he gave us, which would become our textbook. As a result I learned a great amount and met some awesome people.
The living bobblehead.  Will lose himself with his subscripts and superscripts to the point he stops moving and his head bobbles...I think he just needs a reset button

Clemens shows his sincere interest in making a difference in elementary academics throughout the quarter.  I didn't realize what he taught was so right on until I had to use his lecture to make fractions make sense to a fourth grader.
I wish they would have an experienced elementary school teacher teach this class. You could tell Clemens has not spent much time caring for small children.

Professor Clemens has achieved the Aristotelian ideal of professorship. His lectures are outstandingly clear; his lifelong passion for math education work is reflected in each presentation and in his office-hours discussions.

A bit confusing, but a good teacher.  He really makes you understand the processes behind the material.  If you make sure to go to class and read the book- be sure to take notes on his abstract reasoning and do your homework, you'll do great!
confusing, I don't think he has ever taught math to young children so I don't see why he is teaching this class.

Extremly confusing. What he talks about in class has nothing to do with what is in the book. Does not seem to communicate with TAs cuz they will say an answer is one thing and he will say it is something different. Does not seem to know much about childre

summary_comment: Professor Sorcar is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and clarity in explaining concepts. Students find her approachable and helpful, especially during office hours, and appreciate her willingness to assist those who need extra support. Her exams and quizzes are considered fair, though challenging, particularly for those new to the subject, and she emphasizes the importance of engagement and active participation in class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sorcar is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and clarity in explaining complex concepts. Students find her approachable and helpful, especially during office hours, and appreciate her efforts to engage them in the material and encourage understanding.

Ratings.comment: She was nice and good at explaining concepts. Exams and quizzes were fair. If you took AP calculus in high school this course shouldn't be too difficult. Go to office hours for help on the written homework. Once she brought her puppy to lecture and it was really cute :,)

Sometimes engaging, often informative lectures. Exams will thoroughly test your knowledge of the material, but are fair. Quizzes help you to gauge how well you know the material. Prof. Sorcar was helpful in office hours.

The difficulty rating on her is bogus if it is for Math 2568. She is always willing to help if you need it and is very clear about what she wants. Further, the OSU brand of Linear Algebra is not theoretical or proof-driven at all, so it may as well be a Freshman math class. Overall, very good teacher and very easy class.

Ganges is pretty good as a teacher.  She makes more of an effort than most to be clear and thorough with her teaching, and if you pay attention and participate in class it will pay off. The book parallels very well with the class, so using it helps enforce the material even more. Tests are pretty hard, but if you pay attention you should be fine.

Not a very difficult class. Gangotryi(Ganges) is a good teacher and is very clear on what you should expect to appear on the exams. She tries making the class engaging and encourages her students to think for themselves. Would definitely recommend anyone to take Linear Algebra(2568) with her.

She is a really good professor and is really good at helping students that don't understand. Go to office hours and ask questions if you are confused. She grades really tough, and her section is usually the hardest. A lot of the exam questions are more theoretical, and really a lot harder than the homework problems. Over all a great, but hard grade

Ganges is a great teacher. She identifies as tutor, and teaches her class as a large office hours. She presents problems and asks for participation as she solves them. She wants students to become engaged and understand the material. She wants students to succeed. She can be funny in way. If you have trouble SEE HER.

She's a good lecturer and gives in class examples that are really helpful. Homework isn't taken for a grade, but if you don't do it, you'll be boned on the midterm. Even though there isn't a participation grade, she's a lot more lenient with partial credit if you speak up in class.

Rarely gave partial credit on any exams (e.g. missed 3 out of 5 points for a simple arithmetic error while getting the concept completely correct). Quizzes are only worth 2 points so if you make any kind of simple mistake you're in trouble.

summary_comment: Professor Palmer is highly regarded for his clear explanations and dedication to ensuring students understand the material. Students find him approachable and supportive, often staying behind to answer questions and offering additional office hours. While some note the class time is limited for the amount of material covered, his teaching style is praised for making even challenging topics accessible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Palmer is highly regarded for his clear explanations and thorough coverage of material, making complex concepts accessible to students. He is described as a very caring and understanding instructor who goes out of his way to ensure students understand the content, often staying after class to help students and maintaining open office hours.

Ratings.comment: Kenny was a great professor, the only complaint would be more the class itself is short compared to what has to be taught and learned. Truly cared about his students though.
Really cared and made sure everyone understood the material. Super sweet and overall an easy A. Good professor
Very nice guy, always makes sure everyone understands and is on the same page. Lectures are incredibly clear. More than willing to meet you outside of class.

Arch math was the easiest thing, and I am bad with math. He went through material very thoroughly and always made sure everyone understood what was going on. Very nice guy, I kind of felt bad for him because no one participated in class, and he was so nice to us all.

Very kind and understanding instructor. I did not make a good grade in this class but it was entirely a personal matter and not reflective of the teacher. He is crystal clear and explains the subject matter extremely well.

Dr. Palmer was a good lecturer, if you go to his class and take notes you will pass. I had a recitation with a TA the next day after lecture and she went over the material we learned last class. So basically, you get two lectures for material. I took precollege algebra (1075) and i got an A. It was easy and beneficial, I would definitely recommend.

I was lucky enough to get Dr. Palmer two semesters in a row (math 1050 and 1075). I struggled with math my whole life and have done everything I could to avoid it, it just never stuck. He is so helpful and understands that not everyone has the brain of an engineer.

Dr. Palmer was an awesome lecturer! He was very detailed and always asked if everyone was getting it while going over the material. He moves through the material fairly quick, but at a reasonable pace. With that being said he sticks behind to answer any questions as well as having office hours. Super nice guy too.

Dr. Palmer is probably one of the best lecturers at OSU. He is constantly asking the class questions to make sure everyone understands what he is teaching. He also makes himself very available to the students. Also, breaks the material down to a VERY understandable level. He is seriously the "GOAT", (Greatest of all time) of math lecturers.

Mr. Palmer is a great lecturer! If you show up to class and ask questions, he is going to help you understand the material and your most likely to pass! I would recommend every student who is taking math 1050 to join his class!

Save yourself the time find another professor, he goes over material very fast, and when he does go over the material fast even HE gets the wrong answer and gets called out on it. Very unorganized wouldn't recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Migler is an effective teacher who ensures students perform well on exams by thoroughly understanding and studying homework. He is highly regarded for his ability to answer questions, provide fair exams based on homework assignments, and offer additional review sessions. His lectures delve deeply into mathematical theory, making him particularly suitable for math majors interested in a theoretical approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Migler is an effective teacher who ensures students perform well on exams by thoroughly understanding and studying the homework. He is highly recommended for math majors due to his deep exploration of mathematical theory and his availability for additional review sessions.

Ratings.comment: You will do well on the exams if you understand and study the homework well. Holds reviews sections and gives good feedbacks.

Great professor. Very good at answering questions when you have them. Exams were more than fair and based on homework assignments, and he will also have extra review sessions/office hours prior. Highly recommend especially if you are a math major as he goes into theory a lot.

Overall great prof. He doesn't talk down to the class and he works through the material with you. Pretty interactive. He also gets you to see the beauty and big picture of ideas other than just the theorems. Fair exams which are based on the homework problems.

Good lecturer but goes very deep into theory rather than application. He's also pretty funny during lecture in between topics. Definitely go to the recitation to get practice and do the homework. His tests are fair and reasonable and closely follow what you get from the recitation quizzes and online homework.

If you love math theory and don't need to see many applications during class. This is the professor for you. If you learn from being taught a simple version of the theory and then many application examples, this professor is not for you.

summary_comment: Professor Li is known for his clear and concise teaching style, ensuring students only learn what is necessary and relevant for exams. He effectively prepares students with accurate exam content and fair grading. Additionally, while his enthusiasm for hip-hop dance adds a unique dimension, his expertise and dedication to the subject matter are highly regarded.
summary_comment_short: Professor Li is known for his clear and concise teaching style, ensuring students only cover essential material. He is highly effective at preparing students for exams and grades quizzes fairly, making him a reliable resource for academic success.

Ratings.comment: Brian rocks. His teaching style is super clear and concise, and he only teaches what you need to know so you don't waste your time. He knows pretty much exactly what will be on the exams which is great for being well prepared. He grades quizzes fairly too. He dresses nice and dances in his free time?? Suspiciously cool dude to be this good at math

Are you looking for a professor that wears bape and teaches hip hop dance? You've got the right guy. Most days, he doesn't want to be there any more than you do, which is sweet, so class often ends early. In all honesty though, Brian is a cool guy who knows his stuff. Also his review sheets are a godsend.

summary_comment: Professor Wolfe is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style, making even challenging subjects like mathematics enjoyable. Students find him personable and effective, though some note his lectures can be fast-paced. His ability to write and erase simultaneously while teaching is often highlighted as impressive. Overall, Professor Wolfe is seen as a great teacher who pushes students with difficult extra credit assignments.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wolfe is highly regarded for his engaging teaching style, making even complex mathematical concepts entertaining. Students find him knowledgeable and personable, though some note his classes can be fast-paced.

Ratings.comment: No Comments
Dr. Wolfe is a really fun prof. I never thought a Math class could be this entertaining. And, aside from math, he is a really cool guy. I liked his class a lot.

Fast paced but speaks english so its a tradeoff. Makes corny jokes. i think he did get better with time, cuz class was enjoyable. Even though i got a B. Thats fine. Im cool with that. Not bitter. Not one bit. ok maybe just a little.
nice guy, and good teacher. his extra credit assignments are hard, though.
No Comments
Pretty cool guy. Decent teacher. He is the man at the board, though. He can write with one hand and erase with the other at the same time. It is very impressive.
No Comments
Great Teacher
He doesn't comprehend that not everyone is a math genius.  Never shows examples, rather he wastes all 48 minutes working out proofs.  Crap teacher.  Even worse dresser.
Seemed to be a nice guy but class was very hard. Joked around at times to lighten class up.
Fast, very fast. Funny guy and sometimes it's not very clear and he'll try to explain. Overall, OK.

He teaches with one style, some people like it, most don't.  If you're a visual learner try to avoid his class, or hire a tutor as I did.  Some criticisms are that he moves very quickly (do does all of 152), and he will skip over steps when writing probs on the board which gets confusing.  on the up side he's humerous and very willing to help you.

He tried, I gotta give him that much. He was rather unclear, but I am sure that is just because he is inexperienced. He at least attempted to make lectures amusing if nothing else. He didn't work the blackboard too well. I'm sure there are worse lecturers out there, but there are better too.

He's a funny guy, he just needs more experiance.  He's very helpful if you ask for help, but his lectures are sometimes unclear, and he only explains things one way.  The class is a hard one to take, and if my opinion matters, I would take a professor who as been around awhile and knows how to teach it.

He lools like he is 12, and his skill as a teacher is commensurate with his lack of experience. He will probably get better in several years with experience.  He is a verbal teacher and left brained. Not recomended for a visual learner.
He was a great professor.  I learned a lot.  I thought he clearly taught the material.  He was excellent, I would take any other math course with him anyday of the week
He speaks english, which is a lot more than I can say for my TA.

Wolfe is quite the character.  He's like an emo kid all grown up and to be honest his online picture is quite scary.  Although he seems to know his stuff very well, he needs to learn that when you write down items on a board its a lot more effective to write on a black board than one covered with chalk dust.

Prof WOlfe is a young one, bu he's also really nice. Yeah, his class is a bit fast paced but he's willing to stop and go over anything if you ask him to. I actually learned a whole lot more in his class than in my TA but that might just be because no one can understand what she's saying, but all in all, he's a /good teacher

His class lecture is quite fast and he really expects you to know the material as he does, i learned a lot more from the T.A.s. he is really young too, like he got his phd. last year. but he is American and has a pretty good attitude.

summary_comment: Professor Rangipour's teaching is generally considered challenging due to his accent and unclear writing style, which can make lectures difficult to follow. Students find his office hours more helpful for clarifying concepts, though some report initial rudeness. Grading methods are seen as unfair, and attendance is primarily motivated by pop-quizzes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Rangipour's lectures are often described as difficult to follow due to his accent and unclear writing, and many students find his teaching style confusing. Office hours provide significant assistance, though some students still prefer alternative instructors.

Ratings.comment: Lecture was a waste of time.  Not only is his accent in the way, but his writing is indecipherable.  When I went to his office hours, he seemed rather rude as if I was inconveniencing him.  The only reason I went to lecture is so that I could get credit for his pop-quizzes.  Take another instructor if you can.
No Comments

Very hard to understand.  I learned more from reading the book than all of his lectures combined.  The only reason I even went to class is because he throws pop-quizzes.  He means well, but take another professor if at all possible.
Sometimes a little hard to understand, so ask him to clarify in lecture or go to office hours, it really helps a lot. Exams can be tricky, make sure you study the basic stuff and you should be okay.

His method of grading is helpful only to students who constantly improve after each exam, and if you don't expect to get a worse grade than students who did worse than you overall.  Totally unacceptable method of grading.
Sometimes confusing in lecture but helpful during office hours.  He is very helpful if you ask.
This guy is hard to understand, and he doesn't explain things very well.
Go to his office hours. He is very helpful and easier to understand.

This professor had messed up my grade and refused to do anything about it saying my emails were not logical.  I was friends with someone in my class and we shared our grades with each other on everything and in the long run we did the same on everything, but I received a letter grade lower than him...the only logical fallacy here is his grading!
He is very nice and  helpful, absolutely easygoing. He teaches in a real way, first example and then explain the subject in a very simple way. Take any course with him and dont worry at all.
At first I thought he was extremely hard. But the class gets easier and his tests aren't that bad. Overall I thought the class was easy compared to 152.
He tries his best in the class. His lectures need to be better  but over all he is a good teacher.
He is ok, but  a little bit hard to follow.  His pop-up quizzes should be helpful too.

He is awful. I can barely understand him and he does not explain things at all. People ask questions and he basically ignores them. Plus he gives pop-quizzes and expects people to know everything the day after they see it.

He was unable to explain any concepts in class, and completly ineffective with homework assignments. Expected students to basically know the material before entering class. He didn't seem to like to write full words on the board...I would drop this course and take it later if I had the choice...

summary_comment: Professor Nguyen Phan is known for her challenging exams and thorough material, but students find her lectures difficult to follow and often confusing. While some appreciate her knowledge and effort to teach, many describe her as hard to understand and recommend seeking additional resources or alternative professors.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nguyen Phan is generally considered challenging to understand and often criticized for her teaching style, which some students find confusing and unhelpful, particularly during office hours where she avoids explaining basic concepts. However, others acknowledge her knowledge and effectiveness when students put in the necessary effort, noting that her lectures, while difficult, can be supplemented with additional study and resources.

Ratings.comment: Worst professor I've had at OSU. I went into office hours for help and she refused to explain integration concepts because I was supposed to learn them in Calculus 1. Doesn't finish her sentences and is hard to understand.

Despite what some people think, Tam is actually a really good teacher and knows what she's talking about 100%. As long as you do the assigned homework and pay attention in class you will do just fine. Dont underestimate the power of Tam.
Tam tries her best to teach what you need to know and answer questions. She draws very good pictures. The exams are extremely difficult and require tons of studying. Just hope for a good curve :)

If you have the chance to take another professor, I recommend you do.  Tam is truly hard to understand and teaches you barely anything.  She second guesses her lecture material as she teaches and is hard to follow.  I took book notes to comprehend the material.

summary_comment: Professor Sinnott is known for his clear and thorough explanations, making him a highly regarded and approachable instructor. However, his classes are challenging, with difficult homework assignments that often exceed the difficulty level of in-class material, and exams that focus heavily on proofs without clear indication of content. Overall, while some find his classes demanding, many appreciate his expertise and dedication.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sinnott is known for his clarity and preparation, with students praising his thorough explanations and approachability. However, some find his homework to be significantly more challenging than the material covered in class, and a few describe his teaching style as making the subject matter more difficult than it needs to be.

Ratings.comment: One of the worst teachers I've had at OSU. He gave us weekly homework of 20+ problems and would only grade 5(which were usually the hardest). He really liked to test us on proofs but he gave us no idea as to what would be on any of the exams. Everyone said that linear algebra was easy but he made this class torture.
Professor Sinnott is pretty helpful but I feel like the homework he gives is significantly harder than the material that he went over in class
Professor Sinnott is absolutely fantastic. His explanations were always really clear and he genuinely cared about his students. Very approachable.
He's pretty much AWESOME! An amazing experience.

I have had Professor Sinnott for 6 classes (H190, H540-1, H590-2) and two seminars.  All of his classes begin slowly, but continue at a steady pace through all the material.  His explanations are crystal clear.  He is a kind teacher, well-prepared, and funny.
if you're interested at all in p-adic analysis or iwasawa theory, he is your man. great dissertation advisor.

summary_comment: Professor Hui is highly regarded for his enthusiasm and dedication to helping students succeed, despite a sometimes challenging accent. Students appreciate his willingness to re-explain concepts and provide additional support outside of class. The workload is manageable, and exams are generally fair and aligned with the course material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hui is highly regarded for his enthusiasm and dedication to helping students succeed, despite a sometimes challenging accent. Students appreciate his willingness to re-explain concepts and offer additional support outside of class, although some find his fast pace initially difficult to follow.

Ratings.comment: Wingsan was the best! His accent can be a little thick sometimes but mostly because he talks really fast. He is super enthusiastic about math and gets so excited when he teaches new theorems and has no problem re-explaining the material. He really wants his students to succeed. No curveballs on the exams. 4 HW problems due every couple weeks.

He is a very good teacher that will go out of his way to make sure students are understanding what he is teaching. His accent can be thick at times, but he uses the chalkboard to demonstrate what he is talking about. Attendance policies are lax. Bookwork is recommended but not collected. Workload is not too bad. Very good teacher.

Wing San is the man. He's extremely helpful and will stop and re-explain a problem if need be. His class is tough if you aren't really a math person, but this was my second time taking it and he did a much better job than my last professor. He even said we could contact him anytime in the future for help on any math problem. Awesome guy!

For the first day I had difficulty understanding his accent, but I got used to it very quickly. He has been my best math prof out of the entire business math series and his example problems in lecture are very helpful.
As long as you can get over his accent you will have a good class. He's a great, nice guy

He is the nicest, most helpful, & genuine math lecturer I have had! I went to his office hrs & he was SO helpful. His English is understandable, just pay attention. He gets really excited about math & really wants all his students to understand the REAL math meaning. He always reviews before exams that are pretty accurate. Take his class! :)

Awesome lecturer! Difficult part of Math 150 is recitation with TA. He is very funny and adorable. Very willing to help students.Accent isn't that hard to get used to, kinda makes you pay attention more!
He is a great teacher even though sometimes hard to understand. Just ask him if you don't understand something in lecture. He always willing to help

He explains things very thoroughly and I didn't have any problem understanding his accent. If you don't understand something he takes the time to explain it. He's very enthusiastic about math so he gets really excited at times, it's adorable. I've had him for 2 classes and I'm about to start my 3rd class with him as a professor. I highly recommend.

He is a really good professor. His accent is kind of hard to understand at first, but you get used to it. He genuinely wants his students to learn and he does his best to answer questions in lecture. Plus he is absolutely adorable! lol and funny!
He is kind of hard to understand at first but you get used to it.  He is a good lecturer and teaches the class well.  I learned very well from him

He is seriously so adorable and funny. He genuinely cares about what he is teaching and wants his students to understand the subject matter. You have to get used to his accent but if you go to class you should be fine. My only problem was my recitation TA...

Really cares about what he is teaching, and is very good about answering questions in a big lecture hall.  If you attend the class, you will be fine.  As an added bonus, he is adorable and an obvious math nerd.
Excellent instructor. Extremely helpful in office hours.  He will stay until you understand the material. Take him if you have the option.

He cares about the subject and his english can be a little tricky at first, but you get used to it and he goes through everything you need to know for test.  Pleasantly surprised by his performance in class.
I am horrible at math and I was able to learn alot from him. His accent is hard to understand at times but he is pretty clear on material and breaks problems down in a way that is easy to understand.

Excellent professor!  Probably one of the best math professors I've had while attending OSU.  I'm horrible at the subject but I understand everything and have great grades.   He covers all the material you need to know for the tests and clearly breaks down examples that are extremely useful. Some questions are tricky but he'll help you if you ask.

I completely disagree with the post below.. The teacher is very helpful and very easy to understand.. Everything that comes in the test has been covered by him in class so the quizzes and tests are not complicated.. The examples are extremely helpful.. If you attend his class then it is easy to get an A..

He goes really fast through examples, and you have to ask him to explain the steps. he goes through class and shows examples, but his english is VERY hard to understand! if you have him as a TA, find someone to tutor you or expect to get help somewhere else! his quizzes also have "trick" questions so you really have to know your math!

summary_comment: Professor Hsu is widely regarded as having poor communication skills and difficulty in teaching effectively. Students found his lectures hard to follow due to his heavy accent and frequent mistakes, and he often failed to adequately explain concepts or relate exam questions to class material. His teaching style and test structure led many students to feel they learned more outside of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hsu is widely regarded as having poor communication skills, with students struggling to understand his lectures due to his heavy accent and frequent mistakes. His teaching style is criticized for being ineffective, with many students finding it necessary to study independently rather than relying on class content.

Ratings.comment: Incredibly difficult to understand. Terrible English. Always seems nervous. Makes a lot of mistakes when doing examples on the board.

Compared to my previous math teachers and my other profs he was by far the worst. The accent was meh, the tests weren't terrible, but as far as teaching you had to learn everything yourself. Did not explain anything, often skipped steps and made many errors in class. Too fast. I was more productive studying on my own than going to class.

Don't take unless you plan on KEEP taking accelerated math at OSU. Heavy Taiwanese accent, couldn't understand half of the time. Makes many mistakes in lecture notes. 3midterms. Each 6 questions. 3rd midterm class average was 66. Exam questions aren't related to class notes/hw. No curve or extra credit given at all. This class is my biggest regret.

summary_comment: Professor Zhou is known for his clarity in explaining complex subjects, focusing on concepts rather than proofs. While homework varies significantly in difficulty, tests are straightforward and fair. However, the final exam is notably challenging and curved, requiring comprehensive knowledge of the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhou is known for his clarity in explaining complex concepts without relying heavily on proofs, making the subject matter accessible. While his tests are straightforward, the final exam is notably challenging and requires comprehensive knowledge of the course material.

Ratings.comment: Was very clear about the subject matter and always made sure everyone was clear. Focuses a lot on concepts and zero proofs like I have heard in other classes. Some home work will take 30 min others will take 6 hours (there are 12). Tests are very straight forward, you wont get blind sided. Final however was VERY hard-know everything-its curved.

summary_comment: Professor Kelly is known for his engaging and lighthearted teaching style, which helps make difficult material more manageable. However, students find his homework assignments excessively long and challenging to complete within a week. While quizzes are considered average and exams are the easiest part of the course, the overall workload is seen as unbalanced.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kelly excels at making lectures engaging and enjoyable, which aids in balancing the challenging course material. However, his assignments are often excessively lengthy, causing students significant stress, while quizzes and exams are relatively straightforward.

Ratings.comment: Professor Kelly is a fun guy, lectures are lighthearted which helps balance out the difficult material. Unfortunately he seems to have trouble understanding what assignments are legitimately doable in a week. Homework is painstakingly long. The quizzes are average, and the exams are the easiest. Seems a little backwards but that's how it is.

summary_comment: Professor MacRi is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and deep passion for mathematics. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his ability to support students struggling with abstract algebra. His commitment to ensuring student understanding is evident in his approachable teaching style and generous grading on exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor MacRi is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and deep love for mathematics, making him one of the most helpful and favorite professors among students. His dedication to student success, especially in challenging subjects like abstract algebra, is evident through his supportive approach and willingness to assist.

Ratings.comment: Most Helpful professors I ever had. He really loves math and he is always ready to help. Easily one of my favourite professors at Northeastern !!
I wish he was still at OSU.

Take him if you can! Abstract algebra can be so difficult, and Emanuele understands that. He will work with you to make sure you are doing ok in the class and will always help with homework. Exams are a little off from what I expected. But the exams have 12 possible points and he takes them out of ten. Definitely recommend him!

summary_comment: Professor Willke is a thorough and effective teacher who clearly explains complex material, making it accessible to students. He is known for his kindness, approachability, and genuine care for his students' understanding. While his handwriting can be challenging, he compensates by verbalizing what he writes and is always willing to provide additional support.
summary_comment_short: Professor Willke is thorough in his teaching and known for making complex subjects easier to understand. He is highly regarded as a helpful, approachable, and caring instructor who goes out of his way to ensure students grasp the material.

Ratings.comment: Thorough in teaching
Great guy
Super nice, but his red hair was distracting. He also has the handwriting of a 5th grader, but overall great teacher and person.

He is definitely willing to help and will never make you feel stupid for asking. He explains the material clearly, making the tough subject easier to understand. He's a grad student but knows his stuff.
Helpful

He is really nice and approachable.  He is also a really good teacher and tries to make the class more fun and entertaining.  He taught the lecture in a way that is super easy to understand and clarified confusing concepts. You can tell he really cares about students and the class.
His handwriting is not great but he reiterates what he writes aloud. He is always willing to help and his quizzes are fair.

summary_comment: Professor Cervantes is an effective instructor who emphasizes active participation and engagement. He encourages students to attend office hours and seek clarification during lectures, which significantly enhances understanding. His approach makes the material more accessible, provided students stay attentive and proactive in their learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Cervantes is an effective instructor who emphasizes active participation and engagement in lectures. He encourages students to utilize office hours and stay proactive about clarifying concepts, which significantly enhances understanding and prevents falling behind in the course material.

Ratings.comment: Go to office hours! Ask for him to clarify during lecture and sit by the front so you can do this easier. Yeah, it's math, but the more you participate and the more engaged you are, the easier the material is & you won't fall behind in your understanding of the material like it seems so many kids are. The class isn't too hard if you're on the ball.

summary_comment: Professor Spardy at Skidmore College emphasizes extensive study time for calculus, recommending students dedicate 8 to 12 hours weekly. However, her teaching method has been criticized for being ineffective, as she often includes unnecessary details that do not contribute to understanding the core concepts.
summary_comment_short: Professor Spardy at Skidmore College emphasizes extensive study time for calculus, assigning homework that requires students to dedicate 8 to 12 hours weekly. However, her teaching method is criticized for being ineffective, as she often spends class time on irrelevant details, making the class less than ideal and not recommended by many students.

Ratings.comment: Here's a quote from her "you should be doing 8 to 12 hours of calculus a week, more if your having trouble with it."  She assigns homework with this in mind.  Also she teaches at Skidmore College in NY now

Although her class isn't hard, she doesn't present the material well at all. Pretty much half of class is watching her write useless and extraneous information that don't apply to the topic at hand. Would not recommend.

summary_comment: Professor Koch is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, particularly through his TAs, especially Phil, who is praised for making up for any shortcomings in the main professor's instruction. Students emphasize that attending recitations is crucial for understanding the material thoroughly and achieving top grades, noting that Koch’s TA excels at simplifying complex concepts and providing clear, effective explanations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Koch is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, particularly through his dedicated TA, Phil, who compensates for any shortcomings in the primary professor's instruction. Students appreciate Phil's commitment to student learning, his clear explanations, and the numerous examples he provides to ensure understanding.

Ratings.comment: Best TA I have ever had. My professor was awful, and Phil made up for his downfalls in leaps and bounds. If you go to recitation you will learn everything you need to get an A in this class. Phil really cares about his students and makes an effort to explain the material in a way that is extremely easy to understand. Gives great examples.

summary_comment: Professor Coskun is highly regarded for his thorough and engaging teaching style, known for his ability to explain complex concepts clearly and work through detailed proofs with students. While his classes and midterms are challenging, students appreciate his generosity in curving scores and his willingness to help, both in and out of class. His interactive teaching methods and commitment to student understanding make him a standout professor at OSU.
summary_comment_short: Professor Coskun is highly regarded for his thorough explanations and ability to clarify complex concepts, making him an excellent resource for students. While his classes are challenging, particularly with difficult midterms and a tough final, students appreciate his dedication and willingness to help, often achieving better grades through his generous score curves and office hours support.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Coskun is a wonderful professor. Although he will dedicate some time to prove theories, he does explain concepts well,  is willing to clarify any misconceptions you might have, and clearly knows what he's doing. The midterms are difficult, but he is generous with curving scores. If you take away anything here, do the homework!

The best math professor at OSU (but not the easiest). He takes the time to thoroughly go through problems in class and is super helpful if you take the time to go to his office. Make sure you know how to do the problems he hints at in class, they popped up on exams.

He is the best math professor ever. I gained my trust to math professors at OSU due to his teaching. He works through all the details of difficult proofs with us. I feel like I have good understanding of the concepts and can see how to approach real analysis problems. I am glad that I had a chance to have him for both 548 and 549.

Coskun was a good professor who knew everything about the subject. Make sure you understand spherical coordinates. Do not underestimate the difficulty of his class and you should do ok. There was a healthy curve at the end of the class.

Really great professor. He explains things well and loves to get students involved and get to know them. Visit his office hours if possible. Exams are based on homework and examples done in lecture.  1st midterm was easy, 2nd midterm was ok and final was really hard.
Amazing Teacher, you might struggle in his class but he is well worth the time. He has renewed my faith in Math teachers at OSU, as few are very good

Tests and quiz questions are from the HW sets with slight modifications or none at all in some cases. Helpful during office hours and relatively clear in lectures. His handwriting is a bit messy, but is always willing to clarify. Final was difficult though.

Many of my peers had talked very highly of Professor Coskun and his class before I took it. It was not so easy for me to make it into his section because of a long waiting list but it sure is worth it. I learned a ton from him. He teaches interactively in class and willing to help anytime you contact him. I will really  miss his lectures.
He seems to be a professor of the old school to me. I mean he is a solid professor. I am glad to have him and will sign up for his Math 548 section.
Only Jesus can teach better than professor Coskun. Wonderful course organization, great professor!
Even though he has a thick accent you can understand him and he posts his notes and solved problems online. Best math teacher I have had at OSU.

Professor Coskun is one of my favorite math professors. He went through the lectures thoroughly, and stock to textbook completely. I am a mechanical engineering, finding this class extremely helpful as an mathematics introduction. if you really want to learn something, go for his class

Dr. Coskun really got students involved in the class, which none of my other Math professors had previously demonstrated. He was extremely friendly and approachable.  He wanted to help us gain a better long term understanding of math. His pace in lecture was good. Great professor. I would recommend to any student having the opportunity to have hi

Dr. Coskun was one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. In lecture, he conveyed the material thoughtfully and clearly. Although the lecture had nearly 60 students, Dr. Coskun learned every student's name. Additionally, students always had to be on their toes; while lecturing, Dr. Coskun calls on different students to ask the next step i
I had him for both 254 and 415. He gives a lot of homework but exams come straight from those problems. It's a tough class but overall I think rather fair.

This is not a teacher you can slack off with and expect to get a good grade. If you don't really care about math, I would recommend looking into a different professor, but if you are looking for a challenge, this is the man for you.

My best advice for this class: do the homework, but doing the homework means also understanding it.  If you can do the homework problems on your own, then you will definitely do well on his test.  Though some material is difficult (CH 10), he is extremely conscientious of his students and wants them to do well, so ask for help if you need it!

Would have written a better review, but was too busy doing homework. Seriously though, he assigns way too much homework for his 415 class. Had an average of 30 problems per homework assignment, and each problem takes 30-60 minutes to complete if you understand the material, which he doesn't explain well. Avoid.

summary_comment: Professor Kao at Claremont McKenna College is generally regarded as supportive and caring, willing to help students understand the material. However, her lectures can be less effective for learning, focusing on lengthy proofs that may not be necessary, and she sometimes struggles to understand student questions. Homework assignments are frequent, and while midterms and finals closely mirror the homework problems, the class can be challenging without consistent attendance and engagement.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kao is effective at helping students understand the material and is willing to assist them, though her lectures can be less helpful without active engagement, such as attending office hours. Her classes are manageable if students complete the homework, but her focus on detailed proofs in lectures can be overwhelming and not always necessary for understanding the course content.

Ratings.comment: She teaches at Claremont McKenna college now. I did IB Math SL prior to this class and a lot of it was hard for me. If you are hardworking and willing to attend her office hours, I think she's decent but otherwise, her lectures are not very useful and she often misunderstands questions from students. She assigns homework weekly.

The biggest problem I faced was room conditions.  During spring quarter with no AC makes concentrating in class hard enough, much less when she goes through laborious proofs that are unnecessary. The class was easy if you did the HW problems, just be aware that in-class lectures cover pointlessly long proofs.  Otherwise, she did a good job. Easy
A great professor who is really willing to help students and care about students understand the material or not. Midterms and Finals are really similar to homework problem
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Yang's lectures are often criticized for their complexity and lack of clarity, with students finding them difficult to follow and boring. While some appreciate his availability during office hours and his helpfulness when approached outside of class, many find his teaching style abrasive and combative, leading to poor performance despite diligent effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yang's teaching quality is generally poor, characterized by dense derivations without sufficient explanation or context, leading to monotonous and often confusing lectures. Students find his interactions abrasive and report difficulty in understanding the material during class, though some note that he is helpful during office hours and that the final exam, while challenging, is graded fairly.

Ratings.comment: He is horrible. A lot of derivation. Doesn't explain things well nor give the overall picture of what you're learning. Lecture is boring and he is sometimes hard to understand.
Bad lecturer. Only take him if you absolutely have to. Ended up learning MUCH more from the TA than him.
Not an easy class, but he is very helpful if you go to his office hours . Final exam is difficult but is graded fairly.

Any interaction between Yang and the rest of the class is dominated by his abrasive style.  I found him at best impatient and at worst genuinely combative.  Coming into this class with a 3.8 for all prerequisites, I felt prepared.  I barely managed a B in 3607 by working my butt off.   The final was 65% material covered in the last 2 meetings.

Yang's lectures were clear and had lots of examples. He isn't very good at answering questions in class, but you can always ask in recitation instead. I had taken AP calc BC before this class but that didnt make this class easy. A few topics were new and old topics were still hard but I definitely got a better grade because of my experience.

summary_comment: Professor Sharma is known for assigning challenging homework and tests that include both straightforward and complex questions. While she is dedicated and genuinely cares about her students' learning, many find her lectures and explanations difficult to follow, leading to frustration and poor engagement. Students generally recommend seeking additional help outside of class to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sharma struggles with clearly explaining complex concepts, often assigning challenging homework and difficult tests. While she is dedicated and caring, her teaching style can make communication of knowledge difficult for many students.

Ratings.comment: Second class with Dr. Sharma. She has a hard time explaining difficult concepts to students. Always assigns homework from hardest sections of the book. Tests are usually 75% straight forward with a couple tricky questions. Very helpful if you go talk to her. Not a terrible teacher, just a hard time communicating her knowledge to her students.
