Don't ever take a class with this "professor". You're better off going to the Art department for Math lessons. Incredibly boring lectures. She made my cup of coffee fall asleep, insanely long homeworks. Doesn't realize students have other classes too except her "class". And the tests are more or less impossible. My misfortune that I had her again.
Never ever ever take her class!
She's a very nice lady, however also very intimidating. Her class makes you work very hard and I think she genuinely cares about your grade in it. Access

This was the worst math class I've ever taken.  The class was very boring and I love math, I seriously almost fell asleep a few times.  All she did was write a crazy amount of stuff straight from the book during lecture.  Her tests are all unbelievably hard questions, and she grades them with little remorse.  I spent 20+ hours on homework per week.

One of the absolute worst teachers on campus. Holy smokes. All the tests are just proving theorems. Lectures are insanely boring and long. Can't keep a class interested for more than a minute. My coffee mug fell asleep in that class as well. Never taking her class again. Avoid at all costs if you want a good teacher and a good grade.
I did not like this class. Understanding the computations isn't enough... she kills you with the theoretical stuff. Tests are wicked.
The material is hard but she's a good teacher. You can  tell she cares and want you to learn.

Dr. Sharma is very nice and knows what she is talking about. She explains things pretty well, except she says things like "this is easy" when no one understands it. Most of the tests are based on theory which is awful. Grading is brutal on homework and tests. I'm a math major and I would not take her class again if given the option.

summary_comment: Professor David is highly knowledgeable and provides very informative recitations, strongly recommended for attending regularly. She is described as very helpful and nice, with the potential to become an excellent teacher. While her grading can be tedious, she gives partial credit for correct work if shown.
summary_comment_short: Professor David is highly knowledgeable and very helpful, making her recitations informative and valuable for students. She is considered a promising teacher with a bright future in education.

Ratings.comment: Very knowledgeable young lady. The recitation was very informative, I would highly suggest attending and not just showing up on quiz day. Can be very tedious when grading quizzes, just show all of your work and you will be fine. (Gives partial credit if you have correct work.)
Very helpful and nice. Has a bright future as a teacher!

summary_comment: Professor McNeal, known as Betsy, is dedicated to her students' success but can be perceived as demanding. Her classes involve regular homework and quizzes, and attending the tutor room frequently may improve exam grades. Her teaching style emphasizes active engagement and consistent preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor McNeal is dedicated to her students' success and actively seeks to build relationships with them, though students often feel pressure to maintain her favor. Her teaching approach emphasizes consistent engagement through weekly homework and quizzes, with recitations serving as an extension of lectures where asking questions is encouraged.

Ratings.comment: (Goes by Betsy). She cares and wants to get to know her students, but you want to be on her good side. Recitation is just another lecture- learning new materials, so ask questions. Homework assignment due and quiz every week. If you go to the tutor room enough she may round up your exam grades. Get the loose leaf version of the textbook if you can.

summary_comment: Professor Evans is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and care for students, particularly those in actuarial science. His classes are challenging, with a focus on understanding and applying formulas, and he provides ample resources through homework and office hours. Students appreciate his willingness to help and his efforts to get to know them personally, making him a valuable resource for success in actuarial studies.
summary_comment_short: Professor Evans is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and care for his students, making complex material accessible and offering extensive support. His classes are challenging, particularly for aspiring actuaries, but students find his approach effective and his willingness to help invaluable.

Ratings.comment: Rick is a really nice guy and a great resource for aspiring actuaries. The class is difficult and there's lots of memorization. The only grades are the midterms and final. Its easy to fall behind with the homework but the homework is really the best resource to study.

He is great!  Very nice and even goes as far to take kids out to dinner to know them better. If you go to class and do the homework problems you'll be fine. Grades are A(90-100), B(80-90), and so on so a little different than normal for OSU.  I hope he stays around so I can take him for other classes as he is a great resource for future actuaries.

This professor is amazing. I am taking this class this summer, and it is so great. At the beginning of each chapter he will hand out homeworks and solutions. It is up to you to do the homework or not. The midterm is easy, as long as you know how to use all the formulas. The professor makes everything much easier to understand. Would recommend.

All I can say is wow. This class was hard but you can get through it. If you can get Evans, take him, especially if you're an actuarial science major. He's very helpful. The textbooks are needed if you take the FM exam; if not, you don't need them.

Rick is a really great professor who really cares about his students. Gives you lots of opportunity to get an A. Class material was pretty straight-forward, just make sure you keep up and do the homework (not for a grade). Passed FM first try after taking his class.

Easily the Best professor that Ohio State has to offer.  He truly cares about his students and makes an effort to get to know everyone on a first name basis.  Teaches the material excellently, though the class is tough.  Put in the time, ask for help, and a good grade is within reason.

Theory of interest was definitely a good way to spend my summer. The way he presents the material allows it to be picked up and applied, but you need the practice from the homework to be ready for the exams. He was always willing to help with a question or 5 one might have, just make sure you've really tried the problem first. Great Professor.

I really enjoy having Rick as my interest theory teacher. You could tell he really cared about his students. Love actuary students. He might take you out for lunch too, he does that a lot. Grade based on 2 exams and a final. The material is hard. You have to go to class and study. Exams were hard for me. Avg. class grade was probably a B. STUDY!

Solid teacher.  Very good at explaining concepts.  Class attendance is important because some of the concepts are hard to get from mere reading.  He makes them simple.   Really cares about his students.   Very personable.  Do not even think about cheating.

Mr. Evans writes on the board from his own notes, YOU MUST GO TO CLASS TO LEARN THE MATERIAL. He really knows his stuff. The material is not something most people have learned before, so it is not necessarily and easy A.  Doing the practice problems he gives are essential to learning the material.  Only two midterms and a final constitute grades.

Rick is one of the best teachers Ohio State has.  He explains the material very well, which is necessary since the classes are extremely hard.  I had Rick for 3 classes, A in 3618, C+ in 5630, and A in 5631.  Do the homework, that is what the tests are based off of, even though homework doesn't count for anything. Hard material, great teacher!!!

He knows what he's talking about. Speaks really slow so very easy to follow. Go to every class, digest the materials, do the review exercises and you will be good! Always assumesthinks he is right, a character that could sometimes be really annoying.
This is the best professor I have met yet. He is very nice and helpful! I love his class!
He is one of the best professors ever!

Best teacher I have EVER HAD IN MY LIFE.  Rick Evans is the reason I passed MLC.  He makes everything about life contigencies and derivatives make sense.  Plus he's a really nice guy and easy to get along with.  His exams are all multiple choice, and he gives partial credit.  Impossible to NOT get an A in this class.  If you don't, switch majors.
He is one of the best prof at OSU
He is one of those professors that will do whatever it takes to make sure his students understand the material.
A great teacher, easy to understand, helpful, and cares about his students.  Never hesitate to stay after class and ask questions or just chat with Rick, he's a really nice person.
No Comments

professor evans is the best math teacher i have ever had. Math 630,631 and 632 are very hard classes but he makes them very easy to understand. He is committed to his students and he makes sure that each and every one of his students get an A. No one in his class gets a C. Most of the people end up getting an A or a B+.

summary_comment: Professor Davis is perceived as inconsistent in teaching quality, with some students finding him clear and helpful, while others consider him vague and ineffective. The class requires consistent effort and preparation, including daily activity sheets and homework, which some find challenging without adequate support. Overall, opinions vary widely, with a significant portion of negative feedback highlighting issues with clarity and relevance of instruction.
summary_comment_short: Professor Davis is known for his challenging and conceptual teaching style, requiring consistent effort and timely study. While some students find him clear and fair, others describe his lectures as vague and unsuitable for a MATLAB-based course, leading to poor performance and frustration among many students.

Ratings.comment: This is a conceptual class. Make sure that you make time for this class and do not push off studying until last minute. There are activity sheets to be completed in class everyday, and turned in at the end of class. There are also homework assignments over every class that is due at the beginning of the next period.

Such a nice, caring professor. He is sometimes quiet, but if you actually pay attention and put in some work the class is not hard at all. All the students in my class complaining about how hard it was were also always playing games on iPhones.
Hard and isnt clear

I can't believe the university is still allowing him to teach. This man does not deserve to be in the academic setting. I agree with the last two posts, as well. Horrible excuse for a teacher! Do not take his class.

Worst math teacher I have ever had.  When there was a quiz that involved material HE NEVER WENT OVER and was confronted about it, HE DID NOTHING.  After the first test, 80% of the class went next door to another 151 lecturer.  He is very vague and frequently talked over our heads.  Recommend finding another 151 lecturer, if possible.

One of the worst teachers ever. Didn't give back homework until day of the midterm. Didn't teach just expected us to understand his scriblings. If you didnt understand something there was something wrong with you not his teaching. Stay away from him at all costs.
Midterms were far to long to complete. This cours is supposed to be a MATLAB based course and we still haven't even touch MATLAB atfter 5 weeks. Half the class is failing and won't curve

He is a very good teacher.. very clear and makes the tests fair.  He created the C series and the C series is definately much easier than the other calculus sequences.  I would recommend taking this class over the A and regular calculus sequences.
really a great professor, many other professors should take a class from him to learn how it should be done.  I actually learned in this class, instead of memorized.

Bill is truly one of the FINEST instructors I have had (and there have been many). He really cares about students learning and UNDERSTANDING. He is very friendly and REALLY knows his mathematics. He is also humorous and has a lot of fun stories. I only wish I could have him teach all my courses.
this guy knows his stuff..he has a million ways to explain anything.

summary_comment: Professor Chu is highly regarded for her helpfulness and ability to simplify complex material, though her strong accent can initially make her difficult to understand. Despite this, many students find her approachable and recommend her for those seeking to grasp the subject matter effectively. Her classes are generally considered easy, and she is generous with grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chu is highly regarded for her helpfulness and ability to simplify complex material, though her accent can initially make her difficult to understand. Despite this, many students find her classes manageable and recommend her for those seeking a good grasp of the subject matter and decent grades.

Ratings.comment: She really needs to work on her accent. It's impossible to understand her. you'll need to do all the studying on your own from the book which is not that great

Awesome professor! She will really help you understand the difficult material and guide you. Give her accent a few days to get used to and you will understand. I would strongly recommend her for any class. I was not really interested in the topic, but the way she taught, I began to understand and like.
It is almost impossible to comprehend what she says but she is very helpful ,if you could understand her. The course is very easy. I took this course just to fulfil my math requirement.

Qing Chu is one of the best math professors I've had so far.  She is extremely helpful and doesn't make the material difficult at all. Her accent takes a couple of days to get used to but she's also soft spoken.  You'll want to sit up close.  Highly recommended to anyone who wants to pass the class and understand the material.

English is also my 2nd language. So it is even harder to understand instructor who have bad accent. Although it is really easy class, she makes it harder for me. I am not recommend this instructor to anyone. Sorry
she gives good grades. wil recommend her to anybody with math problem.
She is so nice. Although, you may not understand her. However she will give everyone a good grade.
Really nice teacher. Helpful if you go to her office hours. Not strict on giving extra points to you

summary_comment: Professor Berndt is highly regarded for his clear and effective teaching methods, with students praising his straightforward communication and fairness. His lectures are considered valuable, especially for exam preparation, and he is noted for curving grades when necessary. Students appreciate his transparency in testing, finding them manageable with proper effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor Berndt is highly regarded for his clear and effective teaching methods, often praised for his ability to explain concepts in understandable English and for curving exams when necessary. Students appreciate his fairness and straightforward approach to grading, though they note that success requires consistent effort, including attending lectures and completing homework.

Ratings.comment: I think he drove a motorcycle. I'm also pretty sure his heart is made of magic fairy dust. Love, love, love him. Want babies NOW.
good guy. memorize the theorems and you will get an A.
He looks trendy-nerdy. He's really quite a fair teacher. As long as you try you will do fine.
I liked this guy a lot. He didn't try to trick you on exams. He assigns a lot of homework problems but they're worth doing and very good preparation for the tests.
Great professor, much better than the other 151 professors. Finally someone that can speak english! Tests were easy if you did some studying for them. Best math professor I have had to this date.

i did poorly but by my own fault (skipped class cause it was early, didn't do homework, didn't study), good teacher, test were pretty easy, he curved when necessary, spoke well, go to lectures, he's probably one of the better profs
Midterms were concentrated on the terms of the chapter.  Nice to have a young english speaking Math prof.

summary_comment: Professor Mance is highly intelligent but struggles with effective teaching methods, often skipping steps in problem-solving and assuming students can follow along mentally. While some students found his lectures entertaining and appreciated his availability during office hours, others felt the classes were confusing and unhelpful, leading many to rely on TAs or other lecturers for better understanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mance is highly intelligent but struggles with effective teaching methods, often skipping steps in his explanations and leaving students with unclear notes. Despite his brilliance, his lectures are inconsistently organized and sometimes unhelpful, though some students found his office hours beneficial and appreciated his care for students.

Ratings.comment: He's not the most organized lecturer, but he's very entertaining.  He used the examples from the book a lot, but I didn't mind because the book was written so clear that there wouldn't be a need to deviate from it.  He has great office office hours too if you need help.  Overall, I enjoyed this class.

Teacher was not very prepared, always at least 5 min late and did not communicate with the TAs at all so material was often covered twice. Stuck to the predetermined schedule even if material was not covered fully. Tests were challenging but did not matter as much because of a fairly large curve

He is obviously extremely intelligent simply by the way he talks, but this does not show through with his teaching style. He goes through the problems rather quickly and skips over steps, implying that they're obvious. Overall, I did not find him very helpful.
VERY GOOD TEACHER!!! VERY FUNNY!!!CURVE A LOT!!!! VERY CARE ABOUT STUDENTS!!! VERY EASY MIDTERMS..But a little bit hard final. But curve A LOT!!! You can get A if you are 80%!!!!

Agree with other ratings. While its obvious that Mance is probably brilliant, attending his lectures is a waste of time. You will not learn anything because he does not explain what he is doing very well. Good TA is a must. Also consider going to a different lecturer if you find going to lecture useful.

He's quite an awful teacher. This Professor seems to be a brilliant guy... He just can't teach. I'm sure it's all up there.. But it doesn't end up on your paper. He should probably stop hitting the gym and start teaching pre algebra. Sorry to be blunt.

Mance is obviously very intelligent, you can tell by the way he speaks and he pretty much does the problem in his head before touching the chalk to the board. He puts up half of the steps involved in problems because he does much of the problems mentally.You end up with notes that you can't follow when you try to go back over them a day later.

terrible teacher. only went to his lecture twice and almost walked out the second time. does not explain things thoroughly. sometimes went to other lecturer named wong.... he makes the tests. got an A because of that
Professor Mance is obviously very intelligent but he has no idea how to teach. He does examples on the board in his head without actually teaching what is going on.
I have never been to the lecture after the first midterm, though the course is extremely easy, I cannot learn ANYTHING from the lecture. A good TA is NECESSARY!!!
Terrible teacher. Doesn't teach anything. Answers problems with solutions from higher math classes. No one goes to class because he's so bad. Hope for a good TA. If you don't get one, SWITCH.

One of the worst teachers in the math dept, he makes everything so complicated. Keeps flirting around with girls during class. Don't pick him, he will ruin your whole quarter or hope you get an better TA

Absolutely the worst professor I've ever had!! If you have him, get out while you can! Doesn't explain how to do the problems, just expects that you already know how.  Worst of all, if you have a question and you raise your hand he completely ignores you! Its very obvious that he doesn't like teaching nor cares about being there.

summary_comment: Professor Wilson is known for his thorough coverage of mathematical concepts, including historical context and theoretical foundations, which some students found beneficial for understanding the broader picture of calculus. However, his teaching style is often criticized for being disorganized and overly focused on proofs, leading to confusion and difficulty in grasping the material. Despite this, many acknowledge his passion for teaching and the support he provides through frequent office hours.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wilson is known for his thorough coverage of mathematical concepts, including historical context and more advanced topics, which some find beneficial for understanding the broader picture of calculus, while others find it overwhelming and confusing. Despite mixed reviews, many acknowledge his passion and willingness to help through frequent office hours, though his teaching style and organization are often criticized for being disorganized and unclear.

Ratings.comment: The regular in-class quizzes and homework sets were helpful for seeing if you are learning the material. Spends time on history of math and delves into topics somewhat beyond the scope of Calculus III in trying to give us the "big picture" (e.g. topology) rather than giving an applications-oriented approach to vector calculus (e.g. Maxwells Eqs)

James Wilson is a crime against higher education. He appears to be in pain when forced to answer any question from a student. He seems to actually take joy in the frustration and confusion of the students, all the while mentioning how he "used to be in a think tank" and how much smarter he was than his colleagues. He is an insufferable human being.

Really confusing, didn't learn anything new, and his class only confused me on the topics I already knew. Will spend whole lectures proving theorems or go on tangents and then tell you you don't need to know it for anything. I got an A on the final so I got an A for the class, but I almost failed both midterms. He is a looker, though...

Just took the final.  Not easy, but fair, I guess.  Basically, it's not an easy class, but it is fair. James is a very passionate teacher and while not always organized/clear in class, he offers office hours four times a week in order to assist if needed. A little too much focus on far-out proofs, some odd HW problems, but overall a good teacher.

He's a decent lecturer and is fairly thorough, even if he sometimes doesn't prepare his examples. He does put a lot of weight on the final though, which can be a good or bad thing depending on how well you take tests (In my case it was really good, as I didn't have the time to do the homeworks). Overall not bad. Would take another course with him.

Enjoyed making fun of the students. He loved to have some fun where he made you feel like a complete idiot. Never understood what he was talking about and he was a complete d-bag. Wouldn't take him again, however, i did enjoy staring at him. beautiful eyes. If you want a hottie, pick him but if you want to fail, pick him too.

Gotta know your stuff for this class.Would keep high school calc notes handy, especially when he goes off in his esoteric proofs.He has this policy where your final grade is the lowest possible overall grade,and his final was pretty easy (surprisingly) and I got an A even though I bombed everything else.

I seriously disliked this class. I didn't learn anything new and the only reason I knew what was going on was because I had a good Calc teacher last year. His questions on exams are normally never brought up in class and his notes are almost useless because he rarely prepares for class. If I had him as a professor again I would switch out.

You should have a calculus background before taking his class. Takes time to prove a lot of accepted things. Knows what he's talking about, willing to answer questions. Great teacher. You have to know your stuff to pass it though. Nice guy

He really likes math and is really hot, but the class is hard. I had a really tough time and although he knows what he's doing, he doesn't always teach it in the best way. If you can avoid taking calc i would, but if you have to Wilson is a good professor
Hilarious. Actually made Calculus interesting for me, an English major.

Very enthusiastic about teaching however very confusing if you've never used the material before. He only gives one way to figure out the problem and doesn't make it very easy to understand. Spends alot of time on why but not alot on explaining how.

He seemed enthusiastic about math, however, he wasn't really a good teacher. His lectures were confusing. He didn't do too many examples and mainly spent too much time on one problem babbling about the "hows" and "why's" that led to the solution. Maybe that's some peoples style but not mine. Overall, a hard class. This class really takes effort!
This class is tough.  The material is explained well in lecture, but the midterms and exams are lengthy and challenging.  Overall, he was helpful, and explained topics well.
He is very excited for math.

Completely useless. Lectures mainly consisted him rambling on about all the wonderful things you get to do in 152 and 153 instead of actually teaching. Constantly wasted 50 minutes explaining what should take 5-10. Went to appeal wrongly graded question, refused to help, told me "dont worry about points." Midterms/final extermemly hard, 50%s avg.
Terrific! Very easy to understand. A great professor!

Good professor. English is clear. Gets a 3 for clarity because he likes to use proofs to explain problems which can be confusing; however, he does include some example problems. Very helpful and flexible with office hours.

He is all american, so thick foreign accents are not an issue.  He explains things very well in lecture, however he likes to use proofs which, depending on your mathematical background, might be a little confusing at first.  Overall he's very straightforward and accommodating.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Goss is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and supportive approach, with many students praising his enthusiasm for the subject and his efforts to help students understand the material. However, some students found his lectures unclear and less helpful for exam preparation, suggesting that his teaching style may not suit all learners, particularly those in lower-level courses.
summary_comment_short: Professor Goss is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching and supportive approach, with many students praising his enthusiasm for the subject and his efforts to help students understand the material. However, some students found his lectures unclear and less helpful for exam preparation, suggesting that his teaching style may not suit all learners, particularly those in lower-level courses.

Ratings.comment: EXCELLENT PROFESSOR! Easily the most helpful professor I've ever had.  If you need to take a math course at the 500 level then do everything you can to be in his section.  Lifesaver.

GREAT PROFESSOR! Really loves the subject and is excited to be teaching it. Grades a lot on effort, because he understands it's hard! He says "you have to try hard to fail my class". Really tries to help students learn. Would love to have this guy teach all my math classes! Great personality as well-makes class fun.

Wow....this guy was terribly unclear in lectures and always focused on theorems rather than how to do the problems. My TA was also terrible and I have never worked this hard to get an A in my life. If you can help it, don't take this guy.
Absolutely horrible teacher. Lectures are worthless and have no relevance to midterms or finals. TAs are good, but avoid this teacher if at all possible.
Nice man, a little shy.  Very smart but can sometimes trail off into his own mathy world.  Good TA's.  Homework is easy to medium, never hard.  Tests are very easy.  Midterm was easy.
Granted I'm not the best math student, but still I thought my TA was better than him!  Maybe if he would go through examples relevant to the exam people would do better!
He is a very good teacher and teaches very well and is a great father to his two kids
great guy, likes the big picture more than individual specific examples, not recommended for the 150 sequence but great in the higher classes!
poor examples which were worthless on quizes, midterms, homework, etc.
terrible teacher the only thing that helped me was a tutor and an awesome TA
Went very fast and didn't explain things well.  Illegible handwriting.
This guy is great.  Was very flexible with the grades.  The text for the course sucked, but his explanations made it.

Well I switched teachers and got in his class, and compared to the one I had before, he is much better. But he rarely completes problems and tells you to just look at the book examples. You have to put alot of time in on your own if you expect to do good. Plus the TA's aren't that great.
well.... he is a ok teacher... but i think his TAs teach better than him...
The above comments describe this guy perfectly. In fact, I think this is the worst professor I've ever had.
No Comments
No Comments

This is a terrible professor.  Aside from his limited vocabulary he only teaches theory.  Instead of solving problems (his own example questions) he says the answer is easy and moves on.  His TA's all give different answers to the same question.
Writes illegibly, and is difficult to talk to because he is not very friendly.

Horrible Prof.  Writes on board, then stands right infront of what he wrote, making note taking hard.  He also writes illegibly.  As far as trying to help you, he'd rather just tell you that your answer must be wrong rather than help you with it.

summary_comment: Professor Conrad is a knowledgeable and helpful teacher, particularly in his ability to provide detailed solutions to problems, though his teaching style can be monotonous and difficult to follow at times. While some students found his lectures unhelpful and boring, others appreciated his comprehensive explanations and willingness to re-explain concepts. Overall, his exams closely mirror in-class examples, making diligent study essential for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Conrad is an effective teacher who helps students understand the material, as evidenced by positive outcomes such as high grades, despite his sometimes monotonous delivery. However, his lectures can be difficult to follow due to his style of teaching, which may leave some students feeling that attending lectures is unnecessary unless they need additional support for exams.

Ratings.comment: He was boring to listen to, but he was a good teacher. I understood him and ended up getting an A out of the class.

He's not bad but he just continues on and rambles endlessly about the subject. He explains what he's doing to some extent but not enough to help you understand if you really need it. Attending lectures is pointless, just an hour of nothing.

After reading reviews before taking this class, I thought that I would have yet another awful mathematics teacher, but I soon found out that this was not the case. He has actually been the BEST teacher Ive had in the Math department. He can be hard to understand but he really does just want to help. Lots of hw, but lets u know what to study 4 exams

To put it simple I would have been better off with a book or the web homework because both my math teachers lec and rec didn't help me one bit. Conrad is so monotone that it made me want to fall asleep.

This was a great class. Proofs are satisfying & logical-for the most part. Students are of course required to put fourth effort and STUDY ON HEIR OWN LIKE GROWN UPS, but that is to be expected in a higher-level course. Conrad knew a lot about math history, and that made lectures interesting.

Does not explain the material well.  If you have a question, just repeats the definition and thinks you should understand what he is talking about.  Speaks like he is above you (knowledge wise) so it is hard to comprehend what he is trying to say in plain English.

Very jittery and anxious professor. Vague most times. Don't bother going to lecture if are sure to do the online practice problems and read/review through the chapters in the book. DO attend the lecture reviews before midterms and finals, these actually are helpful!

I thought he was a decently good professor.  He explained things in a clear way and was willing to explain things in different ways if people did not understand.  He was very nice and willing to help.  If you do the book problems you will be fine.  Pay attention to the problems he does in class.  His exams are the same problems with different #s.

I do not seem to think he is as bad a prof. as everyone else.  I found him to be pretty concise and clear in his explanations.  It had been 8 years since my last math class and I felt Conrad did a good job explaining the concepts and problems.  Very organized and structured class. Posting the notes online helped, and I found the exams to be fair.

The class wasn't that difficult, but the prof was a jittery talker and not very clear. Made errors on problems in lecture, and put several vague questions on the exams. The new textbooks is HORRIBLE and full of errors, but you have to use it every day for hw problems. I had to retake the course even tho i always attended class. Get a good TA.

His lectures are worthless, and the current textbook is riddled with typos and errors. His explanations in class are vague and complicated. He doesn't seem to be able to easily answer questions, either - it appears they make him nervous.
Didn't make the class interesting. Wasn't helpful when questions were asked

Conrad is definitely a weird mathematician type, but I thought he did a fine job of teaching Math 566. There was a lot of material, but when it came time for a test, he basically spelled out what kinds of problems he was going to give. Pretty rough homework grader, but the curve was forgiving.

He probably knows what he is talking about but it does not show in lecture. Sometimes he trips up on words and does not fully explain concepts. A few technical errors interfere with class as well. He does post lecture notes online which partially help. Just make sure you read the book and go to tutoring hours.
Lectures are useless.  Do homework and go to a recitation now and then and you'll easily get an A.
He is HORRIBLE at explaining. Don't bother showing up to lecture, you can get an A without it.
not helpful at all would totally stay away from him

this was a pretty difficult class he was not very clear but i mean interesting just to watch during lecture, just quizes three labs and a mid and final, not horrible, but i would try to find a diff professor
had him for math 148 wasnt clear most of the time also sometimes wouldnt know what he is talking about i would not reccomend
I would not recommend.

I had a lot of trouble understanding him and though it seemed like he knew what he was doing he often got confused explaining problems on the board. His office hours weren't much help, because he told me not to worry about a certain topic and it was on the quiz next day.
Not good teacher... hated lectures and pointless to go to anyways.

The class was pretty easy for me overall but that's because I took AP Math I in high school and got a 5 on the AP Math AB exam. If you took calc in high school it'll definitely help because Conrad can't explain things very clearly a lot of the time and he makes a LOT of errors. Look at examples in the book and do the homework, you'll do fine.

I think this guy is an alright teacher, but over the years I have found that I require someone who is totally gentle to explain things to me or I just start crying and stop going to class out of frustration!  Conrad is a bit rough around the edges and I found asking him questions nerve-wracking, so I probably would try to avoid him in the future.

He is by far the worst teacher I have ever had in my LIFE! He cant explain anything, he is always making mistakes, and he uses the worst examples in his teaching. If you do have him, do yourself a favor - dont attend lecture, go to tutoring at MSLC and learn it yourself. He is a total waste of time.

DO YOURSELF A FAVOR, AVOID THE HEADACHE AND MAKE SURE YOU ARE NOT IN ONE OF HIS CLASSES. IT'S LITERALLY AWFUL. I'M SURE HE'S AN OK GUY OUTSIDE OF THE LECTURE HALLS BUT IN TERMS OF LEARNING FROM THIS PERSON MY EXPERIENCE WAS VERY POOR AND AFTER ASKING AROUND A LOT OF PEOPLE FELT THE SAME WAY. I KNOW OF MULTIPLE PEOPLE WHO STOPPED ATTENDING CLASS.

I understand what people mean from their prior comments, he is a bit spacey sometimes, messes up sometimes too, but they are normal HUMAN mistakes, sometimes because he doesnt understand the technology he is suing in class.  Otherwise, he is a great prof. extremely knowlegable talk to him during office hrs. if you have problems.
This class is relatively easy, but when asking for help it's easiest to just go to the MSLC and get help. Conrad is very rude and condescending. he mumbled more than anything.
His lectures are a little rough to get through but his tests are not terrible.  He is a really nice guy and very forgiving.  He is also not afraid to admit when he has made a mistake.

Difficult to understand in class sometimes -- he seemed to get confused while explaining some of the topics.  Overall, the homeworks and exams were fair.  If you really want a good understanding of the class, take it with someone else.

I understand where some of the other comments are coming from.   Conrad is kind of a quirky guy, but overall, he is a very fair and intelligent professor.  He was quite clear about expectations, and made efforts to give every student an opportunity to get a good grade.  Sometimes hard to understand, but mostly this was when he was going in depth.
complete idiot, drop his class now, if you want to learn something take another teacher. i frequently went to another profs lectures because this guy was useless

He was a witty guy, often made jokes that most people didn't laugh at.  I went to his office hours a few times, and I really do recommend it.  You get to know them better and it makes a good impression.  Lecture was kind of dull, I agree, and I had a good TA, so it evened out.  He did tell me that he would like people to talk in class and ask ?'s.

Being a freshman and taking this my first qtr of college, I wasn't wise enough to think to sneak into another prof's lectures. I wish I had. This guy dressed and spoke like a hobo. He constantly had to be corrected by students for making errors on the overheads. He never answered questions in class, and simply was not in his office for office hours
do no take the C series with him, he makes the lab grade useless and you never know what the difficulty of the exam or quiz will be.
This guy sucked...he is a joke

i don't know what others experienced in other classes but i thought he did an all right job in 512. explained everything more or less OK and gave a fair amount of useful homework. the exams were as expected and there were no surprises at all. i asked him a few questions throughout the quarter and he did his best in answering them.

He is horrible. I've never had a stronger dislike for a professor. He is very unprofessional, wearing sweatpants to every single lecture and coming unshaved and greasy. He isn't the least bit helpful. Everything I learned was straight from the book on my own or in recitation. Heck, my TA should have taught the class!

He just puts a couple slides on the overhead and then reads them. I didn't learn much at all from him. I snuck into Prof. Schouecker's lecture and learned so much more! If you do stick with Conrad, prepare to teach yourself Math from the book, and if your class is like mine, he'll wear the same plaid shirt for the first half of the quarter.

stopped going to his lecture after the second week of school simply because his lectures were so incoherent. very awkward and gets embarrased when he (frequently) screws up example problems. i managed to get a decent grade by studying on my own and doing homework. really a nice guy, just a bad teacher

Conrad is a joke, if you have the misfortune of getting him as a lecturer, go to one of the other professors. By far one of the worst i have seen at OSU. Tests are difficult and are not like the practice problems.
he sucks
he is boring and skips loads of steps while attempting to teach the material
I'm pretty sure Eric van Fossen Conrad is out of his mind.
I seriously could have learned more math from a goat with a piece of chalk taped to its head.

Worst professor I've come across at OSU. Reads from overheads some with mistakes, goes too quickly, doesn't explain anything well, and is bascially useless. Pray for a good TA, and if all else fails, do what I did and sneak into a better lecturer's class.
He is the greatest teacher I have had at OSU so far.  I think he is a decendent of Newton or some other great mathmatition.  He was awesome!!!
Not a very good professor. Stutters quite a bit and is irritating to just watch him "attempt" to explain things. Read the book and you'll be fine, just don't expect a good lecturer.

First of all, I can understand why all the bad ratings from the lower math-class students - but for 512, he was very good and VERY fair! 512 is a hard, TIME DEMANDING and challenging class, keep that in mind! Immediately find a group to study with since the homework will be very long and hard.

sooo pretty much i NEVER had any idea what he was talking about in lecture. i had him for 2 quarters in a row and everything i know, i learned from my TA or from reading the book. the exams for the most part are hard. he puts evil spins on problems you normally know how to do and it messed you up.
No Comments
don't bother going to lecture, it won't do you any good.  read the book and teach yourself, cuz god knows he won't.

Unclear in all aspects.  Pray to god you have a good TA, or you will fail miserably.  He writes stuff on the overhead without explaining why it is relevant or showing how to come about a real answer. Stay home and read the book, the examples in it are more useful than trying to decifer your notes If its possible, find a different lecture to attend.
He's a very intelligent, nice guy...way smarter at math than i could ever be.  don't worry, he helps you if you need it!
Confusing.  Wasn't as bad as some math profs i've had.

Wow...I took most of this stuff in High school and understood it, but when he teaches it, it makes absolutely no sense. He just starts writing stuff without explaining why, or how it is relevant to the answer.  The only way I passed this class is because my TA was amazing.

You fall asleep in lecture, he "teaches" exactly word for word from the book.  Just sleep in your own bed and read the book later.  He once referenced "Andrew Jackson.. for all the history buffs" when he had a number that was ??.?18281828.. who the heck knows what he's talking about.  He's very spacy and I started going to another lecture.
This guy is a total bum...He understands what he teaches but no one else does. He rambles and makes lessons much more difficult than necessary.
Hilariously out of touch with reality, but very good at teaching partial diff eqs.
Hard to understand and follow...not to mention hard to stay awake in his class.
he makes it more difficult than it is, and makes lecture completely worthless to go to. hope you get a good TA, and it won't be a problem.

Horrible.  I went to about five lectures and just stopped going.  If you're fortunate enough to have a good TA, you can probably afford to miss most of the lectures.  He truly does make the lessons harder than they really are.  Avoid the name "Conrad" when scheduling at all costs.  If you can't avoid him, just take the class another quarter.

Well, he seems like he means well, and he deffinately knows his stuff, but he just doesnt know how to convey it.  He skips around, makes BIG mistakes, and yeah, hes just not good.  If it werent for my TA, i'd be soooo lost!
Horrible.
Make sure you pay attention... this guy makes mistakes, a lot of them.  The first one being when he wakes up in the morning to shower and wear some antipersperant... enough said.

Omg this is the worst math teacher i have ever had!!!  All he does is ramble on the whole class. Like other people said, you leave more confused than you did when you walked in.  I only went to class for the notes.  Plus be careful what you say :) he has really good hearing!!
No Comments
Very unclear and horrible public speaker.
No Comments

Alright this guy seems nice.. but if you go to lecture u'll leave more confused than u were to begin with. take my advice.. skip out his lectures.. do the problems urself and go to recitation. oh and don't dare go to his office hrs..it smells and he has binoculars on the windowsill! u've been warned
He is a decent teacher and nice guys but he rambles on and goes on tangents; sorry Prof, but the fashion scheme has to go. It looks like we could organize a picnic out of your attire.

This teacher is a nice guy but EXTREMELY confusing.  I dont think I learned a thing from him.  I had to teach myself and have my recitation teacher teach me. His 2nd midterms are always impossible.  Our recitation teacher couldnt even solve some of this problems.
Worst professor I have ever had and probably ever will have.
Wierd...but a good instructor, knows his stuff. very helpful.
He's a little different. He definately loves his math. I easily got B's on the midterms without going to lecture. ...just a little spacey, but a nice guy overall

This is the dumbest teacher that I have ever came encounter with.  The exams consist of one regular math problem, and a lot of stupid proofs or some twisted problem that the teacher cannot even solve.

My worst math teacher yet. He can't talk clearly and he is very unhelpful. I questioned the grading of my midterm and he told me that he didn't grade on a consistent basis and that I would receive whatever grade the grader thought I deserved. HORRIBLE teacher and very unhelpful...Dont take his class
Pretty quirky. Lectures can be boring but are generally well laid out and helpful. His exams are not difficult and he gives review sheets with all need material. Definately not a bad professor.
Lectures were a bit boring at times, but were usually very informative.  Really nice guy, very smart. Highly recommend him.
Rambles. Review sheets make the exams easy.
terrible
Constantly makes mistakes, puts stuff not taught on exams
He is a funny guy. Exams are easy.
good teacher...uses good examples in class which relate very well to the easy exams

This was the worst math lecturer of the 4 math classes i had to take.....he mumbles a lot, cant hear what he says....he's really smart but its hard for him to come down to a student level,nice guy though
No Comments
Pointless lectures, he rambles on and doesnt teach very well.
No Comments
great sense of humor, enjoyable, A+++
One of his hobbies includes folk dancing; we enjoyed watching him at a festival.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Everett is highly regarded for his teaching quality, with many students praising his clarity and helpfulness. Despite some issues with legibility and occasional mistakes, he is known for curving grades and providing additional points through homework completion, making him a generally easy grader. However, some students find his older age and outdated teaching methods, such as using an overhead projector, to be drawbacks.
summary_comment_short: Professor Everett is highly regarded for his clear explanations and supportive approach, though his handwriting and ability to recall information in real-time are sometimes criticized. Despite his extensive experience, some students find his lectures challenging to follow and note issues with clarity and occasional algebraic errors.

Ratings.comment: Better than any of the math teachers I had in high school. He curves your Recitation grade if you turn in all your homework, which was awesome because I didn't do so well on the midterms. The midterms are okay except there's like 8 questions and they're worth 10 points a piece...=(
This guy is too old to be teaching.  He can't remember what he did 10 seconds ago.  It's not good when Everett can't read his own writing.

Phil has many years of teaching under his belt but I do think he's way past his prime. At 70-75 years old, he used an overhead projector throughout the class which as hard to read from to begin with and exacerbated by the fact that his writing was often small and illegible. I ended up learning less than I hoped to, even after consistent attendance.

Phil is a great guy.  He's very nice and so helpful (and funny!).  Do the homework!  He factors it into your grade to give you extra points.  He explains problems in class clearly and tries to make sure everyone understands.  great instructor.

While Phil has been teaching for a long time, he makes many algebraic errors on the board. However, he grades all work fairly fast and has it back in a timely fashion. I would suggest Phil as a TA if you would like an easy "A" in recitation, but learning the material should not be expected in his class.

Go to class! He does the problems that were due that day in class and then you turn them in. At the end of the quarter if you did the homework he put points back on your quizzes so that if you failed you can get a 9/10! A little hard to understand but he was easy grades wise.
very helpful. jokes are not funny but hes a really good guy !

Phil often makes mistakes in class over subject material that he should know. Students often correct him and he has difficutly reading directions accurately. He gets offended when students leave his class when his is not teaching anything and targets these students in later classes.

Phil often makes mistakes in class over subject material that he should know. Students often correct him and he has difficutly reading directions accurately. He gets offended when students leave his class when his is not teaching anything and targets these students in later classes.
Nice guy, asks that you do book homework, but it pays off. He makes sense from everything from the lectures. Wouldn't mind having him again.

Haha Phil was my T.A. in 150...hes a funny guy for not being funny at all. He tells terrible jokes every day that make no sense. Also he has nothing better to do except grade your homework so he's very strict (took off points because i did (x)^.5 instead of squaring). Overall pretty good though.
bad jokes, okay classes. nice guy, helps a lot to attend his classes

His class was not hard, but his lectures were pretty horrible.  He told a lot of jokes that were just not funny.  He wasted a lot of time doing that.  And I skipped a lot of his lectures because they were really boring.
Phil is an amazing teacher.  This class is one I took my first quarter here.  He's an amazing teacher because he taught in High School so he makes a good adjustment from High School to College math.

He is a really nice guy and gives very comprehensive notes.  If you go to lecture you should be fine.  If you need extra help go to office hours, hes really nice and willing to sit down and expalin anything to you.
No Comments
definately recommend phil...
Overall a good teacher. Class isn't too bad, study hard for the exams. turn in homework and do well on the quizzes.
Great TA...Every TA should be like him. Makes the class much easier. I never went to a single lecture, but went to every one of his classes and got a B+.
great TA
he was my TA for 148 and was very helpful.  tons better than the lecturer,  nice guy too.
He gives great examples during lecture. He knows his stuff, but can be a little cheesy at times. Over all he's a nice guy.
Good lecturer, lectures assist GREATLY on the homework, tells some pretty lame jokes, but still a good guy nonetheless.

summary_comment: Professor Sequin is highly regarded for his exceptional clarity and ability to simplify complex mathematical concepts, making him an extremely effective teacher. His TAs, particularly Matt, are praised for their patience, willingness to help, and ability to make difficult material more understandable, though some note that grading can be slower.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sequin is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching clarity and ability to simplify complex information, making him an excellent choice for students seeking a strong understanding of the material. His TAs, particularly Matt, are praised for their dedication, willingness to help, and ability to make difficult concepts accessible, though some note that grading can be slower.

Ratings.comment: Take Matt as a TA!  He is very helpful, willing to do example problems, and gives confidence to his students!

Sequin is my boy.  He drinks Coke Zero religiously.  He is EXTREMELY easy to understand.  You should not be in college if you do not understand him.  He's kind of a dork but hey, he's a math teacher, not America's Next Top Model.
Matt is awesome. He is so helpful and willing to work with you until you understand things! I definitely recommend being in his section! :)
Matt is so gorgeous!  And he moves like a dream.  Besides that, he's an absolutely brilliant teacher.  Always willing to meet outside of class.
Does a good job at simplifying and relating information, yet slow with grading.

Matt was a great math TA, quite possibly a better teacher than lecturer Man Tsoi.  He helped me to understand the topics and addressed every question that I had.  Highly recommend if you can take his section!
Excellent TA.  Very Helpful, feel very fortunate if you got Matt as a TA

Great recitation T.A.  He's extremely helpful and makes horrid lessons from the lecture prof clear and understandable.  Constantly reminds students of his office hours and is more than willing to help a student when confused.  He makes Math 150 somewhat bearable.

summary_comment: Professor Wayand is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods that focus on practical application of mathematical concepts. His unconventional teaching style, which often diverges from the textbook, challenges students to truly understand the material rather than just memorize it. While his approach can be disorienting initially, students find it effective and appreciate his dedication to ensuring they grasp the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wayand is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, known for making complex calculus concepts accessible through unconventional and engaging methods. His approach focuses on understanding rather than rote learning, which can initially be disorienting but ultimately leads to deep comprehension and success for those who engage fully with the material.

Ratings.comment: Lee is the best professor I've ever had. He teaches you to use math in the real world rather than just doing it.

This is for Calculus II. The content is very difficult, yet Prof. Wayand finds ways to make it understandable. The strangest thing about his teaching style is that he teaches content, not the text. You'll have no idea what chapter he's on. The lack of structure was difficult to catch onto at first, but when I stopped worrying about it I did well.

best professor i have ever had.  he really helps you learn if you're actually willing to put effort into the class.  the book will become your best friend and you'll want lee on you're good side.  doesn't really care about your grades, only cares that you learn. (also, he's rather sexy.)

Lee is crazy. He let us call him by his first name, and made himself really approachable. We learned math concepts by using anything from Hangman to Quarters. Coolest professor ever. I learned everything in that class with ease, because Lee helps you understand math, instead of just making you do it. Would recommend to anybody.
Absolutely the best teacher I have ever had. Thank you Lee.
He is the****. He is profane, witty, knowledgeable, and an all round smart ass. But he makes sure you know the stuff using some of the most unconventional ways.

I attempted to take this Math 215 at Franklin Unv. Lee is great and knows his math. the down fall is this, you go home to do the homework and do not see what he taught. he teaches it different than the books shows it, so you get real confused. So I don't know if it is him or now, but totally not taking it with Lee again. Take it at CSCC, easier.

Lee is one of the most unique teachers I have ever had. As far as math goes, he is willing talk to you until you understand a concept. Other profs make you DO math, Lee helps you understand math. As an aside, Lee sees himself as a facilitator, not a teacher. If you fool around, and don't learn anything because you didn't do work, he's not bothered.
He is good.  real good.
Very unique and wonderful.  Believes in actual learning as opposed to regurgitation.  Take his class for sure!
Lee Wayand knows Mathematica and he knows how to teach math.  Every time i asked him a question about a problem, he discussed it with me until it made sense.

He certainly has an interesting teaching style like everyone said. I had two midterms. The first was at McDonalds and was about cartoons, and on the second the answer to every question was that it was impossible, so if you tried to answer it you got it wrong. I failed both.  I still got an A.  Interesting style? Sure.  Is it a good thing? I say no.
No Comments
Believes in Socratic teaching. I could not imagine a better teacher.

Lee is the absolute best professor at OSU no doubt. If you dont understand something, he will work with you until you get how to do something. midterms were pretty easy, but i dont know about the exam since he emailed me saying i didnt have to take it (since i got an A in the class). his grading style is odd but thats a good thing! HIGHLY recommend
Lee is probably the best math professor in OSU.  He clearly belongs in Fort Awesome.

Lee was pretty cool most of the quarter. He has a really cool way of teaching, kinda forces you to learn yourself, which is good. The only problem I had was that he was real laid back, which was good. But he told us we could turn in our hw when ever we wan
Very good Teach
Best prof. at OSU....funny, knows what he is talking about... take his class if you can
Funny as hell.  Easy for some, some just don't get it.  Had exam and McDonalds.  Has had exams at 4 Kegs in the past.  Deffinetly take his class.
HE made class interesting and he taught me

He was an awesome teacher!  He always explained things if you didn't understand.  He explained them by making you explain them to yourself!  I know that soudns weird but it makes you understand everything! Oh and his tests are cool.  We had our first midterm at Four Kegs and the final at McDonald's.
He's awesome..He knows how to bring out the skills from u when u don;t know how to do it..
He's hot and teached math good.
very sarcastic and entertaining...even cusses which is funny but be prepared to have to work at it...strongly recommended

I had Lee for calculus and it was wonderful. Lee  makes you teach yourself and it really is a better method...learning is doing, not watching! I love him and I actually looked forward to going to class!
Lee's a great teacher but be prepared to work b/c the class is not easy!

By far the best professor I've ever had in math till now. I was surprised I actually learned something in math. I'm doing 152 now, and I just wish he was teaching it. Strongly, actually very strongly reccomended.
Lee won't teach you, he'll help you teach yourself!    Forget everything you have learned and how you learned it, and go take a class with Lee.

One of the best math teachers I've ever had. He really cares about his students learning the material, not their grades. Most people didn't do very well, but I thought the class was easy.You want this guy as your math teacher. He's hilarious.
Lee is a great math professor.  He really gets the whole class involved and his lectures aren't boring.  You'll never predict what Lee will do next.  I would reccomend him to anyone taking Math 151.

He really makes sure you understand.First math class where I actually had to work at learning, but I understand everything,also a first! :)I love this guy,he is great!You never know what to expect so class is always interesting.Loves learning,not tests!

He'll kick you where it counts, but it makes the class VERY interesting, and you might walk out of this class knowing how to do something. You need to take part in class, in lots of ways. But he's awesome, you want this guy for Calc!

summary_comment: Professor Joecken is widely regarded as one of the best teachers at Ohio State University, known for his exceptional clarity and engaging teaching style. Students consistently praise his ability to make complex topics accessible and his dedication to helping them understand the material deeply.
summary_comment_short: Professor Joecken is widely regarded as one of the best teachers at OSU, known for his exceptional clarity and engaging teaching style. Students consistently praise his ability to make complex topics accessible and his dedication to student learning.

Ratings.comment: one of the best teachers at OSU

summary_comment: Professor Xie is an effective teacher who communicates clearly and provides helpful guidance, though his classes can be challenging. He adheres to a structured approach and covers the material thoroughly, though could benefit from incorporating more complex examples. Students recommend seeking help early and often to stay on track.
summary_comment_short: Professor Xie is effective in making complex topics accessible, though his lectures tend to follow a structured format with limited deviation for challenging examples. He is a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who encourages student engagement and support.

Ratings.comment: For being a foreign teacher, he is possible to understand. This is a challenging class in general; he does an ok job with the time he has but goes by the book alot and doesn't do many challenging examples. Midterms aren't easy. Get help right away if you feel you are behind.
Chao is a great profs. His words are easily understandable, and he is very responsible to students.

Chao is a great TA.  Easy to understand and relates the material very well and makes it easy to understand.  He goes out of his way to help his students succeed.  I hope he is planning on becoming a prof, because he would be excellent (better than half the math profs currently at OSU).
Good guy overall.  Helpful if you seek him out.  Does plenty of examples.
Great TA.  Dont let his name foul you, his english is very understandable. Very helpful if you are willing to ask questions in class or go to office hours.  Has great knowledge of the material.

summary_comment: Professor Lytle, referred to as "Bev," has mixed reviews. While some students find her knowledgeable and helpful as a Teaching Assistant, others criticize her grading as inconsistent and full of errors, leading to confusion among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lytle, known as Beverly, struggles with effective teaching methods, often confusing students and making frequent grading errors. Despite this, some students acknowledge her knowledge and fairness in grading quizzes and homework, finding her presence beneficial in an already challenging course.

Ratings.comment: Beverly means well as a teacher but her tactics are useless. Every day a student corrects her work and everyday she seems more and more confused with the material. Her grading is pretty bad. She makes a lot of mistakes. Typically after she hands them out the entire class can be found waiting to find out exactly what they missed 15 points on...

Bev is a really good TA.  She knows what she is taking about and she is a fair grader when it comes to quizzes and homework assignments.  Math 152 is hard enough as it is, she makes it a little easier.

summary_comment: Professor Nasca demonstrates strong subject knowledge but can be confusing due to assuming prior course understanding. He shows a commitment to making the class accessible and provides ample opportunities for earning maximum points. However, some students find his grading to be overly harsh and his lectures rushed, with frequent corrections needed from the class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nasca demonstrates strong subject knowledge but can be confusing due to assuming prior course knowledge. Despite this, he shows a commitment to accessibility and fairness in grading, providing maximum points possible. However, some students find his lectures rushed and his approach to homework and solutions overly critical.

Ratings.comment: A.J. was the best TA I have had thus far.  He was willing to go above and beyond for his students, explained critical concepts well, and wasn't too tough.  Awesome guy!
Very knowledgeable, however can be confusing. Assumes a lot of knowledge of the course has already been obtained.
I have to say that he has tried his best to keep this class easier to access and understand. As for the grades,he really gives students the maxinum points students can earn.

He is a new teacher that doesn't care about a students grade. He posts HW online and gives us incorrect solutions to those problems. He seems like hes always in a rush during lecture and students always are correcting them. On top of that he grades unnecessarily hard. A students failure is based on his incompetence.

summary_comment: Professor Tran is highly regarded for his clear and helpful teaching style, with students praising his comprehensive lecture notes and the confidence they instill. While his exams and quizzes can be challenging and may not closely resemble homework problems, students emphasize the importance of understanding the material thoroughly and dedicating significant time to homework for success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Tran is regarded as a competent and clear instructor whose lectures and notes are highly beneficial for student understanding. However, his exams and quizzes are noted to be challenging and often differ significantly from homework problems, which can lead to unexpected difficulties during assessments.

Ratings.comment: Dr Anh is my favorite professor. If you go to class, study and do the homework problems, you'll be fine.
Dr. Tran is a good professor. He didn't write the exams so don't judge him based on how hard the exams are.
Dr Anh is a good professor. He's very helpful. His exams are not tough as long as you study and do the homework problems, it's not hard to get an "A" in his class.
I don't know why other students complained about Dr. Tran. Although the exams/ quizzes are not easy, if you understand the material and do the problem, you will do well in his classes.
Dr. Tran is a great professor. Although the exams/ quizzes are not easy, if you understand the material and do problems, you will do well.

You go to lecture, understand what he is trying to teach you (for the most part)and the go home to do the homework (alot) and struggle but get through it. When you finish you fell confident but then quiz/ test time comes and you fail. Some kids just get it, and some dont. Personally I felt "unlucky" everytime I failed if that makes any sense.

His notes are very clear and not very hard to understand. Homework takes a long time to finish but when you are done you feel confident. Then you get to quizzes, midterms, and final where none of the questions are remotely close to the ones on the homework and you get screwed
Dr. Tran was one of my favorite professors at OSU so far. His notes are insanely clear, and his exams are fair. He is lenient in giving points back if you think you deserve them.
Have to do example problems and go to lectures and recessitations. Do the homework and use the textbook and you'll be fine.

I can say without shadow of a doubt that this guy was one of the least helpful professors I have ever had. Even if I could understand him, it wouldn't matter because none of the problems or notes on the board had anything to do with exams.  JUST DROP

Actually having a professor in this class is pointless. He is hard to understand and I had to teach myself almost everything from the book. Quizzes and tests have problems that are much more difficult than the homework.

If you're not a strong math student or have never taken Calculus before, this class will be a struggle. I do go to lectures, but they don't help. The textbook is much better at explaining things, but his assessments either deviate from the book or he'll choice obscure questions. Exams are difficult and I wish I had dropped this class.

Lectures and recitations are a waste. The book will teach it far more clearly than he ever will. Exams are difficult and don't really pertain to the big points of the chapters. Basically random stuff he felt you wouldn't know because he didn't go over it.

summary_comment: Professor Milne is known for making exams straightforward and fair, often resulting in high class averages. However, his lectures can be challenging due to his mumbled speech and poor handwriting, and he tends to focus heavily on theoretical proofs, which can be confusing for some students. Despite these challenges, many find him helpful and appreciate his straightforward approach to exams.
summary_comment_short: Professor Milne is known for making exams very straightforward and fair, often including exam problem types directly in lectures, which helps students perform well. However, his lectures can be challenging due to his mumbling, poor handwriting, and tendency to delve deeply into theoretical proofs, which may confuse some students.

Ratings.comment: Milne is a straight thug. He really got me interested into math. Yes, he is somewhat hard to understand during class and proofs can be dry for those of you not so math oriented. Anyway, like everyone else has said, the tests are easy as hell and the class is very straightforward.
Wants students to do well.  Easiest calc 3 prof by far.

Honestly, his class is kind of difficult to pay attention in and understand what he is saying/writing, but he is incredibly helpful and makes his exams so everyone can pass. There's no curve because he makes it so easy. Just read the book and practice the LNP's and you'll succeed. He tries really hard to motivate the class and I respect that.

This guy's very stringent. He won't round grades, even if you're a tenth of a percent from another letter grade. Steve's hard to understand and his handwriting is atrocious. On the plus side, he is usually up-front about content that is contained on quizzes or exams. Very smart, but not the nicest person.

Milne can be difficult to understand in lecture because he mumbles a bit but he is really helpful if you need help with the material. He is extremely straight-forward on quizzes and exams so if you do all of his lecture note problems and understand them you will get an A in the class.

I really liked Milne. He can be hard to understand when he's going on about theory and proof stuff, and his hand writing's pretty bad, but he basically does all the exam problem types in class. Exams are very reasonable and fair- really high class averages. Take this guy for an easy Calc III. He keeps it real.

Most fair math exams you'll ever have. Pay attention to lecture note problems. Downside is that this guy spends way too much time on theory and will just confuse you once he gets rambling. If you're willing to put in the effort and can deal with his chicken scratch and needless rambling a you'll be ok. Very helpful too

This professor at times was able to convey the material, but most the time he was to busy lost in what I can only describe as his own world, where the most important thing is proving the proofs.  Several times he has been doing the proofs and said "you know what I'm doing" and "your smart read the book" and honestly I was completely lost.

His lectures are pointless but the Lecture Note Problems are really great. Tests are pretty straight forward, going to TA's for office hours helps. If possible, choose another professor for this class. Because in general, Calc III isn't bad!

His lectures are borderline pointless, he basically does the examples from the book on the board in a more difficult way. The Lecture Note Problems are very helpful--quizzes/tests come straight from them
Hard to understand at times, but helpful with tests and quizzes. If you do the work, you should be fine. Good professor.
The way to understand this professor is to read the textbook before class and/or attend the recitation. The TA is more helpful than the professor.

He has what he call Lecture Note Problems that are for every section of the text. If you do them and understand them well you'll get an A. All exams has 5% bonus, and some bonus on quizzes.Best thing that if you did not do well in one of the two midterms the grade can be replaced with your ((best midterm+ final Exam score)/2.7)

Often hard to understand because of his handwriting and how quiet he speaks, but if you read the textbook before class and attend class, it's pretty easy to get an A. His tests are really easy (mostly multiple choice and often with problems taken directly from the book). He also tells you what the test problems are during class.

I took his class for Math 153 and I really didn't to expect to meet him again in Math 254. He had a very bad hand writing and he keeps mess up with the blackboard. the pictures he drew on the board does not help at all. In fact it is more misable. also he has a low voice and i can never understand what he is talking about.

If you have a choice do not take him, he rambles on about something at the board, and moves quickly.  His tests are ridiculously hard and he does not prepare you at all. Our class average was in the 50s on both tests and the class was not curved in any way.
Terrible!  Midterm averages were always in the 50s and we had no curve.  He also gave midterms with 17 questions to do in 48 min, whereas 151/152 only had 6, it seemed.  Do not take.

He was really hard to understand at points and tended to ramble on about things, but if you kept paying attention through it, he would literally tell you everything that was on the tests. My TA was really what taught me the material. His grading scale makes getting an A really easy. Didn't study for 2nd midterm, got a 73, and still got an A overall

He spends far too much time doing proofs than actually teaching. Add that to exams that are twice as long as the should be and a ridiculously strict grading scale. I would not recommend this teacher in anyway.
worst teacher ever! if there is anyway possible do not get this teacher!

AWFUL. Probably the worst professor I have ever had. This was one of the reasons I dropped my math major, as I hated the proof-based discipline it was turning into. Milne simply made us regurgitate proofs verbatim, and took points off on legit proofs that were slightly different. He is senile and stupid, awful, horrible.
It's safe to say this class is ridiculous enough to the point that it made me switch minors.  Drop.

The coursework was fairly easy, however, Dr. Milne was quite possibly one of the worst professors to understand ever. His handwriting isn't much better than a 5-year-old's, but his easy exams are kind of worth the poor lectures.
Blazes through the lecture with completely illegible handwriting. Best advice is listen closely and don't read but do look at the pictures. He is too smart to be teaching 254.
Only wanted proofs exactly as he wrote them. The class is an exercise in memorization, not learning.

You might feel like dropping the class after his first lecture. His notes are so scattered and he thinks so quickly that it's really difficult to follow him. He's crazy smart and a nice guy though, and he tries to make it really obvious exactly what he's putting on the exams. He even works the problems out in lecture. Just pray you get a good TA.

I think that he is a good guy and probably knows a lot about math, but I thought that he was unfair with his grading.  He took off lots of points for dumb things, expecially on midterms.  I did like the large amount of tests and quizzes he dropped to determine the final grade but I don't think it made up for the hard grading.  All in all he is not
He never ennunciates, his writting is little better than scrawl, and he talks fast.  You can rarely understand what he's saying, and he just seems to get confused when you try to ask him a question.

One of the best professors I've had. The material is hard and his lectures can be confusing but go to his office hours he will stay there with you until you understand what you are doing. Yes he has trouble seeing but it doesnt matter. If you have a question say "excuse me" and he will answer your question. Highly recomended if you're not lazy.

I scored Dr. Milne a 2 on easiness because I probably would have been worse off in Dynin's class. Milne's main problem is that he's blind despite wearing huge thick glasses. I'm sure he's brilliant, but he couldn't see a hand raised beyond the first row of the class. His exams were handwritten and hard to read.
I don/'t not like math, but he was okay. An okay guy, I say! I like it also when he says things like, /"The square root of . . ./" =)
Not too bad of a teacher.  Has good examples which are almost always on test.  If you can get an old midterm do so because they are almost exactly the same.
Lectures made no sense. Notes not readable. Stands in front of them at the board. Always late to class.

I thought Dr. Milne was a pretty good teacher - definitely looked better after taking 254 with the Glove. Fairly entertaining (he once talked about Tony Kornheiser's drinking habits for five minutes) and tests are not very hard. All test problems come from class or the textbook.

Come on.  I loved Dr. Milne.  He was pretty entertaining, and helpful, and very nice.  He never tried to trick you or anything... though the exams were long, they were easy.  And there was a generous curve.  For a math teacher, he was good.  Probably a B+ on the math teacher scale.
Doesn't show enough examples but the ones he does are usually on tests
He is pretty difficult to follow in lecture; uses math terminology and writing is very hard to read. He seemed helpful though I never spoke to him. Tests aren't too bad, they are just very long!
Very random.  Not clear in lectures.

He is a brilliant mathmatician, but he teaches at such a high level it is hard to follow. He is geniunely caring about his students. If you can get past the first chapter in this course then you will to fine. It is hard to pick up his teaching style at first, but a good teacher overall.
Milne is hands-down the worst teacher I have had at Ohio State.
HORRIBLE PROFESSOR!!!
Horrible teacher, midterm averages were in the 50s he curved it by 5 pts.  Do not take.
