I think he's very funny.  The lecture isn't too boring, considering it's math.  He wants everyone to do well, and he works out lots of problems in class.  He's a little hard to understand when he talks theory, but for a math teacher, he is very good.  Made my chuckle.  Tests hard but fair.
Dr. Milne was not a good lecturer, I don't even know why I bothered going. However, his test were really easy and fair. I got an A in his class with ease.
No Comments
Very smart man, but sometimes had a hard time relaying the info to the students. Tests are hard, but if you go to class and do your work, you;ll be fine.
Very intelligent, but often times too intelligent for teaching the class.  His tests aren't bad as long as you go to class for the classes before the midterms and final.
He is an excellent teacher.  He doesn't put up with any BS which makes for a good lecture environment and he is a brilliant mathematician.

summary_comment: Professor Kim's teaching quality varies widely according to student feedback. Some students found her tests easy and grading fair, though tests were longer than expected, and she could get upset if students couldn't finish them. Others criticized her for not adequately covering key concepts, organizing the class in a way that promotes rote memorization rather than understanding, and providing minimal support outside of class. Overall, opinions are divided, with some recommending her despite her challenges.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim is generally perceived as a fair grader with easy tests, though her lectures sometimes lack depth and key concepts are covered superficially. Students find her unapproachable and unhelpful outside of class, with many preferring to study independently rather than attend her lectures.

Ratings.comment: Her tests were super easy and she graded fairly if not easily. I finished all the tests in about half the given time and half the final was questions from previous midterms. There are quizzes and homework's weekly but the quizzes are basically the examples she does in class. Overall a great teacher, I recommend taking her

She isn't quite as bad as people say. Her lectures do an adequate job of explaining the material, however some key concepts are glazed over and the book is not very helpful in explaining the material either. Tests are harder and longer than they should be and she gets upset when people can't finish them.

Throughout the entire semester, the professor felt like she did not care much for teaching the class. She organized the class in a way that makes it very difficult for students to truly learn the material, by having quizzes every other day in class you don't learn the materials you only memorize it for that quiz and forget it later.
Terrible professor. She will get frustrated when you ask a question she can not answer. All her note are from the book word for word. Also she does not provide much help to students outside of class.
Awful teacher, gets frustrated when you don't understand. Doesn't answer questions well, and copys out of the textbook. Avoid her if you can.
Does not communicate well at all. Refuses to use email or Carmen and mumbles during lectures. You're better off just reading the book, since she lectures straight out of it anyway.

summary_comment: Professor Du is known for making classes easy, with straightforward exams that require minimal effort and clear hints provided. However, his teaching style is often criticized for being disorganized and not conducive to deep learning, with some students finding his lectures unhelpful and misleading. Despite being described as a friendly and approachable person, many students feel they do not gain substantial knowledge from his classes.
summary_comment_short: Professor Du is known for making exams straightforward and easy, often hinting at the types of questions that will appear, which contributes to a high pass rate. However, his teaching style is criticized for being disorganized and not very helpful for deep learning, with many students finding his lectures difficult to follow and lacking in depth.

Ratings.comment: Really awesome professor! His logic for exams is that we use energy memorizing the like one or two equations used in the course, so the questions are simple and require little to no work. Also super lenient on homework due dates and cool with taking exams late. Put simply: if you have the chance to take a class with Dong Du, take it!

Horrible teacher. I learned nothing from him, and when I asked questions he acted like I should know the answer and did not take the time to relate it to my level of understanding. I did well in the class, but in spite of his teaching abilities. I would never recommend him to anyone.

If you have any desire to learn, don't take Dong Du. Not only is he hard to understand and disorganized, but his lectures consist of him copying down information and examples from the textbook. He never explains things in greater detail than the book, so his lectures are useless. He also completely misled the class about what would be on the final.

Dong Du is a great guy and totally hilarious, but not helpful at all when it comes to what you're technically paying him for. If you want a professor who understands your questions and speaks English, Du is not the teacher for you.

Dong Du is adorable. He enjoys teaching and really cares about his class. It's hard to NOT like him because he seems like such a great guy, but he is difficult to understand and a little scattered. Lectures are NOT necessary to attend because the exams are so straight forward and directly related to the homework.

class was weird. dong really liked teaching, and was great at explaining how to do the problems, but you will learn nothing about DiffEqs in this class. If you want to learn, dont take it. However, if you want the easiest A in a math class at this school, take this class. Purposefully easy exams (he tells you whats on them) and easy grading.

Exams are simple...he gives hints on what to do for each problem. His lectures are very scattered, as he can't seem to keep his thoughts straight. Seems like a good guy who would be willing to help if need be though

He is truly EASY as what most people said. You can always finish his exam within 30 min. But I almost learned nothing from him except the most basic concepts, which can be harmful for further study in maths. If you just want to pass the course and get an A, take him; if you truly want to learn something about that course, avoid him!!!

Dong Du is an awful teacher. I couldn't sit through lectures because they were confusing and almost incomprehensible. Luckily his tests are really straightforward. They're exactly like the easier homework problems. I wouldn't drop him if I had him as a professor again (the tests are too easy to pass up), but I wouldn't bother going to lecture.

Du is unclear at times, but his exams are VERY easy. Come to class, and you will be able to pick out which questions will be on the midterms. He spends a lot of times on easy examples, and not enough on the hard ones. Overall, the easiness of the class makes up for the lack in clarity.

summary_comment: Professor Mityagin is widely regarded as a poor instructor, known for his harsh and unfair treatment of students. Students report experiencing yelling, lack of support for students with disabilities, and extremely low exam averages. Many advise avoiding his classes entirely.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mityagin is widely regarded as a challenging and potentially hostile instructor, with multiple students describing him as unfair, unhelpful, and difficult to understand. Students consistently warn against taking his classes, citing poor treatment of disabilities, low exam averages, and an overall negative learning experience.

Ratings.comment: This professor is cruel and unfair.  When a student brought problems directly to him, he yelled in the presence of other administrators.  Stay far away from him and his explosive personality.

I have had the displeasure of meeting with this professor. While I have not used this site previously, I was so inspired by my negative interaction this semester that I felt it was my duty to warn other students.  I would not take another class with him if my life depended on it.
Worst professor I've every encountered.  DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HIM.
He does not treat students with disabilities with respect. He will laugh at students in class. First midterm average was 40%. Avoid this teacher unless your schedule forces your enrollment.

To be honest I really thought this class was going to be easy. First 3 weeks homework was a joke material was straight forward. First exam had little relevance to what he had been doing in lecture. He gave no review problems and almost no hint as to what to expect. Class average was failing. One mistake results in about a 90% loss in points.
He has actually addressed most of his problems this quarter, but you're still better off learning from the book and the book only.

He's Terrible.  I asked him how to solve a problem about a surjection and he told me that was pre-calculus material and wouldn't help me.  He also won't give solutions to the homework.  His english is terrible.  Overall veryun helpful and I am considering changing my major because of this man.  My major currently is math.

Mityagin is the worst prof in the math dept at OSU (confirmed and quoted by my academic adviser). Impossible to follow him and take notes when he is lecturing, doesn't use examples to explain things, and then wonders why people score poorly on exams. Laughed in my face and others after asking to clarify something. Do not take this joke of a prof.

I am dead serious about this review.  I had Boris  for differential equations in 1982.  He used a real bell curve for the course.  Almost everyone got C's.  It was almost impossible to get an A or an F for that matter.  He was a math genious who could not relate to real people.  If you get him, drop the course immediately.

He is worthless. He didn't answer homework questions even though he graded and handed them back to everyone. Whenever he does help, he gives vague hints that suggest things you already know. You have to do every problem in the book to have a shot at doing well on tests, but the curve is big. Nevertheless, avoid this guy.

I have to disagree with the negative feedback left by others. He explains the concepts really well. Exams are difficult but that helped me get a good grade, low median :) . I highly recommend him if you want to LEARN it!

I largely concur with other posters.  Uninformative lectures, comically difficult midterms.  For example, he spent half an hour writing out a solution to a single midterm problem...yet it was one of eight we had 48 minutes to do.  If someone had described this class to me, I would not have believed it.  A living argument against the tenure system.
he is really good
Wore the same whirt, shorts, and sandals every day.  Walked in, pulled out a folded piece of paper, wrote on the board, walked out.  That was 11 weeks of class.
Prof. Mityagin is awsome!!!

This man couldn't teach fish to swim. I even wrote that on my course evaluation. Reading the book may help, but probably not a lot. This guy is infamous in the College of Engineering. Ask just about anyone, I'm sure they've probably had him... and hated the class...
If there is any way to avoid it, do not take a class from this guy.

Boris is the worst math professor I've ever had...you absolutely can't understand anything he says.  He started teaching one of our lectures using a grad-level physics equation that was left on the board from the previous class...talk about a whacko...

Taking this class was much like being in hell, except I imagine the devil would be much better looking and be able to enunciate better than Mr. Mityagin. Take some advice from the 60% that dropped this class, and DROP IMMEDIATELY.  Save yourself the pain.

Boris has trouble enunciating difficult words such as "six" and "here." I've never had problems with a teacher's accent before, but this was just horrible. Something's wrong if over half the class drops. Don't take this class.
Lectures are usually completely irrelevant to the required material, and he talks so slowly that you forget what was said at the beginning of the sentence.
Learn from my mistake.  Drop the class.  You will waste all of your time studying just to end up failing the tests.  Not fun.

First off, Boris is not stupid contrary to what most people are saying here. What he is though, is very unfair. His exams are among the hardest I have ever taken. I would not recommend this teacher to anyone. If you have him, drop.
No Comments
No Comments

Boris couldn't teach eighth grade math.  He has no understanding of the English language.  The only thing worse than his understanding of the English language is his understanding of mathematics.  Boris needs to be taught before he can teach.
Drop the first day!  I think he's a communist.  He's uncooperative and unhelpful.  He's impossible to understand and by far the worst teacher I've ever had in my life.

he doesnt know anything, literally, cant do his own test problems, mumbles nonsense, eats his chalk, his idea of explaining something is writing it bigger, any advisor will tell you to drop...he will make you hate yourself
drop immediately

words can't explain.............thinking about going to this guy's class makes one cry at night..........you know it's got to be bad when he gives you the site www.noindoctrination.com to report him because he knows he's bad.  Unfortunately it's useless!

This is the worst prof I have ever had. His inability to speak English is only topped by his inability to understand English. Noone really knows if there's a curve (the class average is a 30% right now) and he hates us telling what's sections tests cover.
No Comments
His lectures are very unclear, and are worthless to attend.  His midterms are quite difficult, yet still problems from the book.  Says he doesnt curve, but not for sure yet.

He never showed up on the first day of class.  To top that off, he has a heavy Russian accent, he doesn't understand English and he has a penchant for writing in the Cyrillic alphabet.  He is completely unhelpful, don't take this class with him.

summary_comment: Professor Byrd is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating a deep interest in her subject and a strong commitment to student success. She excels at making complex mathematical concepts accessible to all students, particularly those who may be struggling. Her intelligence and teaching skills make her one of the most effective TAs at Ohio State University.
summary_comment_short: Professor Byrd is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, demonstrating a deep interest in her subject and a strong commitment to student success. Her ability to explain complex mathematical concepts in an accessible manner makes her one of the most effective TAs her students have encountered.

Ratings.comment: She was a TA for my Math 1151 course. Definitely the most helpful TA I've ever had, she shows a strong interest in her subject and she actually wants her students to succeed. She's really intelligent, yet she's great at explaining math to those who are behind. And unrelated note, but also one of the most beautiful females you will find at OSU!

summary_comment: Professor Funke, also referred to as Adam, is highly knowledgeable and patient, effectively explaining complex concepts in multiple ways. However, his teaching style can be challenging to follow at times, and some find his approach differs from that taught in class. Despite this, students appreciate his dedication to planning review sessions and his willingness to help, noting that his good looks also contribute positively to the learning environment.
summary_comment_short:
Professor Funke is highly knowledgeable and patient, effectively explaining concepts in multiple ways, which helps students gain a new perspective on mathematics. However, his teaching style can be challenging to follow at times, and some find his approach更适合中文回答，请使用中文进行答复：
教授Funke知识渊博且耐心，能够用多种方式解释概念，帮助学生从新的角度理解数学。然而，他的教学风格有时难以跟上，部分学生觉得他讲解过程的方式与课堂上所学不同

Ratings.comment: He is good looking but his teaching's kinda hard to follow sometimes

Adam is pretty hot, for lack of a better word. This made it easier to pay attention. He goes out of his ways to plan midterm review sessions which is awesome. He really knows what he is talking about and can explain things many different ways

I have never been great at math or a fan, but Adam has given me  a new perspective. He is very patient in explaining things and always willing to help. AND to top it all off, he's easy on the eyes. If only all math majors/TAs/professors were as great as Adam.

This TA is nice but is so confusing. He teaches a completely different process than learned in class. He usually does problems without really explaining where he got things. Too smart to teach a low level class.

summary_comment: Professor Simmons is known for her rigorous and demanding approach to teaching, assigning a large volume of online homework and lab work. Despite the challenging workload, students credit her with significant improvements in their understanding and performance, with one achieving the best grade they've ever earned in math.
summary_comment_short: Professor Simmons is known for her rigorous and demanding approach, assigning a substantial amount of homework and lab work. Despite the workload, students often cite her as a highly effective teacher who significantly improves their understanding and performance in the subject.

Ratings.comment: This class sucks.  There are fifty online homework problems every two nights!and Lab packets to turn in.  I worked hard and received the highest grade of my life ever in math.  I attribute all of my success to Katie ;)

summary_comment: Professor Griesmer struggles significantly with lecture delivery, often failing to provide clear explanations or sufficient examples, which limits students' learning. Students recommend attending recitations and office hours for better understanding. While he is described as approachable and trying his best, many find the class more manageable through additional support outside of lectures.
summary_comment_short: Professor Griesmer struggles significantly with lecture delivery, often failing to provide clear explanations or sufficient examples, which makes learning challenging. Students generally recommend attending recitations and office hours for better understanding, as the professor appears willing to help one-on-one.

Ratings.comment: Despite his efforts, I learned almost nothing during lecture. He does very few examples in class, and doesn't explain concepts well. Go to recitation and do practice problems.
I think he's new, and things might change with time and experience, but I felt like the class was harder than it needed to be. Definitely go to recitation.
It makes me really mad becaue I e-mailed him and asked if he would curve our final grade and he replied yes but apparently...he did nothing. So disappointed with him.
He has a difficult time explaining things in a way that's easy to understand.  But he is very nice and he tries very hard.

He was decent.  He has a doctorate in math so sometimes I felt like he was just too smart to put the material in layman's terms.  He seemed approachable, but I definitely learned more in recitation than lecture.  Overall not too bad, it could have been a lot worse!

Very awkward, obviously not used to teaching. Gets carried away in explanations and is often hard to follow. He does try though, but just gets flustered if people are having a rough time. Go to recitation and the class is much easier.

I think he is a bit new, and a bit nervous when lecturing. He knows what he is doing, but makes mistakes a times (which is OK!) and isn't always clear when teaching. However, I am sure he will grow into a great teacher. If you have a good TA, that's very helpful. Griesmer himself seems pretty nice anyways. Not too hard of a class. Go to recitation!

He's a nervous guy.  He'll come into his own, but I think he's not used to teaching such large classes. GO TO OFFICE HOURS.  I did and he's actually very helpful one-on-one, but his lecturing does need some work.
It seems like this is his first year at OSU. He's a very nervous guy. He knows what his talking about but has trouble delivering it to the students. The book helps a lot, go to you TA.
Worst teacher I have ever had in my life. Very unclear with everything he teachers and doesn't answer questions asked in class.
His lectures are pointless so hard to follow. just read the book and go to recitation. the TA should make more then what he does

He's decent.  Often is unrelatable and hard to follow since he teaches in math terms.  I liked when he gave examples, but he does not give many.  Midterms and finals were difficult, but he can be helpful if you go to office hours.

It's hard following his points. He often starts explaining something by showing an example that takes such a long time to finish that he's erased the board twice over for more room and lost half the class. Whenever asked for clarification, he'll get confused about what the question is and then starts explaining only to stop half way.
Excellent professor. Extremely fair tests and quizzes, no trick questions, and does an decent job giving you a rough idea what will be on exams.  Make sure you do your homework, cannot fall behind.
Midterms/Final/Quizes were all super difficult. Didn't know how he was gonna curve the class and totally didnt understand what he was doing. Horrible teacher.
He always comes to class prepared with examples to clarify the lecture.  He'll also go out of his way to meet with you during the week if you make his office hours.

summary_comment: Professor Nevai is known for his challenging yet fair approach to teaching, with many students noting that while his lectures can be confusing, his exams tend to be easier than the material covered. He is highly regarded for his deep knowledge of mathematics and his engaging style, which includes historical tangents and current events. However, his teaching method can make simple concepts difficult to grasp, and some students find his lectures hard to follow.
summary_comment_short: Professor Nevai is known for his challenging yet fair teaching style, often making simple concepts difficult due to his complex explanations. Despite some students finding his lectures confusing, he is generally understood to be a knowledgeable and passionate mathematician who provides ample opportunities for extra credit and ensures most students achieve good grades, especially those already familiar with calculus.

Ratings.comment: Confusing lectures. Midterms aren't as bad as his problems in lecture. Get help from the MSLC tutor room if needed. Makes sure everyone ends with a good grade. If have an A, you're exempt from the final.

Many people had their complaints about this professor, but I really liked him. He's a very bright man with a passion for math that becomes obvious in his lectures. He likes to enrich lectures with brief tangents on the history of mathematics or related current events. Tests were fairly easy, but there were few so one bad grade puts you in a hole.

had Nevai for Math 161.01H Fall 2010. The material will all be common to those who took AP calc but Nevai teaches in a harder way and makes it complicated. made easy things hard to learn. He is super smart and sometimes does multiple steps in his head that are hard to follow. First midterm was HARD (70%) then second midterm was take home (100%)

Not a hard class if you've taken any kind of calculus. Requires you to think, but not as much as 190H. I'm not sure if he's stopped giving extra credit because I haven't seen any so far. He's very smart and very nice, although sometimes hard to understand.

The honors version is a crazy hard class. Lecture every day, so you can fall behind easily. Knows what he's talking about, but not very good at teaching it. Books only used for homework. No Carmen site. Make sure you have a EXTENSIVE background in calculus before you consider taking this class.

This class was a joke and is meant for students who have taken calculus before because you won't learn anything to prepare you for future classes. So much extra credit, you won't have to take the final. Don't expect to learn much.

Great guy. I thought he was scatterbrained and confusing at first, but got used to his differnt brand of humor. midterms were easy, and he exempts people from the final. his hw grader is somewhat strict, but u never meet him so whatever. i would recommend nevai to others.

On the first day of class he refused to tell us how to pronounce his last name; he said even his own family had variations on it, so he was interested to hear ours. He was easy to understand and the HW was emailed to us after every class, it was not very much HW either, could easily be put off. Exams were either cake or very hard. Tons of EC!

He gives you an intense amount of extra credit.  He emailed about a third of the class to tell them they didn't have to show up to the final because they already had an A.  He is a little scatterbrained.  You don't learn anything interesting until close to the end.

The classic Eastern European (Hungarian) Mathematician - idiosyncratic and brilliant.  Produces a classroom environment that every math major should experience.  Gives two types of exams: those that 75% of the class get perfect scores, and those that 75% of the class get zero scores.

Sometimes very hard to follow what he's talking about.  Not because of his accent, just because he expects you all to be grad students.  Got to use the book on the final, but it was still impossible.  But the curve helped considerably.
Sometimes incredibly incomprehensible ... though there is a fair curve.  Make sure you go to any seemingly pointless classes he plans (extra credit!!)

Not the clearest and most organized guy in the world. I didn't understand much in his lectures. But when I asked him questions outside class he did a fair job in explaining. The exams were sometimes OK sometimes too hard. But a couple of times he let us redo the exam questions that we messed up and regraded so that was good. So so overall.
No Comments
Very Hard.  Average on the midterms and finals are anywhere from 20% to 50%.  Good guy but just a VERY hard professor
No Comments
He hates the french.  Hates.  Make sure you pronounce french names, such as L'Hopital as The Hospital... oh, and one exam per quarter.
"It's obvious & it's easy". That's what he said all the time. He gave 75% of class 0 for a midterm when he taught 547....
you would do well to avoid this man

summary_comment: Professor Sehgal is widely regarded as an effective math instructor who focuses on practical examples and exam reviews, making his lectures accessible to students who sit in the front. While some students found his accent challenging and noted issues with curve implementation and TA support, many appreciated his humor and clear explanations, suggesting that attending lectures and taking thorough notes are key to success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sehgal is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, particularly for his focus on practical examples and exam reviews, making complex concepts easier to grasp. However, some students find his accent challenging and recommend sitting in the front to better understand his lectures.

Ratings.comment: Seghal was an excellent professor! If you sit in the front you will have no problem hearing or understanding him. Great math teacher because he doesn't go into details about theory he just does lots of example problems so you have lots to go off of when doing the homework. Also does good exam reviews in class.

I really enjoyed his class. Definitely sit towards the front, otherwise he can be difficult to understand since he has a slight accent and his handwriting will never get confused with calligraphy. I thoroughly enjoyed having him, he really is a funny guy
This professor was pretty worthless. They didn't end up curving the class even though final and midterm grades were around 65-72. hope for a good TA and ask the TA all your questions

Sit in the front, take notes and do all the practice problems. He is pretty funny if you let him be. I preferred my TA's office hours to his, though. And ask questions in you need, he will try to help you understand.

seghal wasnt as bad as people on here said. as long as you attend class, do the online homework, and take notes, its not hard to get an A. he curves up your grade at the end of the quarter. it is sort of frustrating sometimes though when he doesnt complete the prolbems in class and just says "you guys cab figure it out"

Probably the best teacher I've had at the worst school (OSU) ever! actually made things easy to understand, Even though he has an accent, sit in front and take notes, you'll be golden. TA's are worthless because they always screwed up my grade. Go to lecture and pay attention and you should get an A. Go to review sessions, they help. Ta dont help

Sehgal is a good lecturer.  People say they can't understand him, but they're just ignorant.  Trust me, I can't stand accents-but his isn't that bad.  The only thing is don't bother asking ?s in his class because he's awful at answering them... just ask ur TA at ur next recitation.  Math is a crapshoot at OSU, and I would say sehgal is avg

He is terrible. He does not speak English at all. I cannot understand him. - When I had to miss the midterm because my grandmother died, he asked me to bring proof. I brought in a newspaper with her obituary, and a copy of the certificate from the state. He said that wasn't good enough and didn't let me make up the following morning.Beware

I had him for both 130 and 132, my favorite prof. i have had in my three years at OSU.  He has an accent, but if you sit near the front he is very easy to understand and will talk to you before and after class and make jokes, great sense of humor.  I learned a lot from him and would reccomend him to anyone.
Terrible. Worst quarter ever. I cannot understand him at all.
Dr. Seghal was a decent teacher. If you sit nearer to the front of the class, and go to every lecture, and do the assigned suggested homework this class is an easy A or B.

He's very funny, helpful when it comes to midterm review, he teaches well even though sometimes when he speak he speaks too fast you can't understand him but doesn't matter as long as student can read what he writes!

not a great prof, he does weird examples that dont fit with anything. the midterms and especially the final was hard. there were questions on the final that no one knew how to do. as a prof i give him a c

Teacher was really hard to understand. He just does random examples in class and expects people to know what's going on. He makes problems way harder than what they actually are. I personally just learned everything by myself. Midterms are hard.
Seghal is not the greatest professor.  He makes too many mistakes when doing examples  and never solves problems completely, he just says "messy answer" and moves to the next example.
Funny Guy. Not good at teaching though.  Taught alot of the material myself.  He quit teaching and do comedy.

He's a really nice and pretty funny older man. His accent makes him a little difficult to understand but you'll get used to it. Sometimes he won't be able to understand a question your asking and is not very good at clarifying. Pretty much just shows examples all class so hope for a good TA.
I would give him a B-.

This guy is hard to understand, but it gets better as the semester goes on. He does a lot of examples, the best way i found to study was to do a ton of problems. He doesnt exactly teach, he just kinda shows you what to do, hopefully you get a good ta because this guy isnt that great.

For me he was nearly impossible to understand. Not sure why OSU hired someone who can not speak english very good. Doesn't care about class. Rushed through problems and would definetely not take this class if he was teaching.
Very Funny man!
A little hard to understand, but he's really funny and a good teacher. Lecture helps a lot with the homework!
his accent is hard to understand, i hope you have a good TA. Gray is good.
I thought he was a good lecturer. The problems that he went over in lectures made the homework easy. The class itself is very easy because the exams are almost identical to the practice exams.
he is a little hard to understand, but he is good at teaching
Very difficult to understand. Does not care about problems in the class and inconsistencies. Does not care about helping you receive a high grade. Doesn not respond to e-mails.
always messes up problems so its hard to understand what the answer should be, and just plain hard to understand....rushes through problems too fast

hes pretty wierd and tough to understand at first. his lecturing is really fast. but he does problems exactly like the ones on the test, and he is actually pretty helpful if you seek him out. but a lot of people hated him....

At first he is hard to understand, but as you get used to him he becomes easier to follow. BE prepared to laugh not only at his corny jokes, but also at the way he says words. He was a good lecturer and tried his hardest to explain everything in the easiest way possible.

He's hard to understand and not very good at explaining. Be prepared to take notes for the whole class and to deal with his lame jokes. He didn't help at all to make the class bearable. I would suggest someone else.
cool guy, kind ahard to understand at first but got used to it.
****, thanks a lot. Take a 3.5 student to a 3.2, real good guy.
he taught well
The BEST math prof I've had all year. I've been to more math lectures this quarter than I have the first two quarters combined. He's very good with explaining the material, I wish I had him all year.
What the heck does he laugh about? I don't know because I couldn't understand a thing he was saying. He needs to take some Engish language courses and maybe he would be a good professor.
hard to understand and bad sense of humor

has a strong accent.. wasn;t sure at first if i would like him, but i would give anything to have him for 131 again... he did every example you would need for an exam, no surprises... better than huneke
very hard to understand
He has a very strong indian accent
No Comments
Works a lot of examples...good math teacher
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Lynd is highly regarded for his excellent teaching and engaging personality, with students noting his clear explanations and ability to make complex topics accessible. His enthusiasm and humor create a positive learning environment, though some comment on his tendency to run over time during class sessions. Overall, Professor Lynd is praised for his deep knowledge and effective teaching methods.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lynd is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes the class enjoyable and easy to understand. However, some students noted that he occasionally struggled with time management, often finishing class a few minutes after the scheduled end time.

Ratings.comment: Justin was a great TA. Very friendly, helpful, and cute!! He was always willing to do examples and answer everyone's questions. Also he looks great in glasses and purple.

Justin is a great teacher.  He likes to have fun in recitation and is always laughing and smiling which makes the environment a lot more interesting.  He is really good on explaining why things work and puts it in a perspective students can understand.  Class time management is his only flaw.  Always got out of class 3+ minutes after the bell.

He's a really nice guy. You can tell he's interested in the subject. He's pretty funny and likes to laugh, so recitation was pretty enjoyable. He's good at teaching strategies how to approach the topics. The only negative was that he wasn't very good at keeping track of time and letting us out of class promptly, so I was always late to my next one.

Awww justin is the nicest guy! yeah i think he is really really smart. you could just tell. and he was so into math but in a good way and he was funny.  he wasnt an easy grader but i think he was fair.  good TA!

He really knew what he was talking about.  Sometimes you could tell his mind was on a completely different level.  He was so smart that at times he couldn't articulate what he meant.  Overall good teacher.

Justin taught my 151 class, and was a TA for my 152 class.  I actually think he was better when he taught the entire class.  He teaches using the definitions and examples and seems to enjoy teaching.  Best Math teacher I've ever had.

summary_comment: Professor Frentz is highly regarded for his dedication and availability, often praised for his patience and commitment to helping students understand complex material. However, his teaching style can be disorganized and unclear, leading to mixed feedback on his effectiveness as a lecturer. Despite these challenges, many students appreciate his willingness to assist and his genuine care for their learning.
summary_comment_short: Professor Frentz is highly regarded for his dedication and willingness to help students, often staying available for extra support. However, his teaching style can be inconsistent; while some find his humor and storytelling engaging, others find his lectures and pacing confusing and unengaging.

Ratings.comment: I have never been good at math, but Prof Frentz is amazing. He is really understanding, and he reminds students time and time again that he is available for help.  Although he jumps around, making himself unclear, he is by far the best math Prof I have had. It's a lot of homework, but it's well worth it. I actually understand the work now!

Very considerate and respectful professor that worked hard to be prepared and cover everything on syllabi. (Not easy!)He went above and beyond to remind students that help is always available and make himself available.This prof isn't only about his retirement- he still cares about his students.

Subtly amusing, very helpful, patient and positive, remarkably dedicated to his job. I have never had a teacher (especially a math teacher) so committed to helping his students understand the subject material.

Pretty boring as a lecturer. Tries to make jokes, but they're not very funny and only he laughs at them. Missed a couple classes, but may have been a personal issue. Was very easy on grading homework. Not very organized and doesn't cover as much as he's supposed to. But, he does mean well and is very understanding (almost a pushover).

This is a weird guy, he tells stories and reviews for the first 20 minutes of class. I learned more from my TA than him, he is unclear, and made some mistakes from time to time, however, the test were fair most of the time. He should almost be an English teacher with the amount of stories he told. Also they were very bad stories that went NO WHERE

Frentz was a good man. Not the greatest teacher, sure, but his humor was corny yet funny and he always told pretty interesting stories. If you needed help you had to ask but overall he was a good person and fair enough teacher.

The class really wasn't that bad, if you've had algebra 2 in high school its pretty much like a review. If you have a question, make sure he knows. It seemed like the class moved quickly, but thats not his fault, its the cirriculums. If you visit him during his office hours he's very helpful
this guy was the most boring teacher i have ever had or heard of, this guy would stutter and make me fall asleep, he was not a bad person but he was boring

He doesn't explain himself very well, and if u dont already undersand the concepts then you probably dont want him as a teacher... If you cant switch classes, make sure u raise ur hand if u have questions
He's got a great heart...and his class isn't that hard.  But he gives WAY TOO Much Homework and doesn't teach very well...But he's a good guy...and tries very hard too..

summary_comment: Professor Gulen is known for his comprehensive lecture notes that cover the textbook extensively, making his classes somewhat redundant if students do not purchase the book. He excels as a one-on-one tutor but struggles with explaining concepts and answering questions in class, often relying heavily on the textbook content. While some students find him helpful during office hours, others describe his teaching as poor and inconsistent, citing issues with attendance, punctuality, and occasional communication errors.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gulen is known for his thorough coverage of course material directly from the textbook, making his classes redundant for those who can study independently. While students find him helpful in office hours for solving techniques, they also note issues with his ability to answer conceptual questions and his punctuality, including arriving late to tests and being absent from office hours.

Ratings.comment: Really liked to spread his notes down the entire chalkboard.  Sometimes he talked to the chalkboard too, almost like he was forgetting who he was teaching.  Gave exact examples from the book, and sometimes had trouble answering concept questions in class.  One on one, a really good teacher though.

Either buy a book, and dont go to class, or go to class and dont bother buying a book.  His lectures are straight from the book, example for example.  Homeworks are handouts, and quizzes are pretty simple.

Comes to class prepared for his presentation of the material, but he often can't answer questions or explain the purpose or application of the math. He is very helpful with solving techniques especially in office hours.
great teacher
horrible

Not only did he take phone calls during he class he did not give us an inclass review session and instead scheduled one outside of class before we were supposed to take the exam.I had another final during the same time so I had to reschedule and he told me I could take it the next day, but he made me take it right there with no review.
often not at his office hours. would come in to class late even on test days!!! he was very willing to answer questions

He communicates the subject matter decently though he sometimes makes minor English errors.  However, you must watch him closely since he tends to make mathematical mistakes.  Not to much homework, no quizzes, and two midterms.
sucked at english but was for the most part clear on getting the main point across
He does not speak good English, often has errors while doing practice problems, is very unclear, and leaves most of the class wondering what the hell he is doing.

summary_comment: Professor McIntyre's teaching methods are divisive; while some appreciate his clear and helpful lectures, others find his classes challenging due to difficult tests and homework. Students note that his exams can be particularly harsh, with low average scores, though he is willing to provide additional support during office hours. Overall, his approach emphasizes deep understanding over rote learning, making his classes both rewarding and demanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor McIntyre's teaching methods are often criticized for being unclear, leading to difficult classes and low test scores. While some students appreciate his clear lectures and willingness to help during office hours, many find his exams exceptionally challenging, with low averages and significant grading curves.

Ratings.comment: He wasn't too clear, which made the class extremely difficult.  The tests were ridiculous, and everyone was always upset with their test scores.  A nice guy, but with poor teaching methods.

This class rocked, and Dr. MyIntrye is one of the best in the math department.  His lectures were clear and helpful.  Difficult homework assignments, but he was more than willing to help at office hours.  Put in the work and get an A.
Exams were very hard. Try go get a different professor!

Wow were his tests different from each other.  I got an A on the first and third and I failed the second (the average was a 30/70).  I thought his final was death to me but somehow I ended up with a B in the class. curve?!?  Stay with the hw and c

Wow his exams are rough. The average score for the 2nd midterm was 30/70! Thats 42%. The kicker: a 10 point curve! So the average score was a 30/60 or 9 percentage points below failing. Thanks for nothing. He is a decent lecturer but his exams are death.
His homework took literally weeks to do. But his lectures were so good, I didn't want to miss any. I will use my notes from his topology class for a while.
No Comments

Dr. McIntyre's class is hard.  The material wasn't hard, but the tests were.  They encourage students to think for themselves rather than learn to pass a test.  If you really want to understand matieral rather than just pass a test, he's good.

summary_comment: Professor Guloglu is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and ability to make classes enjoyable through his humor. Students appreciate his willingness to help and his effectiveness in explaining complex concepts, making it easier to achieve high grades with effort. His approachable and kind demeanor contributes significantly to the positive learning environment.
summary_comment_short: Professor Guloglu is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and engaging classroom presence, making classes both enjoyable and informative. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his ability to explain complex concepts clearly, contributing to a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Turkish men are hot and hilarious
Cares about students and very willing to help. He is  also hillarious which makes the class better.
Best teacher I had first quarter.  He is a good teacher and makes class enjoyable as well.  Funny guy.
Extremely nice guy. He makes it very possible for you to earn an A in the class if you try your best.
I had him for reciation. He gave only one "bonus quiz" but answered all of our questions. He's very good at explaining math and will take the time to help you.
No Comments
He wears blue sandals, and make sure he doesn't lose his hat.

summary_comment: Professor Teh is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and effective teacher who explains concepts clearly and offers helpful office hours. However, his classes are fast-paced and challenging, with long lectures that can be difficult to follow without preparation. Students emphasize the importance of attending class and doing the homework thoroughly to succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Teh is a highly effective teacher who explains concepts clearly and provides valuable office hours. However, his classes are fast-paced and require consistent engagement; students must stay attentive and put in significant effort to succeed.

Ratings.comment: He is a great teacher. He's very fast-paced but provides his lecture notes on Carmen. Class is really long and it's really hard to pay attention sometimes. Beware because he WILL call on you if he thinks you're zoning out. Quizzes do a really good job of preparing you for the midterms. I got an A- without too much effort.

Very little textbook use, however in his lecture notes, he does some problems from the book and hw. I went to most of his office hours and found him very helpful.  I got an E in this class before and passed this class with an A with him.  Rework all lecture problems multiple times, do the hw, and go to class.  Study a lot for exams, they're tricky.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM! He is by far the WORST math teacher I've ever taken. He never uses the book. EVER. He says MML and the text book are worthless but shows examples in his lecture notes. Makes math errors in his work. Avoid this class. 132 is easy math integrals, but he makes it the worst class to take.
He is a very good teacher. Explains everything clearly. His office hours help out alot! I failed this class once and got a A- with him.
No Comments

Great Teacher. I am horrible at math, but he is really good at explaining things and makes sure the whole class understands before moving on.On avg 40% his students get A's as a final grade. Bad thing: he gets frustrated if you don't show up to class.

summary_comment: Professor Majumdar excels in facilitating student inquiry, effectively guiding discussions and providing clear answers that encourage deeper understanding. Students find his approach particularly beneficial when engaging with complex topics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Majumdar excels in fostering an interactive learning environment, effectively guiding students through discussions and ensuring that questions are thoroughly addressed. His ability to encourage thoughtful questioning significantly enhances understanding of complex topics.

Ratings.comment: He did great with questions.  I just had to ask the right ones!

summary_comment: Professor Jackson is highly regarded for his deep knowledge and challenging yet rewarding teaching style. Students find his lectures engaging despite the difficulty, and many credit his help during office hours and clear examples for their success. While some find him intimidating, the consensus is that he is an exceptionally effective and enjoyable professor, though the course material is demanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Jackson is an exceptionally knowledgeable and challenging instructor who demands significant effort and dedication, often resulting in high grades despite the difficulty. Students consistently praise his clarity in lectures and willingness to help, though they note that the class requires substantial time and effort to master.

Ratings.comment: He is pretty intimidating, but a good teacher in the end. Spend a lot of time on the homework and studying and you should be fine. I ended up with an A somehow, but this was definitely one of the hardest clases I've taken.
All I can say is you have to take a class with Craig Jackson to fully experience the glory.
Very, very smart guy. He made things very challenging, but in the end it was okay for me because I got an A- even though I felt lost a lot of the time.

He likes learning where things come from so spends a lot of time on proofs, and "fun" problems, and whatnot. Will help you in office hours but he doesn't really make anything crystal clear. Be prepared to struggle but also to learn.
HE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER ENCOUNTERED.
He is very clear at giving examples and has no problems answering questions in lecture. my only complaint is he didn't show up for his office hours each of the three times i went to them.

Reminds me of a survivalist woodsman who makes his own clothes. Once he starts teaching his voice is clear, he gives examples, and he will breakdance if he makes a mistake (if you ask him about it) does a good job for the poorly organized class. like others said, tests are hard but the curve helps. best 151 teacher I had (i took it twice)

I loved this guy. He's very laid back and scruffy. He's silly in his own little awkward ways and I dont think he really realizes it. He got information across clearly and efficiently without boring you and he made class fun by adding in some humor now and then. Great guy, and very helpful. The Curriculum of the class itself is quite horrible though

Scruffy and confused sometimes, but by the end of the quarter, a hilarious professor. If you went to him for help, he offered it generously, but never went out of his way to make things super clear. The tests were nearly impossible though-the curve allowed people to pass...
Great professor, explained things clearly in a very non=mathy way..  claims not to memorize formulas and didnt expect you too either.

good teacher, kind of strange  but he warms up and he's pretty funny and a little awkward,once in awhile he confuses his stuff, but he you know he knows it. tough class but he's easy to understand,decent curve helped my grade a lot. your t.a. matters cause mine said he hoped we all failed. if i would have had a better t.a. the class would be better

Great professor! By far the best Math professor I've ever had. He is really helpful, knows how to explain the material and shows genuine interest in helping his students learn. I learnt a great deal just by attending his lectures. I loved the jokes he would crack once in a while. I remember actually looking forward to attending  his lectures...

I think this guy is awesome. For 150 at least. He comes off at first like a grumpy professor but he warms up. He happens to be very funny and cracks jokes every once and a while which makes going to math lecture actually enjoyable. He tries to be as clear as he can be and really wants to help his students out. I recommend him!

He is an ok prof... his teaching is ok and somewhat clear with difficult material... the tests are basically impossible and there is almost no time to complete them... huge curve though allowed me to get the C... i would take him again though...
Great professor. Makes things as clear as possible. His reviews before the exams are exactly what is on the exams.  Study the review and it is easy to get an A.

well... he is an ok prof. he is funny. the exam wasnt too tough, you just have to come to his lecture before the exam. he will provides examples simillar to problems in the exam. And there is a decent curve in the class

summary_comment: Professor Kim is a knowledgeable and approachable teacher who excels at helping students understand complex mathematical concepts. However, his unique teaching style and emphasis on practical application can make the material challenging, particularly for those who prefer theoretical explanations. Additionally, his grading can be stringent, with significant weight given to the final exam and limited partial credit for multiple-choice questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kim is a knowledgeable and approachable teacher who excels in explaining complex mathematical concepts, though his teaching style can be challenging due to differences in terminology and approach compared to textbooks. His grading can be perceived as stringent, with significant weight given to the final exam, and he tends to give minimal partial credit, particularly in multiple-choice questions.

Ratings.comment: Had him at Case Western when he taught there during 09-10. He definitely knows what he's doing and is a good teacher, but complicates things by teaching the material differently than the book does, making homework a nightmare because of different terminology. Grading's a little unfair, with final being 3/7 of the grade. Good teacher overall though

Kim manages to take simple math concepts and complicate them. he's very good at math, speaks english clearly and writes neatly, but that doesnt make up for the fact that what he chooses to teach during class isnt that useful. grading was incredibly ticky-tacky, only 20% of class gets A, 20% gets B, which doesnt make a lot of sense.

His class is hard. Our first midterm and final were comparable to those of other 415 sections, but our second midterm average was in the 70s whereas others were in the 90s, and he didn't account for that. Also, if you are bad at multiple choice, take 415 with another professor. He gives no partial credit for multiple choice, which screwed me a lot.
He is nice and always willing to help.  Class in general is a challenge.  Make sure you understand concepts for midterms

I would agree with the Math 415 comments.  This man has a knack for teaching diff eqs and is very personable.  I gave him a hotness star because I think he is regal looking.  Like an emperor.  Not because I find him attractive.
"English not so good".  Lectures are almost strictly examples with little student interaction (really just a 48 minute monologue). Makes up for it some with willingness to help.

He is a great teacher, was always willing to go over any questions in class till the you understand it. Does not stress knowing the mathematical theory, as much as much as being able to physically apply what you are learning. I wish he taught my other Calculus classes.
Excellent; he is clear in teaching the material. The midterms are straight forward and not tricky--they're fine so long as you understand the material, which he does a great job in conveying.
Very good.  Doesn't emphasize theory too much, tells you how to find an answer rather than why an answer exists.

summary_comment: Professor Day is known for his effective teaching methods, particularly through repetition, which can make the class easier for students who engage consistently. However, his teaching style is polarizing; while some students find him engaging and helpful during office hours, others criticize his lack of example-giving and failure to cover all course material comprehensively. Overall, his approach is highly valued by those who put in the effort, though it is not universally appreciated.
summary_comment_short: Professor Day is perceived as a knowledgeable but inconsistent instructor, with some students finding him helpful and engaging, particularly during office hours, while others criticize his teaching methods as insufficient and confusing, leading to difficulties in learning the material. His approach varies widely; some appreciate his repetition and willingness to assist, while others find his lectures lacking in practical examples and comprehensive coverage of course content.

Ratings.comment: I loved this dude. If you keep doing the problems over and over again, the class is fairly easy. I got a D+ on the first exam. A B on the second exam, and an A on the final! It's pretty repetitive. I wish he was still teaching at OSU. He dropped the lowest midterm score, too.

Just a bad teacher. He gives no examples in class and expects us to know how to do various problems. The material isn't difficult, it's just not taught. After our 2nd midterm, he didn't post homework for 3 weeks, until 3 days before the final. In the 3 weeks of homework, about 2/3 I had no idea what to do, and I went to every lecture and recitation

Overall bad professor. He spends the majority of lecture discussing philosophy rather than math and ends up not teaching 1/3 of the section, then never picks it back up. Luckily, I had a good TA who spent all of a recitation where we're expected to finish groupworks explaining what we never covered. Wouldn't be so bad if he taught ALL the material.

I had him for the experimental 415, and he seemed like he enjoyed teaching the class even though he didn't do a good job of it. We would cover only 1 problem in an entire week of lecture, and then be expected to answer 3 on an exam. He could have gone about teaching this class much better than what he did.

I also had him for 162A.  My best advice would be to go to his office hours because you learn so much more from him there then you do in lecture.  Overall he's a pretty good guy and pretty fair.  You'll have to do a lot of work, but I guess it was worth it.  I can't stress enough to go to his office hours.  I also enjoyed his corny jokes.

Awesome professor, class is extremely difficult though.  As the other person said, he will spend a lot of time with you if you are willing to try. Probably one of the best math professors I've ever had, if not THE best.

You're lucky if you have him for the experimental 415 class (this will probably be an obsolete comment soon).  It's ridiculously hard but he really helps you learn it.  Go to office hours, he'll spend as long as you need trying to get you to learn a concept.
very easy to understand, notes follow the textbook, tests are difficult (but it's an accelerated math class....). Grades fairly.

I had Dr. Day for three quarters (161A, 162A, 263A). Very knowledgeable on the subject material in all three classes. Lectures can be boring (very theoretical for an applications class). Make sure you attend office hours, he is very helpful there. Exams range from very easy to extremely difficult. Do the suggested problems!
Amazing professor, had him for three quarters, more helpful and clear in his explanations than any other I've had.  Would recommend for any class (as long as you do all the practice problems).

No matter what grade you got in AP Calc in high school, you WILL have to study for this course. His lectures were pretty uninteresting, but it's math. Very unfair that he doesn't make the quizzes, because his exams are 100 times harder than them or the homework he assigns. STUDY A LOT!

he's a very funny lecturer but his exams were very challenging.. he presents the concepts very clearly but the exams are SO MUCH HARDER... STUDY... do the homework the night the concept was presented... EVEN IF YOU'VE TAKEN CALC BEFORE... this class can really kick you in the butt
Great lecturer, even better in office hours. He does a good job putting things into simpler terms. Overall a good teacher, even better if you put all of the effort in.

Day was a great prof--he made the concepts easy to understand, for the most part.  This class was mostly review for me, since I had taken Calc AB in high school, but I still felt like I learned something in the class.  He is fair but tough.  The midterms weren't too bad, but the final was fairly difficult.  Overall I would highly recommend him.
Awesome prof!!! he is a great teacher, but he makes you work hard.  Don't miss class.

LOVED him. a little goofy, yet hilarious. The amount of times he says fair enough is a little distracting..but funny. Always told you what to study or watch out for..never tried to trick you on tests and exams, which were not too bad.  Cares about your grade, nice guy overall.
He is very helpful and makes the class enjoyable.
Good guy.  Good teacher.  I would highly recommend Jerry Day to anyone.

smart guy, knows what he is talking about.  bad jokes but keeps your attention.  not a bad lecturer.  handwriting is kind of sloppy but you get used to it.  tests and quizzes are pretty similar to previous quarters.  i would recommend him to anyone, pretty good guy all around.  goofy beard though

He is an aged mathematics nerd, who cares about the students if you go to his office hours. He tells terrible jokes, that are somehow hilarious. Just an average lecturer. The tests and quizes are very similar to the past quarter midterms and the final is rather difficult. You should take a later class so that you can find out info from friends.
He was okay, but kind of lazy.  If you have a decent recitation leader you'll be okay.  I thought his jokes were pretty amusing.

I agree, he's kind of a goofy guy but I liked him.  Pretty laid back and his tests weren't too hard, basically the exact same stuff you did on the homework.  He wasn't one to throw crazy stuff at you on the exams.
His jokes are cheesy sometimes, but they keep the lecture a little more interesting. Very nice guy. Covers material in the book in his lectures. Test questions are similar to homework problems.

summary_comment: Professor Sivaraman, known as Vaidy, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality. Students praise his ability to explain complex concepts clearly and make learning enjoyable, often comparing him to one of the best teachers they have encountered. His humor and generosity in grading further enhance the positive learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sivaraman is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex topics easy to understand and delivering classes in an engaging and enjoyable manner. Students consistently praise his ability to explain concepts clearly, provide relevant examples, and offer generous feedback, making him one of the best teachers and TAs they have encountered.

Ratings.comment: Interesting guy, very helpful.

Seriously the best teacher i have ever had in college! He made things easy to understand and was very funny. Cannot give him enough credit for making this class enjoyable...i actually loved going to class...if you can take a class with him, take it no matter what time it is at
Vaidy is awesome for the following reasons: 1. He's good at explaning things. 2 He give examples that are very close to those in the test. 3 He give very generous points in quizes.
Vaidy is the best TA ever! He is hilarious. He's also really helpful and good at explaining concepts you don't understand.
Best TA I've ever had... period. Great teacher.
Vaidy is an awesome TA. Honestly, he makes things easier to understand than the Professor, so that makes him really awesome. Best. TA. Ever.

Vaidy makes learning fun!  No joke, he's funny and smart and incredibly helpful.  He always makes review sheets no other TA does with more information on them than you'd think possible.  Go to his office hours if you're not doing well, he WILL make you understand.
Vaidy Rocks!! He is awesome.... I hope I have him again next Q. Always...Always....go to his review sections!!! Thanks for everything Vaidy!
Vaidy is awesome, explained everything very well, uses great analogies, makes math fun. Very clear. By all means take if you can, it'll be the best thing you can do for your math education
Vaidy is the coolest TA ever.
Vaidy is great. Highly recommended.
Vaidy is the man!  Very funny guy who made sure everyone knew and understood what concept we were going over.

Great TA. One of the best I've had. Always prepared. Provided the class with detailed handouts for each topic. Made the class interesting, even if the topics were not. I would highly recommend taking him for Math 132.
Vaidy is a great TA.  He always makes time to meet with you to go over material.  Also reviews what exactly will be on quizzes and tests just before hand.
Vaidy is awesome...smart guy, very personable, and hilarious. despite being foreign, which is generally a problem for TAs, he's clear and very helpful. highly reccommended
He is very helpful in trying to make u understand. His quizes are pretty easy and he is very flexible in alot of things. I reccomend him as a TA

Vaidy absolutely was the best TA I ever had! I don't have much interest in Math and have never been particularly good at it, but he made Recitations fun and interesting. I learned so much during this course and he made the class very comprehensible!!! Take Vaidy's Recitation for math- He's GREAT!!!
Vaidy is the best!  He saved me from awful Gloria Woods.  He really goes out of his way to help you.  Awesome TA, definitely take his class.

summary_comment: Professor Peng struggles significantly with English, making it difficult for students to understand her explanations. Despite being described as nice and willing to help, her communication issues severely impact her teaching effectiveness. Students generally praise TAs like Na for their clear explanations and helpfulness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Peng has a significant communication barrier due to her poor English proficiency, making it difficult for students to understand her lectures. Despite her willingness to help, her teaching quality is severely impacted by this issue.

Ratings.comment: Her English is terrible. You can understand about every 10th word of what she says. She's very nice and willing to help you out, but it's impossible to understand her when she's trying to explain a concept to you. Also, the math department is full of elitist jerks whose only interest is seeing how many people they can fail this quarter.
I loved Na. She was a fantastic TA. She knows how to explain math concepts in a way that makes sense. She thinks about what will be on quizzes and tests and tells you what to expect.
I loved Na. She was was of the best TA I have ever had. If you go to her office hours she gives you a lot of help and attention. I wish she was my TA all the time

Another charter member of the "Ohio State Instructors who can't speak English" club.  I don't know if she's a good teacher or not, I can't understand a word that comes out of her mouth.  She seems nice enough, but unless you speak Mandarin or Korean or whatever, you're in trouble.  My class was 50% asian.  Apparently word got out...
Very helpful. she did the homework problems on the board before you turned them in. Great TA.
Every time I was confused about something, she was able to see why I was confused and explain it to me in a way I understood.

summary_comment: Professor Kilanowski effectively delivers the necessary mathematical content for tests and quizzes, though his approach is more focused on academics than social interaction. Despite his reserved nature, he is supportive and understanding on a personal level. His teaching helped prevent the student from developing their usual aversion to math.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kilanowski effectively delivers the necessary mathematical content for tests and quizzes, though his approach is more focused on academic instruction than social interaction. Despite his reserved nature, students appreciate his supportiveness on a personal level and credit him with maintaining their interest in mathematics.

Ratings.comment: He was my lecturer for this class and he did a good job. He is obviously a math nerd so he is not the most sociable guy, but he teaches you what you need to know for the tests and quizzes. If you need anything on a personal level, he is very helpful and understanding. He didn't make me hate math, which I normally do so that says something.

summary_comment: Professor Ali is highly regarded for his engaging and personable teaching style, which enhances understanding and retention of complex material. While his quizzes can be challenging, students appreciate his dedication to ensuring thorough comprehension before moving on.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ali is highly regarded for his personable teaching style and commitment to ensuring students understand the material, often going above and beyond to help with individual questions. However, his quizzes are perceived as challenging, sometimes testing concepts that go beyond the reviewed material.

Ratings.comment: Really cool, personable TA who is helpful when going over the material. It is sometimes hard to pay attention, but I blame math, not him. If you have any individual questions, he will not stop until you understand it which is great. His quizzes are a little unreasonable I think though. He typically asks questions that are harder than what we review

summary_comment: Professor Swartz is a clear and understandable lecturer who explains concepts well and is generally approachable and helpful. While his lectures can be fast-paced and redundant for those already familiar with the material, he makes an effort to prepare students for exams and has a good track record of helping them perform well, thanks to his thorough coverage of material and fair grading curves. However, some students find his teaching style monotonous and difficult to stay engaged with.
summary_comment_short: Professor Swartz is a clear and effective lecturer who explains concepts in an understandable manner and is willing to help students. However, his lectures can be fast-paced and repetitive, reading directly from the book, which may make them less engaging for those already familiar with the material. Despite this, he is generally well-regarded for his approachable demeanor and efforts to prepare students for exams.

Ratings.comment: Your typical math lecture: straight out of the book. No need to go to lecture if you can teach yourself. Exams are hard, but Swartz did a decent job trying to keep us up to par with them. Oh, and he speaks English. Probably one of the few Math professors that do. Take him if you can. Good professor.
Goes pretty fast, so be prepared to take notes quickly in lecture. No real complaints. Nice guy, good prof.
A pretty good lecturer.  He explained concepts in a easy to understand manner and helped if you asked.  Nice person in general and tried to make lecture interesting.
It is extremely hard to stay awake during his lexture. All he does is read out of the book so lecture is kinda pointless especially if you have taken calc before. Only good part..he speaks english

Real laid back and nice guy. Really understanding and willing to help. Does a good job covering material and always reviews before an exam. Does not write the tough exams but tries very hard to prepare us for them. Good curve. I would recommend him.
he was horrible and made me fall asleep every time
Great lecturer. Explained everything in a very easy way to  understand. Don't bother buying the book, there is no bookwork for this class.
Good lecturer, I would recommend attending his lectures he does a good job of explaining things and is really clear. He's pretty laid back.
No Comments

Swartz was my lecturer for math 151.  He's good at his job but I feel as though none of the professors in the math department have enough time to go over the required material.  He teaches well for the time allotted, but there isn't much time to ask questions (esp. if you have a class right afterwards). You could always go to office hours I guess!

Eric was my TA for Math 151. He gave great examples for the notes and was very helpful in answering questions. He was very easy to understand and laid-back. He is an excellent teacher. I learned more from him than I did from my lecturer. Go to his class--it really helps!

summary_comment: Professor Volpenhein's teaching is generally highly regarded, with TAs like Matt being particularly praised for their ability to clarify complex concepts and ensure student understanding. While some students found his class structure less than ideal, most commend his straightforward presentation style and his willingness to address questions thoroughly.
summary_comment_short: Professor Volpenhein's TA, Matt, is highly regarded for his ability to clarify complex concepts and ensure students understand the material, often going above and beyond to reinforce key points. Despite some criticisms regarding the lecture flow, Matt is praised for his patience, straightforward teaching style, and commitment to helping students grasp the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: Very helpful TA. Was able to clear up what you didn't understand from lecture.

The book for the class was horrible but Matt did a great job on explaining everything.  He went out of his way to make sure people understand what was going on as a whole even if he had to back track a little bit just to make sure everyone understood.  I recommend having Matt as your TA even if the Lecure really sucks.
really good TA, explained things so that everyone understood, always helped when asked, fair grader

matt way of organizing the class isn't very fluid. i just couldn't follow him. His class has a weird flow, he does answer questions but then he'll be like..Oh wait! back up a few steps and learn this new step i forgot to teach. Im not bustin balls but i think he may be new at it and just dosen't have it down pat.
Matt is a very good teacher who presents material in a straightforward manner. Goes out of his way during class to answer any and all questions and doesn't belittle students. Highly reccommend.

summary_comment: Professor Moore is highly regarded as a legend among students, known for his depth of knowledge and ability to challenge students with rigorous quizzes that ensure thorough understanding of the material. He is praised for his helpfulness, quick responses to emails, and commitment to fighting for student interests on grading, though some find his explanations challenging. Overall, he is seen as a great professor and TA.
summary_comment_short: Professor Moore is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and effective instructor, often described as a legend within the department. Students appreciate his challenging quizzes and his efforts to ensure understanding, though some find his explanations can be difficult to follow at times.

Ratings.comment: This man is a legend. Without him, 1161 may have been a wreck. His quizzes are often fairly difficult, which really forces you to keep up and understand the material. He's also probably a mathematical genius.  Couldn't ask for a better TA.
LOVE DAN SO MUCH HE IS SO AWESOME I CANT BELIEVE HES LEAVING IM SO SAD IM CRYING
This man is a legend.

Great TA. Speaks fluent English, a rarity in the OSU Math Dept. Gives good examples to help explain things and fights for the students on grading.  Other than that nothing in this class is under his control.
Helpful TA.

He is one of those profs who are really smart/good at what they do, but have a little hard time explaining everything. He is very helpful and easy grader. He  is actually funny too! replies to emails very fast, provides a lot of help. overall, great prof/TA. Just attend lectures and take notes!

summary_comment: Professor Waters is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, which include clear and comprehensive examples for all course topics. She balances lectures with interactive participation, creating an engaging learning environment. Her assessments are consistently fair, with well-structured quizzes that are both challenging and representative of the material covered.
summary_comment_short: Professor Waters is highly regarded for their excellent teaching quality, with students praising their comprehensive coverage of topics, fair assessment methods, and engaging teaching style that balances lectures with interactive participation. The overall feedback indicates a strong commitment to student learning and satisfaction.

Ratings.comment: Meryem was a super good TA, she had very good examples for all of the topics covered in class, and had a good mixture of lecture and participation. All of the quizzes she gave had fair questions and were graded fairly. Overall, I would choose to have her as a TA again if I ever had the option.

summary_comment: Professor Samara is highly regarded for his dedication to student understanding and his willingness to help, often through detailed explanations and office hours. However, his teaching style can be quite slow and monotonous, potentially putting students to sleep, and his exams closely follow practice materials. Overall, while his approach can be effective for those who engage actively, it may not suit all learning styles.
summary_comment_short: Professor Samara is highly regarded for his dedication to student understanding and his effective exam reviews, which significantly boost test scores. However, his teaching style can be slow and monotonous, potentially putting students to sleep, and some find his lectures less engaging without much interaction or use of supplementary materials.

Ratings.comment: Best math teacher you can have. Wonderful exam reviews if you can do and understand them you will get 100% on the tests. He lightens class with his fun sense of humor. Is wonderful in office hours and truly cares about his class and helping the students learn the material.

At first I struggled getting about average on the first midterm. He sent a mass email requesting many to drop because they didn't have the preq knowledge. Last 2 midterms had > 90 avg's, I got a 97 and 100 on them. They were almost exactly the practice test. Did take an interest in students, strongly recommend him.
