Basically he spent the entire semester putting the online textbook on the board and reading it to us. Nice guy, but lectures go so slowly and put you to sleep early in the morning. Would have done better to just skip class and read the textbook.

Overall I would say he is an average professor who is very dedicated to making a student understand. I had an 8am lecture so I did more sleeping than anything, but I did go to office hours and he was an extremely nice guy who MADE SURE you understood each problem. The exam concepts were relatively easy, but the grading can definitely be harsh.

He is a good teacher. He tries his hardest to teach the materiel so everyone understands things. If you practice his exam reviews you will get a B- or higher every time. He tries to add humor to the class and I must say it lightens up the mood.

Samara is really helpful and is willing to help you out as best as he can, but I absolutely hated his class. Never went to lecture, but managed to still get a B, therefore, his exams aren't too horrible. His lectures will put you to sleep faster than NyQuil and you never use the textbook, just the online MathLab link. You'll be fine!

Russian like accent, sometimes hard to understand. Spends a long time explaining topics and doing problems in lecture which can be very boring. However, he explains things pretty well and makes sure students understand everything. Most midterms come directly from the study guide or problems from lecture. Nice guy, not intimidating at all.
Marko sometimes will take a long time to explain concepts, but will also take the time to ensure that you understand the topic and/or how the correct answer is achieved.
Makes some dorky jokes that keep the class bearable however the exams are much harder than you will first expect. Quizzes and Homework are generally easy. Good prof overall.
What he said on class is not very difficult, also the quizes. But the exam is extremely hard! It's unfair. In the class after that exam, there was only 60% students left.

Very patient person. Go to office hours. I told him "I am lost with the entire Chapter 10 of Diff. Eqns. No idea what Fourier series is about." and what he did was spent 2 hours of his time re-explaining it to the point it all made sense to me. He'll do his best to answer you. Very understanding prof. Will teach as long as you're willing to learn.
He is nice, funny, and helpful
I had him as professor, the class is slightly slow but he s super nice. He explains everything in great detail and makes small jokes once in a while, keeping the class tolerable.
Good teacher who is always willing to help.  He provides shortcuts and perspectives on math problems the book does not convey.
very nice, but useless. goes over the really simple things, despite what you ask him and what you are learning in class, and tends to spend a very long time going over it.
had him for 415 and didnt like him at all. wasted too much time teaching useless stuff and was an ass about grading if you didnt do the problem his way

Well ok he may not have the best English but come on its a Math class. He is a little slow but is super helpful. ANd he has an awesome temprament and is a pleasant personality. He is much better than the lecturer I have....all that I understand in class is because of the TA and not the lecturer...no complains...

His English is fairly good, but he was not helpful.  He spent every class going over examples that didn't help you understand what we were doing.  If you asked a question, he expected you to already know the answer.
could not understand a word that was coming out of this man's mouth.

He is an ok TA.  He seems to grade slightly easier than the other TAs I've had.  His English is better than my previous TA's English.  He tries to be friendly and personable which helps and has a sense of humor.  The sample problems he does are similar to homework problems.

marko moved from serbia 6 months ago. he refuses to answer questions and on the off chance you do get him to answer a useful question, you will regret it because it will take him 20 minutes to explain simple problems.  he wastes time explaining things you should already know. his english is horrible

summary_comment: Professor Divis is an effective and caring instructor who makes her class accessible while challenging students to excel. She is highly regarded for her dedication and the substantial learning outcomes she achieves, though her class can be demanding and requires significant effort. Students appreciate her support during office hours and her genuine interest in their success.
summary_comment_short: Professor Divis is an effective and caring instructor who makes her classes accessible while maintaining high standards, though her courses can be challenging. Students appreciate her dedication to their success and find her knowledgeable and inspirational, despite some finding the material and teaching style demanding.

Ratings.comment: Professor Divis not only tries to take care of everyone's need based on his/her knowledge, but also makes her class understandable for us. Her class is moderately hard so it won't be a disaster for first-year students. She is caring and inspirational, and I wish to have her class next semester.
I'm literally on the verge of dropping an album called 'Hot Zita' just because of how this Ukrainian god has inspired me.
You''ll hate her or love her. She''s a tough grader though.
Excellent instructor. Highly recommend.

Honors calculus was extremely difficult with her and finding help for this class was near impossible. Her class was not at all enjoyable. Switch out unless you love doing calc problems for hours on end.
She is very hard to understand. Just reads the text and doesn't really teach. And lectured me once on how smoking is bad, I'm an adult I can if I want to

Although her class can be difficult at times, and she expects a lot of her students, I really learned a lot from her class. She is a great person and genuinely cares about all of her students and wants them to succeed, and she is very helpful at office hours. Although I had already taken calculus in high school, I still learned a lot in her class.

Wonderful teacher.  Those claiming she is rude/condescending are completely wrong.  Explains concepts very well.  She does expect you to already have experience with calculus, but you have to have taken the AP Calculus test to even take this class, so it should not be a problem.  Expect a challenge, but also expect to learn.

You can tell professor Divis is an experienced teacher. She has a good combination of proofs/theory and practical "how to" calculus. Only annoying aspect is that she pronounces student names as they would be in their original language (German, Polish, etc).
Bail, Bail, Bail!!!! if you get this teacher switch immeadatley.  You cant understand her and she moves way to fast.  Warning this class will kill you GPA

This teacher can be hard to understand, but overall she's just teaching as fast as the program goes. If you dont want a challenge dont take this class. Can learn most things out of the book, but she will answer questions in class. Pretty boring, and shes not american (harder to understand) but she at least knows calculus..

Very difficult class. She seems to move at such a rapid pace that most people can't keep up. Also, she seems to assume people know the material already, and doesn't really explain things all that well. If you haven't covered the material in high school, then she just kind of moves on and doesn't really help out...
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRGGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHHH i cant understand the freakin lady.  thank god its a lecture and attendance isn't required.  Take my advice self study is much more effective.

I believe she has to teach grad students not undergrads. I hardly understand her. She was helpless even most of the students didn't attend her class,we mostly depended on our TA who was really good. My advise is not taking her class.

Dr. Divis = real teacher.  We directly engaged material in her class.  What was unique about her teaching also: she conferenced with students one-on-one, approachable, willing to help, and (unlike the dept advisors and most math faculty) actually gave a sh#t about what we hoped to do after grad, even though we weren't honors students.
Tough but fair class.  She was a very good teacher, but the material was difficult for me and there was no curve.
It's a hard class, but she is a nice lady.
tough but fair

She can be intimidating, because she is so much smarter than the students she is teaching. Her accent at times makes it difficult to understand what she is saying. She is very helpfull and interested in students doing well. Offers outside of class review sessions, and proctors small study groups
Did not explain anything, was condescending and rude.  Did not TEACH at all, just repeated theorems from the book and made us feel stupid.
hard grader, expects you to know everything
No Comments
Expects that you know everything, failed half the class, not helpful at all.

summary_comment: Professor Kaplin is widely regarded as the best teacher among his peers, consistently delivering high-quality instruction that engages students effectively and enhances their understanding of the subject matter.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kaplin is widely regarded as the best teacher ever according to students, known for delivering exceptional lectures and providing invaluable insights. His teaching quality is consistently praised for its depth and effectiveness.

Ratings.comment: Best ever

summary_comment: Professor Thamrongthanyalak is perceived as having clear lectures and being approachable, though his teaching style is seen as lecture-heavy and reliant on the textbook. Students appreciate his helpfulness and reasonable exams but criticize his unclear grading criteria and lack of feedback, which contribute to significant stress throughout the semester. Overall, opinions vary widely, with some finding the class manageable and others strongly recommending avoidance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thamrongthanyalak is generally perceived as clear in his lectures and helpful when approached with questions, making the material accessible for those who study diligently. However, several students strongly advise against taking his class, citing poor grading practices, lack of feedback, and excessively low exam averages, which make the class highly stressful and not worth the effort.

Ratings.comment: Did a good job of going over the material in class and was helpful if approached with questions. As long as you study all of the theorems, definitions, etc. everything should come fairly easily. None of the exams were unreasonable. Makes it so you're basically guaranteed a C (50%) and will take final exam score if overall grade is lower than it.
Any introduction to discrete math is going to be a hard class.  However, I found that Athipat's lectures were clear and he answered questions patiently both in and outside of class.

I thought Athipat was a pretty good professor. His lectures were interesting and enjoyable, and he gave plenty of hints about what would be on the final. It's not his fault that an introductory proofs-based course can be hard for students.
Don't even bother. Drop now while you can. Get a different prof by any means necessary,

Horrible professor, debatably worse professor ever. If you have this professor for MATH 3345, I strongly recommend that you switch professors immediately. If you cannot switch professors, drop the class, it is not worth it.

Avoid. He reads directly from the book. He doesn't post grades. He varies on how he grades. His exam averages are sub 50. You don't get feedback on homework, and you can't find the solutions anywhere because they are all proofs.

Lecture is straight from the textbook. Grading scale is never explained and there is no way to tell how well you are doing in the class. No feedback is given on exams, and very little partial credit is granted. Avoid this professor. Even if you end up with a good grade, it's not worth the stress of wondering for the entire semester.
Just take my word and avoid him.  He shouldn't even be a professor.

He is absolutely terrible.  This guy has no clue what he is doing and can't even explain to you what you did wrong.  If you make a mistake in a proof, the whole rest of the proof is incorrect.  So if you make a small mistake in the first line, you get a 0 for the problem  even if the rest of the proof is correct.  AVOID ATHIPAT!!!

Completely unclear grading scheme, and no grades recorded on Carmen. Literally laughs at sub 50 averages on midterms, and gives us no indication of how well we're going to do in the class. You may get an A, you may get an E ... only Athipat knows!

He lectures straight out of the book (shared for all 3345) and doesn't give much context for anything. Assignments come without much warning but average a homework or two a week. The final is basically everything and his tests are basically made up of proofs that are easy to lose points on. If you test well, you might be okay.

His lectures are extremely boring and he has no passion for what he is doing.  He also grades ridiculously hard and refuses to negotiate points under any circumstances.  Athipat also does not always write scores on assignments, so it's impossible to track your grade since he doesn't use Carmen.  Avoid.

He lectures straight out of the book. Grading is up to his discretion. Homework is lightly graded, while exams and quizzes are taken point for point. The average for midterm 1 was a 60, which I quote, "That's a pretty good average" by him. Average for midterm 2 was so bad he just said "It's below a 50," and proceeded to lecture. Avoid.

summary_comment: Professor Brady is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, characterized by her warmth and approachability. Students appreciate the ease of her homework assignments and the straightforward nature of her quizzes and tests. Additionally, she is praised for her exceptional TA, who is extremely helpful and dedicated to assisting students in achieving their best possible grades.
summary_comment_short: Professor Brady is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, being both approachable and supportive. Her assignments are described as manageable, with particularly effective TAs who assist students in achieving their best grades.

Ratings.comment: Lisa Brady is awesome. Super nice and really sweet. If you can take her, do it! The homework is super easy and the quizzes/tests are too.
Best TA ever! super helpful and always interested in helping her students get the best grades they can.

summary_comment: Professor Khare is a knowledgeable but challenging instructor whose lectures can be difficult to follow at times, often making class material seem overwhelming initially. However, he is very supportive and willing to help, and many students found his guidance crucial for success, particularly noting that outside resources like TAs and study groups were essential. Despite occasional confusion, his clear sense of humor and dedication to student success make him an effective teacher.
summary_comment_short: Professor Khare is a dedicated but challenging instructor whose lectures can be difficult to follow at times, often leaving students feeling overwhelmed until they grasp the structure of the course. Despite this, he is highly supportive and willing to help, and many students credit his section with better performance compared to others.

Ratings.comment: Hard to understand at times. The problems in class are way easier than the stuff thrown at you on quizzes and midterms. Would not have passed without TA and tutor lab.

Class seems overwhelming at first. Once you understand how it's structured it's fine. Know that webwork and paper homework are optional. Webwork is way harder than quiz or exam problems. Paper homework is good practice. Go to the math website, and add ~McGinnis to the web address to find old midterms and quizzes for practice.

Niraj was sometimes hard to understand, but rarely. He understands that not every student was destined to be good at math so he's quite helpful when you need it. I learned a lot from him. Just pay attention or you'll miss a lot.

Dr. Khare can be difficult to understand and at times you'll think lectures seem pointless. He has a great sense of humor and he is extremely nice and willing to help at any time. He turned out to be a great professor and I feel as if his students succeeded more in the course than students in other sections did. He is overall a good professor.

summary_comment: Professor Kenney is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex mathematical concepts accessible and easy to understand. Despite students entering the course with significant gaps in their mathematical knowledge, they found his instructional methods effective and engaging, ultimately transforming their learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kenney is an exceptionally effective teacher, known for his clear and accessible teaching style that helps students understand complex mathematical concepts easily. Students consistently praise his ability to make even those who feel rusty or out of practice with math feel confident and well-supported in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher!

After being out of the math world since 11th grade (03-04) I was pretty worried that I mind dumped everything I knew, so I was not looking forward to this class. However I cam to find out that Jim is by far the best math teacher I have ever had. His teaching style is easy to follow and he makes sure you are able to understand how everything works

summary_comment: Professor Gutierrez is an outstanding math instructor known for his exceptional teaching skills and willingness to assist students. He simplifies complex concepts into their最基本的形式，使学生易于理解。虽然他不严格遵守作业截止日期，但他期望学生能够自律，充分利用他的帮助。
summary_comment_short: Professor Gutierrez is an exceptional math instructor known for his clear explanations and willingness to assist students. He simplifies complex concepts effectively and, while flexible with deadlines, emphasizes the importance of timely engagement with course material.

Ratings.comment: Fantastic professor.  He's a good teacher, willing to help, and boils everything down to its most basic of terms.  Definitely the best math professor I've had.  He also doesn't enforce due dates, BUT don't take advantage of that, as he will get on you for it.

summary_comment: Professor JI is known for her rapid speech and heavy accent, which can make her lectures challenging to follow. Her lectures are often delivered in a manner that feels disjointed and can come across as rushed, sometimes cutting students off mid-question. Students generally find her classes difficult and have reported low comprehension and poor performance as a result.
summary_comment_short: Professor JI is known for her fast-paced lectures and heavy accent, which make it challenging for students to follow her teachings. Her lectures often feel disjointed and lack clarity, with some students reporting that they are barely understandable and tend to cut students off mid-question.

Ratings.comment: She has an accent and talks super fast. She has good intentions and wants to teach you but its really hard to understand her and she tends to cut you off with your questions. I got my first C in her class an am not happy about it. Try to avoid her class.
lectures are literally mumbled out of the textbook.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Wang is highly knowledgeable and excels at explaining complex concepts clearly, though he sometimes rushes through material, leaving some students struggling with basics. His teaching is effective for those who can keep up, and he provides useful resources like detailed overheads. However, his fast pace and occasional difficulty in understanding can make following his lectures challenging for some students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wang is highly knowledgeable and effective in explaining complex concepts, though he sometimes rushes through material, leaving some students struggling with basics. Despite this, many students find his lectures clear and comprehensive, particularly when combined with the provided overheads and practice problems.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher.  You can tell that he is very knowledgable on the subject and projects it very well.  It is a loss that he is no longer at OSU but I am glad I learned linear algebra from him as I have a better foundation than most.
One of the best TAs in math I have had so far. Has an accent but is a good explainer.

He knows the material extremely well but sometimes rushes through explaining rather complicated concepts. He is good at answering questions but he glosses over the basics and will leave some students scratching their heads. He periodically leaves out information that you need to solve a problem until someone points out that he forgot it.

Explains material extremely well. A little hard to understand at first, but you get used to it.  Gives a very reasonable amount of homework, and doesn't assign anything that wasn't covered in class. Exams are like homework: pretty straightforward if you do the work
I'm just glad this class is over.  He's very difficult to follow and pay attention to.  He goes really fast.  The review sheets and midterms didn't always go together well.
He's an ok teacher.  For me, it was really hard to pay attention, but then it is math.

This guy is awesome! Compared to other math teachers he is very good at just showing you the basics and tells you what you need to know...the bare-minimum kind of professor...he's very nice and helps out during office hours too...get him if you're looking to get an A in calculus!

Makes all the concepts very clear - I rarely had to go to recitation because the overheads he used in class explained the material so well. He can be hard to understand, but as long as you do the problems on the overhead that should really be all you need. Get this guy if you can.
A GREAT PROFESSOR. JUST GO TO CLASS AND GET HELP WHENEVER YOU NEED IT. HE WILL EXPLAIN THINGS THOROUGHLY FOR ANYONE WHO IS HAVING TROUBLE UNDERSTANDING THE MATERIAL.
Easiest math 415 teacher.  A little hard to understand, but you get used to him.  Midterm and Final were very simple.

summary_comment: Professor Geline is known for his energetic and sometimes awkward teaching style, with students noting his animated movements and humorous gestures. While some find his classes engaging and memorable, others describe him as a challenging and unhelpful instructor who focuses heavily on proofs and struggles to explain concepts clearly or provide practical examples, leading to difficulties in test preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Geline is known for his energetic and sometimes humorous teaching style, but his lectures are often criticized for being difficult to follow, with an overemphasis on proofs and derivations rather than practical applications. Students find his teaching style challenging and unhelpful for exam preparation, and many advise avoiding him due to his condescending attitude and lack of willingness to provide additional support.

Ratings.comment: walks like a raptor.  Points to board and jumps around all the time.  Funny hand motions.  Average math class at OSU.
Was not useful and everytime i asked him for help he treated me like i didnt belong in his "intelligent" presence. must avoid
Funny & Energetic. A COLLEGE MATH PROF is not there to baby you. [Yes, you'll have to read & research math on your own!] If you have a genuine interest in math, you'll love him-

Smart guy, GENIUS, just a really bad teacher. He's way ahead of everyone else, and can't seem to slow down to "our level". HARD class. Gets easier towards the end though. Good luck. You'll really need it.

Poor lecturer; other comments are mostly correct (does mostly proofs, doesn't prepare you for tests). Furthermore, he talks down to students to the point that it's awkward when people ask questions. Not willing to help; doesn't think it's worth his time. He feels the need to demonstrate his superior intelligence, but just ends up being unclear.
good guy and very funny. one of my most memorable math classes

AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE! He akwardly explains concepts, focusing almost solely on the derivation (proofs) of the formulas/methods used w/little to no emphasis on usage&examples- which is what you need to know for the quizzes/exams. He often runs out of time and will suggest reading the book- which, indeed, I find much more helpful than his lectures.
Everyone calls him captain mike, hes hilarious to watch cause hes so awkward and goofy. Somewhat good teacher but gets frustrated easily when his problems don't work out well on the board.

Very very funny, even if you're not taking math you could probably sit in and be amused.  Some days are better than others but always entertaining.  Definitely unusual sense of humor, may go over the tops of some heads.
He is hilarious. Explains topics fairly well, but does tend to strain off of the topic every once in a while. He is a good professor though, dont hesitate to take his class.

summary_comment: Professor Chien is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, effectively explaining concepts in a manner that ensures all students understand, regardless of their background. His teaching pace is well-matched to accommodate a wide range of learners, making complex topics accessible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chien is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, effectively explaining concepts in a manner that ensures all students understand, regardless of their background. His ability to maintain an accessible pace makes complex topics more approachable.

Ratings.comment: Yu-Yen was able to explain things very well for my Math 151 class. He went at a pace so everyone would understand. I wish I had him every quarter.

summary_comment: Professor Baishankski was highly knowledgeable and dedicated, known for his patience and generosity with students' time. While his courses were demanding, he was also very supportive and made efforts to help students succeed.
summary_comment_short: Professor Baishankski was highly knowledgeable and dedicated, known for his patience and generosity with students' time, making him a respected and beloved figure among those who studied under him. However, his courses were noted to be demanding, and some students found them challenging.

Ratings.comment: Had him for a qualifying exam prep course over the summer. He was knowledgable, kind, and generous with his time and patience; a true professor. He will be miseed.
Dr. Baishanski retired a few years ago, and died in 2010. His courses were very demanding, but he was a very nice man who always made an effort to help students.

Linear Algebra is different than the math you took before. Some people get it some don't. He is very clear on what you have to know and what will be on the mid-terms and finals. If you don't understand something, I would advise you to see him during office hours. If you study well, a B is not hard to get.
Run for your life.

summary_comment: Professor Chatterji struggles significantly with using a graphing calculator, a crucial tool for the course, leading to frequent errors and confusion during lectures. Her communication of mathematical concepts is often unclear, and she frequently provides incorrect information, making it challenging for students to follow along. Despite some positive aspects noted by a few students regarding her willingness to help and fairness in grading, these issues predominantly overshadow her teaching effectiveness.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chatterji struggles significantly with using a graphing calculator, a critical tool for the course, and frequently makes mistakes during lectures, confusing both herself and students. Her communication is often unclear, and her first language is not English, which further hinders her ability to effectively teach the material.

Ratings.comment: Doesn't know how to use a graphing calculator (which is a huge aspect of the class). She continuously does problems incorrectly during lecture and then confuses herself by trying to see where she went wrong which in turn confuses the students. I stopped going to lecture and started going to the tutor room instead.

Refuses to use a calculator which is required in the course, doesn't communicate material clearly, often gives the wrong formulas or solves a problem wrong, makes tons of mistakes and trys to play it off like she did it on purpose.
She was totally useless and we had substitute professors for 2 weeks because she couldn't make it to class.

she cant use a graphin calculator so shecat help herstudents use it. she isnt clear when she teaches and she just expects everyone to know what she is talking about. Her first language is not english so she has a hard time communicating.

Honestly, I didn't attend her lecture after the first few weeks. I learned way more during my recitation than I did during her lecture. She doesn't know how to use a graphing calculator (which, for this class in necessary) and she does everything by hand which make it impossible to follow her unless your math is on her level, which was not the case

This professor was generally straightforward and willing to help students succeed in her class. Gives bonus points and even gave us a practice exam to help us study for the final. Curves generously as well. Would definitely recommend for a math class if you are willing to work hard and study for this class.

She is very personable. I never felt too intimidated to ask questions. Overall the class was not very difficult. She used questions from the textbook for exam questions so make sure you do a lot of practice problems.

She's an awesome teacher. Her exams were not always fair, but if they weren't she changed the grading scale for them. She also offered tons of bonus points. Just go to lecture, do the homeworks and the suggested problems from the book and you'll be fine. The exams are mostly based on homeworks and problems done in class.

An overall easy class that she made overly complicated and confusing. Decent number of mistakes during lecture, and I am not really sure if she completly understood the material. Strict grading on exams.

Because this class was just a review from high school, it was not that hard. But I definitely feel that had this been the first time the information was introduced to me,I would not have understood the material at all. She was very difficult to understand and not all of the information was covered that was on the tests.

Fall '05 was her first quarter teaching a lecture.  She seemed rather unprepared most days and had many mistakes.  Hard to understand.  Not because of her accent, but because she questioned herself often. Especially with the calculator.  I was lucky to be with a great TA (drew keebel).

summary_comment: Professor Louttit is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which keeps students attentive through sarcastic comments and clear explanations. His ability to simplify complex mathematical concepts and make them accessible to students, coupled with his supportive and patient demeanor, has earned him widespread praise. Students consistently recommend him for his effectiveness in teaching mathematics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Louttit is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which keeps students attentive through sarcastic comments and clear explanations. Students consistently praise his ability to simplify complex mathematical concepts and make the material accessible and understandable.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Louttit is awesome. He is funny and keeps your attention during lecture with his sarcastic comments. And most of his shirts have something to do with whiskey. Definitely recommend him!

Still taking Jason this spring quarter and could not wait to rate him.  MATH at OSU sucks!!  This is the second time taking the class and I understand precalc way beyond imaginable!  First midterm was a 70 last quarter.  I got a 96 through him. If you are clueless in math, TAKE HIM.  he makes it to where you will understand %100.  He needs a raise!
Sarcastic. He's really nice and gives quizzes weekly but they are sometimes straight from our notes. i liked him a lot
Very Helpful instructor at osu...very sarcastic and funny
Good instructor.  I stink in math, but he presented the material in such a way that i could learn and follow along.  Gives in class examples of all the problems students need to know for the exams.
Great professor and hilarious.  come to class and you should understand the math!
The BEST math prof I have ever had, he is absolutly hillarious and makes a really conducive learning environment. He is very clear about the material and is a great asset to OSUs math department...

I have had a slew of really awful math teachers/professors.  This is the absolute best I have ever had.   He presents ideas clearly and concisely in a language that we can all understand, he is patient, answers questions clearly and thoroughly.  I would take another math class if he is the prof.
I think he's just doing this until his stand up career takes off, however, he makes math moderately interesting and gets you out (of class) in no time.
No Comments
VERY easy teacher, I had him summer q so i dont know how he is during the year

summary_comment: Professor Adduci is widely regarded as arrogant and unhelpful, with students finding his teaching style frustrating and demeaning. He frequently assigns difficult problems and deducts points for minor formatting issues, leading to significant frustration among students. Overall, his approach to teaching and grading is considered detrimental to the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Adduci is widely regarded as arrogant and unhelpful, with students describing his demeanor as condescending and frustrating. His teaching methods and grading policies have been particularly criticized for being inflexible and harsh.

Ratings.comment: I would drop out of college and become a bum on the street rather than take another class with him. I've never met such an arrogant little man. He's not as smart as he thinks he is.

Very rude to students, and constantly talked down to us. Arrogant is a good word to use... but infuriating works also. Our whole class would get incredible frustrated every day. TA's should be helpful and want us to learn, not scoff at our questions. Don't think about not properly stapling your homework either, unless you want to see a little fit.
Not helpful, seems arrogant, Partial credit on a test? Nope.. not gonna happen if he is grading  it.

Couldn't agree more with the previous post.  Totally arrogant and unhelpful.  Assigns the hardest possible problems in the section for homework and the same type of problems on quizzes.  Would not recommend taking him.

The guy thinks he is the greatest thing that ever lived and that everyone sucks at math. He took points off of my homework for not putting a box around my answer because he missed it. He laughs at you when you don't understand it.

summary_comment: Professor Dai is highly regarded for his ability to effectively identify and address key concepts in mathematics, significantly reducing the need for extensive text reading. While students appreciate his willingness to assist them, they find his classes somewhat dry and lacking in humor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dai is highly regarded for his ability to efficiently identify and address key aspects of mathematical problems, significantly reducing the need for extensive textbook reading. Despite this, his classes are often described as somewhat dry and lacking in engagement, with no comedic elements to liven up the lectures.

Ratings.comment: kind,glad to help students, but the class is boring, never jokes. He is good at seize the key of the math problems. Going to his class will save you much time on text reading.

summary_comment: Professor Adcock is highly regarded for his deep knowledge of the subject and his commitment to student development, earning strong recommendations from many students. His clear explanations, sense of humor, and willingness to help students are consistently praised. While some found his lectures challenging, overall, he is seen as an effective and engaging instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Adcock is highly regarded for his deep knowledge of the subject and his commitment to helping students develop as computer scientists, with many praising his clear explanations, sense of humor, and willingness to assist students. However, opinions vary, with some finding his lectures challenging and others finding him unapproachable or dismissive.

Ratings.comment: Bruce was one of the best teachers I've had so far. It's unfortunate that he has now left the university, but he had bigger and better aspirations than OSU... Google. Good Luck Bruce

He know's the subject very well, and has a very clear interest in aiding, guiding, and developing his students as computer scientists. He has a refreshing sense of humor. He make's it very clear what to be careful of because he knows very well what his students often trip up on. Would highly recommend this teacher to anyone.

Knows his stuff, tries very hard.  His lectures are great--sense of humor and a good understanding of where most students would get confused.  I personally could not stay awake, but that's because I knew most of the stuff already and because it was early in the morning. He's also good-looking, so that's nice ;)
Extremely helpful, very clear, and obviously very knowledgeable about the subject at hand.  He was very catering to any needs that I had and was quick to respond to emails.
I liked this class and learned a lot. Be prepared to take notes and do all the homework. If you do that, you'll be just fine.
Was an excellent instructor for anyone willing to stay awake in math.
I can't stand this teacher. He's a total jack@$*and cares nothing about his students. He refuses to answer the questions that are asked and doesn't answer most of them thoroughly.

I loved this guy.  He is a really great math teacher with a great sense of humor.  If you do the homework and ask him about things that you don't understand, you shouldn't have any trouble doing well in his class.  Bruce is the man, and he will never bring you down.
Bruce is the best teacher Ever!! I hate math but he makes me love it :)
Has very good teaching skills
awesome ta.. funny.. enjoy going to his class

This guy does not care about his students. It takes him an entire hour to explain one math problem. He never gives us any hints of what is going to be on the midterm. He doesn't even go over the homework problems that we ask him to do. He always changes things around, which is annoying. Horrible TA.
No Comments

He is definitely the best math teacher I've ever had.  He's friendly, easygoing, and fun.  He's always available and tries really hard to make sure everyone understands the material.  He also grades quizzes and tests fairly.  He's cute, too.

summary_comment: Professor Eisenberg is highly dedicated to her students, going above and beyond to provide support. While her exams and homework are challenging and time-consuming, she is known for her commitment and willingness to assist. The course textbook, however, is frequently cited as a significant drawback.
summary_comment_short: Professor Eisenberg is highly dedicated to her students, going above and beyond to assist them. While her exams and homework are challenging and time-consuming, she is known for her strong commitment to their learning.

Ratings.comment: She is very dedicated to her students. Goes far out of her way to be helpful. Exams are hard, and HW is very time consuming. Worst part of the class is the horrible "book."

summary_comment: Professor Kennedy is widely regarded as the top math instructor at Ohio State, known for his exceptional ability to make complex concepts accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise his patience, willingness to help, and commitment to ensuring that no student feels left behind, whether through extra study sessions or additional explanations. His teaching approach fosters a supportive learning environment where students feel empowered to ask questions and improve their understanding.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kennedy is widely regarded as the best Math professor at Ohio State, known for his exceptional ability to make complex concepts accessible and engaging. Students consistently praise his patience, willingness to help, and dedication to ensuring that no student feels left behind.

Ratings.comment: Hands down the best Math professor at Ohio State,no question.

Mr K is the best math instructor I have ever had. I never felt dumb about asking a question. I am terrible at math but he took the time and effort to help me understand. Before the 3rd and 4th exam he showed up an hour early to hold a class study session for anyone who wanted help. I hope I am lucky enough to have him teach my next math class!
Mr.K is seriously the best math teacher i have ever had. He makes things fun and easy to understand and he doesn't make his students feel dumb if they need extra help.
Great instructor, very helpful in answering questions and helping students understand the material. His quizzes are easy and he's very helpful in preparing students for the final exam.
great teacher, makes sure everyone understands the subject and topics

I think he also goes by "Bob."  We called him Bob.  Or at least I called him Bob.  Anyway, this guy never hesistates to fill in "holes" students have in their mathematical skills, and has LOTS of patience and a good spirit when it comes to helping answer questions.  I wish I had math teachers like Bob in high school!
Outstanding teacher. Will do just about anything to help students.  By far the best math teacher I have ever had.

summary_comment: Professor Elsner, known as Tomasz, is widely regarded as one of the best math instructors in the department, making complex topics accessible and engaging. Students appreciate his deep knowledge and commitment to helping them understand the material, though some find his lectures challenging due to his accent and writing speed. Overall, he is praised for his clarity, care for students, and ability to make difficult classes manageable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Elsner, also known as Tomasz, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and deep understanding of mathematics, making complex topics accessible. Students appreciate his dedication and care for their learning, though some find his accent and writing speed challenging at times.

Ratings.comment: Probably one of the best profs in the math department. He made one of the most difficult math courses seem easy. Not only is math his life but he is an award winning scholar.
He seems like a really nice guy.  He can be hard to understand some times, but once you get used to him talking, he's not bad.  He knows what he's talking about and he can answer all questions.

Honestly, I am surprised with the amazing reviews. Yes he is nice and one of the better ones but OMG I think he is very hard to understand and I also think he writes to fast. It really is not the easiest class to follow. He does seem pretty nice though

i just had a difficult time learning from him, he had a Germanish accent and it made it difficult for me to understand him, math doesn't come very easy to me so I had issues with the class. Although his tests are basically the review with changed numbers.

Tomasz is a great teacher and truly cares about his students. He does his best to make the class interesting and to make sure you know the material for his tests. Do the review and you will get a 100%.
Tomasz was an amazing teacher. He made the material interesting and I enjoyed learning it. I would highly recommend taking a class taught by him.
Tests were long, but easy, pretty much the review with the numbers changed
Good Teacher. Makes sure you know the important stuff...not the random stuff that you will never use. Makes a somewhat difficult class pretty easy.

summary_comment: Professor Polo is generally seen as an entertaining instructor who creates a relaxed classroom atmosphere and often includes humor to lighten the mood during dry topics. While some students found his organization and clarity lacking, many appreciated his thorough example-solving approach and his strong command of the English language. Overall, opinions vary, but he is recommended by some for his engaging teaching style.
summary_comment_short: Professor Polo is generally considered disorganized and ineffective at explaining complex concepts, though some find him entertaining due to his humor. While he provides numerous examples and sometimes creates a relaxed quiz environment, his teaching style is divisive, with many finding him confusing and unhelpful during lectures.

Ratings.comment: This guy is an idiot.
He was completely disorganized. He could never clearly explain concepts. Absolutely useless, I would advise a tutor if your unfortunate enough to get him as your TA.

Like stated above, he is a pretty funny guy, which is nice when some of the material gets pretty dry. However, I disagree with the above.  He does countless examples, and although he is human and makes mistakes, he does make sure the concept and key strategies are learned by the students. I would definitely recommend him to a friend.

He is an entertaining TA indeed. He will often joke in class, he grades VERY, easily, and he is very laid back. Not too helpful in class, takes too long to get problems right or just gets them wrong, but overall he creates a relaxed environment to take quizzes.

Pretty much confused me, and he graded homework really hard.  I don't know if he wanted to help the students, or just get through the day.  But on the plus side, he has a full grasp of the english language, which is more than i can say for other TAs.

summary_comment: Professor Olmez is described by students as friendly and energetic, with one student noting his willingness to help. However, there are significant criticisms as well, with some students finding him difficult to follow due to his teaching style, which is perceived as culturally specific and not easily accessible to those with a U.S.-style education background.
summary_comment_short: Professor Olmez is generally perceived as friendly and energetic, with some students finding him approachable and easy to understand. However, others have criticized him as a poor teacher, particularly noting issues with his teaching style being difficult for US-educated students to follow.

Ratings.comment: Friendly and energetic.

I think he was really nice. I almost knew I was gonna fail but he said that he would ignore everything else if I score above average in the final. I dread math and never went to the class. But he was pretty great despite all that.
Great TA, not sure what these people are talking about. Compared to most of my Prof./TA. very easy to understand and get along with.
A disaster
he is awesome, best TA ever.

Terrible teacher! if you get him switch sections ASAP. He only teaches the way he learned math in Turkey. If you took math in a US high school prepare to be stressed out because a lot gets lost in translation. Avoid if at all possible.
This guy is the worst.  If you get him as a TA change you course. He does not speak english and teaches in his native way.

summary_comment: Professor Ye is an exceptionally skilled instructor who provides clear explanations, making the class accessible initially. However, the course becomes significantly more challenging, particularly with advanced topics like heat equations, where many students find it difficult. While she excels at teaching, the class demands strong mathematical skills, making it less forgiving for those who struggle with math.
summary_comment_short: Professor YE is an exceptionally skilled instructor who provides clear explanations, but her course becomes significantly more challenging as it progresses, particularly with topics like heat equations. Students find the class difficult for those who struggle with mathematics, unlike less demanding courses such as 162 or 263.

Ratings.comment: The class is easy at first and the first midterm was a joke but it gets progressively harder and harder until you start doing heat equations and everyone dies. She is a phenomenal teacher though and explains everything very well. However, if you are bad at math, you will probably struggle to get by as this class is not a joke like 162 or 263.

summary_comment: Professor Zeki is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and approachable instructor, known for his clarity and willingness to assist students. However, his teaching style can be challenging for some, with concerns about inconsistent grading and difficulty in following his examples and explanations. Students appreciate his efforts to help, despite occasional frustrations with his pacing and clarity.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zeki is highly regarded as a knowledgeable and approachable instructor, with several students praising his helpfulness and clarity. However, some criticize his teaching methods as inconsistent and occasionally unclear, noting issues with grading and classroom management.

Ratings.comment: he is really great guy.right now, he is teaching at a university which doesnt have campus. still, looking for something.
He was the best prof I ever had. For those seeking excuse for their failure, he is not one of them. Great guy. Too bad he is not prof yet
Is really nice but has trouble understanding what students are asking... Relly hard midterms/finals. beware!
He doesn't clearly explain his examples. He jumps round in an illogical manner. Many of his examples in class are very repetitious

When I took this class, it was during a summer quarter so he didnt have to go by the Math department's standards, but I felt that even though he gave alot of examples and tried to help the students, his grading was very inconsistent and not always fair to everyone in the class! Also, when I went to him for help, he sort of got frustrated with me.
he was great, funny, and very useful... his english was very good, who ever said otherwise is in for a treat with other Fisher teachers/TAs. very helpful

I don't know if I missed the boat everybody else sailed on, but although he seems pleasant, I don't feel he teaches well.He's shown up late to both midterms, how he grades hw seems disorganized,and forgot to attend a review session he was hosting for us.He's not a native English speaker,and I've had a little difficulty understanding him sometimes.
He is an awesome teacher.Very clear and goes out of his way to help you. But be carefull about your grades.He grades inconsistently.
Mustafa was a great teacher. He really cared about the students and went out of his way to help. One of the 2 best math teachers I've had at OSU.
He knows what he is doing, he was the best of all.

Great teacher and very nice guy. Really cares about his students. Very good with answering questions. Gives very fair exams. Gives lots of examples and helpful hints and explains them very precisely. Too bad he's only a TA and not a professor.

summary_comment: Professor Ralston has a strong grasp of the subject matter and effectively communicates complex ideas, though some find his focus on proofs challenging and at times overwhelming. His exams are known to be rigorous, and students often struggle initially before finding them more manageable later in the course. Reviews are mixed, with some praising his thorough proofs and clear notes, while others criticize his teaching style as confusing and unhelpful, recommending against taking his class unless absolutely necessary.
summary_comment_short: Professor Ralston demonstrates a strong grasp of the subject matter and effectively communicates complex ideas, though his teaching style can be challenging, especially in the initial weeks. Students find his emphasis on proofs sometimes overwhelming and not always aligned with practical applications, leading to mixed reviews regarding the overall difficulty and usefulness of the course material.

Ratings.comment: I thought he had a good understanding of the subject matter and was able to express it well.
Described abstract ideas as simply as possible. Sometimes spends too much time on proofs and not enough on applications. Fair tests.

He is a very hard guy to understand. The class starts off ridiculously hard and then becomes extremely easy after the first midterm. Ralston makes some of the hardest tests known to man, but after about 5 weeks you get used to his ways and the class isn't so bad.

The class was extremely hard, the final was ridiculous, but I think he did a decent job teaching and, at the very least, graded fairly.  The book was also pretty crappy, so that definitely did not help.
He goes over a lot of material in class but if you copy everything on the board it is very easy to read your notes. He does a great job proving everything, making it easier to understand!

The most incompressible professor I've ever had. I've had bad teachers but he is worse. He doesn't seem to care whether people understand his material. He just rumbles on into proofs about everything which leaves everyone confused. no one ever understands him. a word to the wise - don't take his class unless you have to.

Spoke mostly to the board. Proved some theorem and then gave us the equation we would need to use and said "so you have an understanding". Final was garbage because most of the stuff we never went over in class. Learned more from TA and tutor

One of the worst professors in the Math Department.  He hardly goes over any examples in class and wastes times in class by proving formulas you will never ues.  Our average for the first midterm was a 58%.  Word to the wise, get a copy of last quarters midterms.  You will be glad you did.  Don't expect more than a 60% on the final.  Good Luck

Extremely hard class. Dont understand his teaching at all. His exam is extremely hard. Save money since he dont allow us to use calculator.   Favourite quote: "Write nothing is better than write something that is false"

summary_comment: Professor Januszkiewicz is challenging for students due to his accent and fast speech, making lectures difficult to follow. Despite being described as a nice person, he struggles with clear communication and organization, leading to confusion and the need for extensive self-study. Exams vary in difficulty, with some students finding midterms easier while others struggled with the final.
summary_comment_short: Professor Januszkiewicz is challenging for students due to his difficult-to-understand accent and fast speech, which complicate an already tough course. Students find his lectures confusing and often need to rely on self-study, leading to mixed results on exams.

Ratings.comment: Horrible professor, accent makes him tough to understand and complicates an already tough course. If you want to do well, you'll have to do a lot of work on your own. Exams were semi-difficult.

He seems intimidating at first but he is indeed a very nice guy.  However, he just isn't cut out to be a teacher. You can tell he is a very smart guy, he just seems to have alot of trouble conveying his thoughts into words.  I went to all his lectures and would leave each day utterly confused.  You have to learn on your own.  Final was impossible.

He is a very nice guy, but he is so confusing especially when he tries to be funny and make jokes. He speaks very fast and his handwriting is pretty hard to read, so sit close.. He is decent in office hours, more understandable but seems to get frustrated when you don't get it. He is a very harsh grader with hard tests.
Tough to understand, nice guy.
Can't understand a word he says.

He's a Nice enough Guy, but I really wouldn't take his class. His lessons are unorganized, he'll sometimes do example problems he can't solve, or will just stop somewhere and assume everyone can finish them. Also, In comparison to the other H161 sections, the grading was not fair. I did fine as this class is basically a repeat of BC Calc, but....

Very hard to understand in lecutres and seems kinda stubborn when it comes to teaching.  Midterms were easy but final was hard, but he must of had a huge curve in the class.  Unlike previous math, the book is impossible to use if you want to teach yourself.

His lectures are impossible to understand, and it's not that I'm bad at math.  I'm actually really good at it, but NOBODY knew what the heck was going on.  His two mid-terms were pretty easy but the final was killer.  A lot of the time he'll refuse to answer questions and I think it's because he's too lazy to do sample problems.

Lectures were disorganized and hard to follow.  Frequently goes off on tangents whose relevance is unknown.  Proofs were, as a previous rater said, disorganized and imprecise.  I passed the class, but I'm not sure what it is that I managed to learn.

Hard to understand. His English is poor and he does not explain anything clearly. Once told me I was "On my own" when I asked him to explain something I did not understand. Lectures do not correspond with homework or exams. Very defensive when I asked questions. Not interested in helping the students understand. Avoid.

Overall a horrible professor. This guy destroyed my love for math. He never explained any of his work and would write a bunch of unrelated math junk on the board and expect people to pick up on it. He doesn't care about teaching and responds to 90% of questions with "You tell me." He even walked away from me as I asked him a question once Avoid him

not very good. he didn't seem interested in teaching at all. when teaching he would often divert to stuff other than the subject matter and waste lots of time on it. his proofs were disorganized and imprecise. often he'd just draw a picture without writing anything and claim that it's the proof. whatever i learned i learned it myself from the book.
Hes a good teacher with a good sense of humor/ You just have to pay attention.

Very hard to understand and follow in class.  I geuss thats why I stopped going after bout half way through.  I actually did better by not going and studying on my own than trying to learn from him.  He is a nice guy though, and he tries to teach but he's just not good at it.  Avoid if possible.
This guy sucks.  He can't teach or he does not want to teach.  He should teach Math 111 or something...

No preparation at all. Works off the top of his head so much and so inaccurately that you can't verify what's true and what's not. No set plan for the class and no book, so you can't even work outside of class. You leave the class learning nothing. Seriously my worst teacher or professor, except for my kindergarten teacher. Should teach 131 or 151.
He is the worst teacher i ever had, hard to understand cause he does not like to teach, it seems he is in class since he has to be.. very bad choice..
No Comments

Hard to follow because he did a lot of problems (which is good) but without explaination of the material.  Tests were fair.  Was not very helpful and sometimes seemed irritated if you weren't understanding the material. Hard class overall.

He's a very nice guy - but sometimes it's difficult to follow what's going on in class because he often fumbles through problems.  But he gives review sheets that are a GREAT indication of what to expect on an exam.

summary_comment: Professor Wiser is known for his enthusiastic and humorous teaching style, which many students find engaging and enjoyable. However, his classes are demanding, with significant amounts of homework that some find overwhelming, particularly when covering theoretical concepts. Despite the workload, many students appreciate his dedication and willingness to assist, often recommending him as one of the best TAs at Ohio State.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wiser is known for his energetic and humorous lectures, which many students find engaging and effective for learning differential equations. However, his classes are also noted for the significant amount of homework assigned, which some find overwhelming, particularly those who already grasp the material well.

Ratings.comment: Hard to understand when teaching theory.  Assigned excessive hw that was not very helpful.  Way too much time is spent on hw once you already understand the material.

Loved going to lecture.  Much more useful than the book.  But, too much work for the summer.  All in all, colorful, funny guy.  I would say, take the class if you really need to know diff eq.  If you want an easy time, find somebody else.

Awesome lecturer.  Learned soooooo much.  Did tons of work, though.  Work hard and you will do fine (and have some fun).  But, be prepared to do lots of problems.  This man loves him so math (and he thinks you do, too).

Justin did a great job teaching. He presented the material in a different light than the professor, which made the material easier and more fun. He was always willing to help in or outside class. I would not have done well in this course if it wasn't for Justin and I would definitely recommend him to other classmates that need to take Math 415.

Justin is, with no doubt, the BEST TA at Ohio State. He spends an incredible amount of time/effort assisting his students in every manner possible. Last quarter he came in on a Sunday for an extra office hour before the final exam. Very nice and quite funny. Don't say to to him that you hate math though, because you might make him cry on the inside

I defy you to not love math when Justin teaches it.  His enthusiasm rubs off on everyone.  He is hilarious and his class is actually fun to attend. He is EXTREMELY helpful to his students.  Writes review sheets with full soltuions, etc. No doubt: best TA I have had at OSU - and I've had plenty.  I love Justin and you will, too.  Highly recommended!

Justin is an adorable goofball!  He did not manage to get me to love math (although it is apparent that he does).  But, he did manage to get me to attend a class (at 8:30) that was not mandatory!  I def recommend him.  He cares a lot about his students and his class is never boring.  Calculus is not easy, but he makes it as fun/clear as possible!
Justin is the best TA I have ever had.  He is very clear and does his best to help with a difficult course .  He is so helpful and nice. I would definitely recommend him to others.

Went waaay above and beyond the call of duty to help students outside of class.  Not easy, but very approachable and he did his best to help us all.   Plenty of opportunities to stop in class and ask questions. I got a whole lot out of his classes. Without doubt, the best TA I have had at OSU. (And a sharp dresser, too!)  Take his class if you can.

summary_comment: Professor Maginnis is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality and ability to explain concepts clearly. Students find him both informative and entertaining, with one noting his great sense of humor. His lecture notes are particularly praised for their thoroughness and clarity.
summary_comment_short: Professor Maginnis is an excellent instructor known for his clear explanations and engaging lectures. His comprehensive notes and humorous demeanor make his classes particularly enjoyable and informative.

Ratings.comment: great and funny man
Great notes given in lecture, explains everything very well. Also, has a very great hair cut.

summary_comment: Professor Olwert is highly regarded for his helpfulness and enthusiasm, making himself readily available to students and ensuring they understand the material before moving forward. While some noted he might be out of his element due to primarily teaching math, his teaching style is praised for encouraging critical thinking and providing ample support. Students consistently recommend his classes and consider him one of the best instructors.
summary_comment_short: Professor Olwert is highly regarded for his willingness to help students and his enthusiastic teaching style, though some noted he seemed a bit out of his element due to primarily teaching math. Overall, he is described as an excellent instructor who goes above and beyond to ensure student understanding and motivation.

Ratings.comment: A very nice guy, more than willing to help with any problems. Having said that, he seemed a bit out of his element at times as he has previously taught mostly math classes. A bit of a "noob," if you will. Class was not too difficult, although he could be picky with paper grading (grammar). Textbook unnecessary. Attendance mandatory.

Very helpful makes time for his students whenever it is best for them.  Never gives up on a student either, makes sure that everyone understands before he moves on.  I would take every class with him if possible. Just an all around great instructor and a great guy

The best Math teacher ever!!! He's really helpful, enthusiastic and cheerful. I love his teaching style. He motivates his students to think by asking them questions instead of simply writing down solutions on the board. You can approach him anytime you want, ask him any kind of question without feeling stupid. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM!!!
Craig was awesome, really bubbly, helpful, and patient!! Good teacher whether or not you're good at math going into the class!!
He tried his best and was always willing to help you out. He went over homework in recitation but didn't go into much detail about the work. Not to bad.

I had this teacher for both Math 148 and 150 and he was the most helpful math teacher!  I missed a lot of lectures but went to his class and then understood all the material.  I highly recommend him as your math TA

summary_comment: Professor Leary is highly regarded for his entertainment value and engaging British accent, which many find amusing. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow, especially for new material, and some students feel they are too fast-paced. Despite this, he is noted for being very helpful and accommodating, particularly with scheduling and offering additional support to students who need it.
summary_comment_short: Professor Leary is highly regarded for his helpfulness and entertainment value, often engaging students with an amusing teaching style and a British accent. However, his lectures can be challenging and less effective for those who struggle with the subject matter, as they can be scattered and hard to follow without additional study.

Ratings.comment: Super helpful. He re added my final exam score when i believed it was graded unfairly and found me 30 extra points the TA's "missed". Also, he is british<3.

These lectures started out fun, when I already knew all the calculus, but once we got into material I hadn't previously covered I realized how scattered and hard to follow they were. I took studious notes only to find out they were straight from the book. If you're willing to teach yourself and study independently from the book you'll love it!
Not exactly the best math professor I have ever had. Although he is entertaining, going to class was worthless.

He is very entertaining although I didn't learn much from him. I already knew all the calculus so I can say midterms and exams were easy. He caught me right as I was entering the building and we had a 10 minute conversation in the freezing snow instead of just stepping inside the classroom... He's a little spacy, but entertaining

Very funny. I laughed outloud at least once in every lecture. He puts everything in terms of a "little cart riding along the function f(x)", english accent, probably not the best professor if you dont catch on to math easily though, he doesnt really make sense most of the time, but if math comes fairly easily hes extreamly entertaining
Worked with me on scheduling conflicts well beyond what most professors would.

Very helpful if you ever need help. Pace seemed quick for someone with a semi-good background in calculus. His style of teaching I found very stimulating and his English accent was amazing. Not the most social guy but always willing to help.

He's alright.. some of his lectures were sort of useless, but overall he did a pretty good job.  Class was pretty easy - midterms and final were cake.  If you have a pretty good understanding of Calc (limits, derivatives, related rates, etc) then you probably won't have to go to lecture much.
Good teacher.  Has a good sense of humor which helps class pass quickly.  Does a good job explaining the material and is extremely helpful if you are having trouble.
He was a good professor, but a bit confusing.  He is a funny guy, which helps make lectures more enjoyable.
His lectures can be a bit confusing, but he explains examples well, and expects a reasonable amount of work.  He's fair in grading, and overall a good professor.

summary_comment: Professor Bokar is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, effectively engaging students and delivering content clearly. His approachability and positive demeanor make him a standout educator.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bokar is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, effectively engaging students and delivering clear content. His approachability and positive demeanor contribute significantly to a rewarding learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Anthony was a great guy and an equally good teacher.  Didn't hurt that he was easy on the eyes either ;)

summary_comment: Professor Bezuglyy is highly regarded by many students for his thorough explanations and dedication to student understanding, despite a challenging accent that takes time to get used to. While some students found his teaching methods and technical proficiency lacking, others praised him for his knowledge, clarity in complex topics, and engaging lectures, leading to significant learning gains.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bezuglyy is highly regarded by some students for his clarity in explanations and dedication to student understanding, despite a challenging accent that takes time to adapt to. However, others found him difficult to follow, especially in terms of technology usage and exam preparation, and warn against his teaching style.

Ratings.comment: Its a MATLAB class and he used a transparency projector. He was terrible. Really a craptastic prof when it came to this class. He didn't know how to use any tech. Hard to understand and made loads of mistakes.

Beware of this guy for 571!  Can't email, post to carmen, or clearly prepare students for exams.  Didn't have a grade posted until week 8.  Cancelled classes by note on board rather than email.  Obsessed with proofs which are completely irrelevant.  Don't bother studying for them because you won't get any points anyways.  Stay away!!!

His notes were really clear, and he always seemed dedicated to making sure the students understood everything. He didn't move too fast but he didn't move too slow, and he would try to involve the class by asking questions sometimes. One of the best professors I've had at OSU. You get used to his accent pretty quickly, also.
Andriy is a wonderful professor. I didn't think there was any way I could get through calculus but he helped me get an A!

He's the best professor I've had since I got to OSU. May find his accent difficult at first, but you'll get used to it pretty soon. He's also got this sense of determination to teach everything he has to, and in a very nice way too... You'll definitely appreciate his class!
Great prof! Has a thick accent, but you get used to it. He is very smart and great at explaining complex concepts.  Very funny too!
has a heavy russian/eastern european accent. still easier to understand than most math profs. learned more in his lecture than the first 2 times i took the class combined.

I thought going to lecture and reading/copying notes was helpful. His accent takes a while to get used to. My TA was horrible. Try to avoid DAW if you can. In general though bezuglyy was knowledgeable and seemed to care.
Actually felt like I learned something in Lecture. Understood his teaching methods.

Andriyy is a great prof! His accent is a little strange at first but very easy to get used to. You don't need the book unless you are doing practice problems. Andriy's notes are perfect and tell you everything you need to know. He cares whether or not you understand th ematerial.

Yes, he has an accent but it's not that bad. It takes 1-2 classes to get used to it. His notes are very clear and well organized. Very caring teacher. His test are kind of tough but if you pay attention in class they are manageable.
Has a strong accent but its kinda hot..his notes are really easy to understand and is what made the class so easy. Has tough quizes but if you know your notes theyre an easy A!

BOOOOOOOO...... The russian guy cant pronounce half the words associated with math. Period. its ridiculous. I learn nothing during lectures... and the TA in my recitation is the only reason im barely passing in the class. Take a class with an ENGLISH speaking teacher. Save yourself the trouble.

He is a cool TA. He actually can explain this stuff with only a bit of misunderstanding. He did most of the problems out of the book and for some reason always left at the beginning of recitation  He really helped during office hours. Though he wasn't there during finals which really was inconvenient.
Not so good

His accent is better now and he never takes attendance. But he's always late to class, never gives stuff back, is never in his office at office hours. Also, none of my class' stuff was put up on Carmen (ever!)! If this is your TA, prepare to go to the tutor room, because you will probably need outside help.
tried really hard but has heavy accent making it hard to understand sometimes

Pretty nice TA, although he sometimes had some trouble conveying what he wanted because of the language barrier. Quizzes were quite hard, but he tried his best to help us learn what we needed to. Overall not bad at all, and very encouraging to everyone.

summary_comment: Professor Woodruff is generally considered a poor lecturer, as students found his explanations verbal and often skipped steps, leaving many more confused after his classes. However, as a teaching assistant, he is highly regarded for his helpfulness, preparedness, and ability to clarify concepts through additional examples and detailed walkthroughs during recitations.
summary_comment_short: Professor Woodruff's teaching style is primarily verbal, often omitting detailed steps in problem-solving, which can confuse students who struggle with math. While some students found him helpful as a teaching assistant, many reported that his classroom instruction was ineffective, leading to confusion and the need for external tutoring.

Ratings.comment: If you learn visually, go get another TA. He explains a lot of things verbally, without showing the steps. Even when he does write problems down he skips steps, which make it difficult to learn if you don't understand math well. He often left me more confused than I had been before class; I had to get a tutor.
Not good professor.  It sounds like he may be a good TA, but drifts off topic and poorly uses class time.  Extremely intelligent, just couldn't translate it to the students.

He may have been a good TA for other classes, but for our class? He was useless. His grading was not in conjuction with the lecturer's rubric. He made no sense when teaching, because he did not teach the same as the lecturer. And he did not help us with worksheets we was supposed to do. He took WAY too long to grade homework.

Good TA. We went over the homework in the recitations, and he made sure you knew what was going on. Always did another example if somebody asked. Went off topic a few times, talking about off-the-wall math related subjects, but it wasn't a big deal. Would recommend.
Rob is the best. I mean, he is so cute and extremely helpful. I wouldn't take a class without him!
great TA...is very helpful and prepared for recitation by answering questions or reviewing examples.  He loves math and gets excited when talking about "cool" problems
great TA.  very helpful.  if you have him you should do well in math 132 reguardless of your professor.
Speaks English, he's very helpful, always available for office hours, take him if offered

summary_comment: Professor Fish receives overwhelmingly negative feedback from students, with many describing him as ineffective and detrimental to their learning experience. Comments highlight issues with his teaching methods, including a disconnect between class content and exam topics, harsh grading, and unhelpful office hours. Students strongly advise avoiding his classes entirely.
summary_comment_short: Professor Fish receives overwhelmingly negative feedback from students, with many describing him as a poor teacher who is unhelpful, unorganized, and confusing. Multiple students strongly advise avoiding his classes entirely due to his harsh grading and lack of clarity in both teaching and testing.

Ratings.comment: Give him a chance. Study before you go into class and after then as well. Go to his office hour he has tons of ideas that he does not covey in the class.
Words can't describe how terrible this man was. Do yourself a favor and just avoid ever taking his class, no matter the cost.

I don't think it can be said enough times - this guy has no business teaching anything, anywhere.  Rearrange your entire life or change your major if it means you don't have to be subjected to this IDIOT.

Avoid him! He teaches one thing and then tests on a completely different topic. He changed his syllabus the first week making all of our grades based on tests. Which the averages for all were around 40-50%. By far the worst math professor I have had
This guy is a retard!!! THE WORST prof I have had since coming to OSU. He was a useless piece of****... The dept chair will hear from me about this ****. If any of you get him, drop IMMEDIATELY!!!!

Doesn't help students at all. Ignores questions and goes on about theory only to ask confusing application questions on tests about something he mentioned briefly. Grades very harshly and makes students take the fall for his terrible teaching ability. Terrible, terrible professor. Avoid at all costs.

People throw around the word "worst" a lot. Well, Fish really is the worst. The worst professor, and pretty much the worst human being I have ever met.  I hope he reads this and sees that everyone hates him so he realizes that he has no business at my university. This class was a total waste of my time and money. Avoid this guy like the plague.
Unorganized, unprofessional, unclear, unwilling to help.  His class was a horrible experience.  I could go on all day... avoid at all costs.

Fish is the worst teacher at Ohio State, period.  His handwriting is ridiculously hard to read, he provides no help for the exams, and I can't even understand half the words that come out of his mouth.  Why is he teaching me linear algbera?  Fish, you may be 30 something years old, but I think it's time to retire soon.
Terrible
