Fish is horrible!  Avoid him at all costs.  His style is very confusing and doesn't write a lot on the board but verbally says it.  Uses a lot of abbreviations that take some getting used to.  Take Hussen for 571 if possible, he's much better.  Fish was very unwilling to provide extra problems before the midterm and final.  AVOID HIM!

summary_comment: Professor Balata is known for his strong grasp of the subject matter and effective teaching methods, making him a reliable and knowledgeable instructor. He maintains a relaxed yet focused classroom environment and provides timely feedback through quizzes and grading. Students appreciate his responsiveness to emails, making him an accessible and supportive TA.
summary_comment_short: Professor Balata is an effective instructor known for his thorough knowledge of the subject matter and his ability to communicate it clearly. Students find him approachable and responsive, particularly appreciating his prompt email replies and fair grading system.

Ratings.comment: I had this guy as my Rec teacher just this last Autumn and he was pretty good. You can definitely tell he knows what he is talking about. He is pretty laid back, easy to understand, quizes are good, and grades fine. He is a good TA by my experience. If you have a question, email him and he gets back to you pretty quick.

summary_comment: Professor Mendelson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching abilities and excellent problem-explanation skills, making him one of the best TAs students have encountered. However, some feedback notes that he could be more timely in posting grades on Carmen.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mendelson is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and ability to explain complex problems effectively, making him one of the best TAs students have encountered. However, some feedback notes that he could be more prompt in posting grades on Carmen.

Ratings.comment: He really is the best TA around, sad that he's gone.
He is a very good TA the best i've had so far. Very good at explaining the problems asked by students. very helpful, though a little slow with posting grades on carmen.

summary_comment: Professor Busakhla is an effective instructor known for his ability to make complex concepts accessible through relevant examples. Despite initial reservations, students found him to be competent and supportive, particularly in recitation sessions where he provided valuable assistance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Busakhla is an effective instructor known for his ability to make complex concepts accessible through relevant examples. Despite initial skepticism, students found him to be competent and supportive in his teaching approach.

Ratings.comment: Naim was the man. Thought he was going to be horrible on the first day when he told us he was deaf, blind, and had poor memory.  Turned out he was normal and always did relevant example problems to help us out.  Glad I went to recitation after the first day I thought he was a clunker.

summary_comment: Professor Frazier is highly regarded for her thorough understanding of the subject matter and her preparedness for classes, though some find her explanations can be unclear. She is known for her availability during office hours and her willingness to help students, though her grading is considered rigorous. Students appreciate her approachability and her positive demeanor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Frazier is known for her thorough preparation and clear explanations, though some find her grading challenging. She is highly supportive during office hours and is appreciated for her willingness to help and approachability.

Ratings.comment: Ms.Frazier was very clear and very understandable. She knows her material and always prepared for class. She is a very tough grader but she is always willing to help. you will work for your grade.

She could be a little unclear in class, but made up for it by always being available in office hours and being genuinely helpful. She's very nice and an incredibly cute lady. Can't beat a nice hot lady
Marian is very helpful and always willing to answer questions asked by students.  Plus she is hot.

summary_comment: Professor Puliyambalath is known for his straightforward and helpful teaching approach, ensuring students have all the necessary knowledge for homework and exams. He is highly regarded as a great professor and strongly recommended for Math 568. However, the course structure is criticized for not fostering critical thinking.
summary_comment_short: Professor Puliyambalath's teaching is straightforward and highly effective, ensuring students have all the necessary knowledge for homework and exams. While his approach is commendable, students note that the structure of Math 568 does not facilitate critical thinking.

Ratings.comment: His teaching is straight forward and helpful. You are taught everything you need to know to do well on the homework and exams. I have absolutely no complaints about Naushad. Great professor and highly recommended if you have to take 568. My only complaint is the structure of Math 568, which is that it is simply not conducive to critical thinking.

summary_comment: Professor Bezugly's teaching quality is questionable, as students find his lectures difficult to follow due to his accent, rendering attending them largely ineffective. While quizzes and homework are considered manageable, the final exam was criticized for containing questions that went beyond the material covered in class, making it overly challenging.
summary_comment_short: Professor Bezugly's lectures are often difficult to follow due to his accent, making attending them largely ineffective for learning. The quizzes and homework are considered straightforward, but the final exam contained numerous questions that were not addressed in class, leading to a perception of unfair assessment.

Ratings.comment: Hard to understand because of accent.  Going to lectures is worthless.  Quizzes and homework are easy.  Final exam was ridiculous- many questions were not covered in the class.

summary_comment: Professor Miller is described as a nice individual but is criticized for his teaching methods, which involve minimal examples and require significant self-study. Lectures are reportedly off-topic and unhelpful, and the assessment is largely through daily quizzes and selective homework assignments, with midterms being short and marked strictly. Students generally do not recommend his classes, especially for mathematics without the lecture and recitation components.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller is a nice instructor but has been criticized for his teaching methods, which often involve minimal examples and require significant self-study. Students find his lectures unhelpful due to frequent digressions and lack of clarity, and they recommend enrolling in the lecture and recitation sections to better understand the material.

Ratings.comment: He is nice guy, older. But only gives one example for each problem. Pretty much have to teach yourself everything. No extra credit, and midterms are short, and marked harshly. wouldnt recommend taking a math without the lec/rec part.

He is a really nice guy, but he does not teach well. His lectures go completely off subject, and you have to teach yourself how to do everything. Quizzes every day you meet, but only few are counted. He only collects a few homeworks and tells you what questions to do. He is not clear. I do not recommend him for this class.

summary_comment: No comments available
summary_comment_short: No comments available

summary_comment: Professor Wu is highly regarded by some students for his effective teaching methods and genuine care for student success, despite some finding his lectures brief. While opinions vary, many praise his clarity and helpfulness, especially in making difficult material more accessible. However, others criticize his teaching approach, citing poor explanation and difficulty in learning from his lectures alone.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wu has a mixed reputation among students, with some finding him highly effective and supportive, particularly in making difficult material accessible and offering generous opportunities for improvement, while others describe his teaching as inadequate and confusing.

Ratings.comment: This man is the WORST teacher I have ever had. I usually like to give people the benefit of the doubt, but I did not learn a single thing from him. Everything I learned, I learned from the MSLC or students with different professors. He does not explain things well AT ALL and then blames you for a lack of effort when you do poorly on exams.
Best teacher i ever had. his exams are easy and no one failed in my class. he lets you go early which is good for evening class. nice teacher i will higly suggest taking him.
He teach only about 1 hour. I like it and he didnt care about attendance. I really enjoy his class^^
He gave us chance to get 5 points to make up. If you solove textbook problems and understand those, you would get A or A-. I like his teaching style. I recommend him to u.
He is very good at what he does, and even though he is not a native English speaker he still is easy to understand.

woody's awesome! he gives full points on the homework for trying and does a lot of the hw in class. he explains everything very clearly, and very helpful with the webwork. definetly the best ta i've ever had. class usually let out about 20 min early, which is awesome because nobody wants to be in class til 9:30pm.
The material is Hard but Woody makes it as easy as possible. He really genuinely cares about his students doing well!! Great guy, great at teaching math, overall awesome!

summary_comment: Professor Arps is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively making complex mathematical concepts accessible and understandable to her students. Her genuine care for her students' learning is evident in her thorough explanations and supportive approach.
summary_comment_short: Professor Arps is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively making complex mathematical concepts accessible and understandable to her students. Her genuine care for her students' learning is evident in her thorough explanations and supportive approach.

Ratings.comment: I've had her for recitation in 131 and 148. She genuinely cares about her students and does an amazing job explaining sometimes difficult math. Definitely take her if you can!
She was great for recitation.  She knows how to make the material understandable!  She did a great job.

summary_comment: Professor Zorn is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods, making complex concepts accessible and understandable. He offers very helpful office hours and provides useful study materials like review sheets and detailed feedback on exams, earning him a strong reputation among students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zorn is highly regarded for making complex mathematical concepts, particularly proof-based material, accessible and understandable. Students find his office hours and detailed study guides very beneficial, and many describe him as an excellent and helpful instructor.

Ratings.comment: This class is all about proofing, so it's kind of difficult to grasp the concept of all the new terminology and procedures, but Chris makes it fairly easy to learn. His office hours are VERY helpful. For exams,make sure you do the study guide he gives you and re-do homework problems in the book. Overall, Chris is an awesome guy and is very helpful!
Office Hours are extremely helpful. Make sure to study his review sheets for the exam and redo all homework problems. Great professor overall!
The best professor I've ever had! He makes the material very easy to understand and the exams are very easy.
Very Helpful, excellent prof.
Dr. Zorn was a decent teacher. He was pretty good at expressing the material to the class, and gave lots of partial credit on exams.

summary_comment: Professor Gard is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts clear and engaging. Students appreciate his willingness to help both in and outside of class, and many credit him with their success in the course. His approachable and humorous demeanor enhances the learning experience, making even lengthy classes enjoyable.
summary_comment_short: Professor Gard is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts clear and engaging. Students consistently praise his willingness to help beyond class hours and his effective teaching methods that ensure understanding and success.

Ratings.comment: great teacher. makes everything clear and more that willing to help. I wish i had him for the rest of 150 series. He makes sure you know what you need to know and his "smart ass" attitude makes class enjoyable and i had a 3hr night class

Andy rocks!!! He's willing to go the extra mile if you are willing to put in the work; let's just say that if you fail his class, it wasn't anything he did or did not do. He makes everything so dummy-proof that no matter how dense you are, you still have a good shot in getting the grade you want- yes, I mean an A.
He is nice and trying to make the class fun. The attandance is not mandatory though you would better go because his lecture is easy and helpful to understand.

It is a shame that he is not a lecturer. Andy helped me get through Math 151 and 152, and even though he didn't teach 153, he was still willing to help me out. If you have Andy as a recitation teacher or as a lecturer, math will come easy to you

he was very helpful and chose good examples to do in class. he was available outside of the classroom. you could tell that he wanted you to do well and was was willing to help you succeed in the class
very helpful, willing to help after class, very helpful during office hours, helped me pass math when i couldnt understand my lecturer! i love andy!
Very smart and willing to take the time to help you outside of the classroom!
Most fun I've ever had in a math recitation.  Andy teaches everything very clearly and will help you however he can if you ask.
I had him last quarter and he's so nice and SO helpful.  He kind of reminds me of Harry Potter is HP was taller and thinner.  :)
if you are so lucky to get into his recitation, you don't need to worry about your math. Follow his step, and you can get A easily.

summary_comment: Professor Thien is known for his genuine care and support for his students, making an effort to ensure everyone understands the challenging material, particularly in proofs. Despite the difficulty of the course, students appreciate his teaching approach and consider him a great instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Thien is known for his genuine care and support for his students' understanding, making a challenging course more accessible. Despite the difficulty of the material, he is highly regarded for his teaching quality and approachability.

Ratings.comment: Joe is a really nice guy and he genuinely wants to see everyone do well. It is a difficult course as it revolves around proofs but Joe tries to make it so that everyone understands the subject. My quarter was his first quarter teaching and I'm glad he hasn't been ruined by the OSU math department. Great guy. Hard class though.

summary_comment: Professor Hammett is highly regarded as an effective and clear math instructor, with students praising his ability to explain complex concepts simply and his willingness to engage with students during lectures. While some note minor issues with organization or delivery style, his teaching is generally considered excellent, making even challenging subjects more accessible.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hammett is highly regarded for his clarity and effectiveness as a math teacher, with students praising his ability to explain complex concepts clearly and making difficult material more understandable. His engaging and humorous teaching style, while occasionally disorganized, is appreciated by many, and he is known for being approachable and encouraging questions during lectures.

Ratings.comment: he was one of the best math teachers i have had at OSU and would reccomend him to anyone.  He was very easy to understand and if you have taken a few math courses at OSU you know how important that is.  Great teacher.
great professor! makes everything he teaches very clear!
Adam is a good teacher. Sometimes I wish he wouldn't talk like he has a PhD in Math though. He is helpful to an extent.
Adam is so funny and makes the class understand everything he's talking about because he uses good examples. He is also good looking and if you hate math thats one up side to going to class:)!
He was really nice and easy to understand. I had to take the class because of a placement test error, and already knew everything, but had I not understood, he would have been amazing.
He is a little off the wall and sometimes disorganized but he seems nice. He prepared us well for quizzes and exams.

Professor Hammet is a good lecturer and at times will make you laugh I really hate math and he made it so you could understand it and he would let you ask him questions during his  lecture even if it meant interrupting him.  I would recommend him to anyone.
Good lecturer, said "yeah" too much, but conveyed the subject matter decently. Knew what he was doing
Yeah?!
Pleasant Personality, but I got the feeling he had never actually taught preschool or early elementary school. I don't feel I learned anything from the class.
Professor made math interesting for the first time. Seriously. It is very nice to actually be able to understand a math professor at Ohio State for once! If you're taking a math class, take him.
really nice guy and you can tell he loves math!  makes class fun and interesting and he will get you excited about the subject, even if you hate math :)  awesome teacher!!!
He's so good I wish he was the prof.  He does an amazing job explaining and keeps it very low-key and honest.
adam hammett is a genius and explains everything really well too
he made quizzes hard just for fun even when the profs midterms were easy his were hard for no reason, didnt help students with anything

Adam is the best math TA you will ever have. I didn't even bother going to lecture after the first few days, because Adam taught me all I needed to know. The funniest, most eccentric, and most knowledgeable math teacher you'll ever have. His mannerisms are awesome.
He does say the funniest things! Also, he is very good about getting important and difficult concepts across without making them hard to manage.
I loved this guy.  He was so much fun and said the funniest things.  Yeah?!  You might not get that now, but you will once you have him.  I would definately take a class with hime again!
No Comments
Very good instructor.  I learn more from him then the Lecturer.  Doesn't assign excessive homework.  Doesn't just go through the problems, rather explains  what and why he is doing certain steps.
Knows material well. good at explaining tough concepts. Helpful and clear.

He is very balanced in that he is not overly difficult but not so easy as to allow someone to get by without learning the material.  He is so helpfull that it is easy to overlook the pressures on his time.

summary_comment: Professor Benzakein is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students citing her inability to explain concepts without notes and her confusing lectures. Despite some students noting her knowledge of the subject matter, many found her teaching style ineffective and overwhelming, leading to low attendance and poor understanding. Overall, her teaching quality has been severely criticized, with several students advising others to avoid her classes entirely.
summary_comment_short: Professor Benzakein is widely regarded as a poor instructor, with students citing her inability to effectively communicate concepts without referring to notes and her confusing lecture style. Many found her lectures unhelpful and difficult to follow, despite some acknowledging her knowledge in the subject matter.

Ratings.comment: horrible teacher, couldn't explain anything without consulting notes. cant beleive they allow her to teach after we all signed a letter having her re-evaluated.
Really knows her stuff!  But not for idiots.  She's tuff, and wants people to lean.
Terrible Professor!

she may be the worst teacher i have ever had.  i went to class five times.  the first day of class and then to take the exams.  got an A though but that was only because i went to a different lecturer.  she wrote in paragraph and i realized how bad she sucked at teaching.  needs to find a new job.

I hated this class.  The professer is sort of okay but she loks a little strange. She likes to wear the gold and green. In classI just didn't understand what the hell she was talking about most of the time. I got a C-. The TA, Benny Setiwan was awesome! GR

this woman is stupid, she doe not know how to teach, she goea all out to make advance calc 2 even harder than what it is, way to go. i have no idea how she got to be a teacher. she sucks. her lecttures are horrible. she has no idea what she is talking about. do not take any of her classes, avoid it at all cost.

It is hard enough that this is an advanced calculus class, add the fact that I had a woman who majored in physics lecturing me, and it made the class even harder. I should still end up with a B+, but that comes with an assload of studying and learning on my own...Benzakein just confused me more when I went to her lectures.

this woman is stupid.  how she came to be TEACHING my advanced calculus course, I'll never know.her 'lessons' consisted of copying definitions out of the book onto the overhead. I may struggle wih calculus but I can read the book for myself, thanks. one good thing; no need to feel guilty for skipping her pointless, assenine lectures.
What a horrible woman.  Random tangents, unclear explanations, enough said.
There is a reason she isn't a professor but a lecturer.  Take another section!

She def confuses you more than she helps. Doesn't know how to solve her own problems, and goes on tangents about random things that have nothing to do with what we're learning. Better off not going to her lectures. Hope you get a good TA!

Horrible!!! I stopped going to class and had a better understanding of the material. She arrived on time but spent the first 10 minutes setting up her overhead, mumbling about random thoughts the entire time.  Frequently, students had to advise her on how to solve a problem or use a calculator.
think she meant well, but honestly, I often ended up more confused after her lectures than before.

I did better on the exams when I stopped going to lecture!  She was HORRIBLE-- couldn't even work out the problems on the overhead.  The only thing that saved me was that I had a very good T.A. My T.A. actually resorted to re-teaching the lectures in recitation. I wouldn't recommend her to ANYONE.
Beverly is truly commited to teaching math, she is an excellent teacher with an amazing knowledge in math.
This is a basical college algebra class and she can't work problems not from her worksheet.  She stumps herself on the easy stuff. Useless professor.  If you have a good TA you'll get through it.
Benzakein trips herself up on difficult qeustions and skips going over the answers, then those same problems end up on the midterm and final.  A good TA can help, but she's a difficult professor.
No Comments

if you have this professor you better pray your TA knows what he/she is doin cause your not gonna get anything out of Benzakein-- she tends to talk to herself and ramble without making sense.  she also went way to fast using the notes she had previously cuz she was too lazy to write them out again

summary_comment: Professor Niu is generally considered a helpful and approachable instructor, with many students praising his willingness to assist during review sessions and before exams. However, his lectures can be challenging to follow due to a heavy accent, and students often find themselves needing to teach themselves much of the material. Overall, while some find the class manageable with sufficient self-study, others recommend avoiding him due to difficulty understanding his lectures.
summary_comment_short: Professor Niu is generally considered a helpful and approachable instructor who provides insights into exam content, though students find his lectures challenging to follow due to his accent. Despite this, he offers support before tests and tries to clarify concepts through examples, although many students note that significant self-study is necessary to succeed.

Ratings.comment: I had the same guy in 152 but didn't get as luck as I did when I got an A. The midterms are ok after the first one.  I screwed up a lot and was 10 points on my final away from an A- in the class. Has a nice curve for an 85> to be an A. Although I will say you must teach your self most of the material but he tells your what to expect.
good teacher

Professor Liang is awesome, he keeps on saying he doesnt speak good english, but he is probably one of the better english speaking teachers in the math departement. He practically gives you whats on the exam in his review sessions. I went to lecture 4 times and I got an A- in the class, so that should tell you how easy and awesome that class is!
hard to understand at first, but he is very helpful, he goes over examples well and helps you understand whats gonna be on midterms.
Awesome prof... very helpful
Really helpful and an awesome guy... he helps you before every test by giving you an idea of what will be on it

Dr. Niu is obviously a really nice person, and it was his first year teaching so I was sympathetic, but when it came to trying to learn the concepts, it was pretty difficult.  His accent is heavy, but compared to some others I've had it's not the worst.  He does his best to work out problems and they kind of help.  You mostly teach yourself though.
I recommend avoiding Dr. Niu. He's very hard to understand and would avoid questions during lecture. If you must take him, hope for a good TA.

Liang Niu is a new professor with some definite potential of being a great teacher, but the fact of the matter is, he does not speak English well! Unless you are willing to try translating what he says each class rather than being able to pay attention to the material being taught, I highly advise taking Math 152 with a different professor.

This professor was new and I give him credit for making an effort. He gives examples right out of the book and tells you sometime what to expect on the test. He is not really clear and want to go through the problems with you all the way. All I can say is pay attention to your webwork and what he says. I got an A doing this.

He's a really nice guy, and he really tries to help you. But it's almost impossible to understand him, so the lectures weren't even worth going to. All of his notes came from powerpoints and he sped through them. I never really understood anything he taught. I would advise you to not take math 152 with him!
Took awhile to get use to the accent, but the lecture notes are sometimes helpful.  Avoid Math 152 if you can.
He's a nice guy.... But don;t take this class it's miserable!! You'll want to shoot yourself. I did.
Noticeable accent, but definitely understandable. Dr. Niu is a really nice guy and shows an interest in his students doing well. It's Calc II, its a hard class no matter what.

If you want a passing grade do not take this unles you have a very good understanding of either Chinese or Calc. He is nearly impossible to understand. The midterms are extremely long and hard. Do yourself a favor and do not take this. Also the first things he said to us was "Hi, I from China, my English no good." Take that for what it is worth--

summary_comment: Professor Czocher, commonly referred to as Jen, is perceived as a laid-back and approachable instructor who is willing to help students understand the material, though her teaching style can be unconventional. While some students find her quizzes challenging and her initial demeanor off-putting, many appreciate her fairness and dedication to ensuring student comprehension. However, there are also criticisms regarding the difficulty of her exams and her perceived lack of interest in supporting struggling students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Czocher is perceived as a laid-back and approachable instructor who is willing to help students understand the material, though some find her teaching style unconventional. While her quizzes are challenging and heavily rely on correctly setting up problems, students generally appreciate her efforts to support their learning, despite mixed feedback on her overall teaching effectiveness and the difficulty of the course.

Ratings.comment: I thought Jen did an amazing job teaching such a high level of calculus. I attribute my grade only to her since our lecturer for the course was pretty bad. shes a little laid back,and different, but is a very fair and just teacher. I would highly recommend her!

Jen was my TA for this class, and I thought she was a pretty good teacher overall.  This class is a fairly tough class for non-math majors so you have to study.  Her only drawback are her quizzes; all following questions are based on setting up the 1st problem correctly, but she still gives points for incorrect work as long as it is fairly logical.

Jen is a trip! She's one of the most laid back TA's I've had in a long time. As long as you keep up on the homework, the quizzes are easy. She's more than willing to help or explain something if you don't understand it. The best were her nerdy examples and making fun of herself to lighten the mood of the class.

She comes of as pushy and not nice, but as the quarter goes on you can tell she really wants to help. Does whatever is needed to make sure you understand. Course was somewhat difficult and Jen made it a lot easier! Great TA

not a very good teacher. She always seemed to have a teacher vs. student mentality. quizzes are hard. she says her classes have the highest grades on the final but this is probably because half the class drops out by then.
Doesn't seem interested in helping students understand
The melodious sound of Jen's voice sounds like waves on a deserted beach in summertime.  Also, I received a 74 on the first mid-term.

The highest grade on our first midterm was a 73. The class average was 59. 2/3 of the class dropped after Jen went on a tirade assuring us there would be no curve. Jen wrote the exams herself. She didn't seem to care that the class was obviously struggling.

I actually learn more in recitation than I do in class. As long as you complete (and understand) the homework assignments, the quizzes are easy. If you have questions on anything, she's more than willing to answer, and explain until you understand what the f you're doing :)
loved her.  she is so smart and such a good teacher.  she will make sure you are more than prepared for exams!! VERY HELPFUL

Decent TA, sometimes tends to explain things in an elementary fashion that just ends up being confusing.  Quizzes were way too hard and kill your recitation grade, but do the homework and practice midterms and you'll get an A.

First time you meet her you will be thrown off guard but she is the best math TA and her class averages are always higher than all the others. i thought she was so good that i had her for 131 and then made sure i had her for 132 also. Always willing to help you and good at explaining things too. Only bad thing is that she has hard quizzes.

summary_comment: Professor Oman is highly regarded for his clarity and ability to explain complex concepts in a straightforward manner, making him an excellent choice for students seeking a well-understood grasp of the material. His lectures are praised for their clarity and step-by-step instructions, particularly in challenging topics like related rates. While some students find his examples simpler than the actual exams, many commend his willingness to help during office hours and his overall effectiveness in teaching mathematics.
summary_comment_short: Professor Oman is highly regarded for his clarity and ability to explain complex concepts in a straightforward manner, making him an excellent choice for students seeking a well-understood grasp of the material. His lectures are praised for their clarity and his willingness to help during office hours, although some students find his homework grading system somewhat harsh.

Ratings.comment: hahahah clearly alotta girls are writing reviews here...i took him my freshman year (now a senior) and i can look back and say i was fortunate to get him. i knew some of the material already but his clarity and examples helped me pull an A in that class.

He was extremely clear. He explains things well, and I felt prepared for the tests. Get old test from someone, because the tests are standardized within the department and they are similar from quarter to quarter. Oman was not bad to look at and his voice is sexy.

One issue I had was that the homework grades don't really reflect the work because he grades only 3-4 problems per assignment. I had two very low homework grades but still pulled out in A in the class, but it was a bit frustrating throughout the quarter. The homework grading could be a little harsh, but overall, he was a pretty good professor.

Greg "Greggy" Oman rocked a beany to class each day along with my world. I never got the guts to ask him to join me for lunch at Panera. I thought we could review derivates (my favorite!). Does anyone know if he's married? I never saw a ring...American. Perfect English. Knows his stuff. End of the quarter gets hard so make sure you go to lectures.

He spends a ton of time saying, "really, this isn't that hard" "it's really simply"  and then gives abstract and hard quizzes. Our class would get the quizzes and everyone would just sit there. The examples he gives in class are normally very basic.  Yes, he does speak perfect English.  I'm not so sure about the the being hott part though...

Very good teacher. Very Clear and gives step by step instructions for difficult related rates problems. If you want a english speaking teacher that you can understand well, make sure you can get him. Willing to help in office hours. Sometimes his examples are not as difficult as the questions on the midterms but still a very good teacher.

I going to make this short and simply. If you can get Oman, then get him because chances of getting a "good" and "clear speaking" math professor at The Ohio State Math Department are slim to none. Oman is a great prof and he cares about your education, unlike 90% of the other math Prof's who can barley speak English.

hes prob the best math professor u can get here at OSU, clarity wise. he explains things REALLY well and has perfect english unlike most profs and TAs because hes american. go to his lectures and u shud be able to learn the stuff unless you just straight suck at life.
Gives lots of examples with all levels of difficulty.  Explains material well.
Very very clear

Very good teacher. Made information very clear cut.  Addressed questions in class.  I would recommend him to anyone! I received an A in this class with very little study effort.  However, the problems we went over in class (in our notes) were not like the homework problems.
If you study a moderate amount you are guaranteed an A. The lectures are kind of boring but he is very thourough. And I don't mind looking at him either. :-)
Clear and willing to help
Great math professor.  He was really clear in his explanations and tried hard to make sure we avoided common mistakes.

AMAZING!!  Teaches the material so well, and is always open for questions.  He wasn't my lecturer, but after the first week of class, i started going to his class instead because he is just that good.  Also, very very easy on the eyes.  He's nice to look at and nice to listen to ;-)

great professor. actually speaks english which is a treat from the math department.  if you have him, its an easy A because he explains things so well and you will never leave class confused.  highly recommended
Probably the best math professor I've ever had.  He's amazing

Definitely the lecturer to choose!  He is American so you can actually understand him!!!  His lectures are worth going to.  Explains things much better than my previous math lecturers.  The book is only needed if you plan to do homework that is optional. All lecturers give quizzes weekly and drop the lowest one.
Good professor. Teaches the material very well. Helps out on things you dont know either. Very clear and understandable :]
Teaches you like your in grade school, which is good for math!
notes are very wordy
great teacher. quiz and test problems come right from homework.
No Comments
He is the man.

Gives you the American and English speaking headfake, then give the stifarm with teaching style.  He always talks about how easy the class is going to be and the average on both the midterms was below 50%.  Has good intentions but others failed out.  Not even close to easy.  A in 153, D in 153

summary_comment: Professor Wiggam is highly regarded for his exceptional ability to explain complex financial concepts, particularly the current financial crisis, and has deep knowledge of CDS's and financial derivatives. He receives no negative comments from students.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wiggam is highly regarded for his exceptional ability to explain complex financial concepts, particularly the current financial crisis, and has deep knowledge of Credit Default Swaps (CDS) and financial derivatives. No comments were provided by other students regarding his teaching style or content.

Ratings.comment: Explained the current financial crisis better than anyone.  Knows much about CDS's and financial derivatives.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Mayboroda is highly regarded for her teaching clarity and comprehensive approach to mathematics. Students find her lectures clear and organized, though some note her accent can be challenging at times. Overall, she is described as a very nice and dedicated instructor who genuinely cares about her students' understanding of the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Mayboroda is highly regarded for her teaching clarity and comprehensive approach to mathematics. Despite some initial absences and a challenging accent, students found her lectures clear and her concern for their understanding genuine, although exams can be demanding.

Ratings.comment: She was great. I wish I could have her as a professor again.
An excellent mathematics instructor, with comprehensive lectures and reasonable expectations of her students.

nice lady, had a a lot of absences though at the beginning, which was annoying. good teacher, organized, taught well, very nice. exams not bad, first midterm average was a 73, final and second midterm both around the 81 range.
Her accent was hard to understand and she moved rather quickly through the material. She doesnt like it when student talk after her back is turned and but shes hot so it wasnt that bad-- i guess.
class average on first midterm was a 40, be prepared.
She was a pretty good teacher. The accent was kind of hard to understand, but not THAT bad. I also recommend Oguz Kurtz as a TA.
She teaches the material very clearly.  Mostly follows the book but skips some things if she feels it unnecessary.  Tests are a little tough but fair if you do the work.  Very nice and very cute!

Ha ha ha, okay, so the person's comment below this one is right... she did spend a while telling us that the upcoming exam was practically going to kill us, but besides that, I liked her as a lecturer.  She seemed honestly concerned about whether we were really understanding the material.  Her lectures were clear and quite understandable.

She once spent 15 minutes telling us how hard our exam was going to be instead of preparing us for the exam. Her accent isn't bad, but for the first half the course she didn't give any examples, just theorems. Overall I would give her 2.7, and if you need help go to her office hours
She's a wonderful teacher. She teaches the reasoning behind things which makes it easier to comprehend. I felt well prepared for the tests. I highly recommend her!

She's okay though her accent can be tough if you're stupid. Partway into the course she began providing examples (even though that's what our recitations were for) and that really helped me out as my recitation guy was lame. Something to keep in mind for math 151 is that the homework and webwork problems are almost never similar to what on the test
Sometimes hard to understand, doesn't teach for exams. Didn't like her so I ended up going to another lecturer, don't waste your time signing up for her lecture.
Can't understand her at all. SHE TRIED TO TAKE AWAY MY CALCULATOR IN THE MIDDLE OF THE EXAM! i had to freashmen forgive this class!
She teaches really easy material in class and it doesn't prepare you for the problems that are going to be on your exam.  Also, she is kind of hard to understand with the accent, but not too bad.

This professor is horrible, she doesn't teach you the material that you need for a quiz (IVT) and is totally clueless about everything going on. One of the worst math professor I've had. I am not looking for a professor I can "parrot" however I want someone who is going to teach the material clearly and on time.
She is a good teacher; however, she teachs easy stuff sometimes then when you go to the test you may screw up if you're not ready. Overall, good teacher....

Does her job of teaching theory very well. Most of those who say that she's not a good teacher are the ones who want everything spoon-fed to them. If you are interested in understanding the reasoning behind mathematics rather than just parroting your teacher, get this professor.
Doesn't teach hard stuff, so we you go to the test you screw up

summary_comment: Professor Siebert is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts accessible and enjoyable through his clear explanations and humor. Students consistently praise his dedication to helping them understand the material, often noting that his classes are so engaging they attend every lecture. His approachable nature and willingness to assist students further enhance the learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Siebert is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, making complex concepts accessible and engaging through clear explanations and humor. Students consistently praise his dedication to helping them understand the material and his ability to foster a fun and enjoyable learning environment.

Ratings.comment: He is so funny, so helpful, I loved going to his class because it was...well...fun!  His humor cant be beat, but above all he really is a great teacher.  I learned so much from him, and for the first time in my entire life, I actually enjoy math.
Best teacher I've ever had here. Take him.

This dude is the coolest mo' fo' ever. If you don't do well in his class from the lectures and his great TA's, then you should just quit college. I barely studied for his calc 2 class and got easy A's on every exam. Make your entire schedule around getting this guy; worth it.

Went to every single lecture because he made it worth it.  Knows how to explain everything clearly and will more often than not, add a joke to the explanation. He's been the TA for the class plenty of times and actually cares that people know what's going on. Not a lecture went by that he didn't get the whole class to crack up.
Awesome guy, always willing to help.  I would have rather had him for lecture than recitation.    You could not ask for a better TA for this class...

Kitz is by far one of the best TA's I have ever had.  His recitations are clear, informative, and fun.  He is hilarious (sometimes subtle humor).  He is very interested in math and helping you with math.  His recictations are much more valuable than the lectures because he doesnt give all of the proof B.S.

summary_comment: Professor Samansky is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics more accessible. He is praised for his clarity and helpfulness, especially through emails and office hours, and for providing useful notes and online resources. While the class is challenging, students appreciate his efforts to prepare them thoroughly for exams and his supportive approach in the classroom.
summary_comment_short: Professor Samansky is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics easier to understand. He provides clear lectures, helpful notes, and is supportive of students who seek assistance, though some find his knowledge can come across as confident or even slightly arrogant at times.

Ratings.comment: enjoyable to have in class. funny

He's geeky-funny. Tells (cheesy) jokes occasionally to keep things light. Teaches well, and at a very nice pace. Very helpful to students who email about homework problems. Presentation is clean, and easy to understand. Sometimes, he comes off a bit of a 'know-it-all', but he's not a bad sport. =)
He is a very nice guy. He is actually interested in what he teaches and does his best to prepare you for the midterms and final.He gives good notes and is clear. Fyi, the final is impossible.

FOR AN EXTREMELY HARD AND TIME CONSUMING CLASS, he was an excellent professor.  The grading scale is totally off for this class, seriously like they state from the beginning that an 85% is a solid A.  He was very clear in his lectures and posted his ntoes online.  Let you know exactly the types of problems to study and was a nice guy! 5 STARS *****

Tough class.  A lot of work, but a decent curve.  He's very helpful if you go to him, take advantage of that. Definitely do all of the extra credit. Pretty good lectures though, he could be a little clearer but he's alright.

Typical math nerd in a cute way.  He's a funny guy and speaks English, which helps.  This course is just difficult, but if you keep up with the practice problems and study his notes (which are all online), you'll be okay.  He's easy to follow and generally tries to dumb down the math lingo.  Be prepared for a lot of work with this class.

Samansky was VERY clear on what types of problems to study. His review & the webwork review practically mirror the exam conceptually. I would definatley recommend this professor, & a piece of advice is to not worry all to much about paper hw and focus more on webwork and webwork reviews, which are worth more points and prepare you for quizzes/tests
Very clear about what he wanted us to know. Made own exams and let you know what would be on them. Never made anyone feel stupid for asking questions. Good sense of humor.

Explains problems in lecture well, as incredibly time consuming as it may be. Tries to give us hints by saying "I took a look at your final/midterm and saw this type of problem" and lecture not mandatory because he posts them online. As hard as the midterms may be, just treat the webworks as if it was the exam and you should be fine. PRACTICE!!!!!!

great teacher. however class is very difficult. The book work and webwork is very annoying and nothing like the exams, which are nearly impossible. He tries to tell us what is going to be on the exams, but test questions are usually much more complicated which are hard to do in 48 minutes. I would highly recommend this professor.
one of the best math teachers i've ever had.

Eric left nothing to chance, everything he wanted us to know was written out in a clear concise manner. I would take other classes taught by him. Very fair, balanced, and intelligent professor. 5 Stars *****
Great Prof. explained everything clearly. Very helpful. Posted notes online. do the homework, youll be fine.

You can understand what he says but his lectures are often dry and you don't need to go to them to do well-he posts his slides on the internet. Do the paper homework, and webwork, and review the concepts from each section and you'll do fine on midterms. The final is horrid (got an 83/200 and had a b+ prior), yet he doesnt write them. He's decent.

I thought he was excellent. one of the best professors I have ever had. While it is his first time teaching teh class he knows the material. My only complaint is he does not create the tests or the lectures.

Reads off of his slides, its all he does. If you take good notes and study them and find alternate examples in the book, you should get at least a B. The firt and third tests are very hard, and final was near impossible. (But he doesn't write the tests. So can't blame him there) My advice, understand the WebWorks. Its the best review before a test.
just awful
taught from the book too much...tests are a lot harder than the assignments and examples in class

Dr. Samansky knows the material and he is great but his teaching methods did not agree with me.  The class itself isn't that hard if you took Calculus in high school.  The webwork help a lot in studying.

A nice guy, but he simply puts overheads up of notes that can be found online. They are simply proofs are copied from the book. He never really does many practice problems so his lectures are boring (as most math lectures are) and entirely useless. Exams in this class are impossible.

You can understand him easily. His teaching method is going over premade slides that are usually from the book. He answers questions when asked, and makes minor mistakes on his slides. Very attractive.
He has no is too smart for his own good and could not teach others if his life depended on it

I've had better math teachers. Samansky is clear, and answers questions, but he just goes over premade slides, which in my opinion is not the most successful method of teaching calculus. Not a bad lecturer to have overall, though.

Very easy to understand and follow along with.  Sometimes he skips steps in his work or makes minor mistakes, but who's perfect? His slides are very neat, shows clear examples, and he usually makes them simpiler yet as he reads them outloud. He always covers all the materials in class and still posts notes online. VERY considerate to students!
No Comments
Kinda just reads over the slides on the over heads and most of his explanations only make sense if you already have your PhD in math.
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor McSweeney is known for his challenging tests and unclear explanations, which can make grasping concepts difficult despite their apparent simplicity. While his teaching style is tough and his grading is strict, the support from his TAs, particularly John, can significantly improve understanding and performance. Overall, the consensus is that his courses are demanding and not recommended for those who are not naturally strong in math or do not plan to put in extensive effort.
summary_comment_short: Professor McSweeney is known for his challenging tests and clear explanations in class, though students find the material difficult to apply during exams, leading to lower grades despite understanding the concepts. Many students also highlight the importance of attending class and studying diligently, while others warn of his strict grading and lack of curve, suggesting it is best to avoid his classes unless one is highly confident in their abilities.

Ratings.comment: It's easy to grasp the concepts, but come test time, it's way hard. He words stuff as if it's completely new to you. I got a 67% and it translated to a B. Attend the class and study and you should be fine.
Very good teacher. Hard tests and quizzes.
John was a great TA. He took time to teach things the prof. left unclear. He was very helpful.
good TA

DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH THIS FOOL, hes a complete psycho...who doesnt know how to teach. He just scribbles something on the Blackboard. He is a VERY VERY VERY mean grader, dont know what is his objective of his course is.is it A) How do i screw someones grades B) How do i screw someone's grade.if you are A or B, and not a genius at math, STAY AWAY

This guy is as stiff as dry concrete, i mean it! 1. He will NOT curve period!. 2. Dont expect anything easy. 3. His HW is too theoretical, quizes are easy but MT and Final are HARRRDDDD. 3. Dont bother arguing about extra point on the HW, he will not give it to you even if you life depended on it. 4. Hes not worth taking a class with.
Terrible.  Hard grader, no curve.  Hard to figure out what he wants as answers on HWs and exams, take someone else if possible.
john is great he knows how to teach better than any other TA i have ever had before now. he knows what to cover too that is important

summary_comment: Professor Zhao, referred to as Peng, is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality. Students consistently praise his ability to explain concepts clearly, provide generous partial credit, and offer extensive support through recitations and flexible policies. His dedication to helping students understand the material has been particularly noted, making him a standout instructor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Zhao is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, providing extensive support through clear explanations and generous partial credit. Students consistently praise his willingness to help and his flexibility in accommodating various needs.

Ratings.comment: Peng is the best. Take him! Very helpful! Partial credit all the time!
Take him. He is awesome! He explains things very well + gives a lot of partial credits. He is willing to help students...He is just the BEST!!!
he is really perfect!!!
I LOVE PENG PENG! Honestly, he's the only reason I'm not failing math. Very very helpful.
peng is so helpful, he pretty much will do your homework/webwork during recitation. he was the only reason i understood stuff in this class as my professor didn't explain anything at all.

Peng is very nice.  He is willing to help, and gives lots of partial credit on tests and homework.  He isn't too strict about taking late homework, and is generally pretty flexible.  Before the exams he goes over just about every problem that will be covered...

summary_comment: Professor Yeum is widely regarded as an ineffective teacher, with students citing her muttering, poor speaking skills, and tendency to teach directly from the book without providing additional value. Tests are described as unpredictable and difficult, often not aligning with the material covered in class, and there is little to no curve, making it challenging for students to perform well without extensive extra study.
summary_comment_short: Professor Yeum is considered challenging due to her teaching style, which closely follows the textbook, and tests that are difficult and often do not align with the in-class material. Students find it necessary to invest significant time outside of class to succeed, as the material tested goes beyond what is covered in lectures, and there is minimal grading curve.

Ratings.comment: Jia teaches to a level different from what she tests. It's often easier for students to read the book and do book work on their own. The best grades in the class were people who put 40 hours a week into studying outside of the required work. There is a very limited to no curve.

avoid at all costs! she mutters and made tests so hard. I haven't taken the final yet, but after 43% avg on midterm, not sure I want to. It seems like she makes the tests based on what we haven't learned. not to mention she teaches word for word out of the book.

One word... run.    She is very nice and seems to kind of care. She is just not talented in the area of teaching nor can she speak very well. She cant answer questions, her mid terms are not accurate representations and her grading is not consistent. Terrible notes, straight from the book and not helpful... sometimes confused me more... RUN
Very nice little asian lady, not great teacher.  I beat the curve on all tests and quizzes except the final and I got a B.  Her final was impossible, but Good luck
She mutters at the chalkboard all quarter and doesn't make any sense. The exams are unpredictable and dont always cover topics from class.

Dr. Yeum is not the greatest teacher... she speaks quietly, and copies DIRECTLY out of the book... word for word. Her midterms are unpredictable and do not represent the material covered. Avoid if possible
she is a good teacher
No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Hindawi is generally regarded as a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who explains concepts clearly and is genuinely interested in helping students succeed. However, his classroom demeanor can be confusing, with frequent joking that sometimes comes across as harsh rather than humorous. While his tests are challenging, they are manageable for students who are well-prepared.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hindawi is considered a knowledgeable and approachable instructor who explains concepts clearly and is genuinely interested in helping students succeed. However, his classroom demeanor can be ambiguous and sometimes comes across as harsh, which affects the overall learning experience.

Ratings.comment: I think he was interested in teaching, and he seemed to want to help students, but his classroom attitude left something to be desired. He would often joke, which was sometimes funny but often just came across as harsh. It was hard to tell if he liked us or really hated us. Tests were also extremely difficult.

He is a good teacher and he's really nice. He wasn't supposed to be our original teacher but we lucked out. he explains things very well. Also, the tests the department chose really weren't that difficult as long as you know what you're doing. He does have a slight accent but its not hard to understand him. I definitely recommend him as a teacher!
